We ordered 2 high teas (with my favorite Earl Grey and also Lady Grey tea) and a shepherd's pie. Everything was delicious, especially the scones and shepherd's pie. The servers were nice and even surprised me with a little cake at the end!

I can see myself coming back for special occasions and when missing London for sure.

excerpts: One tier contains sandwiches (two types of your choice) and salad, another contains scones and tea cookies, and the uppermost is filled with fresh fruit.
I always feel like a princess whenever I'm here!
scones.author: Kristi T.
scones.review:
Love the ambiance here! The tea room is quaint and cozy, though can get a bit too packed sometimes. That's ok though, since service is still attentive. 

I usually order the Queen service. It comes with a pot of tea and your classic three tier service. One tier contains sandwiches (two types of your choice) and salad, another contains scones and tea cookies, and the uppermost is filled with fresh fruit. I always feel like a princess whenever I'm here! There are also hats and a vanity in the center of the room where you can choose your accessories to go with your tea. 

The most recent time I went was for my mom's birthday, and they brought a little piece of dessert for her with a candle. I thought this was super thoughtful of them! Mom greatly enjoyed her first time at Lovejoy's. 

Parking may be difficult around the area. I've always happened to luck out, but I can see how parking could be a headache around the area. Make sure you check out their store across the street! They have their teas for purchase, as well as other cutesy items for you to host your own tea party at home. Your bill comes with a small discount should you wish to purchase from their store across the street. I would advise making a reservation a week in advance as space is quite limited. 

High tea is always pricey so I wouldn't frequent here unless there is an occasion for me every now and then. However, when I am in the mood for one, I will definitely choose this Lovejoy's!

excerpts: I loved the scones they're so flakey and hot
and I loved loading them up with lemon curd and Devon cream as well as the jam.
Overall I can't wait to go back.
It's just a very nice way to spend the afternoon.
My only issue is that there is only one bathroom - it is a tea room
so there is always a line
and it is also pretty noisy at peak hours especially with the large groups
so it is a little hard to hear if you are with someone who is soft spoken.
But I still enjoyed it and am craving their scones today.
scones.author: Josie C.
scones.review: This was my second time coming to lovejoy's tea room. I love how shabby chic it is and how so many different types of events can be held there. Yesterday there were little girl tea parties, bridal showers, baby showers and just regular tea time guests. I went for my birthday with my boyfriend - thankfully, for him, there were other men there (but the patrons are overwhelmingly female). We had the queens tea which is the best way to experience the tea room fare. It comes with your choice of tea, your choice of two types of tea sandwiches (their list of sandwiches is fairly extensive as is their tea list), a scone with preserves Devon cream and lemon curd, fruit, a salad, coleslaw, crumpets and a petit four after the meal. I left stuffed and full of tea. If you ask they will happily refill your pot. Yesterday I got the afternoon Darjeeling but before I had gotten the China rose petal which I think I liked better and ended up buying a bag across the street at the attic. I loved the scones they're so flakey and hot and I loved loading them up with lemon curd and Devon cream as well as the jam. Overall I can't wait to go back. It's just a very nice way to spend the afternoon. My only issue is that there is only one bathroom - it is a tea room so there is always a line and it is also pretty noisy at peak hours especially with the large groups so it is a little hard to hear if you are with someone who is soft spoken. But I still enjoyed it and am craving their scones today.

excerpts: I'd rather skip the crumpet for 2 scones.
Or skip some fruit for 2 coleslaws.
Or vice versa.
Also, the scone was old, dry & crusty.
It was difficult to cut in half.
I should have asked for a fresh one.
It's no wonder why Lovejoy's has such high ratings.
We had fun, the food was tasty & filling, and the staff are really nice.
I posted this in tips, but here it is again; if you don't have reservations, don't panic.
They'll seat you if they have no-shows.
That's how we got seated & it was easy.
You need to show up at the beginning of their "seating time".
I'll definitely go back.
scones.author: Reed S.
scones.review:
We didn't have reservations, but were told to wait until the next seating to see if someone didn't show up. 
We were lucky enough to get seated for the 3:30 seating. 
What's great about this restaurant is that it's a complete mish-mosh of stuff. From the chairs, to the silverware, to the tea cups.  NOTHING matched, & that's what makes it charming!
If you're able, request a seat towards the back of the restaurant. It's much more quiet & somewhat private. 
The staff were fantastic & on top of everything.  The tea was only left empty towards the end of our meal. Other than that, it was refilled and reheated when needed without asking. 
They pretty much forbid the use of cell phones, which is quite a nice change!  We saw at least 3 different signs. 
My only complaint would be that it's somewhat difficult to share one tea service. For example; one scone, one petit four, one coleslaw, one crumpet, etc.  it ended up working, but cutting things in half with a friend is awkward. I'd rather skip the crumpet for 2 scones. Or skip some fruit for 2 coleslaws. Or vice versa.  Also, the scone was old, dry & crusty. It was difficult to cut in half. I should have asked for a fresh one. 
It's no wonder why Lovejoy's has such high ratings. We had fun, the food was tasty & filling, and the staff are really nice. 
I posted this in tips, but here it is again; if you don't have reservations, don't panic. They'll seat you if they have no-shows. That's how we got seated & it was easy. You need to show up at the beginning of their "seating time". 
I'll definitely go back.

excerpts: Great customer service, yummy sandwiches, warm DELICIOUS scones, and the Rose Petal tea was heaven!
scones.author: Magdalena L.
scones.review:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! I've always really wanted to take my daughter out to tea, so I decided to see what I could find on Yelp. After reading all of the rave reviews for LoveJoy, we decided to give it a try and we loved it! Great customer service, yummy sandwiches, warm DELICIOUS scones, and the Rose Petal tea was heaven! After all of this goodness, they came out with crumpets for us! The girls had peanut butter and honey sandwiches with hot cocoa and whipped cream on the side, and they LOVED it! At the end the brought out petit fours for dessert, I normally don't like petit fours but these were so yummy! 

I definitely plan to come back for more mommy daughter dates here, such a fun treat!

excerpts: My favorite items are the scones, devonshire cream, and the preserves.
Super yummy.
I had my baby shower hosted here
and it was lovely.
scones.author: Trudie S.
scones.review:
This place is awesome. My favorite items are the scones, devonshire cream, and the preserves. Super yummy. I had my baby shower hosted here and it was lovely. My whole party had a good time.

Only a few things to comment on for improvement. The place is very busy with groups one after another. Our waitress was polite, but not as attentive as she should have been. A few times she would set things down and quickly walk away and we would have to call her back. It was also disappointing that each person was not asked what tea she wanted. I have been to Lovejoy's in the past for other showers and was always offered my own pot of tea. We were provided a couple of starter pots and those were refilled, but we were never offered our own pot or choice of tea which was part of the tea package my host paid for. It is a tea house after all and there is such a vast selection so that was disappointing.

excerpts: The food is really good and the scones are amazing!
scones.author: Stephanie H.
scones.review: Best tea in the world. Riley is the best server in the world. Be sure to give her a treat tip! The food is really good and the scones are amazing!

excerpts: The scones are a must and the vanilla tea!
Book in advance as it gets booked up so fast!
scones.author: Sinead M.
scones.review: Every time I have family & friends in town or a celebration I will head to love joys. It's the cutest little gem in San Francisco for a cute girly day out. I normally get the queens tea, everything is tasty and well presented. The scones are a must and the vanilla tea! Book in advance as it gets booked up so fast!

excerpts: If you enjoy scones, tea, and petit fours, you'll enjoy Lovejoy's.
It is a very old fashioned place full of beautiful antiques.
Very cozy feeling, but not fancy.
Great!
scones.author: Kelly A.
scones.review: Lovejoy's was fantastic. We enjoyed high tea in a party of four, and got plenty of food. The price was a little high, but you go to experience high tea. Our server was friendly, and the tea and sandwiches were fantastic. If you enjoy scones, tea, and petit fours, you'll enjoy Lovejoy's. It is a very old fashioned place full of beautiful antiques. Very cozy feeling, but not fancy. Great!

excerpts: All their teas are wonderful and so are all the sandwiches, scones and crumpets.
Service was great!
Parking isn't bad, it's street parking only but not bad.
I recommend this place highly!
scones.author: Nanette D.
scones.review: We love coming here all dressed up in hats and gloves.  All their teas are wonderful and so are all the sandwiches, scones and crumpets.  Service was great! Parking isn't bad, it's street parking only but not bad.  I recommend this place highly!

excerpts: The scones are golden, crispy, and delicious!
You can pair them with a light, Devonshire clotted cream, or a sweet strawberry jam.
Finish off with some berries to cleanse your palate, then have a petit four to sweeten the deal.
Lovejoy's is a treat, and well worth it, in my opinion.
scones.author: Joanne K.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's is my favorite tea place! It's a wonderful tea place for hosting bridal parties or any get-togethers. I love the stellar customer service here. The wonderful ladies are always checking to make sure our tea pots are filled. 

I usually order the High Tea (~$20) or the Queen's Tea (~28). The finger sandwiches are quite delicate, and my party and I usually order ones that we would not make ourselves (chicken and asparagus, artichoke and arugula). The scones are golden, crispy, and delicious! You can pair them with a light, Devonshire clotted cream, or a sweet strawberry jam. Finish off with some berries to cleanse your palate, then have a petit four to sweeten the deal. Lovejoy's is a treat, and well worth it, in my opinion.

excerpts: Scones and finger sandwiches were served with the teas.
The scones were delicious, soft, fluffy and warm.
There were horseradich, tuna, and cucumber sandwiches.
That may not sound like much, but let me tell you it will fill you up.
scones.author: Cherise N.
scones.review:
Time to dust off your Sunday hats, fascinators, and polish up those pinkys! This place is your ultimate tea time location. I wonder if they do a Alice in Wonderland themed decor...hmmm. I came here for my cousin's golden birthday (she turned 26 on November 26) and we came ready to sip on some tea. 

Unfortunately for me, I came with other attendees and we were severely late, we came about 30 minutes before they closed. My cousin and the rest of the attendees were there on time, so they were able to enjoy. The hosts, however, were kind and allowed us to stay at least an hour (probably more) past closing. I really appreciated that, thank you Lovejoy staff! They were friendly and very attentive, and patient is definitely an understatement.

The ambiance was a mix of London tea meets a southern belle's Sunday brunch. There was a red London phone booth, hats available to change your style, and decorative tea sets. The music selection was great as well, they played the Dream Girls soundtrack to Tina Turner (I had many breakout singing moments). There were seating opportunities for couples and large groups like ours.

The tea party spread was a delight. The tea variety consisted of lavender, vanilla, green, and passion fruit. Scones and finger sandwiches were served with the teas. The scones were delicious, soft, fluffy and warm. There were horseradich, tuna, and cucumber sandwiches. That may not sound like much, but let me tell you it will fill you up. Make sure you grab a scone before anyone else does ahaha.

Come here and enjoy a warm cup of tea and a tasty treat as you listen to good music!

excerpts: The sandwiches were good, the teas were great, but the scones were Amazing!
I might just go back for just tea and scones!
scones.author: Emily C.
scones.review: I love this incredibly cute place! We were a group of 6 girls and all chose to do their "high tea". We chose various teas and sandwiches so everyone could sample something different. The sandwiches were good, the teas were great, but the scones were Amazing!  I might just go back for just tea and scones!

excerpts:
Cream Cheese & Mandarin Oranges - sweet & juicy oranges paired so well w/ the creamy cream cheese

Scones were out of this world buttery
scones.author: Adrienne G.
scones.review:
We've been back to Lovejoy's a goodly number of times but thought it was high (tea) time for an update

I was genius & scheduled the fam for Easter-Brunch

Unfortunately it was raining so didn't get to sport our Easter Bonnets but they happen to have a whole table of fun Fascinators & Hats.....we didn't partake but the table next to us did & it was fun watching them try on the adornments

Queen's Tea all around & it was SO MUCH FOOD!  (in the best way!!)

Sandwiches choices: (PS it's awesome that we can choose our *own* sandwiches & there are a ton of veggie combos!!)
 
*  Cheddar & Pickle (this is a staple for all our high teas & the tangy-tart Branston pickle was awesomely paired w/ the cheddar)
*  Pear & Stilton - sweet pears w/ lots of blue - delish!
*  Cucumber & Cream Cheese - nice cooling & creamy
*  Cream Cheese & Mandarin Oranges - sweet & juicy oranges paired so well w/ the creamy cream cheese

Scones were out of this world buttery w/ lots of currants & totally loving the clotted cream!!  We were extra piggy & asked for more!

Lots of salad w/ a tangy, balsamic vinaigrette 

Checkerboard Tea biscuits - lovely choc & vanilla shortbread

Fruit was extremely ripe, juicy, & there was a lot of variety

Crumpet was a lovely, spongy vehicle for the slightly sweet lemon curd

Petit Fours were out of this world good!  Mom chose the gluten free truffle w/ lemon cream; sis opted for the pineapple petit four; the Mr chose the coconut & I chose the milk choc......all winners!  Loved the creamy, almost melty marzipan

Teas ranged also all over the place & everyone was happy w/ their decisions - Mom chose a berry somethingorother while Sis & the Mr chose the white vanilla lavender.  I chose a dark chocolate truffle

Thanks for the lovely time, the dainty treats & absolute abundance of food!  As we waddled out of there, the sun was coming back out - next year, I'm wearing my Easter bonnet!!  Happy Easter indeed!!

excerpts: The food was not the best that I've had at a tea venue, but the scones were soooo good.
scones.author: Susan G.
scones.review:
Very cute place with great service. Fun for a celebration of just because.

-Ambiance: cottagey feel with trinkets and a cozy, cluttered atmosphere. The seats and tables are tight.

-Service: super friendly and quick. We had a large group and the waitress was so kind to take photos from both sides of the table and took quite a few, even prompting us to raise our tea cups. That one came out really cute!

-Tea and eats: each person gets their own pot of tea (unless you are sharing a flavor; to save space). The food was not the best that I've had at a tea venue, but the scones were soooo good.

excerpts: The set also came with scones (yum!), 3 types of spread (lemon curd was the best), shortbread cookies, fruit, coleslaw, crumpets (super "spongy", but I wasn't really fond bland/buttery things), salad, and dessert chocolates (s'mores was the best).
My favorite item was probably the dessert chocolate and scone + lemon curd, but the overall package was great!
I'll be back again!
scones.author: Sarina C.
scones.review:
I love this place! It's super cute and decorated - I kind of wish I could decorate my room like this but whenever I have a lot of clutter it just looks messy... Lovejoy's does it right though. I think this is the perfect place to hang out with some girl friends. Dress up too, it's fun. ;)

This place is walkable (4 blocks) from the 24th St Mission BART station. It felt relatively safe walking there, plus there's a really colorful pink house on the way here! 

My 2 friends and I made a reservation on Thursday afternoon for a nice get-together. We ordered 2 sets of Queen's Tea(~$25 each), which is the perfect amount for 3 people. I ordered a hot chocolate (~$5), and that was the most delicious hot chocolate I ever had! It came in a huge cup with fluffy whipped cream and chocolate syrup on top. For our 2 Queen's tea sets, we picked 4 choices of sandwiches, which I thought tasted okay (good, not amazing). The salmon was my absolute favorite, and note that the ones with mustard are slightly spicy. The set also came with scones (yum!), 3 types of spread (lemon curd was the best), shortbread cookies, fruit, coleslaw, crumpets (super "spongy", but I wasn't really fond bland/buttery things), salad, and dessert chocolates (s'mores was the best). My favorite item was probably the dessert chocolate and scone + lemon curd, but the overall package was great! I'll be back again!

excerpts: I love tea..and scones and clotted cream and lemon curd...not in a zoo like environment.
Women flock here for special events...hence, the crowds.
noise and reservations are a must!
A further buzzkill parking is a challenge.
scones.author: Laurel G.
scones.review:
Tea for too many? Yes, this is a San Francisco institution...Rooms full of women in funny hats playing tea party isn't my cuppa. I love tea..and scones and clotted cream and lemon curd...not in a zoo like environment.
Women flock here for special events...hence, the crowds. noise and reservations are a must! A further buzzkill parking is a challenge.

excerpts: It's an awesome deal and can certainly be split between two people, along with add-ons (extra scones or petit fours) without it being too pricey.
Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!
scones.author: Jo W.
scones.review:
Had my first time here yesterday after years of staring at photos online, and it certainly did not disappoint! I had imagined it to be two stories for some reason, and it's a little smaller than I expected, but the decor is so beautiful, charming, and quirky, like straight out of a Victorian storybook with a modern touch (mismatched tea cups, saucers, teapots, and plates).

My friend and I had Queen's Tea. I didn't see it offered on their Yelp menu, but on their menu at the table, it was listed. It's an awesome deal and can certainly be split between two people, along with add-ons (extra scones or petit fours) without it being too pricey. (I looked at the High Tea option. If we had chosen that, and then had extras, it would have costed more than the Queen's Tea with extra). Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!

For tea, we got China Rose Petal. It's as delicious and beautiful as it sounds. The staff and waiters were so friendly and courteous, and were very kind to help me and my friend get photos of us even though they were closing up at 6:00 (my friend and I had a 4:30 reservation).

I really recommend everyone who has appreciation for tea and Victorian aesthetics/culture to visit this place. What a gem! You just have to drive over a bunch of crazy narrow streets and scary steep San Francisco hills.

My sole critique would be reservation. At the time of this review, only phone reservations are accepted, and I booked between a month to 2 weeks in advance, with the option of 11:00 AM or 4:30 PM on the day my friend and I wanted to come here. I would have liked to reserve online for simplicity's sake, and also not to have to play phone tag with staff (nothing wrong on their end. I left a message, and they called back when I was luckily not busy).

I'll be back here! This is a lovely place for a fairy tale tea getaway! :D

excerpts: Also, the scones were fabulous!
I have never much liked scones, because they are usually so dry, but these were moist and SO TASTY!
Also loved their raspberry jam and clotted cream.
The sandwiches were also great and our whole group left feeling very full and satisfied.
There were many teas from which to choose, including ones without caffeine (I love caffeine, but it doesn't love me), so I was able to drink more than a couple of pots while I was there.
All in all, a wonderful experience.
scones.author: Ruth L.
scones.review: Went there yesterday with an online group.  There was a glitch in the reservation (problem with the computer at the online group) and I got there an hour before the changed reservation.  They were SO nice!  They let me sit for an hour and drink tea while I waited for everyone else.  Also, the scones were fabulous!  I have never much liked scones, because they are usually so dry, but these were moist and SO TASTY!  Also loved their raspberry jam and clotted cream.  The sandwiches were also great and our whole group left feeling very full and satisfied.  There were many teas from which to choose, including ones without caffeine (I love caffeine, but it doesn't love me), so I was able to drink more than a couple of pots while I was there.  All in all, a wonderful experience.

excerpts: The scones though are a different story and probably on my top 3 scones I've ever tried.
Freshly baked, crumbly, flaky, buttery, light, just enough moistness and not softness.
If you're not looking to try the full tea service, at least try their scones.
scones.author: June Y.
scones.review:
I was super excited to try this place out seeing as how they have 4.5 stars with a ton of reviews! First off, finding parking in the area during the weekend is TERRIBLE. I had to circle the blocks for 25 minutes before I could find a spot. 

Did high tea for 2 and sampled the following sandwiches:
1. Smoked salmon and cream cheese: Classic. Yummy.
2. Salmon Mousse: Can you tell I like salmon? A-OK.
3. Chicken apple walnut salad: didn't taste any walnut and just tasted like chicken salad to me. Meh.
4. Artichoke Hummus: good but so SALTY.

The tea sandwiches are TINY. tinier than the majority of tea rooms I've been to and I wasn't really terribly impressed with any particular sandwich.

The scones though are a different story and probably on my top 3 scones I've ever tried. Freshly baked, crumbly, flaky, buttery, light, just enough moistness and not softness. If you're not looking to try the full tea service, at least try their scones.

For my tea, I tried the black lavender vanilla tea. Really yummy! You can really taste the lavender and vanilla and it went so well with the savory sandwiches.

Pretty affordable as far as afternoon tea services go. The high tea for two cost $50.
Make reservations ahead of time. They get really busy especially during the weekends.

excerpts: Though the sandwiches and crumpets were both delicious, the scones were the true stars of the meal.
Overall, this was a great tea room and I would love to go back and try more teas.
scones.author: Lakshmi M.
scones.review: Lovejoy's Tea Room was my first attempt at having a classy tea experience. The atmosphere was great, the decorations were cute, and the tea pots and cups were adorable. The staff was also great at explaining the menu to first time customers. My friend and I both decided to get the Queen's Tea because we really wanted to try as much as we could. The Earl Grey was great, but I also really enjoyed the Royal Blend. Though the sandwiches and crumpets were both delicious, the scones were the true stars of the meal. Overall, this was a great tea room and I would love to go back and try more teas.

excerpts: I had one of the best scones I've eaten.
The staff was very friendly and thoughtful.
scones.author: Aylin B.
scones.review: The food was delightful. I had one of the best scones I've eaten. The staff was very friendly and thoughtful.

excerpts: We ordered two high teas & the teas, sandwiches & scones were all delicious!
We got the house blend tea & the Japanese green tea.
For sandwiches, we got the smoked salmon, smoked turkey, roast beef & salmon purée.
I scarfed down those sandwiches since I thought they were so tasty!
Finally for dessert, we had the scones with jam & Devon cream.
One of the best scones I've ever had!
scones.author: Trisha G.
scones.review:
Made reservations a month early for a Friday just in case. They say is right away next to the telephone booth. The staff was super friendly. We ordered two high teas & the teas, sandwiches & scones were all delicious! We got the house blend tea & the Japanese green tea. For sandwiches, we got the smoked salmon, smoked turkey, roast beef & salmon purée. I scarfed down those sandwiches since I thought they were so tasty! Finally for dessert, we had the scones with jam & Devon cream. One of the best scones I've ever had! Will be definitely coming back!

Two high teas came out to $45. Parking took about 5 mins to find. Make sure to make reservations bc they can get pretty busy! Also, try one of their fancy tea hats to have a tea-riffic time!

excerpts: The scones are delicious as are the chicken walnut sandwiches.
You can get any sandwich you wish but I love all of them
scones.author: Cindi W.
scones.review: Best best best tea with best best best friends. I love the little sausage pastry rolls and the fresh salad. The scones are delicious as are the chicken walnut sandwiches. You can get any sandwich you wish but I love all of them

excerpts: They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first.
scones.author: Ziyan C.
scones.review:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

* Fresh Fruit - 3 stars
Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice. 

* Petit Four - 4 stars
full platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#JSpHOzIStSs32UFby1oYIw
cross-section of our choices: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#k3_KeW_0tv5f41UvRFRtJw
We got a dark chocolate/lemon, as well as a rosewater. The chocolate one wasn't great, the jelly-like lemon filling not as sharp as I'd hoped. The rose-water soaked bread-like filling of the other one was great, and we all liked that one much more.

* Tea Biscuit - 3 stars
Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies. 

* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Fj33P7RuOhTOwxyb5OtVJQ
LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy. The outside is a little more crisped as well. Great with combinations of the lemon curd, butter, and blackberry preserves!

* Warm Scone with Preserves & Devon Cream - 3.5 stars
Not quite warm. Tasty but a little bit on the dry side. Love the combos of cream and blackberry preserves, that's the way to have it!

Tea Room Menu Top Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#vFpyqGqPd3Y8rupGqEqLkA
Tea Room Menu Bottom Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Y5Hot1gL66ruNvftbceu-g
Black & Black Flavored Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#tWZwzJRJcZ60PfCdcf0TWA
Decaf, Green/White, Tisanes Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#hDdEmd8WwMj2wwDd8t7gTQ

excerpts: So for that measly insult of a sandwich and two scones and a miniscule scoop of watery double devon cream I paid the exorbitant amount of $13+.
Oh I miss the ladies that for decades really knew what they were doing with this place.
It takes one person to bring it to ruin.
scones.author: Emilia G.
scones.review:
It is sad to see that the new owner does not have a clue about how to run this potential gold mine.  Never be short staffed.  Never fill the whole restaurant at once and only have 2 servers.  Never offer less than what the previous owners had all the regulars used to, like your choice of a tea with every high tea! Today, upon getting seated we were "graced" with a black tea and a vanilla roiboos, but who ordered or picked those two?  How pretentious of them to force their choice of tea on a patron!  Then,  the crumpet for the queen was served as an afterthought.  The sandwiches overall, were great.  The chicken walnut salad sandwich tasted funny, like tuna fish and a tad sour.  The cucumbers were not fresh.  Only one of the persons at the table was offered a petit four! The rest of us were left speechless.  We know they are extra and not included with a high tea but we always used to get tempted at the end of the meal!

To add insult to injury, I ordered a chicken and asparagus tea sandwich to go and when my son opened the box to eat it at home it was turkey with mustard!  no asparagus! what????? So for that measly insult of a sandwich and two scones and a miniscule scoop of watery double devon cream I paid the exorbitant amount of $13+.  Oh I miss the ladies that for decades really knew what they were doing with this place.  It takes one person to bring it to ruin.  Sigh!  

Go to Lovey's in Pacifica, perhaps you will get lucky with the servers there.

excerpts: My favorite part was the scones though.
They were warm, flaky, buttery with small raisins and tasted great with the strawberry preserves.
Extra kudos for the preserves too.
They tasted just like ripe strawberries -- no artificial flavors here! -- and were so easy to spread over the scones.
scones.author: Sophie B.
scones.review:
This is an adorable little spot. The decor is quirky with tea cups and kettles plus assorted British bric-a-brac covering the walls and shelves. 

The staff is so cheerful and helpful. They squeezed us in last-minute before an appointment and recommended some great sandwiches: the Stilton (pear and blue cheese -- sounds unusual but tastes amazing!) and the tomato cheddar. 

The tea selection is wide and varied too. I tried tried the mango black tea, which tasted like candied mango (great if you have a sweet tooth).

My favorite part was the scones though. They were warm, flaky, buttery with small raisins and tasted great with the strawberry preserves. Extra kudos for the preserves too. They tasted just like ripe strawberries -- no artificial flavors here! -- and were so easy to spread over the scones. 

Looking forward to going back :)

excerpts:
Variety of Fruit
Layer 2: Scones, spread, and miniature cookies
Layer 3: Sandwiches and Salad
Layer 4: Sandwiches, Salad, and Coleslaw
scones.author: Michelle C.
scones.review:
Came here for a tea party for my friend's birthday on a Sunday afternoon. When she originally made the reservation, only 11AM was open but she was able to secure a better time for us later on in the day (4pm).

We arrived promptly at 4 (you can find street parking in this area) and were seated at one side of a long table which we shared with another party. My friends and I decided to order the Queen's tea, which comes with a lot of variety of food to munch on. We each got to order our own pot of tea and I got the White Peach. I really like the nice fruity flavor. With the Queen's tea, we also got to choose 2 different sandwiches. I chose the Chicken Salad and the Salmon with Cream Cheese. When it comes out, you get 2 quarters of each sandwich

The tea came out first. It's fun to add the cream and sugar in it to get different flavors/taste. The birthday girl had ordered the Tea Room tea (the house tea? I forget) and when she mixed hers, the end result tasted like HK style milk tea, aka really good.

Then our 4 layer platter of food came out. 
Layer 1: Variety of Fruit
Layer 2: Scones, spread, and miniature cookies
Layer 3: Sandwiches and Salad
Layer 4: Sandwiches, Salad, and Coleslaw

Next, the crumpets came out (still warm!)

We finished off our tea party with little cake (one per person). I chose the strawberry shortcake.

The tea party was an overall success. I enjoyed the scone the most and really liked all the various spreads that came with it. 

We paid for the bday girl so the total per person ended up being somewhere are $45 (there was a total of 4 of us). 

I would definitely recommend celebrating by having a tea party here!

excerpts: The mango tea goes perfect with their scones.
Omg the scones are to die for !!!
LOVE LOVE LOVE
THIS PLACE
scones.author: Jazman M.
scones.review: Love this place! The mango tea goes perfect with their scones. Omg the scones are to die for !!! LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE

excerpts:
The best thing is they were able to do the entire high tea gluten free for me including scones and biscuits and sandwiches which I am extremely impressed with. 
I highly recommend the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches and the black vanilla tea. 
Definitely coming back!!
scones.author: Van-Anh N.
scones.review:
I've been meaning to try this place out because I love high tea just as much as I love brunch. Came on Wednesday early afternoon and got a table for 2 without a problem. We got the Queen's tea which we shared (see picture) with an extra pot of bottomless tea. It is a lot of food and finishes off with petit fours. $45 in total + tips which is a great price for high tea. It's super kooky and vintage decor, mismatched tea pots and cozy vibe. The best thing is they were able to do the entire high tea gluten free for me including scones and biscuits and sandwiches which I am extremely impressed with. 
I highly recommend the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches and the black vanilla tea. 
Definitely coming back!!

excerpts: The scones are the best!
I've never been a fan of scones because they are typically dense and cold and hard but theirs is complete opposite
(of course you should eat it while it's still warm once it comes).
It comes with double Devon cream and a jam.
scones.author: Angela L.
scones.review:
The interior is gorgeous! Every little thing and detail in here fits in all together. Place isn't really big so best to make a reservation. But a really nice place to just have a girls day and just relax and catch up. 

The scones are the best! I've never been a fan of scones because they are typically dense and cold and hard but theirs is complete opposite  (of course you should eat it while it's still warm once it comes). It comes with double Devon cream and a jam. It's already perfect by itself.

My friend and I got the High Tea, so we each got our own choice of tea and each high tea comes with 2 choice of sandwich so we were able to choose 4. 

Overall, the service was good. Making sure we're doing okay and explain to us what the daily special sandwich was and explain each section as our food arrived

excerpts: The tea service was exemplary and the scones out of this world.
Two thumbs way up.
scones.author: Mike K.
scones.review:
What an amazing time. Our daughter's party was delightful, as was the service. My wife and I took a separate table to leave the girls to themselves, and were struck by the knowledge and friendliness of every single staffer.

The tea service was exemplary and the scones out of this world.
Two thumbs way up.

excerpts: Since I'm a go big or go home type of person, I went for the Queen's Tea which included two tea sandwiches, scones, crumpet, fresh fruit, petit fours and a bottomless tea pot.
I'll start off now by saying, this is way too much for one person
but it was very good to be able to taste a little bit of everything.
I was especially impressed with the scone which was light and airy especially with the dreamy clotted cream spread on top.
It was so good
scones.author: Kimberly S.
scones.review:
Pinkies up!

After a long flight, Lovejoy's was the perfect place to reconstruct myself into a new human being. The rickety furniture, crocheted wall hangings, and mismatched china gives the whole place a grandma chic feel. When you walk in, you immediately feel like the walls are closing in you to give you a big, warm, hug.

We made reservations beforehand but SF traffic and ....me being me...... made us 30 minutes late. Luckily the gracious hosts were able to accommodate us immediately and a few minutes later we were swimming in tea and carbs. 

Since I'm a go big or go home type of person, I went for the Queen's Tea which included two tea sandwiches, scones, crumpet, fresh fruit, petit fours and a bottomless tea pot. I'll start off now by saying, this is way too much for one person but it was very good to be able to taste a little bit of everything. I was especially impressed with the scone which was light and airy especially with the dreamy clotted cream spread on top. It was so good, I would (and probably did) give up my left artery for more.

For tea, I went with the standard darjeeling but I was really happy to see that they had such wide and varied choices like chesnut (which my dining partner got) and all of my favorite types of Japanese green tea that I get at home.

Service was relaxed and two hours was plenty of time for us get all of our girl gab on. Don't forget to pick up souvenirs at the shop across the street!

excerpts: The scones and clotted cream are particularly delicious.
Be sure to make a reservation before you go -- they tend to book up pretty far in advance.
scones.author: Amanda S.
scones.review: Note: I haven't been back to Lovejoy's since the change in ownership, so this review is for my experience under the previous owners. You really must go here to fully appreciate it, and you really must go here in general! It really does feel like having tea at your grandmother or great aunt's house (your grandmother or great aunt who happens to love knick knacks). The whole experience is so lovely. Having tea is a tradition my friend and I have started that is one of my most favorite things to do now. Sitting down and talking over delicious tea and tea snacks turns out to be incredibly fun! What surprised me about Lovejoy's that was how good their tea and food was -- I guess I wasn't sure based on all of the tchotchkes, but it's really high quality! Our favorite tea is the strawberry one, and you can't go wrong with any of the different food options. The scones and clotted cream are particularly delicious.  Be sure to make a reservation before you go -- they tend to book up pretty far in advance.

excerpts: Even the Brown's hotel in London doesn't have scones and cream this delicious.
scones.author: Jack R.
scones.review:
Came here to treat my editor out for lunch, and by the looks of it, I didn't know there was a prerequisite of knowing Downton Abbey to eat here.

Woman near the restroom: "Do you watch Downton Abbey?"
Me waiting in line, minding my own business: "No."
Woman near the restroom: "Oh, EVERYBODY WATCHES IT, dear."
2nd woman queuing up; there's only one toilet: "Oh, I heard you mentioning Downton, oh I love that show..."

The next 5 minutes was a blur as they chatted back and forth over what seemed like the game of Clue. There was a butler, a rich man, a maid, and murder.

Thank goodness I was here for their tea. And speaking strictly as someone who's father is British, and from all my travels to London and back, I love this place.

I usually get The High Tea and not the Queen's Tea, only because I don't like Petit Four's. Nasty cake covered in sugar. No offense to Lovejoy's, I dislike all Petit Four's alike.

My favorite sandwiches are their Salmon Mousse, Chicken Salad, and Egg Salad.

The service here is always top notch, they refill my honey, add more water, etc without me having to flag them down.

But, my all time top 20 food comes from this place, and that's their scone with Devon cream. Even the Brown's hotel in London doesn't have scones and cream this delicious.

And, at least the lovely staff doesn't require any prior knowledge of Downton Abbey before they seat you.

excerpts: Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was just lovely for us to enjoy each others' company over seeping tea and tasty sandwiches, scones and crumpets.
scones.author: Marcia Y.
scones.review: We had an exceptional time at Lovejoy's Tea Room.  My mother and I had The Queen's Tea for two and the food was delicious and beautifully presented.  Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was just lovely for us to enjoy each others' company over seeping tea and tasty sandwiches, scones and crumpets.

excerpts: The currant scones with the lemon and raspberry spread are amazing.
scones.author: Kirsten M.
scones.review:
This is my second time at Lovejoy's and I can't wait to come back! I wish that "tea time" was an American tradition - I wouldn't mind taking time every day to sip some tea and eat some crumpets. There's also a comforting feeling being in a tea room. You are in a relaxed environment and genuinely just enjoy your guests company.

You feel so fancy with all of the delicate china that I think it makes you eat slower or more "lady-like" which enables you to really savor and enjoy your food. The food itself isn't too filling, but you fill up on the bottomless tea. The darjeeling tea was my favorite. 

The food comes out on these cute tiered plates. What is it about food being higher up that makes it so fancy? They come out with itty bitty sandwiches with the crusts cut off. I mean, c'mon! Too adorable. My favorite was the pear and stilton cheese. The currant scones with the lemon and raspberry spread are amazing. The crumpet was nothing to write home about. To me it just tastes like a plain waffle. Let's not forget about the petit fours they bring out at the end. Petit fours are basically baby marzipan cakes which are thee perfect bite. 

If you're meeting up with an old friend for lunch, maybe planning a bridal shower, or just in the mood for some good ole tea - Lovejoy's is the perfect spot.

excerpts:
Tea comprises of sandwiches, scones,fresh fruits, biscuit, fresh fruits and bottomless tea. 
- The warm scones served with raspberry & lemon curd jams were buttery deliciousness.
- They have a variety of flavorful teas such as Rose, Summer berries, Violet, White Peach,etc. 
We went with the choice of rose tea which was highly fragrant and refreshing. 
- For the sandwiches, our favorites were - salmon cream cheese and chicken asparagus..
scones.author: Payal B.
scones.review:
Oh Lovejoy, just the mere mention of Parisian-standard tea is enough to make every girl excited. Its one of the best picks to celebrate a day with your lovely ladies such as  bachelorette's, bridal shower or simply when you wanna dress up n feel fancy.

Came here with 5 of my friends for a bachelorette kickoff with high tea.  Made reservation at least 3 weeks in advance as this place is super busy on weekends.

Play dress up for the fun of it. Make sure your girls pick their choice of hats from the hat stand and do a role play from Downtown Abbey. 

Decor -
You are sure to be transformed to the British la la land. The decor is sure to melt your heart like candy floss. So charming with lace, hats, florals and everything antique chic.

Food -
We ordered the High tea and the Queen's tea. Served in absolutely adorable tea sets!

Tea comprises of sandwiches, scones,fresh fruits, biscuit, fresh fruits and bottomless tea. 
- The warm scones served with raspberry & lemon curd jams were buttery deliciousness.
- They have a variety of flavorful teas such as Rose, Summer berries, Violet, White Peach,etc. We went with the choice of rose tea which was highly fragrant and refreshing. 
- For the sandwiches, our favorites were - salmon cream cheese and chicken asparagus.. All sandwiches were super delicious.

Service - 
Excellent. Everything came on time.They always made sure our tea pots are filled.

Price - 
We paid $25 each, for a group of 5. Not bad.

This place was just perfect and a 5 star. Everyone had a great time.

excerpts: The scones are the one thing to die for, along with the clotted cream.
YUM!
scones.author: Christie L.
scones.review: I've heard this place is amazing, but the service is what's bringing my review down. Got the Queen's Tea. The server seemed to rush my sister and I through our "brunch." She kept coming over lots in the beginning, and afterwards we never saw her (when we actually did need her to refill our pots, etc.). Chocolate Decaf Tea and Rosepetal Tea were both great. The food was good, but not amazing. The scones are the one thing to die for, along with the clotted cream. YUM!

excerpts:
In the game of scones,
This is the iron scone.
Did I mention the scones?
So buttery and scrumptious!
scones.author: Catherine K.
scones.review:
In the game of scones,
This is the iron scone.
The one scone to rule them all.

----
Do have high tea. I loved the white strawberry flavor.
Did I mention the scones?
So buttery and scrumptious!

excerpts: The scones were the BEST SCONES
I HAVE EVER TASTED.
They are light, airy, warm, buttery.
When spread with the lemon curd or the raspberry preserves.
I literally heard angels sing.
I am definitely coming back again for the scones!
Definitely a wonderful experience with great scones and teas and will come back again!
scones.author: Helen J.
scones.review:
This is the PERFECT place to have a good time being ladies with some girlfriends. Don't expect to be "full" from this but I was definitely full from the tea. Me and my friends had the Queen's Tea for two. The best tea sandwiches so far were the smoked salmon and cream cheese and the salad was light and fresh. 

The scones were the BEST SCONES I HAVE EVER TASTED. They are light, airy, warm, buttery. When spread with the lemon curd or the raspberry preserves. I literally heard angels sing. I am definitely coming back again for the scones!

I usually like my teas light so i opted for the green tea white peach. It was very delightful and light that I ended up going across the street to their store and purchasing their loose tea leaves. Definitely a wonderful experience with great scones and teas and will come back again!

excerpts: The warm scones were good and the raspberry preserves were delicious.
I could eat that on it's own.
The "salad" and slaw on the bottom of the tray were minimal and flavorless and the dressing was no help.
The real reason we came was for the petite fours!
I have loved them since I was a child and could not wait to have my fiance taste one
I was overjoyed when they brought out the desserts; both for the petite fours and because we were both starving!
Although they are small and were $2.50 each, we got 3 just to sample.
I heard the server advise that they were Marzipan, but after biting into the first one, I almost spit it out.
My fiance bit into his at the same time and the look on our faces spoke volumes.
It was terrible!
I tried to eat them but they literally made me feel sick.
We had to put napkins over them so we could get our check.
I felt so bad.
Last night I had to order some real petite fours online to try and "un-traumatize" my fiance and let him know they aren't really disgusting.
Sad to say, but this place is just a novelty and I should not be rated as highly as it is.
I would give our experience 1.5 stars.
scones.author: Dale S.
scones.review:
I was SO excited to try this place! I've had high tea in London and it was amazing. I also just had a tea party of my own a few months back and it was a delight. I was so eager in fact that I insisted we go to tea before we even handled the errands that brought us to SF for the day. 
The tea room itself is adorable. I love how none of the cups, saucers and pots match. The eclectic decor gives it a really authentic feel and even the bathroom is done up. The antique furniture is great too. We were surprised that there were a lot of kids inside the business and it was actually rather loud and noisy. 
The staff was nice enough, but not genuinely warm. 
We each had a pot of tea. I chose the Vanilla black tea and my fiance had the black currant. I don't know why he chose that and it tasted bad (as I expected it would) with a bad aftertaste as well. Can't blame them for that. We just kept drinking out of my pot lol. 
We got 4 sandwiches with our high tea for two. I had the special which was a fig and goat cheese and I also ordered the pickle chutney. My date had the hummus and artichoke as well as turkey with dijon mustard. When the sandwiches came out they were TINY which is too be expected at a tea. But still, these were exceptionally tiny so we resigned ourselves to eat a real meal somewhere else later. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were inedible. The flavors were overpowering in the worst way and they smelled and tasted rancid. Honestly, there were all terrible with no consideration for anyone's pallet. I was very disappointed. 
The warm scones were good and the raspberry preserves were delicious. I could eat that on it's own. The "salad" and slaw on the bottom of the tray were minimal and flavorless and the dressing was no help. 
The real reason we came was for the petite fours! I have loved them since I was a child and could not wait to have my fiance taste one :) I was overjoyed when they brought out the desserts; both for the petite fours and because we were both starving! Although they are small and were $2.50 each, we got 3 just to sample. I heard the server advise that they were Marzipan, but after biting into the first one, I almost spit it out. My fiance bit into his at the same time and the look on our faces spoke volumes. It was terrible! I tried to eat them but they literally made me feel sick. We had to put napkins over them so we could get our check. I felt so bad. Last night I had to order some real petite fours online to try and "un-traumatize" my fiance and let him know they aren't really disgusting. 
Sad to say, but this place is just a novelty and I should not be rated as highly as it is. I would give our experience 1.5 stars.

excerpts: We each had our own tea & tea sandwiches, fruit, salad, scones, cookies, lemon curd, raspberry preserves, it was so nice!
I highly recommend this place & will definitely be going back, thank you!
scones.author: Marlene C.
scones.review: Loved everything about this cute little place!  Not only did they get us in after we called to make a reservation on my birthday, but they treated us like royalty, I felt like I was in England!  We each had our own tea & tea sandwiches, fruit, salad, scones, cookies, lemon curd, raspberry preserves, it was so nice!  I highly recommend this place & will definitely be going back, thank you!

excerpts: Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc.
All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding.
After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are
scones.author: Elizabeth T.
scones.review:
Beautiful, old-fashion-looking, tea room serving some good 'ol afternoon tea!

Crowd: for weekends --- go online for reservation. You won't be able to get in otherwise. There are set entry times as well. I think the max stay for each party is 2 hours. You will need to put down a card for the reservation as well.

Location: right next to the muni stop on Church, J line goes through here.

Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc. All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding. After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are :) You're really just there for the nice atmosphere, pleasant decor, warm and nice food, and chit chat. 

For those with kids: strollers will not fit inside. No room for highchair. OK to bring infants that can be held/wrapped and are relatively quiet. Not suitable for small children who can't sit still.

Experience: We went with a party of 6 on Sunday 1:15PM with reservation a month in advance. Promptly seated. We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie. Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches. You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal! Service is good and there's really not much to complain! 

Compare to other tea places in SF:

Dartealing is a little better in terms of tea uniqueness & sandwich quality, but overall these two are my favorites. Fairmont hotel afternoon tea is more expensive, has more fancy decor, but the sweets are actually worse. The Rotunda downtown is more noisy, fancier looking, more expensive, and also less refined. Samouvar is not really the same type of place, so no comparison.  I have not been to Crumpet.

So really, Dartealing and LoveJoy are my top 2 recommended afternoon tea in SF. Very affordable and very good!

excerpts: Since this is my first time at Lovejoy's, we choose to go with the Queen's Tea with all the lovely tea sammies, crumpets, scones with clotted cream and lemon curds to go with the Royal Blend black tea.
The ambiance at Lovejoy's is just lovely and inviting-it's no surprise that reservations are hard to come by
scones.author: Taffany H.
scones.review:
Serendipity and spontaneity are in a perfect alignment this afternoon when yours truly and the boy she loves roll by Lovejoy's for a chance to be seated without reservation to guarantee us a spot. But it has all worked out. The nice lady hostess fits us in for a 90 mins tea service and all is well. 
Since this is my first time at Lovejoy's, we choose to go with the Queen's Tea with all the lovely tea sammies, crumpets, scones with clotted cream and lemon curds to go with the Royal Blend black tea. The ambiance at Lovejoy's is just lovely and inviting-it's no surprise that reservations are hard to come by so I feel quite lucky to have this tea service as soon as I walk in today. 

As for the tea, the Royal Blend is pleasantly smooth, with a hint of orange and vanilla-but I may want to try other tea options on our next visit. There is quite a selection on their tea, tea sammies, and the petit fours. For our tea service this afternoon, we opt for the bay shrimp and mayonnaise, and turkey and dijon mustard-what dainty little tasty sandwiches these are... The scone, lemon curd, clotted cream and the raspberry jam were also nice and adequate. 

Overall, for a tea service, I would grade Lovejoy's Ambiance and friendly and attentive service to be 5 stars, taste of food at 3.5. I find their pricing to be quite affordable and would likely try to come back if the gods of tea service would kindly bless me with another spontaneous seating again since reservations are so difficult to get.

excerpts: Also, the scones were some of the best I've had!
scones.author: Joyce E.
scones.review:
I was seriously envisioning giving Lovejoy's Tea Room a glowing 5 star review because I love all the cutesy quirky decor, but my best friend and I got the serious runs after visiting this place! I made a reservation for 2 at 2pm on a Thursday afternoon and my best friend and I arrived 15 minutes before our reservation. We were seated right away, but I was a bit disappointed that we were sitting so close to the party next to us because we could hear every single detail of their conversation. We were going to ask if we could move, but the place was packed and we didn't want to seem like snobs!

As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea. The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard. My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny. Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small! The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people. Also, the scones were some of the best I've had!

As we were eating and chatting about life, I noticed that I felt a tad bit hot halfway through. Thinking it was the tea and lack of ventilation on our side, I ignored it and started to feel this way throughout the remaining portion of our tea time. We paid, left, and my stomach started making odd noises. I ignored it until an hour passed and my BFF and I ran to the shiny porcelain throne and girl, let me tell you, it definitely felt like we were reenacting the scene from White Chicks when Brittany or Tiffany Wilson was holding on for her life when she had the quiche. Definitely NOT  a pretty look! It was my first time taking Pepto Bismol and I was not happy.

Again I really do hate to be that person giving 2 stars on a highly rated establishment, but Lovejoy's, you let me down. Would I come back? Probably not!

excerpts: I don't remember the exact tea service, but it came with delicious looking tea sandwiches, fresh fruits, fresh scones, and more.
scones.author: Marti L.
scones.review:
Lovejoy won me over with their pub fare menu. Yup, it was that simple. 

I'm not a high tea person. I don't normally drink tea. I don't like eating dinky portions. But it's one of those get-in-touch-with-your-feminine-side things. And of course, it's about being in the company of good girlfriends. 

The place felt crowded and cluttered. It was overloaded with pictures, posters, hats, and all sorts of dainty things! Still, they were all interesting to look at. Service was quite friendly and attentive given how busy they were. 

Out of 7 girls, 4 did tea service while 3 ordered from the pub fare. I don't remember the exact tea service, but it came with delicious looking tea sandwiches, fresh fruits, fresh scones, and more. But I would say the winners were the shepherd's pies and salad from the pub fare menu. 

Shepherd's Pie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#TO35VWsTkBqeB_BW3eXzHg): Minced meat and mashed potato baked in a large dish. Served with mixed greens. Not only was the portion huge, it tasted so good! So flavorful and hearty!

Pear & Stilton Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw): Spring greens with pears, strawberries, oranges, blueberries, walnut, stilton cheese, and strawberry balsamic vinaigrette. Served with slices of grapefruit and pita on the side. The salad was also huge. But also very refreshing and delicious! 

One of the girlfriends and I originally made plans to go eat in the Mission afterwards, thinking we won't be full. We ended up going to the Mission to walk off our stuffed bellies.

excerpts: Also, the SCONES!
scones.author: Lizzy B.
scones.review: So much fun! They have a great selection of teas (I really liked the Chestnut) and some really tasty sandwiches! As far as high tea goes, it's very affordable! I loved the English Cheddar and Tomato sandwich. Also, the SCONES!

excerpts: Rooibos tea was tasty, and they had great scones, but I wasn't so much a fan of the finger sandwiches (since the bread was ordinary, like grocery store wonder bread almost..and the fillings weren't super special or tasty.
But definitely try the scones - they're buttery and rich, and perfectly lightly sweet!
scones.author: Kristie C.
scones.review:
Came for my sister's bridal shower. Rooibos tea was tasty, and they had great scones, but I wasn't so much a fan of the finger sandwiches (since the bread was ordinary, like grocery store wonder bread almost..and the fillings weren't super special or tasty. Also, the salad was just haphazardly on one layer of the tiered plate). 

Nonetheless, cute place for a tea party - this is better for the ambiance/environment I would say rather than the food. But definitely try the scones - they're buttery and rich, and perfectly lightly sweet!

excerpts: The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries.
I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin.
It's seriously a lot of food!
My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches.
They were heavenly when paired with the tea.
I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it.

I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it.
scones.author: Kim D.
scones.review:
I came here for my sister's baby sprinkle in a party of ~ 8. It was my first time experiencing high tea, and I didn't expect anything great; I mean, it's just tea and some overpriced biscuits. How great can it be, right?

Well, I found out that it's pretty darn great! First off, everything was adorable, from the mismatched plates and saucers to the homey, antiquey decorations around the tea room. It reminds me of Alice in Wonderland, just a bit! The service is also wonderful. She always came around to keep our tea pots full and to make sure we were doing okay. 

The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries. I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin. It's seriously a lot of food! My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. They were heavenly when paired with the tea. I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it. Also, when you choose your petits fours at the end of your tea ritual, I would suggest avoiding the salted caramel truffle unless you like your truffle EXTREMELY salty. Everything else seemed fine, though.

Overall, I'd definitely come back when I'm in SF. Seeing as how brunch has become pretty basic (but I'm still a huge brunch fanatic - does that make me basic?), I say skip the eggs benedicts and mimosas and have a tea party date with your girlfriends at Lovejoy's instead!

excerpts: so they book up quickly, but they let us order to go (had to order there as they rarely pick up their phone) so that our out of town guests could try their amazing scones.
scones.author: Nicole D.
scones.review: We love Lovejoy's. We've brought out of town guests, celebrated birthdays and holidays here and each time the service has been great.  They have a good selection of teas and food, even for those that aren't in love with tea.  It's a popular place so they book up quickly, but they let us order to go (had to order there as they rarely pick up their phone) so that our out of town guests could try their amazing scones.

excerpts: Their scones are AMAZING.
Order as many as you can and layer on their preserves, Devon cream and lemon curd.
Not all at once, of course.
Or you could.
Why not?
They're so good!
We also had cucumber/cream cheese and smoked salmon/cream cheese tea sandwiches with fresh fruit.
scones.author: Claudine D.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is too stinkin' cute. You do feel like royalty when you visit here and stay for their tea service. We no longer live in California, so when we visit my daughter insists we come to Lovejoy's each time. We brought Grandma for afternoon tea, and we had a ball. Just us girls. Three generations. 

Now for the tea service. Their scones are AMAZING. Order as many as you can and layer on their preserves, Devon cream and lemon curd. Not all at once, of course. Or you could. Why not? They're so good! We also had cucumber/cream cheese and smoked salmon/cream cheese tea sandwiches with fresh fruit. As for tea, we each had our own pot of Vanilla Rooibos, Earl Grey Cream and Afternoon Darjeeling which is my new favorite. 

The mismatch of tea cups, saucers and plates add to the charm. I wish their space was just a tad bit bigger. Tables and chairs are quite close to each other, but this shouldn't be a reason to not visit. It just makes the whole tea room feel quite cozy. My daughter is a huge fan of Lovejoy's and now we've made a fan of my mother too. Make sure you also visit Lovejoy's Attic across the way to purchase those lovely tea blends. Reservations are required. To the tea room. Not the store. You only live once. Treat yourself to Lovejoy's. And often!

excerpts: the only thing i did enjoy were the yummy scones but other than that everything was dissaponting especially because of the raving yelpers that attracted us to even try this place out );!!!
scones.author: Rosh E.
scones.review:
Location: It's on the corner so you won't miss it and it is street parking!


Customer Service: Friendly staff and very attentive.


Decor: Very cute vintage and antique feel! I love the decor actually, it feels like somebody took a box and put in all these memorabilia with cute old school furniture and shook it up and bam you got the love joy tea room!


Presentation of Food: Very cute and everything you'd expect in a tea party setting! Cutest thing was the mismatched tea sets gave it a different feel compared to other tea spots!


How did the food taste?: This is why I gave it two stars! The sandwiches were plain and nothing to rave about? I tried the chicken walnut sammy and it had no flavor! Their sandwhich of the day had turkey cranberry etc and you'd think it's be good because it's the special of the day but it was too sour and just wasn't what I had expected. The salad was bleh also, the dressing was just so bland! the only thing i did enjoy were the yummy scones but other than that everything was dissaponting especially because of the raving yelpers that attracted us to even try this place out );!!! Btw we ordered the high tea! I will say though is that they had good tea.



Overall Experience: It was just eh....


Would I Come Back?: No there's other tea places I target go to!

excerpts: The scones are to die for
scones.author: Katherine Q.
scones.review: This is such a cool unique place to go. Definetly a price lunch but the atmosphere and whole experience make it a worthy treat. Everything is delicate and fresh. The scones are to die for

excerpts: The warm scones and raspberry jam are always amazing.
My favourite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and salmon and cream cheese.
scones.author: Cat B.
scones.review:
My friends and I come here every other month for special occasions and when we just want to have a nice cup of tea and sandwiches. For special occasions, we usually get high tea. The warm scones and raspberry jam are always amazing. My favourite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and salmon and cream cheese. Their sandwiches are always delicious and the bread is soft like clouds. 

For birthdays, LJ's gives a special small birthday cake petit four (all the other petit four flavours are incredible as well- especially the lemon and strawberry ones).
I love the "endless pot o' tea" -- my friends and I always find ourselves drinking two or more teapot-fulls! 
As for tea, China rose petal and Forest berries and rose hips are my absolute favourite.
Lovejoy's is perfect for just hanging out with the girls or for birthday parties. I have seen a post-wedding celebration take place at Lovejoy's as well. I highly recommend for all ages and just about any occasion.

excerpts: Servers were amazing, tea and scones were delicious.
scones.author: Eileen H.
scones.review:
Had high tea here this afternoon, very quaint and cute little tea room.  Lots of books and general clutter around but in a cute "grandma" way.

Servers were amazing, tea and scones were delicious.  

Between the two of us we had 4 sandwiches, the only one I would skip is the salmon and cream cheese.  We had the daily special which was a curry sand which and was delicious.

excerpts: but their scones are the best.
scones.author: Julie L.
scones.review:
Great little tea room for lunch. I ordered the white peach tea and it was smoooooooth. My GF had the black vanilla lavender tea which she said was fragrant.

Tried their high tea and me tea. I was starving and my high tea portions filled me up. I've had better sammies (cucumber cream cheese and bay shrimp) elsewhere but their scones are the best. Dense, moist and flaky. 

Good service. Cute setup. Clean bathroom (it's important!).

excerpts: We shared some chestnut tea, a couple of scones (one being gluten-free, yay), fruit and some marzipan sweets.
I'm not a huge tea fan
and I don't have much of a sweet tooth
scones.author: Teiki K.
scones.review:
Adorable!

Look, I consider myself a pretty typical guy, i.e. one who does not go to tea rooms, not that there's anything wrong with that.

In fact, there is absolutely NOTHING wrong with that! Lovejoy's Tea Room is the most precious little place I've ever been to.

My girlfriend and I had had been wanting to check this place out for a while but never managed to time it quite right. We finally snagged a reservation this weekend and it ended up being the highlight of our weekend (and it was already a good weekend!).

We shared some chestnut tea, a couple of scones (one being gluten-free, yay), fruit and some marzipan sweets. I'm not a huge tea fan and I don't have much of a sweet tooth but I absolutely loved everything!

The service was top-notch, the decor is incredibly cute and cozy and the prices are more than fair. I will definitely be back.

excerpts: The scones are perfect as are the crumpets.
I even take the scones to go.
I can't rave about this place enough
scones.author: Maryam T.
scones.review:
I absolutely love LoveJoys, I just wish they were open more days of the week. If you want to get a good time make sure to make a reservation in advance they may not be able to seat you even during the week.

It's a great place for a bridal shower or baby shower or just a mother daughter outing. The teas are great and so is the hot chocolate. 

My favorite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and smoked salmon, but make sure to try the special sandwich.

Service here is always fast and speedy. You pretty much get food right away. The scones are perfect as are the crumpets. I even take the scones to go. I can't rave about this place enough

excerpts: The tea sandwiches and scones were delicious as well.
I was really impressed by the service and would definitely recommend it to everyone.
scones.author: Evelyn A.
scones.review: I had the best time here for my birthday party. I never had afternoon tea and this was such a great experience. The owner was super sweet and even gave me a complimentary birthday keepsake. She accommodated my party even though we were all late because of the heavy traffic from the rain. My favorite teas were the vanilla and the lavender one. With some milk and sugar it was simply amazing. The tea sandwiches and scones were delicious as well. I was really impressed by the service and would definitely recommend it to everyone.

excerpts: Sandwiches, salad, scones were fresh and yummy!
scones.author: N L.
scones.review: Great place for tea! Must try white peach tea.  Sandwiches, salad, scones were fresh and yummy!

excerpts: We also loved the blueberry scones, which were soft and light.
Spread some of their tantalizing strawberry jam and you are in sweet pastry heaven.
scones.author: Judy H.
scones.review:
In true Judy fashion, I have a new obsession: English afternoon tea. I've never been this excited about something British related since the Spice Girls. Yeah, I'm bringing it waaay back. 

I experienced my first afternoon tea sesh at Lovejoy's Tea Room with my two besties on a gloomy Sunday. We were ooh-ing and ahh-ing over their adorable and vintage tea sets, the cozy yet regal decor, and the impeccable sweet and savory finger foods.

My friends and I each ordered the Queen's Tea Set which includes two sandwiches served with cabbage salad (coleslaw), organic spring greens, mixed fruits, one scone, a crumpet, a Petit Four (small dessert), and a tea biscuit. Essentially, it is a buffet with petite foods. How cute! And let's not forget the bottomless tea pots (it is called afternoon TEA). I decided on the White Peach which paired well with the food because it was not overwhelmingly strong. A light and sweet drink to accompany our little delights.

Now for the tea sandwiches! My friends and I divided and conquered. We sampled six different tiny crustless sandwiches (* denotes favorite):
- Cucumber & Cream Cheese
- Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad*
- Salmon Mousse
- Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise 
- Chicken & Asparagus*
- Lovejoy's Daily Special* 

I can't remember what was in their special but there was chicken involved, and it was simply delicious. You can't go wrong with any of the sandwich choices. All of their daintily cut sandwiches are packed with massive flavors. We also loved the blueberry scones, which were soft and light. Spread some of their tantalizing strawberry jam and you are in sweet pastry heaven. The crumpet was the only thing that we weren't crazy about. It's a waffle-cake hybrid: part waffle in texture but tastes like pancake. It was also very fluffy and hard to cut. We were presented with an assortment of Petit Fours after our meal. I had some type of mocha confectionery--a dense brownie coated with mocha. Mmmm, diabetes!

Loyejoy's is the perfect spot for an afternoon with friends, a romantic date, or a classy bridal shower. We were smitten with the perfectly mismatched china and eclectic setting. This place is essentially an antique shop that serves tea. I'm pretty sure if my grandmas were British, they would be sitting in a place like Lovejoy's sipping on some tea and petting their furry kitties.

Quick tips:
- Make reservations because seating is limited and due to its popularity, Lovejoy's accommodates very few walk-ins. 
- There is a two hour maximum seating time and they will kindly inform you that your time is up and you need to bounce (not in those exact words).
- Use the restroom before you leave! Trust me, with all of that tea you're gulping down, you don't want to risk it. 

Pinkies up!

excerpts: The food is delicious and they make THE best scones.
They are on top of everything and friendliness means a lot to me.
Every server we've ever had in all the times we have been were fantastic.
scones.author: Keeva L.
scones.review: Lovejoy's is wonderful. The servers are always so very nice and accommodating. We didn't have a reservation so we asked if it was possible to get seated anyway. The woman was very nice and told us to wait a little bit because they were fully booked. No problem. About ten minutes or so later she came out and we were seated. The food is delicious and they make THE best scones. They are on top of everything and friendliness means a lot to me. Every server we've ever had in all the times we have been were fantastic.

excerpts: Scones!
scones.author: Julia N.
scones.review:
Tea! Sandwiches! Scones!

Part of me wants to keep this place a secret from my friends, but the other part of me wants to tell the world how interesting, unique, and delicious this place is!

AT and I arrived just after it opened today (11am on a Sunday) and snagged the last available table. I highly recommend making reservations unless you want to risk waiting 1-2 hours for a table. We both ordered the "me tea"--AT got the black tea blend, apple and Stilton sandwich, and the scone. I got the spiced citrus tea, chicken apple walnut sandwich, and the scone. We both really enjoyed every part of the meal (although the part that we both kept raving about was the scone with the double cream and raspberry preserves) and agreed that the size of the "me tea" was plenty (maybe even more than enough) for one person. Plus, the tea continues being refilled throughout the meal!

We can't wait to be back--with reservations!

excerpts: Best scones I've had in America.
Buttery, creamy, tender and flavorful currant scones served with real Devonshire cream and jam.
These scones are the closest to the ones I've had in the tea shops of Cambridge and London, England.
The scones were truly the highlight for me, a definite must!
It was the perfect complement to the sandwiches and scones.
scones.author: Marivic T.
scones.review:
I came here for my friend's baby shower  yesterday and loved it! It's a wonderful place to enjoy afternoon tea. 

Ambiance: Cozy, fun, warm and welcoming.
