There will never, ever be a time that I will say no to Lovejoys. It's a great place to go when you want to have a special place to go with food that isn't too heavy. It's not the place to go if you're going to do something serious, like work on a novel or have a business meeting. Save that for the busy, crowded coffee shops and your break room.

Weekends are generally booked until forever, but they will always take walk-ins. Be prepared for a long wait, but it'll be worth it for two to three things: 1) excellent tea, 2) the yummiest scones you will experience while in a fancy chair whilst feeling like royalty, and for those who like to daydream up stories, 3) the service and the occasional English waiter or waitress. It's the perfect whimsical Alice-in-Wonderland-esque place to have a grand old time with your friends, family, significant others, or handsome strangers.

I've never been disappointed in the tea. It's freshly brewed and loose leaf, and the flavors they have all work so well with all the tea services they offer. I had the Royal Tea, and it's by far my favorite - it's got a touch of grenadine! Oh yes. They always keep your teapots full and the servers make sure to take care of the tea so it always steps evenly. Much appreciated! Plus, I love the extra fanciness of all the random china that's used - I had a friend who described the place as, "It looks like a little old lady threw up all over the place with all the mismatched china and decor. It's awesome." That's pretty much the most perfect definition for Lovejoys.

An added bonus is the people-watching: I love seeing how folks dress up for their version of a tea party. Overall, a good time, and totally worth the wait if you love yourself a cuppa. Just remember - last seating is at 4:30 and the kitchen closes half an hour before Lovejoys does, so being early is not only good manners, it's just going to work out in the long run. Pinkies out, y'all.

excerpts: Their scones are addicting and the cream/jam I kept on piling on!
scones.author: Angela D.
scones.review:
A cute and cozy place for tea time with your girlfriends! 
I got the Light Tea Set. The roast beef and horseradish sammy was delish. English breakfast tea was awesome with milk. Their scones are addicting and the cream/jam I kept on piling on!

Overall, it is kind of expensive for tea  ($17.95) but it was a fun time before going off to see Beach Blanket Babylon :)

excerpts:
- Several varieties of teas
- Cute finger foods: sandwiches, cookies, scones, pastries

I loved this experience because the ambiance took me back to when I was a little girl playing "tea party"---except this time, it actually was a legit tea party!
scones.author: Stacey K.
scones.review:
Such a cute little spot in the city! We came here for my friend's bridal shower.

- Several varieties of teas
- Cute finger foods: sandwiches, cookies, scones, pastries

I loved this experience because the ambiance took me back to when I was a little girl playing "tea party"---except this time, it actually was a legit tea party! Having a group of girl friends and cute cups/snacks gave me a warm/homey feel. I wish we had these when I was growing up!

I'm definitely coming back here if I'm in the city with some girl friends, and i am for sure taking my kids/nieces here when I have them! :D

excerpts: The scones are great and so is the fresh fruit.
There are also heartier dishes available if you or someone else is not in the mood for tea sandwiches.
scones.author: Emily Y.
scones.review:
Great tea little tea room. They were able to seat us during this busy holiday season and we did not have reservations.  I do recommend that you make reservations if you plan to enjoy a delightful tea service. We should have but thought that maybe we would be okay because we came earlier on a Thursday. 

Service is wonderful. There are a variety of tea services, teas, and tea sandwiches available or you can order a la carte.  The scones are great and so is the fresh fruit. There are also heartier dishes available if you or someone else is not in the mood for tea sandwiches. I didn't really care for the crumpet or the petit four, although the petit fours are very pretty.

excerpts: She brought mix matched plates and cups and saucers and tiers for serving the tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets and petit fours we'd ordered.
The egg and onion sandwiches were the best, the scones were incredible with the cream and preserves and the White Tangerine tea was a definite favorite.
Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn.
She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge.
All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.
Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn.
She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge.
All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.
scones.author: J G.
scones.review:
I recently hosted a baby shower catered by Lovejoy's. From start to finish they were a pleasure to work with. Although I went in on a fairly busy day, they were immediately accommodating, sending someone over to answer our questions and share in our excitement. Because the tea room itself can only accommodate parties up to 20, my co-host and I decided to cater the shower at a home instead. The catering menu is available online and Samantha helped us square away the details via email in the weeks leading up to it. The prices were reasonable, they were amenable to last minute changes and provided helpful suggestions throughout. You can include a server and a tea leaf reader for your party too, if you're so inclined!

We didn't lift a finger the day of. Our wonderful server, Carrie, was warm and kind. She arrived on time and set everything up for us. She brought mix matched plates and cups and saucers and tiers for serving the tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets and petit fours we'd ordered. The egg and onion sandwiches were the best, the scones were incredible with the cream and preserves and the White Tangerine tea was a definite favorite. Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn. She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge. All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.

excerpts: The accompanying salad was simple but good, and I love the scones; the Devon cream is delicious.
The bill came out to around $25 per person -- a bit pricey considering it's not a meal, per se -- but I think the experience is more important.
scones.author: Katie M.
scones.review:
The ambience is really the draw (for me) chez Lovejoy; it feels as if you are visiting both an eccentric great aunt's house and a tea party in Wonderland at the same time.  I love the mismatched teacups, teapots, furniture, etc., and there's enough floral brocade to keep my Victorian-era obsessed soul happy.

The tea itself is delicious -- during my most recent visit, I ordered green tea with kombucha; another time I had the blood orange tisane, and both were excellent. 

We showed up with a party of 5 -- and no reservation -- at 11:00 on a Sunday morning. They weren't sure if they could accommodate us, but they managed to squeeze us in by 11:05, which was lovely. We ordered the high tea (there were five of us) with ten tea sandwiches -- the chicken asparagus is my favorite, followed by the artichoke hummus and turkey with dijon. The accompanying salad was simple but good, and I love the scones; the Devon cream is delicious. The bill came out to around $25 per person -- a bit pricey considering it's not a meal, per se -- but I think the experience is more important. Service has always been very friendly, and the space is cozy and intimate.

Food: 4/5
Ambience: 5/5+

excerpts: We ordered their house special tea along with some sandwiches, petite fours, and scones.
I really enjoyed their house special tea with some sugar and milk.
The petite fours were also awesome and the sandwiches were surprisingly pretty delicious for what they were.
scones.author: Kristen T.
scones.review:
I went with here with my fellow yelper, Desmond C.  We ordered their house special tea along with some sandwiches, petite fours, and scones.  I really enjoyed their house special tea with some sugar and milk.  The petite fours were also awesome and the sandwiches were surprisingly pretty delicious for what they were.  My favorite one was their salmon and cream cheese, sounds simple--but it was surprisingly satisfying.  

I really liked the decor of this place and I felt like I was in London (even though I've never been there).  

Also, go right when it opens or better yet, make a reservation so you won't have to wait too long!

excerpts: And today, we had a wonderful table, great service, delicious sandwiches, and ahhh, the scones . . .
just when I thought I couldn't love this place any more, they just outdid themselves--even suggesting we take a group photo in front of the mural outside.
Love you, Lovejoy's!!!
scones.author: Emmy M.
scones.review: Perfection. Planning my mom's surprise birthday party with 11 of her best friends was absolutely seamless and stress-free with Samantha's help. And today, we had a wonderful table, great service, delicious sandwiches, and ahhh, the scones . . . just when I thought I couldn't love this place any more, they just outdid themselves--even suggesting we take a group photo in front of the mural outside. Love you, Lovejoy's!!!

excerpts: The food came out in stacked trays with slices of a variety of sandwiches, scones with jam and butter, and salad.
scones.author: Elysse P.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's brings you back to those days when you used to play "house" and pretend to host tea parties when you were a little girl! You can do that here but this time it's all for real! Lol. So cute/quaint and gives you such a warm feeling. The sandwiches were all amazing... I have no complaints. Came here this passed weekend for a bridal shower and it was the perfect spot. The decor is unique, classic, and so damn cute!!!

The food came out in stacked trays with slices of a variety of sandwiches, scones with jam and butter, and salad. I definitely enjoyed the smoked salmon sandwich the most, but seriously everything was delicious... and who would've thought those little sandwiches would be so filling!

The tea was delicious. My favorites are the mango and earl grey. Nothing was too sweet/bitter/etc... everything was JUSTTT RIGHT!

I definitely recommend this spot for any girly occasion! I would love to take my mom  here for mother's day, host a baby shower here, or have another bridal shower here as well.

excerpts: We each ordered the Queen's Tea - a menu comprised of coleslaw, salad, sandwiches, scones, fresh fruits, and biscuits.
A wide variety of sandwiches and tea to select from.
I thoroughly enjoyed my apricot black flavored tea.
scones.author: Diana M.
scones.review:
A room full of girlfriends having tea.  Rebekah T. is right, "you're never too old to play tea, I mean have tea with friends." =)

My two girlfriends took me here for a quaint celebration. We each ordered the Queen's Tea - a menu comprised of coleslaw, salad, sandwiches, scones, fresh fruits, and biscuits.  A wide variety of sandwiches and tea to select from.  I thoroughly enjoyed my apricot black flavored tea.  Yum!

I love how each cup, plate, and pot, were mis-matched.  Each chair seem to have it's own shape and style. The room has a lot of character - cute and charming. =)

Thank you, V and Ti...for a wonderful time!

excerpts: The warm scones with butter were fabulous.
We loved trying on hats and taking ridiculous pictures.
scones.author: Amanda H.
scones.review: I just went here for the first time and it was awesome! I was surprised how good the food was. The warm scones with butter were fabulous. We loved trying on hats and taking ridiculous pictures.

excerpts: The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, and of course the tea, were all magnificent.
My favorite tea was the "Rose Hips".
I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back.
The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because I've never been to a tea room to compare to this one.
I've read reviews of tea rooms in Solano county where I live
and I have a feeling that the others don't measure up to this one.
scones.author: Cheryl M.
scones.review: I was a virgin tearoom patron and could not have  been more pleased at Lovejoy's. Was there for my cousin's baby sprinkle (as opposed to shower). We were a party of eleven adult ladies, 3 twee tea drinkers and 1 very well behaved 7 month old. The atmosphere was very quaint and welcoming. We were treated like Royalty as our place card stated. The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, and of course the tea, were all magnificent. My favorite tea was the "Rose Hips".  I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back. The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because I've never been to a tea room to compare to this one. I've read reviews of tea rooms in Solano county where I live and I have a feeling that the others don't measure up to this one.

excerpts: I absolutely loved the fresh warm scones and crumpets, the clotted cream & lemon curd were both divine, and all of the little sandwiches were very tasty!
Between us we ordered the cucumber & cream cheese, pear & stilton, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and turkey & mustard sandwiches, and they were all very enjoyable!
The fresh fruit was lovely as well, but the salad and coleslaw didn't do much for me.
(Still, I very much enjoyed the meal overall.)
scones.author: Emma M.
scones.review:
I came here with my mom to celebrate her birthday, and it was a really fun and quaint experience.  The decor is very old fashioned, cute, and a little bit quirky... I almost felt like I had stepped into a different world; Lovejoy's is really like no other place I've been.

We ordered the Queen's Tea for two; to drink I had the special- strawberry herbal tea which I quite enjoyed, though I have to admit I was most impressed by all the beautifully presented snacks.  I absolutely loved the fresh warm scones and crumpets, the clotted cream & lemon curd were both divine, and all of the little sandwiches were very tasty!  Between us we ordered the cucumber & cream cheese, pear & stilton, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and turkey & mustard sandwiches, and they were all very enjoyable!  The fresh fruit was lovely as well, but the salad and coleslaw didn't do much for me.  (Still, I very much enjoyed the meal overall.)  The adorable, sugary, and delicious petit fours at the end were a delightful note to end things on, though by the time we got to those I was already stuffed!

I definitely enjoyed the experience, the tea, and all the tasty treats, but I do feel like the prices were a little high.  Still, it really was a charming and different experience, and it's definitely worth trying at least once!

excerpts: The variety of sandwiches to choose from, the scones with jelly, and the appealing pub fare menu looked and tasted equally appealing.
On my last trip here, I remembered seeing a Shepard's Pie on the menu but not a Chicken Pot PIe.
scones.author: Ben H L.
scones.review:
I've been to Lovejoy's four times in my life.  Some men may never have the high tea experience and I'm lucky enough to have been here so many times.  Since my friend lives in the Diamond Heights neighborhood, she had known about Lovejoy's long before they became super popular.  

My first concern when coming here was about whether I'd still be hungry when I left.  Well, having ordered the High Tea and the Queen's Tea many times, that quickly became a non-issue.  The variety of sandwiches to choose from, the scones with jelly, and the appealing pub fare menu looked and tasted equally appealing.  On my last trip here, I remembered seeing a Shepard's Pie on the menu but not a Chicken Pot PIe.  I could have sworn that I had a chicken pot pie here long ago...maybe it was a special request or they don't do it anymore.

As always, the biggest challenge is to get a reservation here on a weekend.  A fourteen days in advance reservation call to them is highly advised.  They usually have two walk-in tables for people without reservations so whoever gets to the door first before they open will get those tables...and possibly any tables where the reservation party didn't show up.  Since my group got there forty minutes before they opened, we were lucky to get the first walk-in table.

Since it is a small room, the higher volume of ambient noise does make it difficult to talk and seating around your table could be a bit snug.  But after a few minutes, these small issues will pass through your conscious mind after pouring your first cup of tea and enjoying the first few bites of a tasty roast beef and horseradish sandwich.

I definitely won't mind coming back to Lovejoy's because this English style tea house was my first introduction to the tea experience.  I can't imagine going to any other tea house unless they could surpass what Lovejoy's brings to the table...and I highly doubt that any locale in SF can do that.

excerpts: Typically, each guest chooses a service which comes with a personal pot of tea (unlimited refills included) and a range of tea snacks from biscuits and scones to salad and sandwiches.
They serve their scones fresh and warm with an authentic Devon cream that melts in your mouth.
scones.author: Catherine A.
scones.review:
This is my favorite tea room in California: no-fuss, welcoming, and delicious. Their reservations fill up quickly around holidays, but if you plan ahead you won't have a problem finding something that works for you. I've come with small and large groups, and everyone always has a blast. 

First-timers never fail to comment on how cute the space is itself. You feel as though you've walked into a Victorian grandmother's parlor. With mismatched furniture and English china, framed sayings and hats on the wall, Lovejoy's provides plenty of pieces to keep the conversation going. Once the food is served, however, all attention goes to the edible.

For $17-20 per person, the tea service is surprisingly filling. Typically, each guest chooses a service which comes with a personal pot of tea (unlimited refills included) and a range of tea snacks from biscuits and scones to salad and sandwiches. They serve their scones fresh and warm with an authentic Devon cream that melts in your mouth. If your afternoon tea is also your lunch, I recommend the High Tea which comes with 2 sandwiches, salad, a scone, and a shortbread tea biscuit. My favorite sandwich selections are the cucumber & cream cheese (a tea time classic) and the chicken apple walnut salad. Since I gravitate toward floral tea flavors, I always order the China Rose Petal black tea and add some milk.

For those with a sweet tooth, the tray of petit fours can be irresistible if you still have room after your service. I have only tried the Victorian Wedding Cake which tasted very much like a standard vanilla cake pop but was a slightly bigger portion.

The lovely ladies who run the place are ever the gracious hosts--checking in for questions, constantly refilling tea pots, and never rushing the party. As I write this, I'm already thinking up an occasion for my next tea time.

excerpts: Lovejoy's Tea Room offer tiers of smart little crustless sandwiches, delicious scones, clotted cream, curd, sweets and heaps of tea.
Making a reservation might be quite hard as they book up pretty quickly
but it is worth the wait.
The service is fantastic (they even brought out a pastry with a candle for my friend because it was her birthday).
Overall, I find this place quite delightful and will definitely be back in the future.
scones.author: J M.
scones.review:
I and my girlfriends try to get together every month for an afternoon tea to catch-up and of course gossip. It has now become a tradition that we hit up all the tea rooms in the city until we are ready and have polished our tea etiquettes before the pièce de résistance of the tea-tradition in SF(the Fairmont Hotel). 

Lovejoy's Tea Room offer tiers of smart little crustless sandwiches, delicious scones, clotted cream, curd, sweets and heaps of tea. Making a reservation might be quite hard as they book up pretty quickly but it is worth the wait. The service is fantastic (they even brought out a pastry with a candle for my friend because it was her birthday). Overall, I find this place quite delightful and will definitely be back in the future.

excerpts: The scones and pastries were good and fruits were fresh.
scones.author: Rosanne L.
scones.review:
Tip: You must make reservations for this place or they will not seat you! Reservations more than a week in advance recommended too!

My best friend and I are really into tea places. We went to Crown and Crumpet a few months back. She suggested to bring me here for my 25th birthday because she's been here a few times and thinks it's better than C&C. The place is small and has a quirky mismatching decor all around. The service is exquisite.

We sat down and our server was warming. She took our orders and answered all the questions I had. We both ordered the Queen's Tea with an apricot tea and china rose petal black tea. I love the apricot but milk and sugar was needed. It smells delicious though! Wasn't a huge fan of the china rose petal. I felt it was too floral. 

Our food came pretty quick and soon enough, I was munching on tiny triangular-shaped sandwiches. I got the roast beef & horseradish sandwich along with the smoke salmon and cream cheese. My BFF got a turkey and cranberry. I am usually not a fan of cranberry, but I took a bite of her sandwich and I think it was my fave out of the three. The roast beef was slightly dry and bland.

The scones and pastries were good and fruits were fresh. I loved the crumpets, as usual. Buttery and with extra cream on top! Yum!

This place is cheaper than Crown and Crumpet, but I do think the decor there is prettier/girlier/fancier.


We saw an elder pair of granny's and we hope that it would be us in another 50 years :)

excerpts: We had the Queen's tea service and we were so, so full afterwards but couldn't resist everything that was on the menu - from the crustless triangle sandwiches, scrumptious scones and fruit platter.
scones.author: Lisette P.
scones.review:
I love this place! It's more than just high tea, it's an experience. A girlfriend and I got dolled up one Sunday afternoon and stepped into quaint England in this little tea place. 

We had the Queen's tea service and we were so, so full afterwards but couldn't resist everything that was on the menu - from the crustless triangle sandwiches, scrumptious scones and fruit platter. The ladies serving us were so lovely - they talked us through the menu and when the fruit platter came and I realized that we had to change it as I'm allergic to kiwifruit, rather than whisking it away, they gave me a separate platter to eat and let my friend keep the one we had.

Definitely book in advance. A great alternative to a Sunday brunch.

excerpts: With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea.
We had a huge pot of earl grey
and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches.
The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites!
The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins.
scones.author: Stephanie C.
scones.review:
Lovejoy' s is the definition of shabby chic. It's completely charming and full of tons of character. The place is adorned with hats perfect for a royal wedding, lace, cuckoo clocks, vintage pictures, and of course tons of mismatched tea sets. I've been here before but most recently came for my Mom's birthday tea.

My Mom and I shared the Queen's tea for two, $27/person, and then added on my sister for $17. With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea. We had a huge pot of earl grey and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches. I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins. It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam. The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!

This is the perfect place to have a girly date with friends or with your Mom. Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!

excerpts: The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.
scones.author: Snuffles B.
scones.review: Grandma love this place because it looks like her house exploded and landed in Lovejoy's. Its a tough reservation because the place is not big and people sit there for hours on end. The service is solid here and while I love high tea, this one is totally average. The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.

excerpts: Yahh you could brew your own tea, make your own little sandwiches and bake some scones but really, you can't put it together like Lovejoy's does.
All of the mismatched decor, teapots, teacups, plates, cutlery, and even furniture makes the tea party come alive here.
The sandwiches are simple but they are good and there's a variety to choose from.
The scones are warm and buttery when they are brought out
but I'm not too crazy about their shortbread tea biscuits.
They also have cole slaw and spring greens salad to accompany most of their tea service meals.
I tried their mango black tea and their special of the day which was black vanilla lavender.
scones.author: Maya S.
scones.review:
It's all about the experience at Lovejoy's. Yahh you could brew your own tea, make your own little sandwiches and bake some scones but really, you can't put it together like Lovejoy's does. All of the mismatched decor, teapots, teacups, plates, cutlery, and even furniture makes the tea party come alive here. The sandwiches are simple but they are good and there's a variety to choose from. The scones are warm and buttery when they are brought out but I'm not too crazy about their shortbread tea biscuits. They also have cole slaw and spring greens salad to accompany most of their tea service meals. I tried their mango black tea and their special of the day which was black vanilla lavender. I have had better mango tea but a yes to the black vanilla lavender! 

As most reviews note, service here is great. Lovejoy's is definitely a place to go with your gal pals. Also, I saw a couple of little girls celebrating their birthdays here which I thought was super special and adorable. Make some reservations and get ready to sit at a table "Reserved for Royalty or Queens!"

excerpts: Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).
scones.author: Alex C.
scones.review:
6/4/11

It was such a delightful place for afternoon tea/brunch.

The decorations were really whimsical and each utensil (teapot,plates,spoons,cups; were different).

Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).

I was extremely satisfied and filled (all that tea just kept coming, our waitress made sure the pot was full and hot), what more can I say - I'M COMING HERE AGAIN!

excerpts: The scones are TDF, loved the sandwiches (especially the roast beef with horseradish, chutney with cheese, chicken salad -- ok all of them!!!)
scones.author: Olivia L.
scones.review:
So cute!  We had a baby shower here, and the Queen's Tea is the bomb.  The scones are TDF, loved the sandwiches (especially the roast beef with horseradish, chutney with cheese, chicken salad -- ok all of them!!!) and the crumpets are amazing as well.  They only bit I didn't like were the petit fours.  Highly recommend the ceylon tea (better than the darjeeling).  

Why 4 stars instead of 5?  It was in the low 70s outside, but in the 80s and humid inside.  They gotta open a window or install a fan or something!

excerpts: We ordered high tea for three, which includes two sandwiches each, three scones, and three bottomless pots of tea.
Our favorite sandwich was the tomato & cheese.
I LOVED the scones, omg so good!
We chose two teas
however I only remember the second one, which was White Peach.
i highly recommend that one.
It was sweet and flavorful, nothing over the top.
I am British-obsessed
scones.author: Joanne M.
scones.review:
This was my first ever experience of afternoon high tea, which was influenced by an instagram post by a Youtuber. I went with my friend and her foreign exchange student from Italy and were half an hour late to our reservation at 4:30 PM, which is the latest possible. The lot is not large nor is it especially tiny. I have never been to England, but this place is reminiscent of the Victorian era. Everything is mix-matched - from the tea cups to the chairs and tables. We ordered high tea for three, which includes two sandwiches each, three scones, and three bottomless pots of tea. Our favorite sandwich was the tomato & cheese. I LOVED the scones, omg so good! We chose two teas however I only remember the second one, which was White Peach. i highly recommend that one. It was sweet and flavorful, nothing over the top. I am British-obsessed so it was only time that I came to a place like this.

TRY IT OUT.

excerpts: the scones were dotted with plump raisins.
the double devon cream was just about the best imaginable thing you could possibly spread on a warm crumbly scone.
it was rich, decadent, and pure love and joy.
scones.author: Charmaine L.
scones.review:
lovejoy's took me all the way back to when i was 5 years old playing tea party with my stuffed animals and serving them plastic cookies and pouring water as tea. except lovejoy's was far better than my imaginary tea and crumpets!

high tea was a very fun couple of hours on a beautiful saturday afternoon. a table with a sign "reserved for the queens" was waiting for us by the window. 3 bottomless teas: earl grey, passion fruit black tea, and pomegranate green tea. the teas had light flavors and were not bitter.

we had the following finger sandwiches, i'm listing them best to less than best. but they were all good.
1. pear and stilton (sweet and pungent)
2. roast beef and horseradish (tasty)
3. turkey and dijon mustard (the mustard seeds were like luxurious caviar)
4. smoked salmon and cream cheese (can't go wrong)
5. lovejoy's special which was turkey, cranberry, pecan (savory and sweet mixed together)
6. ham and english mustard (spicy kick from the mustard)

all the sandwiches were served on a bed of fresh greens and light dressing. it was very refreshing, especially with a few segments of mandarin oranges.

the scones were dotted with plump raisins. the double devon cream was just about the best imaginable thing you could possibly spread on a warm crumbly scone. it was rich, decadent, and pure love and joy. the strawberry preserves were full of fruit.

the crumpets were a tad rubbery and dry, but the lemon curd more than made up for it. the curd was smooth, tart, and not too sweet. i rolled my eyes back at first bite.

thank you lovejoy's. you've shown me royal greatness. my stuffed animals would have been green with envy.

excerpts: Then came the three-tiered wonder with our sandwiches, cookies, fruit, greens and scones.
scones.author: Marissa C.
scones.review:
Holy heart-attack on a plate, Batman!  Let me just preface this with a warning: if you get the Queen's Tea be prepared to be rolled out of this place from glutting yourself on sumptuous Devon cream and a sundry of other tasty, decadent bites!

I took my mom here recently for her birthday and dropped some major dollar for us to both have the Queen's Tea. For sandwiches we picked cucumber and cream cheese (classic), salmon and capers (amazing), chicken and mango chutney (daily special), and one other with a blue cheese that I can't recall.  For tea we chose the Yorkshire Gold, a favorite of my mom's.  Then came the three-tiered wonder with our sandwiches, cookies, fruit, greens and scones.  And of course, lemon curd and Devon cream.  

As if that wasn't enough, freshly baked crumpets arrived, taunting our already filled bellies.  And the petit four and brownie after that simply mocked us in our naivete!

The waitstaff are superb here and totally accommodating from start to finish. We arrived a little early for our reservations (which you will need!) and seated us at an empty table for a larger party that had not yet arrived while ours was being cleared and prepped so we didn't have to wait out in the cold rain.

Though this tea service does cost a handsome price, I think its well-worth the extra coin.  They also offer you a coupon for their antiques/tea shop across the way which we used to buy some Yorkshire Gold for the road as well as a pair of their dainty little tea strainers.

excerpts: Their scones and sandwiches and delightful.
Just make sure you make reservations a few weeks before because they book up fairly quickly.
scones.author: Chiara M.
scones.review: This place is so cute. Great place for a girls day out. Their scones and sandwiches and delightful. Just make sure you make reservations a few weeks before because they book up fairly quickly.

excerpts: sweets (petit fours and scones), fruit, smoked salmon, sandwiches, etc.
You can order whatever you'd like and it comes with a bottomless refill of tea!!
It was awesome.
scones.author: Holly H.
scones.review:
LOVEJOY'S TEA ROOM was the first tea experience that i've had and it was tons of fun! i took my best friend and two of her roommates here as they visited me in the bay area!

first of all, RESERVATIONS are a must. this place gets jam-packed so make sure you make reservations and arrive on time. 

this place is extremely cozy! it's the perfect place for a sunday morning gossiping with your girlfriends over breakfast or lunch. after you make reservations, they have signs on your table that says "RESERVED FOR ROYALTY or RESERVED FOR QUEENS." it was cute because my best friend calles me her queen! 

anywho, this place gives that antique vibe and the decor is so unique. they also have a hat rack, so if you're feeling any piece missing, that's it! a tea hat!! :) 

they have a lot of options regarding what you want with your tea: sweets (petit fours and scones), fruit, smoked salmon, sandwiches, etc. You can order whatever you'd like and it comes with a bottomless refill of tea!! It was awesome. We tried each other's teas and they were all pretty good. 

Each of us had our own teapot and it ironically matched our outfits. I had their passion fruit and it was good! Also tried apricot, mango, and earl grey! 

If you use the ladies' room, make sure you check out the clipboard they have in the back! It's really cute. It's filled with inspiration and I remember seeing a quote "REAL MEN DRINK TEA." hahahaha thought that was funny. props to all the bold men that go here because it's filled with ladies. 

After tea, go to the giftshop across they street! They have a lot of cutesy stuff you can look at too!

excerpts: Their sandwiches are good and their scones are DELICIOUS!!
scones.author: Anne K.
scones.review:
I've always been a fan of Lovejoy's. I usually get their High Tea. Their sandwiches are good and their scones are DELICIOUS!! The decor at the tea room is really cute too.

Recently hosted a baby shower there and I must say, they have everything down to a T. I really appreciated that. The service was excellent!! For large parties (up to 20 guests), you get 2 hours for your tea time. The waitresses, especially Samantha, were very good about letting you know how much time you have remaining (which is good because when you're having such a good time, it's easy to lose track of time!) without being pushy or mean. Our tea and food were brought out as soon as all the guests had a chance to sit down. An area was set aside for the presents. They brought out a plastic garbage bag for all the wrapping paper/garbage in case we wanted to open presents. The leftover food was boxed up so that we could bring the leftovers home. They even helped us take a group photo outside, around the corner, in front of the Lovejoy's painted on the wall, which I think all groups do! The staff at Lovejoy's really think of everything so that hosting an event there is stress-free and quite enjoyable!!

excerpts: The scones were exceptionally fluffy and light with the perfect hint of raspberries.
scones.author: Steph L.
scones.review:
" Sorry Honey, but the jam is not homemade. I just saw a jar of Smuckers in the back." - my girlfriend who came back from the restroom!

Teas Worthy of Trying:
-Passonfruit Black Tea (aromatic, but has a stronger/darker taste)
-Mango Black Tea (very aromatic)
-Pomegranate Green Tea (light, couldn't really taste the pomegranate)
-English Tea (if you like milk tea - this is your cup of tea)

I had the Savory Tea (2 types of sandwiches + Pot of Tea), selected the LoveJoy's Special (Turkey + Cranberries) and Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese.  The Smoked Salmon was extremely salty (which is very consistent to previous reviews by other yelpers).  Turkey and Cranberry Sandwich was very simple, nothing special.

I'm not a scone person, but I was able to sample some.  The scones were exceptionally fluffy and light with the perfect hint of raspberries.

Since it was one of my girlfriend's birthday, LoveJoy's complimented the birthday girl with one of the petit four + candle (which was a definite bonus).

Definitely make a reservation before coming!  Service is exceptional! Parking wasn't too horrible - near residential area. 

Maybe High Tea is just not my cup of tea.

excerpts: o tea, tiered platters, complete with fresh, hot scones topped with Devon cream and preserves, and tiny crust-less sandwiches of our choosing, with cole slaw and mixed greens.
scones.author: Jacquie L.
scones.review:
I love tea.  I mean, REALLY REALLY love tea.  There is NOTHING better than a perfect cup of black tea, with a bit of sugar and milk.  Herbal tea makes me feel better when I'm sick and without fail, I have a cup of black tea at least once a day.

So, for the girl who thinks that having a perfect cup of tea is the high point of her day (I'm simple.. what can I say) I didn't know it could get this much better!

Lovejoy's offers a beautiful traditional tea experience with a bit of whimsy and all the charm of an English tea room.  Beautiful porcelain tea cups, saucers and tea pots set atop lacey doodles with colorful tablecloths make the perfect tea party for two, three or up to 20 some odd people for larger parties.

And so came the bottomless pot o tea, tiered platters, complete with fresh, hot scones topped with Devon cream and preserves, and tiny crust-less sandwiches of our choosing, with cole slaw and mixed greens.

Heaven, perfection, and love all wrapped up into a high tea experience!  And they even had soy milk for me to put in my tea!!!!!!

excerpts: The scones were wonderful, fluffy, sweet and tasty!
scones.author: LeeLee C.
scones.review:
So cute, so adorable and so picture worthy!  This place captures every girl's heart for a nice relax afternoon high tea.  

We didn't make advanced enough reservation and we called in 11am on Saturday to see if we would be lucky enough.  At first we were told that there was no opening, but by 1pm, they called us back for one cancellation.  So besides us being lucky, I guess they also managed their schedules pretty effectively. 

We went for the high tea package.  For the sandwiches, their choices made my brain surrender.  The pear and stilton was nice, so was the salmon mousse and the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.  The scones were wonderful, fluffy, sweet and tasty!  The tea choices were abundant and they came with tea pod, filter and a beautiful cup set.  

The service was good, only problem, it was so popular that we were only allowed to stay up to certain hours.  After 3.30pm, we were no longer so royal and had to pack up and leave for the next guests. 

As if they were not cute enough, there is a shop setup on the opposite side of the street for souveniors, anything from aprons to tea pots.  They know how to get to girls!

excerpts: So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over.
The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough.
If  I come back
I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.
Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!
scones.author: Rosaline C.
scones.review:
So I was really excited to try this place with a few of my girlfriends on a nice sunny Sunday. We made reservations ahead of time *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED* since this place is tiny and seems to be very busy at all times. The decor is very country imagine a scene from Alice in Wonderland where all the tableware, china and teacups do not match. Everyone in my party ordered the Queen's Tea since it was our first time there we wanted to try everything. It was $24.95 per person and we get our own pot of tea and a bunch of different things for us to sample.  

The presentation was really nice tall and filled with tons of mini treats.  The coleslaw lacked flavor. The crumpet that was served at the end wasn't bad either but by then I was stuffed suprinsingly because I thought I wouldn't be full from the looks of it initially. Rosaline's recommendations:-

-Mango Black Tea
-China Rose Petal
-Chicken & Asparagus Sandwich
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Sandwich
-EggSalad Sandwich
-Scones (make sure to load it with the devon cream and jam!!!)

So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over. The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough. If  I come back I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.  Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!

excerpts: We each got our own Me Tea, which allowed us to pick from a list of tempting sandwiches, scones, and other tasty teatime treats.
The scones are just the right amount of moist and crumbly.
scones.author: Lia S.
scones.review:
After months on the waiting list (I exaggerate) (but only a little) (maybe), my family finally scored a table fit for royalty at Lovejoy's. We each got our own Me Tea, which allowed us to pick from a list of tempting sandwiches, scones, and other tasty teatime treats.

Their houseblend tea is phenomenal. All of their others are somehow also outstanding. I could have happily ordered every tiny sandwich on the menu, but opted for a special that day of curried chicken - good choice! The scones are just the right amount of moist and crumbly. Everything was delivered to the table perfectly inoffensively and our waitress gladly took all of my parents questions about the various teapots and cozies around the room.

Maybe it was because there was so much buildup for this place, but I was just so excited the whole time I was there - this high tea was HAPPENING, and only a mile from my apartment! Lovejoy's certainly lived up to the hype and I would love to go back eventually.

It was also surprisingly not crazy-expensive.

excerpts: so I think the other girls were way more excited than I was about the scones and pastries.
However, I was really impressed with the BLACK TEA!
I really could not get enough of it and have never had anything come close to it.
It was  really rich and went down very smooth.
The sandwiches were good but not spectacular because if I can make it in my kitchen then its not spectacular.
My fav was the salmon cream cheese sandwich though.
I loved the collection of of tea pots and cups.
scones.author: Song C.
scones.review:
Everyone who knows me knows that I do not have a sweet tooth.  I'm not a big fan of desserts and sweets so I think the other girls were way more excited than I was about the scones and pastries.  However, I was really impressed with the BLACK TEA! I really could not get enough of it and have never had anything come close to it.  It was  really rich and went down very smooth.  The sandwiches were good but not spectacular because if I can make it in my kitchen then its not spectacular. My fav was the salmon cream cheese sandwich though. I loved the collection of of tea pots and cups. Very fun place.

Overall, cute little place for a girls get together. We all had a great time. Would definitely come back ... FOR THE BLACK TEA!

excerpts: Like ambiance, tea & scones.
scones.author: Geraldine R.
scones.review:
My friend & I were excited about our trip to Love Joy's since so many raved about this place! However, it didn't live up to the hype.

3 stars:
Love their name, service & attic shop across the street.
Like ambiance, tea & scones.
Sandwiches were a disappointment.

We've been to a less known tea room where all the food was delish, wish it would have been the same for Love Joy's.

excerpts: Their scones are also to die for, and paired with the lemon curd...delicous!
Lovejoy's lemon curd is also perfect!
scones.author: Paula G.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is nothing short of magical.  Comfortably nestled in Noe Valley, I always look forward to high tea here every time I'm in the area.  The tea room is a cozy size, with British paraphrenalia scattered about and dainty chairs and tables that make you feel like a hoity-toity fancypants (without the snobbish air, of course)!  I feel like a princess every time I've been there for high tea.

Three cheers for bottomless tea!  I am a tea fanatic and can't get enough of it!! Their ginseng green tea is superb, very light and not too bitter.  The ginseng is a plus too. I absolutely love their pesto and prosciutto sandwich (available only on Fridays I believe), the pesto is zesty and the prosciutto is ever so tasty.  Their chicken salad sandwich is divine, and don't even get me started on their smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwich! Yummy!!  Their scones are also to die for, and paired with the lemon curd...delicous!  Lovejoy's lemon curd is also perfect!  It's not too tart and has that perfect balance of sweet and tangy that creates a symphony of delight in your mouth!

I could boast about their shepherd's pie and brag endlessly about their delectable pasties as well as their cheerful and polite staff--always willing to give the absolute best service to their customers. 

I will definitely be frequenting Lovejoy's every few weeks or so because, accurately reflecting the five stars they deserve, they're as good as it gets!!

excerpts: We picked the Queen's Tea which gave us two choices of sandwiches each, a salad, coleslaw, two scones with lemon curd (kicking myself for not buying a bottle) and a jam, fruit, 2 crumpets, and we each chose a tea that was refilled and kept fresh throughout our lunch.
We were so full by the end of it.
The turkey sandwich with a port wine cheese was so good.
scones.author: Aimee L.
scones.review:
Came here for a birthday lunch with my mom.  We made reservations so our table said, "Reserved for Royalty" - cute touch!  We picked the Queen's Tea which gave us two choices of sandwiches each, a salad, coleslaw, two scones with lemon curd (kicking myself for not buying a bottle) and a jam, fruit, 2 crumpets, and we each chose a tea that was refilled and kept fresh throughout our lunch.  We were so full by the end of it.  The turkey sandwich with a port wine cheese was so good.  I also enjoyed the chicken salad sandwich.  

The decor was lovely.  A warm inviting space with mismatched chairs and different style tables.  I believe two seating arrangements had comfy couches.  I loved the vintage tea pots, cups, and saucers.  

We had to go across the street to the Lovejoy shop and buy the apricot tea that we loved.  I also picked up a cup and saucer that I love!

The whole experience was awesome and I will definitely be back!

excerpts: The towers of sandwiches and scones were aesthetically set up
but I was a bit disappointed in the taste.
The sandwiches were very ordinary and plain and the scones were a bit too sweet.
scones.author: Jennifer S.
scones.review: Super cute tea room with antique decorations and china. We came here for a bridal shower and the staff was accommodating but were strict on the 2 hour time limit.   I thought the tea was unique and delicious.  The towers of sandwiches and scones were aesthetically set up but I was a bit disappointed in the taste.  The sandwiches were very ordinary and plain and the scones were a bit too sweet.

excerpts: We shared a plate of gluten free scones  (nice and light and just like homemade), the preserves and cream were good too.

I ought to add that it was a great experience walking into a tea shop, a place that might otherwise be considered a temple of wheat flour, and be able to order such delectables as scones and crumpets gluten free--at no fuss at all, and so well made.
scones.author: M P.
scones.review:
Between us we ordered two savory teas (one regular and one gluten free).
All sandwiches can be made gluten free and I had the Cucumber and Cream Cheese Sandwich (tasty but a bit dry) and the Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese Sandwich (excellent).

We shared a plate of gluten free scones  (nice and light and just like homemade), the preserves and cream were good too. We also shared a plate of gluten free crumpets which came with Meyer Lemon Curd and were very very good indeed.

I ought to add that it was a great experience walking into a tea shop, a place that might otherwise be considered a temple of wheat flour, and be able to order such delectables as scones and crumpets gluten free--at no fuss at all, and so well made.

We were also very happy with the service, and can't wait to go back.

excerpts: Everyone else was raving about the scones with the cream (I didn't have any) and the sandwiches look so cute.
scones.author: Quynh-An P.
scones.review:
I came here for a birthday party a few weekends ago.  I was really worried since I'm actually not allowed to have caffeine and I wasn't sure what the situation here would be in terms of teas I could drink.  I usually stick with ginger or peppermint tea since I know those are safe, but I didn't see them on the menu.  Good thing though!  I opted for the Forest Berries and Rose Hips.  This is the best tea I've had in a long time.  It's like sipping candy and it made me smile!  I loved it so much I rushed across the street afterward and bought two bags of this tea!

I got the "Me Service" since I had lunch before our tea service, so I just got the shortbread and petit fours and a crumpet with meyer lemon.  Delicious!  Everyone else was raving about the scones with the cream (I didn't have any) and the sandwiches look so cute.

One of my friends had the truffle chocolate tea and he added a splash of milk and proclaimed it was like drinking chocolate milk.  Yum!

I definitely want to come back here with my girlfriends at another time!

excerpts: Try their house tea (it's a black tea) and put some of the fresh cream on your scones!
scones.author: Vanessa T.
scones.review:
I've been coming to Lovejoy's for years now. It's perfect for Mother's Day, a date with the girls, and (in the future) my baby shower! I love the mismatched tea cozies and dishes and the service has always been top notch. The only downside is that in order to make a reservation (and this is a MUST DO) you almost always have to book 2-3 weeks in advance. They never answer their phones so you'll have to leave a voicemail and they call you back. Also, I wish they would use a different type of bread, I swear they become stale 10 minutes after being served. Try their house tea (it's a black tea) and put some of the fresh cream on your scones!

High Tea per person: $19.95 (choice of tea, 2 sandwiches, a scone, a shortbread cookie, and salad greens)

excerpts: I couldn't resist at least trying the scones and other traditional tea treats, and they were fresh and incredible.
scones.author: Gretchen T.
scones.review:
You know the Queen Mum was ALWAYS asking me to tea when I lived in London*, and I found Lovejoy's to be as incredible as as the best places I went across the pond. Though even more wonderful because they have a healthy plate (whole wheat or gluten-free crackers, salad) and off-beat tea choices that us crazy California kids like but you wouldn't see at afternoon tea at Browns of London. I couldn't resist at least trying the scones and other traditional tea treats, and they were fresh and incredible. 

The service is sweet instead of fussy. I love that the seating is designed for two-tops as well as corner nooks with couches for groups--we had a festive baby shower there without bothering the serious afternoon tea goers. 

*I did live in London, and I even met the Queen Mum, but I only went to proper tea a few times, and sadly, never with royalty.

excerpts: Specially the scones were delicious.
Enjoyed the sandwich as well.
scones.author: Rabita M.
scones.review: Loved the ambience and food! Specially the scones were delicious. Enjoyed the sandwich as well.

excerpts: The scones are really good with the devon creme.
I ordered the Vanilla Rooibus de-caf tea which was really good too.
I prefer Samovar Tea Lounge which is a cleaner place (the downtown location has an awesome view).
scones.author: Mel T.
scones.review: It's been a while since I've been here but the place is SO dirty. There are cobwebs hanging from the ceiling in the restroom. You can see the kitchen also on your way to the restroom and it looked filthy in there. The scones are really good with the devon creme. I ordered the Vanilla Rooibus de-caf tea which was really good too. I prefer Samovar Tea Lounge which is a cleaner place (the downtown location has an awesome view).

excerpts: the scones were delicious of course, i liked the sandwiches.
I too, thought the coleslaw is totally random.
I asked if we could sub the coleslaw and greens for fruit, they said no. ugh.
I hate when establishments say no to customers.
the petite fours were okay,
Actually, I guess everything was kind of just okay.
scones.author: ren u.
scones.review:
My sister and I came in for a spot of tea a few weeks ago. the decor is very.. shabby chic. I am not generally a fan of this, but my sister really liked it. We got first pick of our table so we picked the table with the most comfy looking chairs near the window. We chose the queen's tea for two. I was pleased that you are able to choose your sandwiches, we chose:
chicken apple walnut: best sandwich!
special: chicken pesto: very good!
turkey and dijon mustard: meh. it was ok
Onto the teas. 
 we picked vanilla rooibis or however you spell it and the berry harvest thingie. It tasted like warmed up fruit punch. I did not like the selections of teas, it might just be me, but i feel like other places have better selections. the Vanilla was okay though! 

the scones were delicious of course, i liked the sandwiches. I too, thought the coleslaw is totally random. I asked if we could sub the coleslaw and greens for fruit, they said no. ugh. I hate when establishments say no to customers. the petite fours were okay, Actually, I guess everything was kind of just okay. it sucks because I love crown and crumpet, but I hate that you can't choose your sandwiches, etc. So I thought I'd try Lovejoy's, and I didn't want this review to be a compare and contrast to crown and crumpet but in my honest opinion, crown and crumpet is just the better choice. 
oh and for reference, we came from stockton, took the bart from dublin/pleasanton, and got off on 24th and mission and took a 4 minute cab ride to church and clipper. easy peasy!

excerpts:
The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. 
I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!
scones.author: Amanda L.
scones.review:
Went here for my birthday/father's day, and absolutely loved it! I had picked here because the Crown & Crumpet is in the process of moving, and couldn't have picked a better place.
The food was wonderful, a good variety, including both vegetarian and gluten free options. The chicken and asparagus tea sandwich was amazing!  The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!

excerpts: I had the basic tea service with cookies, scones and little sandwiches.
The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.
It is a very kid friendly atmosphere and there were a number of ladies with children at the location.
scones.author: Nic B.
scones.review:
My standards are very high since my mother is English and hosts formal tea all the time.  I came here during the holidays (after finding them on Yelp) and had a lovely time with a girlfriend of mine. I had the basic tea service with cookies, scones and little sandwiches.  The service was outstanding and the food was delicious.  
  
It is a very kid friendly atmosphere and there were a number of ladies with children at the location.

excerpts: The scones though, man, it was so warm and fluffy and so good.

The sandwhiches I had were:
Salmon and Cream Cheese: My favorite one by far, super flavorful.
Any of their sandwhiches with salmon is good.
Chicken and Walnut Salad:
A review recommended this.
It was quite bland and there really wasn't much to it.
Don't bother with this.
Sandwich of the day - Ham and Mango Chutney:
I thought this was pretty meh too.
An interesting combination at first, but nothing amazing.
All in all, if we did this, my friends agreed they would only do Tea and Scones, because really those were the highlights.
scones.author: Derek C.
scones.review:
The decor of this place is super cute.  I love all the different teapots and the mismatched plates and tea equipment.  The atmosphere is really nice.

Service:  We went on a very rainy day.  So it wasnt so crowded.  We had a reservation and even though it wasn't crowded, I highly recommend making a reservation.  There is a 2 hour maximum in which a table has time to eat - and there is a good reason for that - I am guessing most if not all, maximize this 2 hour.  We stayed until 10 minutes after closing.  The wait staff were super polite and accomodating.  They didn't rush us, and offered boxes.

Food: The food is really good here.  Obviously this isn't a foodie's choice if you are a hipster.  The scones though, man, it was so warm and fluffy and so good. The sandwhiches I had were:
Salmon and Cream Cheese: My favorite one by far, super flavorful.  Any of their sandwhiches with salmon is good.
Chicken and Walnut Salad:  A review recommended this.  It was quite bland and there really wasn't much to it.  Don't bother with this.
Sandwich of the day - Ham and Mango Chutney:  I thought this was pretty meh too.  An interesting combination at first, but nothing amazing.
I liked the crumpet - but none of my friends did.  A very fluffy and pancaky english muffin.  Slather  generous portions of butter, devonshire cream, lemon curd, and raspberry jam to get something truly amazing.  Those crumpets have holes for a reason.
The petit four - You have four option, a sugar cookie, some mini cupcakes and 2 types of marzipan mini cakes.  The plum rose marzipan cake was overwhelmed by the marzipan.  However the bittersweet orange one had a good balance of marzipan and flavor.  That one was good, We didn't bother with the other options as they seemed very plain.
All in all, if we did this, my friends agreed they would only do Tea and Scones, because really those were the highlights. but I like the crumpet, and only the salmon sandwich.
The fennel/caraway coleslaw salad was very good.  I didn't care about the green salad or the fruit on top.  I would have had the coleslaw, scone, and crumpet again.  But just one sandwiches(salmon) and no petit four.

Tea:  I tried the passion fruit tea.  It was very pleasant.  
I wasn't impressed by the masala chai.  But My god - I forgot what my friend got - I think the royal blend.  I never had tea like that before. The flavor was really complex, fruity and it even felt like there were multiple blends of black tea.  I was also very impressed by the black vanilla.  I had so many vanilla type teas I rolled my eyes when I saw the menu.  But when I tried my friends cup, I was blown away.  The vanilla flavor wasn't anything I have tasted before.  I hate it when I have vanilla tea or flavored anything because it just reminds me of extract.  This felt like a different species of vanilla, and tasted very organic and felt very "infused" 

My biggest regret is that they offered to give the remains of the tea in the pot to go.  and I thought it silly to take it with me.  Now I am having massive cravings for the royal blend and the black vanilla and I can't do anything about it.

Price doesn't usually affect my yelp reviews.  But for four people all ordering Queen's Service - it came out to $35.00 with tax and tip included.  Please do not come here to just try the tea and food, this really is a social and dining experience.  Come with good friends and make sure you order different teas(they are bottomless teas anyway!)

excerpts: Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea
scones.author: Maile N.
scones.review:
I've been to high tea time at a few places, but this is the one place I would come back to!  My good friend and I had reservations for 3:30 this afternoon, and we had the best seat in the house next to the window!  

Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea (I had the Blood Orange tea, very good -- my friend likes her stand-by Black Currant tea).  

I thought everything was yummy and just right for the two of us, plus it was reasonably priced.  We stayed for two and a half hours, and not once did I feel like we were rushed out the door - just right!  Thank you, Lovejoy's for a very enjoyable Saturday afternoon!

excerpts: Decided to check this place out after reading some of the old reviews the decor is cute but too stuffy for my taste the servers like stated before are cordial but not warm(just like the trumpets and scones)
the food is very unimpressive,small and cheaply plated do not read the 2 year old 4 star reviews
like I did obviously
this tearoom has changed and isn't 4 stars anymore

excerpts: Of course, the sandwiches & scones & petit fours were delicious, but the presentation was so impressive - our friends loved it!
scones.author: Kate B.
scones.review:
My wife and I have been going to Lovejoy's with friends and relatives since Gillian and Muna first bought the place, and we love it.  

So when we planned our afternoon wedding, we decided that we wanted Lovejoy's to cater it.  No surprise, it was perfect.  Of course, the sandwiches & scones & petit fours were delicious, but the presentation was so impressive - our friends loved it!  

Everything was on giant silver multi-tiered serving stands, and there was a big silver urn for the tea.  The food was wrapped to keep it fresh until we served it, and there were fruit slices for garnish.  We also used Lovejoy's' wonderful trademark "mismatched" cups, saucers and plates.  It was so elegant and beautiful, and all of our guests enjoyed it.  

Also not surprisingly, making the plans with Gillian was so easy and pleasant; she could not have been more accommodating. 

 Lucky us - one of our guests gave us a gift certificate to Lovejoy's as a wedding gift - not that we need any incentive to go there as often as possible!

excerpts: The scones - are always warm;  pillows of doughy, buttery goodness.
And paired with the thick Devon cream and fresh jam preserves they are unreal.
scones.author: Jessica T.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's is a stunning medley of charm, passion, and character.

I take back everything I said about over the top. It was a lame statement of me to make. I don't think I really understood the high standard that I was experiencing at Lovejoy's until I visited other Tea Rooms in the city. 

Everything just melts together. Everything is darling. Everything feels right. Homey. And perfect.

And the food.

The food is what really makes Lovejoys stand out from all of the rest of the Tea Rooms in San Francisco.

It's the best around. 

The sandwiches are perfect. From the freshly cut bread, to the selection, to the fresh ingredients lightly placed inside each slice of wheaty goodness. Their Pear and Stilton are a must.

The scones - are always warm;  pillows of doughy, buttery goodness. And paired with the thick Devon cream and fresh jam preserves they are unreal. Think better than nutella on warm bread  - and that's pretty darn good.

And well...I could continue...

But I may get repetitive with the adjectives; beautiful, heaven, and perfection just keep floating up.

You can't go wrong with anything at Lovejoys. Anybody and everybody will appreciate it. Their food and tea is not cheap, but keep in mind that you're paying for the best and for a thoroughly unique San Francisco tea experience.

Trust.

excerpts: - Scones: delicous!
and they are big
scones.author: Linda C.
scones.review:
Make reservations if you're coming on a weekend, otherwise, good luck! Super cute place with flowery decor and "cutsie" stuff everyone. I was bit overwhelmed by this place since everything was so girly and I am far from girly if you know me. 

Overall, this is a nice experience to have and good for those baby shower events and such. As for food, it's OK and somewhat expensive for what it is, but I think you're paying more for the experience. Portions are small and bite size. They have a nice variety of teas to choose from which I like.

- Sandwiches: salmon good, bay shrimp good, egg ok, chicken salad ok, cream cheese mandarin orange ok
- Scones: delicous! and they are big
- Fruit: refreshing, wish they gave more with the meal

- Teas: chocolate chip was interesting and smelled strongly of chocolate chip but the taste wasn't that strong (good mixed with sugar & milk), japanese rice tea was good, jasmine was very flowery, dragon well was light

excerpts:
: Salmon tasted fresh and this was our favorite
-pear and stilton: your standard sharp tasting stilton

Sweets:
The scones were more like biscuits with raisins and I prefer more buttery scones, but props to them for still being somewhat warm when they came out even if they were a little dry.
scones.author: Alice L.
scones.review:
I took a visiting friend here since it's been a long-time tradition to have tea every time we meet. Located right off a metro stop on the J Line,  I remember passing by the store when I was in 24th Mission but had concluded it was some sort of salon because of its looks.

We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation time, but got seated immediately with a cute sign on the table that said "Reserved for Queens". We ordered "High Tea for Tea", which gave us a substantial amount of food. When it says "four sandwiches" they actually mean four whole sandwiches, not four quarters or four halves like some other tea places. They slice it into quarters, so there were 16 quarters in total.

Savory:
-roast beef and horseradish: This had a nice zing to it provided by the horseradish, 
-chicken apple walnut: This probably had the most filling-to-bread ratio and it tasted like the chicken apple salad that they sell at Costco, which I actually liked
-smoked salmon and cream: Salmon tasted fresh and this was our favorite
-pear and stilton: your standard sharp tasting stilton

Sweets:
The scones were more like biscuits with raisins and I prefer more buttery scones, but props to them for still being somewhat warm when they came out even if they were a little dry. It was served with Devonshire cream and preserves and those were definitely done right!

The shortbread tea biscuits were surprisingly decent tasting. 
We got the Italian wedding cake and a chocolate apricot petit four a la carte. They were $2.50 apiece, which seemed quite steep for a wee piece, but I believe they get it from Dianda's bakery (25th + Mission) that also sells it for the same price.

Ambience: I definitely thought this place was more shabby than chic, like some kind of untouched-for-centuries, dusty house that I would be afraid to touch. I do prefer somewhere that has some finesse, while still keeping the Grandma and girly vibe like Lisa's Tea Treasures,  but this is more a matter of taste preference, so it didn't impact my rating. What did MATTER was the tables were cramped and quite close to each other, making it difficult to go to the bathroom. We could also hear a lot of different conversations. I would prefer more private tables with wider spacing, so I could just relax, but that's just not feasible in a small and popular place. I saw a bridal shower and I felt as if I would want a private room or alcove with less tables if I were them, which is offered in some tea places. The mismatched teapots/cups/strainers resulted in my friend getting a tea strainer that was not wide enough to place on her huge cup, so she had to do a switch-a-roo.

Service: The ladies offered to take a picture for us and were quite prolific in topping off our tea with more water. After some time, it seemed like they were a little too hasty in trying to take our food away before we finished, but nothing super offensive. One of the workers (or manager?) was on the phone, going over some business accounts at the table next to us for a good while, so that was off-putting.

excerpts:
We chose:
- cucumber & cream cheese (obviously)
- apple walnut chicken salad
- tomato & cheese
- "lovejoy special" of the day- ham & mango chutney
Also included were: salad, cole slaw, two scones & two tea biscuits.
We could not stop raving about the scones, which were unusually moist & buttery (as opposed to dense & hard like other scones.)
And the double devon cream & strawberry jam made it that much more decadent (a little *too
scones.author: Fancypants X.
scones.review:
My mother & I participated in the ultimate female bonding ritual: High Tea at Lovejoy's Tea Room...

My first thoughts were, did i trip, fall down the rabbit whole & end up as a character in Alice in Wonderland?

LOOK AT ME:
This place is really unique & charming, almost reminds me of an antique shop; there are so many things to gawk at: chandeliers made from spoons, mirrors on the wall, the red British phone booth, a fireplace, hats hanging on a dresser, etc. All their silverware & chairs are mismatched. 

DRINK ME:
High tea for two was $35. We tried two teas: darjeeling black tea, which we drank with milk & sugar like we heard the Queen does & their "special find" of the day which was pomegranate green tea (totally try whatever "special find" they are offering. This one was exquisite.) Each tea was served in a different style teapot. 

EAT ME:
The tea sandwiches were dainty, delicate & delicious & were served on a two tiered porcelain carrier . We chose:
- cucumber & cream cheese (obviously)
- apple walnut chicken salad
- tomato & cheese
- "lovejoy special" of the day- ham & mango chutney
Also included were: salad, cole slaw, two scones & two tea biscuits. We could not stop raving about the scones, which were unusually moist & buttery (as opposed to dense & hard like other scones.) And the double devon cream & strawberry jam made it that much more decadent (a little *too* decadent says my scale.)

ADORE ME:
I just experienced Lovejoy's for the first time this week & I am already planning another trip back ASAP. Prices are decent for the extraordinary tea party experience you get & service was simply marvelous. Don't forget to sip tea with your pinky up (i swear, i DID NOT do this, but you should.)

excerpts: but they knocked it out by adding cumin seeds), the scones, the warm flaky crumpets with their delicious jam and lemon butter spread!
Tell everyone to come to lovejoy's!!!
scones.author: Nida A B.
scones.review: What can you not say about this place? The decorative knick knacks, the various cups and saucers, and the friendliness of the staff is so warm and welcoming. My sister and friends took me here during my bachelorette weekend and it was a perfect start to our saturday. We all chose our teas, I got the darjeeling tea, and then proceeded to share the large tiers of finger sandwiches (too many to choose from, must go back), salad, coleslaw (which usually I'm not a fan of but they knocked it out by adding cumin seeds), the scones, the warm flaky crumpets with their delicious jam and lemon butter spread! Tell everyone to come to lovejoy's!!!

excerpts: The cream tea choice came with scones, devon cream, and fresh fruits.
Omgosh, the scone took my breath away.
It was melted in my mouth.
I was expecting something super sweet, but nope, it was just perfect.
Not too sweet, but not too bland.
And the cream and jam were all so good that I kept trying to add both on the scone for every bite.
When the tea came out, we had the chance to add our own sugar and cream, so I loved that.
I had control over how much diabetes I wanted to give myself.
jk.
scones.author: Cynthia B.
scones.review:
This place is way too cute. I want to have all my parties here!

I came here with my friend and luckily we got a seat because I don't think my friend made a reservation. The place filled up quick. I got the cream tea with a choice of tea that I cannot exactly remember right now because there's such a huge selection of teas. I wanted to try all of them! Okay, first off, I loved the decoration of this place. I loved the cute tables and chairs, I loved the cute table clothe, and I loved the cute teapots, and plates that served our food. The cream tea choice came with scones, devon cream, and fresh fruits. Omgosh, the scone took my breath away. It was melted in my mouth. I was expecting something super sweet, but nope, it was just perfect. Not too sweet, but not too bland. And the cream and jam were all so good that I kept trying to add both on the scone for every bite. When the tea came out, we had the chance to add our own sugar and cream, so I loved that. I had control over how much diabetes I wanted to give myself. jk. It was fun getting the chance to customize my drink. 

Overall, I really loved coming here. The atmosphere is great, the service is so friendly, and the food is to die for.

excerpts: It is overpriced for the quantity and portion of the little cakes, sandwiches, cookies and scones one gets.
The tab can easily go over $50.00 for just two people.
scones.author: Jonathan F.
scones.review:
As much as I was eager to give Lovejoys a try, I was very disappointed. It is overpriced for the quantity and portion of the little cakes, sandwiches, cookies and scones one gets. The tab can easily go over $50.00 for just two people. And, what is really disappointing is that price can buy a lot more someplace else. 

The atmosphere is charming and the service that day was good. Yet that was because they were not busy. I wonder what it would have been like if the place was full and all the staff were very busy. 

In these times with easy-to-make recipes, for cakes, packaged cookies and microwave ovens, etc. there is no excuse for any type of baked good to be so overpriced. Starbucks and Peet's makes a more hearty and hefty sized portion of scone, muffin and cake than what was offered to us. And, at a more reasonable price. 

Also, with regards to tea, even loose-leaf varieties, the selection of teas one can buy in the supermarket or at Peet's, Starbucks for that matter is always available.  

My friend and I would have done much better to purchase all the needed items for a tea service at home and saved some money if we had done it ourselves. 

Yet, it is nice to be served by a pleasant staff and have all the dishes, table clothes, and so on. But again, I do think the food itself should be outstanding and in more abundant portions to justify such a high price.

excerpts: I had to remind myself that I was in a tea room and restrain myself from ravenously devouring the light and fluffy scones (an oxymoron, I know) slathered with heavenly Double Devon Cream and preserves.
Scones don't normally get me all hot and bothered, but I'm tellin' ya
it was the cream!
It was love at first bite...
scones.author: Anastasia B.
scones.review:
How can I not feel all warm and fuzzy inside sipping on a perfect cup of tea and eating dainty tea sandwiches at this charming and eclectic tea room, especially since this is where my cherry was popped? 

Ahem...I mean my Double Devon Cream cherry, that is. What did you think I meant?

I had to remind myself that I was in a tea room and restrain myself from ravenously devouring the light and fluffy scones (an oxymoron, I know) slathered with heavenly Double Devon Cream and preserves.

Scones don't normally get me all hot and bothered, but I'm tellin' ya it was the cream! It was love at first bite...

excerpts: Their scones are so freaking delicious!
I want some right now just thinking about it.
scones.author: Sannie L.
scones.review:
I had an absolutely wonderful experience here with my friends. It was our first time coming to one of these tea places and we left satisfied and happy. They have choices that are more affordable (ex. a la carte items, tea sets of different prices) and this allows for more flexibility so you can tailor what you order to how hungry you are, how much money you're willing to spend, etc. (ahem, Crown & Crumpet, take note).  I believe we had the High Tea for four and this came with bottomless pots of tea for each of us. Their scones are so freaking delicious! I want some right now just thinking about it. Even though I discovered that Earl Grey was not my thing, I still thoroughly enjoyed the other teas at the table. 

When we arrived we were met with absolutely excellent service. They were friendly and patient when we had no idea what to order. I loved the interior, even though space was a bit limited. They had shelves full of trinkets, teapots, and things that made it feel very home-y.
