It was packed the day we went because it was a weekend but we had reservations so no problems there.This is my go-to place when I want to get tea. Great service, good food and tea, cozy environment.

excerpts: Though very simple, I enjoyed all the finger sandwiches, the scones, and their luscious lemon curd, which they happen to sell at their Attic across the street (along with their teas).
scones.author: Marsha Z.
scones.review:
Tea rooms are to women what sports bars are to men.  Leave the boys at home and come here with the gals.  

I celebrated a belated birthday here, and it was a joy.  It's very cute and homey, which is what sets them apart.  A lot of British memorabilia fills the space.  (I loved the "Keep Calm and Carry On"  signage so much, I ended up buying one for my own place.)  You won't find any culinary delights here, but I thought the food was good.  Though very simple, I enjoyed all the finger sandwiches, the scones, and their luscious lemon curd, which they happen to sell at their Attic across the street (along with their teas).  We had the High Tea for Two, and it was more than enough food.  It was a very good mix of sweet and savory.  

I loved the bottomless pot of tea (I had the China Rose Petal), which proved to be very cleansing between my alcohol binges.

excerpts: There's nothing like taking a couple of hours to slow down and enjoy some quality time with scones, sandwiches and friends.
My BFF and I came here on a beautiful Wednesday afternoon.
Our table was waiting in the middle of the room.
It was fun looking at all the random knick knacks and mismatched plates and cups.
We got four sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, two scones, strawberry preserves and double devon cream, two shortbread cookies and two tea selections.
I chose the black mango tea and it was great.
You don't need sugar or milk because when a tea is good, you can just appreciate it for what it is.
scones.author: Julia T.
scones.review:
3.5 stars. I adore tea time. There's nothing like taking a couple of hours to slow down and enjoy some quality time with scones, sandwiches and friends. My BFF and I came here on a beautiful Wednesday afternoon. Our table was waiting in the middle of the room. It was fun looking at all the random knick knacks and mismatched plates and cups. We decided on the high tea for two for $34 (that's $17 each). We got four sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, two scones, strawberry preserves and double devon cream, two shortbread cookies and two tea selections. I chose the black mango tea and it was great. You don't need sugar or milk because when a tea is good, you can just appreciate it for what it is. I loved how many loose leaves there were in the pot. 

We chose the salmon & cream cheese, egg & onion, chicken apple walnut and asparagus & cream cheese sandwiches. All of them had the crust cut off and were pillowy soft. My favorite was the chicken apple walnut but none of the sandwiches were above average. The asparagus was a yellowish green color that looked like it was boiled too long but it tasted fine. The coleslaw was a little bland for me. Furthermore, I didn't like that the only taste I had was the caraway seeds that were mixed in. I had to spit out those little suckers after every bite. The salad was more like a garnish for the sandwiches to rest upon. I did like the little mandarin oranges in it though. 

The warm scone with raisins was delicious as were the shortbread cookies. Heaven is biting into a warm scone with cream spread and strawberry preserves on top. Lovejoy's is a bit hyped up but the service was fantastic. Our pots were never less than half full. I was also worried that I would still be hungry but the sandwiches and drinking so much of the tea left me quite satisfied.

excerpts:
Top tier: sugar cookies

Second tier: scones ( light buttery fluffy goodness) served with two types of home made jam and home made butter!
scones.author: Ying F.
scones.review:
Hands down the BEST Tea House in the Bay Area!  Walking into this tea house made me feel like I entered another world!!  It had the cute, cosy, fancy english tea room.  Everything was overly decorated (in a positive way).  Felt like I was living a fancy. What a wonderful place to play tea time with the girls!
Came here to celebrate our secret santa party.  There was 6 of us and arrived here very hungry. As usual, my pregnant friend would like to order everything and we did...

Order:
-Hazelnut tea for me - Huge pot of tea!  Love this flavor.  Reminds me of coffee cause of the hazelnut flavor. 

Here comes the tower!

Top tier: sugar cookies

Second tier: scones ( light buttery fluffy goodness) served with two types of home made jam and home made butter! I was in love with the lemon jam!   I would drink a tub of it. 

Third /forth/fifth tier: all the tiny finger sandwiches:
Cucumber&Cream Cheese ( a must)
Smoke Turkey & Dijon Mustard ( not bad)
Egg & Onion ( doesn't give you sticky breath. It's very light)
Chicken- Apple-walnut salad ( love the bits of crunchy pieces)
Smoke Salmon &Cream Cheese (YES!!!)
Tomato&Cheese ( not bad)
Chicken & Asparagus ( its ok)

They came with crumpits ( which was ok to me) and a tray of desserts.  I ended up with a super rich chocolate brown with walnuts (WOW!!)

I don't know why we ordered a Sheppard's pie but I'm glad we did.  That pie was delicious!  I have no idea how I made room for that pie.  But man! that pie is a must!!

Definitely making this our traditional Christmas gift exchange spot!

excerpts: The scones are amazing.
scones.author: Leona G.
scones.review:
My girlfriends and I have been going to Lovejoy's for at least 10 years. I was introduced by attending a baby shower. I had the most fun. I love the mismatched tea cups and pots. The scones are amazing. 

Bring your besties and have a blast.

excerpts: The raisin scones SUCKED ASS!
it was warm, but it was like eating cake!
it was too doughy, and surprisingly too big.
scones.author: Lynn T.
scones.review:
My Bffy had a difficult time getting reservations for Lovejoy's which was so out of the way in SF, so we really really really wanted to love this place. But we didn't. 

To start with, the service was good and attentive. I also like how we get to choose our sandwiches, BUT Not only was the place packed... but it was loud. It was hard to have a decent conversation when the table next to you...was really next to you. Plus it's a tea room, we didn't want to raise our voices.

We had the Tea for Two for $35
- The raisin scones SUCKED ASS! it was warm, but it was like eating cake! it was too doughy, and surprisingly too big. I would rather pay more for a smaller scone ...that was a SCONE!

-We barely noticed the salad that our sandwiches sat on top of. It 
 looked like decorations so we didn't touch it. (well i ate the oranges)

- we choose 4 sandwhiches that were cut into 4s.
  Roast Beef and Horseradish was over powered by the horseradish  
  (and I love horseradish, it's a great kick to most sandwiches)

   Turkey and Dijon Mustard was over slathered with dijon..meh 
   (I also love mustard, it's my go to topping over ketchup and mayo)

    Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese was decent and they didn't   
    skimp on the salmon.

    Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise (the special of the day..blah!)

-Our pot of tea was also the day's special
  Strawberry black tea, it was perfect! 

For sweets we had the 1 Lemon and 1 strawberry petite flour.
The Lemon was eh...ok but the strawberry had way too much cream.
Each cost an extra $2! ...SKIP IT...and go get yourself some BI-Rite Ice cream.

As for decore... not really going to touch this, but it was eclectic...tacky? IDK!

excerpts: We came here months ago as a group of 8 looking for a tea, scones, and fun.
we all loved our scones - big, fluffy, and perfect with the devonshire cream and lemon curd.
scones.author: Sam H.
scones.review:
After going elsewhere I felt I needed to add a positive review to Lovejoy's. We came here months ago as a group of 8 looking for a tea, scones, and fun. Had to make a reservation because the place is always packed and our table was ready when we arrived

At first it seemed expensive but I'd say you definitely get a great experience for the price. the place is lively and cute - with character all over. we shared four "queen tea for two"s and loved all our teas. they came loose leaf and were all unique and flavorful - loved the blood orange, earl grey, rose petal, and the others i cant remember

sandwiches were simple and delicious, not too small - the pear stilton my favorite. salad was light and coleslaw was very interesting, especially considering i usually dont like it. best part is definitely the scone. we all loved our scones - big, fluffy, and perfect with the devonshire cream and lemon curd. omg were those good. 

they were definitely busy but the service was still good - they checked up on us and sincerely seemed happy going about crazily attending to all their customers

when they came around with petit fours i mentioned i had been craving one for weeks and it was part of the reason we had come and she was really sweet giving me a little sign with my petit four. (cant remember what it said lol) sadly it wasn't too great and reminded me exactly of a debbie cake, but i like debbie cakes so not bad.

definitely come here with a group to relax, you should leave full and happy!

excerpts: We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy
scones.author: Lois W.
scones.review:
I loved loved loved having High Tea here!!

Came over here last weekend with few friends after hearing so much about the place. Reservations are hard to come by, and sometimes they forget to call people back. Therefore, my friend came here physically days prior to make the reservation!

The tea room was cutely decorated. There were so many random items all over the place, but somehow they worked together. After being seated, we each picked different types of tea and set - pinkies up! Everything was delicate and delicious. We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy :)

Didn't realise how much food was served until we felt like taking a nap on the sofa, all for ~$20 per person!

excerpts: their scones were amazing, perfectly flaky, just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of raisins and currants.
they were warm, and fresh, and amazing.
the creme, jam, and lemon curd were also amazing and complimented the scones and eachother perfectly.
scones.author: Rebecca A.
scones.review:
Oh my god, this place is the best tea room I have ever been to. 
let me just preface this by saying that I am part British, and i have been going to tea rooms since i could remember, and i daresay that this is the best tea room i have ever been to. 

The decor is soooo cute, and comfy, and this tea room has a great atmosphere and ambiance. It is just soo cute and comfy, and the people who work there are soo nice, attentive and helpful.

The service is great. the servers are very knowledgeable, helpful, attentive, and nice. They are always checking to make sure your tea is hot, and they are always making sure that the food is good and that you are happy with everything.

I have only ever gotten the queen's tea both times i've gone, and it was amazing both times. 
the first time i got the pear and stilton sandwich and the goat cheese, sundired tomato, and olive sandwich. They were both amazing and satisfaying, and perfectly balance. 
the second time i went i got the hummus and artichoke sandwich and the chutney and cheese sandwich. the hummus was okay, it was nothing special but it hit the spot, and the chutney was perfect. 

their scones were amazing, perfectly flaky, just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of raisins and currants. they were warm, and fresh, and amazing. the creme, jam, and lemon curd were also amazing and complimented the scones and eachother perfectly. 

the shortbread cookies were sooo good, they were thin and cruncy, and so perfectly sweet. 

the coleslaw is ridiculously delicious. I have never liked coleslaw and i am in love with their coleslaw. their sauce is amazing, and they put just the right amount of sauce on their coleslaw, and the rye seeds they add just make the coleslaw so much better than you would ever think coleslaw could be. 

the fresh fruit they serve is also really delicious, although i wish they gave you more

the crumpets were really good. they were warm and fresh, and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. they were amazing with the lemon curd and the butter. I'm normally not a big crumpet fan, so the second time i went i just got them to give me an extra scone instead of the crumpet, but  you must try the crumpets at least once. 

the petit fours are also amazing. the chocolate truffle with apricot was amazing, the walnut brownie was amazing, and the rose-water was amazing as well. they have a large and delicious petit four selection, and i have loved every single petit four that i have tried. 

finally, their tea selection is amazing. I love their darjeeling, and they always keep your tea hot, and make sure that it's hot. they have a really wide selection of non-caffein teas as well, and they are all delicious. 

lovejoy's just has the greatest atmosphere and service and it is seriously the best tea room I have ever been to out of los angeles and san francisco.

i made my friend who hates tea and pastries go to lovejoy's and she is now in love with tea time. that's how good lovejoy's is, it converted my pastry and tea hating friend to a tea time fanatic.

lovejoy's is a must try if you are ever in the bay area, it is an amazing experience!


just a side note, on the weekends, and even fridays, you should try to make reservations if you can, although they do also take walk-ins.

excerpts: The only two things I wish were different were the raisins in the scones (I don't care for cooked raisins) and a larger selection of teas.
Other than that, Lovejoy's is pretty perfect.
scones.author: Elle Q.
scones.review:
This place is amazing.

I've organized not one, but TWO tea parties here in the past few months, and they have been delightful experiences. The staff has made scheduling as easy as can be (although if you want to get a reservation here, you'll NEED to call more than a week in advance, as they book up VERY quickly!), the service while at tea has always been amazing, and the food, tea, and atmosphere are simply wonderful.

While I will admit that it's not my absolute favorite tea place in SF, my past experiences have made this THE place for hosting a tea party (larger than 4 people). The only two things I wish were different were the raisins in the scones (I don't care for cooked raisins) and a larger selection of teas. Other than that, Lovejoy's is pretty perfect. :)

excerpts: I think it's the best deal, as it comes with small sandwich slices, salad, coleslaw, scones, cookies, and three pots of tea.
scones.author: April D.
scones.review:
Aw tea parties.  The two times that I have come here, me and two other friends have gotten the High Tea for Three. It's just High Tea for Two with an added person. It's pretty filling. I think it's the best deal, as it comes with small sandwich slices, salad, coleslaw, scones, cookies, and three pots of tea. China Rose tea is my favorite! 

I highly recommend that you make a reservation, because you may not get seating. There is usually one small table available if you get there as soon as the place opens, but it is really is meant for two people. I wish this place were bigger or spacier, but I think they intentionally make the place look overcrowded with nic nacs. I don't recommend it for people who are claustrophobic. I'm not, but the space still bugs me. However, I will come back, because the food, tea, and service is great.

excerpts: The scones and crumpets were made even more tastey by the lemon curd.
yum!
scones.author: Emma F.
scones.review: This was a great place for an intimate baby sprinkle! We had a reservation and sat in a corner booth (I say booth because 3 of the seats were bench style with so many cushions). The artichoke hummus and smoked salmon & cream cheese sandwiches were good, but the presentation of them was confusing - hard to keep track of what was what... It was a little loud, but also very cute. The scones and crumpets were made even more tastey by the lemon curd. yum!

excerpts: It's such a treat to go here: from the unique tea cups you get, to their scrumptious scones, to the cute hats you can wear there, etc.
scones.author: M C.
scones.review:
Whenever family or friends are visiting from out of town, I like to take them to this tea room. It's such a treat to go here: from the unique tea cups you get, to their scrumptious scones, to the cute hats you can wear there, etc. 

Lovejoy's is a cute, cosy place and I love going there.

excerpts: Those sandwiches were quite filling, in addition to the gigantic scones and salad.
The scones were so delicious - we wanted more but were simply stuffed.
scones.author: Rose C.
scones.review:
My friend and I love to get tea with the whole English tea time accompaniments.  We went on a Friday for lunch and luckily, she made reservations.  The decor is utterly quaint and reminiscent of flowery furniture seen in historical films.

We ordered the High Tea for two and got to choose 4 different sandwiches.  We got the Smoked Salmon & Cream, Cheese Chutney & Cheese, Pear & Stilton, and Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard.   Those sandwiches were quite filling, in addition to the gigantic scones and salad.  The scones were so delicious - we wanted more but were simply stuffed.  I opted for the Passion Fruit tea while she got English Breakfast.  We spent a good 2 hours just drinking tea and talking.

excerpts: Out of all the items for our high tea order, I loved the warm scones (point!).
The service was nice, and I liked the variety of people who were there.
It didn't matter if you were more girly, goth, or just wanted to have some tea.
I don't like that it requires reservations.
We called 2 weeks in advance and the 1PM - 3PM tea was full.
scones.author: Lily W.
scones.review:
I guess I'm not really a tea person.

Came to celebrate a friend's birthday, and it was only OK.  I was definitely hesitant to come, as it reminds me of a small child having a tea party at Grandma's house. Nice, but not my cup of tea...ha.  No? Fine.

Out of all the items for our high tea order, I loved the warm scones (point!).  The service was nice, and I liked the variety of people who were there. It didn't matter if you were more girly, goth, or just wanted to have some tea. I don't like that it requires reservations. We called 2 weeks in advance and the 1PM - 3PM tea was full. Sucky.

The food was small portioned. Fair, as this is tea. However, after hanging out with people afterward, we found ourselves hungry after 3 hours. Some people were hungrier even earlier than that.  The sandwiches were only OK for me.  Fruit in sandwiches are just strange for me.  I also saw a large amount of canned veggies and fruits in the back...and realized almost everything I had came from cans. Interesting...

It was also a little pricey for me.  We averaged out at about 23 per person.  If I were more of a British tea person, I think I'd give it a 4.

excerpts: The scones are honestly to die for.
Don't forget the amazing lemon curd with it!
I got the queens tea, strawberry black tea and Shepard's pie.
Will definitely be coming back.
scones.author: Lareine S.
scones.review: Came here for the first time yesterday and loved it! I wasn't able to get a reservation. So I decided I would risk the wait times. I was given an estimate of 30 mins and was in before then. I'm in love with it's ambiance! The scones are honestly to die for. Don't forget the amazing lemon curd with it! I got the queens tea, strawberry black tea and Shepard's pie. Will definitely be coming back.

excerpts:
Way better scones
3. way more food
- we paid $20~$25 and had some extra sammies to-go!
each person got 8 pieces of sammie (not that I counted how many I've eaten
, I know I ate more than that)
That is = 2 whole sammie btw, and you also get a small salad, 1 scone (pretty big), and unlimted tea.
Nice friendly staffs.
scones.author: Anna W.
scones.review:
I came here recently with a big group (20pp) for a Bachelorette party. 

Comparing this to Crown and Crumpet in Ghirardelli Square, Love Joy is:
1. Not as "pretty" or "cute" but very real.. feels like I'm in someone's home with an antique setting of mix and matching tea cups, plates, etc. Nothing seems to match, but I really enjoyed it.. they're not trying too hard to impress, it actually made me want to check out the place a little more. 
2. Way better scones
3. way more food - we paid $20~$25 and had some extra sammies to-go!
each person got 8 pieces of sammie (not that I counted how many I've eaten, I know I ate more than that)   That is = 2 whole sammie btw, and you also get a small salad, 1 scone (pretty big), and unlimted tea.
4. Nice friendly staffs.  We were playing games and made so much noise.. basically taking over the entire tea room, sorry folks.

I'd rather come here than Crown and Crumpet, because the price is right and my stomach was satisfied.  

*Keep Calm Carry On*

excerpts: We had the "high tea" which it was not, for $20.00 plus $9.00 for tea you get two sandwiches, some greens tossed on to the tier and a dish of coleslaw and scones and a cookie..
The Queen would be appalled!
We went with a group and you really don't get much however it is definitely popular.
It was so cramped one could barely walk to the table.
Our server when available was on the surly side.
I really wonder why this place is popular.
I was a guest and honestly next time I am invited
I will suggest tea at my house at least the bread will be fresh and I will provide deserts as part of "high tea"  or save your pennies and go for real afternoon tea at the Garden Court.
scones.author: rassors T.
scones.review:
What are the rave reviews all about? Yes if you want to sip tea and eat stale bread sandwiches in a sardine can this is your place.  Ok I have only had tea in London, Victoria Canada and the Garden Court in SF and I realize Church street is far away but really!  They do not use the thin bread but instead thick American bread, think wonderbread. The parchment thin roast beef was undetectable as were many other fillings..We had the "high tea" which it was not, for $20.00 plus $9.00 for tea you get two sandwiches, some greens tossed on to the tier and a dish of coleslaw and scones and a cookie..
The Queen would be appalled!
We went with a group and you really don't get much however it is definitely popular. It was so cramped one could barely walk to the table. Our server when available was on the surly side. I really wonder why this place is popular. I was a guest and honestly next time I am invited I will suggest tea at my house at least the bread will be fresh and I will provide deserts as part of "high tea"  or save your pennies and go for real afternoon tea at the Garden Court.

excerpts: The tea was great (I ended up buying a canister from their retail store across the street), their scones and crumpets should have been illegal, and their chicken apple sandwiches/devonshire cream/lemon curd were to-freaking-die-for.
scones.author: Ashley F.
scones.review:
I wrote a brief review elsewhere, and I'm just going to copy/paste it here because I am supremely lazy to do a proper one. Also because I said everything I needed to say, and any elaboration I may be inclined to do will more than likely be odd ramblings.

I had tea ... with my ladybug friend last Friday. It was a toss up between this place and Crown & Crumpet, but she said this place offered more for your dollar. The tea was great (I ended up buying a canister from their retail store across the street), their scones and crumpets should have been illegal, and their chicken apple sandwiches/devonshire cream/lemon curd were to-freaking-die-for.

The place was quirky with mismatched chinaware and fun, vintage décor. As much as I liked it, though, the more compulsive part of my personality begged for less clutter and more sophistication/minimalism. That's not to undermine the atmosphere, though. I loved it, and the service was wonderful.

* What I failed to mention was the type of tea (ceylon). To most people, it might not be something to write home about, but I could have this tea (instead of green) forever and ever. And while I'm skeptical of adding any sugar into my tea, after positive prompting from my friend, I caved and decided a small spoonful of sugar only makes it better. Yum!

Bonus: You get to try on hats if you'd like to, and I'm attesting to other reviews that they rarely let your teapot get more than halfway empty.

excerpts:
(Upper Level)

Scones with Strawberry Jam.
These were alright, I think the scones at The Rotunda were better.
Their sandwiches are much better than their scones, assuming you pick good ones.
scones.author: Constance C.
scones.review:
We got the High Tea for Two tea set.



Earl Gray. In a polka dot teapot. Their tea was really fragrant and delish. I haven't had such good Western style tea in a long time.  



Our tea set came with...

(Lower Level)

Mixed Green Salad. This was pretty good. They gave us a light vinaigrette dressing for it. NOMS. 

Coleslaw. It was alright, I'm usually not too big of a fan of coleslaw but this was pretty good, though I'd prefer it drenched in dressing. 

Our Choice of Sandwiches:

Roast Beef and Horseradish. This was pretty good, I liked how they offered horseradish instead of typical dijon mustard. The horseradish gave it more spice and brought out the flavors of the beef better.

Bay Shrimp and Mayonnaise. This was my favorite by far, it tasted really fresh and delish. The tanginess of the mayonnaise definitely enhanced the fresh taste of the shrimp and hid the oceany taste. 

Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese. This was pretty good as well, just like my favorite lox and cream cheese sans bagel!

Chicken Apple Walnut Salad. My least favorite sandwich, mostly because I'm not really a fan of mushy salady sandwiches unless it's amazing and amazing this was not. It was just okay, nothing to write home about really. 

(Upper Level)

Scones with Strawberry Jam. These were alright, I think the scones at The Rotunda were better. These weren't buttery enough and were more dry. 

Shortbread Cookies. Didn't taste these because my friend ended up bringing them home. 

(Not Shown)

Petit Fours. Didn't actually try these unfortunately because we were THAT full. We couldn't stuff anymore in our stomachs!

Overall, I thought it was a good amount of food for my money. I was stuffed by the end of the meal. Their sandwiches are much better than their scones, assuming you pick good ones. Their service was pretty good, they were very busy yet very attentive. 

FYI: My friend tried to make reservations the day before and they didn't have any left. So make your reservations early! But they did tell my friend that they do save a couple tables for walk-ins but there are very few of those. And if you do attempt to chance it by walking in make sure you start waiting there at least 15mins before they open. We got there 20mins before it opened and there were people waiting already.

EDIT: Photos are no longer linked directly to this post, as Yelp does not like me posting my blog on my reviews. Please see food blog for photos.

excerpts: [evil] scones with devonshire cream and raspberry preserves.
scones.author: Fannie S.
scones.review:
So...

I finally made an effort to actually dine-in for their afternoon tea here.  We made reservations and gathered a bunch of people too!  :-) 

We went on Saturday, with a nine-year-old in tow.

We had their High Tea...four sandwiches (artichoke hummus, roast beef, smoke salmon and cream cheese, and chicken-walnut-apple salad), some greens salad (delicious vinegar-y dressing), buttery buttery [evil] scones with devonshire cream and raspberry preserves.  

I also ordered some sausage rolls for the table (they're two-bite appetizers basically).  They were not greasy, flaky dough, and savory filling.  Yum.

For tea, we had the China Rose Petal...which was a strong black tea with hints of rose.  I tried my sister's English breakfast tea, which is different from what I am used to (outside of this tea room).  I was a bit flummoxed by how bitter it was, and how it totally required sugar for drinkability.  

She tempted us with petit-fours as well...so the kid tried triple chocolate (dark, milk and white), and I tried the plum rosewater one which was just so different and so addicting!  

Service = as expected.  They are very attentive, friendly, and just great about refilling your teapots and great about taking photos for us.  

I'll definitely come back...

One of the plus factors for this place: they do not have overly flowery wallpaper, covered in same-fashioned dolls!  

Warning: This is NOT a cheap place.  Go for the experience, and if you don't enjoy it, don't waste money.  I don't want to hear any whining!

excerpts: Lovejoy's has a lively atmosphere, purposefully mismatched china and absolutely delicious offerings such as the Devonshire cream, freshly made scones, lemon curd and petit fours.
scones.author: Alacrity I.
scones.review:
Had tea with a friend recently and was welcomed as if I'd never been away...I have brought many friends and loved ones over the years and I'm thrilled the ladies who own the shop are just as friendly and lovely as ever.  

Lovejoy's has a lively atmosphere, purposefully mismatched china and absolutely delicious offerings such as the Devonshire cream, freshly made scones, lemon curd and petit fours.  The shepherd's pie is delicious!

If you're looking for a perfect spot for a bridal or baby shower, birthday celebration or just a uplifting afternoon to indulge yourself, Lovejoy's is the perfect place!

excerpts:
More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.
, 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:
This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!
They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.
For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/
"Reserved for Royals".
scones.author: Genevieve Y.
scones.review:
Date & Time:  Friday June 6, 2008 @ 5:15pm(they close at 6pm and the last seating is at 5pm, so I recommend coming earlier, but they were so kind to seat us.)
Company:  Michael who gave up Happy Hour to Accompany Me Here
Crowd:  Groups & Twosomes of Ladies @ Tea Time
Atmosphere:  Tea Party we've Dreamed of as Children Come to Life
Decor:  Utterly Charming!  Everything is Precious from the Apricot Window Curtains, Pale Yellow Walls, Seating Areas to the Unique Red Phone  Booth, Paintings and  Porcelain Teacups that Accent this Beautiful Room.  Small Wooden Tables covered w/ Doiley's and Cushioned Wooden Chairs and Benches along w/Seating Sections w/ Sofas, Wooden Loveseats, Coffee Tables and Comfortable Upholstered Chairs.  Very Cozy!
Service:  Very Warm, Helpful, Attentive.
Imbibe:  White Peach Tea!  Vast Selection including Apricot, Passionfruit & China Rose Petal Black Tea.  Served in Unique Teapots w/ Porcelain Cups & Saucers.  Thoughtful Touch!
Devour:  More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.  A Combination of All of The Above is Availabe in High Tea also for Two and Queen's Tea.  Wee Tea for children 10 and under.  
Notes:  Towards the End of this Wonderful Tea Time Experience, the Very Beautiful and Sweet Server Visits Each table with a Tray of Scrumptious & Various Petit Fours where we can Choose the Flavor of our Choice!  I got the Milk Chocolate w/ Apricot and was trying to Signal Michael to get the Strawberry Shortcake,  but he got the Nut Brownie cause it was huge, so we took the rest home!
Side-Notes:  Since we got there so late, we had the Cream Tea where got to Choose a Tea(Apricot), 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:  This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!  They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.  For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/ "Reserved for Royals".

excerpts: The scones are heaven, and the sandwiches are adorable and so yummy &  they have a nice variety to choose from.
scones.author: Amanda B.
scones.review:
This tea room is FANTASTIC!!!  I have been coming here with my family and girlfriends for years and they never disappoint!!  The scones are heaven, and the sandwiches are adorable and so yummy &  they have a nice variety to choose from.   

Everything tastes homemade and the decor/ambiance is sweet and quirky.  This is a great place to take your Mom, Granny,or  girlfriend.

excerpts: The food is delicious especially the scones!
They are super busy on weekends so plan to go on a weekday or make reservations early.
With my BF it took 1 hr plus and with my girls it took 3+ hours
so prepare to be there for awhile.
scones.author: Shirley Y.
scones.review:
I have came here twice and I love this place the best so far. The food is delicious especially the scones! They are super busy on weekends so plan to go on a weekday or make reservations early. With my BF it took 1 hr plus and with my girls it took 3+ hours so prepare to be there for awhile. They are very attentive with reservations and will call you back to confirm and stuff.

The price is reasonable and there is a wide variety of teas. The food is pretty big portions and you get full quickly with the tea and scone. I love the smoke salmon sandwich the best. Tea-wise I enjoyed one of the green tea and the rose tea was nice as well.  Service is lovely even when they are busy. They constantly check if you need more tea which is a plus! Overall a wonderful experience and cannot wait to go back!

excerpts: Their scones are amazing and the petit fours delightful!
I've got to add the catering service is terrific.
We ordered for my sis' bridal shower and everything was wonderful down to the adorable sandwich tiers.
Lovejoy's will forever be my favorite tea spot!!!
scones.author: C J.
scones.review:
Not sure what I can say about this wonderful little gem that hasn't already been written.
Been to a few Bay Area tearooms and without a doubt Lovejoy's is the best. Wonderful service, adorable decor. The rose tea is a must, get a bottomless pot. Sandwiches very good, not at all dry like some of the other places. Their scones are amazing and the petit fours delightful!
I've got to add the catering service is terrific. We ordered for my sis' bridal shower and everything was wonderful down to the adorable sandwich tiers.
Lovejoy's will forever be my favorite tea spot!!!

excerpts: We ALWAYS get the Queen's Tea Service with finger sandwiches and scones.
It's so good!
scones.author: Tracy C.
scones.review:
This my favorite of all tea rooms. I've been going here for many years and it's as good as it ever was.

Meet a few of my friends here for a good British tea service on a regular basis. I had my baby shower here. It's great for showers!

I haven't been to a better tea room than Lovejoy's. Not even in England! There is a very large assortment of loose leaf tea and they keep the pot filled. Quaint decor with mismatched service placements.

Food is good too although I have to admit to never getting any hot items here. We ALWAYS get the Queen's Tea Service with finger sandwiches and scones. It's so good!

excerpts: There were 2 large scones along with jam and clotted cream and a couple of shortbread cookies.
The coleslaw and salad were also pretty tasty (coleslaw is nothing like the heavy mayo based slaw
scones.author: Faye F.
scones.review:
My first time to experience afternoon tea (even after having visited London)!!! What can I say about this? AWESOME! First of all, I didn't know that reservations should be made WAAAY in advance. I was worried that my friend (who's an avid afternoon tea participant) and I wouldn't be able to get a table. Luckily, there was an availability as we walked in. I love the whole feel of Lovejoy's. The decor, the tea sets and chinaware... exquisite!

My friend and I had the High Tea for Two for $34 (NOT per person) with 2 extra petit fours for a few bucks. We tried the Tea House Blend and Passion Fruit. We had 4 sandwiches: smoked salmon and cream cheese, chicken/walnut/apple salad, mandarin oranges and cream cheese, and the Sandwich special of the day which was chicken curry. There were 2 large scones along with jam and clotted cream and a couple of shortbread cookies. The coleslaw and salad were also pretty tasty (coleslaw is nothing like the heavy mayo based slaw so you don't feel as guilty eating it). 

I say this is a great experience to have at least once in your life (even if you're not a fan or you think it's too pricey.. YOU GOTTA TRY)! I don't think the place was too expensive and I believe it's worth it too! Afterwards, we crossed the street to Lovejoy's Attic to buy some tea and check out some cute things on sale. 

I'd love to come here again!

excerpts: My favorite item was the scones.
scones.author: Ken C.
scones.review:
I had an amazing experience at Lovejoy's. This was my first time at a tea salon so I wanted to full experience. We ordered the Queen's Tea, which is their biggest menu option and gives you a sampling of a variety of their tea parings. My favorite item was the scones. The crumpets were good too. I could have done without the little sandwiches as neither of our selections were particularly good. Since we arrived with a big appetite we also purchased the sheppards pie and this puff pastry with pork in it. Both of those entree items were amazing. 

Lovejoy's is a great place to have your first tea salon experience. We also noticed a large group of women that were holding a baby shower so I'd imagine that's pretty common at a place like this. 

If you'd like to experience the whole pomp and circumstance than I'd suggest you order the "High Tea" or the "Queens Tea". Each meal comes with a bottomless pot of the tea of your choice. If you're  guy (like me) and want to experience good food then I'd suggest you get a pot of tea and the sheppard's pie. 

Overall a little spendy, and the service is okay, but it's great food/tea, casual (not stuffy) environment, and Lovejoy's will make sure you have a great experience. Tip: Definitely make sure you book a reservation in advance. :)

excerpts:
I don't know how to do that 1/2 star rating, If you can, pretend it is a 4 1/2 rating =)

4 1/2 because I just didn't feel comfortable spending well over $60.00 for tea, bite sized sandwiches and a limited amount of scones and other unique baked goods.

For the steep price we were able to get

Cucumber and Cream Cheese
Salmon and Cream cheese
Cured ham 

4 scones with the devon sauce?
scones.author: Myrtle M.
scones.review:
I don't know how to do that 1/2 star rating, If you can, pretend it is a 4 1/2 rating =)

4 1/2 because I just didn't feel comfortable spending well over $60.00 for tea, bite sized sandwiches and a limited amount of scones and other unique baked goods. Ok, $60.00 between two people probably isn't too pricey but still the portions were too small to even justify that price.

BUT, In terms of quality, I suppose I won't be so quick to condemn it.

Just when you think you've explored San Francisco for all it's worth, the city surprises you with something new and intricately patterned, like Love Joys. The place was decorated with all sorts of trinkets, reminiscent of Tommys' Joynt, possibly the female version of Tommys'. Because no two table displays are identical, expect every experience to be sweet and emanate warmth. 

The table is set to recreate english tea time, with its fine china and miniature utensils and antiquated furnishes it takes cute and endearing to a whole new level.  Tea is served in your personal sized tea pot and the you get the joy of letting your tea leaves steep, your own personal milk and sugar , etc., etc.

For the steep price we were able to get

Cucumber and Cream Cheese
Salmon and Cream cheese
Cured ham 

4 scones with the devon sauce? ( The devon sauce tastes terrible, that is in massive quantities, be as sparing as possible with it)

and then it was $2.00+ additional for the little cookies and chocolates they walked around offering. It was worth it but that immediately added $10.00 to our bill, it doesn't help that each one of them looked like a must to try

excerpts: The scones were simply delicious with the lemon curd.
scones.author: T T.
scones.review:
What a cute quirky place.  Had a wonderful time there with my friends last weekend.  We made a reservation, which I would recommend to do.  The place was packed, many ladies and girls enjoying an afternoon tea.  

The tea was delicious.  We ordered the earl grey and the vanilla roobios.  Both were phenomenal.  The mix matched cups were super cute, as was the mix matched china.  The scones were simply delicious with the lemon curd.  The little sandwiches were good, but the star of the show was the scone.  

The service was good, we spent almost two hours there and did not feel rushed which was appreciated.  I will definitely be back, it was a fun experience and a very girly thing to do.

excerpts: Best place to go for tea and scones and tea sandwiches...
oh, let's not forget the petit fours at the end of your meal.
My favorite tea sandwiches are the roastbeef and horseradish, the salmon and cream cheese and the chicken and asparagus.
Their dressing for the salad is delicious.
Coleslaw is yummy too and their scones are heaven!
I always save the scone for last!
Soooooo good!
My petit four was delicious as well
, I got the triple chocolate.
I came out feeling more than satisfied!
So delicious!
I wanna go back tomorrow!
scones.author: Reese E.
scones.review:
This place is the perfect place for me to feel super girly! I went here with my mom today for probably the 10th time and all throughout our tea time, I couldn't stop saying, "I love this place." I want my birthday here, once I get proposed to, forget the bachelorette party, I want my bridal shower here and once I get pregnant, I want my baby shower here!

Best place to go for tea and scones and tea sandwiches...oh, let's not forget the petit fours at the end of your meal. My favorite tea sandwiches are the roastbeef and horseradish, the salmon and cream cheese and the chicken and asparagus. Their dressing for the salad is delicious. Coleslaw is yummy too and their scones are heaven! I always save the scone for last! Soooooo good! My petit four was delicious as well, I got the triple chocolate. I came out feeling more than satisfied! So delicious! I wanna go back tomorrow!

excerpts: Crumpets, scones and cheese and pickle sandwiches have never tasted so good.
We had the queen's tea and were not disappointed! :-)
scones.author: Harriet P.
scones.review: Loved it! I'm British and have lived in SF for a year and half now. Lovejoys reminded me of a lot of the good stuff we left behind. Crumpets, scones and cheese and pickle sandwiches have never tasted so good. We had the queen's tea and were not disappointed! :-)

excerpts: And then there's the scones.
And the chestnut tea.
And the shortbread.
And the sausage rolls (not as good as my mom makes 'em, but still good enough to scare away any avid dieters).
scones.author: mary r.
scones.review:
My mom and her side of the family are English, so I kind of know my way around an English tea.  And when I say tea, I mean tea and the food that goes with it.

Lovejoy's has an unsurpassed tea menu...and again, I'm talking about the food.  Their sandwiches are cute, little, de-crusted  combos of cream cheese & cucumber, cheese & tomato, roast beef & horseradish, ham & spicy mustard, cheese & chutney and on and on and on.  There is no skimping on that sandwich menu, believe me.  They serve Taylor's tea, among other choices, so that's pretty cool....but it'd be even cooler if they carried Sainsbury's Red Label!

And then there's the scones.  And the chestnut tea.  And the shortbread.  And the sausage rolls (not as good as my mom makes 'em, but still good enough to scare away any avid dieters).  And the petits fours (mmm, marzipan!).  And the pasties (savory pies, not nipple hiders).  YES.  They have delicious, savory pies here!  Yum.  Although, I'm sure a lot more men would come here if the pasties advertised were of the tittie-bar variety.  And yes, I just used "tittie-bar" while reviewing a tea room.

Which brings me to my next point:  this place has a lovely atmosphere for say, a lunch with the ladies, or a baby shower or just plain high tea.  But it can be a bit precious with all the crazy estrogen and flowered what-nots floating around.  Every time I come here, there is maybe one (bored or forced-to-look-happy) man for every 8 women sitting in the place.  And there are doilies.  Not like that's any different from my mom's house.  I'm just warning the not-so-feminine and the ladylike-lacking so you're not surprised if you get the evil eye for saying something along the lines of  "HOLY FUCKING SHIT!!!  THIS PLACE IS RAD!"

excerpts: Our sandwiches were served with a delicious spring green salad in addition to large warm scones, preserves, and Double Devon Cream (which I thought was whipped butter).
scones.author: Jenny J.
scones.review:
I came here yesterday with some family members for High Tea. I didn't play a role in the booking process but from what I understand, the reservation was made several months in advance. 

Parking wasn't too difficult on a Saturday afternoon and most of us found spots within a few block radius. Lovejoy's was packed and groups were standing outside, waiting and chatting happily. 

Inside was crowded but comfortable; cozy and inviting. Decor was a fun Victorian thrift store look with British overtones... kind of like Target's "Shabby Chic" line but way more authentic and personalized. 

The tea was amazing and our server was incredibly patient in describing each of the varieties to us. I normally dump ridiculous amounts of sugar in any tea I encounter but found myself enjoying both the Chinese Rose Petal and Vanilla Rooibos straight on their flavor alone. Sandwiches for our party of 6 were served on a huge 3-tiered tray, cut into triangles and adorably lined up around the edges. We wondered what they did with all the cut-off crusts at the end of the day. 

Of the vegetarian options, the egg and onion sandwiches were quite good. Cream cheese is pretty much good in anything (wontons, sushi, frosting); paired with Mandarin oranges or sliced cucumber is no exception. The pear and Stilton (English blue cheese) combination, though interesting, did not taste particularly good. Our sandwiches were served with a delicious spring green salad in addition to large warm scones, preserves, and Double Devon Cream (which I thought was whipped butter). The coleslaw, which seemed like an odd addition to our tea and real salad, was creamy but bland and remained barely touched the duration of our meal. 

Overall, Lovejoy's was a wonderful place for our group to get together, visit, and lose track of time. The ambiance lent itself well to feeling cheerful and relaxed and the tea itself was exceptional. It seemed a bit pricey for such dainty fare... I suppose it's more of an experience than an actual meal but we were all hungry shortly after leaving. Also, some of the flavor combinations really missed the mark. So, go with friends, but eat first.

excerpts: The scones were bomb!!
The scones aren't the same, but still delicious.
The service is way better and they don't mind the sharing =
p
scones.author: Deb E.
scones.review:
A friend and I had never been to tea time so we decided to give Lovejoy a try. 

Don't get me wrong, when we first walked in it was cute. We didn't schedule an appointment because we didn't know we had to, but luckily it wasn't busy so our server just gave us a head's up for next time. The scones were bomb!! They have a wide variety of tea choices, too.

The only thing we didn't like was that there was a min. charge per person, so when we tried sharing an order and she didn't looked pleased. Again, she warned us for next time. heh.

We also felt a little bit rushed, even though the place was empty. She kept talking to us like "if you're not going to order anymore, why are you staying?" type of service. Tea time is for catching up with a friend, dude! We were there for less than an hour any way!

Overall, they're really strict about their rules:
seating time limit
no sharing meals if it's under 20 dollars
make an appointment

I'd rather hit up the Secret Garden Tea house on Lincoln. The scones aren't the same, but still delicious. The service is way better and they don't mind the sharing =p

excerpts:
Seven of us enjoyed the Queen's Tea which included sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, crumpets, scones (my favorite!), shortbread cookies, and petit fours. 
The only thing I felt like I missed by doing this was the crumpets.

Scones!
Crumpets

Least Faves:
Fig and olive tapenade sandwich
Coleslaw - the rye seeds give it an odd flavor and I'm the only one who ever eats coleslaw in our group - I wish they'd give us crumpets instead
Petit fours - too sweet

Finish your tea experience by going across the street to Lovejoy's Attic and buying your favorite tea (at a much cheaper price) and tea set.
scones.author: Kathleen M.
scones.review:
This is the perfect place for a bridal shower. I know because I was a guest at one here. The cornucopia of tea snacks was amazing and all very tasty.

UPDATE:
My bachelorette party started here and we had a wonderful time. Seven of us enjoyed the Queen's Tea which included sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, crumpets, scones (my favorite!), shortbread cookies, and petit fours. The food and tea were delicious and served on precious mismatched china.

UPDATE 2:
We went back for a birthday and brought some straight guys. Although the husband was worried he'd have to wear a hat (they have hats available to put on at a tea place near San Diego), I assured him that they didn't make you wear hats here. He survived lunch at Lovejoy's with his manhood intact. (More than survived - he and another male friend were comfortable the whole time.) The husband loved scoopfuls of the after dinner mints.

The Queen's Tea involves a lot of food. For $5 less a person you can get the High Tea which is still plenty of food. The only thing I felt like I missed by doing this was the crumpets.

Now that I've been here a few times I can better evaluate the food:

Faves:
Tea: Passion fruit
Sandwiches: Chicken walnut salad (least fave: fig and olive tapenade)
Scones!
Crumpets

Least Faves:
Fig and olive tapenade sandwich
Coleslaw - the rye seeds give it an odd flavor and I'm the only one who ever eats coleslaw in our group - I wish they'd give us crumpets instead
Petit fours - too sweet

Finish your tea experience by going across the street to Lovejoy's Attic and buying your favorite tea (at a much cheaper price) and tea set.

excerpts: Lovejoy's Tea Room has really delicious scones.
Eat your scones while they're hot!!
scones.author: Anna T.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room has really delicious scones.  And the black currant tea is to die for.

Other than that, I didn't enjoy much else.  After the initial, "omg this is so cute and cozy!" reaction I had, the whole ambiance of the place just felt kind of off to me.  Hodgepodge furniture squished together, no room to even stick out your pinky finger to drink tea like a snob!  

I understand that they are super busy, so I appreciate them fitting us in the 1 hour opening they had.  But the waitress was kind of strange and didn't provide us with attentive, fast service given that she wanted us to leave ASAP.  

My friend came in 3 minutes after we placed our initial order so the waitress said she would be right back to take her order.  But she never really came back until we were half way through our tea time.  

Eat your scones while they're hot!!

excerpts: Middle tier: warm, fresh baked raisin scones with generous servings of raspberry spread, buttery cream, and lemon curd.
This was by far my favorite tier -  conveniently placed at eye-level, these scones made it to my mouth and tummy in no time.
I'll definitely be back for more scones and tea.
Offering a unique and fun 'girly' experience in the heart of Noe Valley, Lovejoy's is great for lunch, birthday & bachelorette parties, or torturing a male companion.
Just kidding.
Sort of.
scones.author: Patty L.
scones.review:
If you're ever unsure of where this celebrated tea room is, keep your eyes and ears peeled for hoards of chatty, polished women standing on a street corner. You've arrived at your destination where the air is filled with lots of estrogenic energy and excitement.

I'm not a girly girl by any means. My friends wore pretty dresses while I had on dark jeans and a grey t-shirt. Though I love tea houses and bars, primarily hippie and zen joints, I was apprehensive about going to a 'girly girl' tea room. I braced myself for the worst, but was pleasantly surprised from the moment I stepped inside Wonderland.

Lovejoy's is UK whimsical meets SF quirky. The space is decorated with all sorts of random trinkets, lace pillows, mismatched tea pots, cups, and saucers, and couches. Sit at a 2 or 4 top where the tables are 'reserved for royalty'. With our reservations, the five of us got to sit on the parlor couches 'reserved for queens' next to a giant red telephone booth. 

We had two servers who were very helpful and attentive. Because I love variety, I like knowing what my options are and these ladies were on it! They gave their recommendations and then gave us options where we could mix and match to get the most out of our meal. What we got:

****Queen's tea - a three tier platter: highly recommended!****
Top tier: fresh, I mean FRESH blackberries, grapefruit, strawberries, kiwi, cantaloupe. Nuff said.

Middle tier: warm, fresh baked raisin scones with generous servings of raspberry spread, buttery cream, and lemon curd. This was by far my favorite tier -  conveniently placed at eye-level, these scones made it to my mouth and tummy in no time.

Bottom tier: light and refreshing housemade coleslaw, a bed of organic mixed greens, and bite sized triangle shaped sandwiches. The smoked salmon was fresh but a little too salty for my taste; the turkey with stone ground mustard was tasty, but my all time favorite was the apple, walnut, and chicken salad salad sandwich. Really light yet packed with flavor and served on both white and wheat bread.

We also had:

Chicken curry pastie: flaky and fresh but a little bland and nothing to write home about.

Ploughman's lunch - good to get if you like goat and bleu cheese, salt and vinegar chips, hummus, and chutney...but otherwise an odd combination. I'd stick with the Queen's tea platter.

Bottomless tea: we had the house blend (very strong and aromatic), mango decaf (didn't get to try), and Dragon Well green (lacked robustness, but probably because we didn't let it steep long enough).

I'll definitely be back for more scones and tea. Offering a unique and fun 'girly' experience in the heart of Noe Valley, Lovejoy's is great for lunch, birthday & bachelorette parties, or torturing a male companion. Just kidding. Sort of.

excerpts: The little sandwiches, warm scones, and big pots of tea are grown-up versions of the tea parties I used to have in my backyard when I was 9.

Important to note:
1) Do make reservations.
The weekends fill up fast.
2) Don't expect this to be a quick lunch.
Most places try to clear their tables quickly for the next party, but Lovejoy's caters to the female side and understand that girls tend to take a while.
We like to talk!
scones.author: Jess J.
scones.review:
This is a wonderful place to reboot estrogen levels with a girlfriend. The little sandwiches, warm scones, and big pots of tea are grown-up versions of the tea parties I used to have in my backyard when I was 9. 
Important to note:
1) Do make reservations. The weekends fill up fast.
2) Don't expect this to be a quick lunch. Most places try to clear their tables quickly for the next party, but Lovejoy's caters to the female side and understand that girls tend to take a while. We like to talk! 
3) The High Tea for two is actually a lot more food than it looks like. If you have leftovers, they'll pack them up for you and even put a damp towel with the sandwiches so they don't dry out on the way home. 
4) Kids - always a touchy issue. The ones we saw there were well behaved and really enjoyed the authentic tea party. 

It was lovely to be a tea ponce for the afternoon!

excerpts: The scones were nice and warm.
They have the tallest towers of food I've ever seen.
Lookign forwarding to trying others to compare.
scones.author: Mira M.
scones.review: LoveJoy was my first tea room in San Francisco to try. This place is small yet it was packed. Great place to take moms, grandma's and friends. Reservations are a must to be seated. The scones were nice and warm.  They have the tallest towers of food I've ever seen. Lookign forwarding to trying others to compare.

excerpts: At first glance it didn't seem like out little tower of scones and sandwiches would be very filling
but they proved to be otherwise.
The  Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard was delish as were the scones!
scones.author: Lisette E.
scones.review:
Tried this place a while ago with some girlfriends and had a great time. As I love tea I was impressed with the teas that they offer and they made it a point to make sure that I always had hot water and I was never empty.  The teas were super tasty and I loved that I had my own personal tea pot. 
=)

At first glance it didn't seem like out little tower of scones and sandwiches would be very filling but they proved to be otherwise. The  Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard was delish as were the scones!

Super important to make reservations in advance. The place can get kinda cramped and warm. I was wearing a sweater and wished I hadn't.

Overall it was a delightful time with girlfriends and I can't wait to do it again.

excerpts: The food was a bit overpriced and you don't get a lot of selection on sandwiches or scones.
scones.author: Stella C.
scones.review:
I was hoping for more when i came here. I guess i have high expectations but i really think a perfect tea room can be achieved in the bay area.

The food was a bit overpriced and you don't get a lot of selection on sandwiches or scones. You actually get one giant scone rather than a bunch of smaller ones. 

The location is random, but that makes it charming -- as are the mismatched settings/teapots. The service was really lovely; very friendly and definitely above & beyond. The food was pretty tasty and I was happy to see pasty on the menu. it's very cozy and casual.

excerpts: I felt like a little girl again playing with my tea set, except this time we had real tea and real scones instead of air and plastic scones.
Scones and other side dishes were still available.
The scones were fresh and light.
We ordered the passion fruit black tea.
They also brought around a tray of petifore.
scones.author: Amy C.
scones.review:
I felt like a little girl again playing with my tea set, except this time we had real tea and real scones instead of air and plastic scones. 

I found Lovejoy's online when I was searching for tea houses in San Francisco for my visit. I was expecting to go to a Japanese or Chinese tea house, but I'm soooooo glad I came across Lovejoy's in my search. 

The decor is very homey, cozy, and welcoming. Even the bathroom was decorated with antiques. 

We got there an hour before closing time so the kitchen was closed. We didn't mind since we were heading to dinner soon after. Scones and other side dishes were still available. The scones were fresh and light. We ordered the passion fruit black tea. They also brought around a tray of petifore. For an hour, I thought I'd died and gone to heaven.

Lovejoy's is every little girl's dream, no matter her age.

excerpts:
no milk needed
- VANILLA ROOIBOS - great! add the milk, it adds a lil something

the food 
- SCONES WITH PRESERVES AND DOUBLE
scones.author: Judy N.
scones.review:
We came for a girlie afternoon tea for 4, with reservations made, we had a cute table all set up. everything was dainty and cutesy, and with good company, it's the perfect set up for a nice light lunch. Parking was no problem at all. 

the Teas: 
- PASSIONFRUIT TEA - great no milk needed
- VANILLA ROOIBOS - great! add the milk, it adds a lil something

the food 
- SCONES WITH PRESERVES AND DOUBLE DEVON CREAMS - was great! even with the lemon sauce it was good 
- fresh fruit - you can't go wrong 
- shortbread tea biscuit
- ROAST BEEF AND HORSERADISH SANDWICH - tasty! 
- salmon and cream cheese sandwich was too salty... eh.. you should opt for another option. 

the service is amazing. the ladies come around often and warm up the tea for you every so often, to ensure that you have a nice relaxing afternoon there. And they limit reservations to 2 hour blocks, so be prepared to spend some time here. 

this is a great place for meeting up with the girls for a girlie afternoon, a special occasion or just enjoying great company. And afterwards go across the street to their antique shop to purchase some of the teas for your own tea party at home, or other fun kitchen knickknacks...

excerpts: The scones were really filling.
scones.author: Mona C.
scones.review:
[M]ona: 5 Stars
[W]ayne: 4.5 Stars
Average: 4.75 Stars

+ Great Ambiance
+ Excellent Service
+ Nice Tea Selection 
+ Cute Interior and Decor
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Good Food!
+ Good Tea!
+ Filling
+ Not a "girly" thing
+ 10% off at Lovejoy's Attic

[M] I took my good friend here for her birthday last year and she liked it very much. So this time, I decided to come here with Wayne and have him enjoy the experience as well. If you think Tea parties are for girls only then you're totally wrong hehe. 

We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon (reservations are recommended especially for the weekend) and there was a table in the center of the tea house waiting just for us. Since Wayne is a pretty big eater, we decided on the Queen's Tea http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=57N_lW3GA1ks-eR5xwMmwA for him and a High Tea http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=fn2qSFZVLENOMjuNJS3JQQ for me. The Queen's Tea comes with your choice of tea with unlimited refills, choice of 2 sandwiches, cole slaw, green salad, platter of fresh fruit, a scone with preserves and double devon cream, tea biscuit, crumpet with lemon curd and a petite four. The High Tea is just the same sans the fresh fruit, crumpet and petite four http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=9qzUBqc5axqMSGw-DIrsPQ. We opted for the Genmai Tea and Black Current Tea. For our sandwich selection, we had the smoked salmon and cream cheese, salmon mousse, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and bay shrimp and mayonnaise.

[W] I thought the tea was pretty good here. I originally chose the Afternoon Darjeeling tea and saw the Genmai Tea written on a blackboard in the back of the restaurant. The hostess was nice enough to help me switch out the tea even though they made a point that they normally don't after they have brewed it. The Genmai http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=pOcaHOwOkJQRQSUJVsx19A was light and ricey. Kinda like the ones from Japanese and Korean restaurants. The sandwiches were pretty good. I especially liked the salmon and cream cheese sandwich as well as the mandarin orange and cream cheese was really refreshing. The crumpet http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=9KKmlGQB8rVk3Sc3ypRWOg looked like a sponge to me but was also good. The scones were really filling.

[M] The Black Current black tea has a nice fruity aroma but doesn't taste as it smells. It was a bit strong and bitter and needed some water to tone down the flavor. My favorite tea selection at Lovejoy's is the China Rose Petal Black Tea and Strawberry Green Tea. The hostess recommended us the Chestnut tea. Perhaps we will try that next time. 

[W] Overall experience was nice. I didn't feel out of place since to my surprise, there were quite a lot of men in there. I always imagined tea parties were for "girly-girls" but Mona totally proved me wrong. We would definitely be back.

excerpts: The best part besides it being Carol's Bridal shower and meeting her other friends is the Scones.
They were really really good, so ladies save room for the scone!
Tea service was nice, the day we went was really really hot and they have no air-conditioning...bummer.
scones.author: K T.
scones.review: The best part besides it being Carol's Bridal shower and meeting her other friends is the Scones. They were really really good, so ladies save room for the scone! Tea service was nice, the day we went was really really hot and they have no air-conditioning...bummer.

excerpts: Lovejoy's is a lovely little tea room that serves some of the best raisin scones with lemon curd I've ever eaten.
scones.author: Courtney S.
scones.review:
High Tea is one of my favorite things.  Usually in the late afternoon, it's an opportunity to nosh in place of a traditional dinner.  When the idea came up to have an outing at Lovejoy's I jumped on it.  I've never been to the establishment before but I am always on the lookout.

Lovejoy's is a lovely little tea room that serves some of the best raisin scones with lemon curd I've ever eaten.  You get to choose from different tea services, I chose the "Queen's Tea," which gives you a choice of two sandwiches, organic green salad, coleslaw, a scone, and crumpet, preserves, Devon cream, lemon curd, and of course, your tea.  I chose the Dragon Well green tea.  

The food was delicious, the tea was perfectly steeped, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was excellent.  I love Lovejoy's and would definitely return.

excerpts: The sandwiches were yummy, but the scones were warm and DELICIOUS!
I'm normally not a fan of scones, but these paired with either their cream or blackberry(?)
jam were divine.
And the little shortbread cookies were the right size for a rich, buttery treat.
Our tea pots were never empty.
Mango and chamomile was our table's favorite.
scones.author: Kimberly S.
scones.review:
What a wonderfully cute place to enjoy high tea for two hours with your favorite ladies =)

My cousin planned a pre-Mother's day get together here for the lady cousins and the aunties/mommies. My mom and I have never done something like afternoon tea before, so I was all for it!
 
There were 8 of us, so we decided to order four "high tea for two." You are allowed to order 4 different sandwiches for each "high tea for two." Luckily none of us were picky about the choices, so we made it simple and just ordered one of every sandwich they offered. Yes, 16 different choices for us ladies to choose from! 

Our waitress was nice enough to point out every crustless sandwich that was on the two 3-tiered trays that came to our table. But with 16 different options and 8 hungry ladies, it was difficult to remember what and where each sandwich flavor was. Everyone just ate off the tray that was within reach. 

I'm not a vegetarian, but I do appreciate the my fruits and veggies. And they have quite the variety of veggie options for sandwiches - artichoke hummus, apple and cheese, and cucumber and cream cheese, just to name a few. Who knew mandarin and cream cheese would taste pretty good?

The sandwiches were yummy, but the scones were warm and DELICIOUS! I'm normally not a fan of scones, but these paired with either their cream or blackberry(?) jam were divine. And the little shortbread cookies were the right size for a rich, buttery treat.  
Our tea pots were never empty. Mango and chamomile was our table's favorite. We also had earl grey and a special one of the day. 

Tea and sandwiches may not make you stuffed, but we walked out of here laughing, smiling, and bellies (and hearts) satisfied =)

My mom had such a good time, she wants to go back for her birthday!

NOTE: they have set seating times for high tea, and they don't fool around. They were kindly letting us know how much time we had left before the next party arrived. So if your lunching with a group, make sure to come on time to get the most of it! Don't forget to give yourself enough time to find parking in this residential area.

excerpts: The other accompaniments - scones, mixed greens and coleslaw were mediocre.
The cream and curd were far from fresh.
The man sitting less than half an arm-length away from me mentioned to his wife and mother in law that these scones were by far better than the scones sold at Starbucks.
scones.author: Ashly d.
scones.review:
My cousin and I, who are very big fans of afternoon tea decided to try Lovejoy one afternoon. We had visited before but were too late, so this time we wanted to make sure we would be able to get seated! 

We waited for over half an hour to get the opportunity to sit in what we felt like was "someones grandma's poorly decorated and somewhat musky, cluttered home". We also had the pleasure of sitting 10 inches away form another party. Yay. 

We had high hopes that all would get better, seeing that their selection of tea had interesting touches and their menu of snacks seemed very tasty.

WRONG. 

The tea was just OK and as much as I do NOT want to be reminded of what I ate there, I will share. My cousin and I ordered "tea for two" w/ a choice of 4 sandwiches. We chose the cucumber, salmon, chicken/asparagus and artichoke hummus sandwiches. After starting to taste our way through the sandwiches we came to a realization. I've made better cucumber sandwiches while drunk, the salmon's texture was very grainy and odd, artichoke hummus was not impressive whatsoever and for Christ's sake the chicken AND asparagus felt and tasted as if it was canned, preserved, aged. The other accompaniments - scones, mixed greens and coleslaw were mediocre. The cream and curd were far from fresh.  The man sitting less than half an arm-length away from me mentioned to his wife and mother in law that these scones were by far better than the scones sold at Starbucks. Enough said.

After barely touching our food we decided we needed to run far far away because we could no longer settle.

excerpts: The scones were flaky and buttery and sooooo good.
YUM!
Even the cream and jam were very good, not too sweet and perfect thickness.
The sandwhiches were perfect size.
In the beginning I thought It would not be enough for all of us but in the end we had left over sandwiches.
The place was crowded as always.
The service was great and always attentive.
Next time I will definitely have the petite fours.
Parking was a pain, we parked 3 blocks away.....
you know those walks... straight up the hill....
at least it burned some of the calorie intake even though it was freezing outside....
scones.author: Emy B.
scones.review:
There were around 9-10 people at our party and we had 3 different kinds of tea.
Sadly I was unable to try the petite fours this time, maybe the next time.
Everything was very good.
The scones were flaky and buttery and sooooo good. YUM!
Even the cream and jam were very good, not too sweet and perfect thickness.
The sandwhiches were perfect size.  In the beginning I thought It would not be enough for all of us but in the end we had left over sandwiches.
 The place was crowded as always.
The service was great and always attentive.
Next time I will definitely have the petite fours.
Parking was a pain, we parked 3 blocks away.....you know those walks... straight up the hill.... :)  at least it burned some of the calorie intake even though it was freezing outside....

excerpts: The food was just okay, except for the scones and the lemon curd.
scones.author: Ang B.
scones.review:
I really, really wanted to like this place more than I did. The food was just okay, except for the scones and the lemon curd. Those were super delish. 

The atmosphere was quaint and eclectic. It just did not live up to the legendary status that I've heard described here on Yelp and in my own friend group. Mildly disappointing for the price. It was nice for a one time experience. Maybe it just wasn't my cup . . . well, you know.

excerpts: The scones are always warm and amazing,all the tea sandwiches are tasty, and the salad is just enough to make you feel less guilty about the milk and sugar you put in your tea.
Only thing I don't care for is the coleslaw - too much fennel?
But make sure you make a reservation if you want to go on a Saturday or Sunday - because they can book up a week or two in advance.
It is so much fun and well worth the money.
scones.author: Jean T.
scones.review: This is my favorite place for afternoon tea in the City.  Not my husband's favorite but I think it's the decor and who can blame him?  It's so whimsical and cozy.  So for a more husband-friendly afternoon tea spot go to Leland Tea Company.  For a good time with girlfriends come here.  I always get the high tea and I order the chestnut tea.  The scones are always warm and amazing,all the tea sandwiches are tasty, and the salad is just enough to make you feel less guilty about the milk and sugar you put in your tea.  Only thing I don't care for is the coleslaw - too much fennel?  But make sure you make a reservation if you want to go on a Saturday or Sunday - because they can book up a week or two in advance.  It is so much fun and well worth the money.

excerpts: (The scones & cream are the exception-
they are really exceptionally DELISH!)
My only real complaint was that one of the waitresses (not ours) was pretty rude when my niece and I were trying on hats to buy-
she snatched them out of our hands as she rushed by and rudely told us to use the ones for guests- before asking us if we were planning on buying them (which we were and did).
Other than than the service was good, our waitress was attentive, and I would definitely go again.
scones.author: Karina N.
scones.review: I've been here a few times, and its got a great atmosphere and is definitely worth going for tea. I took my niece for her birthday recently and the hostess was so incredibly sweet in getting us in last minute on a Saturday with no reservation. She took our name and called back several times in her efforts to accommodate us- which she did! The antique & homey atmosphere is great for parties or showers- although it does get a little loud/rambunctious on weekends when there are often lots of large parties and lots of kids. It was hard to have a conversations with 14 pre-teens singing and talking loudly right next to us- but hey- they were having fun :-). If you want a more quiet experience weekdays are best. The food is good, not anything special but fine. (The scones & cream are the exception- they are really exceptionally DELISH!) My only real complaint was that one of the waitresses (not ours) was pretty rude when my niece and I were trying on hats to buy- she snatched them out of our hands as she rushed by and rudely told us to use the ones for guests- before asking us if we were planning on buying them (which we were and did). Other than than the service was good, our waitress was attentive, and I would definitely go again.

excerpts: Who could say no to an all-girls' bonding session, complete without a steaming pot of English Breakfast with milk and sugar, scones and clotted cream and strawberry jam, and tea sandwiches?
The sandwiches are delicious - we had a selection of salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, chicken apple and walnut salad, tuna, smoked turkey, and cucumber, so are the scones.
Light years better than the Rotunda at Neiman Marcus, sans the ladies with botox and Burberry scarfs, Lovejoy's is a definite gem in the quaint neighborhood of Noe Valley.
Reservation is a must, especially around prime tea time of 3PM and
parking in the area could be tricky
- your best bet is that the Parking God has mercy on you the day you plan on visiting Lovejoy.
scones.author: Ange L.
scones.review:
Who could say no to an all-girls' bonding session, complete without a steaming pot of English Breakfast with milk and sugar, scones and clotted cream and strawberry jam, and tea sandwiches?

Especially in a quintessentially English teahouse such as Lovejoy.  

The tea room is filled with a combination of long benches, straight-backed chairs with cutesy cushions, comfy sofas, and wooden buffet cabinets full of Victorian cups, teapots and whathaveyou.  The patrons of this oh-so-popular place comprise of understandably 99% women, smartly (and sometimes overly) dressed, daintily sipipng on their loose-leaf tea or munching on the perfectly cut triangular-shaped sandwiches.  

The sandwiches are delicious - we had a selection of salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, chicken apple and walnut salad, tuna, smoked turkey, and cucumber, so are the scones.  Light years better than the Rotunda at Neiman Marcus, sans the ladies with botox and Burberry scarfs, Lovejoy's is a definite gem in the quaint neighborhood of Noe Valley.  Reservation is a must, especially around prime tea time of 3PM and parking in the area could be tricky - your best bet is that the Parking God has mercy on you the day you plan on visiting Lovejoy.

excerpts: My favorite part of tea was the scones with devonshire cream.
I'd probably go back and have just that and be content.
scones.author: Benita S.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's is Adorable. It manages to give you the high tea feel without feeling pretentious or overwhelming.  

I went with a group of seven and the staff was very accommodating.  Even taking several photos of us all dolled up in our pretty dresses and hats. But going back to what I love is the fact that you would feel just as comfortable in jeans.

A few tips: give yourself a couple of hours if you are going for high tea with a group. Don't be fooled by portion size, you will get full.  Order different teas so you can share. Enjoy the process and appreciate your company.

My favorite part of tea was the scones with devonshire cream. I'd probably go back and have just that and be content.  Also, if you like the tea services, they are on sale across the street at the Lovejoy's Attic.

Cheers!

excerpts: I love their passion fruit tea and those scrumptous raisin scones slathered in butter and lemon curd!
I'm in my happy place
whenever I'm in there enjoying their bite-size goodies.
Ohh, and how about those petite fours?!
They are delicate sweets of marzapan and chocolate...
mmMm
Oh how I wish I was there again!
scones.author: Roxie T.
scones.review:
I absolutely love LoveJoys! It brings me back to my younger years when my parents would bring my sister and I here for a delicious afternoon brunch of tea and sandwiches!

This place is so quaint and adorable in it's own little way. I love their passion fruit tea and those scrumptous raisin scones slathered in butter and lemon curd! I'm in my happy place whenever I'm in there enjoying their bite-size goodies. Ohh, and how about those petite fours?! They are delicate sweets of marzapan and chocolate...mmMm Oh how I wish I was there again!

excerpts: I've had better scones elsewhere.
