scones.author: Annie Y.
scones.review:
In the last few years, I have nurtured a love for afternoon tea. Something about sitting around a wooden table with a lace tablecloth, or antique-style sofa with a few friends and a nice pot of tea really resonates within me. One would think I feel like a pretentious bourgeois snob, and I am not hypocritical enough to deny it; however, just let it be known that being San Franciscan automatically ingrained a bit of elitism in me. That being said, Lovejoy's Tea Room was not the first time I've taken afternoon tea, and it certainly won't be my last.

We came to Lovejoy's for my friend's birthday and hoped that we did not miss our stop while riding the J-line. The exterior did not impress me, but the moment we stepped inside, it was as if we were transported into another world. In contrast to the brightness and cuteness of Crown & Crumpet, Lovejoy's interior looked antique and mismatched and absolutely lovely. The cups and plates were all unique and pretty. Of the three tea rooms I've been to thus far, the interior design of Lovejoy's is my favorite by far. 

Luckily for us, it was a slow Friday afternoon and we were immediately seated, despite our lack of a reservation. Score! In preparation for documenting my friend's birthday, I brought my camera so I ended up obnoxiously taking pictures of the interior. We made our order, of High Tea for four and the Queen's Tea for the birthday girl.

Food was mediocre. Honestly, the best thing about the food they gave us was the dressing for the salad. I got the smoked salmon with cream cheese, and Lovejoy's special, which was chicken and pesto. Both were unimpressive and was much too creamy. The Devon Cream made me feel as if I were eating butter. I've had better scones elsewhere. The strawberry preserves they gave us was definitely not homemade, and reminded me of smuckers (didn't even spring for Bonne Maman!), and the lemon curd was not tart enough.

But the tea was fantastic! I loved the pomegranate green, and the China Rose Petal tea was a perfect sweetness (this is from someone who does not like herbal teas). Those were my favorites of the five we order. The waitress was also really nice.

Usually, I'd give three stars for mediocre food, but the decorum, service, and company made the entire experience much more enjoyable than the food. This is a fantastic place for just a lovely day out.

Bottom-line: you come here for the setting, the company, and the tea; but not the food.

excerpts: We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones).
scones.author: Melissa B.
scones.review:
I went to Lovejoy's Tea Room on one of my weekly "mommy-daughter" days. My mom and I went to enjoy a morning tea. We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones). I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast. 

The decor was so cute and quaint and the service was extremely friendly and helpful! Most of the good tables were reserved for a special party, but they did have a couple open tables for walk-ins. It was a bit cramped since they try to accommodate so many people, which is why I am only giving four stars, but my mom and I are both pretty small so it didn't bother us too much. I really enjoyed my experience here and seeing as how I love going to tea, this was a great outing for a cheaper price than other tea parlors I have been to. 

Overall great experience and can't wait to go back!

excerpts: For about $35, we each get coleslaw, salad, a choice of two sandwiches, scones, cookies, and our own individual pots of bottomless tea.
The pear and stilton sandwich is my favorite, but if you eat anything make sure you try the scones!
scones.author: Renee M.
scones.review:
*Sigh* My cozy, eclectic hideaway.

Layered doily tablecloths, mismatched utensils, and antique photographs occupy every nook and cranny of this English-style teahouse.  It is the perfect introduction to an afternoon abundant with delicious food, comforting tea, and good conversation.  

My boyfriend and I tend to go for the High Tea for Two.  For about $35, we each get coleslaw, salad, a choice of two sandwiches, scones, cookies, and our own individual pots of bottomless tea.  The pear and stilton sandwich is my favorite, but if you eat anything make sure you try the scones!  

My boyfriend, who is more of the coffee type, enjoys the Yorkshire Gold tea.  I have tried both the pumpkin spice and cha cha cha teas and like them as well.  

We have had the same server on both of our visits.  She has been very good about explaining the menu layout and recommending items.  Our teapots always stay hot and full.  Service is attentive without being invasive.  

Lovejoy's is the perfect place to enjoy some simple food over a nice pot of tea and good company.  I look forward to trying out more teas in the visits to come!

excerpts: Believe everyone about the scones!
scones.author: Francesca G.
scones.review:
Think Alice in Wonderland's or Mary Poppin's tea.  This is a perfect spot for a fun event.  One of us was turning 60, another was turning 65, but the place was full of younger folk, too, evidently celebrating, perhaps engagements.  Lots of eye candy decorates the room - china and linens.

Reservations were no problem (and necessary).  Oddly enough, parking was not a problem.  Once you are there, settle in for a good long time. The staff was wonderful, attentive, accomodating and informative!

The five of us had the Queen's Tea - a feast.  Be sure to tell the staff if there is a birthday in the group so they can put a candle in the petit four (too bad I am not one for almond paste).  I suggest that each guest order a different sandwich filling and then share around the table.  Same with the tea, get different ones and share, being sure to ask for hot water refills.  

Believe everyone about the scones!  I couldn't resist Devonshire cream AND lemon curd on them PLUS buttering the crumpet (It WAS my birthday.)  Perhaps we should have brought a bottle of bubbly with us - corkage is reasonable.  On the other hand, we were stuffed and loggy with tea.  Tea can be quite stimulating - the room rings with conversation.

Sometime that's more fun than a bar crawl, ladies.  BTDTBTT.

excerpts: The scones went well with the different preserves and lemon curd.
scones.author: Caroline S.
scones.review:
I love doing girly things with my girlfriends and this was quite a treat for my bday! 

I've been to Lisa's Tea Treasures in Campbell and enjoyed the atmosphere there. Outside of work, I don't go to SF much, so it's great to find an unique place worth driving out to.  Parking may be a bit of a pain though, unless you are get lucky on one of the side streets with no meters. 

I sure felt like royalty here with the 'Reserved for Royalty' sign and our attentive wait staff. Everyone ordered the Queen's Tea special, which was more than enough food to feast on. I loved all the sandwiches, especially the curry sandwich special they served that day. The scones went well with the different preserves and lemon curd. The petite four bites were a bit too sweet for my taste, it looked too good to eat. 

Great atmosphere, delicious high tea treats, and wonderful company! 

I will be back for another special occasion.  Be sure to make reservations, this place is always packed!

excerpts: The warm scones were delicious and the dressing for the salad was lovely.
Not the hugest fan of the coleslaw, probably because of mint?
in it.
I don't know.
scones.author: Deanna L.
scones.review:
Kind of new to the whole tea thing, I wasn't sure what to expect. I was super excited though, and definitely not disappointed. It definitely has a cozy feel to it, so I wouldn't imagine it would be able to accommodate huge groups. I think the mismatched furniture and silverware adds a nice touch to the atmosphere. 

The sandwiches were really good! We had the high tea for two and were rather full by the end. We got the cucumber sandwich, roast beef with horseradish, salmon with cream cheese and stilton and pear (love!). The warm scones were delicious and the dressing for the salad was lovely. Not the hugest fan of the coleslaw, probably because of mint? in it. I don't know. And having just come from Crown and Crumpet, I can say that I prefer Lovejoys because of the sandwich selections.

excerpts: This includes, salad, cole slaw, 2 sandwhiches of our choice (each, so 4 in all), 2 scones, sugar cookies, and 2 bottomless pots of tea.
My fave combo is bay shrimp and mayo, and either chicken and asparagus or egg and onion with passion fruit tea.
And seriously, the "devonshire cream," aka butter from the Gods is so good on top of a warm scone
I'm thinking about stealing it next time.
Mind u
scones.author: Tor E.
scones.review:
My girl Ness first introduced me to this spot on 16th and Church in the city, and I've have tried to make it a monthly routine ever since. I know, I know. I used to be just like you. Laughing in a bad English accent, "Tea and crumpets with the Queen?" Pshhh. And we all know "cucumber sandwhiches wtih the sides cut off," are frowned upon by heffers far and wide. But let me tell you, this ain't your grandmother's tea party.

The place is a cozy, yet eclectic corner tea house. Complete with mix matched China, vintage wall hangings, and crochet doilies. The waitresses are all very pleasant and very knowledgeable of the teas, food, and what goes good with what. And while it's a rather noisy establishment, cell phones are not allowed so please take ur loud ass outside when ur T-Pain ringtone goes off.

OK, now for the food. OMG. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. While it's no House of Prime Rib, I can honestly say that I've NEVER left this place still hungry - and I CAN GRUB. Me and Ness usually get "High Tea for Two," and I usually end up finishing whatever she leaves behind. This includes, salad, cole slaw, 2 sandwhiches of our choice (each, so 4 in all), 2 scones, sugar cookies, and 2 bottomless pots of tea. My fave combo is bay shrimp and mayo, and either chicken and asparagus or egg and onion with passion fruit tea. And seriously, the "devonshire cream," aka butter from the Gods is so good on top of a warm scone I'm thinking about stealing it next time. Mind u, they also have savory side dishes like sausage rolls, shepards pie, quiches, and puff pastries filled with things like curried chicken.

Lovejoy's Tea Room is the quintessential spot for a bridal/baby shower but any day (especially sunny, warm Sundays!) is a good day for tea!

excerpts: Their sandwiches and scones are delicious!
I love the English double devon cream.
Lovejoy's provides a couple of hours where you can immerse in a world where you can just catch up with some girlfriends and unwind.
Oh yea, pretty easy to find parking on weekdays
but there is a 2 hour limit and the meter maids are always around!
Can't wait for my next tea time!
scones.author: Chrisy C.
scones.review: Having tried a couple of tea rooms in the city, I'd say this is by far my favorite!  The decor is so quaint and delightful!  Makes me wanna speak British for a while! Definitely recommend reservations unless it's a week day. Their sandwiches and scones are delicious!  I love the English double devon cream.  Lovejoy's provides a couple of hours where you can immerse in a world where you can just catch up with some girlfriends and unwind.  Oh yea, pretty easy to find parking on weekdays but there is a 2 hour limit and the meter maids are always around!  Can't wait for my next tea time!

excerpts: And omg, their scones!
I never liked them until I tasted Lovejoys' scones.
scones.author: Kanani N.
scones.review:
LOVE.THIS.PLACE!  Everything about it!  From decor to their food!  I've been here twice.  My absolute favorite is the High Tea for Two in which you can add an additional person for $17.99!  Since you can pick 4 different kinds of sandwiches, (6 if you add an additional person) my grandma, mom and I got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roastbeef, bay shrimp and mayonnaise, cream cheese and green apple, chicken apple walnut salad and smoked turkey and dijon mustard!  My ultimate favorite was the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.

You can pick 2 kinds of tea (3 teas for three people).  We ordered the Vanilla Roobios, China Rose Petal and Passion Fruit which was by far my favorite.  I must say that they're NOT greedy with their tea.  It comes in a big teapot and the waiters are constantly refilling it.  All you can drink tea!  

And omg, their scones!  I never liked them until I tasted Lovejoys' scones.  It comes with the High Tea for Two by the way.  It's warm and soft with raisins mixed in.  Once you spread the preserves and double devon cream, omg...it's ON!!  So delicious!  

The decor is super cute especially the utensils, teacups, teapots and plates.  As if you were at your grandmother's house.  So girly.  However, it can get a bit squishy when you try to get to your table.  Be careful when you walk between tables.  You might break something!  

The waiters are very nice.  I also love how they come to your table and offer you little dessert pastries.  It's not free but it's quite delicious.

Safe area but parking might be hard to find.

excerpts: Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.
Yes, I had my pinky up a few times.
Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.
The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.
The sandwiches were good but not anything special.
I enjoyed the tea.
scones.author: Aaron G.
scones.review:
I've been dying to have a tea party since Jennifer C. told me about her experience in Seattle.  Does this make me an old English lady?  Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.  Yes, I had my pinky up a few times. Is there any other way to drink english tea?

The interior is quite antiquated.  I was waiting for the smell of mothballs to invade my nostrils, but it never did.  There are little knick knacks everywhere.  Antique galore might be a better phrase to describe this place.  I almost felt like i was invading an old lady's hang out spot.  

Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.  The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.  The sandwiches were good but not anything special.  I enjoyed the tea.  We had the Tea Room Blend (black tea) and the Passion Fruit Black Tea.  

Other than that, everything was good.  I didn't find this place super special or super awesome.  It was my first high tea experience and i'm going to continue finding places to have my tea.  However, I now feel a lot more sophisticated now that I've done this.  I am a proper gentleman now.  My next goal is to be knighted.  Sir Aaron Gong has a nice ring to it doesn't it?

excerpts: Their tea on its own without milk or sugar is excellent and their scones are to die for!
The staff was very accommodating even gave my friend's 2 yr old her own cup and saucer.
Will definitely go back to try their tea sandwiches!
scones.author: Janis P.
scones.review: I believe their kitchen closes in the late afternoon because when we went there late afternoon on a weekend, the staff told us that the kitchen was already closed and that we can only order tea and the baked goods on display. Their tea on its own without milk or sugar is excellent and their scones are to die for!  The staff was very accommodating even gave my friend's 2 yr old her own cup and saucer. Will definitely go back to try their tea sandwiches!

excerpts: We end up sharing all the small sammies, sip our flavors teas, had scones with the lemon curd and devon cream.
YUM!
Plus fruit and a petite four.
My goodness did we eat.
scones.author: Donna Y.
scones.review:
I want to say a BIG HAPPY BDAY TO COCO!! What a great reason to write my 500th review. 

Perfect place to have afternoon tea and for any celebration. We came on Saturday to have Tea with Caroline for her Bday. I suggest you call to make a reservation since they place books up fast. We all end up ordering the Queen's Tea. We end up sharing all the small sammies, sip our flavors teas, had scones with the lemon curd and devon cream. YUM! Plus fruit and a petite four. My goodness did we eat. Don't forget the crumpets too. Plus love how all of the food came out and all so cute and decorative. 

The place is deck out in cuteness and girly items. Having tea with friends and catching up is the best. Plus it gave me a sense of times that was slower and simpler. Which was nice. 

Had a wonderful time and so love to do it again.

excerpts: Scones were also good.
Tea sandwiches - we chose pear/stilton, chicken-apple-walnut and salmon mousse.
I think the last one was the daily special, but I forget what it was.
scones.author: Clarissa L.
scones.review:
This is a really cute place :) Two of my friends and I came here and got seated in the corner. The sign said "Reserved for the queens" or something to that effect. Anyway, we ordered crumpets (to try, not knowing what they were.) They came with very yummy lemon curd. I don't think I cared for the crumpets themselves that much.

Ooh, and vanilla rooibos tea... mmm. Sooo good!
Scones were also good.
Tea sandwiches - we chose pear/stilton, chicken-apple-walnut and salmon mousse. I think the last one was the daily special, but I forget what it was. All were pretty good!

Three of us shared a tea for two and we were quite full by the end of the meal... Was kinda surprising. Anyway this is a really cute place with good food :)

excerpts: awesome scones, tea, and sandwiches.
we've been coming here for 6 or 7 years.
best afternoon tea place in SF - scones are warm and moist, sandwiches are tasty.
scones.author: Yin L.
scones.review:
awesome scones, tea, and sandwiches.  we've been coming here for 6 or 7 years.  best afternoon tea place in SF - scones are warm and moist, sandwiches are tasty.  get the egg and onion and the bay shrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches.

the salad that comes with the teas is not interesting and not necessary.  i think they should just skip that.

excerpts: The four of us shared the quiche,  hight tea for two, and another order of scones.
The quiche was okay;  savory and a little fever with egg  cheese and potatoes.
The scones were sublime and as large as hamburger buns; this is the best feature.
The sandwiches were too tiny and nothing special as the turkey and ham meats are
the sky deli meats you get from a grocery store.
I kid you not: the sandwiches are the size of two McDonald's chicken nuggets.
The white peach tea was very tasty.
The black vanilla lavender is actually very pleasant too and was soothing and not at all perfume.
scones.author: Lorenzo V.
scones.review: My family and I had a pleasant dining experience,  but the food was mediocre. Service was friendly and the ambience was home like.  The four of us shared the quiche,  hight tea for two, and another order of scones.  The quiche was okay;  savory and a little fever with egg  cheese and potatoes.  Each high tea cubes with a scone, two sandwiches,  salad, coleslaw,  and a tea biscuit.  The scones were sublime and as large as hamburger buns; this is the best feature.  The sandwiches were too tiny and nothing special as the turkey and ham meats are the sky deli meats you get from a grocery store.  I kid you not: the sandwiches are the size of two McDonald's chicken nuggets. The white peach tea was very tasty.  The black vanilla lavender is actually very pleasant too and was soothing and not at all perfume.

excerpts: The scones were even warm!
The jam even tasted like it was home-made!
It went great with the tea.
The only thing they where missing there, was my Grandma!
ha ha!
They were busy, but we never felt rushed.
The little old lady that waited on us really was sweet.
scones.author: C J.
scones.review:
Let me first start by saying this is not the type of place I would usually go to, but it was good!   My girlfriend was given a gift certificate to this place, so we thought we would have a Sunday brunch there.  We had "High Tea" the bite sized smoked salmon sandwiches were great!  We also had apple-cranberry-nut sandwiches, and they where great!  Service was good, food was good, and prices are good.  The scones were even warm! The jam even tasted like it was home-made!  It went great with the tea.  The only thing they where missing there, was my Grandma! ha ha!  They were busy, but we never felt rushed.  The little old lady that waited on us really was sweet.  We're glad we stopped by!

It really has the charm of my Grandma's old home back in the Mid-West.  

Well done...

Perfect place to take Mom, Grandma, or the girlfriend!

excerpts: Very tasty sandwiches, rich cookies and crumpets, ridiculously good scones, to die for lemon curd, and super sweet fruit.
Great tea selection and quality.
Ambiance is cute and cozy.
Take a friend or family member at least once.
It makes for a memorable experience.
scones.author: Janet J.
scones.review: Best blueberry scone I have ever had in my life, and I have lived in many cities. Crispy and buttery with perfectly cooked blueberries. High tea is served here. I had Queen's tea. It's more than enough food and variety. Very tasty sandwiches, rich cookies and crumpets, ridiculously good scones, to die for lemon curd, and super sweet fruit. Great tea selection and quality. Ambiance is cute and cozy. Take a friend or family member at least once. It makes for a memorable experience.

excerpts: we ordered a bunch of stuff and snacked on tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours, salad, and fresh fruit.
The food here isn't anything super amazing
but it is nice to snack on.
Tea was good as well.
scones.author: Miss H K.
scones.review:
Food: I love this place! We had a going away "tea party" for my best friend. we ordered a bunch of stuff and snacked on tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours, salad, and fresh fruit. The food here isn't anything super amazing but it is nice to snack on. Tea was good as well. This is a fun place to come with your girlfriends!

Price: Pretty expensive. At least $20 or so a person.

Service: Friendly

Atmosphere: Loved the atmosphere in here. Decorations are almost all antique and you feel like your in grandma's house!

Location: Located on Church. You can take the J here.

excerpts: The scones were flaky and flavorful, served with Double Devon cream and preserves...just as they should be.
The hot chocolate for my girls came out in an adorable little pitcher with whipped cream on the side in a smaller pitcher.
scones.author: Virg Y.
scones.review:
Tea rooms range from the opulent such as those at the grand hotels or understated and cuddly, like Lovejoy's. Might I also add that there's a rather large price difference; hotel high tea could set you back about $40+ per person, but at Lovejoy's, the most indulgent tea service is a mere $24.95. 

This small tea room is oh so darling, with it's haphazard decor of mismatched tablecloths and grandma's attic tea implements. The service is warm and friendly, with a wonderfully varied menu of good quality teas and yummy sandwiches. The scones were flaky and flavorful, served with Double Devon cream and preserves...just as they should be. The hot chocolate for my girls came out in an adorable little pitcher with whipped cream on the side in a smaller pitcher. And the petit fours were in the shape of hats.

Cute, Quaint and utterly Fabulous...especially for a girls' afternoon, discussing the finer points of gymnastics camp and soothing the jitters of a newly hatched Kindergartener.

excerpts: The "scones" seem to be right out of the box and are in fact biscuit mix not actual scones.
The sandwiches are pretty tasteless.
My most recent tea place was in the Outer Sunset where they make their own loaves, the quality of the food was top notch and they actually made "scones" from scratches.
Lovejoy is solely relying on their reputation from loyal customers but the quality lacks behind what they serve.
Not worth the price at all.
scones.author: Flo A.
scones.review:
The place itself is ok. The tea sets are really cute and the tea was good. 

However, I've been to many tea places and this one rates very low in my book. The  quality of the food is mediocre. The "scones" seem to be right out of the box and are in fact biscuit mix not actual scones. The sandwiches are pretty tasteless. My most recent tea place was in the Outer Sunset where they make their own loaves, the quality of the food was top notch and they actually made "scones" from scratches. Lovejoy is solely relying on their reputation from loyal customers but the quality lacks behind what they serve. Not worth the price at all.

excerpts: And the scones, the scones were just so yummy.
They were not dry like many scones you taste, but warm (even after they had been sitting on our table for a while) and much more moist than many others.
Plus the strawberry jam made the scone even better!
scones.author: Cara D.
scones.review:
This is probably one of the most eclectic places I have been to! With its mismatched everything and most adorable decorations, Lovejoy's is a perfect place for any occasion, even if its just a lunch on a regular Saturday.

I was treated to a Queens tea here and boy did I feel like a Queen.  Two sandwiches for each person, meaning I got to try 4!  The special of the turkey and cranberry was so delicious and my favorite out of all the ones I tried.  And the scones, the scones were just so yummy.  They were not dry like many scones you taste, but warm (even after they had been sitting on our table for a while) and much more moist than many others.  Plus the strawberry jam made the scone even better!  The crumpets were also quite tasty but the lemon curd really made the crumpet amazing.  Finally the petite fours (or however you spell them) just topped it off!

The whole experience was delightful.  The staff was more than helpful, nice and I just really enjoyed the whole experience!

excerpts: The Earl Grey was the best I've ever had, the food (salad and scones) was 5 star deelish.
The servers enjoy working here and sharing this unique spot, you can tell.
It feels like you've entered a sanctuary.
Parking is easy.
Make a reservation, it is worth the planning!
scones.author: Aquableu C.
scones.review:
I've been meaning to go here for years and today was the day. Why did I wait so long? This is a wonderful experience. The Earl Grey was the best I've ever had, the food (salad and scones) was 5 star deelish. The servers enjoy working here and sharing this unique spot, you can tell. 
It feels like you've entered a sanctuary. Parking is easy. 
Make a reservation, it is worth the planning!

excerpts: The scones with devonshire cream are absolutely perfect with any of their tea selections.
scones.author: L M.
scones.review:
The best place for afternoon tea. I've been here more times than I can count and every time I've had great service, great snacks and bottomless pots of tea. The scones with devonshire cream are absolutely perfect with any of their tea selections. I love their decor, the mismatched china, cuckoo clocks and random frames on the wall make this place feel like a grandmother's place- very cozy. 

I've been to other tea houses in the area and always end up back of Lovejoy's after being disappointed elsewhere. This place is very popular, make a reservation. They will make every effort to seat you without one but expect to wait.

excerpts: The sandwiches are good and so are the scones.
scones.author: Lisa T.
scones.review:
Excellent!

This place is really cute and reasonable price for being a tea room. The sandwiches are good and so are the scones. The crumpets were just alright. Flavored black teas were good (Passion Fruit) and the flavored green tea-- not so much. The petit fours looked really cute. Service was also excellent. Also had good hot chocolate. Cute bathroom too!

excerpts: The scones are amazing.
Warm and soft, combined with the clotted cream and strawberry jam... mmm...
Surprisingly easy to break up into pieces so you shouldn't eat an entire one by yourself or you'll have no room for other food.
scones.author: Lydia W.
scones.review:
I came here with five of my friends to celebrate my birthday, and it was perfect!  Everything I imagined it to be.  The place is decked out in girly-ness.  It's weird when you see a man inside because there are so few.  It's a lot smaller and cozier than I thought it would be, but if you are with your best friends then it allows for a more intimate tea party!  

We opted against ordering a tea sets since there were so many of us, and just ordered a bottomless pot of Earl Grey ($8) with each additional person being $1 more.  Then we ordered a lot of food a la carte.  There is a 9.95 minimum per person so we were forced to order more food than we could actually finish, believe it or not.  We came here starving and left incredibly sated.

The scones are amazing.  Warm and soft, combined with the clotted cream and strawberry jam... mmm... Surprisingly easy to break up into pieces so you shouldn't eat an entire one by yourself or you'll have no room for other food.  I was really heartbroken to see jars and jars of Smuckers jam in their storage pantry while waiting in line for the bathroom.  

The crumpets are so-so, save for the lemon curd.  

Ordered a large plate of sandwiches, which allowed us to get 3 sandwiches, quartered.  We ordered 1. bay shrimp and mayo, 2. salmon mousse, 3. pear and stilton.  I only tried the last two, but they were both yummy.  The pear and stilton was very unique, as was the salmon mousse.  Sandwiches are served on a bed of greens, cool.  Also came with coleslaw which was surprisingly good.

We got a chicken curry pasti (pronounced the A as in PASTA not PASTE) which was AMAZING!  Didn't even need the dipping sauce.  The shell was flaky and hot, the inside was flavorful and fragrant.  So great.  

To get to our 9.95 minimum we ordered the Beef Pasti which was definitely not as good as the chicken one.  

We also got an order of the sausage rolls, which are ridiculously hard to cut in halves.  Interesting taste, but would not recommend it.  

Since it was my birthday I got a petite four that was banana-flavored.  It was really cute and thoughtful but less tasty.  They come around with a platter of petite fours for $2.50 each.  We thought they were just giving us all petite fours for free -_- 

All in all, Lovejoy's was everything I wanted it to be.  I had been wanting to come for years and am extremely satisfied with my experience there!

excerpts: Besides two sandwiches and two bottomless pots of tea, you get two big scones, two cookies, greens and coleslaw for $34.95.
scones.author: M G.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's is usually booked the week between Xmas and New Year's. This year is no different. Hoping to score a table, I signed up for the waiting list and was happy when they called me back with an opening.

High Tea for Two was the perfect cozy way to end the year.  Besides two sandwiches and two bottomless pots of tea, you get two big scones, two cookies, greens and coleslaw for $34.95. My friend and I always end up packing the cookies home - it's a lot of food!

The sandwiches are always tasty.  I had the smoked salmon/cream cheese and chicken-apple-walnut while my friend ordered the cucumber/cream cheese and one other I can't remember.  

Service was exceptional.  Our pots of tea were constantly kept full and hot.   Our gabbing easily had us occupying the table for 2 hours.  When the next reservation was due to arrive, the wait staff gently let us know they needed the table.

The ambiance is cozy and warm, but not stuffy.  I love the little sayings posted throughout the shop. This has become my go-to place for tea with friends. We've tried other tea houses, but they just doesn't compare to Lovejoy's. So, now, if Lovejoy's is closed, we usually just end up waiting until they're open again rather than go elsewhere.

excerpts: The scones were round, soft, and warm, the real deal.
The double Devonshire cream was excellent, the lemon curd fresh, and the strawberry jam not too sweet.
scones.author: Alissa S.
scones.review:
Queen for a Day, what more do you need?

The planets aligned and five of us had two free hours to catch up on the same day at the same time, so I booked a reservation for tea. From the moment we arrived, we had so much fun! We had two waitresses , the table said, "reserved for queens", they explained the teas like they were wines, and the food was excellent. The scones were round, soft, and warm, the real deal. The double Devonshire cream was excellent, the lemon curd fresh, and the strawberry jam not too sweet. My Queen's tea came with all of the above, my own pot of tea, four sandwiches (I had roast beef and chicken salad, yum) and a salad and coleslaw and cookies and a petit four and crumpets. There was plenty of food, we boxed up some to go! Then we strolled around the neighborhood to walk off some crumpet. It was a lovely time and I highly recommend it.

excerpts: The scones were AMAZING.
scones.author: Zoe S.
scones.review: Went here with my mom and sister on a Friday. It was a little busy, but we made a reso, so there were no probs getting a table. We all got the Queen's Tea. Salmon&cream cheese, apple&cream cheese, apple walnut chix salad, prosciutto&gouda cheese - sandwiches were great! The scones were AMAZING. It also came with crumpets, fruit, salad, coleslaw, a petit four, and tea. Really a good deal, and fun experience.

excerpts: This place has the best scones I have ever had.
Hot fluffy raisin scones covered in strawberry preserves, devonshire cream, and lemon curd.
O-M-G is probably the only way to put it.
scones.author: Katherine P.
scones.review:
This place has the best scones I have ever had. Hot fluffy raisin scones covered in strawberry preserves, devonshire cream, and lemon curd. O-M-G is probably the only way to put it. I finished mine before my teamates had gotten through half of theirs.

And the crumpets - yum! 

I love the selection of teas, and the bottomless pots.

I wasn't as happy with the sandwiches (I had the apple/cream cheese, and the special of the day which was curry chicken) but I think in general I'm not a fan of sandwiches with a lot of creamy anything so that's probably my fault.

The Queen's tea is the way to go if you want the ultimate experience but it's really a lot of food and you probably won't be able to finish!

excerpts: the jam and butter are the best with the scones.
the other turn down is that you only get one petite four at the end all this for $30 per person.
I'm sorry but tea and sandwiches are just not worth that price
scones.author: Kay T.
scones.review: It is okay.  It was a turn down since the china was chipped and they don't match - even from tea cup to saucer.  the tea pot had a different lid since the other one was broken.  the food is good, just the roast beef sandwich was dry.  the egg sandwich and the shrimp is good.  the jam and butter are the best with the scones.  the other turn down is that you only get one petite four at the end all this for $30 per person.  I'm sorry but tea and sandwiches are just not worth that price

excerpts: Aromatic teas, buttery crumpets, and delicious scones... if that isn't enough to tempt you then perhaps the warm atmosphere and friendly service will be.
This is one of the BEST places to have teas in the city, and it's pretty obvious.
In my experience you must have a reservation.
scones.author: Anna K.
scones.review:
Aromatic teas, buttery crumpets, and delicious scones... if that isn't enough to tempt you then perhaps the warm atmosphere and friendly service will be.  This is one of the BEST places to have teas in the city, and it's pretty obvious.  In my experience you must have a reservation.  Otherwise please expect a long wait.  

There's no parking in the area unless you have a smart car or are willing to circle a 4 mile radius for hours.  However, I must say it's worth it.  I have other favorites, but I will coming back to this Noe Valley gem.

excerpts: However, my god, the scones with double Devon cream were divine!
I was slathering the cream on my scone like a Chinese mom outdoors with sunblock.
Every time I walk by now, I yearn for those scones.
scones.author: Yan E.
scones.review:
Being Chinese,  "drinking tea" means hot food, hot tea, and cheap prices to me, or at least in my backwoods dialect of Chinese. So Lovejoy's tea was a different experience for me: major sticker shock. Popular place.   There was a large crowd waiting at 10:30, despite the fact Lovejoy's opens at 11a. The six of us had reservations at 11am on Saturday.

I shared a High Tea for two with A. We got English breakfast tea and the following sandwiches:

Chicken-Apple Walnut Salad
Artichoke Hummus
Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese-A's Jewish, so of course he picked it 
Chutney and Cheese-stupid pick on my part bc someone raved about it here. If you don't know what chutney is (like I said, I was stupid), don't get it. 

Tea, sandwiches, shortbread cookies, and salad were all ok, nothing spectacular. It didn't feel very filling either.  I thought it highly overpriced for some tea and crust-less sandwiches. However, my god, the scones with double Devon cream were divine! I was slathering the cream on my scone like a Chinese mom outdoors with sunblock. Every time I walk by now, I yearn for those scones.

Decor: eclectic collection of ornate seats, tables, chairs. Mismatched charm. I loved the different tea sets, cups, creamers etc. Service: great. Everyone was seated quickly. Your pot is refilled quickly no matter how little you've poured out.

As I'm breaking down the price in my head right now, I guess it's not that bad for everything you get. The food is mostly mediocre for what you pay, but the service, decor and ambiance makes for a nice one time experience.

excerpts: so flavorful and refreshing, two scones, two different sandwiches for each person, and a cookie each.
The food was just okay.
Although their finger sandwiches are not bad and have a big selection to what meats you want in it.
Unfortunately, I was too stuffed to try their desserts, they look quite delicious!
The price was about $24-28 each person with tax & tips.
scones.author: Ann L.
scones.review:
Can you say HIGH TEA? On a lovely sunny day, I went with my home girl to this tiny tea room.  The set up is so cramped that I barely had any room to get into my seat.  Let alone the servers go by.  We had the tea for two, which came in your choice of two pots of tea (try the passion fruit tea) so flavorful and refreshing, two scones, two different sandwiches for each person, and a cookie each.  The food was just okay.  Although their finger sandwiches are not bad and have a big selection to what meats you want in it.  Unfortunately, I was too stuffed to try their desserts, they look quite delicious! The price was about $24-28 each person with tax & tips.  I can not recall the exact amount but it was a bit pricey for high tea that did not have tea treats that stood out.  However, for the experience it was not bad.  I wished they had more than one bathroom for its customers, the wait can be pretty long if there's a line.  

P.S. parking is a F*king b*itch here... =/

excerpts: The food here is cute - finger sandwiches piled high on a silver platter along with some scones and salad.
scones.author: Genevieve W.
scones.review:
Ok. Maybe it's because I'm not girly, but I really don't understand the appeal of tea houses. I feel like I could grab a ton of my grandma's old stuff, throw it in a room and paint it pink and then ta-da! - I'd end up with Lovejoy's decor.

The food here is cute - finger sandwiches piled high on a silver platter along with some scones and salad. They were tasty, but nothing that I couldn't make myself.

I did enjoy their tea selection, though - try the rose!

excerpts: It was $35 per person and included limitless pots of our choices of teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and petit fours!
Also a small gift for each of us.
A very special day!
scones.author: Jocelyn B.
scones.review: Had a WONDERFUL time for the Mother's Day Afternoon Tea. It has a shabby chic feel, (no stuffiness here) and even the 3 men in our party didn't feel out of place. It was $35 per person and included limitless pots of our choices of teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and petit fours! Also a small gift for each of us. A very special day!

excerpts: I should have gotten the Cream Tea, because my friend's scones were pretty filling and tasty, and I actually ended up wanting fruit after having my tea.
scones.author: Angeline P.
scones.review:
I came here hoping for a great experience, and for the most part, it wasn't a horrible experience until I got up to go to the bathroom, but more on that later.

My friend from Korea was visiting, so I thought this place would be a cute little place to catch up and snack after her flight landed. I made a reservation, and as soon as she landed, we took the J-church down here without incident, and the place was pretty easy to find.

They reserved us a seat on the couch, which was a cute place to sit (albeit a little bad for sitting up straight to eat), so that was nice of them. The menu is a little overwhelming with a bajillion choices, but I ended up ordering the Savory Tea, which included bottomless tea (I picked Vanilla Rooibos) and two sandwiches (I picked shrimp and mayo and smoked turkey and dijon mustard). My friend got the Cream Tea with Apricot Tea. 

Don't get me wrong, the sandwiches were tasty. I just didn't get very many of them, which, admittedly, is the point of tea. I should have gotten the Cream Tea, because my friend's scones were pretty filling and tasty, and I actually ended up wanting fruit after having my tea. So it was a case of ordering the wrong thing, which isn't necessarily something I would penalize Lovejoy's for. 

After getting pretty full off tea, I needed a bathroom break. So I walked into the back, and caught a glimpse of the kitchen where I saw a loaf of bread sitting on the counter. And that was when everything was shattered. It wasn't like, nice white bread. It was Safeway white bread. The kind you can pick up at any Safeway for about $2 a loaf. And then when I thought about it, it wasn't worth it. The sandwiches were good, but they weren't $15 for 8 small triangles good (including unlimited tea). I could have gone to Safeway and made my own delicious shrimp/mayo, turkey/mustard sandwiches. And the ambiance was good, but I couldn't shake the feeling of being made very well aware that I was out of place, that I didn't belong here. The servers were nice enough, but I felt like unless you were pretty acquainted with ordering tea, you would feel kind of uncomfortable ordering and asking questions.

And after that, nothing was the same. It's like that loaf of Safeway white bread broke the illusion, and I was able to see this place for what it was. And I wasn't that impressed, and will probably never come back unless I have a friend who is REALLY into tea. Otherwise, it's just too far and too awkward for me to venture out here.

excerpts: their homemade scones are to die for.
I had to take some home.
all the tea sandwiches tasted fresh and were marvulous.
Reservations needed as it is a small place, but oh so charming.
After cross the street on Church and visit their shop.
I was amazed and the variety of selection for teas and tea sandwiches.
scones.author: Ann H.
scones.review: A great expierience. Three of us went for the the first time and our expectatins were met.  a charming place to meet with friends for great tea and food.  their homemade scones are to die for.  I had to take some home.  all the tea sandwiches tasted fresh and were marvulous.  Reservations needed as it is a small place, but oh so charming. After cross the street on Church and visit their shop.  I was amazed and the variety of selection for teas and tea sandwiches.

excerpts: The scones were bliss-inducing, wonderfully warm pillows of fluff.
Not the flaky bricks one usually encounters, these were described as "Irish style," if that means anything to you.
The sandwiches were wonderfully fancy versions of the dainty crustless numbers moms make for their daughters.
Pear and stilton, salmon and capers, chicken salad, shrimp.
scones.author: Michael W.
scones.review:
Straight out of a six-year-old girl's tea party fantasy. Lovejoy's is like having tea with your kooky Great Aunt Beatrice. Mismatched floral cups and pots, three-tiered serving trays, and lace. Lots of lace. I went with my mom and sister for my sister's twentieth birthday. We walked in, passed a group of six-year-old girls celebrating a birthday, and got to our seats. The only men in the joint were beaming fathers of six-year-olds, grandfathers, and defeated looking boyfriends and brothers. There was a lot of estrogen.

Our waitress was very sweet, gave suggestions, described teas. We settled on "high tea," all the tea you can drink for $17 per person, plus two sandwiches, a scone, a cookie, some salad and a bit of cole slaw per person. I did not want to like this place. But when the tea arrived, it was perfect. The Irish Breakfast was strong and piping hot, deep and refreshing. The green was herbaceous and nourishing, and the apricot tea was...apricotty?

The scones were bliss-inducing, wonderfully warm pillows of fluff. Not the flaky bricks one usually encounters, these were described as "Irish style," if that means anything to you. The sandwiches were wonderfully fancy versions of the dainty crustless numbers moms make for their daughters. Pear and stilton, salmon and capers, chicken salad, shrimp. Delicate, airy little tastes.

But what really makes this place fun is the service. Tables are labeled "reserved for royalty" or "reserved for the queen," and the waitresses treat you as such, really doing their best to make your experience enjoyable.

I think I may come back for the impressive selection of pub food on the menu!

Oh, and it is easily walkable from 24th st BART!

excerpts: I loved the sandwich selection and the scones were yummy -- especially the toppings.
scones.author: Skip Y.
scones.review:
For 20 years I have wanted to go to Lovejoys.  Have had tea at the Palace, the Ritz and two places in the Avenues.  All were fun but this was the best.  The staff are really nice.  I loved the sandwich selection and the scones were yummy -- especially the toppings.  Unlike any other tea, they also gave you both a homemade coleslaw and some salad with dressing.  

The staff was sooooooooo wonderful.  I came with another man and the staff called us cute!!! Not bad for someone way over 50.  But then we were the only men in the room.

With mismatched cups and saucers and odd chairs, it was just a perfect visit.
My partner's opening words were -- "I am happy.  My life is good."

It took almost 20 years
to get to 
love
joy 
with 
love
joy.

excerpts: Scones...
wow...
I hate scones.
Dry dusty crumbly cotton mouth-inducing pastries.
No!  Not here!
Fresh and moist like a biscuit... and all served with the most exquisites of jams and Double Devon Cream.
I have nooo clue
scones.author: Chris T.
scones.review:
AAAAAH!  This place is too cute!

Bring anyone with ovaries here, no matter what age!  What a thrill to have so many of my interests all in one place.  Antiques.  Sammiches.  Tea.  Kitsch.  Sofas for chairs.  Butta!

We got the section with the sofas and it felt like we were at g-ma's living room.  Nothing matches here, which makes you really look at every single mismatched piece.  Wow, this pink is different than this pink you soon discover.  From fine porcelain classic tea kettles to a Cow kettle... something for everyone.

Sandwiches were pretty fun to try out.  If your group is big enough, you can sample perhaps 8 different kinds!  All you need is a nibble!  Scones... wow... I hate scones.  Dry dusty crumbly cotton mouth-inducing pastries.  No!  Not here!  Fresh and moist like a biscuit... and all served with the most exquisites of jams and Double Devon Cream.  I have nooo clue what the heck that is, but it sounds fancy and fancy was delcious!

The Darjeeling was darling.  The Earl Grey was too bitter.  The Dragon Well was swell.  And the Yorkshire Gold was solid!

The waitress was so kind.  She was like someone's dearest mom making sure we had a good time.  With a full room, she kept her cool all day.  Making sure everyone had constant refills.   Going to come back for sure!

excerpts: Cute, comfortable, oddly picturesque, old English theme, extremely friendly and the best scones with clotted cream and jam in the city!
I love coming to this place!
scones.author: Hin M.
scones.review: Cute, comfortable, oddly picturesque, old English theme, extremely friendly and the best scones with clotted cream and jam in the city! I love coming to this place!

excerpts: Outside of the scones, a good amount of the food was mediocre at best.
The place is so small, I wonder how someone like Mr. Corey Maggette would manage to feel comfortable without a chair.
Parking is such a bother, but again, it's San Francisco.
scones.author: Don U.
scones.review:
Honestly, I wanted to give Lovejoy's Tea Room a higher score.  I mean, it's a British tea place.  You don't find this sort of place in the Bay Area. (Yes, you see plenty of milk tea and Thai tea places, but not British tea places.) It's that the place has a good amount of glaring flaws.  It has 3 stars, but the place is really A-OK indeed.  Side note: one of my sisters brought my siblings and I over to this place for her birthday, my only visit to this place.

As I mentioned in the last paragraph, this is a British tea place.  Obviously, the place has the British look when you go inside.  Oh and of course, this is definitely a place ladies generally should feel at ease.

What was good about the place?  I like the surroundings.  The server we had was wonderful.  The staff members as a whole were wonderful I should say.  Of course, the tea would be good. (This is a tea place after all.) You are given your milk and sugar.  Oh and it is awesome that they carry jade tea, but even if your not much of a tea person, there are other drinks to choose from like coffee and hot chocolate. (Side note: for tea and coffee, I need milk and sugar, but I never put either in jade tea.)

Now, I bring out the flaws.  The place is pricey, but it's San Francisco, and adding on, I'll mention a more horrid flaw regarding money in a bit.  I know that this a tea place, but the food was lackluster.  Outside of the scones, a good amount of the food was mediocre at best.  The place is so small, I wonder how someone like Mr. Corey Maggette would manage to feel comfortable without a chair.  Parking is such a bother, but again, it's San Francisco.  I better mention now that the more horrid flaw regarding money (which I checked out just recently) is that each person must spend a little under $10 meaning that for example, if you're just by yourself, you can't just get a crumpet and milk and be good to go because you just spent $7.37 only before the tip.  Even if you add the tip, you're still under the minimum, as that's only $8.48.

I need to get a couple of notes out of the way.  Obviously, if you plan on coming here, make a reservation ahead of time.  Also, you can purchase the cups and other items.  Just go to the store across the street.

I love the atmosphere.  I love the service we received.  I don't love the lackluster food and the money issues.  Lovejoy's is a place I don't mind going to again for tea with crumpets and biscuits.  I just hope the flaws I mentioned are fixed up.

+:  The service is terrific and Lovejoy's Tea Room gets originality points for being a British tea place, a type of place you will not see often in the Bay Area or probably out west for that matter.

-:  The food is seriously lackluster overall and you figure that you get a little more out of each dollar spent.

excerpts: And eating tasty little cheese sandwiches and warm scones.
scones.author: Kaushal P.
scones.review:
When I'm 60, I want my birthday brunch here, with cute old ladies in fun hats! And a sign on the reserved table that says "reserved for Queens"!! And eating tasty little cheese sandwiches and warm scones. And the little marzipan covered cakes that they tempt you with afterward..

Love and Joy!

excerpts: very interesting food especially like the tea, crumpet and scones with devon cream.
the petite four are cute but too sweet even for me.
ill bring my aunts here next time and plan to try thei lemon curd, salmon sandwich, etc :).
ohh and weedays are good!
no need to wait and no crowd!
scones.author: Elc C.
scones.review: i shared a querns tea with houseblend tea with my mom.  very interesting food especially like the tea, crumpet and scones with devon cream.  the petite four are cute but too sweet even for me.  ill bring my aunts here next time and plan to try thei lemon curd, salmon sandwich, etc :). ohh and weedays are good!  no need to wait and no crowd!

excerpts: You get to choose several different sandwiches, spring greens, scones, shortbread, biscuits, crumpets, and spreads.
I loved the cucumber and cream cheese and apple walnut salad.
scones.author: Kat M.
scones.review:
This quaint and charming Tea room is very Victorianesque. Everything -- from the furniture to the ensembles of the waitresses, is Victorian. The place has an old feel to it. It's extremely girly, so I wouldn't recommend bringing the boys here. Make a reservation for the girls. This would be an awesome "girls day out" place to visit.

I will admit, at first glance, I didn't believe anything on the menu would fill me up. However, each item was so rich with fresh flavor and I was actually stuffed by our meal's end. A downfall -- the prices. I didn't expect tea and sandwiches to be that expensive. The way I see it is, I paid for the experience of trying something new in a great environment, where they definitely pay attention to detail and where high attentive and personable.

If it's just you and another person, order the High Tea for Two. You get to choose several different sandwiches, spring greens, scones, shortbread, biscuits, crumpets, and spreads. I loved the cucumber and cream cheese and apple walnut salad. I literally moaned when I put the crumpet topped with Devonshire cream in my mouth. It just melted...I loved that combination so much, that I went to their retail store across the street to purchase a jar. As far as teas, they offer a wide selection...I would try one from each category.

In short, try it on a Saturday or Sunday morning with girlfriends!

excerpts: And then there are the scones...
I LOVE THE SCONES.
scones.author: Amelia M.
scones.review:
This place is just delightful! From the owner to the food and ambiance. There is something very endearing about this place that has a million little knickknacks, but somehow they make me feel oh so happy. It's like playing tea with the girls... only that now we are allowed to handle hot liqids! 

 I have an odd food allergy and the owner (Muna) was very attentive and sat down on my couch that was reserved for Queens! :) She listed every ingredient and let me know what I could have. She also sold my friends and I into these wonderful sandwiches that we would have never have tried, but she is so knowledgeable and she was able to let us know that due to our like of other similar cheeses, we would be happy with this choice. 

The tea selections are the best. You can try Green teas, Herbal Teas, you name it. And they can even suggest what would go best with your food selection. It is like having fine wine! 

And then there are the scones... I LOVE THE SCONES. They do sell them separately if you must take some with you or want extras with your order. 

My only wish for this place (and I am not going to take stars away for this... because after all... it just means the business is doing well and they should not be punished for that!) is that it would be easier to get in. You really need to plan way in advance if you are to secure a reservation on the date and time you desire. It is a wonderful place to go in a big group and bring people of all ages. You see all types of folks in here. 

This is an overall charming experience. Just make sure you get there on time. If you are driving... get there earlier to secure parking (parking is hard in this area) or take public transportation. 

I need to make a reservation to go back soon! And the owner Muna is FABULOUS! Thank you for paying such great attention to my food allergies. You made me feel normal... unlike other places where they make it sound like I am a nuisance for having restrictions. I just rather be breathing. ;)

excerpts: The food is good (especially the scones!), the service is helpful, and the tea can turn even the most caffine-wary person into a fan.
When I worked with them on my wedding, they were prompt and helpful and their services were far cheaper than many other comparable menus- and probably had better food!
They are a delight, however you choose to experience them.
scones.author: Mira G.
scones.review: I've experienced Lovejoy's Tea Room two ways- as a guest at their place, and as a bride whose wedding they catered.  In both capacities, they are outstanding.  The food is good (especially the scones!), the service is helpful, and the tea can turn even the most caffine-wary person into a fan.  When I worked with them on my wedding, they were prompt and helpful and their services were far cheaper than many other comparable menus- and probably had better food!  They are a delight, however you choose to experience them.

excerpts: Ladies, what could befit a rainy miserable day more than tea and buttered scones at Lovejoy's?

Enjoying crustless finger sandwiches, sausage biscuits, and petit fours with my two of my best friends as we enjoy a light banter about shoes, makeup, boys, and periods(nothing that will hurt our little heads like math, sports, or politics -- that's
man talk, tee-hee).
And there's so much estrogen circulating in the room, we're all on the same cycle now.
scones.author: Suzanne R.
scones.review:
Ladies, what could befit a rainy miserable day more than tea and buttered scones at Lovejoy's? Enjoying crustless finger sandwiches, sausage biscuits, and petit fours with my two of my best friends as we enjoy a light banter about shoes, makeup, boys, and periods(nothing that will hurt our little heads like math, sports, or politics -- that's man talk, tee-hee).
 
And there's so much estrogen circulating in the room, we're all on the same cycle now.

excerpts: Miss Lovejoy's double devon cream and berry jam on flaky, buttery scones would certainly feature on my "Last breakfast on Earth" menu.
But of course, I wouldn't stop there.

I'd go all out and order the "Queen's tea," featuring the aforementioned scones, double devon cream, jam, lemon curd, variety of sandwiches (favorites: fig & olive tapenade, salmon & cream cheese, chicken w/ asparagus, & apple and stilton), crumpets, salad, fruit, petit-fours and a pot of specialty tea per person.
scones.author: Ravena F.
scones.review:
DOUBLE

DEVON

CREAM!!!

Yes, I AM shouting, and yes, it IS necessary!  Miss Lovejoy's double devon cream and berry jam on flaky, buttery scones would certainly feature on my "Last breakfast on Earth" menu.  But of course, I wouldn't stop there.  I'd go all out and order the "Queen's tea," featuring the aforementioned scones, double devon cream, jam, lemon curd, variety of sandwiches (favorites: fig & olive tapenade, salmon & cream cheese, chicken w/ asparagus, & apple and stilton), crumpets, salad, fruit, petit-fours and a pot of specialty tea per person.

Oh wait, that is what I did, just this very afternoon.  Does this mean today is my last day on Earth?  Well, it's been good.  Glad I did it in style: taking my girlfriends out to eat scrumptiously rich and satisfying food.  We ate for nearly 2 hours.  That may sound disgusting, but as a matter of fact, it was pretty - because we were so darned happy to be there, and gettin' hyphy on tea!  

Someday I want to wear a proper hat and white gloves to this place - maybe I'll wait till my hair turns a natural blue!   

Notes:
1. Do make reservations before coming.
2. They have some seasonal teas - had the chestnut black today and it was sensational.

excerpts:
:
There is no shortage of savory and sweet treats here:  lemon curd tarts, scones, double cream, cheeses, chutney, toast points, cucumber sandwiches, petit fours - all cut and shaped into small sizes perfect for popping into your mouth.
scones.author: Liz S.
scones.review:
Mad Hatter: Would you like a little more tea?
Alice: Well, I haven't had any yet, so I can't very well take more.
March Hare: Ah, you mean you can't very well take less.
Mad Hatter: Yes. You can always take more than nothing.

I love Alice in Wonderland for its spirit of adventure, mismatched quirkiness, witty prose, and cast of characters.  It is all culture and tradition, seen through a child's eyes, and turned upside down. 

I love Lovejoy's for the same reasons.  Every chair, cup, serving platter and utensil is different and wonderful, straight out of your English grandmother's attic.  

Drink Me:
Unlike poor Alice, you can have all the tea that you want, a bottomless pot!  My favorite is the Black Currant.

Eat Me:
There is no shortage of savory and sweet treats here:  lemon curd tarts, scones, double cream, cheeses, chutney, toast points, cucumber sandwiches, petit fours - all cut and shaped into small sizes perfect for popping into your mouth.  You can get them in different assortments (Queen's Tea or Ploughman's Lunch, for example), or a la carte, depending on how hungry you are.  

The staff is extremely nice - I have been there both for a group event, and for an intimate lunch, and both times we were treated very well.  The place is usually full no matter what day of the week you are there, so reservations are a must. 

Lovejoy's is a place that you want to linger - filling your cup again and again with delicious hot tea, and savoring a rare moment in the middle of the city.  Going there for lunch with the fabulous laura b. is like the perfect icing on the most scrumptious cake.  Whether you are an underground Alice or a Queen of Hearts, Lovejoy's will tickle your fancy.

excerpts: Scones with jam and cream were delectable.
Cookies good.
Plentiful (damn big, it hurts my wrist to pour) pots of tea.
Too much estrogen in there though.
scones.author: Peg S.
scones.review: Antique-y girls' tea.  Teeny sandwiches were divine, daarhling.  Now wouldn't think this would be filling after doing Bay to Breakers, but got surprisingly full after eating all that came with the high tea.  Scones with jam and cream were delectable.  Cookies good. Plentiful (damn big, it hurts my wrist to pour) pots of tea.  Too much estrogen in there though.

excerpts: I could make you tea, sandwiches, and scones at my house for about 10 dollars total.
I don't think it's worth it to go here unless you love large groups of loud women, small children, and high prices.
It is a cute concept, but something you could easily do at home.
It is not rocket science to make a tea sandwich.
I think it's more the novelty, maybe somewhere to take your out of town mother or grandmother.
scones.author: Julia D.
scones.review: I was having a deep thought about Lovejoy's the other day.  I could make you tea, sandwiches, and scones at my house for about 10 dollars total.  I don't think it's worth it to go here unless you love large groups of loud women, small children, and high prices.  It is a cute concept, but something you could easily do at home.  It is not rocket science to make a tea sandwich.  I think it's more the novelty, maybe somewhere to take your out of town mother or grandmother.

excerpts: Tea for two came with a bunch of tea sandwiches that we picked out, salad, scones (that never tasted sooo good), sugar cookies, and bottomless tea (we each got to pick out our own tea).
scones.author: Ai B.
scones.review:
It's a tea party for Adults!

Went with my girlfriends and it was a majority of our first time experiencing high tea. Fell in love with the decor (very eclectic). Our waitress was very nice. She suggested the "high tea for two" instead of each of us getting the "high tea" because it was the best value for our group size.

Tea for two came with a bunch of tea sandwiches that we picked out, salad, scones (that never tasted sooo good), sugar cookies, and bottomless tea (we each got to pick out our own tea).

excerpts: The scones, which were fine, are now excellent- they started with a new backer relatively recently.
I never have room for the petit fours, but the two times (out of zillions of visits) that I've had them, they have been delicious.
I also recently ordered catering from them, and it is really easy and very reasonable.
I have 1 complaint- too hard to get a reservation!
scones.author: SF Soccer Mom S.
scones.review:
I am not a foodie, but I do know about afternoon tea. It's in my background, if not in my DNA. Lovejoy's is an outstanding and authentic experience. If you like British-style tea (which is obviously a meal, not just the tea), then this is it. More than the best in the city, the best I've had outside the UK. If you don't like traditional British tea, there are no concessions to American taste here. The complaints on yelp reflect a lack of familiarity with this tradition, in my opinion.
The ambience is a bit over-the-top Anglophilic, feminine, and precious- just go with it! The tea is excellent and perfectly prepared. The sandwiches are tiny, crustless, and delicious- my favorites include the ham and (spicy) English mustard, egg and onion, and, of course, cucumber. The scones, which were fine, are now excellent- they started with a new backer relatively recently. I never have room for the petit fours, but the two times (out of zillions of visits) that I've had them, they have been delicious. I also recently ordered catering from them, and it is really easy and very reasonable. I have 1 complaint- too hard to get a reservation!

excerpts: Have the scones (complete with devonshire cream), have the tea sandwiches as they are imaginative and beautiful which is only surpassed by their scrumptiousness.
If you're a bit hungrier, try one of the full plates.
And for God's sake, have the tea.
scones.author: Katie W.
scones.review:
Love LoveJoy's!
A place like this wouldn't be justified if Love weren't in the title. I'm a fan of tea and any time's tea time for me! Walk into this place and it's like you were in Grandma's comfortable, warm, ever-so inviting front room, complete with couches and perhaps a rocking chair (that I'm sure if you wanted, you could buy too!). 

Ok, so atmosphere is set, how about some vitals and beverage? Oh yes. Have the scones (complete with devonshire cream), have the tea sandwiches as they are imaginative and beautiful which is only surpassed by their scrumptiousness. If you're a bit hungrier, try one of the full plates. And for God's sake, have the tea. It's all that tea should be. 

There's just so much food & drink to chose from. After your meal, do splurge on a petit four or four. Grandma would have wanted it that way. Sip, sit, taste and love.

I'm a Lovejoy, she's a Lovejoy, he's a Lovejoy - won't you be a Lovejoy too?

excerpts: You also get cole slaw, salad w dressing, scones with butter cream and preserves and butter cookies.
Everything is so good and
the hot Shepard's Pie is the best Shepard's Pie I've ever had, great balance of all ingredients.
scones.author: Frankie F.
scones.review:
I've been to Love Joy's Tea Room and the sister store, The Attic, across the street and each and every time it is an unforgettable experience.  This time it was for a high tea time for a special 13 year olds birthday. I've been here for Mother's Day, birthdays' for the young and more mature, this is a true gem!

You need to make reservations because it is a known spot. Once you arrive you enter a living room looking space with tea pots, doyles, couch's', tables, and coffee tables spread about.  I've sat in 5 different spaces  and each space is special and unique in it's own way.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  You can tell these ladies like what they do.  They will also take a picture of the whole table because you want to capture the moments spent in Love Joy's.  

You start with a menu of teas (I love the strawberry tea) and different options of high tea and hot appetizers.  The high tea has a menu of sandwich's', each person picks two (I love the smoked salmon, and the chicken asparagus) You also get cole slaw, salad w dressing, scones with butter cream and preserves and butter cookies.  Everything is so good and the hot Shepard's Pie is the best Shepard's Pie I've ever had, great balance of all ingredients. You can end your meal with a petifore (truffle), which might be a little too much after a high tea but it is a delightful treat.

I have never seen a guy in Love Joys so save this one for the special ladies in your life!

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for two and it included cole slaw, spring greens, scones, shortbread biscuits and a bottomless pot of tea of your choice.
You have your choice of four different sandwiches.
We chose the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roast beef and horseradish, fig and olive tapenade and chutney and english cheddar.
I have to say that my favorite has to be the fig and olive tapenade.
It was more on the sweet side rather than the salty but very yummy.
The cream and jam that I put on the biscuits were to die for!
I am not kidding!
A nice little addition to the High tea for Two.
scones.author: Dominique H.
scones.review:
I absolutely loved this place!! All of the antiques and different table settings add so much to the feel of this place. The staff was also really nice and helpful. We ordered the High Tea for two and it included cole slaw, spring greens, scones, shortbread biscuits and a bottomless pot of tea of your choice. You have your choice of four different sandwiches. We chose the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roast beef and horseradish, fig and olive tapenade and chutney and english cheddar. I have to say that my favorite has to be the fig and olive tapenade. It was more on the sweet side rather than the salty but very yummy. The cream and jam that I put on the biscuits were to die for! I am not kidding! It was so good. 

The sausage rolls were warm on the inside and had a crust on the outside that was super flaky. A nice little addition to the High tea for Two.  

At the end of tea time for us they had a tray of many different petite fours that you could choose from. I had the strawberry shortcake petite four which was good but I think by the time they came around with the tray I was too full to really enjoy it. My sister had the lemon one which I liked better.

This was a great place to relax and enjoy a cup of tea with some goodies. The set up was so cute and definitely a place I would like to go back to when i visit San Francisco again. Thanks sis for taking us to such a fun place!

excerpts: They provided quirky mismatched china and silver, and the selection of little crumpets, scones, and finger sandwiches was perfect.
scones.author: Annie D.
scones.review:
My friend had Lovejoy's cater her wedding, and it was the cutest luncheon idea ever. They provided quirky mismatched china and silver, and the selection of little crumpets, scones, and finger sandwiches was perfect. For a unique event I give it an A++

I've eaten there too, and it makes me wish I had a daughter or some very girly friends to share it with. It was a bit wasted on my husband and the male friends we were with. That many floral patterns and even they started craving a manicure. Next time I'll make it a girls brunch to remember. Excellent food and teas, even entice this tom boy back...

excerpts: The tea service for two is good -- you can choose a nice variety of sandwiches to share, get yourself some scones, and each get the tea that you want.
scones.author: R M.
scones.review:
Psst, don't tell anyone. I actually love tea sandwiches.  I don't know what it is about it... but, I can't help it.  The tea service for two is good -- you can choose a nice variety of sandwiches to share, get yourself some scones, and each get the tea that you want.  Where could you go wrong??!!

btw -- the tea shop across the street is nice if you want to take some home.

excerpts: I have always enjoyed this place - the feel of grandma's living room, the delicious little sandwiches and scones, the bottomless tea.
The service has always been fine but this time not so much.
I am not sure if she was the manager but at the least, she must have been working there a while because she was training the our sweet young waitress.
But this woman seemed a little brutish and snooty.
We asked our waitress in training for some extra plates, forks, and knives so we could cut the birthday cake.
The brutish woman came over and scolded this poor girl in front of us - "you can't just give cake plates out.
we charge for that!"
Then the brutish woman gave us the explanation - "i'm sorry
, she is new and should have told you we have a cake cutting fee...
" blah blah...
Then the woman took her aside behind that curtain with the food
and I can see and hear that woman continue to yell at that poor girl!
So unprofessional!
First of all, I felt awful this girl was getting yelled at.
We should have told that woman in the first place that we had a cake.
Second, is it really necessary for people to be treated that way and in front of customers!
If it was me, I would have told that woman to shove a sandwich up her a**.
It saddens me that other humans can treat their fellow humans in such a demeaning way.
I don't know if I can go back there as long as that woman works there.

Second, is it really necessary for people to be treated that way and in front of customers! If it was me, I would have told that woman to shove a sandwich up her a**. It saddens me that other humans can treat their fellow humans in such a demeaning way. I don't know if I can go back there as long as that woman works there.

excerpts: Fresh fruit was perfect and ripe, scones were super-tasty.
scones.author: Erin M.
scones.review:
Girly perfection. Very Victorian, very tasty and very adorable. My gal-pals and I celebrated a belated Christmas gift exchange at Lovejoys. We called earlier in the week for a Sunday reservation, but they said they were booked. However, I popped in at about 1pm on Sunday and was able to score a table that would be ready in about a half hour. Perfect! 

We crowded into the back corner on a couch (and chair), which is perfect for us. We were able to giggle and be our usual obnoxious selves. Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea. Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout. Fresh fruit was perfect and ripe, scones were super-tasty. We were actually full after two hours of delicate edibles and never-ending tea. 

Aside from slightly cramped quarters and the occasional freakishly heavy teapot, Lovejoy's a great, girly afternoon. I'm definitely taking my mom here the next time she's in town.

excerpts: The scones were delicious and I absolutely loved the lemon curd and clotted cream that you topped them off with!
It's a really fun thing to do with girlfriends on an afternoon.
I've been to Samovar and Tal-y-tara as well and must say that Lovejoy's is hands down my favorite.
scones.author: Kathryn M.
scones.review: I came here with a large group of women for the queen's tea service. YUM. The vanilla roobois tea was wonderful. The finger sandwiches were also great-- my favorite was the tomato and cheddar and the cucumber and cream cheese. The scones were delicious and I absolutely loved the lemon curd and clotted cream that you topped them off with! It's a really fun thing to do with girlfriends on an afternoon. I've been to Samovar and Tal-y-tara as well and must say that Lovejoy's is hands down my favorite.

excerpts: (I knew so many boys that would insist on that in junior school) a real porcelain pot of tea (sugar provided but not essential) and scones and jam for dessert (but obviously scoffing down prior to tea is allowed too - or instead of).
scones.author: Jack G.
scones.review:
Sweet! Almost as sweet as the tea!

I'm from England, I was born there, grew up there, was educated there, experienced my first 'everything' there... except this. Yes it's true, I have never ever had "high tea" and couldn't honestly tell you what it was until after living here for almost six years.

Last march Oscar took me here for my 26th birthday lunch and it was lovely! It was not at all what I was expecting, completely informal and more like a trip to Grandma's house than tea on the lawn with the queen. Being part of a generation the UK so quaintly labeled 'Generation-X', I feel that such age old traditions have somewhat passed us by (not that kids in the 60's or 70's particularly practiced large amounts of earl grey consumption - but I am sure they knew what 'high tea' was). And as with anyone born in the early 1980's, I would imagine that unless you are from British royalty the chances are you didn't either. Ok moving on...

The tea and sandwiches are the up-most of British tradition (apparently) including white bread with the crusts cut off (I knew so many boys that would insist on that in junior school) a real porcelain pot of tea (sugar provided but not essential) and scones and jam for dessert (but obviously scoffing down prior to tea is allowed too - or instead of).

Definitely somewhere worthy of treating someone special too, the place is both unique and eye catching. A totally different 'cuisine' and likely something they have never had, or thought of having - and I can't imagine anyone who wouldn't enjoy it. This would do well even in the modern day, chain bar, chain store, chain coffee, chain England.

Enjoy, darling!

excerpts: The scones and tea were great.
Service by one of the women working there was amazing.
scones.author: Mike D.
scones.review:
Great date spot. Memorable ambiance, good food/tea, you won't have to sell any of your organs to eat here...it's surprisingly well-priced. 

Cream cheese and cucumber sandwiches are a must. The scones and tea were great. Service by one of the women working there was amazing. The other server was kinda standoff-ish. 

Overall a place you have to go to if you haven't. We'll go back.

excerpts: Where to go for High tea and Scones?
Lovejoy's Tea Room!!
It's the perfect setting for a Girl's day out, Birthdays, and Baby Showers.
My girlfriends and I go to Lovejoy's every year; it's become an annual Girl's day out tradition.
We usually order High Tea for Two, but we make it for High Tea for Four.
Everyone gets to pick a tea and two sandwiches each, so it's perfectly even!
The presentation of all the tiers of tea sandwiches, salad and scones is so cute and elegantly organized!!!
Even though it doesn't look like it would fill up the 4 of us, it does!
Oh and the scones??
Yum!
Double Devon cream and jam on a warm scone?
So good
scones.author: Karen L.
scones.review:
