Where to go for High tea and Scones? Lovejoy's Tea Room!!  It's the perfect setting for a Girl's day out, Birthdays, and Baby Showers. My girlfriends and I go to Lovejoy's every year; it's become an annual Girl's day out tradition. We all dress up in our cutest outfits and heels and meet at Lovejoy's for tea once a year.  

We usually order High Tea for Two, but we make it for High Tea for Four. Everyone gets to pick a tea and two sandwiches each, so it's perfectly even! The presentation of all the tiers of tea sandwiches, salad and scones is so cute and elegantly organized!!! Even though it doesn't look like it would fill up the 4 of us, it does! By the time the staff comes around to offer a petit four, we all have to say no, because no one can eat another bite! 

All the tea sandwiches and tea selections on the menu, whatever you decide to choose, it will be delicious! I've never had a sandwich I did not want to eat or drank a tea that I did not want to drink. I recommend the blood orange tea; it doesn't require sugar or cream and tastes fabulous on its own. All the tea sandwiches are mouth watering delicious, I cannot pick one that stands out on its own, they are all worthy of being ordered and eaten. Oh and the scones?? Yum! Double Devon cream and jam on a warm scone? So good, it's like heaven in your mouth! 

To make sure you get a table for your party, I highly recommend calling early for a reservation.  The place is small and they only keep one table open for walk ins. Your reservation is only good for 2 hours, so arrive on time to get the most out of your Lovejoy's Tea room experience.  

The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive, BUT they will give you subtle hints to place your order even if you're waiting for the rest of your party or to pack up the last bite of your scone (apparently they have cute mini bags just for it) and if you're really taking your sweet time, they're not afraid to ask you to leave and they do it with a smile!!! =)

excerpts: The food is delicious - scones with cream, mini tea sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, and cookies are all included in the High Tea service.
And of course, there's the tea itself - pot after pot of any tea from their long menu (my favorites are the house blend and the peppermint).
scones.author: DD B.
scones.review:
My college alumnae group has an annual tea at Lovejoy's every year, and it's always been my favorite event (and yes, I went to a women's college).  The food is delicious - scones with cream, mini tea sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, and cookies are all included in the High Tea service.  And of course, there's the tea itself - pot after pot of any tea from their long menu (my favorites are the house blend and the peppermint).  And all of it served on lovely china in a cozy, pretty, exceedingly feminine setting.  

This year I organized the tea.  It was amazingly easy, and the women at Lovejoy's were so professional and pleasant to work with.  It's easy to see why there always seem to be so many groups here. They're also very accomodating: it turned out that one of the women in our group couldn't have dairy, which I didn't know about until the event.  No worries - they whipped up a delicious-looking salad for her, and she was very happy with it.

P.S. I have never seen a man in here, but I'm told that they have been spotted.  So for any man out there who's secure in his masculinity and wants to hang out where a bunch of women are, this is an ideal destination!

excerpts:
My friend and I had High Tea for two which included four crustless sandwiches (each sandwich cut into fours), two scones, two cookies, double Devon cream (same thing as clotted cream) strawberry preserve and a choice of tea that was continuously refilled.  
For sandwiches, we ordered:

Roast Beef and Horseradish (too little roast beef for me, and not the best roast beef I've had either)
Cucumber and Cream Cheese (because it's a must for high tea)
High Tea for two was $34.95 (I think that included the tax).
scones.author: Sooj O.
scones.review:
You must be fully aware in advance that this establishment is in Noe Valley (in the same manner that those who complain about the hipsters in Ritual should really consider that Ritual is smack dab on Valencia).  Truly, I have never seen so many pregnant women in their late twenties, early thirties in one single place.  I counted at least five pregnant women....and on further reflection, as pointed out by my tea-mate, where else would you hold a baby shower considering the ban on caffeine and alcohol during pregnancies?

My friend and I had High Tea for two which included four crustless sandwiches (each sandwich cut into fours), two scones, two cookies, double Devon cream (same thing as clotted cream) strawberry preserve and a choice of tea that was continuously refilled.  For sandwiches, we ordered:

Roast Beef and Horseradish (too little roast beef for me, and not the best roast beef I've had either)
Cucumber and Cream Cheese (because it's a must for high tea)
Hummus (I love having hummus as a sandwich)
Fig and Olive tapenade (the best of the four sandwiches...what a wonderful combination.  The sour sharp tang of olives pairs perfectly with the sweetness of figs)

The clotted cream was wonderful.  For those who have never had clotted cream...if you like butter, you will love clotted cream.  

High Tea for two was $34.95 (I think that included the tax).  

It's a very girly place, so wear something a little precious, catch up with your gal friends and giggle away over girl talk.

excerpts: The sandwiches are all tasty (I won't go into them here, just read all the previous gazillion reviews), the scones and cakes are lovely, the jams are fruity and sweet, and the cream...speaks for itself.
Any tea you select will be steeped properly before it's served, so patience, dearies.
Also, they have a lovely shop that's worth your perusal, and I always end up with a few little sachets of my favorites.
Try the vanilla roobois.
You'll thank me later ;)
scones.author: Krisztina F.
scones.review:
Now I remember why I never reviewed Lovejoy's on Yelp! When you have 365 reviews, who needs one more? But oh well... 

There hasn't been anything I've ingested or imbibed at Lovejoy's that hasn't been tasty or worth the price. It evokes going to a dotty, dear old Aunt's house resplendent with doilies and chintz, and settling in to be well fed over a long period of time. It's shabby chic all the way. If you can't imagine yourself happy being surrounded by chintz....then you're me BEFORE I tried Lovejoy's. I've set my pinstripe suit and high heels and modern style on the shelf for the luxurious, melting, home-like atmosphere of Lovejoy's. 

Whether you're a party of 2 or 12 (I've been in both), I highly recommend reservations. That said, splurge on the high tea. The sandwiches are all tasty (I won't go into them here, just read all the previous gazillion reviews), the scones and cakes are lovely, the jams are fruity and sweet, and the cream...speaks for itself. Any tea you select will be steeped properly before it's served, so patience, dearies. Also, they have a lovely shop that's worth your perusal, and I always end up with a few little sachets of my favorites. Try the vanilla roobois. You'll thank me later ;)

excerpts: Excellent selection of tea, scones and jam to die for, and every last plate and cup is unique and adorably British.
I will be coming back soon!
scones.author: Emily H.
scones.review: Everything about this Tea Room is lovely. I felt like I had stepped into Alice in Wonderland. A fantastic place to go with girlfriends (or friends/SOs of any gender, really). Excellent selection of tea, scones and jam to die for, and every last plate and cup is unique and adorably British. I will be coming back soon!

excerpts: Besides the whole parking issue, the tea, the crumpets, the finger sandwiches and all the sides were to die for, especially the scones.
Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
scones.author: CalBear H.
scones.review:
I was foolish enough to drive to Lovejoy's, do not repeat my mistake as parking in this area is like squeeze blood from stones.  Really, I really felt it was that painful and impossible.

Besides the whole parking issue, the tea, the crumpets, the finger sandwiches and all the sides were to die for, especially the scones.  Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

excerpts: As before scones and crumpets were to die for.
I love to love LOVEJOY"s
scones.author: Dorothy F.
scones.review:
I had the pleasure of going back for my sister's b-day celebration.  

Just as charming and enjoyable as before.  Ironically, our server was Sarah again who is adorably sweet and a great server.  We all had the Queen's tea and sampled each other's endless pots of tea.  This time I chose the Apricot which had a nice soothing flavor.  

At this visit I sampled a couple of different sandwiches (since there were 7 of us), all super delicious: 

-chicken and asparagus ( chunks of asparagus)
-artichoke hummus
-lovejoy's special (a must try)
-ham w/english mustard ( nice dose of spicy mustard)

As before scones and crumpets were to die for.  I love to love LOVEJOY"s

excerpts: And it's likely you'll get the lion's share of the scones from the ladies, if you're patient.
scones.author: Razoo D.
scones.review:
My New-Englander upbringing taught me that "tea parties" were squarely a feminine endeavor. But while I agree that Lovejoy's would make a classy joint for a bridal party, I have to insist that the experience may be universally enjoyed!

Men, fear no tea room - the sandwiches, while small, are scrumptious. Here, there's a delicious shepherd's pie, which will satisfy a normal appetite (I have an outsize one, so this was a perfect "main dish"). And it's likely you'll get the lion's share of the scones from the ladies, if you're patient.

I recommend a less obvious time (like, not on a weekend) - because the decibel level is more tolerable. Then again, if the sound of 'birds chirping' is relaxing to you, by all means go on Sunday around 2 o'clock.

excerpts: We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea.
As both of us were tea novices,
Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling.
The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that.
It was really delicious
and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before.
The salad was fresh.
I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches.
Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese.
The salmon and cheese really went well together.
Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough.
scones.author: Amanda K.
scones.review:
My friend and I both enjoyed our time at Lovejoy's Tea Room the other day. I loved the atmosphere of the place. The decorations that adorn the walls and the mismatched cups and saucers gives Lovejoy's a quirky and rustic atmosphere. I had this perception that tea service would be all proper and formal, but at Lovejoy's it was really relaxing. All the tables were quite close, but I still could have a nice conversation without having to shout at each other.

We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea. As both of us were tea novices, our helpful waitress recommended Tea Room Blend and China Rose Petal. Both were really yummy, with the tea room blend being a little heavier and more bitter, and china rose petal as really fragrant yet light. Our waitress would reheat and refill our tea as well, which was very nice. As for the food, before it arrived, I was a little concerned that I'd still be left hungry. Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling. The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that. It was really delicious and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before. The salad was fresh. I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches. Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese. The salmon and cheese really went well together. Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough. The scone and the teas were the highlights though!

I would definitely make a reservation if I wasn't coming in early. We went right when it opened at around 11 without reservations and we got a table easily, but we saw about half the tables already reserved for later. And when we were about to leave the room was packed and there were a couple people waiting outside. Also there is a two hour time limit, but we never felt rushed. I probably wouldn't come regularly since the prices are a bit high, but I'd definitely return for a special occasion or if I wanted to do something different with my girl friends or mom.

excerpts: Great tea and scones to die for.
scones.author: Cindy W.
scones.review: Love this place. Really cute and charming. Great tea and scones to die for.

excerpts: Everything is yummy...especially the scones with Devonshire cream.
scones.author: ena p.
scones.review: The best tea room in the Bay Area.  This is my go to spot when it's time to catch up with the girlfriends.  Everything is yummy...especially the scones with Devonshire cream.

excerpts: The tea is delicious, I recommend the Mango and Rose teas, and the tea sandwiches and scones are quite tasty as well.
If you enjoy a little afternoon tea I suggest checking out this place, you will not be disappointed.
scones.author: Cynthia C.
scones.review:
I was here not to long ago and absolutely love it.  A friend and I threw a bridal party for my cousin.  It was so girly, she loved it.  The atmosphere is quaint and I love the fact that all the china and silverware doesn't match.  It gives it that little extra charm.  The tea is delicious, I recommend the Mango and Rose teas, and the tea sandwiches and scones are quite tasty as well.  
If you enjoy a little afternoon tea I suggest checking out this place, you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: Oh and you must try the scones with CLOTTED CREAM.
I felt my arteries clogging as I engulfed my scone - also don't forget the jelly, wonderful!
Reminded me on London's tea houses.
scones.author: Pug P.
scones.review:
Their tea sandwiches rocked.  I had them cater a party, and they were fantastic.  The chicken walnut tea sandwich the ham and mustard, cucumber and cheese.
Oh and you must try the scones with CLOTTED CREAM.  I felt my arteries clogging as I engulfed my scone - also don't forget the jelly, wonderful!
Reminded me on London's tea houses.

excerpts: The scones, the creams, the sandwiches, the fruit - delightful.
We had the darjeeling and a vanilla tea?
I can't remember
but it was gorgeously scrumptious.
The waitress came around with petite fours which were dainty and delicious!
scones.author: Christine C.
scones.review:
It's official - this place is awesome! Man, writing this review makes me wish I was there right now!... (pics to come soon)

Came here for a going away tea for one of my best buddies. Thought it'd be nice to dress up and be girly - funnnn!

We reserved a table - which is highly recommended because they have many events going on ALL the time - and were greeted by a card holder with a sign that said, "Reserved for royalty." Cute. Nothing matches but everything is pretty, frilly, flowery, cutesy, charming, lacy... you get the picture! And that's what makes tea so fun! 

My friends ordered a cheese plate - which I am indifferent to because I don't like cheese but they loved it - and I ordered the curry puff. I am a curry puff weakling! Any kind, any day, curry in a flaky pastry - I am your girl! And it was mouthwateringly delicious as well as filling! It came with beans and salad but I didn't care much for those.. heh. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two (I think...) and had a wonderful time exploring different levels of heaven! The scones, the creams, the sandwiches, the fruit - delightful. We had the darjeeling and a vanilla tea? I can't remember but it was gorgeously scrumptious. The waitress came around with petite fours which were dainty and delicious! It was like biting into little pieces of art =)

What a fun experience with wonderful friends - just awesome! This is a great place to be!

excerpts: Great selection of sandwiches, some coleslaw, salad, scones with preserves and double devon cream, shortbread and
each of us had a tea selection.
We ordered some blood orange tea, which was my favorite!
There were three other ones that were good, but I was so taken by the blood orange, I don't really remember.
It was a great place for 4 friends to get together, catch up, and enjoy a great filling lunch!
scones.author: Roenna N.
scones.review:
This is one of two tea rooms I've been too, and I'm going to say, this tops it.  We had reservations of course, highly recommended, as they seemed pretty busy from start to finish.  The team room was sooo, cozy and quaint.  Made me feel like I was in someone else's grandmother's tea room.  I liked how the tea cups and plates were all different, but complimented each other well.  The seating and the tables were all different.  Some benches, chairs, armchairs, etc.
We ordered High Tea for four ($17/persom).  Great selection of sandwiches, some coleslaw, salad, scones with preserves and double devon cream, shortbread and each of us had a tea selection.
We ordered some blood orange tea, which was my favorite!  There were three other ones that were good, but I was so taken by the blood orange, I don't really remember. 
It was a great place for 4 friends to get together, catch up, and enjoy a great filling lunch!

excerpts: The sugar cookies are wonderful and the scones were moist and fresh.
scones.author: Mary R.
scones.review:
This place is ultra darling. I came here for my bridal shower and my BMs did a perfect job fitting everything we wanted to do in the 2 hour timeframe Lovejoy's gave us. We had a group of 11 and they sat us in the back corner table which provided enough privacy for all the little embarrassing moments and wiffles. 

All their teas were really good, including the houseblend. There was plenty of food from the $18.95pp menu. We even had leftovers! The sugar cookies are wonderful and the scones were moist and fresh. 

The service was top notch. We asked to have our leftovers packed and they even put a moist paper towel in with the box of sandwiches to make sure the bread didn't dry out. 

Lovejoy's will hold a special place in my heart =)

excerpts: If only those wonderful scones didn't have raisins in them.
Hate raisins.
Love Lovejoys.
scones.author: Molly T.
scones.review:
This is my 10 year old daughter's favorite place to eat.  Turns out I am also a complete sucker for High Tea.  A total carb, sugar and caffeine fest.  Really doesn't get any better than that.  

The little sandwiches are always just right.  I even love the coleslaw.  But the clotted cream, oh the clotted cream - like butter and whipped cream got married and had the perfect child.  If only those wonderful scones didn't have raisins in them.  Hate raisins.  Love Lovejoys.

excerpts:
w/poppy seed salad 
Green salad with mandarin orange slivers with a vinaigrette dressing
2 raisin scones (OMG
I've died and gone to heaven goodness)
Devonshire cream and strawberry preserves to go on those awesome scones and finally 2 shortbread
scones.author: J. C.
scones.review:
There is no better English tearoom than Lovejoy's.  I had frequented this establishment before they moved to their new location on Clipper. The orig. location was a lot smaller and but now they are able to accommodate baby showers and still have room for parties of 2's.  I always order the High Tea for 2 if I'm with a friend with this you get:

1 pot of tea (great selection from black, green or fruit teas) my favorite is the Tearoom blend. Do it like the English and drink it with milk
 4 sandwiches (my favorites are bay shrimp w/mayonnaise, chicken and asparagus, turkey with horseradish mustard, and egg and onion)  
Cole slaw w/poppy seed salad 
Green salad with mandarin orange slivers with a vinaigrette dressing
2 raisin scones (OMG I've died and gone to heaven goodness)
Devonshire cream and strawberry preserves to go on those awesome scones and finally 2 shortbread "I can't believe its butter" cookies.

If you're into English teas this is the place to be.  The prices are very reasonable and staff is extremely attentive.  
Once you walk through the door you will forget all your worries.  Just concentrate on enjoying the time with you friend(s) and renew yourself spiritually.  Reservations are recommended.

excerpts: Yummy scones served with double devon cream!
scones.author: Trixie J.
scones.review:
A delicious place for 90 minutes (your maximum time allowance, if they're busy) of delightfully pretentious tea-sipping with your chick or gay friends. Make sure your pinky is pointing up and out when you sip your tea. 

Yummy scones served with double devon cream!

excerpts: And those scones!
oh those delicious scones made of flour and magic and other fairy like fantasy things.
I have never in my life been a fan of scones.
Id rather put a cake like muffin in my mouth.
But damn, these scones are amazing.
scones.author: Angela C.
scones.review:
This cute little tea room makes me feel like a bull in a china store.

I don't let that stop me though.  Its not very often that I get to go here but when I do...its tasty!

It is just so incredibly hard to not completely rub that devon cream all over my face and shovel hands of it into my mouth like a cave man scoops the last bits of food out of his bowl made of wooly mammoth bone (or whatever fine materials he makes to use as bowls).  

And those scones! oh those delicious scones made of flour and magic and other fairy like fantasy things.  I have never in my life been a fan of scones.  Id rather put a cake like muffin in my mouth.  But damn, these scones are amazing.

and what is better than one big sandwich?  How about a lot of little ones....arranged on a three plate tier?!?!  devine...

The little high tea snacks alone give it 5 stars....

oh yeah. and they have tea there too.

excerpts: -Delicious, warm, buttery scones with raisins topped with fresh strawberry preserves (my absolute favorite!).
I. Love.
scones.author: Laura D.
scones.review:
It was love at first sight as soon as I stepped into Lovejoy's this morning for my friend's bridal shower. What a charming and quaint place.

-Warm, cozy decor including colorful and comfortable antique furniture.
-Delicious, smooth teas; herbal vanilla (unique flavor) and breakfast tea.
-Quite the collection of unique teapots and tea sets!
-Selection of little sandwiches, including beef with horseradish, smoked salmon, and bay shrimp with mayonnaise. 
-Delicious, warm, buttery scones with raisins topped with fresh strawberry preserves (my absolute favorite!). I. Love. Butter.

The staff was incredibly accommodating, sweet, and patient. I highly recommend Lovejoy's for any type of shower or special girly get together. What a lovely place.

excerpts: and oh, the scones!
Perhaps it's my inability to make a scone that won't damage your teeth, but I'm in melty awe of their scones.
scones.author: Cherie T.
scones.review:
Every time family or friends visit (or even in-town friends gathering) I try to work in Lovejoy's. The atmosphere is fantastic, like going to my grandmother's house for tea (not that my grandmother ever served tea, she was more of a coffee person). Mismatched, antique everthing with little doilies everywhere. I love, love, love the variety of little sandwiches and oh, the scones! Perhaps it's my inability to make a scone that won't damage your teeth, but I'm in melty awe of their scones.  

Their Yorkshire Gold Blend (bottomless pot!) goes so well with everything. I find myself vibrating by the time I walk out of there, but it's hard not to keep pouring myself another cup and doctoring it with the provided milk and sugar so long as it's there.

excerpts: Everything from the ham/mustard sandwiches, crumpets to the scones were beyond delicious (a VERY dangerous place for those on a perpetual diet, like me).
The lemon curd was near-orgasmic!
Best of all, the pot of vanilla rooibos really sent me over the top.
The incredible aroma aroused an urge to drink in as much as possible...
I even considered eating the teapot, or at least lick the strainer (I did neither).
Hours of fun and conversation with friends/family, a bona fide San Franciscan past time.
scones.author: Peter C.
scones.review: The only thing missing from today's tea were fancy hats for the ladies, and tall top hats for the gents!  Everything from the ham/mustard sandwiches, crumpets to the scones were beyond delicious (a VERY dangerous place for those on a perpetual diet, like me). The lemon curd was near-orgasmic!  Best of all, the pot of vanilla rooibos really sent me over the top.  The incredible aroma aroused an urge to drink in as much as possible... I even considered eating the teapot, or at least lick the strainer (I did neither).  Hours of fun and conversation with friends/family, a bona fide San Franciscan past time.

excerpts: The dining portions were more than generous - hearty, dainty tea sandwiches on a bed of mixed greens w/walnuts and mandarins and balsamic dijon vinaigrette, fresh fruits, warm scones, shortbread tea biscuits, warm crumpets, lemon curd, strawberry preserves and petits fours!
Strawberries, blueberries, pineapples, scones - you name it
, I spread cream on it.
scones.author: Olma M.
scones.review:
Absolutely splendid, lovely, quaint and all-around wonderful tea room.  Attended a birthday tea party here and just loved it.  We were a party of 15 on a bustling sunny Saturday afternoon/evening (4-6 p.m.).

The dining portions were more than generous - hearty, dainty tea sandwiches on a bed of mixed greens w/walnuts and mandarins and balsamic dijon vinaigrette, fresh fruits, warm scones, shortbread tea biscuits, warm crumpets, lemon curd, strawberry preserves and petits fours!  

Oh, and step away from the Double Devon cream, because seriously, as my friend Sarah says, "EVERYTHING is better with cream." And at this place, you may as well take it in intravenously.  Strawberries, blueberries, pineapples, scones - you name it, I spread cream on it.  And yes, they sell this stuff, too - don't even bother looking at the nutritional value (I use the word "value" lightly).

The tea service was prompt and lovely and everything was described to us as they were served.  We had a relatively spacious layout in the back of the bustling tearoom, but it all felt very cozy.

Customer service was extremely personable, professional and warm.  The minute I walked in/out, I was making making a mental list of others with whom I would love to experience Lovejoy's again.  Very old school, English tea vibe with a quaint "attic" just across the street where they sell many of their wares and teas.

I think this statement from their website sums it up rather well: "...our tea room reflects the diversity of San Francisco, blending together the traditions of tea service with an eclectic, quirky and playful spirit."

excerpts: It's essential with the warm scones.
scones.author: Karen L.
scones.review:
I chose LoveJoy's to co-host a baby shower and I was really happy with how everything turned out (including Mom-to-be). 

It's British style afternoon-tea dressed up in Victorian decor. Loose tea served in unique teapots and teacups, accompanied by a wide selection of dainty finger sandwiches (vegetarian options are available). I really liked the artichoke hummus and fig tapenade sandwiches. And the dev cream! It's essential with the warm scones. 

I recommend LoveJoy's for groups no larger than 8 (we had 17, so we were spread out between two tables). Overall, it offers a nice change of pace from the boulangerie/coffee scene. Just make sure to call beforehand for reservations - especially if you're planning on going during the weekend.

excerpts: It's about the scones!
It's about the glorious antiques!
It's about the lace table cloths, the warm customer service and chattiness of other patrons...
It *is
scones.author: Now V.
scones.review:
It's about the scones! It's about the glorious antiques! It's about the lace table cloths, the warm customer service and chattiness of other patrons... It *is* Sense and Sensibility come alive! 

I once had tea at the Hotel Picadilly in Picadilly Circus, London. It was *not* as good as LoveJoy's by any means. Lovejoys has *true* "high tea" atmosphere and offerings. 

Treat yourself to a tea service or antiques teapot across the street in their little antiques shoppe. They also offer a bevy of loose teas for your enjoyment at home. It's the best.

I went with a sista-friend but, there were men there as well... Gorgeous mediterranean he-men but... I digress, LOL (tea, girl TEA!) Yes, ahem. Tea. 

All of your favorite teas (Darjeeling, Earl Grey) are available and some you may wish to try (exotic smoky black teas are my fave). I came home with several tins.

*** You can find exceptional tea pots at estate sales for a song! The last one I found came with sugar and creamers to match and they were from the forties!!! 

At Lovejoys, spring for the High Tea spread. The sandwiches are to *die* for... and you've NEVER tasted such cold-slaw and salad. All of this comes to you on a Lazy-Susan (translation for the guys - a tiered tray) with delectable delights on several tiers. Come with someone whose conversation you enjoy. It's like a little bit of heaven.

excerpts: High tea for four included eight tea sandwiches (picked from a menu of fifteen?!?), bottomless tea (eight or so choices here), salad, scones, devonshire double cream, jam, cookies and other bits.
scones.author: G Z.
scones.review:
High tea in SF? I was so surprised and delighted to be informed of the existence of Lovejoy's by my s/o's hairdresser. 

We made plans to go a weekend morning with another couple, and when we arrived it became apparent that things aren't exactly traditional in terms of decor. We were told we'd have an hour wait and offered to call us via mobile when a table was ready. We were seated in closer to 30 minutes.

High tea for four included eight tea sandwiches (picked from a menu of fifteen?!?), bottomless tea (eight or so choices here), salad, scones, devonshire double cream, jam, cookies and other bits. 

It was heaven. Service, aromas, atmosphere, everything. We stayed for around four hours... And never felt rushed to clear the table. 

Go. It'll do you good.

excerpts: I dont like scones
but I LOVED their scones!
They were so moist!
They have a great selection of tea!!
scones.author: Carol K.
scones.review:
I will definitely go back to Love Joys! It was a very pleasurable experience.

We had ten girls go for high tea.  We had gone for two birthday parties.

High tea was great! Sandwiches were great! I dont like scones but I LOVED their scones! They were so moist! They have a great selection of tea!!

excerpts: Always a charm... scones are so heavenly, the sandwiches are perfect and the tea selection is grand.  : )
scones.author: Bin M.
scones.review: Love Lovejoy's.  Always a charm... scones are so heavenly, the sandwiches are perfect and the tea selection is grand.  : )

excerpts: Their scones were fresh and made with quality ingredients.
Shepherd's Pie was a hit with everyone and definitely worth a try!
scones.author: Franny L.
scones.review:
Tried this place out last Sunday with a group of 6. We all ordered a variety of things to share. The finger sandwiches were delightful, perfectly proportioned and tasty! Their scones were fresh and made with quality ingredients. Shepherd's Pie was a hit with everyone and definitely worth a try! This place sure makes me miss London!!

I personally ordered one of the Black Teas - Vanilla with Lavender, couldn't really smell the vanilla, but the tea was soothing, especially for my sore throat!

Make a reservation, the place was packed! Bottomless tea with a restaurant filled mostly of women customers, having only 1 restroom was a little more than inconvenient. Prepare to stand in line for a while.

-1 star for the excessive humid conditions inside. They must have special mold-resistant paint, otherwise, I don't know how they keep the place from rotting. They definitely need a better ventilation system for the place.

excerpts: The scones were a favorite with us both (though I despise raisins and hated to have to sit there and pick them out) and the double devonshire cream was the best I've had since I spent time in England!
scones.author: Shara S.
scones.review:
I went here with a friend a couple of weeks ago and had a great time for the most part.  I ordered the salmon mousse and chicken salad sandwich combo while my friend had the special of the day (chicken pesto) and the stilton and pear.  We were both blown away by the flavor and freshness of everything we were served.  The scones were a favorite with us both (though I despise raisins and hated to have to sit there and pick them out) and the double devonshire cream was the best I've had since I spent time in England! 

However, I do have one complaint which is why I didn't give Lovejoys a full 5 stars.  At the end of the meal, the server approached us with a tray of petit-fours and asked us if we'd like one.  Since this was our first visit and we wanted to experience everything, we agreed.  Little did we know that the tiny little cake that I found to be so-so wasn't complimentary like we imagined, but was $5 charge PER PERSON on our bill! You have to be kidding me guys. Firstly, it was all of 1in x 1in. If any money at all, the most it should have been was $1.50.  Secondly when you approach someone and you are going to charge them, one of the following should be said "would you care to purchase a petit-four?" or "would you care to add a petit-four?" or "would you care to order a petit-four?" NOT "would you like a petit-four?"  That just makes it sound like it was part of the meal or free.

This may sound silly and juvenile, but we were both laid off over a year ago and this was a much saved for celebration (her birthday).  Budgets are our lives currently and every dollar counts to us.  It was just shady.  Shame on you.

Beware of the $5 petit-fours ladies!

excerpts: I loved how we sat at a couch and ate the scones first (upon recommendation of the waitress) because they were hot.
scones.author: Candice D.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's singlehandedly made me obsessed with afternoon tea 4 years ago.  

On a trip to San Francisco, my sister wanted to bring me to tea.
"I dont really like hot tea", said I, having only experienced boxed lipton or green tea. 

I gave it a chance, and immediately fell in love with the charm of this place.  It's so quirky and cute!  I loved how we sat at a couch and ate the scones first (upon recommendation of the waitress) because they were hot. 
I didn't know about fruit flavored herbal teas until I went to this place, complete with cream and sugar.  

I was so hyped up on sugar and caffiene after that experience that I was shaking!

I absolutely loved my first time there, and remembered it fondly.  It's what made me want to find a place in Hawaii that served afternoon tea.  The little gift shop is also a joy, 'cause I got high quality tea souviniers for my friends and such!

excerpts: I just loved the scones (hot) and the sandwitches.
The green salad was fresh as well.
scones.author: Vanilla C.
scones.review:
I loved the food so much. I give their lack of heat (ho heat at all, it was ice cold in the place, I had to keep my coat on.) 

  I ordered the Queens Tea.  I just loved the scones (hot) and the sandwitches.  The green salad was fresh as well.  I wished that they included formal serving service with that price.  

Again, my major  gripe was that is was Cold as heck in there.  The place does not  have any heat at all.  No space heaters, no central heating.  So don't go on a cold day because you will freeze in there.

excerpts: so 8 total per person), scones with clotted cream, and a salad.
You also each get to pick your tea.
I chose the mango tea which was really fragrant.
We had the chicken apple walnut salad sandwich, the salmon and cream cheese, the salmon mousse, and the pear and blue cheese.
They were all good but my favorite by far was the chicken apple walnut sandwich.
I had a petit four for dessert.
scones.author: Jacqueline C.
scones.review:
My friend took me here and I can't thank her enough! This place is so little and cute.  It's the perfect place to eat with a friend or a group of your girlfriends. 

We had the high tea for 2 which comes with a choice of 4 different types of sandwiches (2 of each kind per person so 8 total per person), scones with clotted cream, and a salad. You also each get to pick your tea. I chose the mango tea which was really fragrant. We had the chicken apple walnut salad sandwich, the salmon and cream cheese, the salmon mousse, and the pear and blue cheese. They were all good but my favorite by far was the chicken apple walnut sandwich. I had a petit four for dessert. It was good but probably better to look at than eat. 

I didn't see a lot of men here but I do think that if guys would actually give it a chance they wouldn't mind this place. But they also have meatier stuff like shepard's pie on the menu if you think that tea and sandwiches aren't going to cut it. 

Bottom line, this place has good food and tea. Yes, its a little pricey. But its definitely a worthwhile experience. I'd say try it if your curious and chances are you'll become hooked. I can't wait to go back to this place! I'm planning on taking my bridesmaids =)

excerpts: There were tables with mixed genders...and honestly, the guys looked a little awkward and out of place, no matter how much they profess love the yummy little finger sandwiches and warm scones.
It was definitely loud with chatter and laughter, but Michele and I were able to reminisce about old times and catch up each other on new gossip from our lives.
And yes, the scones are truly delish here....nicely warm
and I'm sure that they're made with insane  gobs of butter to make them so lovely and unscone-like!
scones.author: Evelyn K.
scones.review:
I am clearly not one of the first reviewers for Lovejoy's and certainly will not be one of the last, so what can I possibly say about the legendary tea room nestled in a quiet part of Noe Valley...that hasn't already been said?

An old friend and I stopped by Lovejoy's for a spot of afternoon tea on a Thursday afternoon, and the place was absolutely humming with business.  There were groups with mommies and their little girls bouncing around the room, hyped up from all the caffeine and the sweets.  There were tables with mixed genders...and honestly, the guys looked a little awkward and out of place, no matter how much they profess love the yummy little finger sandwiches and warm scones.  It was definitely loud with chatter and laughter, but Michele and I were able to reminisce about old times and catch up each other on new gossip from our lives.  I was just at her wedding in La Jolla a few weeks ago and of course she was so preoccupied then, we hardly had a few moments to talk then.

A perfectly "delightful" afternoon!  I'd highly recommend the black currant tea -- it was fruity, without being overly sweet.  And yes, the scones are truly delish here....nicely warm and I'm sure that they're made with insane  gobs of butter to make them so lovely and unscone-like!

excerpts: The scones were very good but they was lacking lemon curd.
Only strawberry jam and clotted cream were served on the tray.
My cup was stained and the cutlery was unpolished - sort of a shabby "chic" ambiance.
I would not say that this was the best tea I have been served but it was very nice for a Saturday afternoon.
scones.author: MICHELLE B.
scones.review:
Hi.  We had tea there on Saturday.  We were 15 minutes late for out reservation but were treated nicely and seated promptly. The ambiance is like a tea party for a child but still ok for adults.  There are mostly women who were either having a girls day out or having a shower of some sort.  The tea was delicious.  The little sandwiches and pastry were good, the fruit ok.
The scones were very good but they was lacking lemon curd. Only strawberry jam and clotted cream were served on the tray.  My cup was stained and the cutlery was unpolished - sort of a shabby "chic" ambiance.  I would not say that this was the best tea I have been served but it was very nice for a Saturday afternoon.

excerpts: She then came back with three-tiered trays holding crust-free sandwiches, salad, scones, and fresh fruit.
scones.author: Anna Marie P.
scones.review:
Well, at least we looked like we fit the part. 

My friends and I capped off the end of a bachelorette weekend with a tea party for 11 here. Dressed in our colorful sundresses, we giggled in anticipation as we walked to our table and saw the "Reserved for the Queen" sign. For many of us, it was our first high tea experience. After we seated ourselves, our server met us with a warm smile. She poured us two kinds of teas to begin with, one caffeinated, the other Vanilla Roibos herbal. She then came back with three-tiered trays holding crust-free sandwiches, salad, scones, and fresh fruit. It was all so lovely.

Less than eight minutes later, the tray on my end of the table, which I shared with three other friends, was empty. We scarfed down those yummy sandwiches so fast that our kind host came back with an incredulous look on her face. I'm pretty sure we broke the record for quickest disappearance of food. One of my friends was breathing deeply as if she'd just finished sprinting. The other was slathering the double Devon cream on anything she could get her hands on. The bachelorette's mother who was sitting near us kept offering me sandwiches from her tray because she and the others were nibbling at a normal tea party pace. I politely turned her down because I had held my own and devoured my fair share of the tray.

So much for a leisurely two-hour sitting. We were outta there in one hour. I highly recommend the sliced pear and stilton cheese sandwiches, the chestnut tea, and the lemon petit four. Just don't go with my friends and me, unless you got quick hands that is.

excerpts: The scones with the Devon cream were scrumptious.
What a wonderful place.
The tea was amazing.
They gave us a bottomless pot.
I didn't know it was possible to drink this much tea in one sitting.
Lovejoys definitely has character.
I love the look and comfort of this place.
Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go again.
scones.author: Lauren B.
scones.review:
I love this place!!!!!!!!  Went here with my mom for mothers day.  We ordered the high tea for two.  Before I arrived I expected to leave hungry.  I mean how could some tea satisfy my empty stomach?  Boy was I wrong.  I was stuffed!  Delicious sandwiches.  Sliced cucumber, fig, smoked salmon, hummus, etc.  They were sooooooo good.  The scones with the Devon cream were scrumptious.  What a wonderful place.  The tea was amazing.  They gave us a bottomless pot.  I didn't know it was possible to drink this much tea in one sitting.
  Lovejoys definitely has character.  I love the look and comfort of this place.  Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go again.

excerpts: Scones with double devon cream, salmon & cream cheese sandwiches, and chicken walnut apple sandwiches were yummy!
scones.author: Sharon S.
scones.review:
My, my, my... upon entering this lovely tearoom, I was immediately swept away into another world. A world where it is sweetly comfortable, welcoming, and soothing. Just like visiting an old friend or grandma. 

We had the Queen's Tea during a chilly afternoon, and it was quite delightful to sip a nice variety of hot tea to warm the soul. I was particularly fond of the fruity teas, such as mango and peach! Everything was wonderfully delish! Scones with double devon cream, salmon & cream cheese sandwiches, and chicken walnut apple sandwiches were yummy!

I am definitely returning!

excerpts: There are delicious hot scones, savory sandwiches (you chose from the menu two choices), a fabulous green salad and coleslaw, sliced fruit, lemon curd and devon cream, at the end she comes around with a platter of petite fours - the "wedding cake"  and the "orange" are lovely as are the other choices.
scones.author: Teresa P.
scones.review:
I have visited Lovejoy's Tea Shop at Clipper in San Francisco for a number of years for special occasions and I am NEVER, NEVER disappointed! I have given them FIVE STARS because they DESERVE THEM.

Definitely call for a reservation if you want to guarantee seating! It is always hopping yet it feels very intimate when you are seated. The eccentric decor, the comfortable "grandmother's" home feel is perfect for a visit to a tea shop. The food is ALWAYS fresh and delicious.   My favorite "Queen's Tea" comes with the whole works! Your waitress comes by and checks with you during your visit. She brings the teapot, I enjoy the house blend, and the fun begins!

There are delicious hot scones, savory sandwiches (you chose from the menu two choices), a fabulous green salad and coleslaw, sliced fruit, lemon curd and devon cream, at the end she comes around with a platter of petite fours - the "wedding cake"  and the "orange" are lovely as are the other choices.

When you visit Lovejoy's time slows down - one hour will feel like two.  If you can't stay, Lovejoy's does takeout and you can have your own party at home.

 You will not regret going to this wonderful teashop.

excerpts: It is so cute, and the perfect place to go and sit with your girlfriends, while eating sandwiches, scones, and endless pots of tea.
scones.author: Dana O.
scones.review: This place is the best. It is so cute, and the perfect place to go and sit with your girlfriends, while eating sandwiches, scones, and endless pots of tea. I've been to high tea at other tea spots around the country, and nothing compares to the feel you get at Lovejoys. The sandwiches are nothing gourmet (white bread and mayonnaise!), and the tea is great but nothing exotic, but that is what they are all about. It is a classic high tea place, not a new-age or vegan or hipster hang-out. I love the mixes of tea cups, plates, and pots, the creaky wood floors, and the wait staff. Definitely call ahead and make reservations if you want to go on a weekend, though.

excerpts: It was 5 of us all getting the high tea which includes salad, scones, preservatives, double devon cream (YUM!), 2 mini sandwiches of choice, and of course tea.
scones.author: kimy l.
scones.review:
Love Joy transports you back to another time. The decor is quintessentially what I associate with English tea only more relaxed. Ther plates and cups are cute and nothing matches so it's interesting to look at the patterns of the teaware.

First place I've ever been where they serve the mini sandwiches with the crusts cut off. For those of you who have watched the movie "Brownsugar"

 I need you to be happy for me. I need you to be there for me, just like you asked of me. So - so I can have tea and eat cucumber sandwiches with the crust cut off!

It was 5 of us all getting the high tea which includes salad, scones, preservatives, double devon cream (YUM!), 2 mini sandwiches of choice, and of course tea.

We all shared our sandwiches. We got the smoked turkey & dijon, salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut, roast beef & horseradish, and fig and olive tapenade.

All the sandwiches were good and I was surprisingly full off the food. It 's a cute place to spend time with your girlfriends.

excerpts: Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.
And I have (to date)
scones.author: Joanna R.
scones.review:
I've been to this place since it was at the other location on 24th and Church.  Since then I have moved out of San Francisco, but I still occasionally return to this tea shop!!!  Their sandwiches and teas are wonderful.  Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.  And I have (to date) NEVER left the place hungry!

Note: Block off two hours for this experience of having a nice, easy comfortable tea and get away from civilization!!!  You *deserve* it!  (Also, make sure you go on a day when it's typical foggy San Francisco too!)

Of course, I can only go here with a female friend.  The decor is too "feminine" for my "macho" hubby to feel comfortable, even though he LOVES tea!  That's okay though...more finger sandwiches and Tea Room Blend tea for ME!!!  :-P~~ *evil grin*

excerpts:
---you will be surprisingly full if you eat all your sandwiches, salad, scones w/butter and jam and cookie!  save some jam for the cookie too =)
CHINA ROSE is my tea of choice and the Vanilla Roobois seems to be a favorite if you need to go decaf (what's decaf?!)
scones.author: TC C.
scones.review:
Great place for English Tea in the city!  I've been going to Lovejoy's for years and I even dragged my husband here recently and he liked it as well.  He said it reminded him of enjoying tea in England!

The decor is, dare I say, shabby sheek, but after many years in business it's leaning a bit more towards the shabby side.  My tablecloth was just a tad too worn w/one too many tea stains, and the pillows need some re-filling and re-covering by now.

The service and tea are still great though as one can tell by how packed it is at peak times, especially on weekends.  I always call ahead first to make a reservation or check to see if I can get a table last minute.
Most will love Lovejoy's for its simple charm and lack of pretension.

Favorites/the norm: High Tea for Two 
-beef w/horseradish, chutney and cheese, chicken w/asparagus & pear w/stilton---you will be surprisingly full if you eat all your sandwiches, salad, scones w/butter and jam and cookie!  save some jam for the cookie too =)
CHINA ROSE is my tea of choice and the Vanilla Roobois seems to be a favorite if you need to go decaf (what's decaf?!)

My last visit: there was a pretty annoying group next to me (half a dozen little girls hyped-up on sugar whilst their Moms chit-chatted with one another and let their girls run wild.  Not Lovejoy's fault, but beware of sitting next to a party like this if you are not entertained by children who are obnoxious and ill-behaved!  Ever heard of "indoor voices?!?!").  

Suffice to say, lots of groups here on the weekends in general, so bring your group and join in!!!

excerpts: SCONES: to die for!
scones.author: Bella B.
scones.review:
Really good service. 

Quaint decor with many antique and vintage details -- table settings, tables, chairs, wall decorations, antique fine china and serving pieces.

The interior is small, and while the tables are close together, it felt cozy. I have to admit, that while walking to our table, I was scared I was going to accidentally bump and break something. (I have a hard time imagining someone maneuvering a baby stroller through here.)

I love the fine china! Who would have thought mixing-and-matching would work so well. 

I think it's the original floor, it's warped; while we at at the table half of us thought we were tilting forward, the other half tilting back.

You need to check out the bathroom, cute decor. (The sign about the original plumbing. Only one unisex bathroom in the establishment.)

I think the largest table holds up to 6 people.

I wouldn't recommend having a party for more than 4-5 kids. Kids should be approx 7 yrs or older. (If you're looking for a place where kids can play, take them to something like Chuck E. Cheese, or Super Frank's.)

Saw a father-daughter-grandmother tea time -- very cute.

HIGH TEA

Tea: Single Estate Ceylon was very good.

Sandwiches:
1) Smoked Salmon was delicious. Smoked salmon had a smooth flavor, and melted in my mouth. (Better than a bagel with lox!)
2) Chicken Apple Walnut was also delicious.
3) Chicken Asparagus was interesting. I didn't expect the asparagus to be pureed.
4) Egg & Onion. If you you like egg salad. (I'm not a fan of egg salad sandwiches.)

SCONES: to die for! Moist and fluffy, with delicious clotted cream.

Shortbread tea biscuit: yummy; but would chose the scone over the shortbread if given a choice.

Good experience.

excerpts: The delicate-ness of their sandwiches, scones and cookies, and the Devonshire cream will expand your waistline.
scones.author: Jen L.
scones.review:
Everyone should have an English grandmother.  Or at least tried English tea service once in their lives.  Really.

If you've ever had tea with your grandmother (or played tea with your stuffed animals), this place will jog some fond memories.  It's a quaint English-style service of tea.  I've gone for a number of special occasions and it's done up in all that good old fashioned English-lace-mismatched teacup decor.  The delicate-ness of their sandwiches, scones and cookies, and the Devonshire cream will expand your waistline. 

So wear something (((expandable))).  Reservations are a must, especially on weekends and with mom's day coming up, it's a popular place. 

And if sitting around English antiques isn't enough for you, check out their small shop across the street.  Bottoms up!

excerpts: The scones were so wonderful (the boyfriend prefers the American version of scones to these, the British kind, but I thought they were great).
The devonshire cream and strawberry preserves you can put on the sweet stuff is phenomenal, too.
The boy couldn't turn down buying an orange-chocolate petit four from the tray that was brought around by the owner.
That was also good.
scones.author: Heather T.
scones.review:
I think this will always stand out in my mind as one of the best things I did on vacation in San Francisco.

I took my boyfriend with me on a mid-afternoon jaunt to Lovejoy's.  We ordered High Tea for Two.  I was a little worried that even though it *sounds* like a lot of food, the portions would be dainty.  Not at all!  We're both champion eaters, and this was enough to fill us up.  

I was absolutely in love with the Artichoke-Hummus sandwich, but we were both enamored by the Pear & Stilton sandwich.  The scones were so wonderful (the boyfriend prefers the American version of scones to these, the British kind, but I thought they were great).  The devonshire cream and strawberry preserves you can put on the sweet stuff is phenomenal, too.  The boy couldn't turn down buying an orange-chocolate petit four from the tray that was brought around by the owner.  That was also good.  :)  We had the Tea Room Blend-tea as well as Blood Orange tea.  Both were excellent (particularly the Blood Orange, which was surprising in its deliciousness).

Beyond the food, though, the atmosphere is above reproach.  It was so cozy, calm, friendly and just....happy.  I felt so at home here, and I've never been too much of a girly-girl.  The waitstaff was beyond attentive, but not at *all* obtrusive.  There were several tables full of people, but they still noticed when you needed a clean plate for your scone.  Our waitress complimented our sandwich choices.  I'm sure they do that all the time, but it was a lovely touch because it *seemed* genuine, even if it wasn't.  

I truly wish that this place existed in Madison.  I would go as often as I could!  Please take advantage of this gem of a restaurant if you can.  :)

excerpts: Yummy tea sandwiches, delicious scones, and fabulous tea served in mismatched teacups and cute pots.
Not your grandma's teahouse...or maybe it is...
if she's got panache.
Perfect place for a chatty date.
scones.author: Nathalie P.
scones.review:
This place takes you to a Merchant Ivory set without the annoying characters. Yummy tea sandwiches, delicious scones, and fabulous tea served in mismatched teacups and cute pots. Not your grandma's teahouse...or maybe it is...if she's got panache.
Perfect place for a chatty date.

excerpts: Nice selection of sandwiches, but they're teeny, and a good selection of tea, but the Devon "clotted cream" with the scones was horrible and
not the genuine stuff at all.
Maybe it's really hard to get here, but this was clearly not the real, delicious, super-rich, mccoy, and instead had that distinct UHT long-life flavor to it.

Unless you're one of them, I suppose

Also, fyi, but this is just me being nit-picky, but if they're going for the Anglo-styley with the tea-room thing, they should know that in Britain sandwiches, cookies, tea and scones is called Tea, not High Tea.
scones.author: emily c.
scones.review:
Ho Hum. Average I'd say. Maybe I have certain expectations for tea-time as I'm English but I'd have to say Lovejoy's is only so so. Sure, it has a really nice atmosphere - quaint mismatched china, cute olde-worlde decoration - and the waitresses were nice, but where you get to sit in the room makes quite a bit of difference and the food, well, it just isn't that fabulous for the price. Nice selection of sandwiches, but they're teeny, and a good selection of tea, but the Devon "clotted cream" with the scones was horrible and not the genuine stuff at all. Maybe it's really hard to get here, but this was clearly not the real, delicious, super-rich, mccoy, and instead had that distinct UHT long-life flavor to it. Yeuk. 

Overall, cutesy and sweet place, but really overpriced for what you get and the food just isn't that great. Also, all the women there in their pastel-colored chanel-style suits and high-heeled shoes ooing and ahing over the bridal/baby shower gifts get a little annoying. Unless you're one of them, I suppose

Also, fyi, but this is just me being nit-picky, but if they're going for the Anglo-styley with the tea-room thing, they should know that in Britain sandwiches, cookies, tea and scones is called Tea, not High Tea. High Tea is an early dinner kind of meal, usually for kids who don't eat late, where you eat something like baked beans and bangers, or fried eggs on toast. 

Hmm, yeah, sorry, that was a bit nit-picky.

excerpts: All my girlfriends LOVED the warm scones with preserves and devon cream.
scones.author: Lisandra F.
scones.review:
I have been here two times and I have had great food and service both times. 

On my most recent visit I reserved a table for a group of 8 girl friends for my birthday. They were all new to this tea room and the whole tea experience but they all raved about Lovejoy's for days. We had the High tea and it was enough food and tea for us to leave satisfied and full.

I tried many of the tea sandiwiches but chicken apple walnut was my favorite. The tea room blend and the pomegrante green tea were good.  All my girlfriends LOVED the warm scones with preserves and devon cream. I wish I had one right now.

Lovejoy's is a  great spot to gossip over tea with friends.

excerpts: Of course scones and clotted cream were on the table.
To add to the event we blocked off an hour with the clairvoyant tarot card reader -- so accurate some of the guests returned on their own to have follow up readings!
Lovejoy's also offers party services for little girls 4 years of age and up -- this includes elegant clothing for tea party dress up!
This is where my daughter will be having her 4th birthday for sure...
scones.author: Tanya P.
scones.review:
This is very much a Bohemian tea room, so expect eclectic -- not coordinating -- tea sets and flatware. Great for just meeting up or for an event. My cousin and I hosted a bridal tea shower for her little sister here. It was a grownup tea party for the girls at heart -- and I'm a guy's girl so that's saying a lot. A lovely spread of assorted tea sandwiches ranging from smoked salmon, cream cheese and watercress to roast beef with horse radish. Of course scones and clotted cream were on the table. To add to the event we blocked off an hour with the clairvoyant tarot card reader -- so accurate some of the guests returned on their own to have follow up readings!

Lovejoy's also offers party services for little girls 4 years of age and up -- this includes elegant clothing for tea party dress up! This is where my daughter will be having her 4th birthday for sure...

excerpts: The scones were yummy, too - still warm and sweet w/raisins.
But they were taken to the next level, with the BEST Double Devon Cream.
I don't care if it's a heart attack on a butter knife - MMMMM.
Definitely make reservations early.
Our group lucked out on a last minute cancellation.
scones.author: CINDY K.
scones.review:
I can't fight the urge to break out the British accent whenever I go to a tea room. It was on full tilt at Lovejoy's.  My companions and I had "a jolly good time" there - it's got that packed to the rafters antique store kind of feel to it.  I wish I had worn a flowery dress with a hat and neat white gloves. 
We all went for the Light Tea Service, and between the six of us, we got a good selection of the sandwiches to share and 3 different teas.  The Fig & Olive Tapenade and the chicken apple walnuts were my favs.  
The scones were yummy, too - still warm and sweet w/raisins. But they were taken to the next level, with the BEST Double Devon Cream.  I don't care if it's a heart attack on a butter knife - MMMMM.  
Definitely make reservations early.  Our group lucked out on a last minute cancellation.

excerpts: We got a bottomless pot of tea, 4 sandwiches of our choice, scones, salad, and cole slaw.
scones.author: Nicole L.
scones.review:
Mismatched antique cups and an atmosphere just like a grandma's house. Lovejoys is an adorably cute tea room that is the perfect place to meet up with girlfriends to chat over tea and little snacks. I went to Lovejoys with 2 girlfriends and had an awesome time. We were seated on the red couch in the back which was perfect because it made us feel like we were chatting it up in one of our living rooms. 

For the three of us we ordered the High Tea for Two. We got a bottomless pot of tea, 4 sandwiches of our choice, scones, salad, and cole slaw. 

Service was fast and friendly, the 3 of us spent 3 hours hanging out at Lovejoys and the waitresses in no way made us feel like we had to leave. Instead they offered us tasty Petit Fours and allowed us to finish up our girl talk. I'd definitely recommend their little cakes, i particularly enjoyed the orange butter cream sponge cake one. I'd also recommend making reservations. The place gets packed quickly and only a few tables are available for walk ins and because they allow you to sit in there for as long as you'd like most tables don't clear out for a couple of hours. 

We had such a great time we've already made plans to come back again! Great place for gal pals to chat up a storm.

excerpts: The tea selection is excellent, and the scones are insane.
scones.author: M P.
scones.review: Deeeeelicious, adorable, great service, a highly recommended experience - they were even gracious and welcoming when I showed up by myself without a reservation.  The tea selection is excellent, and the scones are insane.  High tea for one, yum!

excerpts: My friend and I got the Queen's tea, which included sandwiches, scones with jam and clotted cream
scones.author: Jing P.
scones.review: This place....is perfection. There's an assortment of really cute and quirky wooden chairs, tables, and china and it's just oh-so-charming. When you make a reservation, they reserve a table that says "Reserved for Royalty/Queens/etc" which is the cutest thing ever. Also, always make a reservation, even if it doesn't seem like it would be a busy day. My friend and I got the Queen's tea, which included sandwiches, scones with jam and clotted cream (SO FRICKING GOOD), petit fours, fresh fruit, crumpets, and two pots of bottomless tea. We went for the tea house blend (which is very similar to Irish breakfast) and the dragon well with pomegranate leaves. We spent about two and a half hours enjoying the atmosphere, the delicious food, and tea. The service and staff are amazing! They kept warming up or adding hot water to our tea and making sure we were satisfied. Of the sandwiches, chicken asparagus was definitely both our favorites, but everything was miniature, bit-size, and tasty. I LOVED it! Lovejoy's is definitely kind of expensive, but it's well worth going all out rather than trying to get the cheapest options. Plus, it's a place to sit and enjoy the ambiance for a while, to catch up and chat. I will definitely be coming here again!

excerpts:
- Delicious warm scones with double Devonshire cream and jam
- Tea sandwiches to die for
- Yummy petit fours
- Mis-matched antique furniture, cups and dishes
- AMAZING, ATTENTIVE, SUPER FRIENDLY service
scones.author: Brendon C.
scones.review:
This is probably my favorite place in San Francisco.

If you're going on a weekend, you must book WAY ahead, but it is SO worth it.

Why do I love it so?

- Fantastic teas (and bottomless tea pots)
- Delicious warm scones with double Devonshire cream and jam
- Tea sandwiches to die for
- Yummy petit fours
- Mis-matched antique furniture, cups and dishes
- AMAZING, ATTENTIVE, SUPER FRIENDLY service
- AFFORDABLE

A full tea service with scone, bottomless pot of tea, two kinds of tea sandwiches, and a tea cookie is something like $13.  I had high tea at the Palace Hotel once, and it was $50 per person (!) for lower quality product and service.

Lovejoy's is all the fun and sophistication of high tea, without all the snootiness and pretense. Whether you're dressed as a pauper or a prince, you'll always be treated like royalty here.

excerpts: We ordered a few teas (they even had caffeine free ones, which was perfect for my then-pregnant sister) and some sets of high-tea food, which included various sandwiches and scones.
Some tasted better than others, but I guess we eat a lot, because after we left, we went off to eat some more food elsewhere.
The decorations in here are also nice with old English style furniture, and couches as well, and also various styles of teapots.
scones.author: Anita C.
scones.review:
Came here with my sisters and my nephew (a girl's day out, with the exception of my nephew). They have seatings at 11am and 1pm on the weekend so we took the 11am. When we got there a few minutes before 11, there was a wait outside since they don't open the doors until 11. Right after they open the doors, the places fills up instantly with everyone who made reservations.

We ordered a few teas (they even had caffeine free ones, which was perfect for my then-pregnant sister) and some sets of high-tea food, which included various sandwiches and scones. Some tasted better than others, but I guess we eat a lot, because after we left, we went off to eat some more food elsewhere. The decorations in here are also nice with old English style furniture, and couches as well, and also various styles of teapots.

excerpts: The teas are great, and the scones are to die for.
Staff is very helpful.
scones.author: Cee J.
scones.review:
Lovejoy's is like an uber cute Victorian dollhouse come to life. Decorated with frilly pink curtains, antiques, and little teapots, this is the ideal place for girlfriends to catch up over a tea party setting. Great place for a bridal or baby shower too.  The teas are great, and the scones are to die for. Staff is very helpful. Boys: KEEP OUT!

Tip: Be sure to make reservations at least one week in advance! This place books up fast! If you feel like dropping in, be prepared to wait at least an hour.

excerpts: The sandwiches were good, but I was most impressed with the scones and lemon curd and clotted cream.
I thought clotted cream was supposed to be not good-
but I really liked it!
scones.author: Retired B.
scones.review:
Love this place because they give soooooo much food. I did the "queen's tea" with 10+ other girls and we could not even finish everything. 

The sandwiches were good, but I was most impressed with the scones and lemon curd and clotted cream. I thought clotted cream was supposed to be not good- but I really liked it! I only tried two teas since that's all they gave us, it would have been better if we tried more varieties around the table. 

I'll definitely be back again.

excerpts: The sandwiches fill us all up good and scones came after which really put me in a food coma.
Overall, a great place to celebrate anything - promotion, engagement, birthday, etc.
scones.author: Kelly C.
scones.review: At first, I thought the name - Lovejoy's Tea Room - was pretty funny so this would be a great place to have afternoon tea with the girls. Place opens at 11 and already a full house. Luckily, I reserved a table way in advance for my party and got the best seats in the house next to the lovely window. it was a nice set up. Lovejoy definitely had alot of attention to details which included cute plates and cups. My friend and I even flip the plates over to see where they bought them from (Japan and England). I docked one star for being too squishy. You almost feel like you're walking on eggshells in that place hoping not to knock something or someone over because it's so tight.  We ordered 5 "high tea for 2" meal sets which came with 5 different choices of tea and 2 sandwiches per person. The sandwiches fill us all up good and scones came after which really put me in a food coma. Overall, a great place to celebrate anything - promotion, engagement, birthday, etc.

excerpts: The tea for 3 came with 6 selections of different sandwiches, (3 mini sandwiches of each type), salad with a horseradish balsamic vinegar dressing, Cole slaw, 3 cookies, 3 HUGE scones and 3 pots of tea.
The tea was bottomless; I had the mango tea which was very fruity and tropical.
I also tried the passion fruit tea and the chamomile tea which were also very good.
They are all loose leaf teas so they gave us a strainer to put on top of our cups when we poured our tea.
We had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, bay shrimp with mayo, roast beef with horseradish, egg with onion, turkey with cranberry, and a walnut with chicken and apple sandwiches.
My personal favorites out of all of them were the smoked salmon and the bay shrimp.
The service was great, they kept filling our teapots with water and constantly asked if everything was ok.
The only downside when you drink like 10 cups of tea was the bathroom issue.
There is only one bathroom with one toilet.
The line was long and I had to wait impatiently for the bathroom since I really had to go.
The bill came out to be about 22 a person
and I would definitely come back
scones.author: Shirley W.
scones.review:
My friends and I had the tea for 2 and added an extra 17.99 for 3 people. All I can say is the food and tea were amazing! The tea for 3 came with 6 selections of different sandwiches, (3 mini sandwiches of each type), salad with a horseradish balsamic vinegar dressing, Cole slaw, 3 cookies, 3 HUGE scones and 3 pots of tea.
The tea was bottomless; I had the mango tea which was very fruity and tropical. I also tried the passion fruit tea and the chamomile tea which were also very good. They are all loose leaf teas so they gave us a strainer to put on top of our cups when we poured our tea. 
We had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, bay shrimp with mayo, roast beef with horseradish, egg with onion, turkey with cranberry, and a walnut with chicken and apple sandwiches. My personal favorites out of all of them were the smoked salmon and the bay shrimp. =)
The service was great, they kept filling our teapots with water and constantly asked if everything was ok. The only downside when you drink like 10 cups of tea was the bathroom issue. There is only one bathroom with one toilet. The line was long and I had to wait impatiently for the bathroom since I really had to go. 
The bill came out to be about 22 a person and I would definitely come back

excerpts:
Likes:
+ Scones, but I think they should use yellow raisins instead of regular
+ Ambience and mismatched china are fun and girly
+ Very yummy sandwiches.

I like chicken apple walnut, egg and onion, and bay shrimp with mayo
+
Good tea selection
+ Fruit is always ripe and fresh
scones.author: Kandi K.
scones.review:
I have been going to Lovejoy's for a long time, and it's pretty good.  I would say the best tea house in town, although there aren't many to choose from.

Likes:
+ Scones, but I think they should use yellow raisins instead of regular
+ Ambience and mismatched china are fun and girly
+ Very yummy sandwiches.  I like chicken apple walnut, egg and onion, and bay shrimp with mayo
+ Good tea selection
+ Fruit is always ripe and fresh
+ Service/friendliness has improved over the past couple of years

Dislikes:
- They grab my tea pot before I can stop them to "top off" with more hot water.  It dilutes my tea.  I like my tea strong.
- I don't like how if I order tea service with other people, we have to share a serving of jam/cream.  I want my own little container!

excerpts: Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones.
The scones are good.
scones.author: Mister K.
scones.review:
Went here for the first time with our 18 year old daughter. It was a fun time, and she loved it. The cuteness of the place, the outfits the servers wear...all that was just right, as you'd expect it to be. And, it didn't feel like a chain - more like someone's creative idea for a restaurant. They could even go more British...play some Henry Purcell in the background or something. Have pictures of the horse races.

Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones. The scones are good. My wife got the high tea, which comes with sandwiches. They were fine, but nothing particularly great. Right, it was probably Safeway bread, not some freshly baked bread. 

The tea is good quality. Perhaps not insane quality, but good quality.

I had the Stilton and pear salad, which was very good. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but perfectly good for the moment. I suppose you'd never waste a really top-notch Stilton this way, but for the salad, the cheese tasted good.

All in all, a fun thing to do, and we'll hope to come back.

excerpts: However I must say that their scones were to die for.
As I put the first bite in my mouth I think I literally died for a second.
It was heaven.
They were warm
and
oh so buttery.
They bring out the scones with their own special butter and jam which takes it to a whole other level.
Overall my experience here was awesome.
I can't wait to go back.
scones.author: Niki F.
scones.review:
How cool is this place??!! Me and my good friend stopped in for lunch the other day and had such a pleasant experience. Let me first state that when you walk into this restaurant you feel like you're sitting in the middle of a London cafe. Although I have never been to London, I imagine it to be exactly this way. The decor was so fun! It's more of an afternoon spot you go with some girlfriends...not really a date spot. 
The tea was very tasty. You get so many options to choose from!!! the best part is that they keep refilling your kettle and each person get's their own!
Their sandwiches are delicious. Small, yet very flavorful! Again so many delicious choices, you really can't go wrong. However I must say that their scones were to die for. As I put the first bite in my mouth I think I literally died for a second. It was heaven. They were warm and oh so buttery. They bring out the scones with their own special butter and jam which takes it to a whole other level. 
Overall my experience here was awesome. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: I had to Queens Tea which is $24.95 per person and comes with two sandwiches of your choice (I had artichoke hummus and pear with stilton), coleslaw, greens, scones, devon cream, preserves, crumpet, lemon curd, fruit, petit four, and a biscuit and of course your choice of tea.
It was 5 years ago and I still think about it and need to return.
Its not an everyday thing, of course.
But it is a wonderful luxury every once in a while.
scones.author: Mr. E.
scones.review: Adorable tea service in a setting to match. I had to Queens Tea which is $24.95 per person and comes with two sandwiches of your choice (I had artichoke hummus and pear with stilton), coleslaw, greens, scones, devon cream, preserves, crumpet, lemon curd, fruit, petit four, and a biscuit and of course your choice of tea. It was 5 years ago and I still think about it and need to return. Its not an everyday thing, of course. But it is a wonderful luxury every once in a while.

excerpts: Old fashioned place to meet with girlfriends for tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours.
This is a great place for a certain type of person looking for a certain type of ambience.
scones.author: Cathy L.
scones.review: Old fashioned place to meet with girlfriends for tea sandwiches, scones, petit fours.  This is a great place for a certain type of person looking for a certain type of ambience.

excerpts: The warm scones with lemon curd and cream was divine (and I've never described anything as divine in my life)
Had the  Smoked salmon with Cream Cheese and the Chicken apple walnut tea sandwich (How can I go back to eating bread crust ever again?)

I also tasted my friend's cheese and chutney (a little too strong for me)
4.
There was A LOT of food.
scones.author: joanna c.
scones.review:
Wow!
Came here with 3 other girls (the place is packed with women). We each had the Queen's Tea.

1. The warm scones with lemon curd and cream was divine (and I've never described anything as divine in my life)
2. Had the  Smoked salmon with Cream Cheese and the Chicken apple walnut tea sandwich (How can I go back to eating bread crust ever again?)
3. I also tasted my friend's cheese and chutney (a little too strong for me)
4. There was A LOT of food. Fruit, coleslaw, crumpets, tea biscuits, and dessert. I wish I could eat them all. 
5. The Lady Grey tea (not on the menu) was really good. Earl Grey with Mango! 

Will definitely go back for more.

excerpts: We had "high tea for two" that come with 2 scones, 4 sandwiches, coleslaw, salad green, shortbread, and of course, bottomless tea.
scones.author: Yoko S.
scones.review:
My friend and I had a wonderful time there today.

We had "high tea for two" that come with 2 scones, 4 sandwiches, coleslaw, salad green, shortbread, and of course, bottomless tea.

I had black current tea, which I thought was perfect match with the food we've had.  Food was pretty good, but what I liked the best was the shortbread tea biscuit.  It didn't look like a lot of food as those sandwiches are quite small, but we were almost too full by the time we left the tea room.  It was $32 for 2 of us - reasonable in my opinion.

This place is pretty girlie as you can imagine.  Reserved seats have small card that says "reserved for queens."  Too girlie for guys unless they don't mind to be referred as queens.

Making reservation in advance is recommended since they seem to be booked almost every weekend.

excerpts: The scones were yummy with the preserves and double devon cream.
The teas we had were the Apricot black tea and the special during that time, which I don't really remember.
The teas were nice and went well with our food, but nothing too exciting.
scones.author: Phoi B.
scones.review:
Tea, cuteness, and mini-sandwiches... this place is right up my alley.
