Lovejoy's is a quaint little tea room that offers a variety of teas (duh!), sandwiches, and sweets. My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied. We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches. Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up. The scones were yummy with the preserves and double devon cream. The teas we had were the Apricot black tea and the special during that time, which I don't really remember. The teas were nice and went well with our food, but nothing too exciting. The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd. They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish. Mmm : 9

Being in this place made me feel warm and giddy. I would definitely recommend Lovejoy's and hope to make a trip back there soon!

excerpts: Tea sandwiches, good salads, scones with clotted cream to die for, tasty sweets, and neverending tea service!
scones.author: Jennifer J.
scones.review:
Lovelovelove this place. It makes me feel like I'm at my grandma's house with all the lace, and cozies and doilies and shit. Plus, I feel real right and proper and a bit British--which I am clearly not.

The food is yumyum. Tea sandwiches, good salads, scones with clotted cream to die for, tasty sweets, and neverending tea service!

The crowd is mostly ladies: bachelorette parties, bday parties, bridal showers, which I would normally hate, but I can tune that shit out in this place. If a bridal shower from Burlingame and white pumps don't annoy me, then you know this place is the jam. 

Just don't talk about blowjobs while you're there. It's not polite lady conversation and is frowned upon by your neighbors who can hear every word because the tables are pretty close.

That's all. I can't wait until I get back there...

excerpts: The scones, clotted cream and jam were a delight!
As were the rich little butter biscuits.
The chicken cranberry walnut sandwich was very bland, though.
The sandwiches generally weren't very inspiring.
It was a nice tough to include a an organic salad bed, but you have to scoop the salad onto your plate.
They also serve a not insubstantial amount of coleslaw, but it tastes awful.
The service and tea was divine.
scones.author: Kimmie M.
scones.review: The scones, clotted cream and jam were a delight! As were the rich little butter biscuits. The chicken cranberry walnut sandwich was very bland, though. The sandwiches generally weren't very inspiring. It was a nice tough to include a an organic salad bed, but you have to scoop the salad onto your plate. They also serve a not insubstantial amount of coleslaw, but it tastes awful. The service and tea was divine.

excerpts: Very successfully gave myself a food coma with all the yummy sandwiches, scones and tea.
Great for a brunch with your girlfriends, but the men did seem a little awkward :-)
scones.author: Brooke C.
scones.review: Went here with my family for Father's day/birthday brunch and we had so much fun.  The food was great, fun atmosphere for a non-stuffy high tea. Very successfully gave myself a food coma with all the yummy sandwiches, scones and tea.  Great for a brunch with your girlfriends, but the men did seem a little awkward :-)

excerpts:
The scones, topped with clotted cream and 
lemon curd, though laden with calories, were devilishly
delightful.
scones.author: Carmen H.
scones.review:
I'm no newcomer to afternoon tea, having even
experienced three in London - at the Ritz, the Savoy
and at Brown's.  Less than thirty minutes drive from
my Daly City home, I'm delighted to have experienced
Lovejoy's, at the recommendation of a dear friend
and colleague who has long been insisting that we
go there.

We recently treated another colleague for her birthday
and totally indulged.  What a lovely afternoon!!  We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.  Everything was spectacular.  My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-
radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.  The scones, topped with clotted cream and 
lemon curd, though laden with calories, were devilishly
delightful.

At the end of our feast, we were served some scrumptious petit 
fours, followed by more tea, and happily waddled our way into the afternoon.

I purchased the beautiful strawberry teapot that held my
passionfruit tea....everything there is practically for sale...
at the teahouse or in their gift shop across the street.

Lovejoy's is a special place for an afternoon with the 
girls or one of the guys who appreciates some place 
special and unique.

excerpts: The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . .

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.
scones.author: Audrey S.
scones.review:
I feel very girlie when I come to this place for tea. It's very charming, very feminine. Shawls are thrown over couches -or on the flowery upholstered chairs, lace dollies are scattered here and there, and you drink from delicate tea cups, and eat tiny sandwiches (with the crust taken off). I like that the furniture and even the tea wear is mismatched. Sort of what one might expect in granny's old house. 

For me, the place feels like what I imagined when I had my tea parties as a young child. Well, except for the fact that the food and tea are real and so are the people (no, Mr. Brown Bear or Mrs. Rabbit in attendance). 

But Lovejoy's  can get stuffy. The place is always packed with people. The hot pots of tea also add to the temperature a bit. Reservations are HIGHLY suggested!

Anyway, I love the fact that this quiant place will "top off" your tea pot, thus insuring a very HOT pot of tea. The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . . gosh, everything is delicious.  

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.

It's a wonderful place to get away from it all and relax.

excerpts: I filled up on little tea sandwiches, crumpets, scones, etc etc etc.
The Queen's tea was a good amount of food and let you sample a variety of things.
mmmmmmmm
The service was friendly, refilled our pots often and with a smile, and didn't kill me when my purse was constantly in their way (my bad :( )
scones.author: Tara O.
scones.review:
Freaking adorable. Seriously. 

I came here with two girlfriends for some tea and catch up time. What more could you ask for from a tea house? I filled up on little tea sandwiches, crumpets, scones, etc etc etc. The Queen's tea was a good amount of food and let you sample a variety of things. mmmmmmmm :) The service was friendly, refilled our pots often and with a smile, and didn't kill me when my purse was constantly in their way (my bad :( ) A little on the pricey side, but really aren't high teas supposed to be decadent anyway?

Warning: girls, unless you want to break up with him, please don't bring your boyfriend here. Or a date, or a male for that matter that won't appreciate the cutesy girly factor. He will not enjoy it. The frills will kill him. Trust me.

excerpts: Their scones are good, though they have eggs in them
so I can't eat them anymore.
scones.author: vickie j.
scones.review:
I often have a birthday tea here. They're good for accomadating my group though they limit it to 25 people.  Their scones are good, though they have eggs in them so I can't eat them anymore. They were good about swapping out crumpets instead. 
The tea is great. And why else would you go for afternoon tea if you don't enjoy great tea?

excerpts: Wonderful scones and Devonshire cream and fresh fruit.
scones.author: Joseph S.
scones.review: Excellent! Great tea selections..loose leaf served by the pot.  Had an flavorful Ceylon "endless pot" great value. Wonderful scones and Devonshire cream and fresh fruit.

excerpts: The scones with jam and clotted cream are too tasty to pass on.
And so are the smoked salmon and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.
But really, we go for the ambiance and delicious mini cakes they serve at the end of the meal.
Get the italian wedding cake...
it's the only reason to get married!
scones.author: Kamael S.
scones.review: I can't say enough good things about Lovejoy.  The place is adorable with couches and tables of all sizes (and floral patterns).  My girlfriends and I will gather there ever so often to pretend like we have interesting things to tell each other over a cup of tea and some finger sandwiches.  The scones with jam and clotted cream are too tasty to pass on. And so are the smoked salmon and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.  But really, we go for the ambiance and delicious mini cakes they serve at the end of the meal.  Get the italian wedding cake...it's the only reason to get married!

excerpts: And the scones, oh god, the scones - so so good!
I would never come here too often (it's on the expensive side), but it makes a great treat.
scones.author: Kristen B.
scones.review: This place is adorable, and perfect for a girls' day out. I've gone twice now, and both times got the High Tea with 3 of my friends. It doesn't look like all that much food since it's so light, but I was surprised at how full I was by the end. It's great to go with multiple friends so you can try different types of teas and sandwiches. And the scones, oh god, the scones - so so good! I would never come here too often (it's on the expensive side), but it makes a great treat.

excerpts: The homemade scones are amazing - light and buttery, melt in your mouth, smeared with clotted cream and jam.
scones.author: Asteridae A.
scones.review:
Some friends and I went here this past weekend to celebrate Lewis Carroll's birthday.  It's a charming, whimsical place in Noe Valley.  A bit crowded - I suggest making a reservation.  Definitely not stuffy - this is not "tea at the Ritz."  No white glove service here.  What you get are mismatched china, hodgepodge seating arrangements, and assorted bric-a-brac scattered around.

The ham sandwiches were a bit heavy on the horseradish, which I didn't mind, but some might.  The shrimp, cucumber, and fig sandwiches are also good.  The homemade scones are amazing - light and buttery, melt in your mouth, smeared with clotted cream and jam.  Yum.

Nice selection of teas, and I like the different "levels" of tea you can get based on how hungry you are - if you just want a tea and scone, you can get that.  If you're a little hungrier but don't want to spoil dinner, go for the Light Tea which is a scone + 1 sandwich + fruit + shortbread.  There are larger teas as well.

Service was quick and friendly, and they refilled our tea pots with fresh hot water.

I'll definitely be going back, and taking my mother with me!

excerpts: What a delightful, mis-matched but perfectly quaint tea room with a wonderful selection of teas (brewed to order and refreshed at no charge), scones and their best friends Devon cream and wonderful jams, as well as a delicious selection of tea sandwiches and salad that are sure to please everyone at the table.
scones.author: Mariangela S.
scones.review:
Why as a tea, scone, and tea sandwich lover I have waited so long to visit Lovejoy's is beyond me! What a delightful, mis-matched but perfectly quaint tea room with a wonderful selection of teas (brewed to order and refreshed at no charge), scones and their best friends Devon cream and wonderful jams, as well as a delicious selection of tea sandwiches and salad that are sure to please everyone at the table.

The perfect place for Mother's Day, birthdays, Sunday afternoons, and almost any occasion!

excerpts: scrumptious pastries and scones.
Check.
fragrant, tasty, and bottomless teas.
scones.author: Danielle Y.
scones.review:
Let's see...

cute mismatched teaware.  Check.
tasty sandwiches with crusts cut off.  Check
DOUBLE CREAM.  Check.
scrumptious pastries and scones.  Check.
fragrant, tasty, and bottomless teas.  Check.

Five checks.  Five stars.  

Oh, and make reservations.

excerpts: Love the scones.
scones.author: Elaine Y.
scones.review: The best tea service I have ever had in the states. They even make the shepherd's pie fresh daily. Love the scones.

excerpts: And the scones were the best I've had since actually being in England - seriously.
scones.author: Samantha C.
scones.review:
For your next girls date, come to this place!

This cute little restaurant is definitely one my new favorite spots. It was packed with people when we came, but the hostess went out of her way to accommodate our party of 9, which was really nice. (hint, make reservations!) The best thing to order is the high tea for two, queens tea seems a bit overpriced for the additional candies you get. The teas themselves are delicious, especially the seasonal ones. And the scones were the best I've had since actually being in England - seriously.

The funniest thing we saw while we were there was a dozen 8 year old girls having a birthday party. They were all dressed up and I swear one even had on white gloves... Okay, that was a little scary. But don't let that scare you away from trying the place. I promise, you'll love it!

excerpts: Definitely get the services listed on the left side so that you get the most variety for your money - the teas, sandwiches, scones
scones.author: Neha A.
scones.review:
Awesome - the only reason that this isn't getting 5 stars are because prices are a bit steep. ALSO, book a reservation on the weekend - you are NOT getting in if you casually show up on the weekend; from what I understand, it's pretty empty on the weekdays...

Definitely get the services listed on the left side so that you get the most variety for your money - the teas, sandwiches, scones - they are all great....

This place is like going back in time to your grandmother's cottage in England, it is totally unreal...

excerpts: As are the scones.
scones.author: Alison N.
scones.review:
Who knew that a cucumber layered with cream cheese in between 2 slices of bread could be so good.  Maybe it's because the crusts are cut off and the sandwiches are cut into cute little triangles.  The salmon, cream cheese and caper sandwich is to die for.  As are the scones.  Deelish!

The tea room blend is their specialty and it's definitely a good pot of tea.  I went into tea overload and was jittery for the remainder of the day.  But the experience definitely stays with you.  I highly recommend this place for a girls' weekend.  It's a great way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.

excerpts: We settled on a tower of assorted tea sandwiches and scones with English breakfast tea and something else.
scones.author: Alex H.
scones.review:
I've never been a fan of fu-fu restaurants and dining. "Give it to me big and give it to me good" has always been my motto. So needless to say that when the gf informed me that we were joining some friends for English tea time, my first question was "Do I have to go?" I'm fairly glad that she forced me to under promises of big food after if I was still hungry.

This place does do tea right. The decorations remind me of the old lady across the street's house that smelled of dust and strong perfume. There are tables of course, but there are also couches, love seats and chairs creating an environment that is both old-fashioned and fun (there's even a replica of an red English phone booth). I didn't try them myself, but I've been told that the hats in the parlor are available to borrow for the patrons during their tea-time.

Anyways, skeptical of the entire menu, I let the gf order whatever. I added a meat pie to make myself feel like I was going to eat something substantial. We settled on a tower of assorted tea sandwiches and scones with English breakfast tea and something else.

The tea was actually quite tasty. I enjoyed it as much as anyone who doesn't really like hot beverages could.

The tea sandwiches were awesome! My particular favorites were the bay shrimp salad and the pear with Gorgonzola cheese. Also, the meat pie WAS filling, and tasted great with a heap of homemade mashed potatoes on top. Yum!

I'm glad I was pleasantly surprised by the food and tea. I probably still wouldn't go back of my own free will, but I must give credit where credit is due. If you like tea, this is the spot.

*Note: Better make reservations, because this place is packed and you'll be waiting for a while.

excerpts: the coleslaw... the SCONES with double devon cream and jam... the shortbread cookies... and of course, the bottomless pots of hot tea.
scones.author: Raquel U.
scones.review:
I absolutely adore this place!!  After hearing so many good things, my mom and I decided to throw my sister a bridal tea party here last October.  From the moment we walked in, every aspect of the tea service did not disappoint.  Considering there were 13 of us, the service was prompt and definitely on point and we never had to ask for a HOT pot of tea as they were constantly topping off our pots.  What a concept!

Since that first experience, I've been here numerous times and I never get tired of it.  The mismatched furniture, dishes, tea cups and teapots... the lace and doilies... the variety of sandwiches... the salad... the coleslaw... the SCONES with double devon cream and jam... the shortbread cookies... and of course, the bottomless pots of hot tea.  Heavenly!

My favorite is the High Tea, which comes with all that I mentioned above.  I've had the Queen's Tea but frankly, I don't care for the fruit or the crumpets and if you change your mind and want a petit four, it can be added on for an additional $2.50.  I highly recommend the Vanilla Rooibos tea - my absolute favorite and I actually don't even ask for anything else anymore.  

Although it may not sound like it, you will get full off of what appears to be a petite meal.  The best part is that it's not that greasy, gross full but a satisfactory full.  You will definitely want to call in advance to make reservations.  They do have some open seating but it's first come first served and it fills up quick.  Be sure to plan to spend at least 1 1/2-2 hours - the service is not slow but you'll find yourself taking your time to savor the tea and food and enjoy the company you're with.  

Have I mentioned how much I adore this place?!

excerpts: and I always order their shepherd's pie and have also tasted & sampled all their variety of sandwiches, salads, scones & biscuits.
I love their presentation of different teapots & cups & saucers and a feeling of taking care of one's self with a cup of tea.
It's just a great place to relax, chill and to have some tea.
Also, it is a great place for showers and b-day parties.
I have been to a few there for ladies'  day outing and with my late BF/fiance -
he was addicted to their shepherd's pie, too.
I can't wait to bring my granddaughter here, too when she can sit down and appreciate it (she's still only 2 years old).
You need to make reservations here in advance.
It can get real full and crowded because of its popularity.
I highly recommend this place to visitors and locals!
scones.author: Arlene Z.
scones.review: I have been going to this tea house since 2002 when one of my friends I met on a trip to France introduced me to this quaint and cute tea house.  I love the ambiance and atmosphere of eclectic antique decor and furniture.  The owners Jillian & Moona are very hospitable and their servers are very friendly, too!  I have always loved their variety of teas and I always order their shepherd's pie and have also tasted & sampled all their variety of sandwiches, salads, scones & biscuits.  I love their presentation of different teapots & cups & saucers and a feeling of taking care of one's self with a cup of tea.  It's just a great place to relax, chill and to have some tea.  Also, it is a great place for showers and b-day parties.  I have been to a few there for ladies'  day outing and with my late BF/fiance - he was addicted to their shepherd's pie, too.  I can't wait to bring my granddaughter here, too when she can sit down and appreciate it (she's still only 2 years old).  You need to make reservations here in advance.  It can get real full and crowded because of its popularity.  I highly recommend this place to visitors and locals!

excerpts: Their scones are the best I've ever had - not these dry, sandy triangles with miserly flecks of dried fruit which you find in most bakeries.
These are light, moist biscuity things with juicy raisins and currants tucked inside.
Their sandwiches (crust free, of course) are also great.
If whomever bakes their scones would make the crumpets as well, I'd move in.
scones.author: Jordan J.
scones.review: A fabulous brit feast. The food is excellent and the decor is just hokey enough to be fun. Their scones are the best I've ever had - not these dry, sandy triangles with miserly flecks of dried fruit which you find in most bakeries.  These are light, moist biscuity things with juicy raisins and currants tucked inside. Their sandwiches (crust free, of course) are also great. For me the only misstep are the crumpets-which come straight from Safeway. If whomever bakes their scones would make the crumpets as well, I'd move in.

excerpts: Teas are good, service is very friendly and quick, and they have delicious tea sandwiches, particularly tasty scones, and petit-fours for dessert.
We always get cream tea for two (scones and fruit, with a bottomless pot of your choice of tea), with a side of tea sandwiches.
I particularly like the stilton and pear sandwiches, but most of them are great.
scones.author: Andrew H.
scones.review:
This is a really fun place to have tea. It's often estrogen heavy (filled with women in flowery clothing with a couple sheepish looking guys thrown in), but if you can get over the girly decor, it's great. Teas are good, service is very friendly and quick, and they have delicious tea sandwiches, particularly tasty scones, and petit-fours for dessert.

We always get cream tea for two (scones and fruit, with a bottomless pot of your choice of tea), with a side of tea sandwiches. I particularly like the stilton and pear sandwiches, but most of them are great. All the black teas we've had there were pretty good, and the atmosphere is fun.

It's super crowded all the time, I recommend making reservations, especially on weekends. We're lucky enough to live nearby so we just walk in and if there's a long wait, we go somewhere else.

excerpts: I loved the tea scones, served warm and with lemon curd and devon cream.
My favorite sandwiches were roast beef and horse radish, egg and onion, and the hummus.
The staff is very accommodating and gracious.
We had a tea leaf reader which added to the fun of the afternoon.
We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely be back.
scones.author: Nou S.
scones.review:
I threw a baby shower here for a girlfriend who really enjoys high tea.
Although a little too loud for a traditional baby shower, Lovejoy's was a great experience. 
It is indeed a bit cluttered and a little grandmotherly in it's decor but that's the part of the charm.  I really liked the hominess of the place, it brought comfort to me on that cold rainy day.  The tea was lovely, our table had Earl Grey and  Blood Orange teas. We ordered an assortment of sandwiches which were all yummy. There was actually quite a bit of food and we ended up taking some home. I loved the tea scones, served warm and with lemon curd and devon cream. My favorite sandwiches were roast beef and horse radish, egg and onion, and the hummus. 
The staff is very accommodating and gracious.   We had a tea leaf reader which added to the fun of the afternoon. 
We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely be back.

excerpts: the scones were great!
scones.author: KK M.
scones.review:
i've been wanting to try love joys ever since i've tried secret garden 2 years ago. my friends all rave how much better it is so finally me and the hubby went to try it this year

he's been trying to get reservations for over a week and finally on saturday they told him to just walk in and hopefully they can get us a spot. i can see why when i came in it was completely packed. so many gals with their baby showers and bdays going on. i guess since it was super busy everything was a lil lacking

i honestly didnt enjoy it as much as i thought i would like at secret garden. i had the mango black tea and he had forest berries. both teas were yummy and the sandwishes weren't as delicious as i have imagined. the scones were great!

we choose the high tea for 2. it seemed like a steal. we had 4 diff sandwichs, cucumber and cream cheese, love joy special (so far my fav there, its tuna, celery, and i think apples) chicken and walnuts,  and man we had one more sandwich but i dont remember. it came with a salad and a cole slaw. we both didnt eat the cole slaw. the sandwiches were good. i think if it wasn't as busy i would have enjoyed everyting much more.

excerpts: saturday~ love the warm scones and it is such a cute dainty place!
scones.author: Alice S.
scones.review: yummyyyy! just went this past saturday~ love the warm scones and it is such a cute dainty place! I went with a good friend and ordered the high tea for two and got to choose two types of tea (pomegranate green tea and a more favorful mango tea) and 4 types of sandwiches. YUMMMM I really really enjoyed the shrimp and mayonnaise sandwich! We also had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, chicken with asparagus (tasted a little like baby food), and.. roast beef with horse relish that I thought was kind of overwhelming. I think I got too full from the scone! hehe over all very comfy seats and perfect place to chat and munch!

excerpts: Scones smothered with cream and preserves were the group's favorite, but we were also pretty satisfied with the sandwiches, especially the fig and olive tapenade.
scones.author: Jessica K.
scones.review:
Came here for a little girls' afternoon out for my birthday. I was afraid we'd be turned away at the door for being late, but actually we were seated but had to wait at least 10 minutes before our server paid any attention to us. Another plus: we actually sat for about 2 hours even though I saw them ask a table of two to leave bc they "had other people waiting." On to the food part:

Of course, everything was cute and dainty and the only thing old lady-ish about the place was the musty/stuffy air that afternoon. Our party was delighted by the High Tea for Two. Scones smothered with cream and preserves were the group's favorite, but we were also pretty satisfied with the sandwiches, especially the fig and olive tapenade. 

Overall, it's a great place to meet up or celebrate a special occasion, although it is a very female dominated atmosphere. Parking wasn't too much of a problem. Like everyone else said, make reservations.

excerpts: I have never been a fan of scones, but this is also the first time I had a hot scone.
It was wonderful.
Great experience, my first time at a tea house.
I will be back!
scones.author: Alyssa d.
scones.review: Went here for my birthday lunch, a gift to me from my sister.  I saw this place on "Check Bay Area Please" and decided to give it a try.  I was not disappointed. We got the Queen's tea and I was so surprised at the selections.  Bottomless pot of English Breakfast Tea.  I had the stilton and pear and the salmon and cream cheese.  Delish.  The crumpet came a little later and I was pleasantly surprised.  I had never tried one, and I wanted another as soon as I tasted it.  I have never been a fan of scones, but this is also the first time I had a hot scone.  It was wonderful.  Great experience, my first time at a tea house.  I will be back!

excerpts: The scones, crumpets, and clotted cream are always top-notch, the service bright and helpful, and the decor is as cute as it gets.
I can't recommend this place enough if you're after an unapologetically girly indulgence.
scones.author: Alissa L.
scones.review: Wonderful is the only way to describe each visit to Lovejoys! As a huge fan of English tea, nothing gets the fix like a pot of Lovejoys blackcurrant. Indulging for a spot of cream tea is something I didn't think I'd get to do again after moving back to the US from England. The scones, crumpets, and clotted cream are always top-notch, the service bright and helpful, and the decor is as cute as it gets. I can't recommend this place enough if you're after an unapologetically girly indulgence.

excerpts: We got the Queen's Tea which came with plenty of tea, sandwiches, salad, scones and crumpets to fill us up.
The space was super adorable and was a perfect place to catch up with the girls.
scones.author: Stacy L.
scones.review: Had a girls' only tea party here for a 30th birthday party and even as grown women, we loved it! We got the Queen's Tea which came with plenty of tea, sandwiches, salad, scones and crumpets to fill us up. The space was super adorable and was a perfect place to catch up with the girls.

excerpts: Tea & Scones are good.
Scones are not as good as  you would find in England, but close.
Pricey.
Worth checking out for special occassions.
scones.author: Duy N.
scones.review: Tea & Scones are good. Scones are not as good as  you would find in England, but close. Pricey. Worth checking out for special occassions.

excerpts: Great value, real pleasure in the scones, crumpets, lemon curd!
Pleasant altho loud atmosphere.
Could use a second bathroom, for sure!
Kinda crowded at Christmas - but a great place for Afternoon Tea.
I am looking forward to another visit - good looking pub food on other half of menu!
Will be making this an annual or more visit!
Atmosphere real - not a candy cane, or Alice in Wonderland, like some places turn into.
Able to stuff both sexes equally, with satisfaction all around!
scones.author: Christie L.
scones.review: Great value, real pleasure in the scones, crumpets, lemon curd! Pleasant altho loud atmosphere. Could use a second bathroom, for sure! Kinda crowded at Christmas - but a great place for Afternoon Tea.  I am looking forward to another visit - good looking pub food on other half of menu!  Will be making this an annual or more visit!  Atmosphere real - not a candy cane, or Alice in Wonderland, like some places turn into. Able to stuff both sexes equally, with satisfaction all around!

excerpts: I will definitely be back for their scones and tea!
scones.author: The T.
scones.review: I had my birthday party here sometime in June, and I'm glad I chose LoveJoy's to host my birthday party. We had 11 people and everyone enjoyed their experience, even the guys! They were extremely accommodating, and were really nice and patient to me and my friends even though we were sometimes embarrassingly a little too loud. My party had a little corner of the tea room to ourselves, where they set up a cute little row of sofas and chairs for us to sit at and enjoy our tea. The tea room was decorated shabby chic, and all the tea ware you are served with are mismatched yet adorable; but that adds to the shabby chic vibe!  The teas were phenomenal, I've never had such delicious and fragrant tasting teas in my life! My favorite teas that we sampled that day were the Ginseng tea and Vanilla Rooibos. The food was good, I REALLY recommend everyone order at least one scone for themselves, you might end up ordering more because they are the best things I have ever put in my mouth! They are ridiculously buttery and delicious, I tried to savor my scone as much as I could since it was so good. The sandwiches were pretty good, but not as good as I thought from reading other previous reviews. We ordered the horseradish sandwich with beef (?), I wasn't able to sample it since I don't eat red meat but it was a no go for all of my friends. The curry sandwich was a little overpowering for us. The standouts among the sandwiches were the chicken artichoke & LoveJoy's special. The citrus salad was refreshing and tasty.  What really made my time at LoveJoy's special was at the end of our tea session, the staff came out with a petit four with a little candle on it, which was like a mini personal cake to me! They also gifted me a cute little faux diamond encrusted tiara. Love that extra touch, it really made my birthday at LoveJoy's a special and great experience. I will definitely be back for their scones and tea!

excerpts: Today we were seated three across on a very soft, squishy couch -- kinda impractical to drink tea and eat scones on.
Aside from that, we love Lovejoy's!
p.s.
The tea service for the under-10 crowd is awesome --- a big pot of hot chocolate with whipped cream, a couple of tea sandwiches and a few other goodies.
It's my younger daughter's idea of nirvana.
scones.author: Gina F.
scones.review:
My two daughters and I have a tradition of going for tea every year on the first day of school.  It's a tradition I love and hope to continue forever and ever...  Anyway, we used to go downtown to either The Compass Rose (no longer around), one of the other fancy hotels, or to The Rotunda at Neiman-Marcus.  The last few years we've stayed local and gone to Lovejoy's.  The prices are much more affordable than downtown (about half that of Neiman's.)  The food is also fresher and more abundant.  Service is wonderful and accomodating.  The only reason I did not give five stars is that sometimes the seating is cramped/uncomfortable.  Today we were seated three across on a very soft, squishy couch -- kinda impractical to drink tea and eat scones on.  Aside from that, we love Lovejoy's!
p.s.  The tea service for the under-10 crowd is awesome --- a big pot of hot chocolate with whipped cream, a couple of tea sandwiches and a few other goodies.  It's my younger daughter's idea of nirvana.

excerpts: My friends and I shared the Queen's tea (complete with scones, crumpets, salad, sandwiches and lots more) and I think it was enough for 2 people.
I had scones with raisins and strawberry preserves.
scones.author: Roland R.
scones.review:
My friends and I came across this place on yelp and decided to try it because it has better reviews than other places like Crown & Crumpet.

Note that their last seating is at 4.30-5pm.

The place was very well decorated. There were antique sofas and mirrors. They had cute little trinkets and even a red telephone booth display! It had a vintage feel to it.
The tea sets and plates were also beautiful, but strangely, they were mismatched. Hmmm
Anyway, it's still a good place for snacks, to hang out and relax.

My friends and I shared the Queen's tea (complete with scones, crumpets, salad, sandwiches and lots more) and I think it was enough for 2 people. We ended up paying $15 each.

I like it that they had a great selection of teas and sandwiches (check out the menu on their website). I tried the peach and china rose tea and for sandwiches, smoked salmon and pear & Stilton.  The teas were very fragrant and the sandwiches were pretty good even though they were so small. I had scones with raisins and strawberry preserves. It was heavenly!

The people who worked there were very welcoming, exceptionally patient and friendly. I really enjoyed the experience and I really recommend Lovejoy's!

excerpts: Their scones were not that spectacular (but not bad by any means) and their tea is FABULOUS
(China Rose Petal =
, vanilla herbal tea = def not no. 1).
They are really helpful with what is good and/or popular on the menu.
We got the Tea-for-two for $34, plus an additional $17 for a third person.
scones.author: Alison K.
scones.review:
Not to be redundant, but I Love Lovejoy's.

Service: Excellent.  First, they try their best to accommodate your party, even though they are booked up the wazoo.  RESERVATIONS, early ones, are a must.  I got lucky and was able to squeeze into a one hour slot, which they ended up being able to extend.  The tea came out immediately and the food followed soon after.  

Food: NOM NOM NOM.  Their sandwiches were delicate and delicious, and quite substantial.  Their scones were not that spectacular (but not bad by any means) and their tea is FABULOUS (China Rose Petal = No. 1!!!, vanilla herbal tea = def not no. 1).  They are really helpful with what is good and/or popular on the menu.  We got the Tea-for-two for $34, plus an additional $17 for a third person.  We left quite full and very pleased.  

Price: Not bad for afternoon tea.  Going to the Ritz, which is usually my favorite, will cost you double.  This is a lot of yummy bang for your buck.  

Location: Easy to get to and easy to park.  What more could you possibly need?!   Their decor is nice too, not overly Victorian-doll-overkill, as many tea rooms tend to be.  Do they really think I like eating with so many dolls watching me?

Highly recommended!  Or maybe not, I don't want their reservation wait lines to get even more ridiculous.

excerpts: The sweet food is great (scones.)
scones.author: Kristina R.
scones.review: I live a couple of blocks from Lovejoy's so I see it all the time when I drive by.  My friend and I come here for tea and it's fun and girlie.  We always feel very welcome here, since the staff is so friendly.  They even accommodated my friend's little baby, which isn't easy in that place...lots of breakable stuff.  You can feel the estrogen in the room when you walk in.  It's definitely the spot for a girl get together.  The food is good (sandwiches.)  The sweet food is great (scones.)

scones.review:

SERVICE:
We lucked out and got the server with an English accent!

ATMOSPHERE:
Very cute eclectic, mismatched antique furniture, mismatched English tea cups saucers and pots. The atmosphere is casual. Some table seating, and some sofa seating. Very cute for a group of ladies who want to catch up, or DEFINITELY major huge brownie points for a guy to bring a girl here for a first date.

excerpts: the tea includes: coleslaw, spring greens, scones, crumpets, cookies, fruit, sandwiches, and various teas (i tried to rooibos, chestnut, and a black over the course of the tea.)
scones.author: Jill k.
scones.review:
ever wonder what it would feel like to live in a victorian dollhouse?

well, wonder no more, for lovejoy's is here, the most adorably quirky teahouse in sf!

my friend's bridal shower was here, so we went all out with the queen's tea.  the tea includes: coleslaw, spring greens, scones, crumpets, cookies, fruit, sandwiches, and various teas (i tried to rooibos, chestnut, and a black over the course of the tea.)

everything was beautifully presented (i love the mismatched china and teaware!), the service was beyond personable and friendly, and everything, above all, tasted great.

so, whether for a bridal shower, an intimate brunch option, or a quiet afternoon for yourself, consider lovejoy's!  it is a true treat!

excerpts: that clotted cream for the scones rocks my world.
scones.author: Julie T.
scones.review:
very chintz-y...like victorian living magazine threw up a little, but with a definite element of kitsch.

i heart this place. i like the aprons the ladies wear.

i think i used to order the 'cream tea'. that clotted cream for the scones rocks my world. 

i can't wait to visit sf again so i can go here.

excerpts: We ordered the Savory Beef pasty, Shepard's pie, scones, chicken and turkey sandwiches, earl grey tea, hot chocolate.
There was nothing special about any of it.
I can't figure out how this place got such good ratings.
The ambience of the place is old and musty and the food is just so so.
It cost us about $20/person...
I was disappointed and felt let down by all the reviews I read about this place.
scones.author: Kevin J.
scones.review: This place was a let down.  After reading all the reviews on how good the tea experience was at Lovejoy, I was expecting so much more.  I took the family here on Friday morning, and the place was half full.  We ordered the Savory Beef pasty, Shepard's pie, scones, chicken and turkey sandwiches, earl grey tea, hot chocolate.  There was nothing special about any of it.  I can't figure out how this place got such good ratings.  The ambience of the place is old and musty and the food is just so so.  It cost us about $20/person...I was disappointed and felt let down by all the reviews I read about this place.

excerpts: Tea is great, stick with the scones and clotted cream, stay away from the other food.
scones.author: Yo G.
scones.review:
My partner and I took our 7 year old niece to LoveJoy's for a "fancy tea party".  The atmosphere was cute, the teapots were actually beautiful, but the food was god awful.  I did enjoy the pot of the house tea.  My partner had a tisane which was very well done and our niece ended up fully cracked out on a pot of hot chocolate.  The hot chocolate was in an Alice in Wonderland tea pot which was really amazing and kept the interest of the table as we attempted to swallow our food.
OK, the food...
The sandwiches were so budget that I was embarrassed.  The niece wouldn't even eat the very basic jelly and cream cheese (in all honesty she doesn't have very high standards).  It was just kinda all bland, sweet, and nasty too.  Bread was stale.  Uh oh, a bad start.  The grown up's sandwiches were just as bad if not worse.  Chicken salad with asparagus sounds really fab until you realize that the asparagus came from a can. Gross, mushy, stale.  The other sandwiches were not gross but were disappointing and seriously lacked even basic freshness.  
Tea is great, stick with the scones and clotted cream, stay away from the other food.

excerpts: The scones are so good and I loved the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches.
The waitresses are friendly and helpful and they really make sure your teapot doesn't have a chance to get empty.
A great place to go with girlfriends for a treat out.
scones.author: Angelyn C.
scones.review: Very cute and cozy. The scones are so good and I loved the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. The waitresses are friendly and helpful and they really make sure your teapot doesn't have a chance to get empty. A great place to go with girlfriends for a treat out.

excerpts: Yes this 6 foot tall, 200 lbs, one time varsity athlete (now just a weekend warrior) loves his lemon curd and warm scones.

Tier two has the warm scones (soft, hot and with raisins) on which you have the option of spreading clotted cream (think super-thick whipped cream), lemon curd (FANTASTIC), and/or fresh berry preserves (highly recommended to combine with the clotted cream).
There are also shortbread cookies in case your heart needed more butter and sugar.
scones.author: Aaron M.
scones.review:
I'm a fancy boy - I love Lovejoys.  Yes this 6 foot tall, 200 lbs, one time varsity athlete (now just a weekend warrior) loves his lemon curd and warm scones.  Mmm...cry havoc and set free the drool!

High tea here is unpretentious and delicious.  More important to the last vestiges of my masculinity, it is filling and plate lickingly delicious.  Ok, so Lovejoys has far more doilies than a man should volunteer to be around, but the Queen's tea is outstanding enough to get me to turn in my man-card for an afternoon of finger sandwiches every time.  

Men this is how it works when you get the Queen's tea (my recommendation).  First, you get an endless pot of tea (which means I drink several pots without realizing it and spend the rest of the day peeing) and choice of a pair of finger sandwich flavors.   I like egg and onion and pear and gorgonzola the best, but I've had almost every flavor and they are great (although the shrimp one is a bit cat-foody).  The sandwiches come cut in little triangles, but you get a bunch of them so it's satisfying and delicious.  This is all served on a three tiered silver platter/tower, in which the top tier is covered in fruits and the second tier is where the real goodness hides.  Tier two has the warm scones (soft, hot and with raisins) on which you have the option of spreading clotted cream (think super-thick whipped cream), lemon curd (FANTASTIC), and/or fresh berry preserves (highly recommended to combine with the clotted cream).  There are also shortbread cookies in case your heart needed more butter and sugar.  The sandwiches are on their three, along with salad greens and some dressing.  

While you scarf up this bounty, over extend your bladder, and whittle away at your manhood, the waitstaff will come by to give you warm crumpets.  Crumpets serve as another vessel for the toppings on tier two.  At this point in your meal when you should be wrestling with, "I'm a man, I had high tea, I'm full, I think like being fancy... this is so confusing," the waitstaff will come out with petit-fours as a knockout blow.  Think bite sized cake.

To survive Lovejoys use my trick to maintaining the illusion of masculinity: take the women in your life here to celebrate their live events / hollidays.  They will love it, you get to eat the goodness and you can tell your buddies you were forced to go because it was your wife's birthday, because your sister had a wedding shower, etc.  Little will they know that you've turned into a fancy boy just like me.  

p.s. If you are going here, always have a reservation.

excerpts: Who knew you could get such a great buzz from fruity tea or so stuffed-to-the-gills with dainty little sammiches and buttery warm scones?
I love that the atmosphere is way more your auntie's living room than some cold Palace (although the latter is more conducive to tiara-wearing, depending on your auntie).
Added bonus and little-known fact
: They hold your reservation for the full HOUR timeslot.
This is great if you're one of those California-time people (or your partner/pals are).

excerpts: The finger sandwiches were very good (as far as English fare goes-note that I am not a big fan of white bread; my favorite was the chicken-apple-walnut), the scones light, the clotted cream thick and rich, and the tea delicious.
scones.author: Yodel A.
scones.review: I am still stuffed and I ate over an hour ago!  The finger sandwiches were very good (as far as English fare goes-note that I am not a big fan of white bread; my favorite was the chicken-apple-walnut), the scones light, the clotted cream thick and rich, and the tea delicious.  Our high tea for two also came with salad, coleslaw, and shortbread cookies. Beautifully presented, servers are nice and efficient, and we luckily did not have to wait at all without a reservation (reservations are recommended).  A great place to dish with a girlfriend and a fun atmosphere.

excerpts: What is with every tea place in SF rationing scones as if they are made of gold?
Argh.
This decor is cute, the tea and bites were tasty, and the service was fine, but the scarcity was really annoying.
We ordered a Queen's Tea -- one of the largest combos they have -- and it came with only ONE scone across the FOUR of us.
Um, last I checked, a $28 tea platter should not be intended to be eaten by one single person.
So we had to order the Cream Tea in order to get additional scones.
When our platters were served, we were told, "at the end, you'll get a selection of petit fours."
Okay, cool - that sounds fun and yummy.
Fast forward about an hour.
The "selection" showed up...a cute, colorful variety of teeny tiny cake bites...and we were allowed to choose ONE.
For all four of us.
Is sugar and dough really THAT expensive???
What the heck?!
It's basically the same deal at the Secret Garden tea place.
I love the tea tradition, but I am really baffled and annoyed by the stingy servings, especially given that people generally go to tea in groups.
Plural.
Sheesh.
