excerpts: I actually crave their scones, cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches, and chicken apple walnut sandwiches.
I would avoid the coleslaw,

my friends and I were so hungry last time we forgot it tastes "garbagey!" and after the first (and last) forkful we spent a couple minutes trying to drown out the flavor with our bottomless blood orange tea!
Take a trip to the attic across the street if you have time!
scones.author: Valerie A.
scones.review: Make a reservation and prepare to put on your pretty pearls! I actually crave their scones, cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches, and chicken apple walnut sandwiches.  I would avoid the coleslaw, my friends and I were so hungry last time we forgot it tastes "garbagey!" and after the first (and last) forkful we spent a couple minutes trying to drown out the flavor with our bottomless blood orange tea! :)  Take a trip to the attic across the street if you have time!

excerpts: The black English-style tea was very good of course (mixed with milk as the Limeys do) but the tea sandwiches, scones and cookies really impressed.
Especially the clotted cream
-I can still taste it-Yum!
The decor is as frilly-tea-party as you can get, complete with guests dressed up in bonnets and white gloves.
One gent out with the ladies even sported a Napoleon outfit.
So there you go.
scones.author: Brandon R.
scones.review: The black English-style tea was very good of course (mixed with milk as the Limeys do) but the tea sandwiches, scones and cookies really impressed. Especially the clotted cream-I can still taste it-Yum! The decor is as frilly-tea-party as you can get, complete with guests dressed up in bonnets and white gloves. One gent out with the ladies even sported a Napoleon outfit. So there you go.

excerpts: And, they make a great "high tea" with clotted cream and fresh scones.
scones.author: Travel G.
scones.review:
I can't say enough good things about this place.  You really feel like you've stepped into a tea house in Britain when you go there.  They have a really large selection of both teas and sandwiches and I've always really enjoyed all the food and teas I've tried here.  

I've visited Lovejoys a couple of times wtih only one other person, and they were able to fit us in at the last minute, but the place is usually crowded so if you want to definitely get a table, you need to make reservations in advance. And, if you have a larger party, you need to book a few weeks out because this place is so popular.

In addition to all of the lovely English decorations, one nice thing is that while some parties are dressed up for special occassion, you don't feel uncomfortable in casual clothing or jeans.  It is a great place to take your Mom, to go with your girlfriends or for a young girl's tea party.

And, they make a great "high tea" with clotted cream and fresh scones.

excerpts: The mini sandwiches and scones were also a nice little mid-afternoon snack to get me through to dinner.
scones.author: Kristin S.
scones.review: When you're feeling especially 'girly' - this is a great place to meet your female friends.  I went on a recently hot day - too hot for tea - but ordered the Ginger Beer (like root beer but made of ginger - YUM!)  The mini sandwiches and scones were also a nice little mid-afternoon snack to get me through to dinner.

excerpts: (or is that from the cookies?)...but the brave are rewarded with sandwiches of fig & olive tapenade, and steaming scones with jam.
scones.author: Alison C.
scones.review: Doily-covered sofas, crumpets with cream, mismatched antique china, and hostesses in frilly aprons...a perfect setting for bridal & baby showers, or an afternoon with the girls.  Boys, beware; there's enough estrogen in this room to widen your hips....(or is that from the cookies?)...but the brave are rewarded with sandwiches of fig & olive tapenade, and steaming scones with jam.

excerpts: We ordered high tea which came with teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, cookies, and more!
It was a tower of food!
OH, they also had fruits as well.
Their teas were delicous, some teas had very strong aromas, some are just right, and my silly me just ordered green tea!
It tasted just like any other green teas, but the other teas that I tasted were good!
You have to make reservations because they book up and they close early, too.
Great place to take your lovely mothers, grandmothers, and of course with your girlfriends, maybe a gay friend, and boys are very limited here!
scones.author: Jojo N.
scones.review: This place is so precious! I love trying new things! My friends and I came here for a gf's birthday! We ordered high tea which came with teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, cookies, and more! It was a tower of food! OH, they also had fruits as well. Their teas were delicous, some teas had very strong aromas, some are just right, and my silly me just ordered green tea! It tasted just like any other green teas, but the other teas that I tasted were good! You have to make reservations because they book up and they close early, too. Great place to take your lovely mothers, grandmothers, and of course with your girlfriends, maybe a gay friend, and boys are very limited here!

excerpts: Kind of a place to experience crustless sandwiches, scones and English tea.
It has its share of fans.
I would prefer the Ritz Carleton.
scones.author: miriam b.
scones.review: Funky, funky old grandmother's mismatched home furnishings and serving pieces. Kind of a place to experience crustless sandwiches, scones and English tea. It has its share of fans. I would prefer the Ritz Carleton.

excerpts: I really enjoy the freshly baked scones with devonshire cream and preserves (MMM).
I'm always satisfied when I walk out, especially with the tea and sandwiches.
I'm never overly stuffed and my stomach never feels like it's gonna burst.
It's a great place to hang out and just enjoy tea!!
scones.author: Cristina D.
scones.review: I've been going here for almost 10 years now. I had my 15th birthday party there, now I'm 23, and I'm still loving it. I really enjoy the freshly baked scones with devonshire cream and preserves (MMM). I'm always satisfied when I walk out, especially with the tea and sandwiches. I'm never overly stuffed and my stomach never feels like it's gonna burst. It's a great place to hang out and just enjoy tea!!

excerpts: The finger sandwiches are delicious and so are the fresh scones w/the clotted cream.
Our faves are the smoked salmon, chicken asparagus, egg, and bay shrimp sandwiches.
Stay away from the roast beef -- they can be a bit dry.
scones.author: Tina T.
scones.review: Been here several times before and the service and food is always good.  My girlfriends and I usually order the High Tea.  The finger sandwiches are delicious and so are the fresh scones w/the clotted cream. Our faves are the smoked salmon, chicken asparagus, egg, and bay shrimp sandwiches.  Stay away from the roast beef -- they can be a bit dry.

excerpts: Slathering crispy, delicate scones with fluffy Devon cream and lemon curd.
And getting totally cracked-out on sugary
Darjeeling tea while learning how to conduct myself in a mannerly fashion.
scones.author: Delilah P.
scones.review:
This place made me miss my Grannie. She was a buttery old Scottish lady who introduced me at a tender age to the delights of afternoon tea. Sitting on a puffy little tuffet, daintily munching on crustless lil' sandwiches stuffed with cream cheese, cucumbers, watercress, and other assorted goodies. Slathering crispy, delicate scones with fluffy Devon cream and lemon curd. And getting totally cracked-out on sugary  Darjeeling tea while learning how to conduct myself in a mannerly fashion. 
At Lovejoy's, I enjoyed all of the above, minus the watercress and mannerly fashion, but plus the following: cheddar and chutney sandwiches, delicious coleslaw (really it was exceptional - how many people can say that about coleslaw?), ripe melon and berries, shortbread, crumpets, and petit fours. I think at some point I emitted a very lady-like "Oink."
All-in-all, a very civilized afternoon. Just don't go here if you have an irrational fear of doilies.

excerpts: The different teas were tasty and the sandwhiches and scones were yum!
I'm inspired to create the same experience at home.
But it won't be the same as I dont have the cute tea sets and antique decor.
I'd definitely throw an intimate shower here in the future!
scones.author: Maureen D.
scones.review: So fun! We went here for a friend's bridal shower. The ambiance was very charming and sweet. I felt like my inner child who would play make-believe tea party had her dreams come true! The different teas were tasty and the sandwhiches and scones were yum! I'm inspired to create the same experience at home. But it won't be the same as I dont have the cute tea sets and antique decor. I'd definitely throw an intimate shower here in the future!

excerpts: The tea, tea sandwiches and scones were delicious and we just loved everything about the place!
I can't wait to go back for more and dress up in our "Sunday Best".
scones.author: Valerie C.
scones.review: My bridesmaid hosted my bridal shower here! It was such a great experience and something new that we've never done before.  The decor was very antique and felt like we were in another era!  The tea, tea sandwiches and scones were delicious and we just loved everything about the place!  I can't wait to go back for more and dress up in our "Sunday Best".  :)

excerpts: The shortbread cookies and scones with devonshire cream topped it all off.
We had an excellent server and as always when coming to Lovejoys, the owner's were very friendly and welcoming.
Thanks for keeping this place top notch!
scones.author: Cristina M.
scones.review: Spent Saturday afternoon at Lovejoys with two wonderful friends.  The tea was fantastic - Chestnut and Rooibos.  The food was excellent - we had the Shepperd's Pie, which was very tasty.  We also had the Sausage wrapped with Puff Pastry - can't go wrong with that.  My favorite sandwich was the roastbeef & horseradish but I also enjoyed the turkey/dijon, green apple/cream cheese and cucumber/cream cheese.  The shortbread cookies and scones with devonshire cream topped it all off.  We had an excellent server and as always when coming to Lovejoys, the owner's were very friendly and welcoming.  Thanks for keeping this place top notch!

excerpts: Great little sandwiches, Sheppard's pie, and of course their scones!
Does anyone know if they make them themselves or order it from a bakery?
And their 15+ different teas.
I believe most of the decorations are up for sale and they also have a retail store across the street.
Make reservations on the weekends because it was packed!
So if you want to be British for a day, come here at about 12pm.
scones.author: Jason A.
scones.review: It's like you are in nightmare where you're stuck having tea with girls at grandma's house.  Okay it isn't that bad.  My lady dragged me and our friends from Chicago over here for breakfast.  They have a really great niche going on here.  Great little sandwiches, Sheppard's pie, and of course their scones!  Does anyone know if they make them themselves or order it from a bakery?  And their 15+ different teas.  I believe most of the decorations are up for sale and they also have a retail store across the street.  Make reservations on the weekends because it was packed!  So if you want to be British for a day, come here at about 12pm.

excerpts: Tea for Two was perfect--a generous portion of tea sandwiches, two scones, Devonshire cream, and two pots of tea, plus salad and sauerkraut (which I skipped, since it was my b'day
and I don't eat veggies on my birthday).
My only complaint would be the scone.
It was nice and warm but tasted a little more biscuit-like than scone-like; I think I detected a note of pre-packaged scone-ness.
Otherwise, this place is a real find and in a great location.
Just a couple blocks up and you're in Noe Valley and can stop by the awesome Noe Knit store (if you're a knitting fanatic as I am) or Ambiance clothing.
scones.author: Samantha R.
scones.review:
Can't give it a 5 because it would have to be in London (Basil Street Inn gets 5).  Came here for my birthday on a lovely rainy, wintery day and Lovejoy's was the perfect, cozy setting for a romantic afternoon tea with my husband (who, fortunately, is very secure with his masculinity and did not mind being the only guy in the entire place).  The space is definitely girly with its artful clutter of packaged teas, crockery, and various knicknacks.  The tea was delicious and unlimited (though I wonder who can actually go through more than one generous pot of tea).  Tea for Two was perfect--a generous portion of tea sandwiches, two scones, Devonshire cream, and two pots of tea, plus salad and sauerkraut (which I skipped, since it was my b'day and I don't eat veggies on my birthday).  My only complaint would be the scone.  It was nice and warm but tasted a little more biscuit-like than scone-like; I think I detected a note of pre-packaged scone-ness.  Otherwise, this place is a real find and in a great location.  Just a couple blocks up and you're in Noe Valley and can stop by the awesome Noe Knit store (if you're a knitting fanatic as I am) or Ambiance clothing.  Even my husband, a Noe Valley detractor, managed to find a sufficiently obscure LP at Streetlight to add to our growing collection of useless, unplayable LPs.

Anyway, I digress.  Lovejoy's Tea Room.  Try it.  It's absolutely ripping.

excerpts: I am going back, with my network of girlfriends shortly..yummy scones, sandwiches, shortcake and smooth tea just the way i like it.
scones.author: Ada W.
scones.review: I had a sudden craving for High Tea.. and as we were hanging out in the area, we searched on mobile Yelp on our cellphone and found this place.. it was truly a great hangout for some good food and tea. I went with my husband but we both agreed that this is more of a place for girlfriends and women. I am going back, with my network of girlfriends shortly..yummy scones, sandwiches, shortcake and smooth tea just the way i like it.  As I was saying, this is much better than a typical 5 star hotel that "try" to serve high tea.. Lovejoy's Tea Room is more authentic and laid back.

excerpts: Their scones are so light and fluffy.
The clotted cream was soo tasty!
My mouth is still watering.
Definitely would love to come back soon.
Decor is awesome, furniture is neat, china is unique, and great service!
Definitely a San Francisco gem!
Bring some of your girlfriends and boyfriends and have a tea party, it's fun :]
scones.author: Rebecca T.
scones.review: I came here on a Sunday with reservations made ahead. It's a nice lovely tea room located in the Noe Valley. Since I have never been to a British Tea room or party, it was definitely a new experience. Their chairs and tables were so cute. They had tables with reserved signs that said, "Reserved for Royalty" or "Reserved for Queens" it was adorable! Their menu was straight forward and a bit pricey. I loved the fact that the tea was bottomless and that the china was mix-matched. The service here is great and they are very attentive. Their scones are so light and fluffy. The clotted cream was soo tasty! My mouth is still watering. Definitely would love to come back soon. Decor is awesome, furniture is neat, china is unique, and great service! Definitely a San Francisco gem!  Bring some of your girlfriends and boyfriends and have a tea party, it's fun :]

excerpts: Scones are excellent and the tea is great!
I took my fiance and Mom
and we had a great time!
It may not be the most manly thing to go and have tea with the ladies
but if ya gotta do it this is the place you gotta go to.
scones.author: Kale T.
scones.review: I've never had had real high tea until I came to this place! I've heard all the stories of the Ritz and all these other grand tea rooms, but Lovejoy's is just the place for me.  Scones are excellent and the tea is great!  I took my fiance and Mom and we had a great time!  It may not be the most manly thing to go and have tea with the ladies but if ya gotta do it this is the place you gotta go to.

excerpts: I love, love, love, their scones!!
This a great place for girlfriend get togethers, baby showers, birthdays, and Mother's Day.
The first time I went here was with my sister and our mother for her birthday (?)
or was it Mother's Day (?).
In any case, I fell in love with this place.
Been here several times since then.
The last time was for my friend's small baby shower.
There were six of us and had a great time.
I also took my childhood friend for her birthday here.
She loved it too.
My friends and I all loved the scones.
After our tea party, we went across the street to their  little shop where they sell their loose tea, tea accessories, and other items to complete your own little tea party.
If only they sold the recipe for their scones =).
scones.author: Neni E.
scones.review: I love, love, love, their scones!! This a great place for girlfriend get togethers, baby showers, birthdays, and Mother's Day. The first time I went here was with my sister and our mother for her birthday (?) or was it Mother's Day (?). In any case, I fell in love with this place. Been here several times since then. The last time was for my friend's small baby shower. There were six of us and had a great time. I also took my childhood friend for her birthday here. She loved it too. My friends and I all loved the scones. After our tea party, we went across the street to their  little shop where they sell their loose tea, tea accessories, and other items to complete your own little tea party. If only they sold the recipe for their scones =).

excerpts: Yummy tea sandwiches and scones, great tea selection, relaxed and homey atmosphere.
The service was fast and friendly.
They say reservations are recommended, but we walked in and were seated right away.
It was really packed (Saturday afternoon - it figures)
so I guess we were lucky.
scones.author: Flora B.
scones.review: I really enjoyed Lovejoys's Tea Room... Yummy tea sandwiches and scones, great tea selection, relaxed and homey atmosphere. The service was fast and friendly. They say reservations are recommended, but we walked in and were seated right away. It was really packed (Saturday afternoon - it figures) so I guess we were lucky.

excerpts: My sister-in-law wanted to do English Afternoon Tea Party for my baby shower, so she took me here to taste some tea, scones, and sandwiches.
The place doesn't look much when you go in--at least I didn't think so--, but after you are seated, you'll find that every seats have very cute decor.
We had High Tea for Two, which includes a pot of tea of your choice, 4 choices of sandwiches, 2 scones, and 2 shortbread cookies.
I had Vanilla something tea, which is herbal tea, and my sister-in-law added another pot of tea that was caffeinated.
The tea was really good, great aroma, and the sandwiches were good too.
There was a long list of sandwiches, and we chose chicken asparagus, chicken hummus walnut, figs & olives, and beef and something (I forget).
But of course, they are just sandwiches that you can make yourself.
Now the scones... mmm... so good!
Very filling, but very good.
They give you jam and butter for the scone, but the butter is very different.
It's either home-made or flavored butter
so it's so very delicious.
It's probably very fattening, but why would I care?
I'm having a baby!
We were so stuffed before we could finish everything, it cost us a total of $40 including tax & tips.
scones.author: HsuMeow L.
scones.review:
My sister-in-law wanted to do English Afternoon Tea Party for my baby shower, so she took me here to taste some tea, scones, and sandwiches.  The place doesn't look much when you go in--at least I didn't think so--, but after you are seated, you'll find that every seats have very cute decor. The tables are covered with some old style table cloth, plate & cup sets are all very pretty, and there are different paintings, pictures, and other decorations all over the store and around the walls.  

We had High Tea for Two, which includes a pot of tea of your choice, 4 choices of sandwiches, 2 scones, and 2 shortbread cookies. I had Vanilla something tea, which is herbal tea, and my sister-in-law added another pot of tea that was caffeinated. The tea was really good, great aroma, and the sandwiches were good too. There was a long list of sandwiches, and we chose chicken asparagus, chicken hummus walnut, figs & olives, and beef and something (I forget). But of course, they are just sandwiches that you can make yourself.  Now the scones... mmm... so good! Very filling, but very good. They give you jam and butter for the scone, but the butter is very different. It's either home-made or flavored butter so it's so very delicious.  It's probably very fattening, but why would I care? I'm having a baby! We were so stuffed before we could finish everything, it cost us a total of $40 including tax & tips. The service was very nice too, so the overall experience was great!

Right across from the tea room, there's its shop where you can get the tea and the tea sets. It's also a very cute store.

We went on a Wednesday for lunch, and we thought it would be less crowded, but it was surprisingly full. We almost didn't a get a nice, cozy seat because we didn't have reservation, but the waitress was nice enough to work it out for us. So my recommendation is to always make reservations no matter which day you go.

excerpts: We had so much food, tea sandwiches, scones with lemon curd, jam, fruit, cookies, salad and bottomless pots of tea.
The atmosphere was cozy and pleasant.
Our waitress was amazing and we left feeling so happy :o)
I want to go there every Sunday...
scones.author: Amanda G.
scones.review: Just went here for the first time the other day with my girlfriend on a Sunday afternoon... I LOVED it!!  So adorable.  Everything from the dishware, decor, waitress, food, etc.  We ordered the Queen's Delight for 2 and it was delicious!  We had so much food, tea sandwiches, scones with lemon curd, jam, fruit, cookies, salad and bottomless pots of tea.  The atmosphere was cozy and pleasant.  Our waitress was amazing and we left feeling so happy :o)  I want to go there every Sunday...

excerpts: The scones?
SUPER yum.
Over a bottomless pot of the house blend, we chit chatted and cooed at the adorable decor.
Kinda pricey when you think about what you're actually eating, but the overall experience makes up for it.
Perfect for a girly good time.
scones.author: Christine C.
scones.review: Cute cute cute!  It was a gorgeous day in SF and I walked into Lovejoy's in a good mood.  Eyed the couches on the side, and was so excited when my friends and I were seated there.  The name of our menu selection escapes me, but we had our choice of 2 sandwiches each (I had the smoked salmon/cream cheese and pear/stilton).  Yum.  The scones?  SUPER yum.  Over a bottomless pot of the house blend, we chit chatted and cooed at the adorable decor.  Kinda pricey when you think about what you're actually eating, but the overall experience makes up for it.  Perfect for a girly good time.  :)

excerpts: The scones are to die for and the tea selection is amazing.
The customer service was top notch
and I hope to go back there on my next trip to SF!
Also, they sing "Happy Birthday" beautifully!
Such harmony!!
scones.author: Theresa T.
scones.review: AMAZING experience!  We had a bridal tea there and loved every minute of it!  They sat us near the window and we had plenty of space for 9 girls!  The scones are to die for and the tea selection is amazing.  The customer service was top notch and I hope to go back there on my next trip to SF!  Also, they sing "Happy Birthday" beautifully!  Such harmony!! :)

excerpts: The scones were D-lish!
scones.author: DeDe Y.
scones.review:
I was really looking forward to trying out Lovejoy's
I went away with feeling under whelmed.

We went on a Sunday and it very crowded and loud.  We had a reservation and were seated right away.

The waitress was friendly but seemed frazzled. There was a baby shower going on behind us...maybe it had been a long day.  After the baby shower was a bridal shower.  All the coming and going made it difficult to enjoy our tea.  Especially while being bumped into every few seconds by the various shower goers and Lovejoy staff.  

The Queens Tea was enjoyable and the waitress was quite prompt on keeping our teapots full.  The finger sandwiches were yummy.  We didn't care for the communal salad.  At first we thought it was decorations for the sandwiches.  The scones were D-lish!

I would not go out of my way to go back to Lovejoy's.  It was OK but to me not worth the drive up to San Francisco.  I would rather stay local and visit Lisa's Tea Treasures.

excerpts: Love the pasties, scones and array of sandwiches...great for girly high teas...
sorry guys!
The Lovejoy's antique store across the street is amazing too!
scones.author: Jocelyn L.
scones.review: "Such a cute little tearoom! Love the pasties, scones and array of sandwiches...great for girly high teas...sorry guys! The Lovejoy's antique store across the street is amazing too!"

excerpts: Everything was surreal, from the little girls in dresses sipping tea with their mothers to the towers of warm scones, fresh fruit, and finger sandwiches.
I recommend Lovejoy's to everyone for the food and atmosphere, even to the men who think they are too manly for a place like this.
The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I'm not a tea connoisseur.
It tasted good to me though!
scones.author: Susan L.
scones.review: I felt like I was the American Girl Samantha doll in this place. Everything was surreal, from the little girls in dresses sipping tea with their mothers to the towers of warm scones, fresh fruit, and finger sandwiches. I recommend Lovejoy's to everyone for the food and atmosphere, even to the men who think they are too manly for a place like this. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because I'm not a tea connoisseur. It tasted good to me though!

excerpts: If you're looking for something a bit more "substantial" than finger sandwiches, try the pasties, though hopefully someone at the table gets an order of the scones w/ double Devon cream.
Devine!
scones.author: Anonymouse C.
scones.review: Good luck getting in.  This place tends to get packed early.  And if you're a gal, feel free to come wearing your "Merchant Ivory" period dress, white gloves and hat.  If you're looking for something a bit more "substantial" than finger sandwiches, try the pasties, though hopefully someone at the table gets an order of the scones w/ double Devon cream.  Devine!

excerpts: Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us.
The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way).
scones.author: Aisha W.
scones.review:
This tearoom is wonderful! Reservations are a must but considering they have a cancellation wait list, this is a piece of cake! Despite the message machine saying they were fully booked for the weekend, I left a message including dates and times - requesting placement on the wait list - and my call was returned within hours! I immediately had a reservation and when another engagement popped up, rescheduling was super easy! Actually, I had to reschedule twice...but the woman returning my calls never expressed frustration at all!

So our tea date arrived and my mother and I happened to show up 10 minutes before our reservation. We found a parking spot immediately (perhaps it being 4PM helped) and were seated at once. A minute later, another woman asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we weren't because we were so busy taking pictures of the cute sign on our table that said Reserved for Royalty and were also settling into our lovely seats by the window! The room was packed with mismatched couches, chairs, tables, teacups, teapots and decor but this made it so much more comfortable. I felt I could talk as loud as I wanted, spill tea, whatever, and no one would notice. We finally decided on Queen's Tea (for two) and from the lengthy sandwich list, chose the chicken apple walnut, cucumber and cream cheese, pear and stilton cheese, and bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches. They were all deliciously different in their own ways, however, my favorite was the bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwich. With the help of our patient server, we picked Taylor's Tea Room Blend and Yorkshire Gold and both were perfectly flavorful. We shared both teas and ironically ended up preferring the one the other picked. To every cup we added cream and sugar and seriously, I couldn't stop drinking. It didn't help that our tea pots were refilled every 10 minutes! Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us. The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way). 

Because I had so much tea, I had to use the restroom 4 times in an hour! After my mother and I left the tea room to check out their antique store, the Attic, I had to use the restroom again! Since Lovejoy's was closed, I didn't want to try using their restroom and I would've gone to a gas station but my mom was driving and refused to make another stop. So I went back to the tea room and surprisingly, the staff was so nice and didn't mind at all! Not even hints of irritation!

Definitely going back soon!!!

excerpts: Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.
The service was good, and we all had a great time.
I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!
Oh, and the price was very reasonable.
scones.author: Tera M.
scones.review: Planned my best friend's birthday party at Lovejoy's for 6 of us, and ended up having 7 - they accommodated us with no problem.  The decor was cute, quaint and perfect for a ladies tea party.  It sort of reminded me of Alice in Wonderland with its mismatched cups and whimsical style.  Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.  All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.  Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.  The service was good, and we all had a great time.  I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!  Oh, and the price was very reasonable.

excerpts: The tiny sandwiches and scones were delicious however, the sausage rolls were mediocre.
scones.author: Yan M.
scones.review: Comfortable and cosy little English tea house. Quaint place with lots of cute trinkets and bric-a-brac. The tiny sandwiches and scones were delicious however, the sausage rolls were mediocre. My mum would love this place....great for high tea. Definitely secure reservations on weekends. They were full two Saturdays in a row when I called during the week.

excerpts: It was fun to try it all, but if I went back, I would order the tea with just the sandwiches and the scones.
The warm scones with devon cream and strawberry jam were delicous!
I also liked the mocha petit four.
Very much a ladies' place.
scones.author: Linnea M.
scones.review: This is a great, cozy little place. The decor was eclectic and cute-I really liked the mismatched teacups and saucers. Seemed very authentic-in fact, there was an middle-aged english woman sitting next to us who seemed quite pleased with everything. Especially with the cross-stitch of teapots hanging on the wall that she was convinced she had made back in the day! We ordered the "Queen's Tea"-the most deluxe one. It was fun to try it all, but if I went back, I would order the tea with just the sandwiches and the scones. The warm scones with devon cream and strawberry jam were delicous! I also liked the mocha petit four. Very much a ladies' place.

excerpts: The scones and sandwiches are so yummy.
You can't help but feel dainty and ladylike when you're dining here.
scones.author: Audrey Jean T.
scones.review: I love to put on my hat and gloves and best dress to go here. It's a great place to catch up with a friend over a lovely cup of tea. It's tiny and busy so it's best to plan ahead rather than dropping in. The scones and sandwiches are so yummy. You can't help but feel dainty and ladylike when you're dining here.

excerpts: 1 star for the scones!
yummy!

1 star for the great service (never had to ask for a refill of the tea pot)
1 star for the amount of food you get, make sure you go hungry
1 star for the take your time eating, enjoying your tea and company because they do not rush you out-
so make sure you make reservations.
scones.author: Jay R.
scones.review:
02.06.11 - high tea with one other, for my bday. ordered the queen's tea

1 star for the choices tea (tried the passion fruit, it was great!)
1 star for the scones! yummy!
1 star for the great service (never had to ask for a refill of the tea pot)
1 star for the amount of food you get, make sure you go hungry
1 star for the take your time eating, enjoying your tea and company because they do not rush you out- so make sure you make reservations.

excerpts: The scones are great, especially if you eat them with the cream provided, but the tea sandwiches are nothing special (think generic white bread).
The place is also pretty small and if you come here at a prime hour (like sat afternoon), expect to wait.
Reservations are accepted so I recommend that.
I would recommend this place mostly for the experience.
scones.author: Barbara O.
scones.review: I love this place! It's really cute (sorta gives you the impression of your grandmother's house with all the flower print), parking is not really an issue, and they have a rather large variety of teas to choose from. The only reason why I didn't give this place a higher rating is because the food is not amazing. The scones are great, especially if you eat them with the cream provided, but the tea sandwiches are nothing special (think generic white bread). The place is also pretty small and if you come here at a prime hour (like sat afternoon), expect to wait. Reservations are accepted so I recommend that. I would recommend this place mostly for the experience.

excerpts: the scones were heavenly, soft and delicious.
like little warm biscuits and definitely not the abhorred rock like ones.
however baked goods that are really good, usually tend to involve a lot of butter.
anyway, the cream and strawberry preserves combined with the scone and fruit was to die for.
but then again, the warm tea, and warm scone made me really happy since it was freezing outside.
some things just taste better in vivid contrast.
scones.author: Faye P.
scones.review: Wonderful cup of tea. made for an enjoyable afternoon with a fancy tea room, playing dress up and downing those warm cups of caffeineted taylor's tea room blend. what a mouthful. the eclectic assortment of various tea services and mismatching teapots made for a well-loved, worn in feel. the scones were heavenly, soft and delicious. like little warm biscuits and definitely not the abhorred rock like ones. however baked goods that are really good, usually tend to involve a lot of butter. anyway, the cream and strawberry preserves combined with the scone and fruit was to die for. but then again, the warm tea, and warm scone made me really happy since it was freezing outside. some things just taste better in vivid contrast.

excerpts: You have proper tea, scones and finger sandwiches
but it's not stuffy and
noone drinks with their pinkies high in the air.
It's a very cozy tea room and the staff is very helpful when helping you decide what tea to order.
It's not any more expensive than other tea rooms that I've been to.
Just make sure you make a reservation because Lovejoy's gets booked out pretty far in advance.
scones.author: Queenie C.
scones.review: What's a better way to escape adulthood than getting a bunch of girlfriends together and have an old-fashioned tea party? I really like Lovejoy's because it feels like you're walking into your kooky grandma's attic. It's super girly (there's lace everywhere, I mean, it IS tea time) and the tea sets are adorable - plus it's quite endearing how everything is mismatched. You have proper tea, scones and finger sandwiches but it's not stuffy and noone drinks with their pinkies high in the air.  It's a very cozy tea room and the staff is very helpful when helping you decide what tea to order. It's not any more expensive than other tea rooms that I've been to. Just make sure you make a reservation because Lovejoy's gets booked out pretty far in advance.

excerpts: The salad is fresh and the scones come out warm!
Then they give you petit fours to end the meal.
Try this place and you'll never want to try another tearoom in the city.
scones.author: Joyce G.
scones.review: This is the BEST place for high tea in SF. I've been to other tea rooms, but Lovejoy's always comes out on top. It could be because the service is on point. Reservations are recommended. Sometimes when you call, you'll get an answering machine. The greeting will tell you if there are any upcoming dates that are fully booked, which is helpful. If you leave a message, your call is returned promptly. Its very girly inside, but its all part of the high tea experience. The menu has good variety, but their high tea for two is my favorite when visiting Lovejoy's with my sis. They have a great tea sandwich selection, and the bread is super soft. The salad is fresh and the scones come out warm! Then they give you petit fours to end the meal. Try this place and you'll never want to try another tearoom in the city.

excerpts: The selection includes delicious tea sandwiches, delectable scones, and a wide variety of tea (herbal, black, and beyond).
scones.author: Evin B.
scones.review: Entering Lovejoy's Team Room is like returning to your grandma's parlor. The decor is dainty, charming, and welcoming - all without being over the top. This is a perfect place for a bridal shower, baby shower, or girls' day out. Reservations are strongly recommended. The selection includes delicious tea sandwiches, delectable scones, and a wide variety of tea (herbal, black, and beyond). I strongly recommend that if you like tea, high tea finger foods, or girlie restaurants - this place is for you! Reservations fill up long in advance around the time of holidays, especially Mother's Day. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It is a place that makes memories.

excerpts: This is a great place for girls to catch up over perfect crustless tea sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and delicious strawberry preserves.
I like that they add salad and coleslaw --- yay for some veggies!
We also tried the sausage rolls, they are tasty, as well.
Go here for some good convo steaming pots of delicious tea.
There's just something about having a cup of tea out of a porcelain teacup and the process of daintily  using a tea strainer, pouring cream and spooning sugar with a tiny spoon.
Yay!
scones.author: Jennifer C.
scones.review: Super duper cute tea room. I live super close and made it for the first time today! It's the perfect tea room - mismatched china, doilies on tables and the ever helpful waitstaff always ready to refresh your bottomless pot of tea. We managed to snag a table for two right away after seeing the enormous wait at Chloe's. This is a great place for girls to catch up over perfect crustless tea sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and delicious strawberry preserves. I like that they add salad and coleslaw --- yay for some veggies! We also tried the sausage rolls, they are tasty, as well. Go here for some good convo steaming pots of delicious tea. There's just something about having a cup of tea out of a porcelain teacup and the process of daintily  using a tea strainer, pouring cream and spooning sugar with a tiny spoon. Yay!

excerpts: Scones are heavenly right out of the oven, crumpets a delight and service incredible.
Teas are lovely and a good variety.
Dessert was perfect.
I wish I could eat there once a month.
A great value for the money.
I would reccomend reservations even though they save some small tables for walk ins.
scones.author: Sherene K.
scones.review: This is the tea experience. I have been doing teas and tea rooms since I was young and this is far the most memorable. Went there during the holidays with friends and really enjoyed it. Sandwiches are outstanding with lots of choices even for us vegetarians. Fruit, salad and quiches are very fresh. Scones are heavenly right out of the oven, crumpets a delight and service incredible. Teas are lovely and a good variety. Dessert was perfect. I wish I could eat there once a month. A great value for the money. I would reccomend reservations even though they save some small tables for walk ins.

excerpts: The scones with lemon curd, fresh cream, and homemade preserves are my favorite menu item...but the tiny sandwiches, quiche, fresh fruits and sweet treats are lovely, too.
The atmosphere is the best--antique furniture, beautiful old china (every teapot, cup, and saucer is different), and lovely sunlight streaming through the windows makes this perch unforgettable.
The red vanilla tea is as good as it gets...buy some across the street at Lovejoys attic and take a bit of the tea room home!
You need a reservation!
scones.author: Catherine P.
scones.review: One of my most favorite spots in town. A great place to go with a group of girls or your best friend, daughter, or niece...but not your boyfriend or husband. This girlie tea house is as authentic as they get outside of London. Try the Queen's tea...and you'll enjoy a little taste of everything. The scones with lemon curd, fresh cream, and homemade preserves are my favorite menu item...but the tiny sandwiches, quiche, fresh fruits and sweet treats are lovely, too. The atmosphere is the best--antique furniture, beautiful old china (every teapot, cup, and saucer is different), and lovely sunlight streaming through the windows makes this perch unforgettable. The red vanilla tea is as good as it gets...buy some across the street at Lovejoys attic and take a bit of the tea room home! You need a reservation!

excerpts: I had sausage rolls which were good (not amazing but good) and really really good scones with clotted cream and jam, no they were really good.
I'd definitely go back for seconds.
scones.author: Nathaniel R.
scones.review: I went on a Sunday afternoon, there were a lot of women in this joint, not many dudes (see other reviews for the types of events folks come here for). Demographics aside, there are some great teas available, if you're a tea nut or British you'll be happy. I had sausage rolls which were good (not amazing but good) and really really good scones with clotted cream and jam, no they were really good. I'd definitely go back for seconds.

excerpts: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office
and I have to say their food is delicious.
This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream.
Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.
scones.author: Jelly F.
scones.review: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office and I have to say their food is delicious. This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream. Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.

excerpts: The scones however...
we're
warm and fluffy on the inside and the mullberry jam that matched with it was perfect with the raisnyness of the scones!!
I could eat those every morning (ok maybe not to the point I get sick of
it.)LOL.
Each of us had our own pot of tea.
scones.author: Trish G.
scones.review:
I went to my first Lovejoy's experience today with a couple of my friends and my friend's bf. Waiting outside till it open for afternoon tea, I can see the cutsey decor and all the mis-matched  Kate Spade tea dishes. The tearoom is very quaint, small and cozy...thought it was spatially larger from the looks on their website, but I was wrong. My friend opted to order us non-experienced tea partiers  2 High Tea for Two. We ordered the Cucumber & Cheese ; Smoke Salmon & Creme Cheese (very tasty); Creme Cheese & Mando Orange ; Bay shrimp & mayo ; Smoked Turkey & Dijon..can't remember the rest. 
The first 3 sandwiches was really tasty and filling. The Bay shrimp & mayo and the smoked Turkey dijon are another story. Yes they are filling, but the shrimp in the Bay Shrimp tasted very watery and wasn't wiped down enough. As for the Smoked Turkey & Dijon, the dijon used was very spicy...has a lot of horseraddish, to the point where I almost choked and had to take it outta my mouth. So if u likey the spicy, then you can choose the dijon & turkey sandwich.
The scones however...we're warm and fluffy on the inside and the mullberry jam that matched with it was perfect with the raisnyness of the scones!! I could eat those every morning (ok maybe not to the point I get sick of it.)LOL.
Each of us had our own pot of tea. My friends got the English Breakfast Tea, Earl Grey tea, Mango flav Black Tea and I got the Passion fruit flav Black Tea. I didn't try the others, but the Passion Fruit tea was ok. Couldn't really taste much of the Passion Fruit flavor as I'm used to in Japanese tea.
The High Tea also had cookies, which my friends say were good, but I couldn't eat anymore after stuffing  myself w/ my diuretic tea and sandwiches.
Cost wasn't as bad, like $64 something, we split the bill so it didn't really hurt us as much.
All in all my Lovejoy's tea experience was ok. I couldn't really give it a high enough score yet...I need to go to other tea places to compare it to this.

excerpts: We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream
(what I live for!).
The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint
and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely
get together with your girlfriends.
scones.author: Helen T.
scones.review: I've been wanting to check out Lovejoy's for awhile now and finally had the chance a few weeks ago.  So I wore some pearls, put on some white gloves and went to high tea with my friend.  And it did not disappoint.  We both got the Queen's Tea and it was A LOT of food!  We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream (what I live for!).  The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely get together with your girlfriends.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea.
We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc.
It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable.
The scones came with devon cream and jam...
scones.author: D L.
scones.review:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time with a close friend on Saturday morning. We were greeted warmly by the waitress and seated promptly as we had reservations at 11am (which is when they open). The decor is adorable and the atmosphere is cozy, clean, and friendly. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea. We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc. It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable. We ordered a side of crumpets with lemon curd - I had never had crumpets before but it complimented the hot tea so well. The scones came with devon cream and jam...YUMMY!

The waitress saw my camera on the table and graciously asked us if we would like our picture taken. We were attended to very often as different waitresses came by to make sure that our teas were filled to the brim and the food was to our liking. 

I am definitely coming back here.. I think it would be a great place to take a girl friend out for her birthday!

excerpts: We went with the Queen's tea and left pretty full from mini sandwiches, tasty scones, and delicious tea.
After delivering the tea, our server came back to check and make sure the tea was ready.
I accidentally dropped all the loose tea leaves to the pot and our server brought a new one, without being asked.
Very happy with that.
At the end they offer pieces of dessert.
They're so cute we couldnt resist, too bad the taste didn't live up to the look.
The whole experience was great, will definitely come back.
scones.author: Mona K.
scones.review: Came here for my bridal shower. After getting pampered for mani/ pedi n salon treatment, we were looking for a day feeling like royalty and love's joy definitely completed the day. We Enjoyed every minute of it. First thing to do: make reservation!Service was really great. We went with the Queen's tea and left pretty full from mini sandwiches, tasty scones, and delicious tea.  After delivering the tea, our server came back to check and make sure the tea was ready. I accidentally dropped all the loose tea leaves to the pot and our server brought a new one, without being asked. Very happy with that. At the end they offer pieces of dessert. They're so cute we couldnt resist, too bad the taste didn't live up to the look. The whole experience was great, will definitely come back.

excerpts: I love the English afternoon tea sandwiches, scones and their special scone spread/butter are all very tasty.
scones.author: Gina W.
scones.review: Whenever I'm in the mood for a traditional English treat, I come here.  The decor is very characteristic, country, floral and English.  I love the English afternoon tea sandwiches, scones and their special scone spread/butter are all very tasty.

excerpts: I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven.
scones.author: Sharman G.
scones.review: Lovejoy's is such a treat, and I'm so glad it exists -- if only they were open seven days a week and/or were open later! I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven. Be sure to get the Tea Room Blend.

excerpts: The best part of our meal were the traditional english scones....
the best scone i have ever eaten in life no lie, like a mix between a bisquit and a scone.
scones.author: Yolanda O.
scones.review: iF YOU WANT THE ULTIMATE GIRLIE INDULGENCE...THIS IS IT!!! My BFF Caroline invited me to a private tea party for two for my birthday yesterday. We had "High Tea For 2". We chose to drink the Rose Petal tea. Along with tea we got an array of finger sandwhiches (salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, turkey & dijon, and chicken & asparagus). The best part of our meal were the traditional english scones....the best scone i have ever eaten in life no lie, like a mix between a bisquit and a scone. Then we ordered crumpets & lemon curd and sausage puffs a la carte. The sandwhiches were accompanied with a green salad and cole slaw. For dessert we each had a shortbread cookie and a petit lil cake that we inhaled in 2 bites. The service and experience was phenomenal. I adored every second of it. Go there with plenty of time to enjoy and relax. It took us 2 hours for our experience and we loved it. The tea pot was kept warm and full at all times. Great service as well.

excerpts: The detail of the scones and pastries was a bit lacking, not too fancy.
More of a lady like lunch.
BUT don't get me wrong
the tea selections are great and just going with friends is so much fun you will get swept away!
Lovely, just not fantastic!
scones.author: julie q.
scones.review: Fun place to go for high tea. The detail of the scones and pastries was a bit lacking, not too fancy. More of a lady like lunch. BUT don't get me wrong the tea selections are great and just going with friends is so much fun you will get swept away! Lovely, just not fantastic!

excerpts: Their fresh baked scones and mini sandwiches are unreal!
This is my favorite place to get tea in the area, and they have a shop across the street that sells more vintagey tea things.
Most of the time I think it's just women in the place, but guys don't be intimidated by the general frilliness.
No one should have to miss Devonshire cream on a fresh scone with strawberry jam.
It's so tasty it hurts.
scones.author: Erinn B.
scones.review: This place is so cute.  The vintage girly tea house things decorate the room, and the waitresses all wear vintage aprons.  Their fresh baked scones and mini sandwiches are unreal!  This is my favorite place to get tea in the area, and they have a shop across the street that sells more vintagey tea things.  Most of the time I think it's just women in the place, but guys don't be intimidated by the general frilliness.  No one should have to miss Devonshire cream on a fresh scone with strawberry jam.  It's so tasty it hurts.

excerpts: The scones -- yummy.
I hate dried scones -- aka Starbucks.
The sandwiches were good, nothing to write home about.
We did try the pear & stilton cheese.
That was new and if you like blue cheese, this is something to try.
It was a great experience
but I'll come back and edit this review when I've had a few more teas...
scones.author: Chris I.
scones.review: Took my husband here this past weekend.  He went to the UK in the fall and has been mad about tea since.  This was the first experience for both of us so I'm trying to be reserved about my rating.  We picked High Tea for two.  We picked their blend and their strongest.   Their blend was described as smooth but ended up very strong.  The strongest ended up smooth????   The scones -- yummy.  I hate dried scones -- aka Starbucks.  The sandwiches were good, nothing to write home about.  We did try the pear & stilton cheese.  That was new and if you like blue cheese, this is something to try.  It was a great experience but I'll come back and edit this review when I've had a few more teas...

excerpts: Add to that  a hearty helping of delicate, fresh and delicious tea sandwiches, buttery currant scones served with huge dollops of real Devonshire cream, hot, buttery, holey crumpets and the room goes a little fuzzy as you slip into warm bliss.
The friendly, attentive staff (decked out in vintage aprons) and the mismatched china make it all the more fun.
In your tea-induced coma, don't miss all the great, fun and funky gift shop across the street:
Lovejoy's attic.
Unlike the "Secret Garden" tea room--you will find NO FAIRIES or TIARAs here.
Beehouse teapots, vintage aprons, a few (genuine) old lady tea hats and lots of tea (fresh looseleaf) and tea accoutrement -- including very hip Japanese Beehouse teapots.
scones.author: M W.
scones.review: Unlike the many faux tearooms in SF, Lovejoys understands that exceptionally fresh, loose leaf tea brewed in piping hot water (refreshed often) is the heart and soul of any tearoom. Add to that  a hearty helping of delicate, fresh and delicious tea sandwiches, buttery currant scones served with huge dollops of real Devonshire cream, hot, buttery, holey crumpets and the room goes a little fuzzy as you slip into warm bliss. The friendly, attentive staff (decked out in vintage aprons) and the mismatched china make it all the more fun. In your tea-induced coma, don't miss all the great, fun and funky gift shop across the street: Lovejoy's attic. Unlike the "Secret Garden" tea room--you will find NO FAIRIES or TIARAs here. Beehouse teapots, vintage aprons, a few (genuine) old lady tea hats and lots of tea (fresh looseleaf) and tea accoutrement -- including very hip Japanese Beehouse teapots.

excerpts: And the scones are to die for.
Can't wait to return.
scones.author: Big e.
scones.review: Cute and very girly!  Loved the passionfruit and mango black teas.  And the scones are to die for.  Can't wait to return.

excerpts: It's the best place in the Bay Area to have tea; sandwiches are excellent, ploughman's lunch wonderful, scones and Devonshire cream to die for.
Ambience is wonderful -- classy, idiosyncratic, clever, relaxing.
The only negative is that it's fairly pricey.
Makes a nice special-occasion treat.
scones.author: Thomas R.
scones.review: I can't say enough good things about this unique restaurant. It's the best place in the Bay Area to have tea; sandwiches are excellent, ploughman's lunch wonderful, scones and Devonshire cream to die for. Ambience is wonderful -- classy, idiosyncratic, clever, relaxing. The only negative is that it's fairly pricey. Makes a nice special-occasion treat.

excerpts: Really enjoyed the cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches, the scones are also very good.
Suggest reservations--it can get pretty full.
Nothing better on a foggy day.
scones.author: kelly f.
scones.review: A cup of tea in the afternoon is so civilized. Really enjoyed the cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches, the scones are also very good. Suggest reservations--it can get pretty full. Nothing better on a foggy day.

excerpts: The scones which are my favorite thing on the plate, so warm, flaky and so delicious, I am sure heaven will serve these.
The tea is outstanding.
After you have finished with your meal they bring around a wonderful selection of petite fores and truffles for you to choose from if you wish.
Seeing the platter of treats and the wonderfully glowing face of the server gives me such mixed emotions.
scones.author: M. Allan P.
scones.review:
My friends and I go to Lovejoy's every chance we get and I can not say enough about how FABULOUS Lovejoy's actually is.  It's starts the moment you walk in the door.  You are virtually stepping into the most  inviting, cozy, eclectic, and oh so vintage English style parlor and are greeted almost instantaneously by the warmest and most genuine smiles you will ever see.  It's like going to grandma's house for  a family reunion.  It is filled with happy people laughing and chatting, kids playing dress up and smell of delicious food wafting through the air.   For anyone who is feeling home sick I suggest going to Lovejoy's, I guarantee the feelings will disappear by the time you leave.  

There is an amazing selection of  wonderfully tasty food, tea and sweets.  The tea sandwiches are by far the best I have had...EVER! The scones which are my favorite thing on the plate, so warm, flaky and so delicious, I am sure heaven will serve these. The tea is outstanding.  After you have finished with your meal they bring around a wonderful selection of petite fores and truffles for you to choose from if you wish.  Seeing the platter of treats and the wonderfully glowing face of the server gives me such mixed emotions.  I am excited about diving into sweets being offered and sad because I know at this point I am almost finished with my tea and will have to be leaving soon.  

Lovejoy's is an amazing way to spend the afternoon alone, with that special someone or with a group to celebrate a special event.  It doesn't matter what the reason is just GO TO LOVEJOY'S once and you will return again and again.

excerpts: This place is just beautiful...the scones and fig tempanad sandwich is just delightful.
Everyone makes you feel right at home and fulfilled.
Ever need just to catch up with a friend, sit for a while drink eat and enjoy, this is the place to be.
scones.author: Edessa C.
scones.review: This place is just beautiful...the scones and fig tempanad sandwich is just delightful.  Everyone makes you feel right at home and fulfilled.  Ever need just to catch up with a friend, sit for a while drink eat and enjoy, this is the place to be.

excerpts: Still, this is the place to go for your clotted cream, scones, lemon curd, and little sandwiches.
This is ideal for girlish and lady-like get-togethers and they handle groups exceptionally well.
No matter how busy they are, the waitresses don't seem to mind capturing your picture-perfect tea party on your camera when asked.
They even take the extra step of shooting extra pics and positioning the 'reserved for royalty' sign in the photo frame.
Delightfully kitschy and one of those instances in which it's more 'British' than what you typically get in Britain.
scones.author: Juno P.
scones.review: Sitting amidst the miss-matching tea sets and doilies, you'll feel like you're in the living room of the English Nanna you never had.  And this Nanna is intent on stuffing you silly with cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches and delightful petit fours.  Thankfully, they have some healthier options like organic spring greens and hummus, but that is the extent to which they depart from the typically 'deep in Devonshire' English menu.  I wish they'd infuse it with a little more 'New British cuisine,' like having more wholemeal bread (or 'brown bread' as our they call it on the other side of the pond).  Still, this is the place to go for your clotted cream, scones, lemon curd, and little sandwiches.  This is ideal for girlish and lady-like get-togethers and they handle groups exceptionally well.  No matter how busy they are, the waitresses don't seem to mind capturing your picture-perfect tea party on your camera when asked.  They even take the extra step of shooting extra pics and positioning the 'reserved for royalty' sign in the photo frame.  Delightfully kitschy and one of those instances in which it's more 'British' than what you typically get in Britain.

excerpts: Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed.

The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios.
Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways.
The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch.
The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?
scones.author: Gourmet G.
scones.review: As rabid an Anglophile as I am, I detest tea . . . the beverage (although iced will do), not the lovely little afternoon break that's de rigueur in England, even to this day. In London, the best are offered on Oxford Street in Selfridge's - a grande dame of a department store overshadowed only by Harrod's - and Fortnum and Mason in Piccadilly. Here in the heart of Noe Valley we have this cozy  tearoom with its Laura Ashley-inspired decor providing a replica good enough to pass muster. Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed. The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios. Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways. The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch. The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?

excerpts:
My thoughts:

Pros:
-TEA SANDWICHES & SCONES.
scones.author: Carrie A.
scones.review:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time after reading the rave reviews here on Yelp. I usually go to Tranquitea in Pacifica and have experienced a NZ teatime. My thoughts:

Pros:
-TEA SANDWICHES & SCONES. Lovejoy's has an excellent assortment of tea sandwiches. You get to choose from 16 delectable little sandwiches, of which I enjoyed the Chicken-Apple-Walnut and the Chicken & Asparagus. High Tea for Two is an awesome deal.

Cons:
-LACK OF GENUINE CUSTOMER SERVICE. My mom went in to get a table while I found parking. Even though they had four women working, I wasn't greeted at the door and we were only asked how our meal was right at the beginning (when we barely took bites of our food). They topped of my tea without asking if I wanted it topped off (my idea of being wasteful). When the woman served us Petits Fours at the end of our meal, she picked the dessert up w/ the tongs and put it on my dirty lunch plate. Oh, and the Petits Fours were warm.
-PASTRIES. I've had meatpies overseas, and I really did not enjoy the meatpie here. I ordered the Curried Chicken, and it was definitely too spicy to be enjoying with tea. The pastry shell was not flaky and was quite soggy. It reminded me of one of those microwave pastry deals, but worse.
-AMBIENCE. The set-up was very cute; however, it did need some tidying up. Our tablecloth was stained with food and the place seemed like it needed some dusting. The area that had tea cups, teas, and collectibles for sale was a bit disorganized. This area drastically needed some cleaning up. Although some might appreciated the mismatched tea sets, I did not.

Although Lovejoy's has a nice assortment of teas, it wasn't anything that you wouldn't find at any other tea room.

Overall, Lovejoy's was not the pleasant little tea room that I envisioned it to be. I didn't feel like I was truly having High Tea and felt more like I was eating in a San Francisco diner.

DON'T BOTHER GOING HERE.

My recommendation: Tranquilitea in Pacifica. Parking is easy and I guarantee you'll have a heavenly High Tea experience :)

excerpts: The scones were very fresh and warm.
Cottled cream did wonders.
I even had room for the cookies.
YUMMMM.
Would love love love to go back!
All three of us were soooo stuffed!
But in a good way.
Next time, I will try their Shephard's pie.
Miss those...
Oh, there is only one bathroom.
And don't use the lotion, it smells like shit!
scones.author: Aiko L.
scones.review:
Deeeelicious!!!!
Just went there today for the first time after having heard stories of wonderful sandwiches and teas. We made reservations for 1pm, but got there around 1:20, since our bart was running late (you can take the 24th/mission station, and walk about 10mins).
It was pretty packed when we arrived, but our table was there, w/that little "reserved" sign on it. The service was great. Our teas came out in less than 5 mins.
We got the High Tea for Two plus one. Three of us ordered two types of sandwiches each. The fig & olive was not very popular, only one of us liked it. The pear & stilton cheese was very good. Chicken & asparagus delicious. Roastbeef and horseradish a little too spicy for me. Cucumber and cream cheese could've used a little more taste, but ate it all anyway. Salmon and cream cheese, I didn't eat, but the other two loved it. The teas--passion fruit tea was sweet and yummy. Chinese rosehip very aromatic. I got the forest berries, which smelled and tasted like cough syrup! gasp. I told our server I really did not like it, and she asked if I wanted a replacement :) Hooray! I got an earl grey instead, since that's what I know and love. It was great. The scones were very fresh and warm. Cottled cream did wonders. I even had room for the cookies. YUMMMM. Would love love love to go back!
All three of us were soooo stuffed! But in a good way. Next time, I will try their Shephard's pie. Miss those...

Oh, there is only one bathroom. And don't use the lotion, it smells like shit!

AND feeling like your in grandma's living room then you will LOVE lovejoys!
its a sweet little place only to be reserved for those who will appreciate it...like me...

excerpts: My favorites were the scones and crumpets.
The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.
scones.author: Lisa C.
scones.review: This was the first time I've ever had afternoon tea. I thought the place was really cute and the food was delicious. It's a bit pricey and not something you'd do often. But get a bunch of people together and it's great to way to spend an afternoon. Go for the High Tea or the Queen's Tea for the most variety but make sure you come with a hearty appetite. My favorites were the scones and crumpets. The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.

excerpts: We ordered the "High-Tea for 2, with an extra added on" which comes with a choice of 2 sandwiches per person, a green salad, scones with devon shire cream and jam, and cookies.
For the sandwiches we ordered chicken apple walnut, chicken & asparagus, and pear & stilton.
They were all very good, but the pear & stilton was my fav.
It all culminated with the scones and devon shire cream--
Oh my god--pure heaven.
Good service, cute ambience, and yummy scones and tea! loved it!
scones.author: S A.
scones.review: Went here for brunch with 2 friends. The atmosphere is really kitschy with lots of knick knacks--kind of feels like what a sweet old grandma from england's house would be like. The chairs, tables, china--all odds and ends-nothing matches, but that's what gives this place its charm. We ordered the "High-Tea for 2, with an extra added on" which comes with a choice of 2 sandwiches per person, a green salad, scones with devon shire cream and jam, and cookies. For the sandwiches we ordered chicken apple walnut, chicken & asparagus, and pear & stilton. They were all very good, but the pear & stilton was my fav. For tea, I chose yorkshire gold which was a stronger black tea. Everything was very very delish, and I at 1st thought it wouldn't be enough to fill me up, but by the end I was stuffed. It all culminated with the scones and devon shire cream--Oh my god--pure heaven.  Good service, cute ambience, and yummy scones and tea! loved it!

excerpts: Having a connection to England myself, it reminds me of those days - such sweet sandwiches, sausage rolls & baked beans, amazing scones with clotted cream!
Need I say more?!
The only downfall is it's usually really busy and the prices are high!
scones.author: Michelle D.
scones.review: I have been bringing my parents here and meeting here with friends for a few years and I LOVE IT!! Having a connection to England myself, it reminds me of those days - such sweet sandwiches, sausage rolls & baked beans, amazing scones with clotted cream! Need I say more?! The only downfall is it's usually really busy and the prices are high!

excerpts: Finger sandwiches, warm scones split open and smothered with double cream and preserves and a hot pot of tea were enjoyed (almost) daily by my engorging little self.
Upon my return to the states, I just about gave up the dream of ever having such a luxuriously delicious afternoon until I came to know Lovejoy's Tea Room.
First of all, it's adorable.
The walls are covered in little antiquey thing-a-ma-bobs (all of which are for sale), the tables adorned with lace doileys and cloths and every woman who works there is almost ridiculously kind.
scones.author: Robin A.
scones.review:
I did one of those semester abroad things in London, and one my absolute favorite things about the brits is their High Tea. Finger sandwiches, warm scones split open and smothered with double cream and preserves and a hot pot of tea were enjoyed (almost) daily by my engorging little self. 
Upon my return to the states, I just about gave up the dream of ever having such a luxuriously delicious afternoon until I came to know Lovejoy's Tea Room.
First of all, it's adorable. The walls are covered in little antiquey thing-a-ma-bobs (all of which are for sale), the tables adorned with lace doileys and cloths and every woman who works there is almost ridiculously kind. (On a personal note, I also enjoy that most of the time the tea room is a women's space, sometimes a few men will be here and there).

Next, to the food and tea. Hot pots of neverending tea accompany your high tea selections or you can buy just a pot for $8. All the teas are amazing, and the servers come by every 10 minutes or so to check on the tea level and refill it. Everytime I've been there I've ordered the High Tea for Two to share with my girlfriend, a freakin' steal at $34 bucks. You select 4 types of sandwiches to share, a warm scone each, with strawberry preserves and double devon cream, 2 shortbread tea biscuits, coleslaw (with caraway seeds mmmmm) and spring greens/dressing. I order the cucumber/cream cheese sandwiches (they cut off the crusts!!!), The Stilton and Pear, The Artichoke Hummus and the Tomato and cheese (I'm a vegetarian, though I'm sure their meat sandwich selections are just are delicious). 
All of this is served on a layered silver tray, which makes me feel a bit like a princess, I can't help it.
At the end of the meal, though I've always been stuffed, they bring around yet another beautiful tray with petit fours for an additional $2.50. Omg, just get one, ok?
Everything about this place is enjoyable, calming, nurturing and delicious, and I feel again like I am in the UK. I tried to think of a reason to give it only 4 stars, but I really can't. 
An amazing place to bring out-of-town guests, or to enjoy a lazy sunday brunch with your love or a good book. 
Oh, and their strawberry preserves would make sawdust taste like mana from heaven. How the hell do they make them?

excerpts: We like to order the queen's tea- don't eat anything before hand, all those sandwiches and salad, scones, crumpets, cookies and lemon curd is more than plenty, but everything is too yummy to leave behind!
Lovejoy's feels indulgent, and is therefore a great place to celebrate life's exciting events.
I've seen many a shower or small party here.
Mostly, though, this teahouse always reminds me how important it is to honor our friendships and indulge them with time, space, and conversation over perfectly steeped tea!
scones.author: Jessica R.
scones.review: Now, there are plenty of places to have an impromptu get together for tea, but if you want to make it a special date (and you should! value your girlfriends!), call two weeks in advance and book yourself a table. You can wear anything from jeans to your party dress, it's all acceptable. Your tea will be served and timed perfectly, with plenty of cream and sugar, should you need it, and enough strainers so that you'll never have to mix flavors. Beware the giddiness of too much caffeine. There is an hour and a hall seating time (which we tend to use and then some), but we have never been rushed out of a table. We like to order the queen's tea- don't eat anything before hand, all those sandwiches and salad, scones, crumpets, cookies and lemon curd is more than plenty, but everything is too yummy to leave behind! Lovejoy's feels indulgent, and is therefore a great place to celebrate life's exciting events. I've seen many a shower or small party here. Mostly, though, this teahouse always reminds me how important it is to honor our friendships and indulge them with time, space, and conversation over perfectly steeped tea!

excerpts: Best scones ever!
scones.author: Millo M.
scones.review: Absolutely the best English tea room in San Francisco. My older sister first brought me to Lovejoy and have introduced it all my girlfriends. This charming place filled with antique is perfect for bridal showers and birthday parties. Be sure to check out the store across the street. Best scones ever!

excerpts: We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.
The service was the best any of us had experienced!
It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!
scones.author: Laurie G.
scones.review: What an amazing experience!  We recently had a birthday tea with 9 girlfriends and it was by far the best high tea experience any of us had ever had!  We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.  The service was the best any of us had experienced!  It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!

excerpts: I've been back to the UK a few times since and feel about scones & Britain the way I do about bagels & NYC.
It's nearly impossible to get a good scone with all the fixin's here in the US, but Lovejoy's does a remarkably good job.
Beyond that, though, it's a joy to sit there with the china tea cups, the wonderful tea, the delicious treats.
(Why are simple, little sandwiches with the crust cut off so dang good?)
The staff is wonderful, accommodating and cheerful.
They promptly fit us in even when the recording had said they were not taking any more reservations and our server was totally on the ball.
The idea that you are not only able but encouraged to linger over endless pots of tea and nibbles is great.
I was a bit surprised at the rowdiness of the crowd and, consequently, the loudness of the place.
This isn't a deal-breaker for me at all, just something worth noting since it's been mentioned before.
In our case it wasn't screaming children, but it was a large group of excitable women for a wedding shower, I'm guessing.
So, if you're looking for a very upscale, quiet, formal place for tea, this isn't quite it.
But the trade-off is that it's not at all snooty, the prices are reasonable, service is excellent and food delicious.
scones.author: Fran C.
scones.review: I really think Lovejoy's is a joy.  About 20 years ago now (yikes!) I tasted my first scone, visiting my sister who was living in Scotland.  I've been back to the UK a few times since and feel about scones & Britain the way I do about bagels & NYC. It's nearly impossible to get a good scone with all the fixin's here in the US, but Lovejoy's does a remarkably good job. Beyond that, though, it's a joy to sit there with the china tea cups, the wonderful tea, the delicious treats. (Why are simple, little sandwiches with the crust cut off so dang good?)  The staff is wonderful, accommodating and cheerful.  They promptly fit us in even when the recording had said they were not taking any more reservations and our server was totally on the ball.  The idea that you are not only able but encouraged to linger over endless pots of tea and nibbles is great.
