I was a bit surprised at the rowdiness of the crowd and, consequently, the loudness of the place.  This isn't a deal-breaker for me at all, just something worth noting since it's been mentioned before.  In our case it wasn't screaming children, but it was a large group of excitable women for a wedding shower, I'm guessing.  So, if you're looking for a very upscale, quiet, formal place for tea, this isn't quite it.  But the trade-off is that it's not at all snooty, the prices are reasonable, service is excellent and food delicious.

excerpts: The sandwiches,scones, and tea(s)are wonderful.
The hostess's were great, I would definitely go back.
I've been raving about Lovejoy's ever since I sat down at our table.
Lovejoy's has become a new tradition for me.
scones.author: Linda K.
scones.review: I am so impressed with Lovejoy's. The sandwiches,scones, and tea(s)are wonderful. The hostess's were great, I would definitely go back. I've been raving about Lovejoy's ever since I sat down at our table. Lovejoy's has become a new tradition for me.

excerpts: Like most high teas, the Queen's tea came with scones, crumpets, lemon curd, fruit preserves/jam, and Devon cream.
I really liked that it also came with fresh fruit.
crumpets.author: Vira P.
crumpets.review:
My friend and I love checking out all the high tea places San Francisco offers.  This one has been on my list for quite some time, especially because I've seen it in several magazines and travel shows.

I, too, recommend going to Lovejoy's Tea Room for high tea.  They definitely have their aesthetic down.  The atmosphere is very English grandma.  There's cute knick knacks everywhere, and they even have hats available for you to wear while you dine!

What I like about their menu is that you can choose your sandwiches.  I don't eat beef, and there have been some times where I can't substitute items without changing my entire order.  I got the turkey with dijon mustard and artichoke hummus for my Queen's tea.  They were both very good.  The Queen's tea also came with a salad and coleslaw.  I wasn't a fan of the salad because it has arugula.  I'm not an fan of it, but it did go well with the coleslaw, which had the right amount of dressing.  I'm glad there was salad, though, because I needed some greens with this meal.

Like most high teas, the Queen's tea came with scones, crumpets, lemon curd, fruit preserves/jam, and Devon cream.  I really liked that it also came with fresh fruit.  You also get a tea biscuit and your choice of a petit four at the end.

Some of the other places I've gone to were heavy on the desserts.  Lovejoy's isn't, which is fantastic.  I usually feel like I'm going into diabetic shock, but I felt that dining hear was well balanced.

And as for the tea, I got blood orange, and it was delicious.  I didn't need any sugar at all.  

Service was fantastic.  I felt welcomed and well taken care of.

I suggest making reservations as this place is very popular.  And give yourself at least 30 minutes to find parking if you're driving.

excerpts: Perfect if you want something lighter or if you're not into the usual scones, crumpets and sandwiches.
crumpets.author: Jessie L.
crumpets.review:
Solid afternoon tea. Nothing particularly special about the food or even the tea, but Lovejoy's has that cozy afternoon tea vibe and is a good spot for catching up with a friend or gathering for a birthday. It's definitely more about the company and experience than the actual food or tea.

That being said, it's kind of an expensive experience, with the cheapest tea services being about $20 and the full tea service (Queen's Tea) being $30. It's easy to make a similar experience at home for much less, but obviously without the quirky decorations around.

I ordered the HEALTHY TEA ($20), which was a large platter consisting of salad, carrots and cucumber, fruit, walnuts, crackers, cream cheese and an option of smoked salmon or artichoke hummus. Perfect if you want something lighter or if you're not into the usual scones, crumpets and sandwiches.

For my tea, I got the Black Vanilla with Lavender, which was recommended by our waitress. Couldn't really taste the lavender but it had a subtle sweetness reminiscent of vanilla. They're very good about refilling your tea pot so it's really bottomless.

Note that they do have a 2 hour limit on the tables! There's also only 1 bathroom and a consistently long line so don't wait until the last moment to get in line.

excerpts: I recommend the high tea which comes with two sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and crumpets.
crumpets.author: Amy J.
crumpets.review:
If you like to indulge in afternoon high tea, this is the place for you. Invite your best girlfriends for a real treat. There are several different items you can try. I recommend the high tea which comes with two sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and crumpets. My friend and I each ordered the high tea which also includes tea of course. The staff are lovely to boot. 

Even though the items aren't really that big, I found myself getting full after eating. It's not super noisy here so it's a good place to catch up. They also have fun hats you can wear while indulging or just take some pictures with them. It's not too far away from the 24th St Mission BART stop but there was plenty of parking in the middle of the day. It's worth checking out at least once.

excerpts: The crumpets have gone up for two pieces ($4 for one crumpet, seriously?!)
crumpets.author: Petra S.
crumpets.review: Just like everything else that was good in the city, lovejoys apparently has become the latest sellout. The last couple of times i've come here i noticed that the new owners lack the British charm, the hospitality and most of all the portions that Lovejoys was so well known for under previous ownership. Portions have become incredibly stingy and trust me as i have been going here for nearly a decade. I always get the same thing, the egg and onion salad and smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. There is barely any smoked salmon in there and the tiny layer that is there covers about half. The same with the egg salad being a very thinly spread layer and it was extremely over salt especially today. The crumpets have gone up for two pieces ($4 for one crumpet, seriously?!) the teas don't taste as strong (i always get the tea room blend) prices have gone up and service is not very warm or friendly, except for when you're asking for the check. Saying that i'm very disappointed is an understatement!

excerpts: Personally I don't really enjoy crumpets or Petit Fours so that basically means $7 for a bit of fruit.
However, if you love crumpets and Petit Fours, go for it!
I can finish the whole High or Queen's Tea myself so it makes me full but doesn't keep me full for more than an hour or two.
However, the experience is really fun and cute for special occasions.
crumpets.author: Amanda L.
crumpets.review:
I recently went twice and got Queen's Tea one time and High Tea the other time. Both are good options but I definitely prefer High Tea and will probably get that from now on. The reason I prefer High Tea over Queen's Tea is that Queen's Tea is $7 more and only gives you a crumpet, some fruit, and a Petit Four. Personally I don't really enjoy crumpets or Petit Fours so that basically means $7 for a bit of fruit. However, if you love crumpets and Petit Fours, go for it! I can finish the whole High or Queen's Tea myself so it makes me full but doesn't keep me full for more than an hour or two. However, the experience is really fun and cute for special occasions. If you're looking for a light fruity tea, one of my personal favorites is White Peach.

The environment itself is very old fashioned and cute with pretty, mismatched dishes. Everyone is friendly there too. However, both times I came with a party of 3 and got stuck at the table with the "shared" bench, meaning you share a bench with someone from another table. The time I sat on that bench, I felt every time the girl sitting on the other side moved or rocked it (because of course it's not level). I plan to now go with either one other person or a party of 4+ now unless they replace that bench haha. Don't forget to make reservations (which you can do online)!

excerpts: We ordered two sets Queen's tea which had fruits, salad, scones, sandwiches, and crumpets.
The scones were scrumptious (especially with lemon curd) and the tea sandwiches were divine (my fave was the egg and onions and the apple and cream cheese)!
We tried the peppermint tea, and the peach green tea- both very good and refreshing.
Definitely a good place to hang out when you are in Noe Valley.
crumpets.author: Notsky P.
crumpets.review: A perfect spot to enjoy afternoon tea with friends.  Our reservations was at 4pm but I came 15 minutes early.  Not an issue as they have our tables ready and promptly seated me while I wait for the rest of my party.  The decor was on point and the mismatched tea sets were adorable!  We ordered two sets Queen's tea which had fruits, salad, scones, sandwiches, and crumpets.  The scones were scrumptious (especially with lemon curd) and the tea sandwiches were divine (my fave was the egg and onions and the apple and cream cheese)!  We tried the peppermint tea, and the peach green tea- both very good and refreshing.  Definitely a good place to hang out when you are in Noe Valley.

excerpts: It comes with fresh fruit two sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, scones, crumpets tea cookies and petite fours and of course a bottomless pot of your choice of tea.
The Queens tea was about ~$29 per person.
You can't go wrong with the tea, and their scones are so good and buttery and are warm when you get them.
We got the smoked salmon/cream cheese, chicken walnut apple and pear and Stilton sandwiches.
The smoked salmon was delicious, pear was ok
and I would skip the chicken walnut apple next time.
Their fruit was sweet and the coleslaw lacked flavor and the salad was just the greens, mandarin oranges with balsamic vinaigrette.
The crumpets come half way through and we're nice and hot.
The petite fours were sweet and a nice touch to the end.
Over all I would come again but maybe just get the tea, scones, a crumpet and maybe even one sandwich.
crumpets.author: Michelle P.
crumpets.review: I ordered the queens tea. It comes with fresh fruit two sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, scones, crumpets tea cookies and petite fours and of course a bottomless pot of your choice of tea. The Queens tea was about ~$29 per person. You can't go wrong with the tea, and their scones are so good and buttery and are warm when you get them. We got the smoked salmon/cream cheese, chicken walnut apple and pear and Stilton sandwiches. The smoked salmon was delicious, pear was ok and I would skip the chicken walnut apple next time. Their fruit was sweet and the coleslaw lacked flavor and the salad was just the greens, mandarin oranges with balsamic vinaigrette. The crumpets come half way through and we're nice and hot. The petite fours were sweet and a nice touch to the end. Over all I would come again but maybe just get the tea, scones, a crumpet and maybe even one sandwich.

excerpts: Everything was pretty delish, but the most outstanding would be the crumpets.
They were warm & soft & crunchy.
crumpets.author: Amy C.
crumpets.review:
My sweet boyfriend took me here for my belated birthday celebration this past Sunday since I celebrated with both him & my family on my actual birthday. Originally, he made reservations at Benihana, but I prefer something that is new to us from my bookmarks therefore Lovejoy it is! 

We luckily found a good spot a few steps from Lovejoy's since it was starting to drizzle at the time. I love the heart painting on the side of the place. So cute!

We were seated at a small table next to the English red telephone booth looking cabinet. This place is very mismatch-y which really bothered my hunny cause he's like OCD. Haha.. but it's still very cozy and cute and unique little place. 

We both got the Queen's Tea for 2 while he chose the English Breakfast while I had the China Rose Petal tea. Everything was pretty delish, but the most outstanding would be the crumpets. They were warm & soft & crunchy. Yum! 

Service was friendly, sweet, and attentive. The lady which we're pretty sure is the owner is always addressing us as loveys which was very endearing. 

She brought out a candle on a present box looking petit four since he told them it was for my birthday during the reservation process. So that was nice. 

It's definitely a cute little tea place to visit if you're into high tea. :)

excerpts:
I  had the cucumber sandwich with cream cheese
Hummus and cucumber, crumpets with lemon curd,
Serving was just right.
This is a casual and wonderful place to visit.
I ordered the Queen Tea.
crumpets.author: Margaret C.
crumpets.review:
The service was excellent.  We were able to relax without being rushed.  The Tea was oh so good.  I  had the cucumber sandwich with cream cheese
Hummus and cucumber, crumpets with lemon curd,
Serving was just right.  This is a casual and wonderful place to visit.  I ordered the Queen Tea.

excerpts: Love the lemon curd, almond paste petit four, homemade scone and crumpets, loved the ambiance, the bone china,  and the tea strainer.
Extra scone is 2.95.
crumpets.author: Helen L.
crumpets.review: Let's start from the beginning.   Try getting a group of 6 to decide on the date and time.  Once done, go online to their website and fill out the form.  Then i get an email to confirm date and time with Lovejoy.  Then gave them my credit card to reserve this time and date.  I was told as long as i call to cancel my credit card won't be used.  Closer to the date i got a reminder text and a reminder call.  This reflects how much they want us to show up..  Unfortunately, only one could not come.  I wasn't charged and they were super nice about it.  We got the queen's tea and healthy tea.  $2.00 tea charge for each person.  We got the caffeine free berry tea and ceylon decaf.  This was a 4 pm reservation so we watched our caffeine intake.  Ordered a side of sausage puff which was delicious. Love the lemon curd, almond paste petit four, homemade scone and crumpets, loved the ambiance, the bone china,  and the tea strainer.  Extra scone is 2.95.  Crumpet was spongy and warm.  Devonshire cream was yummy.  Tiny cup of coleslaw.

excerpts: Quiche looked good; we didn't get to try the crumpets.
crumpets.author: Miriam W.
crumpets.review:
OK, I'm going to split this into a two-pronged attack!

1) TEA WHORES

If you are a true tea connoisseur and lover and you have at least 5 loose-leaf teas at home in proper temperature controlled and vacuum-sealed containers that did not come to you as a gift in a gift basket, you are a true tea lover. Being a generic tea lover, however, is separate from being a Western-tradition high tea lover, in that, there's East and West. Dimsum-style East, high tea-style West. If you have participated and explored the tea rituals of the west frequently -- you will not see this as five-star place, but you will enjoy it. 

2) GENERAL PUBLIC

It is quaint, it is charming like all the reviews say. The teas are good. Not amazing, but good. The service is ... good enough. It's San Francisco, the place isn't huge. The prices ... are as expected. The ambiance is your dotty grandma's house, stuffed to the gills with tea paraphernalia and family photos, doilies and crochet-work cuddling up the dusty old lampshades. The bathroom is clean and spacious (a rarity in the city). It is filled with many groups of women at various stages of life, from celebrating engagements to graduations to gossiping to catch up. The petit fours are freshly made and moist (I was surprised and impressed by this). The scones are freshly made, as they should be. They do provide proper clotted / Devonshire cream, and luxurious preserves to smear on your scone. They have a good-sized savoury menu aside from tea service.

If you're not a tea whore and don't really take your high tea very seriously, and you rarely do this sort of thing, you'll be satisfied with the environment and you will have fun, and one tea service will generally make you stuffed and happy.

If you ARE a tea whore, you will notice some thangs. They aren't major, but cost the fifth star:

- Service: This place has been around a while and is extremely busy and popular, and it's in the city, so I get the "French maitre'd" vibe that has happened. Let's just say that the vibe I expect when I go to High Tea is generally about ensuring you are calm, comfortable, looked after, and delighted. We had touch points with multiple staff members and only one staff member was happy and pleasant toward us; the rest treated us like they were busy lor annoyed and that worrying about how busy they were was more important than worrying about the experience for the customers they had. They basically expect that making the food, putting the tea in front of you, the decor, and checking on you once suffices. It does not. I highly recommend that if it's possible all the staff members attend a proper tea (I have yet to find one in SF actually, even at highly rated hotels) and once they have their mind blown they'll get it. It's hard to explain. It's about the experience, the ritual, and being catered to, tea time is sacred in England. Originally, it went on for hours. If you are really trying to recreate that experience, you're not there yet. If you're making your own Cali version ... it's good enough.

- Pricing: A quality tea service doesn't charge you extra for a "bottomless pot of tea." It's included in the price of the service. Also it's SF, so I wasn't surprised by how much you pay for what you get, but it's a little on the stingy side (I was letting it go for the foodstuffs but I got offended that you're paying extra for the tea, since that's the whole point of being there).

- Food: For 3 people, they don't give you particularly generous portions of clotted cream or preserves. We are all trying to watch our weight so we didn't ask for more and made do. Salad is generous. The caraway seed (I think that's the spice) is FAR too overused in their coleslaw salad and I'd frankly they not include that salad and expend that on a free petit four for everybody by default. Quiche looked good; we didn't get to try the crumpets. Scones were good. Sandwiches were on the small side so if you order a tea service with 2 included per person I recommend you order one more for the table to share. Cream cheese is nothing special / has nothing in it (no herbs or seasoning) but the salmon tasted fresh. Basically the sandwiches are super simple and more like tea at home that auntie made versus tea at a fine tea house. Tomato and cheese is straight up tomato and cheese - you could make it at home.

- Tea: As mentioned, good, not amazing. If they spent money on real high quality tea they'd be broke of course, or prices would have to go up significantly. They have a pretty broad selection. I just went with the House Blend, which was okay. Friends ordered other types and were pleased with theirs. The staff made note of how long we should steep the tea, which was great to see.

If you ever want to have a tea experience that blows your mind -- Brown Hotel in London. DO IT.

excerpts: It comes with your choice of tea, your choice of two types of tea sandwiches (their list of sandwiches is fairly extensive as is their tea list), a scone with preserves Devon cream and lemon curd, fruit, a salad, coleslaw, crumpets and a petit four after the meal.
I left stuffed and full of tea.
If you ask they will happily refill your pot.
Yesterday I got the afternoon Darjeeling
but before I had gotten the China rose petal
which I think I liked better and ended up buying a bag across the street at the attic.
crumpets.author: Josie C.
crumpets.review: This was my second time coming to lovejoy's tea room. I love how shabby chic it is and how so many different types of events can be held there. Yesterday there were little girl tea parties, bridal showers, baby showers and just regular tea time guests. I went for my birthday with my boyfriend - thankfully, for him, there were other men there (but the patrons are overwhelmingly female). We had the queens tea which is the best way to experience the tea room fare. It comes with your choice of tea, your choice of two types of tea sandwiches (their list of sandwiches is fairly extensive as is their tea list), a scone with preserves Devon cream and lemon curd, fruit, a salad, coleslaw, crumpets and a petit four after the meal. I left stuffed and full of tea. If you ask they will happily refill your pot. Yesterday I got the afternoon Darjeeling but before I had gotten the China rose petal which I think I liked better and ended up buying a bag across the street at the attic. I loved the scones they're so flakey and hot and I loved loading them up with lemon curd and Devon cream as well as the jam. Overall I can't wait to go back. It's just a very nice way to spend the afternoon. My only issue is that there is only one bathroom - it is a tea room so there is always a line and it is also pretty noisy at peak hours especially with the large groups so it is a little hard to hear if you are with someone who is soft spoken. But I still enjoyed it and am craving their scones today.

excerpts: After all of this goodness, they came out with crumpets for us!
The girls had peanut butter and honey sandwiches with hot cocoa and whipped cream on the side, and they LOVED it!
crumpets.author: Magdalena L.
crumpets.review:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! I've always really wanted to take my daughter out to tea, so I decided to see what I could find on Yelp. After reading all of the rave reviews for LoveJoy, we decided to give it a try and we loved it! Great customer service, yummy sandwiches, warm DELICIOUS scones, and the Rose Petal tea was heaven! After all of this goodness, they came out with crumpets for us! The girls had peanut butter and honey sandwiches with hot cocoa and whipped cream on the side, and they LOVED it! At the end the brought out petit fours for dessert, I normally don't like petit fours but these were so yummy! 

I definitely plan to come back for more mommy daughter dates here, such a fun treat!

excerpts: All their teas are wonderful and so are all the sandwiches, scones and crumpets.
Service was great!
Parking isn't bad, it's street parking only but not bad.
I recommend this place highly!
crumpets.author: Nanette D.
crumpets.review: We love coming here all dressed up in hats and gloves.  All their teas are wonderful and so are all the sandwiches, scones and crumpets.  Service was great! Parking isn't bad, it's street parking only but not bad.  I recommend this place highly!

excerpts: The crumpets were just okay.
The salad and dressing were good, as was the fruit.
The petit-fours dessert was just okay.
The truffles were the best I think.
The marzipan cake so-so.
crumpets.author: June B.
crumpets.review: The crumpets were just okay. The salad and dressing were good, as was the fruit. The petit-fours dessert was just okay. The truffles were the best I think. The marzipan cake so-so.

excerpts: The set also came with scones (yum!), 3 types of spread (lemon curd was the best), shortbread cookies, fruit, coleslaw, crumpets (super "spongy", but I wasn't really fond bland/buttery things), salad, and dessert chocolates (s'mores was the best).
My favorite item was probably the dessert chocolate and scone + lemon curd, but the overall package was great!
I'll be back again!
crumpets.author: Sarina C.
crumpets.review:
I love this place! It's super cute and decorated - I kind of wish I could decorate my room like this but whenever I have a lot of clutter it just looks messy... Lovejoy's does it right though. I think this is the perfect place to hang out with some girl friends. Dress up too, it's fun. ;)

This place is walkable (4 blocks) from the 24th St Mission BART station. It felt relatively safe walking there, plus there's a really colorful pink house on the way here! 

My 2 friends and I made a reservation on Thursday afternoon for a nice get-together. We ordered 2 sets of Queen's Tea(~$25 each), which is the perfect amount for 3 people. I ordered a hot chocolate (~$5), and that was the most delicious hot chocolate I ever had! It came in a huge cup with fluffy whipped cream and chocolate syrup on top. For our 2 Queen's tea sets, we picked 4 choices of sandwiches, which I thought tasted okay (good, not amazing). The salmon was my absolute favorite, and note that the ones with mustard are slightly spicy. The set also came with scones (yum!), 3 types of spread (lemon curd was the best), shortbread cookies, fruit, coleslaw, crumpets (super "spongy", but I wasn't really fond bland/buttery things), salad, and dessert chocolates (s'mores was the best). My favorite item was probably the dessert chocolate and scone + lemon curd, but the overall package was great! I'll be back again!

excerpts: Though the sandwiches and crumpets were both delicious, the scones were the true stars of the meal.
Overall, this was a great tea room and I would love to go back and try more teas.
crumpets.author: Lakshmi M.
crumpets.review: Lovejoy's Tea Room was my first attempt at having a classy tea experience. The atmosphere was great, the decorations were cute, and the tea pots and cups were adorable. The staff was also great at explaining the menu to first time customers. My friend and I both decided to get the Queen's Tea because we really wanted to try as much as we could. The Earl Grey was great, but I also really enjoyed the Royal Blend. Though the sandwiches and crumpets were both delicious, the scones were the true stars of the meal. Overall, this was a great tea room and I would love to go back and try more teas.

excerpts: The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh.
crumpets.author: Ziyan C.
crumpets.review:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

* Fresh Fruit - 3 stars
Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice. 

* Petit Four - 4 stars
full platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#JSpHOzIStSs32UFby1oYIw
cross-section of our choices: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#k3_KeW_0tv5f41UvRFRtJw
We got a dark chocolate/lemon, as well as a rosewater. The chocolate one wasn't great, the jelly-like lemon filling not as sharp as I'd hoped. The rose-water soaked bread-like filling of the other one was great, and we all liked that one much more.

* Tea Biscuit - 3 stars
Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies. 

* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Fj33P7RuOhTOwxyb5OtVJQ
LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy. The outside is a little more crisped as well. Great with combinations of the lemon curd, butter, and blackberry preserves!

* Warm Scone with Preserves & Devon Cream - 3.5 stars
Not quite warm. Tasty but a little bit on the dry side. Love the combos of cream and blackberry preserves, that's the way to have it!

Tea Room Menu Top Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#vFpyqGqPd3Y8rupGqEqLkA
Tea Room Menu Bottom Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Y5Hot1gL66ruNvftbceu-g
Black & Black Flavored Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#tWZwzJRJcZ60PfCdcf0TWA
Decaf, Green/White, Tisanes Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#hDdEmd8WwMj2wwDd8t7gTQ

excerpts: Next, the crumpets came out (still warm!)
crumpets.author: Michelle C.
crumpets.review:
Came here for a tea party for my friend's birthday on a Sunday afternoon. When she originally made the reservation, only 11AM was open but she was able to secure a better time for us later on in the day (4pm).

We arrived promptly at 4 (you can find street parking in this area) and were seated at one side of a long table which we shared with another party. My friends and I decided to order the Queen's tea, which comes with a lot of variety of food to munch on. We each got to order our own pot of tea and I got the White Peach. I really like the nice fruity flavor. With the Queen's tea, we also got to choose 2 different sandwiches. I chose the Chicken Salad and the Salmon with Cream Cheese. When it comes out, you get 2 quarters of each sandwich

The tea came out first. It's fun to add the cream and sugar in it to get different flavors/taste. The birthday girl had ordered the Tea Room tea (the house tea? I forget) and when she mixed hers, the end result tasted like HK style milk tea, aka really good.

Then our 4 layer platter of food came out. 
Layer 1: Variety of Fruit
Layer 2: Scones, spread, and miniature cookies
Layer 3: Sandwiches and Salad
Layer 4: Sandwiches, Salad, and Coleslaw

Next, the crumpets came out (still warm!)

We finished off our tea party with little cake (one per person). I chose the strawberry shortcake.

The tea party was an overall success. I enjoyed the scone the most and really liked all the various spreads that came with it. 

We paid for the bday girl so the total per person ended up being somewhere are $45 (there was a total of 4 of us). 

I would definitely recommend celebrating by having a tea party here!

excerpts: The crustless sandwiches were so good along with their crumpets.
Love Love Loved everything about this place!!!
crumpets.author: Erica C.
crumpets.review:
My first tea room experience!

A bunch of ladies for a bridal shower.  The place has really cute decor, and has the woodsy old town British vibe.  The staff was super attentive and amazing.  Even though it was a packed house everything came out in a timely manner and the ladies were so patient with us.

Their tea sets are absolutely adorable.  The crustless sandwiches were so good along with their crumpets. Love Love Loved everything about this place!!!

excerpts: Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was just lovely for us to enjoy each others' company over seeping tea and tasty sandwiches, scones and crumpets.
crumpets.author: Marcia Y.
crumpets.review: We had an exceptional time at Lovejoy's Tea Room.  My mother and I had The Queen's Tea for two and the food was delicious and beautifully presented.  Service was prompt and attentive and the atmosphere was just lovely for us to enjoy each others' company over seeping tea and tasty sandwiches, scones and crumpets.

excerpts: I wish that "tea time" was an American tradition - I wouldn't mind taking time every day to sip some tea and eat some crumpets.
There's also a comforting feeling being in a tea room.
crumpets.author: Kirsten M.
crumpets.review:
This is my second time at Lovejoy's and I can't wait to come back! I wish that "tea time" was an American tradition - I wouldn't mind taking time every day to sip some tea and eat some crumpets. There's also a comforting feeling being in a tea room. You are in a relaxed environment and genuinely just enjoy your guests company.

You feel so fancy with all of the delicate china that I think it makes you eat slower or more "lady-like" which enables you to really savor and enjoy your food. The food itself isn't too filling, but you fill up on the bottomless tea. The darjeeling tea was my favorite. 

The food comes out on these cute tiered plates. What is it about food being higher up that makes it so fancy? They come out with itty bitty sandwiches with the crusts cut off. I mean, c'mon! Too adorable. My favorite was the pear and stilton cheese. The currant scones with the lemon and raspberry spread are amazing. The crumpet was nothing to write home about. To me it just tastes like a plain waffle. Let's not forget about the petit fours they bring out at the end. Petit fours are basically baby marzipan cakes which are thee perfect bite. 

If you're meeting up with an old friend for lunch, maybe planning a bridal shower, or just in the mood for some good ole tea - Lovejoy's is the perfect spot.

excerpts: I don't think I've ever had crumpets before but
crumpets.author: Christina L.
crumpets.review:
This place gives me the heeby-jeebies, something about grown ass women wearing little tea party hats and gloves eating food in baby portions weirds me out.  

Alas, it is still fun to do once in a while, I guess it's not my cup-o-tea (see what I did there).

I do have to give them props for getting us seats without reservations, though, that was awesome.  There were four of us on a Sunday and couldn't initially accommodate our party size, however, called me back and gave us a table that was meant for three. 

We ordered two queen's tea services, and it was for sure not enough for two girls and two guys.  I'd recommend at least three services for four people, or one per person to play it safe. 

The scone was delicious as well as the marmalade, jam and butter it was served with, however, wtf was that crumpet?  I don't think I've ever had crumpets before but it was like a really airy spongy pancake that took forever to get to our table and only arrived in my mouth to deliver disappointment and longing for something more satisfying. 

The salmon and cream cheese sandwich was really good, the asparagus one was aiiight nothing amazing, and I think the chicken salad one was a favorite as well, however, I didn't try it myself. 

We ordered a vanilla black tea, it was good!  It's hard to go wrong with tea though. 

Overall not impressed for the price you are paying.

We went to McDonalds an hour later.

excerpts: Best, most buttery biscuits and perfectly toasted crumpets I've ever had!
crumpets.author: Jess C.
crumpets.review:
Best, most buttery biscuits and perfectly toasted crumpets I've ever had! 

The atmosphere is super cute, make sure to call ahead for reservations.

excerpts: Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc.
All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding.
After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are
crumpets.author: Elizabeth T.
crumpets.review:
Beautiful, old-fashion-looking, tea room serving some good 'ol afternoon tea!

Crowd: for weekends --- go online for reservation. You won't be able to get in otherwise. There are set entry times as well. I think the max stay for each party is 2 hours. You will need to put down a card for the reservation as well.

Location: right next to the muni stop on Church, J line goes through here.

Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc. All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding. After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are :) You're really just there for the nice atmosphere, pleasant decor, warm and nice food, and chit chat. 

For those with kids: strollers will not fit inside. No room for highchair. OK to bring infants that can be held/wrapped and are relatively quiet. Not suitable for small children who can't sit still.

Experience: We went with a party of 6 on Sunday 1:15PM with reservation a month in advance. Promptly seated. We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie. Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches. You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal! Service is good and there's really not much to complain! 

Compare to other tea places in SF:

Dartealing is a little better in terms of tea uniqueness & sandwich quality, but overall these two are my favorites. Fairmont hotel afternoon tea is more expensive, has more fancy decor, but the sweets are actually worse. The Rotunda downtown is more noisy, fancier looking, more expensive, and also less refined. Samouvar is not really the same type of place, so no comparison.  I have not been to Crumpet.

So really, Dartealing and LoveJoy are my top 2 recommended afternoon tea in SF. Very affordable and very good!

excerpts: Since this is my first time at Lovejoy's, we choose to go with the Queen's Tea with all the lovely tea sammies, crumpets, scones with clotted cream and lemon curds to go with the Royal Blend black tea.
The ambiance at Lovejoy's is just lovely and inviting-it's no surprise that reservations are hard to come by
crumpets.author: Taffany H.
crumpets.review:
Serendipity and spontaneity are in a perfect alignment this afternoon when yours truly and the boy she loves roll by Lovejoy's for a chance to be seated without reservation to guarantee us a spot. But it has all worked out. The nice lady hostess fits us in for a 90 mins tea service and all is well. 
Since this is my first time at Lovejoy's, we choose to go with the Queen's Tea with all the lovely tea sammies, crumpets, scones with clotted cream and lemon curds to go with the Royal Blend black tea. The ambiance at Lovejoy's is just lovely and inviting-it's no surprise that reservations are hard to come by so I feel quite lucky to have this tea service as soon as I walk in today. 

As for the tea, the Royal Blend is pleasantly smooth, with a hint of orange and vanilla-but I may want to try other tea options on our next visit. There is quite a selection on their tea, tea sammies, and the petit fours. For our tea service this afternoon, we opt for the bay shrimp and mayonnaise, and turkey and dijon mustard-what dainty little tasty sandwiches these are... The scone, lemon curd, clotted cream and the raspberry jam were also nice and adequate. 

Overall, for a tea service, I would grade Lovejoy's Ambiance and friendly and attentive service to be 5 stars, taste of food at 3.5. I find their pricing to be quite affordable and would likely try to come back if the gods of tea service would kindly bless me with another spontaneous seating again since reservations are so difficult to get.

excerpts: The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries.
I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin.
It's seriously a lot of food!
My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches.
They were heavenly when paired with the tea.
I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it.
My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches.
They were heavenly when paired with the tea.
I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it.
crumpets.author: Kim D.
crumpets.review:
I came here for my sister's baby sprinkle in a party of ~ 8. It was my first time experiencing high tea, and I didn't expect anything great; I mean, it's just tea and some overpriced biscuits. How great can it be, right?

Well, I found out that it's pretty darn great! First off, everything was adorable, from the mismatched plates and saucers to the homey, antiquey decorations around the tea room. It reminds me of Alice in Wonderland, just a bit! The service is also wonderful. She always came around to keep our tea pots full and to make sure we were doing okay. 

The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries. I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin. It's seriously a lot of food! My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. They were heavenly when paired with the tea. I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it. Also, when you choose your petits fours at the end of your tea ritual, I would suggest avoiding the salted caramel truffle unless you like your truffle EXTREMELY salty. Everything else seemed fine, though.

Overall, I'd definitely come back when I'm in SF. Seeing as how brunch has become pretty basic (but I'm still a huge brunch fanatic - does that make me basic?), I say skip the eggs benedicts and mimosas and have a tea party date with your girlfriends at Lovejoy's instead!

excerpts: The scones are perfect as are the crumpets.
I even take the scones to go.
I can't rave about this place enough
crumpets.author: Maryam T.
crumpets.review:
I absolutely love LoveJoys, I just wish they were open more days of the week. If you want to get a good time make sure to make a reservation in advance they may not be able to seat you even during the week.

It's a great place for a bridal shower or baby shower or just a mother daughter outing. The teas are great and so is the hot chocolate. 

My favorite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and smoked salmon, but make sure to try the special sandwich.

Service here is always fast and speedy. You pretty much get food right away. The scones are perfect as are the crumpets. I even take the scones to go. I can't rave about this place enough

excerpts: They brought our crumpets out fresh out of the oven.
The scone was simply delicious.
At the end, we were able to choose from a platter of Petit Fours.
I choose the strawberry cheesecake, which was rich and delightful.
For tea I choose the Decaf Lady Grey: apricot with Earl Grey that was full flavored with great apricot flavor.
crumpets.author: Vivian A.
crumpets.review:
Invited some birthday Princesses here to help celebrate another year of their lives. Seating is every two hours so we reserved the first spot first thing on Sunday morning (11am). This place felt a bit mature and I felt like I was back in England having tea with my elder neighbors. 


What we swallowed:
QUEEN'S TEA: You get two sandwiches so I ordered the salmon/cream cheese with capers and the turkey with cranberry and walnuts (my favorite of the two). They brought our crumpets out fresh out of the oven. The scone was simply delicious. At the end, we were able to choose from a platter of Petit Fours. I choose the strawberry cheesecake, which was rich and delightful. For tea I choose the Decaf Lady Grey: apricot with Earl Grey that was full flavored with great apricot flavor. I tried a cup of my friend's Chocolate Truffle tea and that was delicious also: very smooth and good chocolate flavors, perfect with sugar and milk.

Lovejoy's was a great experience. It was fun to catch up with the ladies and gander at all the doilies, lace and trinkets around the room.

excerpts: Their crumpets come with a lemon curd, and they both definitely complemented one another.
crumpets.author: Alexis G.
crumpets.review:
My love for tea houses has grown incredibly since I tried this place yesterday. It was just like having a tea party as a kid, but an actual sized tea set and real food. 

They have a wide variety of teas. I tried the Black Vanilla with Lavender, and it was like getting a hug in your stomach. (All teas should make you feel as zen and comforting as this.) Their food selection was too perfect. With the Savory Tea package, you get two sandwich choices. I chose the classic Smoked Salmon with Cream Cheese and their special of the day, the Prosciutto and Pear. Their portions may appear rather small, like they always do at tea parties, but they definitely fill you up. Their crumpets come with a lemon curd, and they both definitely complemented one another. Lastly, the scones. Those will be the primary reason (besides their teas) as to why I return probably next week. And the jam that came with them completed their already perfect taste. 

It's a cute, little quiet spot to hang out and have afternoon tea whether you're with friends or having some me time. The next time I go here, I'll probably be flying solo for a bottomless pot and their amazing scones.

excerpts: I wasn't a fan of the crumpets with the lemon curd
but then again, I never have been a fan of crumpets to begin with.
Also, I normally wouldn't have opted for the "Pear and Stilton" sandwich but it was delicious!
The waitresses are all very friendly.
Perfect place for a date with your girlfriends.
crumpets.author: Tania S.
crumpets.review:
Can you say CAYOOT with a capital Q? First and foremost, I'm an avid Downtown Abbey viewer so I love the idea of high tea in all its fancy glory. This place is in the heart of Noe Valley, walked by it a million times but finally came around to trying it. The decor reminds me of the Shabby Chic collection with the crocheted pillows and floral patterns. I've been to Crown & Crumpet in Japantown before but the food/tea here is WAY better.

Normally, there's a long wait but if you get there early enough you might be able to skip the line. We got there right when it opened so we were seated immediately. We ordered the "High Tea" service with the Mango, White Peach (my favorite), Chamomile and Peppermint teas. I loved the sandwiches and the scones were ultra fluffy and yummay. I wasn't a fan of the crumpets with the lemon curd but then again, I never have been a fan of crumpets to begin with. Also, I normally wouldn't have opted for the "Pear and Stilton" sandwich but it was delicious! The waitresses are all very friendly. Perfect place for a date with your girlfriends.

excerpts: The only thing missing is a garden in the back with soft white butterflies fluttering around while sipping some tea and eating some crumpets and petit fours.
The sandwiches are divine and this place alone can sell itself with the fresh made blueberry scones and warm crumpets with their spreads.
My sister and I had the chestnut tea which is my favorite and
the staff made sure that we were never without tea and good fine service.
Definitely a go to place for morning brunch and afternoon tea time.
crumpets.author: Edgar I.
crumpets.review:
Product: high tea service - This place is a breath of British Victorian fresh air.  The only thing missing is a garden in the back with soft white butterflies fluttering around while sipping some tea and eating some crumpets and petit fours.  Though this place can seem a bit pretentious due to the nature of British high tea, the staff and the atmosphere that the place brings makes it more like having tea with grandma and telling her what's going on with life.  The sandwiches are divine and this place alone can sell itself with the fresh made blueberry scones and warm crumpets with their spreads.  My sister and I had the chestnut tea which is my favorite and the staff made sure that we were never without tea and good fine service.  Definitely a go to place for morning brunch and afternoon tea time.  "It's divine, it's delectable, is de-Lovejoy's!"

Service rating:  The staff at Lovejoy's is nothing but wonderful.  Very friendly, very respectful to not interrupt conversation when refilling your teapots, and makes sure that everyone in your party is enjoying their tea time and snacks.  Whether you're in your best floral Sunday brunch dresses, button down and designer jeans, or even just shorts and a sweater they make you feel like you belong and either are really great at hiding judgment or are just quite humble and amiable.  

Ambiance: Granny from Wales who likes to bake, have tea, and then go hunting in her Chanel or Burberry hunting ensemble post afternoon high tea.  This place is really great at keeping itself authentic to an old fashioned Victorian tea time saloon.  They offer afternoon tea, high tea, and Royal tea service which I find very refreshing and proprietary.  

Recommendation: Clotted cream or spotted dick, YUM! Other than that, I hope they keep it as it is and I hope this place keeps attracting customers.  I plan to bring my future children here for afternoon tea or Sunday brunch one day!

excerpts: The Queen's Tea is soooo worth the $28 and the crumpets with lemon curd are to die for!
crumpets.author: Sarah T.
crumpets.review: Great ambiance and worth the drive to the city!! The Queen's Tea is soooo worth the $28 and the crumpets with lemon curd are to die for!

excerpts: A platter of warm scones with a generous pile of clotted cream and raspberry jam followed up by another platter of warm crumpets which go great with lemon curd.
crumpets.author: Amy C.
crumpets.review:
Why You Should Have Your Bridal Shower At Lovejoy's:

1)  Even though it is difficult to get them on the phone, they usually call back promptly.  

2)  They will accommodate random requests like a side table for a bridal shower scrapbooking project and a gluten free tea service for your gluten allergic guest.

3)  You will be welcomed by a sign that proclaims that this table is "Reserved for the Queens."

4)  A fabulous tea selection like black tea with Chestnut, a not too floral Vanilla and Lavender tea, and plenty of herbal options like a Vanilla Rooibos.  All are served in cute mismatched tea pots, cups and saucers. 

5)  With the Queen's Tea, you'll get a huge platter of flavorful and dainty sammiches like egg with capers, chicken salad, chicken and asparagus and bay shrimp.  You'll also have a fruit selection, salad greens with balsamic dressing, and caraway sprinkled coleslaw.

6)  A platter of warm scones with a generous pile of clotted cream and raspberry jam followed up by another platter of warm crumpets which go great with lemon curd.

7)  A choice of adorable petit fours.  Loved the chocolate raspberry one that I got and I also tried a lemon marzipan one.

8)  If you bring a bottle of bubbly, they will pour it for you and graciously take photos.

9)  They will give the bride a tea spoon as a memento and $5 coupon for Lovejoy's Attic across the street where you can purchase teas and other tea themed goodies.

Nothing but LOVE for Lovejoy's!  (And for D and M.)

excerpts: Their menu features ala carte items (including pasties ($9.95), shepherd's pie ($10.95), and quiche ($10.95)) and an assortment of combinations, ranging from the "Cream Tea" ($14.95) which comes with scones, fruit, and a bottomless pot o' tea to the "Queen's Tea" ($26.95) which comes with two types of finger sandwiches, a coleslaw type salad, a green salad, scones, crumpets, fruit, petit fours, shortbread tea biscuits, and, of course, a bottomless pot o' tea.
This came with 10 different types of finger sandwiches, 5 different pots of tea, a green salad, coleslaw, scones, and shortbread cookies.
They have many different finger sandwiches to choose from.
My favorites were the smoked salmon and cream cheese, the special chicken and pesto, and the pear and stilton (blue cheese).
They also have an assortment of teas.
We tried the vanilla lavender, a green tea, the spiced citrus, and the teahouse blend.
Our favorite was the Vanilla Lavender so definitely try that one when you go
crumpets.author: Eileen E.
crumpets.review:
The perfect venue for a girly birthday, bridal shower, baby shower, mother's day, or just a cozy hangout with friends. :) For my 26th birthday, I wanted to celebrate with my friends and do something a little bit different than just a fun lunch or dinner. I also wanted to do something that would give us a chance to catch up and chat :). Lovejoy's Tea Room was absolutely perfect for this.  

I made my reservation 2-3 weeks in advance and they were able to seat 7 of us no sweat. We had a big round table near the window with lots of comfy pillows. I think the term "Shabby Chic" was invented to describe the quirky, frilly, cozy decor in this lil tea shop! A sign reading "Reserved for the Queens" was sitting on the table when we arrived. *Does the Queen of England Wave.*

Their menu features ala carte items (including pasties ($9.95), shepherd's pie ($10.95), and quiche ($10.95)) and an assortment of combinations, ranging from the "Cream Tea" ($14.95) which comes with scones, fruit, and a bottomless pot o' tea to the "Queen's Tea" ($26.95) which comes with two types of finger sandwiches, a coleslaw type salad, a green salad, scones, crumpets, fruit, petit fours, shortbread tea biscuits, and, of course, a bottomless pot o' tea.

My friends and I split 5 High Tea's ($19.95) among the 7 of us (see picture for the tower o' treats!). This came with 10 different types of finger sandwiches, 5 different pots of tea, a green salad, coleslaw, scones, and shortbread cookies. They have many different finger sandwiches to choose from. My favorites were the smoked salmon and cream cheese, the special chicken and pesto, and the pear and stilton (blue cheese). They also have an assortment of teas. We tried the vanilla lavender, a green tea, the spiced citrus, and the teahouse blend. Our favorite was the Vanilla Lavender so definitely try that one when you go :).

Thank you so much Lovejoy's for such an adorable, fun, and laidback way to spend my special day with friends!

excerpts: The sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets with butter, clotted cream--
crumpets.author: Chiara A.
crumpets.review:
This review for Lovejoy's Tea Room has been in my yelp! draft folder for quite sometime.  

High Afternoon Tea is a habit I acquired whilst on holiday in the UK; London, England specifically. When I returned, having high afternoon tea was the method my mates and I spent time together. We would go to the high street hotels for high afternoon tea. Places like the Stanford Court Hotel, Sir Francis Drake, St. Francis Westin Hotel, the Ritz Carlton, the King George Hotel, and Lovejoy's Tea Room. 

Lovejoy's Tea Room was one of the mate's find . . . it was a change and a less expensive option from the high street hotels. I was impressed by my mate's find to have another resource for high afternoon tea that was not in the high street. :-))) A very cute, charming, and quaint tea room. The cups, saucers, and plates are not the typical matching set, they do not match at all--yet they are coordinated.  The service is charming, our teapots were refilled. The sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets with butter, clotted cream--ooh la la!!!!

It has been awhile since we have been back to Lovejoy's Tea Room. The token male of our group, the husband of one of the girlfriends, decided to opt out. As far as he was concerned, we girls could carry on without him. 

Lovejoy's Tea Room is not the type of place to drop in for tea, a reservation is a must. A le must piece of advice from me.

It has been sometime since I have been to Lovejoy's Tea Room. Must make a "I shall return visit" since I am jonesing for high afternoon tea--Lovejoy's style a la UK.

Fresh Review #9 of 100 Yelps! for 2013.

excerpts: Since Crown and Crumpets was closed because they were relocating, this was the next best thing.
crumpets.author: Karla Marie D.
crumpets.review:
Tea party anyone?

Came in here feeling like a little girl again. The eclectic design brings back so many childhood memories. Since Crown and Crumpets was closed because they were relocating, this was the next best thing. 

We came in on a Sunday afternoon. There was no wait, although I did make a reservation. The place is a little cramped for me, but still worth it. 

We had the "Queen's tea" ($27). It included the following: choice of 2 sandwiches (turkey and shrimp sandwiches), spring salad, scone, crumpet, Petit four, and shortbread biscuit. 

My niece had the "Wee Tea" ($16) which included the following: cream cheese and jelly sandwich, scone, fresh fruit, Petit Four, tea/hot chocolate.

My sister's bf had the "Tea Sandwich Plate" ($13) which included salmon and cucumber sandwiches. He also had a side of large coffee.

Our total came about to $70-ish (pretty hefty, if you asked me).

My faves were the crumpet and the lemon curd spread.. yum!!! (i love anything lemony). At the end we were asked to choose 2 Petit four, which is basically a dessert. It's very small, but packed with sweetness. I wanted to eat all of them since they looked so pretty, but sadly only two had the pleasure of my taste buds.

Overall, great experience, but pricey! I would come here again with my girls.

excerpts:
We all ordered the queen's tea which consisted:

2 sandwiches of your choice, cole-slaw, greens, assortment of fruits, currant scones, crumpets, a petite four, a small white and brown cookie, your choice of a pot of tea and 3 spreads: lemon curd, raspberry-blackberry(?)
But what really stood out here was the freshly baked currant scones, OMG.
These were amazing!
Hands down the best scones I've ever had.
They were soft, flakey, buttery, moist and full of flavor.
I wish they sold them in bags to go!
I also decided on the strawberry tea which was a nice and refreshing taste.
I really liked my friends
China rose petal black tea though.
crumpets.author: Laura T.
crumpets.review:
I've finally found the best high tea room in San Francisco! Everything was lovely. I came here with a group of ladies today and received the special treatment of royalty.

We all ordered the queen's tea which consisted:

2 sandwiches of your choice, cole-slaw, greens, assortment of fruits, currant scones, crumpets, a petite four, a small white and brown cookie, your choice of a pot of tea and 3 spreads: lemon curd, raspberry-blackberry(?) jam and this amazing white clotted cream which tasted like a sweet butter.

 I decided on the salmon + cream cheese sandwich, as well as the bay shrimp + mayo. Both were delicious! The fruits had a wonderful selection, all the spreads were delightful, even the salad dressing was yummy. But what really stood out here was the freshly baked currant scones, OMG. These were amazing! Hands down the best scones I've ever had.  They were soft, flakey, buttery, moist and full of flavor. I wish they sold them in bags to go! I also decided on the strawberry tea which was a nice and refreshing taste. I really liked my friends China rose petal black tea though. Also, the interior of the tea room was gorgeous, really, a girl's dream. 

I just wish they had sugar cubes.

excerpts: When you enter this adorable space full of pink frills, tea hats, crumpets and everything inbetween, you will be feeling very
"Hi, your majesty.
May I pour you another glass?
crumpets.author: Tiffany D.
crumpets.review:
Cuteness and lace doilies explosion. When you enter this adorable space full of pink frills, tea hats, crumpets and everything inbetween, you will be feeling very "Hi, your majesty. May I pour you another glass?" This is British High Tea, done right. It's the perfect cutesy brunch, afternoon with the girls, little girl's birthday party, etc. etc.  

Share a bottomless pot of tea with your best girls for $9, +$2 per additional person to a single pot. Or opt for $19.95 High Tea service, including 2 tea sandwiches, a scone, coleslaw, and some other goodies. We ordered 2 tea services for 4 of us ladies (2 per single person serving) and were stuffed.

The sandwiches were delicate and delectable, my favorite being the Chicken Asparagus (surprisingly!) and the Cucumber & Cream Cheese! They have such great mixes of sandwiches, and many traditional ones with an interesting twist. The Roast Beef & Horseradish was also very tasty.

Scones were good, but standard. They have devonshire cream, and while I prefer clotted cream, this was also tasty with their jam. 

We tried the "Afternoon Darjeeling" for our tea and it was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend it!

Had a splended time here, and will definitely be back! 

Tip: while you wait, there's a cute store of tea-related accessories across the way "Lovejoy's Attic". Scout what you want, then have your tea, and go back, because at the end of tea they give you a nice 10-15% off coupon for the Attic store!

excerpts:
I'll never have a Starbucks scone again. 

- Crumpets.
crumpets.author: Courtney N.
crumpets.review:
I brought my British friend here (more like, forced him to teach me the ways of High Tea), and he was amused, to say the least, by the cutesy, lacey decor and the mismatched dishware. Let's just get over the fact that the decor is, well, a bit over the top, because the service and food are both excellent!

We ordered Queen's Tea for two: 
- Yorkshire Tea (amazing -- apparently quite difficult to find in the States, because I've been looking for this stuff ever since. Really, this is the only tea you'll ever need)
- Apricot Tea (paled in comparison to the Yorkshire tea)

- Chicken walnut salad sandwiches were delicious! Half white and half whole wheat bread, which is a nod to both tradition and current standards. Also had Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese, which sounds strange, but is absolutely delicious! Would highly recommend those two sandwiches
- The salad and coleslaw was okay -- they were skimpy on the mandarins, and the Caraway Cream Dressing was oddly bitter? Mayonaisse-y? Not my favorite part of the meal.

- I learned, finally, how to eat scones properly. And have a proper scone. Which aren't the scones from Starbucks, or wherever you get them. These scones are large and studded with blueberries and are warm, not flaky, like you'd think a biscuit sort of thing should be, but are meant to be cut down the middle, like a bagel, and spread with Devon cream (which isn't normal butter -- it's thicker and whipped and DELICIOUS) and then preserves. Amazing! Absolutely delightful. I'll never have a Starbucks scone again. 

- Crumpets. Oh my god. I don't even know what to say about these. There aren't American corollaries, but think of a biscuit, but not flakey. In fact, holey. And warm. And delicious. And should be slathered with the butter and the lemon curd, while the crumpet is still warm. The butter will soak through the crumpet. And so will the lemon curd. It's worth upgrading from High Tea to Queen's Tea to try this sucker out. 

- Fruit was good, pretty fresh and ripe, well cut
- The tea biscuit (which is just a lil tea cookie) was a bit disappointing
- You get to choose a Petit Four from a platter of many, and they were quite delicious! 

Don't forget to make reservations, at least a week or two in advance! They fill up quite quickly, and it's worth the brunch out with a date or with friends.

Overall, worth the experience and quite authentic, according to my friend.

excerpts: We had their "High Tea" for 3 and everything was good - selections of tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, salad, scones, petit cookies, crumpets and petit fours.
crumpets.author: Ken G.
crumpets.review:
This was a unique and interesting thing to do on a Sunday morning...

We had their "High Tea" for 3 and everything was good - selections of tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, salad, scones, petit cookies, crumpets and petit fours.  Amazingly enough we left very satisfied, but it wasn't an extremely heavy meal.

The ambiance is fun and quirky with a nod to the Victorian era...very cool spot.

excerpts: We ordered some finger sandwiches, some crumpets with lemon curd and a Pear & Stilton salad that was large enough for two to share.
crumpets.author: Esther A.
crumpets.review:
This place has charm and character and I love that I live nearby. The quaint little tea room was inviting and yesterday was the perfect gloomy rainy day to have high tea.  I dragged the hubs and he initially was wary because he thought it was going to be cutesy and pink like a little girls tea party but once we arrived he was relieved to see that it was not. We didn't have reservations and all tables were booked but they let us sit at a table that was reserved and the party wasn't arriving for awhile. 

We didn't go w/ the recommended teas but went with a black one that we thought sounded great. We ordered some finger sandwiches, some crumpets with lemon curd and a Pear & Stilton salad that was large enough for two to share. The finger sandwiches are tiny so if you are hungry make sure you order enough and order some of the other "Pub Fares".

I loved the decor. This place had the an old vintage antique shop feel with the mismatched tea pots/cups. They had ladies hats hung up on a dresser situated right smack in the middle of the tea room with a red British phone booth behind it. Service was quick and friendly.  I absolutely loved everything about Lovejoy.

excerpts: Food consists of all the traditional fare with some edits: tea and finger sandwiches, crumpets with lemon curd and cream, fruit, herb salad with balsamic dressing, and for a splurge, petite fours.
crumpets.author: Rachel H.
crumpets.review:
"Can I offer you a cup of tea, love?"

My toes curl (in a good way) when I hear that phrase.  It takes me back to visits with family and friends in England, where tea seems to be on offer as a symbol of hospitality, conviviality and friendship.

It's fitting then that Lovejoy's is all of those things.  It's the perfect cozy little tea house to meet and celebrate with a friend, with doilies, mismatched china, and that feeling that you are visiting your aunty's flat in Notting Hill which she hasn't updated in over a quarter of a century.

Food consists of all the traditional fare with some edits: tea and finger sandwiches, crumpets with lemon curd and cream, fruit, herb salad with balsamic dressing, and for a splurge, petite fours.   It's a generous tea offering at the price, and your guest (mom, grandma or little girl) will leave full and happy.

I hosted a baby shower here too for a good friend, and Lovejoy's is a great spot for special events.  Reasonable compared to a hotel tea (like Sheraton Palace Garden Court) and quirky, local and fun to boot.  We had a reader Lovejoy's recommended come to read our tea leaves, as a bit of a laugh, which was a blast to be sure, but many left brained ladies were thinking how eerily accurate those "fun" readings turned out to be.

All in all, Lovejoy's is a great spot to sink into a Victorian couch,  nibble on sandwiches and enjoy some tea and company.

excerpts: Each set comes with its bottomless pot of tea, scone, salad, slaw, 2 sandwiches, crumpets, fruit, and a petit four.
Crumpets: To be honest, I dont know what this was, but I ate it anyways.
Its not as good as the scone.
It feels like a english muffin mochi.
crumpets.author: Carmen C.
crumpets.review:
This place is adorable! They have super cute teacups and random decor. It's a very homey feeling, with non-matching tea sets and lace tablecloths. 

I got the Queen's tea for 2 and it was plenty! Each set comes with its bottomless pot of tea, scone, salad, slaw, 2 sandwiches, crumpets, fruit, and a petit four. So much food! 

Tea: I got a black tea, which was very delicious and I got the white peach tea, which was fruity but not very strong. Highly recommend both of these. They are so awesome to give you strainers so you dont get the leaves in your cup.

Sandwiches: So cute and yummy! Salmon and cream cheese one was the best by far! Chicken salad one was also good. Pear and stilton one was not my favorite bc the stilton cheese (blue cheese) was too smelly. yuck

Scone: This was absolutely the BEST SCONE ever. Ive never eaten such a good scone. You'd think scones are dry and cold, but this one was warm, flakey and buttery, like a biscuit. Tastes super good with the lemon curd, devon cream and preserves.

Crumpets: To be honest, I dont know what this was, but I ate it anyways. Its not as good as the scone. It feels like a english muffin mochi. haha

Fruit: Just a variety of sliced fruits, from strawberries, blackberry, honeydew, orange, grapefruit

Petit Four: You can choose 1 out of their tray of desserts. A lot of them were marzipan ones, and there is also truffle and sugar cookie. Not a fan of marizpan. 

Salad and Slaw: Salad is regular salad with balsamic dressing and slaw was yummy 

Overall a very cute and fun experience with your girlfriends to dress up and chat. I would definitely be recommending this to my friends for birthday, wedding showers, etc. I had a really good time here, its so friggin cute!

excerpts: I'd compare it to Crown and Crumpets, minus all the pink.
crumpets.author: Samantha L.
crumpets.review:
Lovejoy's is a charming tea room that everyone should take the opportunity to enjoy at least once. The mixed assortment of tea pots, plates, chairs, and tablecloths makes you smile. 

A group of elderly women sat prim and proper to the left of our table.  It was adorable and heart warming! i imagine they gather at Lovejoy's regularly to catch up over scones and pots of fragrant teas. Children and families fit right in too. Make reservations in advance! I think this is especially important around the holidays.

Super affordable in comparison to the Garden Court or The Rotunda. I'd compare it to Crown and Crumpets, minus all the pink.

An additional pointer... those little cute petit fours that come around on their silver trays are NOT complimentary ;)

excerpts: The crumpets are also really good, crispy outside with a soft chewy inside.
Scone and Crumpets are delicious, I highly recommend sampling them!
crumpets.author: Terence N.
crumpets.review:
Finally came here for brunch and the experience is really amazing.  I sampled the high tea set, which pretty much comes with everything.  I am not a huge fan of tea sandwiches, the ones here are good but nothing great.  I sampled both black and rooibos tea, both are delicious, although I prefer the rooibos.  Black tea just tasted like black tea?  The ornaments and decorations are cute and pretty.  I got to say it was a bit too cramped inside, I understand there's not a lot of space in SF, but I was expecting more white table clothes and white everything.  This tea room is really laid back and cozy.  

My favorite are the scones, these suckers are absolutely delicious!  Reminds me more of a buttery biscuit, but it has the perfect texture.  Slap on some of their famous marionberry jam and extra butter, you are in heaven!  The crumpets are also really good, crispy outside with a soft chewy inside.  If you order anything from Lovejoy's, get the Scone and Crumpet!  They constantly refill your tea, and you have about 2 hrs to chit chat..but really how much tea can your bladder hold?  For dessert you get to choose a marzipan chocolate, if you like marzipan you will lose these, otherwise it will be really sweet for you.

You definitely need to make reservations here, we got lucky and came 30min before they open.  We got lucky and got the only non-reserved table left.  There was a line even before they opened doors!  Scone and Crumpets are delicious, I highly recommend sampling them!

excerpts: The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, salads, tea biscuits, and shepherd's pie we had today were delightful and paired nicely with Lovejoy's popular teas.
If you haven't visited this San Francisco gem for a Queen's Tea yet, I recommend that you make a reservation today.
Five stars all the way!
I wish I could give six!!
crumpets.author: Alicia N.
crumpets.review: Oh, oh, oh -- what a treat! We had a graduation celebration with 17 guests at Lovejoy's today, and the service was impeccable. A delightful woman named Cassie was our waitress, and she made sure we had everything we needed. And the tea -- and the food!! I can't praise Lovejoy's enough. The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, salads, tea biscuits, and shepherd's pie we had today were delightful and paired nicely with Lovejoy's popular teas. If you haven't visited this San Francisco gem for a Queen's Tea yet, I recommend that you make a reservation today. Five stars all the way! I wish I could give six!!

excerpts: The scones were pure heaven and the crumpets just as good.
My friend selected 2 sandwiches (classic cucumber and classic salmon) and I selected 2 sandwiches (savory chutney & cheddar and a lovely stilton & pear).
I was saying mmmmmmm so many times!!
We took a very long time to nibble and chat and eat.
I did try to make room for the petit fours that were totally unexpected.
The SCONES ARE AMAZING!!!!
crumpets.author: Rick L.
crumpets.review:
I went there with a former co-worker and good friend from England that is touring the Bay Area. We met on Friday which was also my Birthday. We had a proper High Tea for 2 at 4. 

The food selections were simply marvelous. The scones were pure heaven and the crumpets just as good. My friend selected 2 sandwiches (classic cucumber and classic salmon) and I selected 2 sandwiches (savory chutney & cheddar and a lovely stilton & pear). I was saying mmmmmmm so many times!! We took a very long time to nibble and chat and eat. I did try to make room for the petit fours that were totally unexpected. I chose the lemon!

I do wish there were finger bowls to dip and cloth napkins as well, yet the experience was DREAMY!

Just near my seat was a lovely little book of birthdays so I read mine, and she read hers. Great fun!

The decor was fabulous and the little touches were just dreamy.
I do love the selection of hats to choose from while we experienced the joys of Love Joys!

I've been there before and will assuredly return.

p.s. The SCONES ARE AMAZING!!!!

excerpts: Your will arrive at your table "reserved for rotalty" with a pretty plate of hot crumpets and butter during the middle of your meal.
crumpets.author: Amethyst Popkiss A.
crumpets.review:
I'll start with the ambiance. This place is very quaint, original, old Victorian. 5 stars for making me feel like I'm in old England. Mix matched furniature, tea saucers, cups, and teapots, lace table cloths, victorian floral couches, vintage bookshelves, chairs, and vanities. This all adds to the unique style that is Lovejoy's. I would say more velvet would be nice, but that's just me... 

The menu. 5 stars for being super delicious & beautifully arranged every single time I come here. I always get the Queen's Tea, which includes three tiers of fanciful goodies. The top tier has a varity of fruit, including grapes, pineapple, strawberry, kiwi, and orange. The middle tier has scones, double devonshire cream, strawberry jam, and lemon curd plus two cookies. The bottom tier has tea sandwiches of your choice (you pick two kinds), coldslaw, mixed greens with arugala, and their house vinegarette, which is pretty creamy & tangy. I usually always order the salmon and cream cheese, and either the stilton pear and cream cheese or roast beef and horseradish tea sandwiches! So delicious & flavorful. 

Let's not forget your choice of tea, which you will get with sugar and milk, all served in an assortment of fun, floral dishware & a huge teapot. I opt for black tea, preferably what is known as the "Champagne of all teas," which they call Afternoon Darjeeling here at Lovejoy's. In my opinion, it is one of the more sophisticated teas that exist, and it is amazingly smooth, and just feels good going down (get your mind out the gutter lil' nasty). Afternoon Darjeeling tastes like assam tea and oolong tea mixed together, but it is a thin-bodied, hence the smooth sailing down the piehole... It tastes like a vacation! They do have a large variety of fun herbal teas, black, white, and green teas. I have tried a variety of their teas. Wish I reviewed them back then. Sorry guys! But the rose black tea is also awesome.

Service: the servers are always very nice, not extra nice, but they serve you right. Sometimes it is very busy, and they don't have time to charm you because, well, the tearoom itself can entertain you and the company of your choice should entertain you. They do get 5 stars for service. They keep everything short and sweet! Your will arrive at your table "reserved for rotalty" with a pretty plate of hot crumpets and butter during the middle of your meal. This is when you drop whatever you have in your hand, pick up your butter knife, thereupon smearing your butter over your nice hot crumpet and enjoy while it's fresh and hot. Oh, believe me, it's worth getting enthusiastic about. It's like if Lana del Ray arrived at your door at night offering to sing you some lullabies. That exciting!!!! Notice she's my current and always and forever crush. Anyway, you can of course devour that wonderous duo of crumpet and butter alone or savor it with a bit of lemon curd or strawberry jam. You're royalty when you're here, so you can do as you well damn please ;) You will also get a petite four at the end of you're meal. They usually have the option of strawberry, white wedding cake (my fav), esspresso, rice crispy treat, chocolate and apricot, among others I forget at the moment. 

Come to this lovely little tea room, you'll notice your pinky will automatically go up as you drink your cup of tea. It's not a mystery, it will just happen. Don't question it. Enjoy!

excerpts: Nicola arrived a little over an hour before the event, explained what everything was and how to serve the tea and crumpets with simple, yet specific instructions.
Everything looked beautiful!
The Baby Shower:
crumpets.author: Spice O.
crumpets.review:
This review is for Lovejoy's catering services:
I am having my first baby and my mom and aunts decided they would like to throw me a baby shower.  I live in SF, but they live in and around Washington, D.C.  I thought it would be much easier if I planned it, and I am SO HAPPY I found Lovejoy's on Yelp!
