I knew nothing about tea parties and had actually never been to a tea before, but I liked the vibe and style of Lovejoy's: playful, mismatched cups and plates (I didn't know this was a "thing":), and very true to a British tea experience.  I would have been hesitant to do a tea like one that is done at a more expensive, stiffer place like the Ritz, for example. 
This was right up my alley and everything from the communication to the planning, pricing, setup, event itself and returning the dishware went very smoothly.  
Communication:  When I inquired about a month prior to the shower (I was lucky they were available, I'd recommend planning sooner), Gillian followed up in a timely manner and gave me her email so we could more easily communicate specific items my mom and I wanted. We had several questions and Gillian answered each one thoughtfully and thoroughly.  When the date got closer, she had Nicola, the onsite staff who would set up our tea and food, contact us about logistics.  
Planning: It was slightly tricky because I was the main point of contact until my mom was able to join in on the email communication, and she wanted quite a bit more food than I thought we needed, and she had the foresight to ask more questions about dishware, setup, cleanup than I did!  That was fine and Gillian adjusted quotes as we went and had no problem with the multiple changes we made.
Pricing:  Everything was VERY reasonable, and  though I did not look into other places, I'd have a hard time imagining that other catered tea lunches providing the same level of service and quality of food and tea would be this inexpensive.  We had 20 guests and we rented ALL of the dishware and flatware AND we had the caterer setup for an hour and pick up the items the next day.  
Setup:  Nicola arrived a little over an hour before the event, explained what everything was and how to serve the tea and crumpets with simple, yet specific instructions.  Everything looked beautiful!
The Baby Shower:  So many people commented on how delicious the food was, from the sandwiches to the scones (even the gluten free ones for our wheat intolerant guests!), truffles, petit fours, salad and dressing, to the fresh fruit!  We had the event in a 2 bedroom suite at the Ritz Carlton Club and Residences where my parents were staying during their SF visit, and many people said they assumed it was a Ritz Tea.  The quality and presentation were both top rate.
I had a such a great experience that a few of my girlfriends and I from the shower plan to go to the tearoom for a lunch date.  Thank you Lovejoy's, my baby shower was wonderful and you played such a big part!

excerpts: Serving tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, along with lemon curd and devon cream - Lovejoy's is the most authentic British tea room in the city!
The sandwiches were all fresh and delicious and I heard so many compliments on the scones.
crumpets.author: Nina E.
crumpets.review:
This was my location of choice for my birthday last November, 2013. Serving tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, along with lemon curd and devon cream - Lovejoy's is the most authentic British tea room in the city! 

We were so impressed with their menu and atmosphere that we hired Lovejoy's to Cater our recent Vintage Afternoon Tea themed wedding (Sept 2014). Our wedding was a memorable event - full of smiles, joy, and happiness. Lovejoy's presentation was fantastic and their contribution was far above expectations. Gillian & Amanda from Lovejoy's assisted in all aspects of the event, including set up (which was admittedly a bit chaotic). Everything went smoothly and our guests enjoyed themselves immensely. I cannot possibly imagine pulling it off without their hard work, organization and event skills. 

The food was also amazing (of course). The sandwiches were all fresh and delicious and I heard so many compliments on the scones. I have no doubt they have a number of new fans singing their praises.

We definitely plan on being back.

excerpts: I like their crumpets!
Great interior design.
crumpets.author: Ange G.
crumpets.review: They have a good variety on their tea and sandwiches selection. I like their crumpets! Great interior design.

excerpts:
basically the salad is the Costco baby green mix (that one you get in the plastic box) and the cole slaw is sliced cabbage with light mayo (non-sweetened...such a difference from KFC) and very plain tasting

Crumpets:
- its like one of those vietnamese coconut waffles except in the shape and color of an english muffin.
crumpets.author: Tina A.
crumpets.review:
Cutesy Brittish Grandma Tea Time!

The wait was ridiculous on a sunday afternoon.   they told us 15 minutes so we waited outside for about 20 minutes then asked again how much longer the wait would be.  apparently they put our names off to the side of the paper and forgot about us... i know we are some dark asians but daym!  good thing we checked!

the whole staff was all dolled up like toys u see on tv when little girls have a tea party.  all the furniture was antique, the decorations were creepily old and the tableware was fancy shmancy.   the service was quite friendly.  it made me want to just drink tea with my pinky up and talk in an english accent.  i refrained because i did not want to embarrass myself.

for a party of 3 we got:

Tea for Two: 
- 4 Sandwiches.  thoughtfull that they take the time to cut off the crust on these tiny delecate sandwich quarters.
  *Chicken Apple Walnut Salad: tastes like the kind you get at the cafeteria.  not too shaby.
  * Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese: the salmon was not too salty and the cream cheese was soft.
  * Artichoke Hummus: probably the blandest hummus ever made.  its never really a good idea to order hummus in a non-middle eastern place.
  * Lovejoy's Special - pesto with goat cheese and some sort of meat.. the best sandwich!  did not taste the pungent goat cheese at all and it was delicious!!

Scone
- the most moist and buttery scone ever.  it was like a biscuit, except scone flavored!  (with nuts and berries and such) - verry delicious and it was served with devon cream ...what i like to think of as a cross between butter and cream cheese

Cole Slaw + Salad
- not too impressive but a healthy addition to all the butter you are getting.  basically the salad is the Costco baby green mix (that one you get in the plastic box) and the cole slaw is sliced cabbage with light mayo (non-sweetened...such a difference from KFC) and very plain tasting

Crumpets:
- its like one of those vietnamese coconut waffles except in the shape and color of an english muffin.  it was nice and fresh, but slightly soggy when it cooled down.  we had lemon curd on the side - it was like liquified lemon merengue pie.  

Mango Tea was not very fruity...it also had a bitter aftertaste
Vanilla Tea was very smooth and fragrant, and left no bitter aftertaste

I would totally recommend this place if you want to eat at a very unique place.  there are very few places who bring you back to 100 years to have a tea party.  also it's great if you are trying to get skinny.  all the food is delicate and eaten slowly so u get full off of a few bites...  
 - get the Lovejoy's special sandwich
 - enjoy a scone
 - get some vanilla tea

excerpts: She brought mix matched plates and cups and saucers and tiers for serving the tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets and petit fours we'd ordered.
The egg and onion sandwiches were the best, the scones were incredible with the cream and preserves and the White Tangerine tea was a definite favorite.
Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn.
She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge.
All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.

She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge.
All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it.
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.
crumpets.author: J G.
crumpets.review:
I recently hosted a baby shower catered by Lovejoy's. From start to finish they were a pleasure to work with. Although I went in on a fairly busy day, they were immediately accommodating, sending someone over to answer our questions and share in our excitement. Because the tea room itself can only accommodate parties up to 20, my co-host and I decided to cater the shower at a home instead. The catering menu is available online and Samantha helped us square away the details via email in the weeks leading up to it. The prices were reasonable, they were amenable to last minute changes and provided helpful suggestions throughout. You can include a server and a tea leaf reader for your party too, if you're so inclined!

We didn't lift a finger the day of. Our wonderful server, Carrie, was warm and kind. She arrived on time and set everything up for us. She brought mix matched plates and cups and saucers and tiers for serving the tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets and petit fours we'd ordered. The egg and onion sandwiches were the best, the scones were incredible with the cream and preserves and the White Tangerine tea was a definite favorite. Carrie warmed the scones, toasted the crumpets, poured drinks, continually restocked the food and tea and otherwise  welcomed our guests at every turn. She left the kitchen in great shape and the leftovers in the fridge. All in all, it was a perfectly adorable and shabby chic little ladies tea and our guest of honor loved it. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them or use them again.

excerpts: The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, and of course the tea, were all magnificent.
My favorite tea was the "Rose Hips".
I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back.
The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because I've never been to a tea room to compare to this one.
I've read reviews of tea rooms in Solano county where I live
and I have a feeling that the others don't measure up to this one.
crumpets.author: Cheryl M.
crumpets.review: I was a virgin tearoom patron and could not have  been more pleased at Lovejoy's. Was there for my cousin's baby sprinkle (as opposed to shower). We were a party of eleven adult ladies, 3 twee tea drinkers and 1 very well behaved 7 month old. The atmosphere was very quaint and welcoming. We were treated like Royalty as our place card stated. The tea sandwiches, scones, crumpets, and of course the tea, were all magnificent. My favorite tea was the "Rose Hips".  I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back. The only reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because I've never been to a tea room to compare to this one. I've read reviews of tea rooms in Solano county where I live and I have a feeling that the others don't measure up to this one.

excerpts: I absolutely loved the fresh warm scones and crumpets, the clotted cream & lemon curd were both divine, and all of the little sandwiches were very tasty!
Between us we ordered the cucumber & cream cheese, pear & stilton, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and turkey & mustard sandwiches, and they were all very enjoyable!
The fresh fruit was lovely as well, but the salad and coleslaw didn't do much for me.
(Still, I very much enjoyed the meal overall.)
crumpets.author: Emma M.
crumpets.review:
I came here with my mom to celebrate her birthday, and it was a really fun and quaint experience.  The decor is very old fashioned, cute, and a little bit quirky... I almost felt like I had stepped into a different world; Lovejoy's is really like no other place I've been.

We ordered the Queen's Tea for two; to drink I had the special- strawberry herbal tea which I quite enjoyed, though I have to admit I was most impressed by all the beautifully presented snacks.  I absolutely loved the fresh warm scones and crumpets, the clotted cream & lemon curd were both divine, and all of the little sandwiches were very tasty!  Between us we ordered the cucumber & cream cheese, pear & stilton, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and turkey & mustard sandwiches, and they were all very enjoyable!  The fresh fruit was lovely as well, but the salad and coleslaw didn't do much for me.  (Still, I very much enjoyed the meal overall.)  The adorable, sugary, and delicious petit fours at the end were a delightful note to end things on, though by the time we got to those I was already stuffed!

I definitely enjoyed the experience, the tea, and all the tasty treats, but I do feel like the prices were a little high.  Still, it really was a charming and different experience, and it's definitely worth trying at least once!

excerpts: I loved the crumpets, as usual.
Buttery and with extra cream on top!
crumpets.author: Rosanne L.
crumpets.review:
Tip: You must make reservations for this place or they will not seat you! Reservations more than a week in advance recommended too!

My best friend and I are really into tea places. We went to Crown and Crumpet a few months back. She suggested to bring me here for my 25th birthday because she's been here a few times and thinks it's better than C&C. The place is small and has a quirky mismatching decor all around. The service is exquisite.

We sat down and our server was warming. She took our orders and answered all the questions I had. We both ordered the Queen's Tea with an apricot tea and china rose petal black tea. I love the apricot but milk and sugar was needed. It smells delicious though! Wasn't a huge fan of the china rose petal. I felt it was too floral. 

Our food came pretty quick and soon enough, I was munching on tiny triangular-shaped sandwiches. I got the roast beef & horseradish sandwich along with the smoke salmon and cream cheese. My BFF got a turkey and cranberry. I am usually not a fan of cranberry, but I took a bite of her sandwich and I think it was my fave out of the three. The roast beef was slightly dry and bland.

The scones and pastries were good and fruits were fresh. I loved the crumpets, as usual. Buttery and with extra cream on top! Yum!

This place is cheaper than Crown and Crumpet, but I do think the decor there is prettier/girlier/fancier.


We saw an elder pair of granny's and we hope that it would be us in another 50 years :)

excerpts:
I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! 
The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!
crumpets.author: Stephanie C.
crumpets.review:
Lovejoy' s is the definition of shabby chic. It's completely charming and full of tons of character. The place is adorned with hats perfect for a royal wedding, lace, cuckoo clocks, vintage pictures, and of course tons of mismatched tea sets. I've been here before but most recently came for my Mom's birthday tea.

My Mom and I shared the Queen's tea for two, $27/person, and then added on my sister for $17. With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea. We had a huge pot of earl grey and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches. I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins. It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam. The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!

This is the perfect place to have a girly date with friends or with your Mom. Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!

excerpts: The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.
crumpets.author: Snuffles B.
crumpets.review: Grandma love this place because it looks like her house exploded and landed in Lovejoy's. Its a tough reservation because the place is not big and people sit there for hours on end. The service is solid here and while I love high tea, this one is totally average. The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.

excerpts: Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).
crumpets.author: Alex C.
crumpets.review:
6/4/11

It was such a delightful place for afternoon tea/brunch.

The decorations were really whimsical and each utensil (teapot,plates,spoons,cups; were different).

Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).

I was extremely satisfied and filled (all that tea just kept coming, our waitress made sure the pot was full and hot), what more can I say - I'M COMING HERE AGAIN!

excerpts: and the crumpets are amazing as well.
They only bit I didn't like were the petit fours.
crumpets.author: Olivia L.
crumpets.review:
So cute!  We had a baby shower here, and the Queen's Tea is the bomb.  The scones are TDF, loved the sandwiches (especially the roast beef with horseradish, chutney with cheese, chicken salad -- ok all of them!!!) and the crumpets are amazing as well.  They only bit I didn't like were the petit fours.  Highly recommend the ceylon tea (better than the darjeeling).  

Why 4 stars instead of 5?  It was in the low 70s outside, but in the 80s and humid inside.  They gotta open a window or install a fan or something!

excerpts: Would you like some tea & crumpets?
We added crumpets, picked our sandwiches and the teas chosen were two black teas; Afternoon Darjeeling and Passion Fruit.
Yess, even out of the crumpets, short breads and sandwiches.
We've never tried tea with cream, and I was a little hesitant mixing the flavors of cream and passion fruit
together-
but it adds just the right amount of sweetness.
As for the food, great compliments to tea.
Freshly made, but not so filling.
crumpets.author: S Y.
crumpets.review:
"Would you like some tea & crumpets?" I never thought I'd be saying that... and actually mean it! 

A Girls Day Out started here and it was actually fun. It was time to be dainty and ladylike while having some qt with your girlfriends! Cute and charming atmosphere. Bridal and baby showers, little birthday tea parties and girlfriends of all ages get together here. On this lovely day, a group of ladies had a mad hatter party- all dressed in the most hideous hats I've ever seen. I wish I had taken pics! 

Even though we had reservations, we still waited about 15 minutes to be seated, which meant picture ops on the bench placed right outside. 

When finally seated, we were helped by a nice lady who made a few suggestions. We ordered two "High Tea for Two" since there were four of us. We added crumpets, picked our sandwiches and the teas chosen were two black teas; Afternoon Darjeeling and Passion Fruit. 

With our pinkies up, we sipped from our teacups. The Passion Fruit tea was the best of everything! Yess, even out of the crumpets, short breads and sandwiches. We've never tried tea with cream, and I was a little hesitant mixing the flavors of cream and passion fruit together- but it adds just the right amount of sweetness. As for the food, great compliments to tea. Freshly made, but not so filling. You'll be hungry soon after. 

One tip: the tea runs right through you like some bad alcohol. Wherever you go after, make sure there's a bathroom. We went to Haight after and all of us were strugglinggg!

excerpts: except lovejoy's was far better than my imaginary tea and crumpets!
the crumpets were a tad rubbery and dry, but the lemon curd more than made up for it.
the curd was smooth, tart, and not too sweet.
crumpets.author: Charmaine L.
crumpets.review:
lovejoy's took me all the way back to when i was 5 years old playing tea party with my stuffed animals and serving them plastic cookies and pouring water as tea. except lovejoy's was far better than my imaginary tea and crumpets!

high tea was a very fun couple of hours on a beautiful saturday afternoon. a table with a sign "reserved for the queens" was waiting for us by the window. 3 bottomless teas: earl grey, passion fruit black tea, and pomegranate green tea. the teas had light flavors and were not bitter.

we had the following finger sandwiches, i'm listing them best to less than best. but they were all good.
1. pear and stilton (sweet and pungent)
2. roast beef and horseradish (tasty)
3. turkey and dijon mustard (the mustard seeds were like luxurious caviar)
4. smoked salmon and cream cheese (can't go wrong)
5. lovejoy's special which was turkey, cranberry, pecan (savory and sweet mixed together)
6. ham and english mustard (spicy kick from the mustard)

all the sandwiches were served on a bed of fresh greens and light dressing. it was very refreshing, especially with a few segments of mandarin oranges.

the scones were dotted with plump raisins. the double devon cream was just about the best imaginable thing you could possibly spread on a warm crumbly scone. it was rich, decadent, and pure love and joy. the strawberry preserves were full of fruit.

the crumpets were a tad rubbery and dry, but the lemon curd more than made up for it. the curd was smooth, tart, and not too sweet. i rolled my eyes back at first bite.

thank you lovejoy's. you've shown me royal greatness. my stuffed animals would have been green with envy.

excerpts: As if that wasn't enough, freshly baked crumpets arrived, taunting our already filled bellies.
crumpets.author: Marissa C.
crumpets.review:
Holy heart-attack on a plate, Batman!  Let me just preface this with a warning: if you get the Queen's Tea be prepared to be rolled out of this place from glutting yourself on sumptuous Devon cream and a sundry of other tasty, decadent bites!

I took my mom here recently for her birthday and dropped some major dollar for us to both have the Queen's Tea. For sandwiches we picked cucumber and cream cheese (classic), salmon and capers (amazing), chicken and mango chutney (daily special), and one other with a blue cheese that I can't recall.  For tea we chose the Yorkshire Gold, a favorite of my mom's.  Then came the three-tiered wonder with our sandwiches, cookies, fruit, greens and scones.  And of course, lemon curd and Devon cream.  

As if that wasn't enough, freshly baked crumpets arrived, taunting our already filled bellies.  And the petit four and brownie after that simply mocked us in our naivete!

The waitstaff are superb here and totally accommodating from start to finish. We arrived a little early for our reservations (which you will need!) and seated us at an empty table for a larger party that had not yet arrived while ours was being cleared and prepped so we didn't have to wait out in the cold rain.

Though this tea service does cost a handsome price, I think its well-worth the extra coin.  They also offer you a coupon for their antiques/tea shop across the way which we used to buy some Yorkshire Gold for the road as well as a pair of their dainty little tea strainers.

excerpts: So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over.
The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough.
If  I come back
I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.
Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!
crumpets.author: Rosaline C.
crumpets.review:
So I was really excited to try this place with a few of my girlfriends on a nice sunny Sunday. We made reservations ahead of time *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED* since this place is tiny and seems to be very busy at all times. The decor is very country imagine a scene from Alice in Wonderland where all the tableware, china and teacups do not match. Everyone in my party ordered the Queen's Tea since it was our first time there we wanted to try everything. It was $24.95 per person and we get our own pot of tea and a bunch of different things for us to sample.  

The presentation was really nice tall and filled with tons of mini treats.  The coleslaw lacked flavor. The crumpet that was served at the end wasn't bad either but by then I was stuffed suprinsingly because I thought I wouldn't be full from the looks of it initially. Rosaline's recommendations:-

-Mango Black Tea
-China Rose Petal
-Chicken & Asparagus Sandwich
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Sandwich
-EggSalad Sandwich
-Scones (make sure to load it with the devon cream and jam!!!)

So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over. The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough. If  I come back I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.  Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!

excerpts: We picked the Queen's Tea which gave us two choices of sandwiches each, a salad, coleslaw, two scones with lemon curd (kicking myself for not buying a bottle) and a jam, fruit, 2 crumpets, and we each chose a tea that was refilled and kept fresh throughout our lunch.
We were so full by the end of it.
The turkey sandwich with a port wine cheese was so good.
crumpets.author: Aimee L.
crumpets.review:
Came here for a birthday lunch with my mom.  We made reservations so our table said, "Reserved for Royalty" - cute touch!  We picked the Queen's Tea which gave us two choices of sandwiches each, a salad, coleslaw, two scones with lemon curd (kicking myself for not buying a bottle) and a jam, fruit, 2 crumpets, and we each chose a tea that was refilled and kept fresh throughout our lunch.  We were so full by the end of it.  The turkey sandwich with a port wine cheese was so good.  I also enjoyed the chicken salad sandwich.  

The decor was lovely.  A warm inviting space with mismatched chairs and different style tables.  I believe two seating arrangements had comfy couches.  I loved the vintage tea pots, cups, and saucers.  

We had to go across the street to the Lovejoy shop and buy the apricot tea that we loved.  I also picked up a cup and saucer that I love!

The whole experience was awesome and I will definitely be back!

excerpts:
We also shared a plate of gluten free crumpets which came with Meyer Lemon Curd and were very very good indeed.

I ought to add that it was a great experience walking into a tea shop, a place that might otherwise be considered a temple of wheat flour, and be able to order such delectables as scones and crumpets gluten free--at no fuss at all, and so well made.
crumpets.author: M P.
crumpets.review:
Between us we ordered two savory teas (one regular and one gluten free).
All sandwiches can be made gluten free and I had the Cucumber and Cream Cheese Sandwich (tasty but a bit dry) and the Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese Sandwich (excellent).

We shared a plate of gluten free scones  (nice and light and just like homemade), the preserves and cream were good too. We also shared a plate of gluten free crumpets which came with Meyer Lemon Curd and were very very good indeed.

I ought to add that it was a great experience walking into a tea shop, a place that might otherwise be considered a temple of wheat flour, and be able to order such delectables as scones and crumpets gluten free--at no fuss at all, and so well made.

We were also very happy with the service, and can't wait to go back.

excerpts:
The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. 
I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!
crumpets.author: Amanda L.
crumpets.review:
Went here for my birthday/father's day, and absolutely loved it! I had picked here because the Crown & Crumpet is in the process of moving, and couldn't have picked a better place.
The food was wonderful, a good variety, including both vegetarian and gluten free options. The chicken and asparagus tea sandwich was amazing!  The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!

excerpts: Those crumpets have holes for a reason.
The petit four - You have four option, a sugar cookie, some mini cupcakes and 2 types of marzipan mini cakes.
The plum rose marzipan cake was overwhelmed by the marzipan.
However the bittersweet orange one had a good balance of marzipan and flavor.
That one was good, We didn't bother with the other options as they seemed very plain.
crumpets.author: Derek C.
crumpets.review:
The decor of this place is super cute.  I love all the different teapots and the mismatched plates and tea equipment.  The atmosphere is really nice.

Service:  We went on a very rainy day.  So it wasnt so crowded.  We had a reservation and even though it wasn't crowded, I highly recommend making a reservation.  There is a 2 hour maximum in which a table has time to eat - and there is a good reason for that - I am guessing most if not all, maximize this 2 hour.  We stayed until 10 minutes after closing.  The wait staff were super polite and accomodating.  They didn't rush us, and offered boxes.

Food: The food is really good here.  Obviously this isn't a foodie's choice if you are a hipster.  The scones though, man, it was so warm and fluffy and so good. The sandwhiches I had were:
Salmon and Cream Cheese: My favorite one by far, super flavorful.  Any of their sandwhiches with salmon is good.
Chicken and Walnut Salad:  A review recommended this.  It was quite bland and there really wasn't much to it.  Don't bother with this.
Sandwich of the day - Ham and Mango Chutney:  I thought this was pretty meh too.  An interesting combination at first, but nothing amazing.
I liked the crumpet - but none of my friends did.  A very fluffy and pancaky english muffin.  Slather  generous portions of butter, devonshire cream, lemon curd, and raspberry jam to get something truly amazing.  Those crumpets have holes for a reason.
The petit four - You have four option, a sugar cookie, some mini cupcakes and 2 types of marzipan mini cakes.  The plum rose marzipan cake was overwhelmed by the marzipan.  However the bittersweet orange one had a good balance of marzipan and flavor.  That one was good, We didn't bother with the other options as they seemed very plain.
All in all, if we did this, my friends agreed they would only do Tea and Scones, because really those were the highlights. but I like the crumpet, and only the salmon sandwich.
The fennel/caraway coleslaw salad was very good.  I didn't care about the green salad or the fruit on top.  I would have had the coleslaw, scone, and crumpet again.  But just one sandwiches(salmon) and no petit four.

Tea:  I tried the passion fruit tea.  It was very pleasant.  
I wasn't impressed by the masala chai.  But My god - I forgot what my friend got - I think the royal blend.  I never had tea like that before. The flavor was really complex, fruity and it even felt like there were multiple blends of black tea.  I was also very impressed by the black vanilla.  I had so many vanilla type teas I rolled my eyes when I saw the menu.  But when I tried my friends cup, I was blown away.  The vanilla flavor wasn't anything I have tasted before.  I hate it when I have vanilla tea or flavored anything because it just reminds me of extract.  This felt like a different species of vanilla, and tasted very organic and felt very "infused" 

My biggest regret is that they offered to give the remains of the tea in the pot to go.  and I thought it silly to take it with me.  Now I am having massive cravings for the royal blend and the black vanilla and I can't do anything about it.

Price doesn't usually affect my yelp reviews.  But for four people all ordering Queen's Service - it came out to $35.00 with tax and tip included.  Please do not come here to just try the tea and food, this really is a social and dining experience.  Come with good friends and make sure you order different teas(they are bottomless teas anyway!)

excerpts: but they knocked it out by adding cumin seeds), the scones, the warm flaky crumpets with their delicious jam and lemon butter spread!
Tell everyone to come to lovejoy's!!!
crumpets.author: Nida A B.
crumpets.review: What can you not say about this place? The decorative knick knacks, the various cups and saucers, and the friendliness of the staff is so warm and welcoming. My sister and friends took me here during my bachelorette weekend and it was a perfect start to our saturday. We all chose our teas, I got the darjeeling tea, and then proceeded to share the large tiers of finger sandwiches (too many to choose from, must go back), salad, coleslaw (which usually I'm not a fan of but they knocked it out by adding cumin seeds), the scones, the warm flaky crumpets with their delicious jam and lemon butter spread! Tell everyone to come to lovejoy's!!!

excerpts: I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.
The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.
crumpets.author: Lis B.
crumpets.review:
I absolutely adore Lovejoy's.  It is the quintessetial tea room.  Girly, dainty, chintzy, and oh-so-English, it's a definite winner.

Gentlemen:  enter at your own risk.

I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.  The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.

With both teas, you get your choice of tea sandwiches (I love the pear/blue cheese and the apple/cream cheese), tea (they're all good!), warm scone (with lemon curd, jam and clotted cream), coleslaw, spring salad (with mandarin oranges) and shortbread cookie.  The Queen's tea adds a crumpet, a petit four, and a lot of fresh fruit.  

All of the tea cups and saucers are mismatched, making it all completely adorable.  It's all for sale, too.  Just ask (they also have a shop with everything for sale across the street).  

I like sitting near the front, near one of the windows.  It's especially nice if you can get a seat on the banquette and tuck yourself in.  The place is always packed, and it's good to be able to observe the fray, rather than be a part of it.  Speaking of packed, reservations are a necessity.

The waitstaff is always friendly and helpful, although they sometimes look a bit beleaguered.

And the best part about coming here?  In addition to the delicious tidbits I hear from my friends over tea, I always end up hearing little snippets of other people's conversations (hey, the place *is* small), and I've learned more about complete strangers than I ever wanted to know.  Something about the tea must make them open up and spill all their secrets!!

excerpts: We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy
crumpets.author: Lois W.
crumpets.review:
I loved loved loved having High Tea here!!

Came over here last weekend with few friends after hearing so much about the place. Reservations are hard to come by, and sometimes they forget to call people back. Therefore, my friend came here physically days prior to make the reservation!

The tea room was cutely decorated. There were so many random items all over the place, but somehow they worked together. After being seated, we each picked different types of tea and set - pinkies up! Everything was delicate and delicious. We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy :)

Didn't realise how much food was served until we felt like taking a nap on the sofa, all for ~$20 per person!

excerpts:
the fresh fruit they serve is also really delicious, although i wish they gave you more

the crumpets were really good.
you must try the crumpets at least once.
crumpets.author: Rebecca A.
crumpets.review:
Oh my god, this place is the best tea room I have ever been to. 
let me just preface this by saying that I am part British, and i have been going to tea rooms since i could remember, and i daresay that this is the best tea room i have ever been to. 

The decor is soooo cute, and comfy, and this tea room has a great atmosphere and ambiance. It is just soo cute and comfy, and the people who work there are soo nice, attentive and helpful.

The service is great. the servers are very knowledgeable, helpful, attentive, and nice. They are always checking to make sure your tea is hot, and they are always making sure that the food is good and that you are happy with everything.

I have only ever gotten the queen's tea both times i've gone, and it was amazing both times. 
the first time i got the pear and stilton sandwich and the goat cheese, sundired tomato, and olive sandwich. They were both amazing and satisfaying, and perfectly balance. 
the second time i went i got the hummus and artichoke sandwich and the chutney and cheese sandwich. the hummus was okay, it was nothing special but it hit the spot, and the chutney was perfect. 

their scones were amazing, perfectly flaky, just the right amount of sweetness, and the perfect amount of raisins and currants. they were warm, and fresh, and amazing. the creme, jam, and lemon curd were also amazing and complimented the scones and eachother perfectly. 

the shortbread cookies were sooo good, they were thin and cruncy, and so perfectly sweet. 

the coleslaw is ridiculously delicious. I have never liked coleslaw and i am in love with their coleslaw. their sauce is amazing, and they put just the right amount of sauce on their coleslaw, and the rye seeds they add just make the coleslaw so much better than you would ever think coleslaw could be. 

the fresh fruit they serve is also really delicious, although i wish they gave you more

the crumpets were really good. they were warm and fresh, and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. they were amazing with the lemon curd and the butter. I'm normally not a big crumpet fan, so the second time i went i just got them to give me an extra scone instead of the crumpet, but  you must try the crumpets at least once. 

the petit fours are also amazing. the chocolate truffle with apricot was amazing, the walnut brownie was amazing, and the rose-water was amazing as well. they have a large and delicious petit four selection, and i have loved every single petit four that i have tried. 

finally, their tea selection is amazing. I love their darjeeling, and they always keep your tea hot, and make sure that it's hot. they have a really wide selection of non-caffein teas as well, and they are all delicious. 

lovejoy's just has the greatest atmosphere and service and it is seriously the best tea room I have ever been to out of los angeles and san francisco.

i made my friend who hates tea and pastries go to lovejoy's and she is now in love with tea time. that's how good lovejoy's is, it converted my pastry and tea hating friend to a tea time fanatic.

lovejoy's is a must try if you are ever in the bay area, it is an amazing experience!


just a side note, on the weekends, and even fridays, you should try to make reservations if you can, although they do also take walk-ins.

excerpts: The scones and crumpets were made even more tastey by the lemon curd.
yum!
crumpets.author: Emma F.
crumpets.review: This was a great place for an intimate baby sprinkle! We had a reservation and sat in a corner booth (I say booth because 3 of the seats were bench style with so many cushions). The artichoke hummus and smoked salmon & cream cheese sandwiches were good, but the presentation of them was confusing - hard to keep track of what was what... It was a little loud, but also very cute. The scones and crumpets were made even more tastey by the lemon curd. yum!

excerpts: The tea was great (I ended up buying a canister from their retail store across the street), their scones and crumpets should have been illegal, and their chicken apple sandwiches/devonshire cream/lemon curd were to-freaking-die-for.
crumpets.author: Ashley F.
crumpets.review:
I wrote a brief review elsewhere, and I'm just going to copy/paste it here because I am supremely lazy to do a proper one. Also because I said everything I needed to say, and any elaboration I may be inclined to do will more than likely be odd ramblings.

I had tea ... with my ladybug friend last Friday. It was a toss up between this place and Crown & Crumpet, but she said this place offered more for your dollar. The tea was great (I ended up buying a canister from their retail store across the street), their scones and crumpets should have been illegal, and their chicken apple sandwiches/devonshire cream/lemon curd were to-freaking-die-for.

The place was quirky with mismatched chinaware and fun, vintage décor. As much as I liked it, though, the more compulsive part of my personality begged for less clutter and more sophistication/minimalism. That's not to undermine the atmosphere, though. I loved it, and the service was wonderful.

* What I failed to mention was the type of tea (ceylon). To most people, it might not be something to write home about, but I could have this tea (instead of green) forever and ever. And while I'm skeptical of adding any sugar into my tea, after positive prompting from my friend, I caved and decided a small spoonful of sugar only makes it better. Yum!

Bonus: You get to try on hats if you'd like to, and I'm attesting to other reviews that they rarely let your teapot get more than halfway empty.

excerpts:
More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.
, 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:
This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!
They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.
For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/
"Reserved for Royals".
crumpets.author: Genevieve Y.
crumpets.review:
Date & Time:  Friday June 6, 2008 @ 5:15pm(they close at 6pm and the last seating is at 5pm, so I recommend coming earlier, but they were so kind to seat us.)
Company:  Michael who gave up Happy Hour to Accompany Me Here
Crowd:  Groups & Twosomes of Ladies @ Tea Time
Atmosphere:  Tea Party we've Dreamed of as Children Come to Life
Decor:  Utterly Charming!  Everything is Precious from the Apricot Window Curtains, Pale Yellow Walls, Seating Areas to the Unique Red Phone  Booth, Paintings and  Porcelain Teacups that Accent this Beautiful Room.  Small Wooden Tables covered w/ Doiley's and Cushioned Wooden Chairs and Benches along w/Seating Sections w/ Sofas, Wooden Loveseats, Coffee Tables and Comfortable Upholstered Chairs.  Very Cozy!
Service:  Very Warm, Helpful, Attentive.
Imbibe:  White Peach Tea!  Vast Selection including Apricot, Passionfruit & China Rose Petal Black Tea.  Served in Unique Teapots w/ Porcelain Cups & Saucers.  Thoughtful Touch!
Devour:  More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.  A Combination of All of The Above is Availabe in High Tea also for Two and Queen's Tea.  Wee Tea for children 10 and under.  
Notes:  Towards the End of this Wonderful Tea Time Experience, the Very Beautiful and Sweet Server Visits Each table with a Tray of Scrumptious & Various Petit Fours where we can Choose the Flavor of our Choice!  I got the Milk Chocolate w/ Apricot and was trying to Signal Michael to get the Strawberry Shortcake,  but he got the Nut Brownie cause it was huge, so we took the rest home!
Side-Notes:  Since we got there so late, we had the Cream Tea where got to Choose a Tea(Apricot), 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:  This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!  They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.  For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/ "Reserved for Royals".

excerpts: The crumpets were good too.
I could have done without the little sandwiches as neither of our selections were particularly good.
Since we arrived with a big appetite we also purchased the sheppards pie and this puff pastry with pork in it.
crumpets.author: Ken C.
crumpets.review:
I had an amazing experience at Lovejoy's. This was my first time at a tea salon so I wanted to full experience. We ordered the Queen's Tea, which is their biggest menu option and gives you a sampling of a variety of their tea parings. My favorite item was the scones. The crumpets were good too. I could have done without the little sandwiches as neither of our selections were particularly good. Since we arrived with a big appetite we also purchased the sheppards pie and this puff pastry with pork in it. Both of those entree items were amazing. 

Lovejoy's is a great place to have your first tea salon experience. We also noticed a large group of women that were holding a baby shower so I'd imagine that's pretty common at a place like this. 

If you'd like to experience the whole pomp and circumstance than I'd suggest you order the "High Tea" or the "Queens Tea". Each meal comes with a bottomless pot of the tea of your choice. If you're  guy (like me) and want to experience good food then I'd suggest you get a pot of tea and the sheppard's pie. 

Overall a little spendy, and the service is okay, but it's great food/tea, casual (not stuffy) environment, and Lovejoy's will make sure you have a great experience. Tip: Definitely make sure you book a reservation in advance. :)

excerpts: Crumpets, scones and cheese and pickle sandwiches have never tasted so good.
We had the queen's tea and were not disappointed! :-)
crumpets.author: Harriet P.
crumpets.review: Loved it! I'm British and have lived in SF for a year and half now. Lovejoys reminded me of a lot of the good stuff we left behind. Crumpets, scones and cheese and pickle sandwiches have never tasted so good. We had the queen's tea and were not disappointed! :-)

excerpts:
Seven of us enjoyed the Queen's Tea which included sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, crumpets, scones (my favorite!), shortbread cookies, and petit fours. 
The only thing I felt like I missed by doing this was the crumpets.

Scones!
Crumpets

Least Faves:
Fig and olive tapenade sandwich
Coleslaw - the rye seeds give it an odd flavor and I'm the only one who ever eats coleslaw in our group - I wish they'd give us crumpets instead
Petit fours - too sweet

Finish your tea experience by going across the street to Lovejoy's Attic and buying your favorite tea (at a much cheaper price) and tea set.
crumpets.author: Kathleen M.
crumpets.review:
This is the perfect place for a bridal shower. I know because I was a guest at one here. The cornucopia of tea snacks was amazing and all very tasty.

UPDATE:
My bachelorette party started here and we had a wonderful time. Seven of us enjoyed the Queen's Tea which included sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, crumpets, scones (my favorite!), shortbread cookies, and petit fours. The food and tea were delicious and served on precious mismatched china.

UPDATE 2:
We went back for a birthday and brought some straight guys. Although the husband was worried he'd have to wear a hat (they have hats available to put on at a tea place near San Diego), I assured him that they didn't make you wear hats here. He survived lunch at Lovejoy's with his manhood intact. (More than survived - he and another male friend were comfortable the whole time.) The husband loved scoopfuls of the after dinner mints.

The Queen's Tea involves a lot of food. For $5 less a person you can get the High Tea which is still plenty of food. The only thing I felt like I missed by doing this was the crumpets.

Now that I've been here a few times I can better evaluate the food:

Faves:
Tea: Passion fruit
Sandwiches: Chicken walnut salad (least fave: fig and olive tapenade)
Scones!
Crumpets

Least Faves:
Fig and olive tapenade sandwich
Coleslaw - the rye seeds give it an odd flavor and I'm the only one who ever eats coleslaw in our group - I wish they'd give us crumpets instead
Petit fours - too sweet

Finish your tea experience by going across the street to Lovejoy's Attic and buying your favorite tea (at a much cheaper price) and tea set.

excerpts: I also had some lovely crumpets with fresh marmalade.
Unfortunately I wasn't able to try the little sandwiches because I am lactose-intolerant.
My friend said they were wonderful, though!
crumpets.author: Veronica J.
crumpets.review:
Wonderful black tea here in the most quaint of atmospheres. Great china.
The tea was top-notch; what a large menu selection. Really enjoyed it!
I also had some lovely crumpets with fresh marmalade. Unfortunately I wasn't able to try the little sandwiches because I am lactose-intolerant. My friend said they were wonderful, though!

excerpts: For my group, I ordered the high tea + crumpets because I love crumpets.
Everyone tucked in, and then crumpets were served about 10 minutes after people started winding down on the tea trays.
crumpets.author: Tasha D.
crumpets.review:
I booked Lovejoy's on the strength of yelp reviews for a bridal shower I was hosting as matron of honor for my best friend.  Lovejoy's staff was absolutely amazing helping me to arrange it -- everything was very simple.  I reserved the group several months ahead (they're very popular), and then they just had me tell them the size of the guest list, even though they and I both knew the number of attendees would be far smaller, they were just earmarking more than enough space for me.  Then I simply had to confirm the number of guests 48 hours before the event -- incredibly short notice, really convenient for last minute changes.

So!  For my group, I ordered the high tea + crumpets because I love crumpets.  I thought that on a per-person basis for a nice event, it was very reasonably priced.

When I arrived half an hour early, our tables were already set up, and there were two tables set aside as gift tables, which were very nice to have.  I had plenty of time to lay out favors and seating cards as my guests trickled in.  Hot tea in an assortment of flavors was laid out immediately for guests to enjoy, and then they could order specific flavors as well.

Ten minutes after 4 o'clock, tea was served on large multi-tiered trays.  Everyone tucked in, and then crumpets were served about 10 minutes after people started winding down on the tea trays.

Tea pots were promptly refilled as they were emptied; the service was absolutely fantastic; and the food was more than anyone could eat.  I had a large bag of leftovers to take home, and that was a big bonus!   
Everyone at the tea party let me know they had a fabulous time, and I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room for any event that needs a good cup of tea.  :)

excerpts: Crumpets were toasted and buttery with Devon cream, couldn't get enough of those!
Assorted sammies were good too.
Our group wanted a photo taken and the owner helped us out by taking a photo outside in front of the hears painted on the side of the building.
When my god-daughter is old enough, I will definitely take her here.
crumpets.author: Susan F.
crumpets.review: We had a high school group reunion at Lovejoy's and it was really great.  The decor helps you feel like you've stepped out of your everyday environment and taken a little trip to London.  This is a great place to bring your Mom, Auntie, niece, nephew (yes, boys too can enjoy sharing this experience), girlfriends, etc.  Crumpets were toasted and buttery with Devon cream, couldn't get enough of those! Assorted sammies were good too.  Our group wanted a photo taken and the owner helped us out by taking a photo outside in front of the hears painted on the side of the building.  When my god-daughter is old enough, I will definitely take her here.

excerpts: And crumpets on the side.
I learned the proper way to pour tea (pour the milk and sugar in the cup first, then the tea).
We had the peach and the vanilla.
It was aromatic and heavenly.
When the food arrived, we nibbled and noshed.
Surprisingly, I was full by the end of the meal of tiny sandwiches and tea.
I survived and enjoyed the experience.
crumpets.author: David P.
crumpets.review:
I was first taken to this place by a friend. Of course me being a meat and potatoes kinda guy my response was, "Tea? Finger sandwiches? Are you kidding me?"

Walking in, the decor made me want to turn and run without looking back, but I sat down and was willing to suffer through whatever girly nightmare torture my friend had in mind for me.

We each ordered a pot of tea and a multi-tiered plate of food. And crumpets on the side. I learned the proper way to pour tea (pour the milk and sugar in the cup first, then the tea). We had the peach and the vanilla. It was aromatic and heavenly. When the food arrived, we nibbled and noshed. Surprisingly, I was full by the end of the meal of tiny sandwiches and tea. I survived and enjoyed the experience. I guess there is something to the whole European Tea culture.

Later in the month I took my niece and her roommate there for brunch. They were ecstatic. They've never done anything like this before and kept thanking me. We ate our fill and took a drive around the City looking at landmarks. It was a good day.

excerpts: My friends were also very pleased with their Savory Tea and crumpets.
crumpets.author: Ashley W.
crumpets.review:
Yum!!  The best cream tea I've had in America!

My friends were also very pleased with their Savory Tea and crumpets.

Only drawback is that it's VERY crowded and a little noisy depending on what sort of groups are there (we had a children's birthday party and a baby shower in addition to other customers), which doesn't really make it the perfect place to linger over your bottomless pot of tea.  We still had a great time, and the quality of the food and the cheerful attitude of all of the staff made up for the crowd.  In spite of all the patrons, the service was very good - hardly any wait and never a cold pot of tea.  Ambiance and china were good.  

If you want to make sure you can get a table, call for a reservation very far in advance, especially on the weekends.  We didn't call early enough to get a reservation, but fortunately, they are pretty able to accommodate small groups of walk-ins.  Our wait was about 20 mins., and it passed very quickly as we browsed in their cute shop across the street.

I hope to go back to Lovejoy's when we're in SF next - just hope to be able to plan it at a time when they're not as busy.

excerpts: Laughing in a bad English accent, "Tea and crumpets with the Queen?
" Pshhh.
And we all know "cucumber sandwhiches wtih the sides cut off," are frowned upon by heffers far and wide.
crumpets.author: Tor E.
crumpets.review:
My girl Ness first introduced me to this spot on 16th and Church in the city, and I've have tried to make it a monthly routine ever since. I know, I know. I used to be just like you. Laughing in a bad English accent, "Tea and crumpets with the Queen?" Pshhh. And we all know "cucumber sandwhiches wtih the sides cut off," are frowned upon by heffers far and wide. But let me tell you, this ain't your grandmother's tea party.

The place is a cozy, yet eclectic corner tea house. Complete with mix matched China, vintage wall hangings, and crochet doilies. The waitresses are all very pleasant and very knowledgeable of the teas, food, and what goes good with what. And while it's a rather noisy establishment, cell phones are not allowed so please take ur loud ass outside when ur T-Pain ringtone goes off.

OK, now for the food. OMG. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. While it's no House of Prime Rib, I can honestly say that I've NEVER left this place still hungry - and I CAN GRUB. Me and Ness usually get "High Tea for Two," and I usually end up finishing whatever she leaves behind. This includes, salad, cole slaw, 2 sandwhiches of our choice (each, so 4 in all), 2 scones, sugar cookies, and 2 bottomless pots of tea. My fave combo is bay shrimp and mayo, and either chicken and asparagus or egg and onion with passion fruit tea. And seriously, the "devonshire cream," aka butter from the Gods is so good on top of a warm scone I'm thinking about stealing it next time. Mind u, they also have savory side dishes like sausage rolls, shepards pie, quiches, and puff pastries filled with things like curried chicken.

Lovejoy's Tea Room is the quintessential spot for a bridal/baby shower but any day (especially sunny, warm Sundays!) is a good day for tea!

excerpts: Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.
Yes, I had my pinky up a few times.
Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.
The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.
The sandwiches were good but not anything special.
I enjoyed the tea.
crumpets.author: Aaron G.
crumpets.review:
I've been dying to have a tea party since Jennifer C. told me about her experience in Seattle.  Does this make me an old English lady?  Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.  Yes, I had my pinky up a few times. Is there any other way to drink english tea?

The interior is quite antiquated.  I was waiting for the smell of mothballs to invade my nostrils, but it never did.  There are little knick knacks everywhere.  Antique galore might be a better phrase to describe this place.  I almost felt like i was invading an old lady's hang out spot.  

Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.  The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.  The sandwiches were good but not anything special.  I enjoyed the tea.  We had the Tea Room Blend (black tea) and the Passion Fruit Black Tea.  

Other than that, everything was good.  I didn't find this place super special or super awesome.  It was my first high tea experience and i'm going to continue finding places to have my tea.  However, I now feel a lot more sophisticated now that I've done this.  I am a proper gentleman now.  My next goal is to be knighted.  Sir Aaron Gong has a nice ring to it doesn't it?

excerpts: The crumpets with lemon curd were so delicious!
And all the tea we sampled were very different but yummy.
crumpets.author: Diana C.
crumpets.review:
It was a girl's day out so we had tea at Lovejoy's. 

They open on the dot at 11 am. Thank goodness we had reservations. Everyone that showed up seemed to have had them too. 

We all loved the antique plates and tea pots. Not one piece of silverware or dinnerware was the same! The crumpets with lemon curd were so delicious! And all the tea we sampled were very different but yummy. The sandwiches were bite-size and delectable. 

It's definitely a fun spot for ladies to hangout, not so much for guys. And they are very accommodating to groups. Lovejoy's was very enjoyable. We'd do it again if we have the chance.

excerpts: Don't forget the crumpets too.
crumpets.author: Donna Y.
crumpets.review:
I want to say a BIG HAPPY BDAY TO COCO!! What a great reason to write my 500th review. 

Perfect place to have afternoon tea and for any celebration. We came on Saturday to have Tea with Caroline for her Bday. I suggest you call to make a reservation since they place books up fast. We all end up ordering the Queen's Tea. We end up sharing all the small sammies, sip our flavors teas, had scones with the lemon curd and devon cream. YUM! Plus fruit and a petite four. My goodness did we eat. Don't forget the crumpets too. Plus love how all of the food came out and all so cute and decorative. 

The place is deck out in cuteness and girly items. Having tea with friends and catching up is the best. Plus it gave me a sense of times that was slower and simpler. Which was nice. 

Had a wonderful time and so love to do it again.

excerpts: Anyway, we ordered crumpets (to try, not knowing what they were.)
They came with very yummy lemon curd.
I don't think I cared for the crumpets themselves that much.
crumpets.author: Clarissa L.
crumpets.review:
This is a really cute place :) Two of my friends and I came here and got seated in the corner. The sign said "Reserved for the queens" or something to that effect. Anyway, we ordered crumpets (to try, not knowing what they were.) They came with very yummy lemon curd. I don't think I cared for the crumpets themselves that much.

Ooh, and vanilla rooibos tea... mmm. Sooo good!
Scones were also good.
Tea sandwiches - we chose pear/stilton, chicken-apple-walnut and salmon mousse. I think the last one was the daily special, but I forget what it was. All were pretty good!

Three of us shared a tea for two and we were quite full by the end of the meal... Was kinda surprising. Anyway this is a really cute place with good food :)

excerpts: The bride invited her bridal party to this place for cucumber sandwiches sans the crust, tea, freshly made crumpets, buttery cookies and petit fours.
Delicious food, teacups with character, and a wonderful venue for a get together.
Make reservations and be prepared to wait when you arrive.
crumpets.author: Cynthia C.
crumpets.review: First high tea experience.  The bride invited her bridal party to this place for cucumber sandwiches sans the crust, tea, freshly made crumpets, buttery cookies and petit fours.  Delicious food, teacups with character, and a wonderful venue for a get together.  Make reservations and be prepared to wait when you arrive.

excerpts: Very tasty sandwiches, rich cookies and crumpets, ridiculously good scones, to die for lemon curd, and super sweet fruit.
Great tea selection and quality.
Ambiance is cute and cozy.
Take a friend or family member at least once.
It makes for a memorable experience.
crumpets.author: Janet J.
crumpets.review: Best blueberry scone I have ever had in my life, and I have lived in many cities. Crispy and buttery with perfectly cooked blueberries. High tea is served here. I had Queen's tea. It's more than enough food and variety. Very tasty sandwiches, rich cookies and crumpets, ridiculously good scones, to die for lemon curd, and super sweet fruit. Great tea selection and quality. Ambiance is cute and cozy. Take a friend or family member at least once. It makes for a memorable experience.

excerpts: I will rave about the bottomless tea, the scone, crumpets.
The sandwiches again, were extremely small and the sandwich bread was dry, almost stale.
crumpets.author: Mary P.
crumpets.review:
I brought my daughter and several of her little friends to Lovejoy's to celebrate my daughter's birthday.  The five of them had a ball!  The hostess (sorry I forgot your name) and Mara our waitress were simply fantastic! The hostess was super nice to us when we arrived a bit late (wrangling ten year old girls is not just a job, its an adventure) I did call and let her know that we were fast and furiously on our way from the East Bay and to please not give away our table.  Mara was nice and friendly and explained everything to us and offered some nice suggestions for the birthday girl and her entourage.  She even helped us take some really cute photos of ourselves in hats and crowns.

The young ladies had the Wee Tea, which is perfect for those 10 and under. Hot chocolate with plenty of whipped cream, warm scone, choice of one tea sandwich assorted fruit and a lollipop all arrived on pretty tiered serving trays.  Kids really like the lemon curd and Devonshire cream, I would strongly suggest adding one or both of these to the Wee Tea.  The kids did complain that they wished they had more sandwiches (cream cheese and mandarin orange and tried and true cream cheese and cucumber) to eat with their Wee Tea.  The sandwiches are incredibly small. The kids were only a little bit hungry afterward, but most of the kids I know seem to have tapeworms, a hollow leg or both, especially when it comes to food consumption.  So I am not surprised that they were still hungry.

 I had the Queens Tea with ham and pesto sandwiches and chicken apple walnut sandwiches.  I will rave about the bottomless tea, the scone, crumpets. The sandwiches again, were extremely small and the sandwich bread was dry, almost stale. Also, I could barely taste the pesto on my ham and pesto sandwiches.

The Decor was very charming.  Everything is mismatched so do not be startled by this and if you want brand new everything and matchy-matchy, go else where.  Everything is worn and cozy and comfortable. 
The kids loved the china mosaic that was on the floor just inside the front door. 

Lovejoy's a great experience for my daughter and her friends.  The laughed and giggled and nibbled snacks and got the chance to play proper English ladies. A great time was had by all. This was definitely a birthday my daughter will remember for years to come!

excerpts: The biscuits and butter or "crumpets and clotted cream," as the Queen would say, are scrumptious and I think even Hercule Poirot would love this joint.
It's pricey, but worth it if you want to do something "different" with people who have a sense of humor and a royal palate.
crumpets.author: Nancy L.
crumpets.review: What's not to love about tiny sandwiches and pretending to be the Queen of England? The biscuits and butter or "crumpets and clotted cream," as the Queen would say, are scrumptious and I think even Hercule Poirot would love this joint. It's pricey, but worth it if you want to do something "different" with people who have a sense of humor and a royal palate.

excerpts: We decided crumpets are a pancake-english muffin hybrid, a puffin.
crumpets.author: Monique H.
crumpets.review:
Went here for the first time today.  My girlfriend from high school was visiting from out of town and we had been talking about having high tea.  After much searching and disappointment that The Four Seasons Hotels and the Ritz-Carlton Hotels have discontinued their tea service, we found this place on Yelp.

We were half an hour late (boyfriends are slow) but lucky one person in our party was only 5 minutes late and saved the table for us.  She said they were very nice and didn't harass her about the rest of her party not showing up.

I had the Queen's Tea with English Breakfast tea and cucumber and turkey sandwiches.  The tea arrived first and after waiting anxiously for it to seep, I poured myself a cup.  It was delicious, but I am not a tea connoisseur.  Then arrived the food, on a three tiered platter.  The top tier was the fresh fruit, next the scone, biscuit, jam, lemon stuff, and the devon cream, the bottom tier had the sandwiches, cole slaw, and greens.

To be frank, when I first looked at it I thought they kind of skimped out on the fruit, but I was stuffed by the end of my meal, so really they are smarter than me!

After having some fruit, I decided to try the scone.  I first tried the devon cream...and that is when I realized that I loved this place!  If I had a lover, forget the whipped cream or chocolate sauce, this is what I'd cover his body with and lick off!!!  I could not get enough of it and I think this was my favorite item here.  Of course the jam and lemon stuff was good too, but I cannot describe my devotion to devon cream now.

The sandwiches were of course delicious and...dainty, delicate?  FUN!  I am not a super girlie girl.  My friend and I decided to put dresses on for the special occasion and I felt like a streetwalker even though my dress is conservative, but that is how rarely I wear things that don't have legs.  But this place played into my feminine side without me feeling awkward about it.  So yes, it's frilly and kitsch, but it works for this place.

A little while later came my fresh crumpet.  We decided crumpets are a pancake-english muffin hybrid, a puffin. Delicious, but I just wanted to get back to my scone and devon cream to be honest.

Lastly when we were done, we had our petite fours.  Which apparently I didn't really experience because I got the dark chocolate truffle with dried apricot.  But it was so cute and I love dark chocolate.  Petite fours are candy-sized, individually glazed pieces of cake. (My friend went to culinary school)

I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.  The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.  But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it made me want ribs or something) and I was too full to even consider wasting space on a salad!

So if you go, invite me?

excerpts: The crumpets were also quite tasty but the lemon curd really made the crumpet amazing.
crumpets.author: Cara D.
crumpets.review:
This is probably one of the most eclectic places I have been to! With its mismatched everything and most adorable decorations, Lovejoy's is a perfect place for any occasion, even if its just a lunch on a regular Saturday.

I was treated to a Queens tea here and boy did I feel like a Queen.  Two sandwiches for each person, meaning I got to try 4!  The special of the turkey and cranberry was so delicious and my favorite out of all the ones I tried.  And the scones, the scones were just so yummy.  They were not dry like many scones you taste, but warm (even after they had been sitting on our table for a while) and much more moist than many others.  Plus the strawberry jam made the scone even better!  The crumpets were also quite tasty but the lemon curd really made the crumpet amazing.  Finally the petite fours (or however you spell them) just topped it off!

The whole experience was delightful.  The staff was more than helpful, nice and I just really enjoyed the whole experience!

excerpts: The crumpets were just alright.
Flavored black teas were good (Passion Fruit) and
the flavored green tea-- not so much.
The petit fours looked really cute.
Service was also excellent.
Also had good hot chocolate.
Cute bathroom too!
crumpets.author: Lisa T.
crumpets.review:
Excellent!

This place is really cute and reasonable price for being a tea room. The sandwiches are good and so are the scones. The crumpets were just alright. Flavored black teas were good (Passion Fruit) and the flavored green tea-- not so much. The petit fours looked really cute. Service was also excellent. Also had good hot chocolate. Cute bathroom too!

excerpts: The crumpets are so-so, save for the lemon curd.
crumpets.author: Lydia W.
crumpets.review:
I came here with five of my friends to celebrate my birthday, and it was perfect!  Everything I imagined it to be.  The place is decked out in girly-ness.  It's weird when you see a man inside because there are so few.  It's a lot smaller and cozier than I thought it would be, but if you are with your best friends then it allows for a more intimate tea party!  

We opted against ordering a tea sets since there were so many of us, and just ordered a bottomless pot of Earl Grey ($8) with each additional person being $1 more.  Then we ordered a lot of food a la carte.  There is a 9.95 minimum per person so we were forced to order more food than we could actually finish, believe it or not.  We came here starving and left incredibly sated.

The scones are amazing.  Warm and soft, combined with the clotted cream and strawberry jam... mmm... Surprisingly easy to break up into pieces so you shouldn't eat an entire one by yourself or you'll have no room for other food.  I was really heartbroken to see jars and jars of Smuckers jam in their storage pantry while waiting in line for the bathroom.  

The crumpets are so-so, save for the lemon curd.  

Ordered a large plate of sandwiches, which allowed us to get 3 sandwiches, quartered.  We ordered 1. bay shrimp and mayo, 2. salmon mousse, 3. pear and stilton.  I only tried the last two, but they were both yummy.  The pear and stilton was very unique, as was the salmon mousse.  Sandwiches are served on a bed of greens, cool.  Also came with coleslaw which was surprisingly good.

We got a chicken curry pasti (pronounced the A as in PASTA not PASTE) which was AMAZING!  Didn't even need the dipping sauce.  The shell was flaky and hot, the inside was flavorful and fragrant.  So great.  

To get to our 9.95 minimum we ordered the Beef Pasti which was definitely not as good as the chicken one.  

We also got an order of the sausage rolls, which are ridiculously hard to cut in halves.  Interesting taste, but would not recommend it.  

Since it was my birthday I got a petite four that was banana-flavored.  It was really cute and thoughtful but less tasty.  They come around with a platter of petite fours for $2.50 each.  We thought they were just giving us all petite fours for free -_- 

All in all, Lovejoy's was everything I wanted it to be.  I had been wanting to come for years and am extremely satisfied with my experience there!

excerpts: My Queen's tea came with all of the above, my own pot of tea, four sandwiches (I had roast beef and chicken salad, yum) and a salad and coleslaw and cookies and a petit four and crumpets.
There was plenty of food, we boxed up some to go!
crumpets.author: Alissa S.
crumpets.review:
Queen for a Day, what more do you need?

The planets aligned and five of us had two free hours to catch up on the same day at the same time, so I booked a reservation for tea. From the moment we arrived, we had so much fun! We had two waitresses , the table said, "reserved for queens", they explained the teas like they were wines, and the food was excellent. The scones were round, soft, and warm, the real deal. The double Devonshire cream was excellent, the lemon curd fresh, and the strawberry jam not too sweet. My Queen's tea came with all of the above, my own pot of tea, four sandwiches (I had roast beef and chicken salad, yum) and a salad and coleslaw and cookies and a petit four and crumpets. There was plenty of food, we boxed up some to go! Then we strolled around the neighborhood to walk off some crumpet. It was a lovely time and I highly recommend it.

excerpts: It also came with crumpets, fruit, salad, coleslaw, a petit four, and tea.
Really a good deal, and fun experience.
crumpets.author: Zoe S.
crumpets.review: Went here with my mom and sister on a Friday. It was a little busy, but we made a reso, so there were no probs getting a table. We all got the Queen's Tea. Salmon&cream cheese, apple&cream cheese, apple walnut chix salad, prosciutto&gouda cheese - sandwiches were great! The scones were AMAZING. It also came with crumpets, fruit, salad, coleslaw, a petit four, and tea. Really a good deal, and fun experience.

excerpts: And the crumpets - yum!
crumpets.author: Katherine P.
crumpets.review:
This place has the best scones I have ever had. Hot fluffy raisin scones covered in strawberry preserves, devonshire cream, and lemon curd. O-M-G is probably the only way to put it. I finished mine before my teamates had gotten through half of theirs.

And the crumpets - yum! 

I love the selection of teas, and the bottomless pots.

I wasn't as happy with the sandwiches (I had the apple/cream cheese, and the special of the day which was curry chicken) but I think in general I'm not a fan of sandwiches with a lot of creamy anything so that's probably my fault.

The Queen's tea is the way to go if you want the ultimate experience but it's really a lot of food and you probably won't be able to finish!

excerpts: Aromatic teas, buttery crumpets, and delicious scones... if that isn't enough to tempt you then perhaps the warm atmosphere and friendly service will be.
This is one of the BEST places to have teas in the city, and it's pretty obvious.
In my experience you must have a reservation.
crumpets.author: Anna K.
crumpets.review:
Aromatic teas, buttery crumpets, and delicious scones... if that isn't enough to tempt you then perhaps the warm atmosphere and friendly service will be.  This is one of the BEST places to have teas in the city, and it's pretty obvious.  In my experience you must have a reservation.  Otherwise please expect a long wait.  

There's no parking in the area unless you have a smart car or are willing to circle a 4 mile radius for hours.  However, I must say it's worth it.  I have other favorites, but I will coming back to this Noe Valley gem.

excerpts: It was $35 per person and included limitless pots of our choices of teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and petit fours!
Also a small gift for each of us.
A very special day!
crumpets.author: Jocelyn B.
crumpets.review: Had a WONDERFUL time for the Mother's Day Afternoon Tea. It has a shabby chic feel, (no stuffiness here) and even the 3 men in our party didn't feel out of place. It was $35 per person and included limitless pots of our choices of teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and petit fours! Also a small gift for each of us. A very special day!

excerpts: One highlight of the visit were the freshly made crumpets.
I always wondered what exactly crumpets were, but they arrived hot and buttery and reminded me of a really yummy un-split english muffin.
crumpets.author: Ken W.
crumpets.review:
This review is somewhat late in coming, but it's one of the few places that I can remember months after visiting.

We were up in the Bay Area on a roadtrip and Lovejoy's came highly recommended by J's S.F. friend. Now, food-wise I'm as manly as they come, but even I can't say 'no' to a tower of food along with an accompanying pinch of civilization.

Being from L.A., I know about the horrible, nearly nonexistent street parking of S.F. and this place didn't disappoint. However, persistence paid off and I found a space across from their storefront.

Located in Noe Valley, along MUNI's J Line on Church Street (alas, there's no station nearby) Lovejoy's fits right in; quaint, old-world charm with a healthy dose of Victorian kitzch. It's sort of like being transported back in time; a doily-friendly lunching space with curtains, lamps, and other knick-knacks compelling you to sit down on a couch or table and have a cup of tea. 

And a scone. 

With clotted cream.

And some finger sandwiches. 

Or two...

And a petit four. 

And... and...

We opted for sharing a Queen's Tea, the name of which felt like a challenge to my masculinity, but I gotta say that both of us were stuffed afterwards. One highlight of the visit were the freshly made crumpets. I always wondered what exactly crumpets were, but they arrived hot and buttery and reminded me of a really yummy un-split english muffin.
