This place also features some lunch items on the menu so if tea's not exactly your thing, you're okay. Our friend mentioned a shepherd's pie, which thankfully, we didn't order.  

The thing I like about afternoon tea is the sense of civilization it imparts to the senses, similar to a kaiseki meal or a cocktail hour with aperitifs, clinking ice, and tony cocktail glasses. I might also mention that the prices are also on the civilized side. I've never found afternoon tea to be a bargain outing and Lovejoy's is no exception, yet I've never come across a place as charmingly quaint as Lovejoy's. 

It's most definitely a place to relax and take your time; savoring the experience in a cozy atmosphere. It's an experience I'd definitely recommend.

Hell, even I caught myself sticking out my pinky finger once or twice.

excerpts: Lovejoy's is a place I don't mind going to again for tea with crumpets and biscuits.
crumpets.author: Don U.
crumpets.review:
Honestly, I wanted to give Lovejoy's Tea Room a higher score.  I mean, it's a British tea place.  You don't find this sort of place in the Bay Area. (Yes, you see plenty of milk tea and Thai tea places, but not British tea places.) It's that the place has a good amount of glaring flaws.  It has 3 stars, but the place is really A-OK indeed.  Side note: one of my sisters brought my siblings and I over to this place for her birthday, my only visit to this place.

As I mentioned in the last paragraph, this is a British tea place.  Obviously, the place has the British look when you go inside.  Oh and of course, this is definitely a place ladies generally should feel at ease.

What was good about the place?  I like the surroundings.  The server we had was wonderful.  The staff members as a whole were wonderful I should say.  Of course, the tea would be good. (This is a tea place after all.) You are given your milk and sugar.  Oh and it is awesome that they carry jade tea, but even if your not much of a tea person, there are other drinks to choose from like coffee and hot chocolate. (Side note: for tea and coffee, I need milk and sugar, but I never put either in jade tea.)

Now, I bring out the flaws.  The place is pricey, but it's San Francisco, and adding on, I'll mention a more horrid flaw regarding money in a bit.  I know that this a tea place, but the food was lackluster.  Outside of the scones, a good amount of the food was mediocre at best.  The place is so small, I wonder how someone like Mr. Corey Maggette would manage to feel comfortable without a chair.  Parking is such a bother, but again, it's San Francisco.  I better mention now that the more horrid flaw regarding money (which I checked out just recently) is that each person must spend a little under $10 meaning that for example, if you're just by yourself, you can't just get a crumpet and milk and be good to go because you just spent $7.37 only before the tip.  Even if you add the tip, you're still under the minimum, as that's only $8.48.

I need to get a couple of notes out of the way.  Obviously, if you plan on coming here, make a reservation ahead of time.  Also, you can purchase the cups and other items.  Just go to the store across the street.

I love the atmosphere.  I love the service we received.  I don't love the lackluster food and the money issues.  Lovejoy's is a place I don't mind going to again for tea with crumpets and biscuits.  I just hope the flaws I mentioned are fixed up.

+:  The service is terrific and Lovejoy's Tea Room gets originality points for being a British tea place, a type of place you will not see often in the Bay Area or probably out west for that matter.

-:  The food is seriously lackluster overall and you figure that you get a little more out of each dollar spent.

excerpts: You get to choose several different sandwiches, spring greens, scones, shortbread, biscuits, crumpets, and spreads.
I loved the cucumber and cream cheese and apple walnut salad.
crumpets.author: Kat M.
crumpets.review:
This quaint and charming Tea room is very Victorianesque. Everything -- from the furniture to the ensembles of the waitresses, is Victorian. The place has an old feel to it. It's extremely girly, so I wouldn't recommend bringing the boys here. Make a reservation for the girls. This would be an awesome "girls day out" place to visit.

I will admit, at first glance, I didn't believe anything on the menu would fill me up. However, each item was so rich with fresh flavor and I was actually stuffed by our meal's end. A downfall -- the prices. I didn't expect tea and sandwiches to be that expensive. The way I see it is, I paid for the experience of trying something new in a great environment, where they definitely pay attention to detail and where high attentive and personable.

If it's just you and another person, order the High Tea for Two. You get to choose several different sandwiches, spring greens, scones, shortbread, biscuits, crumpets, and spreads. I loved the cucumber and cream cheese and apple walnut salad. I literally moaned when I put the crumpet topped with Devonshire cream in my mouth. It just melted...I loved that combination so much, that I went to their retail store across the street to purchase a jar. As far as teas, they offer a wide selection...I would try one from each category.

In short, try it on a Saturday or Sunday morning with girlfriends!

excerpts: I'd go all out and order the "Queen's tea," featuring the aforementioned scones, double devon cream, jam, lemon curd, variety of sandwiches (favorites: fig & olive tapenade, salmon & cream cheese, chicken w/ asparagus, & apple and stilton), crumpets, salad, fruit, petit-fours and a pot of specialty tea per person.
crumpets.author: Ravena F.
crumpets.review:
DOUBLE

DEVON

CREAM!!!

Yes, I AM shouting, and yes, it IS necessary!  Miss Lovejoy's double devon cream and berry jam on flaky, buttery scones would certainly feature on my "Last breakfast on Earth" menu.  But of course, I wouldn't stop there.  I'd go all out and order the "Queen's tea," featuring the aforementioned scones, double devon cream, jam, lemon curd, variety of sandwiches (favorites: fig & olive tapenade, salmon & cream cheese, chicken w/ asparagus, & apple and stilton), crumpets, salad, fruit, petit-fours and a pot of specialty tea per person.

Oh wait, that is what I did, just this very afternoon.  Does this mean today is my last day on Earth?  Well, it's been good.  Glad I did it in style: taking my girlfriends out to eat scrumptiously rich and satisfying food.  We ate for nearly 2 hours.  That may sound disgusting, but as a matter of fact, it was pretty - because we were so darned happy to be there, and gettin' hyphy on tea!  

Someday I want to wear a proper hat and white gloves to this place - maybe I'll wait till my hair turns a natural blue!   

Notes:
1. Do make reservations before coming.
2. They have some seasonal teas - had the chestnut black today and it was sensational.

excerpts: They provided quirky mismatched china and silver, and the selection of little crumpets, scones, and finger sandwiches was perfect.
crumpets.author: Annie D.
crumpets.review:
My friend had Lovejoy's cater her wedding, and it was the cutest luncheon idea ever. They provided quirky mismatched china and silver, and the selection of little crumpets, scones, and finger sandwiches was perfect. For a unique event I give it an A++

I've eaten there too, and it makes me wish I had a daughter or some very girly friends to share it with. It was a bit wasted on my husband and the male friends we were with. That many floral patterns and even they started craving a manicure. Next time I'll make it a girls brunch to remember. Excellent food and teas, even entice this tom boy back...

excerpts: I can't speak to the food, but crumpets with devonshire cream and curd is yum if you've never had it.
crumpets.author: Sasha T.
crumpets.review:
A great place to bring a group of girlfriends or your momma. This place is all about the experience/atmosphere. I've been going here for 10 years, and unfortunately they decided within the last 5 to have a $7.50 minimum per person- which is not cool if you're not hungry and just want tea- but i guess it's because they have limited seats.

I can't speak to the food, but crumpets with devonshire cream and curd is yum if you've never had it. Think somewhere between a panna cota and whip cream.

They also have a ribena, not sure what it's made of, but it's a cold current or berry drink that i've never seen elsewhere.

excerpts: Besides the whole parking issue, the tea, the crumpets, the finger sandwiches and all the sides were to die for, especially the scones.
Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
crumpets.author: CalBear H.
crumpets.review:
I was foolish enough to drive to Lovejoy's, do not repeat my mistake as parking in this area is like squeeze blood from stones.  Really, I really felt it was that painful and impossible.

Besides the whole parking issue, the tea, the crumpets, the finger sandwiches and all the sides were to die for, especially the scones.  Would definitely come back if I'm in the area.

excerpts: As before scones and crumpets were to die for.
I love to love LOVEJOY"s
crumpets.author: Dorothy F.
crumpets.review:
I had the pleasure of going back for my sister's b-day celebration.  

Just as charming and enjoyable as before.  Ironically, our server was Sarah again who is adorably sweet and a great server.  We all had the Queen's tea and sampled each other's endless pots of tea.  This time I chose the Apricot which had a nice soothing flavor.  

At this visit I sampled a couple of different sandwiches (since there were 7 of us), all super delicious: 

-chicken and asparagus ( chunks of asparagus)
-artichoke hummus
-lovejoy's special (a must try)
-ham w/english mustard ( nice dose of spicy mustard)

As before scones and crumpets were to die for.  I love to love LOVEJOY"s

excerpts: So the idea of sitting down ON PURPOSE and have tea and crumpets is a little over the top for me.
I still think having tea and crumpets is over the top.
crumpets.author: Heather L.
crumpets.review:
Let me start by saying that I'm not a tea drinker. I'm not a coffee drinker either. So the idea of sitting down ON PURPOSE and have tea and crumpets is a little over the top for me. 

However, I made a visit recently when my best friend's bridal shower was hosted there. Such a cute place. Our server was oh so cute and sweet. She clearly explained how to make the most of our experience there and gave tons of great suggestions on what kinds of teas, sandwiches and desserts to order. It ended up being a really nice time and I will definitely go again. Well, I'll go when the occasion calls for it. I still think having tea and crumpets is over the top.

excerpts: I came thinking that perhaps I'd need lunch afterwards, but those teeny tiny sandwiches are surprisingly filling - you get a choice of 6 different kinds of sandwiches for the Queen's High Tea (we chose cucumber + cream cheese; shrimp + mayo; roast beef with horseradish crme; pear & stilton; egg salad; smoked salmon + cream cheese), light salad; a scone with double cream and preserves, cookies, crumpets and petit fours
crumpets.author: Claudine C.
crumpets.review:
4.5 stars...

Another bachelorette party highlight, this was the last stop of our weekend.   My girls thought of everything and ordered a "Queen's Tea" which included, for our table of 11, 3 enormous tiers of food. I came thinking that perhaps I'd need lunch afterwards, but those teeny tiny sandwiches are surprisingly filling - you get a choice of 6 different kinds of sandwiches for the Queen's High Tea (we chose cucumber + cream cheese; shrimp + mayo; roast beef with horseradish crme; pear & stilton; egg salad; smoked salmon + cream cheese), light salad; a scone with double cream and preserves, cookies, crumpets and petit fours... I was so full that I could not bring myself to finish my petit-four; several girls agreed likewise, and I got to take what was not consumed home.

All in all, a very delightful place to visit - the places settings are charmingly mismatched hodge-podge china pieces, service is exceptional and yes, their chestnut tea is one of the most beautifully unusual tastes you'll encounter.  I wish they had some for us to purchase and take home.

excerpts: I took my BFF here to celebrate her impending nuptials, and we were very elegant and refined, except when we were moaning over delicious crumpets and jam with fresh cream or cooing and giggling like little girls at the lovely little petit fours that look like tiny, tiny gifts wrapped in sugary frosting just for us.
crumpets.author: Amie S.
crumpets.review:
Pinkies up, ladies! If ever there was a time for daintiness, it is here in the cute, cozy, eclectically cluttered warmth of Lovejoy's tea room. I took my BFF here to celebrate her impending nuptials, and we were very elegant and refined, except when we were moaning over delicious crumpets and jam with fresh cream or cooing and giggling like little girls at the lovely little petit fours that look like tiny, tiny gifts wrapped in sugary frosting just for us. 

The atmosphere at Lovejoys is relaxed and comfortable, with mismatched china and tables covered in lace and floral tablecloths. Things could get tacky and grandmother-y pretty easily with too much of either of those things, but here it is pulled off perfectly and is nothing but charming. Lovejoy's charm is no secret, either - be sure to call ahead for a reservation or risk gazing in at the loveliness from a lonely street corner!

If you're looking for tea for more than two, this is also a great place to throw a party. They are happy to host your birthday party, baby shower, wedding shower, etc. You can even have a psychic on hand to read your tea leaves! Is another visit to Lovejoy's in my future? I sure hope so!

excerpts: Btw, love those CRUMPETS!!!
crumpets.author: Grace D.
crumpets.review:
I completely agree with a lot of the reviews about this place...

This is my VERY FIRST TIME to do tea and I wouldn't have tried it unless my sis in law invited me to go for one and I LOVED IT!  I also think that it helped that we picked the right place, for me being a "first-timer."  

I loved the ambiance and just that old rustic english country side feel "thingy" which definitely helped my appetite and my willingness to drink black tea with milk...(before, I was like..."huh? milk in tea? unheard of")...and now I'm a convert.  Service was great and super friendly. I was skeptical about how they served the sandwiches (being so small because of English culture being so dainty and "lady-ish...) but surprisingly enough, the quality and taste of the food served together with our tea was exceptional and it was enough to fill me up.  We had the Tea for Two and just PERFECT...we left the place not feeling overly indulged...

I would love to try it again and this time will be bringing my daughter in.  Who knows, if she likes it, we might have a small birthday get-together here again.  Btw, love those CRUMPETS!!!"

excerpts: Everything from the ham/mustard sandwiches, crumpets to the scones were beyond delicious (a VERY dangerous place for those on a perpetual diet, like me).
The lemon curd was near-orgasmic!
Best of all, the pot of vanilla rooibos really sent me over the top.
The incredible aroma aroused an urge to drink in as much as possible...
I even considered eating the teapot, or at least lick the strainer (I did neither).
Hours of fun and conversation with friends/family, a bona fide San Franciscan past time.
crumpets.author: Peter C.
crumpets.review: The only thing missing from today's tea were fancy hats for the ladies, and tall top hats for the gents!  Everything from the ham/mustard sandwiches, crumpets to the scones were beyond delicious (a VERY dangerous place for those on a perpetual diet, like me). The lemon curd was near-orgasmic!  Best of all, the pot of vanilla rooibos really sent me over the top.  The incredible aroma aroused an urge to drink in as much as possible... I even considered eating the teapot, or at least lick the strainer (I did neither).  Hours of fun and conversation with friends/family, a bona fide San Franciscan past time.

excerpts: The dining portions were more than generous - hearty, dainty tea sandwiches on a bed of mixed greens w/walnuts and mandarins and balsamic dijon vinaigrette, fresh fruits, warm scones, shortbread tea biscuits, warm crumpets, lemon curd, strawberry preserves and petits fours!
Strawberries, blueberries, pineapples, scones - you name it
, I spread cream on it.
crumpets.author: Olma M.
crumpets.review:
Absolutely splendid, lovely, quaint and all-around wonderful tea room.  Attended a birthday tea party here and just loved it.  We were a party of 15 on a bustling sunny Saturday afternoon/evening (4-6 p.m.).

The dining portions were more than generous - hearty, dainty tea sandwiches on a bed of mixed greens w/walnuts and mandarins and balsamic dijon vinaigrette, fresh fruits, warm scones, shortbread tea biscuits, warm crumpets, lemon curd, strawberry preserves and petits fours!  

Oh, and step away from the Double Devon cream, because seriously, as my friend Sarah says, "EVERYTHING is better with cream." And at this place, you may as well take it in intravenously.  Strawberries, blueberries, pineapples, scones - you name it, I spread cream on it.  And yes, they sell this stuff, too - don't even bother looking at the nutritional value (I use the word "value" lightly).

The tea service was prompt and lovely and everything was described to us as they were served.  We had a relatively spacious layout in the back of the bustling tearoom, but it all felt very cozy.

Customer service was extremely personable, professional and warm.  The minute I walked in/out, I was making making a mental list of others with whom I would love to experience Lovejoy's again.  Very old school, English tea vibe with a quaint "attic" just across the street where they sell many of their wares and teas.

I think this statement from their website sums it up rather well: "...our tea room reflects the diversity of San Francisco, blending together the traditions of tea service with an eclectic, quirky and playful spirit."

excerpts: Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.
And I have (to date)
crumpets.author: Joanna R.
crumpets.review:
I've been to this place since it was at the other location on 24th and Church.  Since then I have moved out of San Francisco, but I still occasionally return to this tea shop!!!  Their sandwiches and teas are wonderful.  Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.  And I have (to date) NEVER left the place hungry!

Note: Block off two hours for this experience of having a nice, easy comfortable tea and get away from civilization!!!  You *deserve* it!  (Also, make sure you go on a day when it's typical foggy San Francisco too!)

Of course, I can only go here with a female friend.  The decor is too "feminine" for my "macho" hubby to feel comfortable, even though he LOVES tea!  That's okay though...more finger sandwiches and Tea Room Blend tea for ME!!!  :-P~~ *evil grin*

excerpts: If you love tea, sandwiches, and have never had crumpets, you're in for a real treat.
crumpets.author: cat g.
crumpets.review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?? Been here more than just a few times, my husband likes it too - he never wanted to come in the first place thinking he would starve to death but the food choices aren't bad and you *can* have a real lunch here and leave with a happy, full stomach. Just don't look at the bill. Anyway, all the tea connoisseurs out there will say that the authenticity of the tea experience here isn't quite authentic. But it comes close. Darn close. Close enough where if you know the real deal about tea you'll complain. But that just means it's cuz they're thisclose to the way it should be! Ok, soapbox aside, the devonshire cream and lemon curd is to die for, and if you can spring for it have the 'high tea for two' or the 'queen's tea'. If you love tea, sandwiches, and have never had crumpets, you're in for a real treat. 

Oh, and PS - it's all STREET PARKING only. Don't forget to call for a reservation or you'll be waiting outside for a while during their busier times.

excerpts: (SO FRICKING GOOD), petit fours, fresh fruit, crumpets, and two pots of bottomless tea.
We went for the tea house blend (which is very similar to Irish breakfast) and the dragon well with pomegranate leaves.
We spent about two and a half hours enjoying the atmosphere, the delicious food, and tea.
The service and staff are amazing!
They kept warming up or adding hot water to our tea and making sure we were satisfied.
Of the sandwiches, chicken asparagus was definitely both our favorites, but everything was miniature, bit-size, and tasty.
I LOVED it!
Lovejoy's is definitely kind of expensive, but it's well worth going all out rather than trying to get the cheapest options.
Plus, it's a place to sit and enjoy the ambiance for a while, to catch up and chat.
I will definitely be coming here again!
crumpets.author: Jing P.
crumpets.review: This place....is perfection. There's an assortment of really cute and quirky wooden chairs, tables, and china and it's just oh-so-charming. When you make a reservation, they reserve a table that says "Reserved for Royalty/Queens/etc" which is the cutest thing ever. Also, always make a reservation, even if it doesn't seem like it would be a busy day. My friend and I got the Queen's tea, which included sandwiches, scones with jam and clotted cream (SO FRICKING GOOD), petit fours, fresh fruit, crumpets, and two pots of bottomless tea. We went for the tea house blend (which is very similar to Irish breakfast) and the dragon well with pomegranate leaves. We spent about two and a half hours enjoying the atmosphere, the delicious food, and tea. The service and staff are amazing! They kept warming up or adding hot water to our tea and making sure we were satisfied. Of the sandwiches, chicken asparagus was definitely both our favorites, but everything was miniature, bit-size, and tasty. I LOVED it! Lovejoy's is definitely kind of expensive, but it's well worth going all out rather than trying to get the cheapest options. Plus, it's a place to sit and enjoy the ambiance for a while, to catch up and chat. I will definitely be coming here again!

excerpts: My gf and I enjoy afternoon tea, sammiches and crumpets and so far
Lovejoy's ranks #1 on our list.
We tried a few other places in the East Bay, and although the tea selection is not unique to Lovejoy's, the food definitely is.
Their menu selections far exceed anyone's expectations thinking they cannot get full from tea & crumpets.
crumpets.author: Aurelie N.
crumpets.review:
The best tea spot EVER!

My gf and I enjoy afternoon tea, sammiches and crumpets and so far Lovejoy's ranks #1 on our list.  We tried a few other places in the East Bay, and although the tea selection is not unique to Lovejoy's, the food definitely is.  Their menu selections far exceed anyone's expectations thinking they cannot get full from tea & crumpets.  Believe you me, when you order the "Queen's Tea" service - you'll walk out feeling quite content.

Ask any of my gf's (girl & guy friends) - I'm always raving about this place and it is evidenced by the fact that I'm here every other month! LOL!

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea along with crumpets & petit fours.
It was a very relaxing 2 hrs, & was hard to leave.
crumpets.author: Pam R.
crumpets.review: I've been a fan of Lovejoy's since its original location @ Church/24th Sts. Great place to take my Mom when she visited from NY. About 3 mos ago 3 friends & myself went to Lovejoy's. We got there early thinking there might be a place for us. However, we just missed out as the tearoom was packed.  One of the owners was very accommodating & said for us to come back in about 45 minutes: there would be  table for us.  Sure enough, there was  Very nice table set-up. Excellent service. We ordered the High Tea along with crumpets & petit fours.  It was a very relaxing 2 hrs, & was hard to leave.

excerpts: we got all lady-liked-up for some tea and yummy crumpets...
crumpets.author: becky f.
crumpets.review:
perfect place to bring my bridesmaids!  we got all lady-liked-up for some tea and yummy crumpets... it was the most ideal setting to start the chaos that is wedding planning!

at about $16-17 each, i was able to treat everyone out to one of the best tea experience around... 
-no too stuffy
-great selection of sandwiches
-huge list of teas
-friendly servers dressed in the most adorable outfits
-cutesy and dainty tea sets that you can even purchase!
-awesome website to plan ahead:)

we were lucky to get the large window seating area for more privacy and a nice view of the street.  loved the atmosphere and food... we were seriously stuffed after the first few courses! 
can't wait to go back!!  it'll be my go-to tea house with special guests and possibly my future daughter!  holy crap!!!  i love this place so much that i'm thinking that far in advance!

excerpts: Fruit, coleslaw, crumpets, tea biscuits, and dessert.
I wish I could eat them all.
The Lady Grey tea (not on the menu) was really good.
crumpets.author: joanna c.
crumpets.review:
Wow!
Came here with 3 other girls (the place is packed with women). We each had the Queen's Tea.

1. The warm scones with lemon curd and cream was divine (and I've never described anything as divine in my life)
2. Had the  Smoked salmon with Cream Cheese and the Chicken apple walnut tea sandwich (How can I go back to eating bread crust ever again?)
3. I also tasted my friend's cheese and chutney (a little too strong for me)
4. There was A LOT of food. Fruit, coleslaw, crumpets, tea biscuits, and dessert. I wish I could eat them all. 
5. The Lady Grey tea (not on the menu) was really good. Earl Grey with Mango! 

Will definitely go back for more.

excerpts: My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied.
We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches.
Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up.
The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd.
They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish.
crumpets.author: Phoi B.
crumpets.review:
Tea, cuteness, and mini-sandwiches... this place is right up my alley. 

Lovejoy's is a quaint little tea room that offers a variety of teas (duh!), sandwiches, and sweets. My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied. We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches. Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up. The scones were yummy with the preserves and double devon cream. The teas we had were the Apricot black tea and the special during that time, which I don't really remember. The teas were nice and went well with our food, but nothing too exciting. The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd. They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish. Mmm : 9

Being in this place made me feel warm and giddy. I would definitely recommend Lovejoy's and hope to make a trip back there soon!

excerpts:
We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.
Everything was spectacular.

My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-

radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.
crumpets.author: Carmen H.
crumpets.review:
I'm no newcomer to afternoon tea, having even
experienced three in London - at the Ritz, the Savoy
and at Brown's.  Less than thirty minutes drive from
my Daly City home, I'm delighted to have experienced
Lovejoy's, at the recommendation of a dear friend
and colleague who has long been insisting that we
go there.

We recently treated another colleague for her birthday
and totally indulged.  What a lovely afternoon!!  We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.  Everything was spectacular.  My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-
radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.  The scones, topped with clotted cream and 
lemon curd, though laden with calories, were devilishly
delightful.

At the end of our feast, we were served some scrumptious petit 
fours, followed by more tea, and happily waddled our way into the afternoon.

I purchased the beautiful strawberry teapot that held my
passionfruit tea....everything there is practically for sale...
at the teahouse or in their gift shop across the street.

Lovejoy's is a special place for an afternoon with the 
girls or one of the guys who appreciates some place 
special and unique.

excerpts: The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . .

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.
crumpets.author: Audrey S.
crumpets.review:
I feel very girlie when I come to this place for tea. It's very charming, very feminine. Shawls are thrown over couches -or on the flowery upholstered chairs, lace dollies are scattered here and there, and you drink from delicate tea cups, and eat tiny sandwiches (with the crust taken off). I like that the furniture and even the tea wear is mismatched. Sort of what one might expect in granny's old house. 

For me, the place feels like what I imagined when I had my tea parties as a young child. Well, except for the fact that the food and tea are real and so are the people (no, Mr. Brown Bear or Mrs. Rabbit in attendance). 

But Lovejoy's  can get stuffy. The place is always packed with people. The hot pots of tea also add to the temperature a bit. Reservations are HIGHLY suggested!

Anyway, I love the fact that this quiant place will "top off" your tea pot, thus insuring a very HOT pot of tea. The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . . gosh, everything is delicious.  

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.

It's a wonderful place to get away from it all and relax.

excerpts: I filled up on little tea sandwiches, crumpets, scones, etc etc etc.
The Queen's tea was a good amount of food and let you sample a variety of things.
mmmmmmmm
The service was friendly, refilled our pots often and with a smile, and didn't kill me when my purse was constantly in their way (my bad :( )
crumpets.author: Tara O.
crumpets.review:
Freaking adorable. Seriously. 

I came here with two girlfriends for some tea and catch up time. What more could you ask for from a tea house? I filled up on little tea sandwiches, crumpets, scones, etc etc etc. The Queen's tea was a good amount of food and let you sample a variety of things. mmmmmmmm :) The service was friendly, refilled our pots often and with a smile, and didn't kill me when my purse was constantly in their way (my bad :( ) A little on the pricey side, but really aren't high teas supposed to be decadent anyway?

Warning: girls, unless you want to break up with him, please don't bring your boyfriend here. Or a date, or a male for that matter that won't appreciate the cutesy girly factor. He will not enjoy it. The frills will kill him. Trust me.

excerpts: They were good about swapping out crumpets instead.
The tea is great.
And why else would you go for afternoon tea if you don't enjoy great tea?
crumpets.author: vickie j.
crumpets.review:
I often have a birthday tea here. They're good for accomadating my group though they limit it to 25 people.  Their scones are good, though they have eggs in them so I can't eat them anymore. They were good about swapping out crumpets instead. 
The tea is great. And why else would you go for afternoon tea if you don't enjoy great tea?

excerpts: frankly, I don't care for the fruit or the crumpets and if you change your mind and want a petit four, it can be added on for an additional $2.50.
crumpets.author: Raquel U.
crumpets.review:
I absolutely adore this place!!  After hearing so many good things, my mom and I decided to throw my sister a bridal tea party here last October.  From the moment we walked in, every aspect of the tea service did not disappoint.  Considering there were 13 of us, the service was prompt and definitely on point and we never had to ask for a HOT pot of tea as they were constantly topping off our pots.  What a concept!

Since that first experience, I've been here numerous times and I never get tired of it.  The mismatched furniture, dishes, tea cups and teapots... the lace and doilies... the variety of sandwiches... the salad... the coleslaw... the SCONES with double devon cream and jam... the shortbread cookies... and of course, the bottomless pots of hot tea.  Heavenly!

My favorite is the High Tea, which comes with all that I mentioned above.  I've had the Queen's Tea but frankly, I don't care for the fruit or the crumpets and if you change your mind and want a petit four, it can be added on for an additional $2.50.  I highly recommend the Vanilla Rooibos tea - my absolute favorite and I actually don't even ask for anything else anymore.  

Although it may not sound like it, you will get full off of what appears to be a petite meal.  The best part is that it's not that greasy, gross full but a satisfactory full.  You will definitely want to call in advance to make reservations.  They do have some open seating but it's first come first served and it fills up quick.  Be sure to plan to spend at least 1 1/2-2 hours - the service is not slow but you'll find yourself taking your time to savor the tea and food and enjoy the company you're with.  

Have I mentioned how much I adore this place?!

excerpts: My advice, get the High Tea (you're going to want the two sandwiches for sure) and split an order of crumpets with your favorite ladies.
Don't forget to ask for extra Devon cream.
crumpets.author: Jane K.
crumpets.review: I've been imbibing on tea ever since I can remember. My favorites are fennel-infused and sage (not together). After leaving home and not having Mom to steep tea for me, I went through a stint of settling on tea bags. Since moving to San Francisco, I graduated to loose-leaf and tea rooms. Lovejoy's is probably my favorite tea room in the area. I've enjoyed many girls' outings here as it would be remiss to bring a guy to these establishments.  I appreciate the quirkiness of the space staying true to its antique shop past, the 'Reserved for the Queen' sign that secured our table and the aromatic tea selections that can be enjoyed without having to mask the taste with sugar and cream. My advice, get the High Tea (you're going to want the two sandwiches for sure) and split an order of crumpets with your favorite ladies. Don't forget to ask for extra Devon cream.

excerpts: For me the only misstep are the crumpets-which come straight from Safeway.
If whomever bakes their scones would make the crumpets as well, I'd move in.
crumpets.author: Jordan J.
crumpets.review: A fabulous brit feast. The food is excellent and the decor is just hokey enough to be fun. Their scones are the best I've ever had - not these dry, sandy triangles with miserly flecks of dried fruit which you find in most bakeries.  These are light, moist biscuity things with juicy raisins and currants tucked inside. Their sandwiches (crust free, of course) are also great. For me the only misstep are the crumpets-which come straight from Safeway. If whomever bakes their scones would make the crumpets as well, I'd move in.

excerpts: I mean, who the heck cares about tea, crumpets, and cucumber sandwiches (on "wonderbread") with crusts cut off?
FROU FROU.
I have to admit, I did enjoy the surprisingly tasty edibles.
The tea was okay and most of the food was really good.
I ended up having a good time there with friends Polly Prissypants and Clyde Frog.
Yay.
crumpets.author: Animal K.
crumpets.review:
I really didn't want to come here, what with doilies, china, and chintz everywhere, but friends dragged me there kicking and screaming.   I mean, who the heck cares about tea, crumpets, and cucumber sandwiches (on "wonderbread") with crusts cut off?  FROU FROU. 

I have to admit, I did enjoy the surprisingly tasty edibles.  The tea was okay and most of the food was really good.   I ended up having a good time there with friends Polly Prissypants and Clyde Frog.  Yay.

excerpts: and it comes with assortments of tiny sandwiched, fruit, salad, crumpets, cakes, etc.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
crumpets.author: EM F.
crumpets.review:
SO CUTE.
this is the best place in the city to go with some girlfriends on a lazy afternoon when you have TONS to gossip about. 
its pure delightful girl-time. the tables and settings are all mismatched and adorable and the homebaked goods that come on the trays are DELICIOUS.
queens tea is by the best and it comes with assortments of tiny sandwiched, fruit, salad, crumpets, cakes, etc. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

excerpts: Don't miss the crumpets.
Mmm..crumpets.
With jam and Devonshire cream!
crumpets.author: Ms. Q.
crumpets.review:
Best tea sandwiches in the city, hands down.  I've been to the Ritz, the Palace, etc, and this place takes the proverbial cake. Don't miss the crumpets.  Mmm..crumpets. With jam and Devonshire cream! Your inner anglophile would be so pleased.  

Plus, the staff was kind enough to accomodate a to-go order on a busy Sunday, only gently asking me to order at least a day in advance next time (note taken) without being the least bit bitchy about it.  I left with a platter full of tea sandwiches (covered in moist towelettes to keep them from drying), and even extra thinly sliced cucumbers for garnish. Wow, how nice.  I also usually pick up their tea room blend at the shop across the street. I think you get a discount if you take tea at the shop, and their black teas are extra fine so it takes less time for me to get a good, strong steep. 

If you know someone who'd appreciate some tasty, dainty sammiches but can't deal with the frou setting, a takeaway order would do nicely as it can be enjoyed in a more man-friendly setting. Just remember to order at least a day in advance.

excerpts: The scones, crumpets, and clotted cream are always top-notch, the service bright and helpful, and the decor is as cute as it gets.
I can't recommend this place enough if you're after an unapologetically girly indulgence.
crumpets.author: Alissa L.
crumpets.review: Wonderful is the only way to describe each visit to Lovejoys! As a huge fan of English tea, nothing gets the fix like a pot of Lovejoys blackcurrant. Indulging for a spot of cream tea is something I didn't think I'd get to do again after moving back to the US from England. The scones, crumpets, and clotted cream are always top-notch, the service bright and helpful, and the decor is as cute as it gets. I can't recommend this place enough if you're after an unapologetically girly indulgence.

excerpts: We got the Queen's Tea which came with plenty of tea, sandwiches, salad, scones and crumpets to fill us up.
The space was super adorable and was a perfect place to catch up with the girls.
crumpets.author: Stacy L.
crumpets.review: Had a girls' only tea party here for a 30th birthday party and even as grown women, we loved it! We got the Queen's Tea which came with plenty of tea, sandwiches, salad, scones and crumpets to fill us up. The space was super adorable and was a perfect place to catch up with the girls.

excerpts: Great value, real pleasure in the scones, crumpets, lemon curd!
Pleasant altho loud atmosphere.
Could use a second bathroom, for sure!
Kinda crowded at Christmas - but a great place for Afternoon Tea.
I am looking forward to another visit - good looking pub food on other half of menu!
Will be making this an annual or more visit!
Atmosphere real - not a candy cane, or Alice in Wonderland, like some places turn into.
Able to stuff both sexes equally, with satisfaction all around!
crumpets.author: Christie L.
crumpets.review: Great value, real pleasure in the scones, crumpets, lemon curd! Pleasant altho loud atmosphere. Could use a second bathroom, for sure! Kinda crowded at Christmas - but a great place for Afternoon Tea.  I am looking forward to another visit - good looking pub food on other half of menu!  Will be making this an annual or more visit!  Atmosphere real - not a candy cane, or Alice in Wonderland, like some places turn into. Able to stuff both sexes equally, with satisfaction all around!

excerpts: My friends and I shared the Queen's tea (complete with scones, crumpets, salad, sandwiches and lots more) and I think it was enough for 2 people.
I had scones with raisins and strawberry preserves.
crumpets.author: Roland R.
crumpets.review:
My friends and I came across this place on yelp and decided to try it because it has better reviews than other places like Crown & Crumpet.

Note that their last seating is at 4.30-5pm.

The place was very well decorated. There were antique sofas and mirrors. They had cute little trinkets and even a red telephone booth display! It had a vintage feel to it.
The tea sets and plates were also beautiful, but strangely, they were mismatched. Hmmm
Anyway, it's still a good place for snacks, to hang out and relax.

My friends and I shared the Queen's tea (complete with scones, crumpets, salad, sandwiches and lots more) and I think it was enough for 2 people. We ended up paying $15 each.

I like it that they had a great selection of teas and sandwiches (check out the menu on their website). I tried the peach and china rose tea and for sandwiches, smoked salmon and pear & Stilton.  The teas were very fragrant and the sandwiches were pretty good even though they were so small. I had scones with raisins and strawberry preserves. It was heavenly!

The people who worked there were very welcoming, exceptionally patient and friendly. I really enjoyed the experience and I really recommend Lovejoy's!

excerpts: the tea includes: coleslaw, spring greens, scones, crumpets, cookies, fruit, sandwiches, and various teas (i tried to rooibos, chestnut, and a black over the course of the tea.)
crumpets.author: Jill k.
crumpets.review:
ever wonder what it would feel like to live in a victorian dollhouse?

well, wonder no more, for lovejoy's is here, the most adorably quirky teahouse in sf!

my friend's bridal shower was here, so we went all out with the queen's tea.  the tea includes: coleslaw, spring greens, scones, crumpets, cookies, fruit, sandwiches, and various teas (i tried to rooibos, chestnut, and a black over the course of the tea.)

everything was beautifully presented (i love the mismatched china and teaware!), the service was beyond personable and friendly, and everything, above all, tasted great.

so, whether for a bridal shower, an intimate brunch option, or a quiet afternoon for yourself, consider lovejoy's!  it is a true treat!

excerpts: Prompt, friendly service, delicious tea and crumpets, and a cozy atmosphere, all make lovejoy's the destination spot for my friends and I, whenever we are celebrating!!
crumpets.author: E. v.
crumpets.review: I have been to lovejoy's several times over the last few years, and it has never let me down. Prompt, friendly service, delicious tea and crumpets, and a cozy atmosphere, all make lovejoy's the destination spot for my friends and I, whenever we are celebrating!!

excerpts: While you scarf up this bounty, over extend your bladder, and whittle away at your manhood, the waitstaff will come by to give you warm crumpets.
Crumpets serve as another vessel for the toppings on tier two.
crumpets.author: Aaron M.
crumpets.review:
I'm a fancy boy - I love Lovejoys.  Yes this 6 foot tall, 200 lbs, one time varsity athlete (now just a weekend warrior) loves his lemon curd and warm scones.  Mmm...cry havoc and set free the drool!

High tea here is unpretentious and delicious.  More important to the last vestiges of my masculinity, it is filling and plate lickingly delicious.  Ok, so Lovejoys has far more doilies than a man should volunteer to be around, but the Queen's tea is outstanding enough to get me to turn in my man-card for an afternoon of finger sandwiches every time.  

Men this is how it works when you get the Queen's tea (my recommendation).  First, you get an endless pot of tea (which means I drink several pots without realizing it and spend the rest of the day peeing) and choice of a pair of finger sandwich flavors.   I like egg and onion and pear and gorgonzola the best, but I've had almost every flavor and they are great (although the shrimp one is a bit cat-foody).  The sandwiches come cut in little triangles, but you get a bunch of them so it's satisfying and delicious.  This is all served on a three tiered silver platter/tower, in which the top tier is covered in fruits and the second tier is where the real goodness hides.  Tier two has the warm scones (soft, hot and with raisins) on which you have the option of spreading clotted cream (think super-thick whipped cream), lemon curd (FANTASTIC), and/or fresh berry preserves (highly recommended to combine with the clotted cream).  There are also shortbread cookies in case your heart needed more butter and sugar.  The sandwiches are on their three, along with salad greens and some dressing.  

While you scarf up this bounty, over extend your bladder, and whittle away at your manhood, the waitstaff will come by to give you warm crumpets.  Crumpets serve as another vessel for the toppings on tier two.  At this point in your meal when you should be wrestling with, "I'm a man, I had high tea, I'm full, I think like being fancy... this is so confusing," the waitstaff will come out with petit-fours as a knockout blow.  Think bite sized cake.

To survive Lovejoys use my trick to maintaining the illusion of masculinity: take the women in your life here to celebrate their live events / hollidays.  They will love it, you get to eat the goodness and you can tell your buddies you were forced to go because it was your wife's birthday, because your sister had a wedding shower, etc.  Little will they know that you've turned into a fancy boy just like me.  

p.s. If you are going here, always have a reservation.

excerpts: Doily-covered sofas, crumpets with cream, mismatched antique china, and hostesses in frilly aprons...a perfect setting for bridal & baby showers, or an afternoon with the girls.
Boys, beware; there's enough estrogen in this room to widen your hips....
crumpets.author: Alison C.
crumpets.review: Doily-covered sofas, crumpets with cream, mismatched antique china, and hostesses in frilly aprons...a perfect setting for bridal & baby showers, or an afternoon with the girls.  Boys, beware; there's enough estrogen in this room to widen your hips....(or is that from the cookies?)...but the brave are rewarded with sandwiches of fig & olive tapenade, and steaming scones with jam.

excerpts: We ordered high tea which came with teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, cookies, and more!
It was a tower of food!
OH, they also had fruits as well.
Their teas were delicous, some teas had very strong aromas, some are just right, and my silly me just ordered green tea!
It tasted just like any other green teas, but the other teas that I tasted were good!
You have to make reservations because they book up and they close early, too.
Great place to take your lovely mothers, grandmothers, and of course with your girlfriends, maybe a gay friend, and boys are very limited here!
crumpets.author: Jojo N.
crumpets.review: This place is so precious! I love trying new things! My friends and I came here for a gf's birthday! We ordered high tea which came with teas, scones, crumpets, sandwiches, cookies, and more! It was a tower of food! OH, they also had fruits as well. Their teas were delicous, some teas had very strong aromas, some are just right, and my silly me just ordered green tea! It tasted just like any other green teas, but the other teas that I tasted were good! You have to make reservations because they book up and they close early, too. Great place to take your lovely mothers, grandmothers, and of course with your girlfriends, maybe a gay friend, and boys are very limited here!

excerpts: At Lovejoy's, I enjoyed all of the above, minus the watercress and mannerly fashion, but plus the following: cheddar and chutney sandwiches, delicious coleslaw (really it was exceptional - how many people can say that about coleslaw?), ripe melon and berries, shortbread, crumpets, and petit fours.
I think at some point I emitted a very lady-like "Oink.

"
All-in-all, a very civilized afternoon.
Just don't go here if you have an irrational fear of doilies.
crumpets.author: Delilah P.
crumpets.review:
This place made me miss my Grannie. She was a buttery old Scottish lady who introduced me at a tender age to the delights of afternoon tea. Sitting on a puffy little tuffet, daintily munching on crustless lil' sandwiches stuffed with cream cheese, cucumbers, watercress, and other assorted goodies. Slathering crispy, delicate scones with fluffy Devon cream and lemon curd. And getting totally cracked-out on sugary  Darjeeling tea while learning how to conduct myself in a mannerly fashion. 
At Lovejoy's, I enjoyed all of the above, minus the watercress and mannerly fashion, but plus the following: cheddar and chutney sandwiches, delicious coleslaw (really it was exceptional - how many people can say that about coleslaw?), ripe melon and berries, shortbread, crumpets, and petit fours. I think at some point I emitted a very lady-like "Oink."
All-in-all, a very civilized afternoon. Just don't go here if you have an irrational fear of doilies.

excerpts: This place should be for special occasions because its so special, but its hard not to go there often for lotsa tea and some yummy sandwiches and crumpets.
As a vegetarian there are many options for sandwiches that are deliciousness, their service is great, and atmosphere is fun.
I go here with my boyfriend and we enjoy sipping here for a while.
We have never made a reservation and have always found the wait not too bad, but would probably make a reservation in the future because you never know.
This place is cozy and beloved.
crumpets.author: Sari G.
crumpets.review: This place should be for special occasions because its so special, but its hard not to go there often for lotsa tea and some yummy sandwiches and crumpets. As a vegetarian there are many options for sandwiches that are deliciousness, their service is great, and atmosphere is fun. I go here with my boyfriend and we enjoy sipping here for a while. We have never made a reservation and have always found the wait not too bad, but would probably make a reservation in the future because you never know. This place is cozy and beloved.

excerpts: The sandwiches are delicious and the crumpets to die for!
It may not sound filling - but make sure your appetites are in tact because you shouldn't underestimate how filling everything is!
crumpets.author: Anne M.
crumpets.review: I love the frilly afternoon tea!  It's such a cute spot. The tea sets never match but it's precious that way. there is a wide array of teas you can choose from.  The sandwiches are delicious and the crumpets to die for! It may not sound filling - but make sure your appetites are in tact because you shouldn't underestimate how filling everything is!

excerpts: I loved the mini sandwiches and the crumpets!
A perfect place to get together and gab with the girls!
crumpets.author: Lisa K.
crumpets.review: I went for a bridal shower on Saturday. The service was very accommodating and friendly. Everything was excellent! I had the spearmint green tea and the amount of food they bring you is a great deal for the price. Yum...I loved the mini sandwiches and the crumpets! A perfect place to get together and gab with the girls!

excerpts: Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us.
The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way).
crumpets.author: Aisha W.
crumpets.review:
This tearoom is wonderful! Reservations are a must but considering they have a cancellation wait list, this is a piece of cake! Despite the message machine saying they were fully booked for the weekend, I left a message including dates and times - requesting placement on the wait list - and my call was returned within hours! I immediately had a reservation and when another engagement popped up, rescheduling was super easy! Actually, I had to reschedule twice...but the woman returning my calls never expressed frustration at all!

So our tea date arrived and my mother and I happened to show up 10 minutes before our reservation. We found a parking spot immediately (perhaps it being 4PM helped) and were seated at once. A minute later, another woman asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we weren't because we were so busy taking pictures of the cute sign on our table that said Reserved for Royalty and were also settling into our lovely seats by the window! The room was packed with mismatched couches, chairs, tables, teacups, teapots and decor but this made it so much more comfortable. I felt I could talk as loud as I wanted, spill tea, whatever, and no one would notice. We finally decided on Queen's Tea (for two) and from the lengthy sandwich list, chose the chicken apple walnut, cucumber and cream cheese, pear and stilton cheese, and bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches. They were all deliciously different in their own ways, however, my favorite was the bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwich. With the help of our patient server, we picked Taylor's Tea Room Blend and Yorkshire Gold and both were perfectly flavorful. We shared both teas and ironically ended up preferring the one the other picked. To every cup we added cream and sugar and seriously, I couldn't stop drinking. It didn't help that our tea pots were refilled every 10 minutes! Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us. The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way). 

Because I had so much tea, I had to use the restroom 4 times in an hour! After my mother and I left the tea room to check out their antique store, the Attic, I had to use the restroom again! Since Lovejoy's was closed, I didn't want to try using their restroom and I would've gone to a gas station but my mom was driving and refused to make another stop. So I went back to the tea room and surprisingly, the staff was so nice and didn't mind at all! Not even hints of irritation!

Definitely going back soon!!!

excerpts: Scones are heavenly right out of the oven, crumpets a delight and service incredible.
Teas are lovely and a good variety.
Dessert was perfect.
I wish I could eat there once a month.
A great value for the money.
I would reccomend reservations even though they save some small tables for walk ins.
crumpets.author: Sherene K.
crumpets.review: This is the tea experience. I have been doing teas and tea rooms since I was young and this is far the most memorable. Went there during the holidays with friends and really enjoyed it. Sandwiches are outstanding with lots of choices even for us vegetarians. Fruit, salad and quiches are very fresh. Scones are heavenly right out of the oven, crumpets a delight and service incredible. Teas are lovely and a good variety. Dessert was perfect. I wish I could eat there once a month. A great value for the money. I would reccomend reservations even though they save some small tables for walk ins.

excerpts: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office
and I have to say their food is delicious.
This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream.
Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.
crumpets.author: Jelly F.
crumpets.review: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office and I have to say their food is delicious. This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream. Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.

excerpts: Our waitress was great and very informative, since we've never been there before and had little experience with crumpets.
crumpets.author: Rei and Rick ..
crumpets.review: A couple of my friends and I had our annual Christmas lunch here, for the first time and it was such a wonderful experience (for the little girls at heart).  We had to do a prix fix menu, which was fine because the variety of food and tea that came out was divine.  We had a great time and a lot of conversation was about the food (in a good way).  Looking around at the other tables, it was so nice to see all the happy faces.  Our waitress was great and very informative, since we've never been there before and had little experience with crumpets. =)

excerpts: We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream
(what I live for!).
The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint
and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely
get together with your girlfriends.
crumpets.author: Helen T.
crumpets.review: I've been wanting to check out Lovejoy's for awhile now and finally had the chance a few weeks ago.  So I wore some pearls, put on some white gloves and went to high tea with my friend.  And it did not disappoint.  We both got the Queen's Tea and it was A LOT of food!  We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream (what I live for!).  The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely get together with your girlfriends.

excerpts: We ordered a side of crumpets with lemon curd - I had never had crumpets before but it complimented the hot tea so well.
crumpets.author: D L.
crumpets.review:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time with a close friend on Saturday morning. We were greeted warmly by the waitress and seated promptly as we had reservations at 11am (which is when they open). The decor is adorable and the atmosphere is cozy, clean, and friendly. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea. We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc. It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable. We ordered a side of crumpets with lemon curd - I had never had crumpets before but it complimented the hot tea so well. The scones came with devon cream and jam...YUMMY!

The waitress saw my camera on the table and graciously asked us if we would like our picture taken. We were attended to very often as different waitresses came by to make sure that our teas were filled to the brim and the food was to our liking. 

I am definitely coming back here.. I think it would be a great place to take a girl friend out for her birthday!

excerpts: Then we ordered crumpets & lemon curd and sausage puffs a la carte.
The sandwhiches were accompanied with a green salad and cole slaw.
For dessert we each had a shortbread cookie and a petit
lil cake that we inhaled in 2 bites.
The service and experience was phenomenal.
I adored every second of it.
Go there with plenty of time to enjoy and relax.
It took us 2 hours for our experience and we loved it.
The tea pot was kept warm and full at all times.
Great service as well.
crumpets.author: Yolanda O.
crumpets.review: iF YOU WANT THE ULTIMATE GIRLIE INDULGENCE...THIS IS IT!!! My BFF Caroline invited me to a private tea party for two for my birthday yesterday. We had "High Tea For 2". We chose to drink the Rose Petal tea. Along with tea we got an array of finger sandwhiches (salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, turkey & dijon, and chicken & asparagus). The best part of our meal were the traditional english scones....the best scone i have ever eaten in life no lie, like a mix between a bisquit and a scone. Then we ordered crumpets & lemon curd and sausage puffs a la carte. The sandwhiches were accompanied with a green salad and cole slaw. For dessert we each had a shortbread cookie and a petit lil cake that we inhaled in 2 bites. The service and experience was phenomenal. I adored every second of it. Go there with plenty of time to enjoy and relax. It took us 2 hours for our experience and we loved it. The tea pot was kept warm and full at all times. Great service as well.

excerpts: Add to that  a hearty helping of delicate, fresh and delicious tea sandwiches, buttery currant scones served with huge dollops of real Devonshire cream, hot, buttery, holey crumpets and the room goes a little fuzzy as you slip into warm bliss.
The friendly, attentive staff (decked out in vintage aprons) and the mismatched china make it all the more fun.
In your tea-induced coma, don't miss all the great, fun and funky gift shop across the street:
Lovejoy's attic.
Unlike the "Secret Garden" tea room--you will find NO FAIRIES or TIARAs here.
Beehouse teapots, vintage aprons, a few (genuine) old lady tea hats and lots of tea (fresh looseleaf) and tea accoutrement -- including very hip Japanese Beehouse teapots.
crumpets.author: M W.
crumpets.review: Unlike the many faux tearooms in SF, Lovejoys understands that exceptionally fresh, loose leaf tea brewed in piping hot water (refreshed often) is the heart and soul of any tearoom. Add to that  a hearty helping of delicate, fresh and delicious tea sandwiches, buttery currant scones served with huge dollops of real Devonshire cream, hot, buttery, holey crumpets and the room goes a little fuzzy as you slip into warm bliss. The friendly, attentive staff (decked out in vintage aprons) and the mismatched china make it all the more fun. In your tea-induced coma, don't miss all the great, fun and funky gift shop across the street: Lovejoy's attic. Unlike the "Secret Garden" tea room--you will find NO FAIRIES or TIARAs here. Beehouse teapots, vintage aprons, a few (genuine) old lady tea hats and lots of tea (fresh looseleaf) and tea accoutrement -- including very hip Japanese Beehouse teapots.

excerpts: Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed.

The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios.
Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways.
The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch.
The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?
crumpets.author: Gourmet G.
crumpets.review: As rabid an Anglophile as I am, I detest tea . . . the beverage (although iced will do), not the lovely little afternoon break that's de rigueur in England, even to this day. In London, the best are offered on Oxford Street in Selfridge's - a grande dame of a department store overshadowed only by Harrod's - and Fortnum and Mason in Piccadilly. Here in the heart of Noe Valley we have this cozy  tearoom with its Laura Ashley-inspired decor providing a replica good enough to pass muster. Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed. The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios. Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways. The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch. The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?

excerpts: Cherry cordial isn't served here, nor is there a likelihood you'll meet your Gilbert (but it's perfect for those drawn to the more refined, leg crossing, floating pinky finger male species), but the warm crumpets, divine sandwiches (fig & olive tapenade - my personal fave) and eclectic decor will make your girlish dreams come alive.
I've thrown a couple bridal showers here for my queens and religiously sip tea at Lovejoy's when mum's in town.
The service is fitting, a little noisy if there's a large party, but overall, great price for quite a different experience from the 5 star hotel tea rooms.
Oh, and I might add that LJ's is light years better than the more fabricated 'Lisa's Tea Treasures' chain.
Finally, check out the recently set up sister shop across the street so that you, too, can acquire similar pieces for your Lovejoy's at home.
crumpets.author: Irene S.
crumpets.review: Okay all my fellow Anne Shirley fans, throw on the country apron, your best Anthropologie outfit and prepare yourself for a memorable afternoon at Green Gables.  Cherry cordial isn't served here, nor is there a likelihood you'll meet your Gilbert (but it's perfect for those drawn to the more refined, leg crossing, floating pinky finger male species), but the warm crumpets, divine sandwiches (fig & olive tapenade - my personal fave) and eclectic decor will make your girlish dreams come alive.   I've thrown a couple bridal showers here for my queens and religiously sip tea at Lovejoy's when mum's in town.  The service is fitting, a little noisy if there's a large party, but overall, great price for quite a different experience from the 5 star hotel tea rooms.  Oh, and I might add that LJ's is light years better than the more fabricated 'Lisa's Tea Treasures' chain.  Finally, check out the recently set up sister shop across the street so that you, too, can acquire similar pieces for your Lovejoy's at home.

excerpts: My favorites were the scones and crumpets.
The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.
crumpets.author: Lisa C.
crumpets.review: This was the first time I've ever had afternoon tea. I thought the place was really cute and the food was delicious. It's a bit pricey and not something you'd do often. But get a bunch of people together and it's great to way to spend an afternoon. Go for the High Tea or the Queen's Tea for the most variety but make sure you come with a hearty appetite. My favorites were the scones and crumpets. The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.

excerpts: I had never experienced afternoon tea with crumpets.
I loved the whole experience.
The different types of teas we chose were absolutely delicious.
I believe we ordered about 4 different types of sandwiches.
Being a vegetarian, they had plenty of options to choose from.
The fresh fruit and salad added the perfect touch!
During the time we were enjoying our sandwiches, our host had booked a tea leaf reader.
She was amazing!
I was not expecting that, and she blew my mind away.
Keep in mind that when you do want to book her it is for an hour
and I believe the rate is $95.00.
In conclusion, this was a great experience, and I think that everyone should try it once.
Although the crowd is typically older, it is still fun, especially with a lot of your girlfriends.
I HIGHLY recommend this place.
crumpets.author: Samantha R.
crumpets.review: I was lucky enough to come here for a bridal shower.  To be honest, born and raised in Texas I had never experienced afternoon tea with crumpets.  I loved the whole experience.  The different types of teas we chose were absolutely delicious.  I believe we ordered about 4 different types of sandwiches. Being a vegetarian, they had plenty of options to choose from.  The fresh fruit and salad added the perfect touch!  During the time we were enjoying our sandwiches, our host had booked a tea leaf reader.  She was amazing!  I was not expecting that, and she blew my mind away.  Keep in mind that when you do want to book her it is for an hour and I believe the rate is $95.00.  In conclusion, this was a great experience, and I think that everyone should try it once.  Although the crowd is typically older, it is still fun, especially with a lot of your girlfriends.  I HIGHLY recommend this place.

excerpts: We like to order the queen's tea- don't eat anything before hand, all those sandwiches and salad, scones, crumpets, cookies and lemon curd is more than plenty, but everything is too yummy to leave behind!
Lovejoy's feels indulgent, and is therefore a great place to celebrate life's exciting events.
I've seen many a shower or small party here.
Mostly, though, this teahouse always reminds me how important it is to honor our friendships and indulge them with time, space, and conversation over perfectly steeped tea!
crumpets.author: Jessica R.
crumpets.review: Now, there are plenty of places to have an impromptu get together for tea, but if you want to make it a special date (and you should! value your girlfriends!), call two weeks in advance and book yourself a table. You can wear anything from jeans to your party dress, it's all acceptable. Your tea will be served and timed perfectly, with plenty of cream and sugar, should you need it, and enough strainers so that you'll never have to mix flavors. Beware the giddiness of too much caffeine. There is an hour and a hall seating time (which we tend to use and then some), but we have never been rushed out of a table. We like to order the queen's tea- don't eat anything before hand, all those sandwiches and salad, scones, crumpets, cookies and lemon curd is more than plenty, but everything is too yummy to leave behind! Lovejoy's feels indulgent, and is therefore a great place to celebrate life's exciting events. I've seen many a shower or small party here. Mostly, though, this teahouse always reminds me how important it is to honor our friendships and indulge them with time, space, and conversation over perfectly steeped tea!

excerpts: Yes, the atmosphere is so cute, but if you look at the prices, you realize you're getting ripped, especially if you see the price of a package of crumpets in a local supermarket.
And $7.95 (I think that's what it was) for a pot of tea!!!
You're definitely getting ripped.
I think of  Higher Grounds in Glen Park and their pots for about two bucks.
Yes, it's an endless pot, but I can only drink so much tea.

I may be in the wrong situation to appreciate this place properly, since I was the only solo customer there, and an endless pot of tea might be good for a group, and pooling your money for a large platter of goodies might pay off.

And as for atmosphere, granted I may have more slow digestive system than average, but it's hard to fully relax and appreciate the atmosphere as much as you might when the server asks you if you're all done because other parties need your table.
Probably this is great for girly parties, but for those truly living the revered Jane Austen's lifestyle (a single woman alone), you might want to make a different choice.
crumpets.author: Cat S.
crumpets.review:
Atmosphere is everything!!
