excerpts: We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.
The service was the best any of us had experienced!
It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!
crumpets.author: Laurie G.
crumpets.review: What an amazing experience!  We recently had a birthday tea with 9 girlfriends and it was by far the best high tea experience any of us had ever had!  We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.  The service was the best any of us had experienced!  It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!

excerpts: We also split the Tea Sandwich Plate ($12.95).
The 4 tea sandwich choices we chose between the Queen's Tea and the Plate were the Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese and the Pear and Stilton.
We liked them all with the exception of the Pear and Stilton which had a weird taste.
Both sandwich plates also came with a mixed green salad and cabbage slaw both of which were okay if not standard.
tea sandwich plate.author: Carrie W.
tea sandwich plate.review:
I am officially obsessed with Lovejoy's! I live a few blocks from here and after begging A for MONTHS to go on a tea date with me, he finally gave in and we were able to make a reservation. I will say that I think we may have gotten in earlier had we been able to walk in but Lovejoy's is too popular. I think the reservation process is a bit opaque, however, since you have to request a reservation without knowing which times are available. I wish they were on OpenTable or Resy or at least had a more detailed calendar but I guess there is some charm in having to go through a bit of effort.

Anyways, we requested any available time but noted that we preferred earlier in the day on Saturday rather than later. To our luck, we got a reservation at 11AM right when they opened. When we got there, the place was already pretty full and there was a wedding shower going on at one of the long communal tables. Lovejoy's is SUPER cute on the inside and they have all of these adorable hats you can wear during your tea party. A was not about that AT ALL and felt a bit self-conscious in the admittedly feminine space.

Anyways, we had a difficult time ordering because we didn't want to over-order. We settled on getting one Queen's Tea ($28) and split the bottomless tea pot (+$2) since we both wanted a black tea and it didn't make sense to spend an additional $10 when we would have ordered something similar if not the same thing. We also split the Tea Sandwich Plate ($12.95). The 4 tea sandwich choices we chose between the Queen's Tea and the Plate were the Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese and the Pear and Stilton. We liked them all with the exception of the Pear and Stilton which had a weird taste. Both sandwich plates also came with a mixed green salad and cabbage slaw both of which were okay if not standard. The Queen's Tea also came with a scone, a crumpet and a petit four. The scones at Lovejoy's are AMAZING. It was served warm and was flaky but not dry. We devoured the one that came with our tea so we ordered another one for $2.95 and did not regret it at all. The crumpet was satisfying and the petit four was cute and the perfect end to our meal. Was it cheap? No. Did A leave hungry? Maybe. But even in the end, he was a convert to the joys of high tea and wants to go experience it at one of the fancy hotels in the city! I cannot wait to come back to Lovejoy's in any case but I wish I could just stop in and get a scone to go :D

excerpts: My sister's bf had the "Tea Sandwich Plate" ($13) which included salmon and cucumber sandwiches.
tea sandwich plate.author: Karla Marie D.
tea sandwich plate.review:
Tea party anyone?

Came in here feeling like a little girl again. The eclectic design brings back so many childhood memories. Since Crown and Crumpets was closed because they were relocating, this was the next best thing. 

We came in on a Sunday afternoon. There was no wait, although I did make a reservation. The place is a little cramped for me, but still worth it. 

We had the "Queen's tea" ($27). It included the following: choice of 2 sandwiches (turkey and shrimp sandwiches), spring salad, scone, crumpet, Petit four, and shortbread biscuit. 

My niece had the "Wee Tea" ($16) which included the following: cream cheese and jelly sandwich, scone, fresh fruit, Petit Four, tea/hot chocolate.

My sister's bf had the "Tea Sandwich Plate" ($13) which included salmon and cucumber sandwiches. He also had a side of large coffee.

Our total came about to $70-ish (pretty hefty, if you asked me).

My faves were the crumpet and the lemon curd spread.. yum!!! (i love anything lemony). At the end we were asked to choose 2 Petit four, which is basically a dessert. It's very small, but packed with sweetness. I wanted to eat all of them since they looked so pretty, but sadly only two had the pleasure of my taste buds.

Overall, great experience, but pricey! I would come here again with my girls.

excerpts: One tip, be sure to order a side of lemon curd with your High Tea.
You will not regret it!
side of lemon curd.author: Michelle D.
side of lemon curd.review:
I don't know what they put in the decaf Vanilla Rooibos tea at this place, but that stuff is the best drug on earth!! Every time I order it, I am on a high for the rest of the day. That high is mostly likely due in part to the tea, in part to the spoon of sugar I put in each cup, and also due to the incredible food served in the High Tea and the fact that I always have the BEST time with my girlfriends at this adorable place. The staff could not be more pleasant and it's fun to witness so many celebrations happening around you.
One tip, be sure to order a side of lemon curd with your High Tea. You will not regret it!

excerpts: It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam.
side of devon cream.author: Stephanie C.
side of devon cream.review:
Lovejoy' s is the definition of shabby chic. It's completely charming and full of tons of character. The place is adorned with hats perfect for a royal wedding, lace, cuckoo clocks, vintage pictures, and of course tons of mismatched tea sets. I've been here before but most recently came for my Mom's birthday tea.

My Mom and I shared the Queen's tea for two, $27/person, and then added on my sister for $17. With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea. We had a huge pot of earl grey and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches. I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins. It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam. The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!

This is the perfect place to have a girly date with friends or with your Mom. Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!

excerpts: For $30, you can get the Queen's service, which comes with bottomless tea, two full sandwiches of your choosing, a scone with lemon curd, clotted cream, and raspberry jam, petit fours, tea biscuit, fruit, salad, and a crumpet??
crumpet.author: Pooja M.
crumpet.review:
I've had the pleasure of enjoying high tea service at Lovejoy's Tea Room a few times now, and each time I've been impressed with the quantity and quality of food and tea you receive for an affordable price! 

For $30, you can get the Queen's service, which comes with bottomless tea, two full sandwiches of your choosing, a scone with lemon curd, clotted cream, and raspberry jam, petit fours, tea biscuit, fruit, salad, and a crumpet?? You will absolutely walk away feeling stuffed and satisfied!

They have plenty of tea services aside from the Queen's service, so if you're looking for a more inexpensive tea service, Lovejoy's has a myriad of options. And if none of those options catch your eye, you can customize your own service or even order from their a la carte menu. 

Their tea menu is expansive as well and ranges across black teas, herbal teas, decaffeinated, fruit teas, etc, so again, you're bound to find something you'll love.

What impresses me the most about Lovejoy's tea service is how much choice you have in deciding your food items. High tea is one of my favorite indulgences, but it can be very restrictive in that the menu of what is served is pre-fixe unless you let the restaurant know ahead of time about your food allergies/restrictions. With Lovejoy's you can choose which tea sandwiches you want with your tea service, and they have plenty of meat, seafood, and vegetarian options. You can also choose which petit fours you want from a tray that they bring around to you that includes mini cakes, marzipans, chocolates, etc. I like that as a person with allergies and a food restriction (I am a pescatarian), I don't have to inform Lovejoy's ahead of time of these restrictions because their tea menu caters to everyone and all potential restrictions. 

I also love the decor of this tea room. Lovejoy's Tea Room is decorated just like a cute quintessential English tea room, with lovely pastel colors throughout, fine teapots and cups, floral wallpaper, lace curtains and tablecloths, and embroidered pillows and couches where there weren't chairs. 

Lovejoy's is truly a special tea room in Noe Valley, and it's a tea room I will definitely be coming back to again and again!

excerpts: We all ordered the Queen's Tea (Choice of Two Sandwiches, Served w/Cabbage Salad, Caraway Cream Dressing, Organic Spring Greens, Scone w/Preserves & Devon Cream, Crumpet w/Meyer Lemon Curd, Fresh Fruit, Petit Four, Tea Biscuit, $29.95, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wzNGMt87QuKAu7vzCjTXQw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg).
The crumpet was just ok for me since it's meant to be more dry/chewy.
I chose the peanut butter petit four, and that was really good.
Although the tea service isn't cheap at $29.99, we actually had a ton of leftovers, and you're also paying for the experience.
crumpet.author: Amy D.
crumpet.review:
I loved Lovejoy's the first time I went there a few years ago, and came back recently for a friend's birthday. It wasn't quite as magical as my first time here, but this is still one of the most authentic and best tea rooms in the Bay Area. My friend made reservations for our group a couple months in advance, and reservations are highly recommended! Make sure your group is on time, since they only give you 2-2.5 hours for your seating. It was completely packed at 11am on a Sunday. 

We all ordered the Queen's Tea (Choice of Two Sandwiches, Served w/Cabbage Salad, Caraway Cream Dressing, Organic Spring Greens, Scone w/Preserves & Devon Cream, Crumpet w/Meyer Lemon Curd, Fresh Fruit, Petit Four, Tea Biscuit, $29.95, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wzNGMt87QuKAu7vzCjTXQw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg). We tried the following sandwiches and teas:

-Roast Beef & Horseradish: There wasn't much roast beef in this, and the horseradish wasn't very strong.
-Egg & Onion: Yum- great version of egg salad, but very onion-y.
-Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad: Just ok for me, but I don't like nuts in chicken salad.
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese: Solid smoked salmon & cream cheese:

-Tea Room Blend: Solid black tea, and easy to drink.
-Chestnut Tea: I loved the chestnut aroma, but this tea was STRONG. You definitely needed to add a good amount of milk to dilute it.

You can order unlimited teas, but the tables are small, and we didn't have room for a lot of teas. I wish I had tried: Apricot, Pomegranate Green, Genmai Cha, Jasmine, and White Peach.

The scone was my favorite part of the tea- it was buttery and flaky, and super delicious smothered in Devonshire double cream and lemon curd. The crumpet was just ok for me since it's meant to be more dry/chewy. I chose the peanut butter petit four, and that was really good. Although the tea service isn't cheap at $29.99, we actually had a ton of leftovers, and you're also paying for the experience. This is a great place to go with a group of girlfriends and have a British high tea experience! I heard that their Redwood City location is actually more spacious than SF, so will definitely have to check that out next time since that's closer to home. Parking actually wasn't difficult to find on a Sunday, since there were a good amount of street parking spots available.

excerpts: Went here for tea, when we got our bill we were charged double for one crumpet.
Charged $5.95 for what was stated as $2.95 on the menu.
They charged us nearly $6 for one crumpet since we were sharing it.
Dissatisfied with the tricky sales tactics we did not leave a tip.
We left to go look at their store across the street when someone from the tea room followed us and interrogated us why we didn't leave a tip.
Very unprofessional and hostile environment.
crumpet.author: Allison C.
crumpet.review: Went here for tea, when we got our bill we were charged double for one crumpet.  Charged $5.95 for what was stated as $2.95 on the menu. They charged us nearly $6 for one crumpet since we were sharing it. Dissatisfied with the tricky sales tactics we did not leave a tip. We left to go look at their store across the street when someone from the tea room followed us and interrogated us why we didn't leave a tip. Very unprofessional and hostile environment.

excerpts: We both ordered the queen's tea (2 sandwiches, cabbage salad, fruit, scone, crumpet, petit four & biscuit, and of course a bottomless pot of tea).
This was a TON of food!
I didn't love the sandwiches I chose, but there are a ton to pick from
so I'd love to come back and try some of the others.
crumpet.author: Catherine S.
crumpet.review:
I brought my mom here for an early mother's day meal & we had the best time! The decor is super whimsical- mismatched teacups, christmas lights, and british memorabilia. 
I made reservations for 3PM on a Thursday, and when we arrived the restaurant was about 1/3-1/2 full. The restaurant itself is pretty tiny, so I would make reservations just in case. 
We both ordered the queen's tea (2 sandwiches, cabbage salad, fruit, scone, crumpet, petit four & biscuit, and of course a bottomless pot of tea). This was a TON of food! I didn't love the sandwiches I chose, but there are a ton to pick from so I'd love to come back and try some of the others. The rest of the meal was delicious (mmm those scones though), and my mom loved the whole experience. Such a cute/fun afternoon!

excerpts: Highlight: scones, Devon cream, lemon curd, crumpet and petite four.
Ordered the following sandwiches: cucumber cream cheese, mandarin cream cheese, ham and mustard, turkey and mustard.
I personally like the cucumber and mandarin sandwiches because they are light and refreshing.
crumpet.author: Stephanie L.
crumpet.review:
So cute. So quaint. My favorite place for high tea. 

We ordered the Queen's tea because we get a little bit of everything. Highlight: scones, Devon cream, lemon curd, crumpet and petite four. Ordered the following sandwiches: cucumber cream cheese, mandarin cream cheese, ham and mustard, turkey and mustard. I personally like the cucumber and mandarin sandwiches because they are light and refreshing. We ordered the savory sandwiches with a little punch of flavor to complement the lighter fare. 

The staff are so nice and accommodating. As it is high tea, we sat for about 2 hours. Staff checked on us regularly enough. We refilled our tea twice (we drink A LOT of tea). 

You get a little coupon to their retail storefront across the street Lovejoy's Attic when you dine.

excerpts: I'd like to try a crumpet as well!
crumpet.author: Sean A.
crumpet.review:
Made reservations for Lovejoy's on their website for 11 AM. Be sure to do the same. When we arrived the tables were all reserved. 

The restaurant is outfitted with English decor. There is a hat rack with hats that you might be able to wear. 

We opted for the High tea. There is another higher level set with more food. But, we ended up really being stuffed, so I'd recommend the High tea unless you are absolutely starving. It's much cheaper too. 

Our server was nice and friendly and suggested teas and sandwiches that we might like. There was another server that did, however, give a far more detailed explanation of the menu to another party. 

For tea, I chose Chestnut. My girlfriend chose Apricot. Mine wasn't suited to me. My girlfriend, being awesome as she is, tried mine and liked it, so we switched. I really liked the Apricot. They freshen up the tea for you after a bit and give you huge potfuls. 

I was able to choose two sandwiches for my set. The two that I chose were salmon and chicken salad with walnuts. The sandwiches were good not great. 

Also included was a wonderful cabbage salad with Carraway cream dressing. I scarfed that one down. 

The organic spring greens were a little wilted. 

The highlight of the set had to be the scone! Nice and warm with currants. I recommend spooning some Devon cream and preserves on each bite. Super yummy!

I think the next time that I come here I will go straight for the tea and scones. I'd like to try a crumpet as well!

excerpts: The crumpets have gone up for two pieces ($4 for one crumpet, seriously?!)
crumpet.author: Petra S.
crumpet.review: Just like everything else that was good in the city, lovejoys apparently has become the latest sellout. The last couple of times i've come here i noticed that the new owners lack the British charm, the hospitality and most of all the portions that Lovejoys was so well known for under previous ownership. Portions have become incredibly stingy and trust me as i have been going here for nearly a decade. I always get the same thing, the egg and onion salad and smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. There is barely any smoked salmon in there and the tiny layer that is there covers about half. The same with the egg salad being a very thinly spread layer and it was extremely over salt especially today. The crumpets have gone up for two pieces ($4 for one crumpet, seriously?!) the teas don't taste as strong (i always get the tea room blend) prices have gone up and service is not very warm or friendly, except for when you're asking for the check. Saying that i'm very disappointed is an understatement!

excerpts: The reason I prefer High Tea over Queen's Tea is that Queen's Tea is $7 more and only gives you a crumpet, some fruit, and a Petit Four.
crumpet.author: Amanda L.
crumpet.review:
I recently went twice and got Queen's Tea one time and High Tea the other time. Both are good options but I definitely prefer High Tea and will probably get that from now on. The reason I prefer High Tea over Queen's Tea is that Queen's Tea is $7 more and only gives you a crumpet, some fruit, and a Petit Four. Personally I don't really enjoy crumpets or Petit Fours so that basically means $7 for a bit of fruit. However, if you love crumpets and Petit Fours, go for it! I can finish the whole High or Queen's Tea myself so it makes me full but doesn't keep me full for more than an hour or two. However, the experience is really fun and cute for special occasions. If you're looking for a light fruity tea, one of my personal favorites is White Peach.

The environment itself is very old fashioned and cute with pretty, mismatched dishes. Everyone is friendly there too. However, both times I came with a party of 3 and got stuck at the table with the "shared" bench, meaning you share a bench with someone from another table. The time I sat on that bench, I felt every time the girl sitting on the other side moved or rocked it (because of course it's not level). I plan to now go with either one other person or a party of 4+ now unless they replace that bench haha. Don't forget to make reservations (which you can do online)!

excerpts: The second time I came, I ordered the light tea but added a crumpet on the side.
I think that I liked this tea service a lot better.
It still made me full and instead of the salad, there was fruit.
I think that it was nice to have some sweet.
crumpet.author: Tina Y.
crumpet.review:
It's such a cute experience! 

I think that out of all the tea rooms that I've been to, this one is the best. I came here twice in the span of two weeks because I know so many of my friends have always wanted to try this. 

Once I got the high tea and another time I got the light tea. 

When I got the high tea, you can get two sandwiches. I picked the artichoke hummus/arugula and the roast beef with horseradish. Both of these sandwiches were good and they were a good balance to each other. It came with a salad and scone. It kept me surprisingly full! 
I picked the white strawberry tea. It was so yummy and light. I didn't add any cream or sugar into it at all. I think it was too light for the cream and sugar. 

The second time I came, I ordered the light tea but added a crumpet on the side. I think that I liked this tea service a lot better. It still made me full and instead of the salad, there was fruit. I think that it was nice to have some sweet. The salad from the high tea didn't excite me in anyway. The sandwich that I got for this tea service was the chicken walnut. I think I would have went with another sandwich for next time. I got the decaf mango black tea. It got pretty strong after sitting for a while. I didn't add cream and sugar when it was lighter, but my second and third cup I put in the works. 

I would say that this is kind of pricey for what it is, but this place is really more for the experience more than anything. It's nice food to chat over.

excerpts: Over all I would come again but maybe just get the tea, scones, a crumpet and maybe even one sandwich.
crumpet.author: Michelle P.
crumpet.review: I ordered the queens tea. It comes with fresh fruit two sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, scones, crumpets tea cookies and petite fours and of course a bottomless pot of your choice of tea. The Queens tea was about ~$29 per person. You can't go wrong with the tea, and their scones are so good and buttery and are warm when you get them. We got the smoked salmon/cream cheese, chicken walnut apple and pear and Stilton sandwiches. The smoked salmon was delicious, pear was ok and I would skip the chicken walnut apple next time. Their fruit was sweet and the coleslaw lacked flavor and the salad was just the greens, mandarin oranges with balsamic vinaigrette. The crumpets come half way through and we're nice and hot. The petite fours were sweet and a nice touch to the end. Over all I would come again but maybe just get the tea, scones, a crumpet and maybe even one sandwich.

excerpts: For one Queens tea, you get to choose two sandwiches and it comes with crumpet, scone, fruit, salad and this litto piece of cake.
My friend chose the tea but they were both fruity
and I thought they were just ok.
I am not really a tea person unless it is the boba.
Overall it is a cute experience to do with friends for a special occasion.
When you are inside, it looks so busy but it is because it used to be an antique shop.
crumpet.author: Amy H.
crumpet.review: I made a reservation online weeks before the actually Saturday morning and it is quite popping. This place opens up at 11am and it was packed. I had a gift certificate for queens tea for two and this was actually enough for four people. There is unlimited tea and there are enough litto sandwiches to satisfy us. For one Queens tea, you get to choose two sandwiches and it comes with crumpet, scone, fruit, salad and this litto piece of cake. My friend chose the tea but they were both fruity and I thought they were just ok. I am not really a tea person unless it is the boba. Overall it is a cute experience to do with friends for a special occasion. When you are inside, it looks so busy but it is because it used to be an antique shop.

excerpts: The Queen's Tea also came with a scone, a crumpet and a petit four.
The crumpet was satisfying and the petit four was cute and the perfect end to our meal.
Was it cheap?
No.
Did A leave hungry?
Maybe.
crumpet.author: Carrie W.
crumpet.review:
I am officially obsessed with Lovejoy's! I live a few blocks from here and after begging A for MONTHS to go on a tea date with me, he finally gave in and we were able to make a reservation. I will say that I think we may have gotten in earlier had we been able to walk in but Lovejoy's is too popular. I think the reservation process is a bit opaque, however, since you have to request a reservation without knowing which times are available. I wish they were on OpenTable or Resy or at least had a more detailed calendar but I guess there is some charm in having to go through a bit of effort.

Anyways, we requested any available time but noted that we preferred earlier in the day on Saturday rather than later. To our luck, we got a reservation at 11AM right when they opened. When we got there, the place was already pretty full and there was a wedding shower going on at one of the long communal tables. Lovejoy's is SUPER cute on the inside and they have all of these adorable hats you can wear during your tea party. A was not about that AT ALL and felt a bit self-conscious in the admittedly feminine space.

Anyways, we had a difficult time ordering because we didn't want to over-order. We settled on getting one Queen's Tea ($28) and split the bottomless tea pot (+$2) since we both wanted a black tea and it didn't make sense to spend an additional $10 when we would have ordered something similar if not the same thing. We also split the Tea Sandwich Plate ($12.95). The 4 tea sandwich choices we chose between the Queen's Tea and the Plate were the Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese and the Pear and Stilton. We liked them all with the exception of the Pear and Stilton which had a weird taste. Both sandwich plates also came with a mixed green salad and cabbage slaw both of which were okay if not standard. The Queen's Tea also came with a scone, a crumpet and a petit four. The scones at Lovejoy's are AMAZING. It was served warm and was flaky but not dry. We devoured the one that came with our tea so we ordered another one for $2.95 and did not regret it at all. The crumpet was satisfying and the petit four was cute and the perfect end to our meal. Was it cheap? No. Did A leave hungry? Maybe. But even in the end, he was a convert to the joys of high tea and wants to go experience it at one of the fancy hotels in the city! I cannot wait to come back to Lovejoy's in any case but I wish I could just stop in and get a scone to go :D

excerpts: Crumpet was spongy and warm.
Devonshire cream was yummy.
Tiny cup of coleslaw.
crumpet.author: Helen L.
crumpet.review: Let's start from the beginning.   Try getting a group of 6 to decide on the date and time.  Once done, go online to their website and fill out the form.  Then i get an email to confirm date and time with Lovejoy.  Then gave them my credit card to reserve this time and date.  I was told as long as i call to cancel my credit card won't be used.  Closer to the date i got a reminder text and a reminder call.  This reflects how much they want us to show up..  Unfortunately, only one could not come.  I wasn't charged and they were super nice about it.  We got the queen's tea and healthy tea.  $2.00 tea charge for each person.  We got the caffeine free berry tea and ceylon decaf.  This was a 4 pm reservation so we watched our caffeine intake.  Ordered a side of sausage puff which was delicious. Love the lemon curd, almond paste petit four, homemade scone and crumpets, loved the ambiance, the bone china,  and the tea strainer.  Extra scone is 2.95.  Crumpet was spongy and warm.  Devonshire cream was yummy.  Tiny cup of coleslaw.

excerpts: I've had crown and crumpet, dartealing, and sip as well.
For $29.95 you get the queens tea which includes all the items you need - 2 sandos, scone, crumpet, fruit, cookies, and a few more.
crumpet.author: A Y.
crumpet.review:
Been here 3-4 times and it's still the best high tea I've had in the city. I've had crown and crumpet, dartealing, and sip as well. Haven't tried the bougier spots like rotunda. 

For $29.95 you get the queens tea which includes all the items you need - 2 sandos, scone, crumpet, fruit, cookies, and a few more. I like that the price is reasonable and you get your tea refilled as well.

The interior is very cozy and intimate, and I personally love the mismatched cushions and tea sets.

This place gets packed on the weekends so book ahead! Also I'm thrilled they now have an online Rez system where you don't have to email them for time slots.

excerpts: The scones and crumpet were so good.
I will definitely be back again and again.
crumpet.author: Rude G.
crumpet.review: Excellent as always. Service was great. The scones and crumpet were so good. I will definitely be back again and again.

excerpts: For example; one scone, one petit four, one coleslaw, one crumpet, etc.
it ended up working, but cutting things in half with a friend is awkward.
I'd rather skip the crumpet for 2 scones.
Or skip some fruit for 2 coleslaws.
Or vice versa.
Also, the scone was old, dry & crusty.
It was difficult to cut in half.
I should have asked for a fresh one.
It's no wonder why Lovejoy's has such high ratings.
We had fun, the food was tasty & filling, and the staff are really nice.
I posted this in tips, but here it is again; if you don't have reservations, don't panic.
They'll seat you if they have no-shows.
That's how we got seated & it was easy.
You need to show up at the beginning of their "seating time".
I'll definitely go back.
crumpet.author: Reed S.
crumpet.review:
We didn't have reservations, but were told to wait until the next seating to see if someone didn't show up. 
We were lucky enough to get seated for the 3:30 seating. 
What's great about this restaurant is that it's a complete mish-mosh of stuff. From the chairs, to the silverware, to the tea cups.  NOTHING matched, & that's what makes it charming!
If you're able, request a seat towards the back of the restaurant. It's much more quiet & somewhat private. 
The staff were fantastic & on top of everything.  The tea was only left empty towards the end of our meal. Other than that, it was refilled and reheated when needed without asking. 
They pretty much forbid the use of cell phones, which is quite a nice change!  We saw at least 3 different signs. 
My only complaint would be that it's somewhat difficult to share one tea service. For example; one scone, one petit four, one coleslaw, one crumpet, etc.  it ended up working, but cutting things in half with a friend is awkward. I'd rather skip the crumpet for 2 scones. Or skip some fruit for 2 coleslaws. Or vice versa.  Also, the scone was old, dry & crusty. It was difficult to cut in half. I should have asked for a fresh one. 
It's no wonder why Lovejoy's has such high ratings. We had fun, the food was tasty & filling, and the staff are really nice. 
I posted this in tips, but here it is again; if you don't have reservations, don't panic. They'll seat you if they have no-shows. That's how we got seated & it was easy. You need to show up at the beginning of their "seating time". 
I'll definitely go back.

excerpts:
Lots of salad w/ a tangy, balsamic vinaigrette 

Checkerboard Tea biscuits - lovely choc & vanilla shortbread

Fruit was extremely ripe, juicy, & there was a lot of variety

Crumpet was
crumpet.author: Adrienne G.
crumpet.review:
We've been back to Lovejoy's a goodly number of times but thought it was high (tea) time for an update

I was genius & scheduled the fam for Easter-Brunch

Unfortunately it was raining so didn't get to sport our Easter Bonnets but they happen to have a whole table of fun Fascinators & Hats.....we didn't partake but the table next to us did & it was fun watching them try on the adornments

Queen's Tea all around & it was SO MUCH FOOD!  (in the best way!!)

Sandwiches choices: (PS it's awesome that we can choose our *own* sandwiches & there are a ton of veggie combos!!)
 
*  Cheddar & Pickle (this is a staple for all our high teas & the tangy-tart Branston pickle was awesomely paired w/ the cheddar)
*  Pear & Stilton - sweet pears w/ lots of blue - delish!
*  Cucumber & Cream Cheese - nice cooling & creamy
*  Cream Cheese & Mandarin Oranges - sweet & juicy oranges paired so well w/ the creamy cream cheese

Scones were out of this world buttery w/ lots of currants & totally loving the clotted cream!!  We were extra piggy & asked for more!

Lots of salad w/ a tangy, balsamic vinaigrette 

Checkerboard Tea biscuits - lovely choc & vanilla shortbread

Fruit was extremely ripe, juicy, & there was a lot of variety

Crumpet was a lovely, spongy vehicle for the slightly sweet lemon curd

Petit Fours were out of this world good!  Mom chose the gluten free truffle w/ lemon cream; sis opted for the pineapple petit four; the Mr chose the coconut & I chose the milk choc......all winners!  Loved the creamy, almost melty marzipan

Teas ranged also all over the place & everyone was happy w/ their decisions - Mom chose a berry somethingorother while Sis & the Mr chose the white vanilla lavender.  I chose a dark chocolate truffle

Thanks for the lovely time, the dainty treats & absolute abundance of food!  As we waddled out of there, the sun was coming back out - next year, I'm wearing my Easter bonnet!!  Happy Easter indeed!!

excerpts: I choose to get a scone and crumpet served wit lemon curd, sweet butter and raspberry jam.
crumpet.author: Christine C.
crumpet.review:
Really enjoyed my time here.  Cute atmosphere perfect for couples and a friends get together. If you're looking for a well done afternoon tea experience without it being super pricey, this is the place to go. Definitely recommend, especially for tea time newbies. 

~~details of my experience~~

Order (for 2):

Ploughmans Lunch ($16.95) - cheese platter with salad, fruits, hummus, toast and chips. Very tasty and pretty filling. Nice as a sharing platter. 

Savory tea ($14.95) - 2 sandwhich options w/ choice of tea. Had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, which was a bit much for me. Also got smoked turkey with Dijon mustard, which I loved.

"Me" tea ($15.95) - basically the option to mix and match what you want w choice of tea. I choose to get a scone and crumpet served wit lemon curd, sweet butter and raspberry jam. All very tasty. 

Fruit salad ($8.95) - very nicely put together although did not come with as much fruits as expected. A bit pricey for the amount of fruits served.

Tea choices:

Darjeeling - A good complement with the food. Not a too heavy tea. Quite enjoyed it.

Tea House Blend - A nice blend w a slight bitter aftertaste. Not one of my favorites but adding milk and sugar still made it pretty tasty. Slightly heavier tea flavor. 

Service: 

Fantastic service. Servers were warm and attentive. Food arrival was fast. Tea pot was constantly refilled without having to ask. 

Atmosphere:

Cute, old-timey and comfy. If you are looking for classy and luxurious, I suggest the Laurel Court afternoon tea at the fairmont in SF, but if you are like me, this lovely quirky little tea house is perfect.

Overall: 

One of best afternoon tea experiences. Many tea places lack quality food, but Lovejoys has both the tea time ambience that we look for and the well prepared food items. Really recommend a group party to go with the Ploughmans lunch.

excerpts: Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!
crumpet.author: Jo W.
crumpet.review:
Had my first time here yesterday after years of staring at photos online, and it certainly did not disappoint! I had imagined it to be two stories for some reason, and it's a little smaller than I expected, but the decor is so beautiful, charming, and quirky, like straight out of a Victorian storybook with a modern touch (mismatched tea cups, saucers, teapots, and plates).

My friend and I had Queen's Tea. I didn't see it offered on their Yelp menu, but on their menu at the table, it was listed. It's an awesome deal and can certainly be split between two people, along with add-ons (extra scones or petit fours) without it being too pricey. (I looked at the High Tea option. If we had chosen that, and then had extras, it would have costed more than the Queen's Tea with extra). Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!

For tea, we got China Rose Petal. It's as delicious and beautiful as it sounds. The staff and waiters were so friendly and courteous, and were very kind to help me and my friend get photos of us even though they were closing up at 6:00 (my friend and I had a 4:30 reservation).

I really recommend everyone who has appreciation for tea and Victorian aesthetics/culture to visit this place. What a gem! You just have to drive over a bunch of crazy narrow streets and scary steep San Francisco hills.

My sole critique would be reservation. At the time of this review, only phone reservations are accepted, and I booked between a month to 2 weeks in advance, with the option of 11:00 AM or 4:30 PM on the day my friend and I wanted to come here. I would have liked to reserve online for simplicity's sake, and also not to have to play phone tag with staff (nothing wrong on their end. I left a message, and they called back when I was luckily not busy).

I'll be back here! This is a lovely place for a fairy tale tea getaway! :D

excerpts:
* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Fj33P7RuOhTOwxyb5OtVJQ
LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy.
The outside is a little more crisped as well.
crumpet.author: Ziyan C.
crumpet.review:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

* Fresh Fruit - 3 stars
Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice. 

* Petit Four - 4 stars
full platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#JSpHOzIStSs32UFby1oYIw
cross-section of our choices: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#k3_KeW_0tv5f41UvRFRtJw
We got a dark chocolate/lemon, as well as a rosewater. The chocolate one wasn't great, the jelly-like lemon filling not as sharp as I'd hoped. The rose-water soaked bread-like filling of the other one was great, and we all liked that one much more.

* Tea Biscuit - 3 stars
Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies. 

* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
