excerpts: Then,  the crumpet for the queen was served as an afterthought.
The sandwiches overall, were great.
The chicken walnut salad sandwich tasted funny, like tuna fish and a tad sour.
The cucumbers were not fresh.
Only one of the persons at the table was offered a petit four!
The rest of us were left speechless.
crumpet.author: Emilia G.
crumpet.review:
It is sad to see that the new owner does not have a clue about how to run this potential gold mine.  Never be short staffed.  Never fill the whole restaurant at once and only have 2 servers.  Never offer less than what the previous owners had all the regulars used to, like your choice of a tea with every high tea! Today, upon getting seated we were "graced" with a black tea and a vanilla roiboos, but who ordered or picked those two?  How pretentious of them to force their choice of tea on a patron!  Then,  the crumpet for the queen was served as an afterthought.  The sandwiches overall, were great.  The chicken walnut salad sandwich tasted funny, like tuna fish and a tad sour.  The cucumbers were not fresh.  Only one of the persons at the table was offered a petit four! The rest of us were left speechless.  We know they are extra and not included with a high tea but we always used to get tempted at the end of the meal!

To add insult to injury, I ordered a chicken and asparagus tea sandwich to go and when my son opened the box to eat it at home it was turkey with mustard!  no asparagus! what????? So for that measly insult of a sandwich and two scones and a miniscule scoop of watery double devon cream I paid the exorbitant amount of $13+.  Oh I miss the ladies that for decades really knew what they were doing with this place.  It takes one person to bring it to ruin.  Sigh!  

Go to Lovey's in Pacifica, perhaps you will get lucky with the servers there.

excerpts: Queen's Tea $26.95: Two choices of sandwiches served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic springs, a scone with preserves and devon cream, a crumpet with meyer lemon curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit.
I chose the shrimp with mayonnaise and my friend got the smoked salmon sandwich.
It was enough to fill us up pretty well!
We got the white peach green tea with the set!
crumpet.author: Chena N.
crumpet.review:
Just from one visit, I could tell the owner indeed has a love of joy. Probably not what the name was intended to be, but it was what I felt at Lovejoy's! 
Took my bestie, Kelly D. here for a catch up and I felt like it was the perfect place, and I have been obsessing over tearooms recently. 

.::Atmosphere::.
Spot on classy but heartwarming, traditional yet fun.  I absolutely adore the decors. Its  so detailed and cute, you can tell they put a lot of time and effort into putting this together. Mismatched tea sets here and there, unique hats, pink curtains, etc. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#mVntZj0oO-nMkmQn-BdggA

.::Service::.
I got SO scared because the morning of, I read the yelp reviews and saw that reservations were a must or else there would be a 2.5 hour wait. So 5 minutes before they opened, I left a message wanting a reservation and they called me back half an hour later with a reservation at 12:30pm!!!!! So super KUDDOs for that! Waitresses were all super friendly and welcoming! 

.::Food::.
Queen's Tea $26.95: Two choices of sandwiches served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic springs, a scone with preserves and devon cream, a crumpet with meyer lemon curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit. I chose the shrimp with mayonnaise and my friend got the smoked salmon sandwich. It was enough to fill us up pretty well! We got the white peach green tea with the set! Absolutely refreshing all around!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=B4n7o61UYtNr86ZvLX4Obg#Fi8bMHC4bKIvIIZYRQzldg

Maybe a bit pricier than what I would like, but I can definitely see why with the atmosphere and a better quality of food than the other tearoom I have been to!

excerpts: Since I'm a go big or go home type of person, I went for the Queen's Tea which included two tea sandwiches, scones, crumpet, fresh fruit, petit fours and a bottomless tea pot.
I'll start off now by saying, this is way too much for one person
but it was very good to be able to taste a little bit of everything.
I was especially impressed with the scone which was light and airy especially with the dreamy clotted cream spread on top.
It was so good
crumpet.author: Kimberly S.
crumpet.review:
Pinkies up!

After a long flight, Lovejoy's was the perfect place to reconstruct myself into a new human being. The rickety furniture, crocheted wall hangings, and mismatched china gives the whole place a grandma chic feel. When you walk in, you immediately feel like the walls are closing in you to give you a big, warm, hug.

We made reservations beforehand but SF traffic and ....me being me...... made us 30 minutes late. Luckily the gracious hosts were able to accommodate us immediately and a few minutes later we were swimming in tea and carbs. 

Since I'm a go big or go home type of person, I went for the Queen's Tea which included two tea sandwiches, scones, crumpet, fresh fruit, petit fours and a bottomless tea pot. I'll start off now by saying, this is way too much for one person but it was very good to be able to taste a little bit of everything. I was especially impressed with the scone which was light and airy especially with the dreamy clotted cream spread on top. It was so good, I would (and probably did) give up my left artery for more.

For tea, I went with the standard darjeeling but I was really happy to see that they had such wide and varied choices like chesnut (which my dining partner got) and all of my favorite types of Japanese green tea that I get at home.

Service was relaxed and two hours was plenty of time for us get all of our girl gab on. Don't forget to pick up souvenirs at the shop across the street!

excerpts: The crumpet was nothing to write home about.
To me it just tastes like a plain waffle.
Let's not forget about the petit fours they bring out at the end.
crumpet.author: Kirsten M.
crumpet.review:
This is my second time at Lovejoy's and I can't wait to come back! I wish that "tea time" was an American tradition - I wouldn't mind taking time every day to sip some tea and eat some crumpets. There's also a comforting feeling being in a tea room. You are in a relaxed environment and genuinely just enjoy your guests company.

You feel so fancy with all of the delicate china that I think it makes you eat slower or more "lady-like" which enables you to really savor and enjoy your food. The food itself isn't too filling, but you fill up on the bottomless tea. The darjeeling tea was my favorite. 

The food comes out on these cute tiered plates. What is it about food being higher up that makes it so fancy? They come out with itty bitty sandwiches with the crusts cut off. I mean, c'mon! Too adorable. My favorite was the pear and stilton cheese. The currant scones with the lemon and raspberry spread are amazing. The crumpet was nothing to write home about. To me it just tastes like a plain waffle. Let's not forget about the petit fours they bring out at the end. Petit fours are basically baby marzipan cakes which are thee perfect bite. 

If you're meeting up with an old friend for lunch, maybe planning a bridal shower, or just in the mood for some good ole tea - Lovejoy's is the perfect spot.

excerpts: Then we had the crumpet.
It was hard on the bottom.
I didn't finish it.
Then the pastries came out and sadly they weren't what I expected.
Too sweet and felt like it wasn't made there.
crumpet.author: Lynn C.
crumpet.review:
Such a cute little cottage!!! Haha. I loved the unmatched tea sets and the oddities of the decor. So fun!!!

Had a large party of about 15. We had a big round table and a rectangled on attached to the side. They even had a Victorian couch! So CUTE. 

The sandwiches were yummy but nothing outstanding. My favorite one was the scone. Perfectly made. Sweet and fluffy. It came with 3 sauces: raspberry lemon butter. Lemon was too lemony. The butter WITH the jam was delicious!!! Then we had the crumpet. It was hard on the bottom. I didn't finish it. Then the pastries came out and sadly they weren't what I expected. Too sweet and felt like it wasn't made there. Kinda disappointing. 

The tea was really yummy. I liked the fruity flavors more so than the plain black teas. I was just in a sweeter mood. 

It's all about the experience though and I had a great time!

excerpts: The scone was delicious as well as the marmalade, jam and butter it was served with, however, wtf was that crumpet?
crumpet.author: Christina L.
crumpet.review:
This place gives me the heeby-jeebies, something about grown ass women wearing little tea party hats and gloves eating food in baby portions weirds me out.  

Alas, it is still fun to do once in a while, I guess it's not my cup-o-tea (see what I did there).

I do have to give them props for getting us seats without reservations, though, that was awesome.  There were four of us on a Sunday and couldn't initially accommodate our party size, however, called me back and gave us a table that was meant for three. 

We ordered two queen's tea services, and it was for sure not enough for two girls and two guys.  I'd recommend at least three services for four people, or one per person to play it safe. 

The scone was delicious as well as the marmalade, jam and butter it was served with, however, wtf was that crumpet?  I don't think I've ever had crumpets before but it was like a really airy spongy pancake that took forever to get to our table and only arrived in my mouth to deliver disappointment and longing for something more satisfying. 

The salmon and cream cheese sandwich was really good, the asparagus one was aiiight nothing amazing, and I think the chicken salad one was a favorite as well, however, I didn't try it myself. 

We ordered a vanilla black tea, it was good!  It's hard to go wrong with tea though. 

Overall not impressed for the price you are paying.

We went to McDonalds an hour later.

excerpts: We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie.
Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches.
You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal!
I have not been to Crumpet.
crumpet.author: Elizabeth T.
crumpet.review:
Beautiful, old-fashion-looking, tea room serving some good 'ol afternoon tea!

Crowd: for weekends --- go online for reservation. You won't be able to get in otherwise. There are set entry times as well. I think the max stay for each party is 2 hours. You will need to put down a card for the reservation as well.

Location: right next to the muni stop on Church, J line goes through here.

Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc. All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding. After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are :) You're really just there for the nice atmosphere, pleasant decor, warm and nice food, and chit chat. 

For those with kids: strollers will not fit inside. No room for highchair. OK to bring infants that can be held/wrapped and are relatively quiet. Not suitable for small children who can't sit still.

Experience: We went with a party of 6 on Sunday 1:15PM with reservation a month in advance. Promptly seated. We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie. Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches. You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal! Service is good and there's really not much to complain! 

Compare to other tea places in SF:

Dartealing is a little better in terms of tea uniqueness & sandwich quality, but overall these two are my favorites. Fairmont hotel afternoon tea is more expensive, has more fancy decor, but the sweets are actually worse. The Rotunda downtown is more noisy, fancier looking, more expensive, and also less refined. Samouvar is not really the same type of place, so no comparison.  I have not been to Crumpet.

So really, Dartealing and LoveJoy are my top 2 recommended afternoon tea in SF. Very affordable and very good!

excerpts: This comes with your choice of two sandwiches, served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic spring greens, a scone with preserves and Devon cream, a crumpet with Meyer Lemon Curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit.
crumpet.author: Mandy G.
crumpet.review:
My 200th review goes out to Lovejoy's Tea Room! It was a tough debate between  Lovejoy's Tea Room, Lovejoy's Attic, and Koja Kitchen. 

Lovejoy's is located on the corner of Church & Clipper St, right across from their sister store, Lovejoy's Attic (cute place for tea sets, etc. btw!). This tea room is one of the better places I have been to - it's cute, the food & tea taste great,  and the service is awesome. Parking in the area may be tough, depending when you come. 

It's highly recommended to make reservations in advance. Book 2-4 weeks in advance; depending if there's a holiday coming up. I came here near the holidays and I couldn't get a reservation 2 weeks in advance, but they do allow walk-ins. If you're a walk-in like me, you will have a set amount of time there. The time limit for my friend & I was about 2 hours. Sadly, it did feel like we had to rush the end of our afternoon tea because the 2 hour was ending. If you're in a hurry to go somewhere, I suggest you to give yourself a 3 hour time frame to relax. 

My friend and I got the Queen's Tea ($28 pp). This comes with your choice of two sandwiches, served with cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, organic spring greens, a scone with preserves and Devon cream, a crumpet with Meyer Lemon Curd, fresh fruit, a petit four and a tea biscuit. 

The Petit four will be served at the end and you get  your choice of ONE dessert; if you pick two, there will be an additional $2.50 charge on your bill (my mistake). Their petit fours were adorable as it had a Christmas theme to it :) I think my favorite of the two sandwiches - smoked salmon & cream cheese and one of their daily specials, was probably the smoked salmon & cream cheese - you can never go wrong with that! It was delish, though I can't describe in detail, since it's been awhile since I last went.

I'd love to come back again, when I can find a lady-friend to come with! Miss you Carmen, and our fun tea adventures! Come back from LA soon! :(

excerpts: Along with my sandwiches came a delicious scone with a side of strawberry jam and butter; while my brother chose a crumpet, his personal favorite, with a side of lemon spread.
The sandwiches also came with a salad and vinaigrette.
crumpet.author: Brittany D.
crumpet.review:
Takes me back to England! Even though my fondest memories were in England, drinking tea is a global phenomenon that many people from all the different parts of the world partake in. When I was in college, I studied abroad in England and one thing I miss most is the amazing tasting teas & the tearooms! Pinkies up! 

Of course, tearooms are more widespread in the land of the monarchy, but it's nice to know one of them is a 10-minute drive from my place in SF. Parking is very easy to find even on the weekends. We were able to find street parking a block away. Beware of street signs if you park in the afternoon on weekdays. The tea room is only open Wednesdays to Sundays until 6PM. Last feeding (their words not mine) is at 4:30PM. I would highly recommend making a reservation, especially on the weekends just so you secure yourself a spot in this quaint and cozy little tearoom. You can reserve up to 2 hours in advanced if you're not quite sure of your schedule until the day of. They usually don't pick up, so make sure you leave a message & they'll return your call right away. 

When we arrived we were seated at this cute little table by the window and on the table, there was a sign that said "reserved for royalty". I know at one point I wanted to marry Prince William, but that hardly makes me royal. Regardless, that made me feel very special. The tearoom is small, probably fitting only about 7-10 tables tops. But I think this creates a very intimate experience. Our waitress was very attentive and I felt like she was able to get us everything we needed, which was probably because the space accommodated a handful of people (a plus!). Our waitress was also very knowledgeable about the teas and didn't mind waiting until we perused through the extensive menu that included over 20 different teas! 

We ended up ordering the high tea and "me" tea with black vanilla lavender tea and darjeeling tea-- both of my new favorites. What I loved about the tea was that it was loose leaf, which is definitely the healthier type of tea (tea bags contain added chemicals that aren't good for you). With the tea, we were able to order sandwiches and a side pastry. I ordered the darjeeling with the chicken and asparagus & salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. My brother ordered his vanilla lavender tea with the daily special sandwich-- which was cranberry and turkey (reminded me of Thanksgiving). Along with my sandwiches came a delicious scone with a side of strawberry jam and butter; while my brother chose a crumpet, his personal favorite, with a side of lemon spread. The sandwiches also came with a salad and vinaigrette. I think the food was excellent and it paired very well with the tea. 

The tea is a bit pricey (bill was $40 for 2), but I think it was worth it given the wonderful experience that my brother and I had. I definitely want to come back another time with family and friends. It was such a lovely and nostalgic experience.

excerpts: My friends and I each ordered the Queen's Tea Set which includes two sandwiches served with cabbage salad (coleslaw), organic spring greens, mixed fruits, one scone, a crumpet, a Petit Four (small dessert), and a tea biscuit.
Essentially, it is a buffet with petite foods.
How cute!
And let's not forget the bottomless tea pots (it is called afternoon TEA).
I decided on the White Peach which paired well with the food because it was not overwhelmingly strong.
The crumpet was the only thing that we weren't crazy about.
It's a waffle-cake hybrid: part waffle in texture but tastes like pancake.
It was also very fluffy and hard to cut.
We were presented with an assortment of Petit Fours after our meal.
I had some type of mocha confectionery--a dense brownie coated with mocha.
crumpet.author: Judy H.
crumpet.review:
In true Judy fashion, I have a new obsession: English afternoon tea. I've never been this excited about something British related since the Spice Girls. Yeah, I'm bringing it waaay back. 

I experienced my first afternoon tea sesh at Lovejoy's Tea Room with my two besties on a gloomy Sunday. We were ooh-ing and ahh-ing over their adorable and vintage tea sets, the cozy yet regal decor, and the impeccable sweet and savory finger foods.

My friends and I each ordered the Queen's Tea Set which includes two sandwiches served with cabbage salad (coleslaw), organic spring greens, mixed fruits, one scone, a crumpet, a Petit Four (small dessert), and a tea biscuit. Essentially, it is a buffet with petite foods. How cute! And let's not forget the bottomless tea pots (it is called afternoon TEA). I decided on the White Peach which paired well with the food because it was not overwhelmingly strong. A light and sweet drink to accompany our little delights.

Now for the tea sandwiches! My friends and I divided and conquered. We sampled six different tiny crustless sandwiches (* denotes favorite):
- Cucumber & Cream Cheese
- Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad*
- Salmon Mousse
- Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise 
- Chicken & Asparagus*
- Lovejoy's Daily Special* 

I can't remember what was in their special but there was chicken involved, and it was simply delicious. You can't go wrong with any of the sandwich choices. All of their daintily cut sandwiches are packed with massive flavors. We also loved the blueberry scones, which were soft and light. Spread some of their tantalizing strawberry jam and you are in sweet pastry heaven. The crumpet was the only thing that we weren't crazy about. It's a waffle-cake hybrid: part waffle in texture but tastes like pancake. It was also very fluffy and hard to cut. We were presented with an assortment of Petit Fours after our meal. I had some type of mocha confectionery--a dense brownie coated with mocha. Mmmm, diabetes!

Loyejoy's is the perfect spot for an afternoon with friends, a romantic date, or a classy bridal shower. We were smitten with the perfectly mismatched china and eclectic setting. This place is essentially an antique shop that serves tea. I'm pretty sure if my grandmas were British, they would be sitting in a place like Lovejoy's sipping on some tea and petting their furry kitties.

Quick tips:
- Make reservations because seating is limited and due to its popularity, Lovejoy's accommodates very few walk-ins. 
- There is a two hour maximum seating time and they will kindly inform you that your time is up and you need to bounce (not in those exact words).
- Use the restroom before you leave! Trust me, with all of that tea you're gulping down, you don't want to risk it. 

Pinkies up!

excerpts: and I have to say that (aside from the "crumpet") it was amazing.
The crumpet...well...the crumpet was actually an english muffin from Kinnikinnick.
A good try, but no match to a real crumpet.
I didn't finish my gluten free version...and I almost always finish everything on my plate...
so that's saying something.
crumpet.author: Jennie C.
crumpet.review:
I finally had a chance to try Lovejoy's gluten free Queen's Tea and I have to say that (aside from the "crumpet") it was amazing.

Yes, this place gets crowded...the place was packed for their 11 am seating on a Sunday and people were lined up outside 15 minutes before the place opened. It's crowded for a reason. The food is great and the kitschy-ness makes it so fun to have tea here.

Our server was very friendly and always made sure our teapots were full. The service flowed seamlessly.

The gluten free scone was warm and soft. It had a nice flavor and the lemon curd, preserves and clotted cream complimented it well. 

The gluten free bread was seriously THE BEST gluten free bread I have ever eaten. In fact, I'm not even sure if it was gluten free (okay, I am...the bread was brown in color and still had the crusts on; my dining partner had wheat flour based bread and the crusts were removed). But seriously, THE BEST gluten free bread I have ever eaten. I had the cucumber cream cheese and one of their daily specials...I think it was a turkey and chutney. I'd skip the turkey and chutney concoction and head for the salmon mousse to go along with cucumber cream cheese next time. 

The cabbage salad with caraway is a favorite of mine. I've always enjoyed it. I've tried to replicate it at home...but I can never make it the same. 

I always enjoy the delicate green salad with the vinaigrette. 

The fruit was fresh.

The tea biscuit was tasty. 

The crumpet...well...the crumpet was actually an english muffin from Kinnikinnick. A good try, but no match to a real crumpet. I didn't finish my gluten free version...and I almost always finish everything on my plate...so that's saying something. Not bad, but not really worth eating toward the end of my tea service. 

Instead of a petit four, I received a gluten free cake pop...and to my delight it was lemon. I love all things lemon, so this was perfect. It was moist and lovely. It was actually the first cake pop I ever had. They weren't popular back in the days when I was eating gluten and now that they've made their way into many markets, I hadn't had a chance to try one until I had the Queen's Tea at Lovejoy's. 

In short, a lovely tea experience. I am already making plans to head back. 

Call at least 4-6 weeks in advance to get the weekend seating of your choice. They're often booked many weekends in a row and if you're hoping to get a last minute reservation, you might just be out of luck. 

I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room. They're my favorite tea room in the Bay Area...even before I was gluten free...and now that they have such a wonderful gluten free tea service I am beyond a fan. 

GO! Make a reservation NOW!

excerpts: I've been to Crown & Crumpet in Japantown before but the food/tea here is WAY better.
crumpet.author: Tania S.
crumpet.review:
Can you say CAYOOT with a capital Q? First and foremost, I'm an avid Downtown Abbey viewer so I love the idea of high tea in all its fancy glory. This place is in the heart of Noe Valley, walked by it a million times but finally came around to trying it. The decor reminds me of the Shabby Chic collection with the crocheted pillows and floral patterns. I've been to Crown & Crumpet in Japantown before but the food/tea here is WAY better.

Normally, there's a long wait but if you get there early enough you might be able to skip the line. We got there right when it opened so we were seated immediately. We ordered the "High Tea" service with the Mango, White Peach (my favorite), Chamomile and Peppermint teas. I loved the sandwiches and the scones were ultra fluffy and yummay. I wasn't a fan of the crumpets with the lemon curd but then again, I never have been a fan of crumpets to begin with. Also, I normally wouldn't have opted for the "Pear and Stilton" sandwich but it was delicious! The waitresses are all very friendly. Perfect place for a date with your girlfriends.

excerpts: Near the end, we got one crumpet and a petit four.
crumpet.author: Bahar A.
crumpet.review:
I liked it. It's a special occasion kind of place, and definitely not for those who want big hearty meals. 

I do wish they were more considerate with the portions of the pastries. We got the Queen tea that had a total of 4 sandwiches (hummus and cucumber and green apple and cream cheese). 

The scone came with a lemon curd and raspberry jam that accompanied the platter. Near the end, we got one crumpet and a petit four. The vanilla one was fantastic but sadly, it's $2.50 to add another. 

As for the tea, the black strawberry tea was quite enjoyable and fragrant. Note to share the tea, it's an extra $2. 

Over all the place is quite cute and something to do once in a while. However, if you don't want to get rushed near closing, go sooner in the day; the kitchen closes half an hour early.

excerpts: We also got a salad, scone, crumpet, biscuit, and chocolate each.
crumpet.author: Azeena H.
crumpet.review:
Came here with my mom. We both had a queens tea and it kept us full for the rest of the day. 

The waitress was well informed about the teas and suggested the chestnut. I loved it. 
We had a selection of four different sandwiches: salmon, salmon paste, turkey honey dijon, and hummus. My favorite was the salmon and hummus. We also got a salad, scone, crumpet, biscuit, and chocolate each. There scone is the best thing I have ever tasted. 

I would go back just for there scones. They are that good.

excerpts: With the two combined, we had a total of 4 different types of tea sandwiches, 2 pots of tea, salads, 2 scones, 1 crumpet, 2 checker cookies and slices of fruits.
My favorite was the scone.
It was buttery and of the perfect texture.
Everything else was tasty but not mindblowing.
Service was great though.
I loved the hostess and our server.
crumpet.author: Judy L.
crumpet.review:
Good for the price. Not the best tea I have had but one of the best for the price. We got the Queen's Tea and the High Tea. With the two combined, we had a total of 4 different types of tea sandwiches, 2 pots of tea, salads, 2 scones, 1 crumpet, 2 checker cookies and slices of fruits. My favorite was the scone. It was buttery and of the perfect texture. Everything else was tasty but not mindblowing. Service was great though. I loved the hostess and our server. Also, very cute tea sets with quirky tablecloths and decorations. 

Call ahead at least 2 weeks in advance to make sure you can get a reservation.

excerpts: The Queen's tea included 2 sandwiches, a scone, a crumpet, a petit four, the 2 types a salad and a bottomless teapot (they just top it off with hot water) for $29.
To this we added an extra scone ($2.50) and an extra sandwich ($4), we also got charged $2 for the extra person using the tea.
Overall a great and unrushed experience.
Seems to be popular for baby showers and such and when these groups are present it tends to get a little loud.
crumpet.author: Alisa Z.
crumpet.review: Great experience and something different to do for brunch. My friend and I split the Queen's tea and got a few extras. I didn't realize you can split a tea before coming here. The Queen's tea included 2 sandwiches, a scone, a crumpet, a petit four, the 2 types a salad and a bottomless teapot (they just top it off with hot water) for $29. To this we added an extra scone ($2.50) and an extra sandwich ($4), we also got charged $2 for the extra person using the tea. Overall a great and unrushed experience. Seems to be popular for baby showers and such and when these groups are present it tends to get a little loud.

excerpts: This means that you get to select a tea flavor--and it's bottomless, you get to pick two types of sandwiches (each sandwich is cut into four cute little pieces), you get a layer of fruit, a scone, a crumpet and a petite four cake.
crumpet.author: Myra H.
crumpet.review:
My sister took my mom and I here for tea for my birthday. It was awesome, cute, and delicious. We all had the Queen's Tea. This means that you get to select a tea flavor--and it's bottomless, you get to pick two types of sandwiches (each sandwich is cut into four cute little pieces), you get a layer of fruit, a scone, a crumpet and a petite four cake. 

They have a great selection of tea, I got the China Rose Petal tea--its a black tea, and taste good with a little sugar. It has a floral sweet taste YUMM. My mother got the Chestnut Tea-- black tea, it's rich in flavor and she had it with a little cream and sugar--similar to dessert :)  Lastly, my sister got the Black Lavender Jasmine Tea, this taste so good and smells amazing. We all had each others tea and were pretty hydrated by the end .

THE SCONE IS THE BEST, MAKE SURE IF ANYTHING, YOU GO HERE AND EAT A SCONE!

Also, their service is really good, they can answer all your questions and are so accommodating. If this is your first time, this is the place to go!!

excerpts: It included the following: choice of 2 sandwiches (turkey and shrimp sandwiches), spring salad, scone, crumpet, Petit four, and shortbread biscuit.
My faves were the crumpet and the lemon curd
spread
(i love anything lemony).
At the end we were asked to choose 2 Petit four, which is basically a dessert.
It's very small, but packed with sweetness.
crumpet.author: Karla Marie D.
crumpet.review:
Tea party anyone?

Came in here feeling like a little girl again. The eclectic design brings back so many childhood memories. Since Crown and Crumpets was closed because they were relocating, this was the next best thing. 

We came in on a Sunday afternoon. There was no wait, although I did make a reservation. The place is a little cramped for me, but still worth it. 

We had the "Queen's tea" ($27). It included the following: choice of 2 sandwiches (turkey and shrimp sandwiches), spring salad, scone, crumpet, Petit four, and shortbread biscuit. 

My niece had the "Wee Tea" ($16) which included the following: cream cheese and jelly sandwich, scone, fresh fruit, Petit Four, tea/hot chocolate.

My sister's bf had the "Tea Sandwich Plate" ($13) which included salmon and cucumber sandwiches. He also had a side of large coffee.

Our total came about to $70-ish (pretty hefty, if you asked me).

My faves were the crumpet and the lemon curd spread.. yum!!! (i love anything lemony). At the end we were asked to choose 2 Petit four, which is basically a dessert. It's very small, but packed with sweetness. I wanted to eat all of them since they looked so pretty, but sadly only two had the pleasure of my taste buds.

Overall, great experience, but pricey! I would come here again with my girls.

excerpts: Same as the High Tea but with the addition of fresh fruit, a crumpet with lemon curd, and a petit four.
Even though I was full after consuming the fruit, salad, coleslaw, sandwiches, and mass amounts of tea, I managed to make room for my scone (with currants) and crumpet.
Both were delicious with the devonshire cream and lemon curd.
I took my shortbread biscuit and petit four to go.
They bring out the petit fours near the end of the tea service for each person to pick one.
crumpet.author: Emily J.
crumpet.review:
Another perfect mother-daughter tea time. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/crown-and-crumpet-temporarily-closed-san-francisco#hrid:6FAE-J3uCt0c9lpTUeTBMQ)

I bought my mom a gift certificate for High Tea for Two (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lovejoys-attic-san-francisco#hrid:I-uCa9YzHcHbGTS7M9ewMA) but upon arrival, and after a quick peek at the menu, both my mom and I and our mother/daughter friends decided to go big with the Queen's Tea. 

*High Tea ($17.95; additional people $17/each): A bottomless pot of tea with choice of two sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, scones, preserves and devonshire cream, and a shortbread biscuit.

*Queen's Tea: ($24.95; additional people $24/each): Same as the High Tea but with the addition of fresh fruit, a crumpet with lemon curd, and a petit four. 

We each ordered a different tea so we could taste four different ones. I picked the Genmai Cha which I had taken a whiff of across the street at Lovejoy's Attic. It is a green tea with popcorn and rice in it. Yes, POPCORN and RICE. It sounds strange but it is now one of my new favorite teas. The popcorn and rice add a subtle nutty flavor. I also enjoyed a cup of both the apricot tea and a rose petal tea that two of my tea companions ordered. 

My mom and I ordered four different sandwich options to share. We got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, pear and stilton, chicken and asparagus and the special which was a turkey salad sandwich with cranberries and pecans. I like that both their High Tea and the Queen's Tea come with mixed greens with balsamic and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is light with the perfect amount of mayo and the surprising addition of caraway seeds. The fresh fruit included honeydew, orange and grapefruit slices, kiwi, strawberries and blackberries. 

Even though I was full after consuming the fruit, salad, coleslaw, sandwiches, and mass amounts of tea, I managed to make room for my scone (with currants) and crumpet. Both were delicious with the devonshire cream and lemon curd. I took my shortbread biscuit and petit four to go. They bring out the petit fours near the end of the tea service for each person to pick one. I chose a little hazelnut and chocolate cake which made for a delightful snack later that day. 

As if the wonderful tea and foods weren't enough, service was wonderful and the quirky mix-n-match furniture and table settings create the perfect ambiance for time spent with fabulous company.

excerpts: And should be slathered with the butter and the lemon curd, while the crumpet is still warm.
The butter will soak through the crumpet.
And so will the lemon curd.
crumpet.author: Courtney N.
crumpet.review:
I brought my British friend here (more like, forced him to teach me the ways of High Tea), and he was amused, to say the least, by the cutesy, lacey decor and the mismatched dishware. Let's just get over the fact that the decor is, well, a bit over the top, because the service and food are both excellent!

We ordered Queen's Tea for two: 
- Yorkshire Tea (amazing -- apparently quite difficult to find in the States, because I've been looking for this stuff ever since. Really, this is the only tea you'll ever need)
- Apricot Tea (paled in comparison to the Yorkshire tea)

- Chicken walnut salad sandwiches were delicious! Half white and half whole wheat bread, which is a nod to both tradition and current standards. Also had Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese, which sounds strange, but is absolutely delicious! Would highly recommend those two sandwiches
- The salad and coleslaw was okay -- they were skimpy on the mandarins, and the Caraway Cream Dressing was oddly bitter? Mayonaisse-y? Not my favorite part of the meal.

- I learned, finally, how to eat scones properly. And have a proper scone. Which aren't the scones from Starbucks, or wherever you get them. These scones are large and studded with blueberries and are warm, not flaky, like you'd think a biscuit sort of thing should be, but are meant to be cut down the middle, like a bagel, and spread with Devon cream (which isn't normal butter -- it's thicker and whipped and DELICIOUS) and then preserves. Amazing! Absolutely delightful. I'll never have a Starbucks scone again. 

- Crumpets. Oh my god. I don't even know what to say about these. There aren't American corollaries, but think of a biscuit, but not flakey. In fact, holey. And warm. And delicious. And should be slathered with the butter and the lemon curd, while the crumpet is still warm. The butter will soak through the crumpet. And so will the lemon curd. It's worth upgrading from High Tea to Queen's Tea to try this sucker out. 

- Fruit was good, pretty fresh and ripe, well cut
- The tea biscuit (which is just a lil tea cookie) was a bit disappointing
- You get to choose a Petit Four from a platter of many, and they were quite delicious! 

Don't forget to make reservations, at least a week or two in advance! They fill up quite quickly, and it's worth the brunch out with a date or with friends.

Overall, worth the experience and quite authentic, according to my friend.

excerpts: You have a choice of two tea sandwich selections: LOVE the delish Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese / Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise sandwiches served with coleslaw, organic spring greens, a scone, a crumpet, fresh fruit, a petit four and shortbread tea biscuit.
The tea room decor is quirky and whimsical filled with mismatched tea cups, saucers and teapots .
Excellent attentive servers.
crumpet.author: Susie L.
crumpet.review: Lovejoy's is a delightful and romantic place for Afternoon High Tea. The Queen's Tea is my all-time favorite. You have a choice of two tea sandwich selections: LOVE the delish Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese / Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise sandwiches served with coleslaw, organic spring greens, a scone, a crumpet, fresh fruit, a petit four and shortbread tea biscuit.  The tea room decor is quirky and whimsical filled with mismatched tea cups, saucers and teapots . Excellent attentive servers.  I highly recommend this "hidden gem" for high tea located in Noe Valley.

excerpts: If you order anything from Lovejoy's, get the Scone and Crumpet!
They constantly refill your tea, and you have about 2 hrs to chit chat..but really how much tea can your bladder hold?
crumpet.author: Terence N.
crumpet.review:
Finally came here for brunch and the experience is really amazing.  I sampled the high tea set, which pretty much comes with everything.  I am not a huge fan of tea sandwiches, the ones here are good but nothing great.  I sampled both black and rooibos tea, both are delicious, although I prefer the rooibos.  Black tea just tasted like black tea?  The ornaments and decorations are cute and pretty.  I got to say it was a bit too cramped inside, I understand there's not a lot of space in SF, but I was expecting more white table clothes and white everything.  This tea room is really laid back and cozy.  

My favorite are the scones, these suckers are absolutely delicious!  Reminds me more of a buttery biscuit, but it has the perfect texture.  Slap on some of their famous marionberry jam and extra butter, you are in heaven!  The crumpets are also really good, crispy outside with a soft chewy inside.  If you order anything from Lovejoy's, get the Scone and Crumpet!  They constantly refill your tea, and you have about 2 hrs to chit chat..but really how much tea can your bladder hold?  For dessert you get to choose a marzipan chocolate, if you like marzipan you will lose these, otherwise it will be really sweet for you.

You definitely need to make reservations here, we got lucky and came 30min before they open.  We got lucky and got the only non-reserved table left.  There was a line even before they opened doors!  Scone and Crumpets are delicious, I highly recommend sampling them!

excerpts: This is when you drop whatever you have in your hand, pick up your butter knife, thereupon smearing your butter over your nice hot crumpet and enjoy while it's fresh and hot.
Oh, believe me, it's worth getting enthusiastic about.
It's like if Lana del Ray arrived at your door at night offering to sing you some lullabies.
That exciting!!!
Notice she's my current and always and forever crush.
Anyway, you can of course devour that wonderous duo of crumpet and butter alone or savor it with a bit of lemon curd or strawberry jam.
You're royalty when you're here, so you can do as you well damn please ;)
You will also get a petite four at the end of you
're meal.
crumpet.author: Amethyst Popkiss A.
crumpet.review:
I'll start with the ambiance. This place is very quaint, original, old Victorian. 5 stars for making me feel like I'm in old England. Mix matched furniature, tea saucers, cups, and teapots, lace table cloths, victorian floral couches, vintage bookshelves, chairs, and vanities. This all adds to the unique style that is Lovejoy's. I would say more velvet would be nice, but that's just me... 

The menu. 5 stars for being super delicious & beautifully arranged every single time I come here. I always get the Queen's Tea, which includes three tiers of fanciful goodies. The top tier has a varity of fruit, including grapes, pineapple, strawberry, kiwi, and orange. The middle tier has scones, double devonshire cream, strawberry jam, and lemon curd plus two cookies. The bottom tier has tea sandwiches of your choice (you pick two kinds), coldslaw, mixed greens with arugala, and their house vinegarette, which is pretty creamy & tangy. I usually always order the salmon and cream cheese, and either the stilton pear and cream cheese or roast beef and horseradish tea sandwiches! So delicious & flavorful. 

Let's not forget your choice of tea, which you will get with sugar and milk, all served in an assortment of fun, floral dishware & a huge teapot. I opt for black tea, preferably what is known as the "Champagne of all teas," which they call Afternoon Darjeeling here at Lovejoy's. In my opinion, it is one of the more sophisticated teas that exist, and it is amazingly smooth, and just feels good going down (get your mind out the gutter lil' nasty). Afternoon Darjeeling tastes like assam tea and oolong tea mixed together, but it is a thin-bodied, hence the smooth sailing down the piehole... It tastes like a vacation! They do have a large variety of fun herbal teas, black, white, and green teas. I have tried a variety of their teas. Wish I reviewed them back then. Sorry guys! But the rose black tea is also awesome.

Service: the servers are always very nice, not extra nice, but they serve you right. Sometimes it is very busy, and they don't have time to charm you because, well, the tearoom itself can entertain you and the company of your choice should entertain you. They do get 5 stars for service. They keep everything short and sweet! Your will arrive at your table "reserved for rotalty" with a pretty plate of hot crumpets and butter during the middle of your meal. This is when you drop whatever you have in your hand, pick up your butter knife, thereupon smearing your butter over your nice hot crumpet and enjoy while it's fresh and hot. Oh, believe me, it's worth getting enthusiastic about. It's like if Lana del Ray arrived at your door at night offering to sing you some lullabies. That exciting!!!! Notice she's my current and always and forever crush. Anyway, you can of course devour that wonderous duo of crumpet and butter alone or savor it with a bit of lemon curd or strawberry jam. You're royalty when you're here, so you can do as you well damn please ;) You will also get a petite four at the end of you're meal. They usually have the option of strawberry, white wedding cake (my fav), esspresso, rice crispy treat, chocolate and apricot, among others I forget at the moment. 

Come to this lovely little tea room, you'll notice your pinky will automatically go up as you drink your cup of tea. It's not a mystery, it will just happen. Don't question it. Enjoy!

excerpts: I've come here a couple times because the feminine overtones are toned down in comparison to places like Crown & Crumpet.
crumpet.author: David S.
crumpet.review:
It is grandma's attic, but somehow, it still surprises me to see so many mother daughter combos. I've come here a couple times because the feminine overtones are toned down in comparison to places like Crown & Crumpet.

Service here is generally nice, but I noticed the underbelly of a commercial operation the last time I stopped in. I heard an older woman, who looked to be a manager, telling staff something like, "Only an hour per table." Someone came over and up-sold me a dessert on top of the "Light Tea" I ordered.

Then a staffer asked that I get off my cell phone, which I suppose would have made sense if it was a quiet day. But it wasn't. And I hate people on cell phones pretty much everywhere, so I understood, but it happened to be my birthday and I was sitting alone, so a friend called to take pity on me. I told the waitress, and she gave me a free dessert with a candle. *And* they took off from my bill the dessert they hocked. So, good on them for trying to right the situation.

This place tends to book reservations a week in advance, so call early. Having said that, I came in on a weekday without notice and they sat me immediately. The food is overpriced but delicious. The tea is fabulous. I don't ever feel rushed, even if I get the sense they might be rushing.

excerpts: there was also a green salad, fruit, cookie, crumpet & scone (as if a crumpet or a scone isn't enough.)
at the end there was a petite fore, i could only eat half of the little thing.
i was just stuffed.
i had it with the house tea which was amazing.
oh, and they served clotted cream (which is like butter...but better) with the crumpet.
crumpet.author: lori s.
crumpet.review:
OMG!  lovejoy's was AMAZING!  AMAZING!

i went on a friday around 2pm and it was packed.  they sent us across the street to their little boutique and called us in about half an hour.  watch out for the boutique.  it's over priced and everything is adorable.

i went w/ one other person.  we both had the queen's tea.  she had the turkey and roast beef sandwiches and i had the roast beef and egg salad.  she was luke warm about the turkey but LET ME tell YOU! the roast beef sandwiches and egg salad sandwiches could not be beat.  i'm SUPER fussy about egg salad but something told me it was gonna be good and something did not lie.  the queens tea also came with this amazing, tangy slaw.  i always hate slaw b/c it's hardly ever perfect but this was far beyond.  there was also a green salad, fruit, cookie, crumpet & scone (as if a crumpet or a scone isn't enough.)  at the end there was a petite fore, i could only eat half of the little thing.  i was just stuffed.  i had it with the house tea which was amazing.  oh, and they served clotted cream (which is like butter...but better) with the crumpet.

when i left i had a food coma.  from there the food coma turned into a food hang over.  it was decadent.  it's kind of funny b/c you don't really see men in there.  i don't know why that is.  but you know what?  good! more for us ladies.  you're not manly enough for lovejoy's tea, you don't get any.

it's a really nice thing to do for a special occasion.  the service was great, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was just right.  it was a food experience.

excerpts: Last year we went to Crown and Crumpet.
I thought their teas were tasty and their food too.
At Crown and Crumpet, we had to cut those 1/4 sandwiches in half
so we can both try the different sandwiches.
crumpet.author: Sarah C.
crumpet.review:
My friend Connie came here before and told me about how great it is. Last year we went to Crown and Crumpet. I thought their teas were tasty and their food too. It is a bit hard to compare two different styles. 

I made reservations about a couple days in advanced for Saturday at 4pm. I called a couple times hoping to talk to an actual person but always getting voicemail. I left a voicemail stating my reservation information and left a contact number. Within 30 minutes I got a call back to confirm. Hint: Although they open til 6 the last seating is 4.30pm. 

I am really glad I made reservations as when I got off the J train it looked like there was a lot of people. 

We ordered the light tea for two since both ate lunch. 
Light Tea - Your choice of one sandwich, served with a scone, preserves, and Devon cream, Fresh fruit and shortbread tea biscuit $17.95 (Additional light teas can be added for $17.00) 

I like how you can actually pick your sandwiches. I picked the shrimp and mayo whereas my friend cream cheese & mandarin oranges. Both was good! Tasty! The crusts were removed and the left overs are cut into fourths. At Crown and Crumpet, we had to cut those 1/4 sandwiches in half so we can both try the different sandwiches. It sure is a lot of work to cut small sandwiches even smaller. 

The scones really filled me up but they were really good. I like the scone and the short bread. 

Overall, the food was good and surprisingly filling. We didn't eat anything else for the rest of the night. 

The teas got really bitter fast! The herbal forest berries/rosehips was very strong. It reminded me of those ice teas you buy at walgreens. I didn't like it. 

The service here is good but I felt like we were rushed out. Who wants to work longer than they have to? I can't blame them.

excerpts: I didn't really care for the crumpet or the petit four, although the petit fours are very pretty.
crumpet.author: Emily Y.
crumpet.review:
Great tea little tea room. They were able to seat us during this busy holiday season and we did not have reservations.  I do recommend that you make reservations if you plan to enjoy a delightful tea service. We should have but thought that maybe we would be okay because we came earlier on a Thursday. 

Service is wonderful. There are a variety of tea services, teas, and tea sandwiches available or you can order a la carte.  The scones are great and so is the fresh fruit. There are also heartier dishes available if you or someone else is not in the mood for tea sandwiches. I didn't really care for the crumpet or the petit four, although the petit fours are very pretty.

excerpts: The crumpet was delicious and loved the fruit on the top of my tower.
crumpet.author: Amy O.
crumpet.review:
Pretty good place. I like that they have quite a few options on the menu, especially that my gluten free vegan friend had options as well!

The sandwich options were great. I ordered the cheese and chutney one as well as the pear and stilton. Okay, the pear and stilton was to die for and the other one...well, it has potential. The chutney is really good, but it is super strong. The cheese on that sandwich doesn't stand a chance. A more strong cheddar would be perfect for the sandwich to pair up next to the chutney.

I ordered the Queen's Tea because I wanted two sandwiches. It came with cole slaw and salad which are both a little random. Could have passed on both. I like those things, but not for tea. The crumpet was delicious and loved the fruit on the top of my tower.

There were less tea options than I am used to, but plenty to choose from. I had a green decaf since it was already mid-afternoon. It was delightful. Service was also great..she came by to refill out tea pots.

excerpts: We went to Crown and Crumpet a few months back.
She suggested to bring me here for my 25th birthday because she's been here a few times and thinks it's better than C&C.
The place is small and has a quirky mismatching decor all around.
This place is cheaper than Crown and Crumpet, but I do think the decor there is prettier/girlier/fancier.
crumpet.author: Rosanne L.
crumpet.review:
Tip: You must make reservations for this place or they will not seat you! Reservations more than a week in advance recommended too!

My best friend and I are really into tea places. We went to Crown and Crumpet a few months back. She suggested to bring me here for my 25th birthday because she's been here a few times and thinks it's better than C&C. The place is small and has a quirky mismatching decor all around. The service is exquisite.

We sat down and our server was warming. She took our orders and answered all the questions I had. We both ordered the Queen's Tea with an apricot tea and china rose petal black tea. I love the apricot but milk and sugar was needed. It smells delicious though! Wasn't a huge fan of the china rose petal. I felt it was too floral. 

Our food came pretty quick and soon enough, I was munching on tiny triangular-shaped sandwiches. I got the roast beef & horseradish sandwich along with the smoke salmon and cream cheese. My BFF got a turkey and cranberry. I am usually not a fan of cranberry, but I took a bite of her sandwich and I think it was my fave out of the three. The roast beef was slightly dry and bland.

The scones and pastries were good and fruits were fresh. I loved the crumpets, as usual. Buttery and with extra cream on top! Yum!

This place is cheaper than Crown and Crumpet, but I do think the decor there is prettier/girlier/fancier.


We saw an elder pair of granny's and we hope that it would be us in another 50 years :)

excerpts: The crumpet that was served at the end wasn't bad either but by then I was stuffed suprinsingly because I thought I wouldn't be full from the looks of it initially.
crumpet.author: Rosaline C.
crumpet.review:
So I was really excited to try this place with a few of my girlfriends on a nice sunny Sunday. We made reservations ahead of time *HIGHLY RECOMMENDED* since this place is tiny and seems to be very busy at all times. The decor is very country imagine a scene from Alice in Wonderland where all the tableware, china and teacups do not match. Everyone in my party ordered the Queen's Tea since it was our first time there we wanted to try everything. It was $24.95 per person and we get our own pot of tea and a bunch of different things for us to sample.  

The presentation was really nice tall and filled with tons of mini treats.  The coleslaw lacked flavor. The crumpet that was served at the end wasn't bad either but by then I was stuffed suprinsingly because I thought I wouldn't be full from the looks of it initially. Rosaline's recommendations:-

-Mango Black Tea
-China Rose Petal
-Chicken & Asparagus Sandwich
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Sandwich
-EggSalad Sandwich
-Scones (make sure to load it with the devon cream and jam!!!)

So final recap if you come to Lovejoy make sure to try the SCONES and their CRUMPETS and spread the lemon creme all over. The reason why I gave it 3 stars is because the sandwichs was nothing special especially when I noticed they used Safeway branded breads and also my tea wasn't hot enough. If  I come back I wouldn't order the Queens tea again.  Till next time eat laugh and say YUM-O!!!

excerpts: I got the "Me Service" since I had lunch before our tea service, so I just got the shortbread and petit fours and a crumpet with meyer lemon.
Delicious!
crumpet.author: Quynh-An P.
crumpet.review:
I came here for a birthday party a few weekends ago.  I was really worried since I'm actually not allowed to have caffeine and I wasn't sure what the situation here would be in terms of teas I could drink.  I usually stick with ginger or peppermint tea since I know those are safe, but I didn't see them on the menu.  Good thing though!  I opted for the Forest Berries and Rose Hips.  This is the best tea I've had in a long time.  It's like sipping candy and it made me smile!  I loved it so much I rushed across the street afterward and bought two bags of this tea!

I got the "Me Service" since I had lunch before our tea service, so I just got the shortbread and petit fours and a crumpet with meyer lemon.  Delicious!  Everyone else was raving about the scones with the cream (I didn't have any) and the sandwiches look so cute.

One of my friends had the truffle chocolate tea and he added a splash of milk and proclaimed it was like drinking chocolate milk.  Yum!

I definitely want to come back here with my girlfriends at another time!

excerpts: it sucks because I love crown and crumpet, but I hate that you can't choose your sandwiches, etc.
So I thought I'd try Lovejoy's, and I didn't want this review to be a compare and contrast to crown and crumpet but
in my honest opinion, crown and crumpet is just the better choice.
oh and for reference, we came from stockton, took the bart from dublin/pleasanton, and got off on 24th and mission and took a 4 minute cab ride to church and clipper.
easy peasy!
crumpet.author: ren u.
crumpet.review:
My sister and I came in for a spot of tea a few weeks ago. the decor is very.. shabby chic. I am not generally a fan of this, but my sister really liked it. We got first pick of our table so we picked the table with the most comfy looking chairs near the window. We chose the queen's tea for two. I was pleased that you are able to choose your sandwiches, we chose:
chicken apple walnut: best sandwich!
special: chicken pesto: very good!
turkey and dijon mustard: meh. it was ok
Onto the teas. 
 we picked vanilla rooibis or however you spell it and the berry harvest thingie. It tasted like warmed up fruit punch. I did not like the selections of teas, it might just be me, but i feel like other places have better selections. the Vanilla was okay though! 

the scones were delicious of course, i liked the sandwiches. I too, thought the coleslaw is totally random. I asked if we could sub the coleslaw and greens for fruit, they said no. ugh. I hate when establishments say no to customers. the petite fours were okay, Actually, I guess everything was kind of just okay. it sucks because I love crown and crumpet, but I hate that you can't choose your sandwiches, etc. So I thought I'd try Lovejoy's, and I didn't want this review to be a compare and contrast to crown and crumpet but in my honest opinion, crown and crumpet is just the better choice. 
oh and for reference, we came from stockton, took the bart from dublin/pleasanton, and got off on 24th and mission and took a 4 minute cab ride to church and clipper. easy peasy!

excerpts: I had picked here because the Crown & Crumpet is in the process of moving, and couldn't have picked a better place.
The food was wonderful, a good variety, including both vegetarian and gluten free options.
The chicken and asparagus tea sandwich was amazing!
crumpet.author: Amanda L.
crumpet.review:
Went here for my birthday/father's day, and absolutely loved it! I had picked here because the Crown & Crumpet is in the process of moving, and couldn't have picked a better place.
The food was wonderful, a good variety, including both vegetarian and gluten free options. The chicken and asparagus tea sandwich was amazing!  The crumpets and scones were so good.
I love that the teacups, saucers and teapots are all different patterns and don't match, it adds a unique feel to the room.
The service was wonderful, everyone was polite and very prompt. I even got a birthday treat!
I will definitely be returning here in the future!

excerpts: I liked the crumpet - but none of my friends did.
A very fluffy and pancaky english muffin.
Slather  generous portions of butter, devonshire cream, lemon curd, and raspberry jam to get something truly amazing.
but I like the crumpet, and only the salmon sandwich.
The fennel/caraway coleslaw salad was very good.
I didn't care about the green salad or the fruit on top.
I would have had the coleslaw, scone, and crumpet again.
crumpet.author: Derek C.
crumpet.review:
The decor of this place is super cute.  I love all the different teapots and the mismatched plates and tea equipment.  The atmosphere is really nice.

Service:  We went on a very rainy day.  So it wasnt so crowded.  We had a reservation and even though it wasn't crowded, I highly recommend making a reservation.  There is a 2 hour maximum in which a table has time to eat - and there is a good reason for that - I am guessing most if not all, maximize this 2 hour.  We stayed until 10 minutes after closing.  The wait staff were super polite and accomodating.  They didn't rush us, and offered boxes.

Food: The food is really good here.  Obviously this isn't a foodie's choice if you are a hipster.  The scones though, man, it was so warm and fluffy and so good. The sandwhiches I had were:
Salmon and Cream Cheese: My favorite one by far, super flavorful.  Any of their sandwhiches with salmon is good.
Chicken and Walnut Salad:  A review recommended this.  It was quite bland and there really wasn't much to it.  Don't bother with this.
Sandwich of the day - Ham and Mango Chutney:  I thought this was pretty meh too.  An interesting combination at first, but nothing amazing.
I liked the crumpet - but none of my friends did.  A very fluffy and pancaky english muffin.  Slather  generous portions of butter, devonshire cream, lemon curd, and raspberry jam to get something truly amazing.  Those crumpets have holes for a reason.
The petit four - You have four option, a sugar cookie, some mini cupcakes and 2 types of marzipan mini cakes.  The plum rose marzipan cake was overwhelmed by the marzipan.  However the bittersweet orange one had a good balance of marzipan and flavor.  That one was good, We didn't bother with the other options as they seemed very plain.
All in all, if we did this, my friends agreed they would only do Tea and Scones, because really those were the highlights. but I like the crumpet, and only the salmon sandwich.
The fennel/caraway coleslaw salad was very good.  I didn't care about the green salad or the fruit on top.  I would have had the coleslaw, scone, and crumpet again.  But just one sandwiches(salmon) and no petit four.

Tea:  I tried the passion fruit tea.  It was very pleasant.  
I wasn't impressed by the masala chai.  But My god - I forgot what my friend got - I think the royal blend.  I never had tea like that before. The flavor was really complex, fruity and it even felt like there were multiple blends of black tea.  I was also very impressed by the black vanilla.  I had so many vanilla type teas I rolled my eyes when I saw the menu.  But when I tried my friends cup, I was blown away.  The vanilla flavor wasn't anything I have tasted before.  I hate it when I have vanilla tea or flavored anything because it just reminds me of extract.  This felt like a different species of vanilla, and tasted very organic and felt very "infused" 

My biggest regret is that they offered to give the remains of the tea in the pot to go.  and I thought it silly to take it with me.  Now I am having massive cravings for the royal blend and the black vanilla and I can't do anything about it.

Price doesn't usually affect my yelp reviews.  But for four people all ordering Queen's Service - it came out to $35.00 with tax and tip included.  Please do not come here to just try the tea and food, this really is a social and dining experience.  Come with good friends and make sure you order different teas(they are bottomless teas anyway!)

excerpts: (ahem, Crown & Crumpet, take note).
crumpet.author: Sannie L.
crumpet.review:
I had an absolutely wonderful experience here with my friends. It was our first time coming to one of these tea places and we left satisfied and happy. They have choices that are more affordable (ex. a la carte items, tea sets of different prices) and this allows for more flexibility so you can tailor what you order to how hungry you are, how much money you're willing to spend, etc. (ahem, Crown & Crumpet, take note).  I believe we had the High Tea for four and this came with bottomless pots of tea for each of us. Their scones are so freaking delicious! I want some right now just thinking about it. Even though I discovered that Earl Grey was not my thing, I still thoroughly enjoyed the other teas at the table. 

When we arrived we were met with absolutely excellent service. They were friendly and patient when we had no idea what to order. I loved the interior, even though space was a bit limited. They had shelves full of trinkets, teapots, and things that made it feel very home-y. It was packed the day we went because it was a weekend but we had reservations so no problems there.This is my go-to place when I want to get tea. Great service, good food and tea, cozy environment.

excerpts: I guess this place is too "grandma" for me compared to Crown and Crumpet.
It's small here, and the food isn't even good.
crumpet.author: Karen H.
crumpet.review:
Came here for a bridal shower. I guess this place is too "grandma" for me compared to Crown and Crumpet. It's small here, and the food isn't even good. Service is slow and everything was super dusty. 

I still had fun with my friends, but the sandwhices were not fresh and they didn't give us different teas fast enough. The salad was wilted. Nothing seemed fresh and our space was so cramped. 

Since the bridal part paid, I don't know how much it cost, but not my type of place.

excerpts: The Queen's tea adds a crumpet, a petit four, and a lot of fresh fruit.
crumpet.author: Lis B.
crumpet.review:
I absolutely adore Lovejoy's.  It is the quintessetial tea room.  Girly, dainty, chintzy, and oh-so-English, it's a definite winner.

Gentlemen:  enter at your own risk.

I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.  The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.

With both teas, you get your choice of tea sandwiches (I love the pear/blue cheese and the apple/cream cheese), tea (they're all good!), warm scone (with lemon curd, jam and clotted cream), coleslaw, spring salad (with mandarin oranges) and shortbread cookie.  The Queen's tea adds a crumpet, a petit four, and a lot of fresh fruit.  

All of the tea cups and saucers are mismatched, making it all completely adorable.  It's all for sale, too.  Just ask (they also have a shop with everything for sale across the street).  

I like sitting near the front, near one of the windows.  It's especially nice if you can get a seat on the banquette and tuck yourself in.  The place is always packed, and it's good to be able to observe the fray, rather than be a part of it.  Speaking of packed, reservations are a necessity.

The waitstaff is always friendly and helpful, although they sometimes look a bit beleaguered.

And the best part about coming here?  In addition to the delicious tidbits I hear from my friends over tea, I always end up hearing little snippets of other people's conversations (hey, the place *is* small), and I've learned more about complete strangers than I ever wanted to know.  Something about the tea must make them open up and spill all their secrets!!

excerpts: My favourite was the crumpet though.
They brought it out later, freshly out of the toaster.
Amazing texture - crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside.
crumpet.author: Steph L.
crumpet.review:
Lovejoy's is such a charming place to go for high tea. It's a place you would wear your Sunday clothes to, complete with grandma's pearls, hat, and lace gloves. Their mismatched tea sets add a nice quirky touch too!

In addition to their tea service, they also serve standard British fare like sausage rolls, ploughman's, pasties, shepherd's pie, and quiche. My mom and I shared a shepherd's pie and a Queen's Tea.

The SHEPHERD'S PIE was amazing! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=PeTed6UBTWeBk7jEVkTkLw) Perfectly seasoned ground beef topped with creamy mashed potatoes. And pretty too! The mashed potato is artfully swirled onto the top - details like this really add to their charm :)

The QUEEN'S TEA (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=A8V8DoiszacJREq7-b0w0g) was pretty good. It came with everything I wanted to try. I had a really hard time choosing the sandwiches because they had such a big selection! (Not that I'm complaining). The coleslaw and spring greens were aiight (I'm not what you would call a "salad girl"). The scone and tea biscuit were also good, but mostly because of the fabulous fruit preserves and lemon curd. My favourite was the crumpet though. They brought it out later, freshly out of the toaster. Amazing texture - crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. We also got our choice of petit four at the end and I chose the cutest one (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=dZd79TtAvold1OhQdyiesQ).

All in all, Lovejoy's is a great place to go for afternoon tea - charming neighbourhood and decor, unpretentious, good selection of food, and not ridiculously overpriced.

excerpts: I wasn't too fond of the crumpet that was served.
It was too big and hard to chew.
crumpet.author: Sharon Y.
crumpet.review:
I miss having tea time with my stuffed animals, thankfully there is this place where I can still pretend play. It was pretty accessible by BART (stop at 24th and mission) and a good 5 minute walk up hill from the station to Church Street that definitely worked up my appetite!!!

 This quaint cozy tearoom is an excellent place to catch up with a good friend. It's like walking into a vintage doll house and I couldn't stop snapping photos.

The waitresses were more than friendly to help snap photos for 2 giddy girls posing with their pots of tea and sandwich platters too.  If you don't like your tea cup or plates you can go choose another set from any that are placed out. Thankfully we arrived at an earlier time than the bustling period and were seated without reservation but they say its generally good to get a reservation.

Love Joy's is known for their tea services. When coming here I had to do it right and chose to order the Queen's tea even though it was a bit pricey. BUT for this kind of atmosphere and spending quality brunch time with a friend it was worth it and a treat to myself! 

In the Queen's tea , of course a bottomless pot of tea is included. I opted to get the Black mango tea after much debate between the other contenders of the pomogrante green tea and the blood orange. I do like fruit teas alot!!! My friend got the pom green so it was a win/win. They allow you to have a whiff of the dry tea leaves first to help with the tea selection but trust me the dry tea leaves do not do the black mango tea justice.

 Dry tea leaves are a bit musky but when it was steeped and poured out you can smell and definitely taste the mango scent and presence.  It was very fragrant and I liked that stand alone without the milk and sugar it still tasted delicious and I actually prefer it that way than with the additions.

 Being a tea junky I had 2 pots!!!! I love that the waitress comes from time to time to check if the tea is still hot otherwise they bring you a fresh hot pot back. 

Within the Queen's tea you get a choice of 2 sandwich selections.  My friend got the savory tea so we got to taste a total of 4 types of sandwiches.  They quarter the sandwiches into adorable bite size triangles. 
We selected the following:
1) Chicken-Apple-Walnut- You could taste the crispness of the apple still. The ratio of the 3 items were good and the mayo wasn't overly lathered to mask the individual flavors. 

2) Pear Stilton- With my recent discovery that I actually like blue cheese I got this one. The stilton was so creamy and gave such a great nutty taste and the pear was thinly sliced and retained the crunchiness still. It's a perfect combo! 

3)Cream Cheese and Mandarin Orange- this one was just ok, cream cheese and canned oranges. 

4) Love joy's daily special ( that day it was a smoked trout w/ capers). I loved smoked fish!!! The capers weren't too salty and the smoked trout definitely had the spotlight and wasn't masked. 

along with the sandwiches I also had a wonderful warm scone that was flaky and crumbly enough. I liked the strawberry preserve that came with it and used the lemon curd on it as well. The double devon cream was ok used in moderation but a thick slab of it on the scone was too rich for me. 

The queens tea also comes with fresh fruit , spring greens salad and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is interesting as its the first time i had fennel seed in one. It was pretty good. 

I wasn't too fond of the crumpet that was served. It was too big and hard to chew. Icouldn't cut it apart.

The sugar cookie /shortbread  was made perfectly and lightly dusted with sugar.

Last was the selection of a petit fours. I chose the orange creme one that had a ribbon of dark chocolate in it. It was a bit too sweet for me so when I come back next time I'll probably get the triple dark chocolate one which was the runner-up. 

The morning passed quickly into afternoon spent here chatting with my friend and we both enjoyed the service and hospitality. I would definitely bring my friends back here for a Girls day out. 

P.S: they give you a 10% off coupon if you visit Love Joy's attic found across the street if you like to bring back a souvenir of the tea you had or various tea cups pots etc.
