cream tea.review:
This place is way too cute. I want to have all my parties here!

I came here with my friend and luckily we got a seat because I don't think my friend made a reservation. The place filled up quick. I got the cream tea with a choice of tea that I cannot exactly remember right now because there's such a huge selection of teas. I wanted to try all of them! Okay, first off, I loved the decoration of this place. I loved the cute tables and chairs, I loved the cute table clothe, and I loved the cute teapots, and plates that served our food. The cream tea choice came with scones, devon cream, and fresh fruits. Omgosh, the scone took my breath away. It was melted in my mouth. I was expecting something super sweet, but nope, it was just perfect. Not too sweet, but not too bland. And the cream and jam were all so good that I kept trying to add both on the scone for every bite. When the tea came out, we had the chance to add our own sugar and cream, so I loved that. I had control over how much diabetes I wanted to give myself. jk. It was fun getting the chance to customize my drink. 

Overall, I really loved coming here. The atmosphere is great, the service is so friendly, and the food is to die for.

excerpts: Since we got there so late, we had the Cream Tea where got to Choose a Tea(Apricot)
cream tea.author: Genevieve Y.
cream tea.review:
Date & Time:  Friday June 6, 2008 @ 5:15pm(they close at 6pm and the last seating is at 5pm, so I recommend coming earlier, but they were so kind to seat us.)
Company:  Michael who gave up Happy Hour to Accompany Me Here
Crowd:  Groups & Twosomes of Ladies @ Tea Time
Atmosphere:  Tea Party we've Dreamed of as Children Come to Life
Decor:  Utterly Charming!  Everything is Precious from the Apricot Window Curtains, Pale Yellow Walls, Seating Areas to the Unique Red Phone  Booth, Paintings and  Porcelain Teacups that Accent this Beautiful Room.  Small Wooden Tables covered w/ Doiley's and Cushioned Wooden Chairs and Benches along w/Seating Sections w/ Sofas, Wooden Loveseats, Coffee Tables and Comfortable Upholstered Chairs.  Very Cozy!
Service:  Very Warm, Helpful, Attentive.
Imbibe:  White Peach Tea!  Vast Selection including Apricot, Passionfruit & China Rose Petal Black Tea.  Served in Unique Teapots w/ Porcelain Cups & Saucers.  Thoughtful Touch!
Devour:  More than A Dozen Types of Tea Sandwiches such as Cucumber & Cream Cheese & Bay Shrimp 
Scones, Crumpets, Short Bread Tea Biscuits.  A Combination of All of The Above is Availabe in High Tea also for Two and Queen's Tea.  Wee Tea for children 10 and under.  
Notes:  Towards the End of this Wonderful Tea Time Experience, the Very Beautiful and Sweet Server Visits Each table with a Tray of Scrumptious & Various Petit Fours where we can Choose the Flavor of our Choice!  I got the Milk Chocolate w/ Apricot and was trying to Signal Michael to get the Strawberry Shortcake,  but he got the Nut Brownie cause it was huge, so we took the rest home!
Side-Notes:  Since we got there so late, we had the Cream Tea where got to Choose a Tea(Apricot), 2 Delicious Scones served with Preserves & Devon Cream and Fresh Fruit.
Total:  $71.38 w/o Tip
More Notes:  This Place is Very Popular on Weekends so Make Reservations since they Host a Number of Baby Showers!  They do reserve a few tables for walk-ins.  For the reserved tables they put up a cute little sign on a silver stand w/ "Reserved for Royals".

excerpts: We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones).
cream tea.author: Melissa B.
cream tea.review:
I went to Lovejoy's Tea Room on one of my weekly "mommy-daughter" days. My mom and I went to enjoy a morning tea. We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones). I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast. 

The decor was so cute and quaint and the service was extremely friendly and helpful! Most of the good tables were reserved for a special party, but they did have a couple open tables for walk-ins. It was a bit cramped since they try to accommodate so many people, which is why I am only giving four stars, but my mom and I are both pretty small so it didn't bother us too much. I really enjoyed my experience here and seeing as how I love going to tea, this was a great outing for a cheaper price than other tea parlors I have been to. 

Overall great experience and can't wait to go back!

excerpts: The best cream tea I've had in America!
cream tea.author: Ashley W.
cream tea.review:
Yum!!  The best cream tea I've had in America!

My friends were also very pleased with their Savory Tea and crumpets.

Only drawback is that it's VERY crowded and a little noisy depending on what sort of groups are there (we had a children's birthday party and a baby shower in addition to other customers), which doesn't really make it the perfect place to linger over your bottomless pot of tea.  We still had a great time, and the quality of the food and the cheerful attitude of all of the staff made up for the crowd.  In spite of all the patrons, the service was very good - hardly any wait and never a cold pot of tea.  Ambiance and china were good.  

If you want to make sure you can get a table, call for a reservation very far in advance, especially on the weekends.  We didn't call early enough to get a reservation, but fortunately, they are pretty able to accommodate small groups of walk-ins.  Our wait was about 20 mins., and it passed very quickly as we browsed in their cute shop across the street.

I hope to go back to Lovejoy's when we're in SF next - just hope to be able to plan it at a time when they're not as busy.

excerpts: My friend got the Cream Tea with Apricot Tea.
I should have gotten the Cream Tea, because my friend's scones were pretty filling and tasty, and I actually ended up wanting fruit after having my tea.
cream tea.author: Angeline P.
cream tea.review:
I came here hoping for a great experience, and for the most part, it wasn't a horrible experience until I got up to go to the bathroom, but more on that later.

My friend from Korea was visiting, so I thought this place would be a cute little place to catch up and snack after her flight landed. I made a reservation, and as soon as she landed, we took the J-church down here without incident, and the place was pretty easy to find.

They reserved us a seat on the couch, which was a cute place to sit (albeit a little bad for sitting up straight to eat), so that was nice of them. The menu is a little overwhelming with a bajillion choices, but I ended up ordering the Savory Tea, which included bottomless tea (I picked Vanilla Rooibos) and two sandwiches (I picked shrimp and mayo and smoked turkey and dijon mustard). My friend got the Cream Tea with Apricot Tea. 

Don't get me wrong, the sandwiches were tasty. I just didn't get very many of them, which, admittedly, is the point of tea. I should have gotten the Cream Tea, because my friend's scones were pretty filling and tasty, and I actually ended up wanting fruit after having my tea. So it was a case of ordering the wrong thing, which isn't necessarily something I would penalize Lovejoy's for. 

After getting pretty full off tea, I needed a bathroom break. So I walked into the back, and caught a glimpse of the kitchen where I saw a loaf of bread sitting on the counter. And that was when everything was shattered. It wasn't like, nice white bread. It was Safeway white bread. The kind you can pick up at any Safeway for about $2 a loaf. And then when I thought about it, it wasn't worth it. The sandwiches were good, but they weren't $15 for 8 small triangles good (including unlimited tea). I could have gone to Safeway and made my own delicious shrimp/mayo, turkey/mustard sandwiches. And the ambiance was good, but I couldn't shake the feeling of being made very well aware that I was out of place, that I didn't belong here. The servers were nice enough, but I felt like unless you were pretty acquainted with ordering tea, you would feel kind of uncomfortable ordering and asking questions.

And after that, nothing was the same. It's like that loaf of Safeway white bread broke the illusion, and I was able to see this place for what it was. And I wasn't that impressed, and will probably never come back unless I have a friend who is REALLY into tea. Otherwise, it's just too far and too awkward for me to venture out here.

excerpts: Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea.
Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout.
cream tea.author: Erin M.
cream tea.review:
Girly perfection. Very Victorian, very tasty and very adorable. My gal-pals and I celebrated a belated Christmas gift exchange at Lovejoys. We called earlier in the week for a Sunday reservation, but they said they were booked. However, I popped in at about 1pm on Sunday and was able to score a table that would be ready in about a half hour. Perfect! 

We crowded into the back corner on a couch (and chair), which is perfect for us. We were able to giggle and be our usual obnoxious selves. Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea. Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout. Fresh fruit was perfect and ripe, scones were super-tasty. We were actually full after two hours of delicate edibles and never-ending tea. 

Aside from slightly cramped quarters and the occasional freakishly heavy teapot, Lovejoy's a great, girly afternoon. I'm definitely taking my mom here the next time she's in town.

excerpts: Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones.
The scones are good.
cream tea.author: Mister K.
cream tea.review:
Went here for the first time with our 18 year old daughter. It was a fun time, and she loved it. The cuteness of the place, the outfits the servers wear...all that was just right, as you'd expect it to be. And, it didn't feel like a chain - more like someone's creative idea for a restaurant. They could even go more British...play some Henry Purcell in the background or something. Have pictures of the horse races.

Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones. The scones are good. My wife got the high tea, which comes with sandwiches. They were fine, but nothing particularly great. Right, it was probably Safeway bread, not some freshly baked bread. 

The tea is good quality. Perhaps not insane quality, but good quality.

I had the Stilton and pear salad, which was very good. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but perfectly good for the moment. I suppose you'd never waste a really top-notch Stilton this way, but for the salad, the cheese tasted good.

All in all, a fun thing to do, and we'll hope to come back.

excerpts: We always get cream tea for two (scones and fruit, with a bottomless pot of your choice of tea), with a side of tea sandwiches.
I particularly like the stilton and pear sandwiches, but most of them are great.
cream tea.author: Andrew H.
cream tea.review:
This is a really fun place to have tea. It's often estrogen heavy (filled with women in flowery clothing with a couple sheepish looking guys thrown in), but if you can get over the girly decor, it's great. Teas are good, service is very friendly and quick, and they have delicious tea sandwiches, particularly tasty scones, and petit-fours for dessert.

We always get cream tea for two (scones and fruit, with a bottomless pot of your choice of tea), with a side of tea sandwiches. I particularly like the stilton and pear sandwiches, but most of them are great. All the black teas we've had there were pretty good, and the atmosphere is fun.

It's super crowded all the time, I recommend making reservations, especially on weekends. We're lucky enough to live nearby so we just walk in and if there's a long wait, we go somewhere else.

excerpts: Indulging for a spot of cream tea is something I didn't think I'd get to do again after moving back to the US from England.
cream tea.author: Alissa L.
cream tea.review: Wonderful is the only way to describe each visit to Lovejoys! As a huge fan of English tea, nothing gets the fix like a pot of Lovejoys blackcurrant. Indulging for a spot of cream tea is something I didn't think I'd get to do again after moving back to the US from England. The scones, crumpets, and clotted cream are always top-notch, the service bright and helpful, and the decor is as cute as it gets. I can't recommend this place enough if you're after an unapologetically girly indulgence.

cream tea.review:
very chintz-y...like victorian living magazine threw up a little, but with a definite element of kitsch.

i heart this place. i like the aprons the ladies wear.

i think i used to order the 'cream tea'. that clotted cream for the scones rocks my world. 

i can't wait to visit sf again so i can go here.

Okay, cool - that sounds fun and yummy.

The "selection" showed up...a cute, colorful variety of teeny tiny cake bites...and we were allowed to choose ONE.
For all four of us.

What the heck?!
It's basically the same deal at the Secret Garden tea place.
I love the tea tradition, but I am really baffled and annoyed by the stingy servings, especially given that people generally go to tea in groups.
Plural.
Sheesh.

excerpts: Savory tea ($14.95) - 2 sandwhich options w/ choice of tea.
Had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, which was a bit much for me.
savory tea.author: Christine C.
savory tea.review:
Really enjoyed my time here.  Cute atmosphere perfect for couples and a friends get together. If you're looking for a well done afternoon tea experience without it being super pricey, this is the place to go. Definitely recommend, especially for tea time newbies. 

~~details of my experience~~

Order (for 2):

Ploughmans Lunch ($16.95) - cheese platter with salad, fruits, hummus, toast and chips. Very tasty and pretty filling. Nice as a sharing platter. 

Savory tea ($14.95) - 2 sandwhich options w/ choice of tea. Had the smoked salmon with cream cheese, which was a bit much for me. Also got smoked turkey with Dijon mustard, which I loved.

"Me" tea ($15.95) - basically the option to mix and match what you want w choice of tea. I choose to get a scone and crumpet served wit lemon curd, sweet butter and raspberry jam. All very tasty. 

Fruit salad ($8.95) - very nicely put together although did not come with as much fruits as expected. A bit pricey for the amount of fruits served.

Tea choices:

Darjeeling - A good complement with the food. Not a too heavy tea. Quite enjoyed it.

Tea House Blend - A nice blend w a slight bitter aftertaste. Not one of my favorites but adding milk and sugar still made it pretty tasty. Slightly heavier tea flavor. 

Service: 

Fantastic service. Servers were warm and attentive. Food arrival was fast. Tea pot was constantly refilled without having to ask. 

Atmosphere:

Cute, old-timey and comfy. If you are looking for classy and luxurious, I suggest the Laurel Court afternoon tea at the fairmont in SF, but if you are like me, this lovely quirky little tea house is perfect.

Overall: 

One of best afternoon tea experiences. Many tea places lack quality food, but Lovejoys has both the tea time ambience that we look for and the well prepared food items. Really recommend a group party to go with the Ploughmans lunch.

excerpts: With the Savory Tea package, you get two sandwich choices.
I chose the classic Smoked Salmon with Cream Cheese and their special of the day, the Prosciutto and Pear.
Their portions may appear rather small, like they always do at tea parties, but they definitely fill you up.
savory tea.author: Alexis G.
savory tea.review:
My love for tea houses has grown incredibly since I tried this place yesterday. It was just like having a tea party as a kid, but an actual sized tea set and real food. 

They have a wide variety of teas. I tried the Black Vanilla with Lavender, and it was like getting a hug in your stomach. (All teas should make you feel as zen and comforting as this.) Their food selection was too perfect. With the Savory Tea package, you get two sandwich choices. I chose the classic Smoked Salmon with Cream Cheese and their special of the day, the Prosciutto and Pear. Their portions may appear rather small, like they always do at tea parties, but they definitely fill you up. Their crumpets come with a lemon curd, and they both definitely complemented one another. Lastly, the scones. Those will be the primary reason (besides their teas) as to why I return probably next week. And the jam that came with them completed their already perfect taste. 

It's a cute, little quiet spot to hang out and have afternoon tea whether you're with friends or having some me time. The next time I go here, I'll probably be flying solo for a bottomless pot and their amazing scones.

savory tea.author: Steph L.
savory tea.review:
" Sorry Honey, but the jam is not homemade. I just saw a jar of Smuckers in the back." - my girlfriend who came back from the restroom!

Teas Worthy of Trying:
-Passonfruit Black Tea (aromatic, but has a stronger/darker taste)
-Mango Black Tea (very aromatic)
-Pomegranate Green Tea (light, couldn't really taste the pomegranate)
-English Tea (if you like milk tea - this is your cup of tea)

I had the Savory Tea (2 types of sandwiches + Pot of Tea), selected the LoveJoy's Special (Turkey + Cranberries) and Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese.  The Smoked Salmon was extremely salty (which is very consistent to previous reviews by other yelpers).  Turkey and Cranberry Sandwich was very simple, nothing special.

I'm not a scone person, but I was able to sample some.  The scones were exceptionally fluffy and light with the perfect hint of raspberries.

Since it was one of my girlfriend's birthday, LoveJoy's complimented the birthday girl with one of the petit four + candle (which was a definite bonus).

Definitely make a reservation before coming!  Service is exceptional! Parking wasn't too horrible - near residential area. 

Maybe High Tea is just not my cup of tea.

savory tea.author: Sharon Y.
savory tea.review:
I miss having tea time with my stuffed animals, thankfully there is this place where I can still pretend play. It was pretty accessible by BART (stop at 24th and mission) and a good 5 minute walk up hill from the station to Church Street that definitely worked up my appetite!!!

 This quaint cozy tearoom is an excellent place to catch up with a good friend. It's like walking into a vintage doll house and I couldn't stop snapping photos.

The waitresses were more than friendly to help snap photos for 2 giddy girls posing with their pots of tea and sandwich platters too.  If you don't like your tea cup or plates you can go choose another set from any that are placed out. Thankfully we arrived at an earlier time than the bustling period and were seated without reservation but they say its generally good to get a reservation.

Love Joy's is known for their tea services. When coming here I had to do it right and chose to order the Queen's tea even though it was a bit pricey. BUT for this kind of atmosphere and spending quality brunch time with a friend it was worth it and a treat to myself! 

In the Queen's tea , of course a bottomless pot of tea is included. I opted to get the Black mango tea after much debate between the other contenders of the pomogrante green tea and the blood orange. I do like fruit teas alot!!! My friend got the pom green so it was a win/win. They allow you to have a whiff of the dry tea leaves first to help with the tea selection but trust me the dry tea leaves do not do the black mango tea justice.

 Dry tea leaves are a bit musky but when it was steeped and poured out you can smell and definitely taste the mango scent and presence.  It was very fragrant and I liked that stand alone without the milk and sugar it still tasted delicious and I actually prefer it that way than with the additions.

 Being a tea junky I had 2 pots!!!! I love that the waitress comes from time to time to check if the tea is still hot otherwise they bring you a fresh hot pot back. 

Within the Queen's tea you get a choice of 2 sandwich selections.  My friend got the savory tea so we got to taste a total of 4 types of sandwiches.  They quarter the sandwiches into adorable bite size triangles. 
We selected the following:
1) Chicken-Apple-Walnut- You could taste the crispness of the apple still. The ratio of the 3 items were good and the mayo wasn't overly lathered to mask the individual flavors. 

2) Pear Stilton- With my recent discovery that I actually like blue cheese I got this one. The stilton was so creamy and gave such a great nutty taste and the pear was thinly sliced and retained the crunchiness still. It's a perfect combo! 

3)Cream Cheese and Mandarin Orange- this one was just ok, cream cheese and canned oranges. 

4) Love joy's daily special ( that day it was a smoked trout w/ capers). I loved smoked fish!!! The capers weren't too salty and the smoked trout definitely had the spotlight and wasn't masked. 

along with the sandwiches I also had a wonderful warm scone that was flaky and crumbly enough. I liked the strawberry preserve that came with it and used the lemon curd on it as well. The double devon cream was ok used in moderation but a thick slab of it on the scone was too rich for me. 

The queens tea also comes with fresh fruit , spring greens salad and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is interesting as its the first time i had fennel seed in one. It was pretty good. 

I wasn't too fond of the crumpet that was served. It was too big and hard to chew. Icouldn't cut it apart.

The sugar cookie /shortbread  was made perfectly and lightly dusted with sugar.

Last was the selection of a petit fours. I chose the orange creme one that had a ribbon of dark chocolate in it. It was a bit too sweet for me so when I come back next time I'll probably get the triple dark chocolate one which was the runner-up. 

The morning passed quickly into afternoon spent here chatting with my friend and we both enjoyed the service and hospitality. I would definitely bring my friends back here for a Girls day out. 

P.S: they give you a 10% off coupon if you visit Love Joy's attic found across the street if you like to bring back a souvenir of the tea you had or various tea cups pots etc.

excerpts: The place is pretty pricey though, I ordered the savory tea, comes with choice of 2 sandwiches, came out to $18 with tax + tip, and the sandwiches were okay.
The salmon mousse was good, a little salty, but the chicken walnut was a little runny with too much mayo.
savory tea.author: Grace L.
savory tea.review:
This is such a cute place! came here with the ladies for a book club meeting and what a great place for our purpose.  

Bottomless teas and friendly staff and food came out quickly.  The place is pretty pricey though, I ordered the savory tea, comes with choice of 2 sandwiches, came out to $18 with tax + tip, and the sandwiches were okay.  The salmon mousse was good, a little salty, but the chicken walnut was a little runny with too much mayo.  Tea was delicious!

Overall, a great place to hang out with the girls, it's a little pricey, but your'e really paying for the ambience.

excerpts: We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones).
savory tea.author: Melissa B.
savory tea.review:
I went to Lovejoy's Tea Room on one of my weekly "mommy-daughter" days. My mom and I went to enjoy a morning tea. We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones). I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast. 

The decor was so cute and quaint and the service was extremely friendly and helpful! Most of the good tables were reserved for a special party, but they did have a couple open tables for walk-ins. It was a bit cramped since they try to accommodate so many people, which is why I am only giving four stars, but my mom and I are both pretty small so it didn't bother us too much. I really enjoyed my experience here and seeing as how I love going to tea, this was a great outing for a cheaper price than other tea parlors I have been to. 

Overall great experience and can't wait to go back!

excerpts: My friends were also very pleased with their Savory Tea and crumpets.
savory tea.author: Ashley W.
savory tea.review:
Yum!!  The best cream tea I've had in America!

My friends were also very pleased with their Savory Tea and crumpets.

Only drawback is that it's VERY crowded and a little noisy depending on what sort of groups are there (we had a children's birthday party and a baby shower in addition to other customers), which doesn't really make it the perfect place to linger over your bottomless pot of tea.  We still had a great time, and the quality of the food and the cheerful attitude of all of the staff made up for the crowd.  In spite of all the patrons, the service was very good - hardly any wait and never a cold pot of tea.  Ambiance and china were good.  

If you want to make sure you can get a table, call for a reservation very far in advance, especially on the weekends.  We didn't call early enough to get a reservation, but fortunately, they are pretty able to accommodate small groups of walk-ins.  Our wait was about 20 mins., and it passed very quickly as we browsed in their cute shop across the street.

I hope to go back to Lovejoy's when we're in SF next - just hope to be able to plan it at a time when they're not as busy.

excerpts: The menu is a little overwhelming with a bajillion choices, but I ended up ordering the Savory Tea, which included bottomless tea (I picked Vanilla Rooibos) and two sandwiches (I picked shrimp and mayo and smoked turkey and dijon mustard).
savory tea.author: Angeline P.
savory tea.review:
I came here hoping for a great experience, and for the most part, it wasn't a horrible experience until I got up to go to the bathroom, but more on that later.

My friend from Korea was visiting, so I thought this place would be a cute little place to catch up and snack after her flight landed. I made a reservation, and as soon as she landed, we took the J-church down here without incident, and the place was pretty easy to find.

They reserved us a seat on the couch, which was a cute place to sit (albeit a little bad for sitting up straight to eat), so that was nice of them. The menu is a little overwhelming with a bajillion choices, but I ended up ordering the Savory Tea, which included bottomless tea (I picked Vanilla Rooibos) and two sandwiches (I picked shrimp and mayo and smoked turkey and dijon mustard). My friend got the Cream Tea with Apricot Tea. 

Don't get me wrong, the sandwiches were tasty. I just didn't get very many of them, which, admittedly, is the point of tea. I should have gotten the Cream Tea, because my friend's scones were pretty filling and tasty, and I actually ended up wanting fruit after having my tea. So it was a case of ordering the wrong thing, which isn't necessarily something I would penalize Lovejoy's for. 

After getting pretty full off tea, I needed a bathroom break. So I walked into the back, and caught a glimpse of the kitchen where I saw a loaf of bread sitting on the counter. And that was when everything was shattered. It wasn't like, nice white bread. It was Safeway white bread. The kind you can pick up at any Safeway for about $2 a loaf. And then when I thought about it, it wasn't worth it. The sandwiches were good, but they weren't $15 for 8 small triangles good (including unlimited tea). I could have gone to Safeway and made my own delicious shrimp/mayo, turkey/mustard sandwiches. And the ambiance was good, but I couldn't shake the feeling of being made very well aware that I was out of place, that I didn't belong here. The servers were nice enough, but I felt like unless you were pretty acquainted with ordering tea, you would feel kind of uncomfortable ordering and asking questions.

And after that, nothing was the same. It's like that loaf of Safeway white bread broke the illusion, and I was able to see this place for what it was. And I wasn't that impressed, and will probably never come back unless I have a friend who is REALLY into tea. Otherwise, it's just too far and too awkward for me to venture out here.

excerpts: I had the savory tea which comes with two sandwiches and a bottomless pot.
I chose the vanilla rooitis tea, turkey and dijon sandwich, and cheese and tomato sandwich.
I also ordered a chicken curry pastie.
All were so delicious!
savory tea.author: Kristi D.
savory tea.review:
I went here today for lunch and highly recommend it! 

I had the savory tea which comes with two sandwiches and a bottomless pot. I chose the vanilla rooitis tea, turkey and dijon sandwich, and cheese and tomato sandwich. I also ordered a chicken curry pastie. All were so delicious! All of this for about 20/30 bucks which seemed well worth it! 

The decor is really cute and girly, it's a great place for lunch with girlfriends or a celebration although I'd also come here on a date-night with my bf.

I think it would be neat to add some cordials or champagne to the mix although I do recognize that this is a tea-house and not a bar so it's probably considered inappropriate. 

I recommend reservations even in the middle of the day on a weekday unless you don't mind a bit of a wait!

I was surprised at the lack of a wait for the loo considering all the tea consumed! 

I will definitely come back here in the future. :)

excerpts: I ordered the HEALTHY TEA ($20), which was a large platter consisting of salad, carrots and cucumber, fruit, walnuts, crackers, cream cheese and an option of smoked salmon or artichoke hummus.
healthy tea.author: Jessie L.
healthy tea.review:
Solid afternoon tea. Nothing particularly special about the food or even the tea, but Lovejoy's has that cozy afternoon tea vibe and is a good spot for catching up with a friend or gathering for a birthday. It's definitely more about the company and experience than the actual food or tea.

That being said, it's kind of an expensive experience, with the cheapest tea services being about $20 and the full tea service (Queen's Tea) being $30. It's easy to make a similar experience at home for much less, but obviously without the quirky decorations around.

I ordered the HEALTHY TEA ($20), which was a large platter consisting of salad, carrots and cucumber, fruit, walnuts, crackers, cream cheese and an option of smoked salmon or artichoke hummus. Perfect if you want something lighter or if you're not into the usual scones, crumpets and sandwiches.

For my tea, I got the Black Vanilla with Lavender, which was recommended by our waitress. Couldn't really taste the lavender but it had a subtle sweetness reminiscent of vanilla. They're very good about refilling your tea pot so it's really bottomless.

Note that they do have a 2 hour limit on the tables! There's also only 1 bathroom and a consistently long line so don't wait until the last moment to get in line.

excerpts: We got the queen's tea and healthy tea.
$2.00 tea charge for each person.
We got the caffeine free berry tea and ceylon decaf.
This was a 4 pm reservation
so we watched our caffeine intake.
Ordered a side of sausage puff which was delicious.
healthy tea.author: Helen L.
healthy tea.review: Let's start from the beginning.   Try getting a group of 6 to decide on the date and time.  Once done, go online to their website and fill out the form.  Then i get an email to confirm date and time with Lovejoy.  Then gave them my credit card to reserve this time and date.  I was told as long as i call to cancel my credit card won't be used.  Closer to the date i got a reminder text and a reminder call.  This reflects how much they want us to show up..  Unfortunately, only one could not come.  I wasn't charged and they were super nice about it.  We got the queen's tea and healthy tea.  $2.00 tea charge for each person.  We got the caffeine free berry tea and ceylon decaf.  This was a 4 pm reservation so we watched our caffeine intake.  Ordered a side of sausage puff which was delicious. Love the lemon curd, almond paste petit four, homemade scone and crumpets, loved the ambiance, the bone china,  and the tea strainer.  Extra scone is 2.95.  Crumpet was spongy and warm.  Devonshire cream was yummy.  Tiny cup of coleslaw.

excerpts: I ordered the "Healthy Tea", which was ginormous!
I consider myself a big eater with a bottomless stomach, but I could not finish the plate--excuse me, I mean platter!
The Healthy Tea came with one of the most delicious hummus (hummi?)
healthy tea.author: Kym M.
healthy tea.review:
I was looking for a kitschy tea room for my birthday, and Lovejoy's fit the bill exactly. We went on Halloween and all the waitresses even dressed up as men with mustaches ("We thought it would be funny to dress up as men since there are hardly any that come here.")

I ordered the "Healthy Tea", which was ginormous! I consider myself a big eater with a bottomless stomach, but I could not finish the plate--excuse me, I mean platter! The Healthy Tea came with one of the most delicious hummus (hummi?) I've ever tried and the yogurt brought out the sweetness of the strawberries and was a soft accompaniment to the crackers and veggies.

We also had the High Tea at our table, and the sandwiches, cookies, and such were all delicious. No complaints.

I'm not much of a tea connoisseur, so I'll just say that I ordered the Blood Orange Herbal Tea, and it tasted exactly as such.

The only complaint is that we sat next to a glass china cabinet and there was a picture inside of Barack Obama. They need to take that out. . .It ruins the whole atmosphere.

...Also have to add...We were there around closing time, and we felt a little rushed, so we hurried out. We were sitting outside for awhile waiting for our ride, and when we got home, we realized we had left our box inside the tea room on the couch. I don't know why they couldn't have given it back to us while they were cleaning up inside and we were waiting just outside the door.

excerpts: Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.
All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.
healthy tea.author: Tera M.
healthy tea.review: Planned my best friend's birthday party at Lovejoy's for 6 of us, and ended up having 7 - they accommodated us with no problem.  The decor was cute, quaint and perfect for a ladies tea party.  It sort of reminded me of Alice in Wonderland with its mismatched cups and whimsical style.  Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.  All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.  Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.  The service was good, and we all had a great time.  I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!  Oh, and the price was very reasonable.

excerpts: I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea.
The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me.
I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea.
Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over.
light tea.author: Katie C.
light tea.review:
Simply put, I love Lovejoy's Tea Room.

Just entering the tea room, I felt incredibly happy and giddy. Although the decor consisted of beautiful mismatched items, it was still in good taste. There are hats available for you to wear during your tea time. 

I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea. The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me. I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea. Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over. We were well taken care of by the staff. 

I made a reservation for two about a month in advance. I highly recommend you make a reservation, especially if you are planning on coming on a weekend. 

The tea room is perfect for all types of parties: couples, parents with their young children, and friends catching up.

excerpts: I got the light tea.
The second time I came, I ordered the light tea but added a crumpet on the side.
I think that I liked this tea service a lot better.
It still made me full and instead of the salad, there was fruit.
I think that it was nice to have some sweet.
light tea.author: Tina Y.
light tea.review:
It's such a cute experience! 

I think that out of all the tea rooms that I've been to, this one is the best. I came here twice in the span of two weeks because I know so many of my friends have always wanted to try this. 

Once I got the high tea and another time I got the light tea. 

When I got the high tea, you can get two sandwiches. I picked the artichoke hummus/arugula and the roast beef with horseradish. Both of these sandwiches were good and they were a good balance to each other. It came with a salad and scone. It kept me surprisingly full! 
I picked the white strawberry tea. It was so yummy and light. I didn't add any cream or sugar into it at all. I think it was too light for the cream and sugar. 

The second time I came, I ordered the light tea but added a crumpet on the side. I think that I liked this tea service a lot better. It still made me full and instead of the salad, there was fruit. I think that it was nice to have some sweet. The salad from the high tea didn't excite me in anyway. The sandwich that I got for this tea service was the chicken walnut. I think I would have went with another sandwich for next time. I got the decaf mango black tea. It got pretty strong after sitting for a while. I didn't add cream and sugar when it was lighter, but my second and third cup I put in the works. 

I would say that this is kind of pricey for what it is, but this place is really more for the experience more than anything. It's nice food to chat over.

excerpts: My friends had the Queen and Light Tea set.
and I honestly would've been okay with the Light Tea set.
We reserved this place a week ahead on a Sunday and used up the two hour seating limit.
Overall, a fun little place for a catch up sesh.
We paid about $90 between the four of us with each of our tea sets.
light tea.author: Angelie A.
light tea.review: It's a cutesy little place to go for a Sunday brunch. The service and ambiance was great. They have tea sandwiches that was surprisingly filling. Also, maybe it was because of the pot of tea refills that made us feel full. My friends and I each ordered our own sets which was waaaayyy more food than we anticipated. My friends had the Queen and Light Tea set. I had the High Tea and I honestly would've been okay with the Light Tea set. We reserved this place a week ahead on a Sunday and used up the two hour seating limit. Overall, a fun little place for a catch up sesh. We paid about $90 between the four of us with each of our tea sets. I suggest getting two Queen tea or High tea sets for 4 people instead of each of your own. Make sure to check out their "attic" across the street for some tea set goodies!

excerpts: I got the "Light Tea" with the cucumber sandwiches and loved everything on my plate!
light tea.author: Nicole W.
light tea.review:
Lovejoy's is one of the cutest places in SF! I went here with my book club and had such a great time! We ordered variations of the tea service and all got the "bottomless teapots". I got the "Light Tea" with the cucumber sandwiches and loved everything on my plate! The sandwiches, scones, and fruit were a perfect amount of food. It was also so fun to learn more about tea amidst the eclectic decor!

The servers were very sweet and took great care of us. One even shared a heartwarming story about how she got the infamous "cat teapot." Apparently you can request it :)

Love Lovejoy's!

excerpts: THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea.
This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us.
light tea.author: Ziyan C.
light tea.review:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

* Fresh Fruit - 3 stars
Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice. 

* Petit Four - 4 stars
full platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#JSpHOzIStSs32UFby1oYIw
cross-section of our choices: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#k3_KeW_0tv5f41UvRFRtJw
We got a dark chocolate/lemon, as well as a rosewater. The chocolate one wasn't great, the jelly-like lemon filling not as sharp as I'd hoped. The rose-water soaked bread-like filling of the other one was great, and we all liked that one much more.

* Tea Biscuit - 3 stars
Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies. 

* Crumpet with Lemon Curd - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Fj33P7RuOhTOwxyb5OtVJQ
LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy. The outside is a little more crisped as well. Great with combinations of the lemon curd, butter, and blackberry preserves!

* Warm Scone with Preserves & Devon Cream - 3.5 stars
Not quite warm. Tasty but a little bit on the dry side. Love the combos of cream and blackberry preserves, that's the way to have it!

Tea Room Menu Top Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#vFpyqGqPd3Y8rupGqEqLkA
Tea Room Menu Bottom Half: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#Y5Hot1gL66ruNvftbceu-g
Black & Black Flavored Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#tWZwzJRJcZ60PfCdcf0TWA
Decaf, Green/White, Tisanes Teas: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#hDdEmd8WwMj2wwDd8t7gTQ

excerpts: I loved my Light Tea selection that came with my selection of a cucumber and cream cheese finger sandwich (childhood bliss) and the best freshly baked red currant scone I have ever had in my life!
Add Devon cream, fresh fruit and a pot of Earl Grey--delightful.
light tea.author: Linda A.
light tea.review: Wonderful gathering spot for 3 Generations from 2 coasts! Window Table was set and ready for our reservation. Quirky, eclectic table settings and decor lent to a fun and indulgent excursion! I loved my Light Tea selection that came with my selection of a cucumber and cream cheese finger sandwich (childhood bliss) and the best freshly baked red currant scone I have ever had in my life! Add Devon cream, fresh fruit and a pot of Earl Grey--delightful.

excerpts: We ordered 1 light tea, 1 high tea and 1 queen's tea.
It was more than enough for 3 people.
We were a little sad that they didn't have macarons, but they did have a lot have cute hats that you can borrow to take photos in!
light tea.author: Michelle C.
light tea.review: Had a great time coming here with my friends. YAY for having gluten free options! (Even it does cost a little more) We ordered 1 light tea, 1 high tea and 1 queen's tea. It was more than enough for 3 people. We were a little sad that they didn't have macarons, but they did have a lot have cute hats that you can borrow to take photos in!

excerpts: I suggest ordering their "Light Tea" choice if you are wanting a satisfying, yet lighter type of lunch.
light tea.author: Anna B.
light tea.review:
The cutest English tea room I've ever been to! 

The service is fast and they serve the finest scones, sandwiches, and tea. I suggest ordering their "Light Tea" choice if you are wanting a satisfying, yet lighter type of lunch. 

The meal fees are pricey, but it is certainly worth it for the serene ambience, elegant décor and furniture, and marvelous tasting tea food this place provides. 

Also, be sure to make reservations a week in advance. It will save you time and is far more beneficial in the long run.

excerpts: I got the light tea, which included a bottomless pot of tea of your choosing, two sandwiches of your choosing, and a warm scone with cream and preserves.
The staff are very nice, the food and tea are lovely, and afterwards you can go across the street and browse their collection of antiques.
Overall, going here was a very enjoyable experience, surprisingly kid friendly, and we will definitely return on a later date.
light tea.author: Virgil W.
light tea.review:
This is a very charming, lovely place to sit down and have a cup of tea. They can seat you as a walk-in, or you can make reservations for a specific table ahead of time. I got the light tea, which included a bottomless pot of tea of your choosing, two sandwiches of your choosing, and a warm scone with cream and preserves. The staff are very nice, the food and tea are lovely, and afterwards you can go across the street and browse their collection of antiques.
Overall, going here was a very enjoyable experience, surprisingly kid friendly, and we will definitely return on a later date.

excerpts: Someone came over and up-sold me a dessert on top of the "Light Tea" I ordered.
light tea.author: David S.
light tea.review:
It is grandma's attic, but somehow, it still surprises me to see so many mother daughter combos. I've come here a couple times because the feminine overtones are toned down in comparison to places like Crown & Crumpet.

Service here is generally nice, but I noticed the underbelly of a commercial operation the last time I stopped in. I heard an older woman, who looked to be a manager, telling staff something like, "Only an hour per table." Someone came over and up-sold me a dessert on top of the "Light Tea" I ordered.

Then a staffer asked that I get off my cell phone, which I suppose would have made sense if it was a quiet day. But it wasn't. And I hate people on cell phones pretty much everywhere, so I understood, but it happened to be my birthday and I was sitting alone, so a friend called to take pity on me. I told the waitress, and she gave me a free dessert with a candle. *And* they took off from my bill the dessert they hocked. So, good on them for trying to right the situation.

This place tends to book reservations a week in advance, so call early. Having said that, I came in on a weekday without notice and they sat me immediately. The food is overpriced but delicious. The tea is fabulous. I don't ever feel rushed, even if I get the sense they might be rushing.

excerpts: We ordered the light tea for two since both ate lunch.
Light
light tea.author: Sarah C.
light tea.review:
My friend Connie came here before and told me about how great it is. Last year we went to Crown and Crumpet. I thought their teas were tasty and their food too. It is a bit hard to compare two different styles. 

I made reservations about a couple days in advanced for Saturday at 4pm. I called a couple times hoping to talk to an actual person but always getting voicemail. I left a voicemail stating my reservation information and left a contact number. Within 30 minutes I got a call back to confirm. Hint: Although they open til 6 the last seating is 4.30pm. 

I am really glad I made reservations as when I got off the J train it looked like there was a lot of people. 

We ordered the light tea for two since both ate lunch. 
Light Tea - Your choice of one sandwich, served with a scone, preserves, and Devon cream, Fresh fruit and shortbread tea biscuit $17.95 (Additional light teas can be added for $17.00) 

I like how you can actually pick your sandwiches. I picked the shrimp and mayo whereas my friend cream cheese & mandarin oranges. Both was good! Tasty! The crusts were removed and the left overs are cut into fourths. At Crown and Crumpet, we had to cut those 1/4 sandwiches in half so we can both try the different sandwiches. It sure is a lot of work to cut small sandwiches even smaller. 

The scones really filled me up but they were really good. I like the scone and the short bread. 

Overall, the food was good and surprisingly filling. We didn't eat anything else for the rest of the night. 

The teas got really bitter fast! The herbal forest berries/rosehips was very strong. It reminded me of those ice teas you buy at walgreens. I didn't like it. 

The service here is good but I felt like we were rushed out. Who wants to work longer than they have to? I can't blame them.

excerpts: I got the Light Tea Set.
The roast beef and horseradish sammy was delish.
light tea.author: Angela D.
light tea.review:
A cute and cozy place for tea time with your girlfriends! 
I got the Light Tea Set. The roast beef and horseradish sammy was delish. English breakfast tea was awesome with milk. Their scones are addicting and the cream/jam I kept on piling on!

Overall, it is kind of expensive for tea  ($17.95) but it was a fun time before going off to see Beach Blanket Babylon :)

excerpts: If you don't care about the greens, you can get the light tea, that will come with fres fruit.
The scone is heaven with the cream.
My friend says you can only find it at one grocery store in SF.
I need to remember which one ggrrrr.
light tea.author: Pam S.
light tea.review:
Came here for tea with my lovely girlfriends.  Who said mix and match are not fun?  This place is exactly that but it all came together perfectly.  It feels like you just walked in one of your friend's house and chit chated about life over tea and snacks.

A lot of knick knacks all over the place so your eyes and conversations will sure be entertained.

Reservations only!

I had the high tea - choice of two sandwiches, salad, scone and biscuit.  If you don't care about the greens, you can get the light tea, that will come with fres fruit.  The scone is heaven with the cream.  My friend says you can only find it at one grocery store in SF.  I need to remember which one ggrrrr.   Our afternoon tea was served with bottomless tea.  

We also ordered some sausage rolls but it felt out of place and the taste was so-so.

For $20, why not spend a couple hours at Lovejoy's with your besties ;)

excerpts: We usually get the light tea, which includes: sandwich, scone, preserves, and double devan cream with fresh fruit and a shortbread tea biscuit.
I usually get the smoked turkey and dijon mustard, VERY good.
light tea.author: Marylouise R.
light tea.review:
My gal pals and I have been going here for the last 4 years and we just adore it!  We usually get the light tea, which includes: sandwich, scone, preserves, and double devan cream with fresh fruit and a shortbread tea biscuit.  I usually get the smoked turkey and dijon mustard, VERY good.  My friends have tried the following and loved it all: apple-chicken-walnut (a fav of mine), smoked salmon and cream cheese chutney.

It's a cozy little place with a quaint feel.  The presentation of the food is excellent!  I love the tea sets, i get a different one each time and I love their random, but delicate china.  We look forward to this tea party every year.  we love this place!

excerpts: All together, for 2 light tea's and 1 queen's tea was $65 (inc.
t&t).
light tea.author: Adorable T.
light tea.review:
I came here with a party of four on a Sunday afternoon, around 1:35pm, and luckily got seats within 10 minutes (not to mention I got lucky with parking!). The waitress was very pleasant, taking away plates when we were finished, and giving us clean plates so we wouldn't have to mix tastes. She was also very honest in giving her opinion about what was good on the menu vs. what was popular.

I ordered the Queen's Tea and had he China Rose Petal (black tea). I chose the Chicken-Apple-Walnut sandwich and the Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese sandwiches. This set came with coleslaw (ehh), organic spring greens (really plain salad), a raisin scone with preserves (yummm!) and double devon cream (a better version of butter), a crumpet with lemon curd (delicioussss and zesty), fresh fruit, and a petit four and a shortbread tea biscuit.

The tea was very aromatic. It had just the right amount of flavor. Adding sugar and milk to it made it easier to drink, but I enjoyed it plain.

The sandwiches are are cut into fourths. The chicken-apple-walnut sandwich was quite delicious. It was basically a chicken salad with chunks of apple and walnut. Smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches were very normal. The ones I make at home taste about the same. I didn't touch the cole slaw cause I don't like it. The organic spring greens were bitter (as usual), but I didn't like the dressing enough to finish it (lighter type of dressing). The raisin scone is soft on the inside, but has just the right "crunch" on the outside. it went well with the butter and jam, but i was really into the lemon curd. Iono about the crumpet. Are they supposed to be like half pancake, half english muffins? I didn't finish it (even when spread with the lemon curd!) cause it was just unappetizing. The fresh fruit had a good variety (strawberries, grapes, grapefruit, blueberries, kiwis). The petit four was a strawberry shortcake with marzipan. Very sweet and delicious. Shortbread tea biscuit is how you would imagine it to be like, but not as heavy as a "walker's".

I would give this place 5 stars because of the variety of foods offered, but I didn't like the quality/pairings of all the foods (eg. salad and dressing, crumpet). All together, for 2 light tea's and 1 queen's tea was $65 (inc. t&t).

excerpts: I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.
The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.
But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it
light tea.author: Monique H.
light tea.review:
Went here for the first time today.  My girlfriend from high school was visiting from out of town and we had been talking about having high tea.  After much searching and disappointment that The Four Seasons Hotels and the Ritz-Carlton Hotels have discontinued their tea service, we found this place on Yelp.

We were half an hour late (boyfriends are slow) but lucky one person in our party was only 5 minutes late and saved the table for us.  She said they were very nice and didn't harass her about the rest of her party not showing up.

I had the Queen's Tea with English Breakfast tea and cucumber and turkey sandwiches.  The tea arrived first and after waiting anxiously for it to seep, I poured myself a cup.  It was delicious, but I am not a tea connoisseur.  Then arrived the food, on a three tiered platter.  The top tier was the fresh fruit, next the scone, biscuit, jam, lemon stuff, and the devon cream, the bottom tier had the sandwiches, cole slaw, and greens.

To be frank, when I first looked at it I thought they kind of skimped out on the fruit, but I was stuffed by the end of my meal, so really they are smarter than me!

After having some fruit, I decided to try the scone.  I first tried the devon cream...and that is when I realized that I loved this place!  If I had a lover, forget the whipped cream or chocolate sauce, this is what I'd cover his body with and lick off!!!  I could not get enough of it and I think this was my favorite item here.  Of course the jam and lemon stuff was good too, but I cannot describe my devotion to devon cream now.

The sandwiches were of course delicious and...dainty, delicate?  FUN!  I am not a super girlie girl.  My friend and I decided to put dresses on for the special occasion and I felt like a streetwalker even though my dress is conservative, but that is how rarely I wear things that don't have legs.  But this place played into my feminine side without me feeling awkward about it.  So yes, it's frilly and kitsch, but it works for this place.

A little while later came my fresh crumpet.  We decided crumpets are a pancake-english muffin hybrid, a puffin. Delicious, but I just wanted to get back to my scone and devon cream to be honest.

Lastly when we were done, we had our petite fours.  Which apparently I didn't really experience because I got the dark chocolate truffle with dried apricot.  But it was so cute and I love dark chocolate.  Petite fours are candy-sized, individually glazed pieces of cake. (My friend went to culinary school)

I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.  The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.  But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it made me want ribs or something) and I was too full to even consider wasting space on a salad!

So if you go, invite me?

excerpts: Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea.
Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout.
light tea.author: Erin M.
light tea.review:
Girly perfection. Very Victorian, very tasty and very adorable. My gal-pals and I celebrated a belated Christmas gift exchange at Lovejoys. We called earlier in the week for a Sunday reservation, but they said they were booked. However, I popped in at about 1pm on Sunday and was able to score a table that would be ready in about a half hour. Perfect! 

We crowded into the back corner on a couch (and chair), which is perfect for us. We were able to giggle and be our usual obnoxious selves. Between us, we ordered three Light Tea services and one Cream Tea. Everyone was happy, the crustless sandwiches were great with the Pear & Stilton as a standout. Fresh fruit was perfect and ripe, scones were super-tasty. We were actually full after two hours of delicate edibles and never-ending tea. 

Aside from slightly cramped quarters and the occasional freakishly heavy teapot, Lovejoy's a great, girly afternoon. I'm definitely taking my mom here the next time she's in town.

excerpts: We all went for the Light Tea Service, and between the six of us, we got a good selection of the sandwiches to share and 3 different teas.
The Fig & Olive Tapenade and the chicken apple walnuts were my favs.
light tea.author: CINDY K.
light tea.review:
I can't fight the urge to break out the British accent whenever I go to a tea room. It was on full tilt at Lovejoy's.  My companions and I had "a jolly good time" there - it's got that packed to the rafters antique store kind of feel to it.  I wish I had worn a flowery dress with a hat and neat white gloves. 
We all went for the Light Tea Service, and between the six of us, we got a good selection of the sandwiches to share and 3 different teas.  The Fig & Olive Tapenade and the chicken apple walnuts were my favs.  
The scones were yummy, too - still warm and sweet w/raisins. But they were taken to the next level, with the BEST Double Devon Cream.  I don't care if it's a heart attack on a butter knife - MMMMM.  
Definitely make reservations early.  Our group lucked out on a last minute cancellation.

excerpts: Brought my parents here and we each ordered a Light Tea.
On paper, it sounds like light fare (choice of one sandwich from a list of over 15 ---
I got the chicken apple walnut, they got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, both good --- a scone with dev cream and preserves, fruit and shortbread).
Oh man, it was more than filling.
Especially with the huge pot of tea we each got
(I got the Vanilla Rooibos).
light tea.author: spiff e.
light tea.review:
Awesome!  Brought my parents here and we each ordered a Light Tea.  On paper, it sounds like light fare (choice of one sandwich from a list of over 15 --- I got the chicken apple walnut, they got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, both good --- a scone with dev cream and preserves, fruit and shortbread).  Oh man, it was more than filling.  Especially with the huge pot of tea we each got (I got the Vanilla Rooibos).  My family loves loves afternoon tea and this place has pretty much all the same stuff as the Ritz, but at a fraction of the price.

What makes it 4 instead of 5 stars?  The pot they gave me was so freakin huge and full it was majorly heavy when I went to pour my tea, while my dad got a daintier pot.  They should have considered who they were giving the mongo pot to.  Also, the grapes on the fruit tier were DIRTY.  They were still covered in dirt/mold.  Obviously not rinsed.  We just wiped them with tea-dampened napkins before eating them.  But still, I'll go back again and again.

excerpts: If you're a little hungrier but don't want to spoil dinner, go for the Light Tea which is a scone + 1 sandwich + fruit + shortbread.
light tea.author: Asteridae A.
light tea.review:
Some friends and I went here this past weekend to celebrate Lewis Carroll's birthday.  It's a charming, whimsical place in Noe Valley.  A bit crowded - I suggest making a reservation.  Definitely not stuffy - this is not "tea at the Ritz."  No white glove service here.  What you get are mismatched china, hodgepodge seating arrangements, and assorted bric-a-brac scattered around.

The ham sandwiches were a bit heavy on the horseradish, which I didn't mind, but some might.  The shrimp, cucumber, and fig sandwiches are also good.  The homemade scones are amazing - light and buttery, melt in your mouth, smeared with clotted cream and jam.  Yum.

Nice selection of teas, and I like the different "levels" of tea you can get based on how hungry you are - if you just want a tea and scone, you can get that.  If you're a little hungrier but don't want to spoil dinner, go for the Light Tea which is a scone + 1 sandwich + fruit + shortbread.  There are larger teas as well.

Service was quick and friendly, and they refilled our tea pots with fresh hot water.

I'll definitely be going back, and taking my mother with me!

excerpts: Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.
All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.
light tea.author: Tera M.
light tea.review: Planned my best friend's birthday party at Lovejoy's for 6 of us, and ended up having 7 - they accommodated us with no problem.  The decor was cute, quaint and perfect for a ladies tea party.  It sort of reminded me of Alice in Wonderland with its mismatched cups and whimsical style.  Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.  All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.  Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.  The service was good, and we all had a great time.  I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!  Oh, and the price was very reasonable.

excerpts: We chose the high tea package option and we were able to pick different teas during our brunch.
Nobody got too creative and I think we only ordered the white tea in addition to what was already on the table (this was good though!)
high tea.author: Emily C.
high tea.review:
Hosted my belated birthday party brunch here! The process was super smooth and I made reservations ahead of time to accommodate a larger party. Gina was the one emailing me back and forth and though I was somewhat unresponsive (I'm sorry!) due to not getting voicemails in time and just being bad at responding to emails because work was busy.. she was still very helpful and friendly! 

We chose the high tea package option and we were able to pick different teas during our brunch. Nobody got too creative and I think we only ordered the white tea in addition to what was already on the table (this was good though!) but Gina also brought us out a pumpkin tea. 

Finger sandwiches were decent but nothing too extraordinary but I think you are mostly paying for the ambiance anyway. The scones were really good though! At the end of our brunch we found the hat rack and decided to snap some photos. I think it's a cute tough to have these out for everyone to borrow and feel a little tea-ready! Overall, cute place and I would be back if I had another event to attend!

excerpts: I've had the pleasure of enjoying high tea service at Lovejoy's Tea Room a few times now, and each time I've been impressed with the quantity and quality of food and tea you receive for an affordable price!

High tea is one of my favorite indulgences, but it can be very restrictive in that the menu of what is served is pre-fixe unless you let the restaurant know ahead of time about your food allergies/restrictions.
With Lovejoy's you can choose which tea sandwiches you want with your tea service, and they have plenty of meat, seafood, and vegetarian options.
You can also choose which petit fours you want from a tray that they bring around to you that includes mini cakes, marzipans, chocolates, etc.
high tea.author: Pooja M.
high tea.review:
I've had the pleasure of enjoying high tea service at Lovejoy's Tea Room a few times now, and each time I've been impressed with the quantity and quality of food and tea you receive for an affordable price! 

For $30, you can get the Queen's service, which comes with bottomless tea, two full sandwiches of your choosing, a scone with lemon curd, clotted cream, and raspberry jam, petit fours, tea biscuit, fruit, salad, and a crumpet?? You will absolutely walk away feeling stuffed and satisfied!

They have plenty of tea services aside from the Queen's service, so if you're looking for a more inexpensive tea service, Lovejoy's has a myriad of options. And if none of those options catch your eye, you can customize your own service or even order from their a la carte menu. 

Their tea menu is expansive as well and ranges across black teas, herbal teas, decaffeinated, fruit teas, etc, so again, you're bound to find something you'll love.

What impresses me the most about Lovejoy's tea service is how much choice you have in deciding your food items. High tea is one of my favorite indulgences, but it can be very restrictive in that the menu of what is served is pre-fixe unless you let the restaurant know ahead of time about your food allergies/restrictions. With Lovejoy's you can choose which tea sandwiches you want with your tea service, and they have plenty of meat, seafood, and vegetarian options. You can also choose which petit fours you want from a tray that they bring around to you that includes mini cakes, marzipans, chocolates, etc. I like that as a person with allergies and a food restriction (I am a pescatarian), I don't have to inform Lovejoy's ahead of time of these restrictions because their tea menu caters to everyone and all potential restrictions. 

I also love the decor of this tea room. Lovejoy's Tea Room is decorated just like a cute quintessential English tea room, with lovely pastel colors throughout, fine teapots and cups, floral wallpaper, lace curtains and tablecloths, and embroidered pillows and couches where there weren't chairs. 

Lovejoy's is truly a special tea room in Noe Valley, and it's a tea room I will definitely be coming back to again and again!

excerpts: The menu is a bit confusing in comparison to other high tea I've attended.
You have to pick what service you would like and the sandwiches.
The service allows you to choose up to 2 sandwiches, which doesn't offer much variety.
I recommend coming with a group of 4, so that you can share and get a little bit of everything.
If you don't want to do a "set service" you can order items a la carte.
The food wasn't standout amazing, but a nice experience.
I was never asked if I wanted to try another tea, but just had it refilled.
high tea.author: Lisa L.
high tea.review:
The one place where EVERYONE is wearing floral. They have a great selection of Teas, ranging from black, green, and non-caffeine. The white peach was my favorite and the apricot was also a great choice.

The menu is a bit confusing in comparison to other high tea I've attended. You have to pick what service you would like and the sandwiches. The service allows you to choose up to 2 sandwiches, which doesn't offer much variety. I recommend coming with a group of 4, so that you can share and get a little bit of everything. If you don't want to do a "set service" you can order items a la carte. The food wasn't standout amazing, but a nice experience. I was never asked if I wanted to try another tea, but just had it refilled. It would have been nice to be able to change it up, since it unlimited pots of tea

Made reservations! It tends to get busy and there is a 2 hours max seating.

excerpts: My friend and I love checking out all the high tea places San Francisco offers.
I, too, recommend going to Lovejoy's Tea Room for high tea.
They definitely have their aesthetic down.
The atmosphere is very English grandma.
high tea.author: Vira P.
high tea.review:
My friend and I love checking out all the high tea places San Francisco offers.  This one has been on my list for quite some time, especially because I've seen it in several magazines and travel shows.

I, too, recommend going to Lovejoy's Tea Room for high tea.  They definitely have their aesthetic down.  The atmosphere is very English grandma.  There's cute knick knacks everywhere, and they even have hats available for you to wear while you dine!

What I like about their menu is that you can choose your sandwiches.  I don't eat beef, and there have been some times where I can't substitute items without changing my entire order.  I got the turkey with dijon mustard and artichoke hummus for my Queen's tea.  They were both very good.  The Queen's tea also came with a salad and coleslaw.  I wasn't a fan of the salad because it has arugula.  I'm not an fan of it, but it did go well with the coleslaw, which had the right amount of dressing.  I'm glad there was salad, though, because I needed some greens with this meal.

Like most high teas, the Queen's tea came with scones, crumpets, lemon curd, fruit preserves/jam, and Devon cream.  I really liked that it also came with fresh fruit.  You also get a tea biscuit and your choice of a petit four at the end.

Some of the other places I've gone to were heavy on the desserts.  Lovejoy's isn't, which is fantastic.  I usually feel like I'm going into diabetic shock, but I felt that dining hear was well balanced.

And as for the tea, I got blood orange, and it was delicious.  I didn't need any sugar at all.  

Service was fantastic.  I felt welcomed and well taken care of.

I suggest making reservations as this place is very popular.  And give yourself at least 30 minutes to find parking if you're driving.

excerpts: This is a great place to go with a group of girlfriends and have a British high tea experience!
I heard that their Redwood City location is actually more spacious than SF, so will definitely have to check that out next time since that's closer to home.
Parking actually wasn't difficult to find on a Sunday, since there were a good amount of street parking spots available.
high tea.author: Amy D.
high tea.review:
I loved Lovejoy's the first time I went there a few years ago, and came back recently for a friend's birthday. It wasn't quite as magical as my first time here, but this is still one of the most authentic and best tea rooms in the Bay Area. My friend made reservations for our group a couple months in advance, and reservations are highly recommended! Make sure your group is on time, since they only give you 2-2.5 hours for your seating. It was completely packed at 11am on a Sunday. 

We all ordered the Queen's Tea (Choice of Two Sandwiches, Served w/Cabbage Salad, Caraway Cream Dressing, Organic Spring Greens, Scone w/Preserves & Devon Cream, Crumpet w/Meyer Lemon Curd, Fresh Fruit, Petit Four, Tea Biscuit, $29.95, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=wzNGMt87QuKAu7vzCjTXQw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg). We tried the following sandwiches and teas:

-Roast Beef & Horseradish: There wasn't much roast beef in this, and the horseradish wasn't very strong.
-Egg & Onion: Yum- great version of egg salad, but very onion-y.
-Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad: Just ok for me, but I don't like nuts in chicken salad.
-Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese: Solid smoked salmon & cream cheese:

-Tea Room Blend: Solid black tea, and easy to drink.
-Chestnut Tea: I loved the chestnut aroma, but this tea was STRONG. You definitely needed to add a good amount of milk to dilute it.

You can order unlimited teas, but the tables are small, and we didn't have room for a lot of teas. I wish I had tried: Apricot, Pomegranate Green, Genmai Cha, Jasmine, and White Peach.

The scone was my favorite part of the tea- it was buttery and flaky, and super delicious smothered in Devonshire double cream and lemon curd. The crumpet was just ok for me since it's meant to be more dry/chewy. I chose the peanut butter petit four, and that was really good. Although the tea service isn't cheap at $29.99, we actually had a ton of leftovers, and you're also paying for the experience. This is a great place to go with a group of girlfriends and have a British high tea experience! I heard that their Redwood City location is actually more spacious than SF, so will definitely have to check that out next time since that's closer to home. Parking actually wasn't difficult to find on a Sunday, since there were a good amount of street parking spots available.

excerpts: Our server told us it was easier for them if we all ordered the same set, so we all opted for the High Tea set ($22.95), which comes with your choice of two sandwiches, salad, a scone, a tea biscuit, and your choice of tea.

I was worried that the high tea set wouldn't be enough food, as I was pretty hungry after skipping breakfast, but I was stuffed by the end and even had trouble finishing the last couple bites of the scone.
high tea.author: Dianna H.
high tea.review:
5 stars for the ambiance and food, but subtracting a star for service

I adore afternoon tea, so I got a group of girls together to try out the Lovejoy's in Noe Valley. I made reservations two weeks or so in advance for afternoon tea for 6 people on Saturday at 1:30 pm. There was still quite a bit of availability.

I'm glad that they have a much easier to use reservation system in place now through Resy; I had looked into coming here before but was always put off by having to fill out a form on their website.

We were quickly seated at a large table that could have accommodated up to 8 easily. Good to know for the future that they can accept larger groups.

First thing I noticed was the decor - everything was absolutely adorable! There were so many small thoughtful touches we loved. For example, on a shelf next to our table, we saw a Mrs. Potts and Chip tea pot and cup. I can tell there was a lot of thought that went into the decorations to create a quaint look for afternoon tea.

Our server told us it was easier for them if we all ordered the same set, so we all opted for the High Tea set ($22.95), which comes with your choice of two sandwiches, salad, a scone, a tea biscuit, and your choice of tea. For my two sandwiches, I went with the smoked salmon and chicken salad with pesto, which was one of their daily specials.

Instead of us each getting our food individually on a small tower, they actually placed all of our sandwiches together in one tower, which I was little disappointed about initially as I had wanted a picture with just my food. But the tower was really cute so it was hard to stay upset :) The smoked salmon sandwich was good, but I was really blown away by the chicken salad sandwich...it tasted super fresh and I could not get enough.

For my tea, I went with the mango, which both smelled and tasted delicious! I kind of wish I had gotten the decaf version afterwards though, as I was jittery for the rest of the day as my body tried to process all the caffeine.

The scone was also delicious. It came with a spread of cream and jam, and even though I knew the scone was already very rich (I've seen how much butter goes into scone recipes before...), the cream and especially the jam were totally worth the extra calories! 

I was worried that the high tea set wouldn't be enough food, as I was pretty hungry after skipping breakfast, but I was stuffed by the end and even had trouble finishing the last couple bites of the scone. 

So why the -1 star for service? Our server (forgot her name) just didn't seem to be in a good mood or something, as her attitude towards us was curt and almost mean at times. I didn't realize there was a 2 hour limit, so by the time 3:30 rolled around, she told us we needed to leave in a not-so-polite way. My friends and I were all kind of put off by her attitude, but luckily we didn't need deal with her too much so it didn't detract too much from what was otherwise a great experience.
