Random note: one of my friends was vegetarian and I was pleasantly surprised by how many vegetarian sandwich options were on the menu. Definitely a vegetarian friendly spot :)

excerpts: If you like to indulge in afternoon high tea, this is the place for you.
Invite your best girlfriends for a real treat.
There are several different items you can try.
I recommend the high tea which comes with two sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and crumpets.
My friend and I each ordered the high tea which also includes tea of course.
high tea.author: Amy J.
high tea.review:
If you like to indulge in afternoon high tea, this is the place for you. Invite your best girlfriends for a real treat. There are several different items you can try. I recommend the high tea which comes with two sandwiches, salad, cole slaw, and crumpets. My friend and I each ordered the high tea which also includes tea of course. The staff are lovely to boot. 

Even though the items aren't really that big, I found myself getting full after eating. It's not super noisy here so it's a good place to catch up. They also have fun hats you can wear while indulging or just take some pictures with them. It's not too far away from the 24th St Mission BART stop but there was plenty of parking in the middle of the day. It's worth checking out at least once.

excerpts: My favorite place for high tea.
As it is high tea, we sat for about 2 hours.
Staff checked on us regularly enough.
high tea.author: Stephanie L.
high tea.review:
So cute. So quaint. My favorite place for high tea. 

We ordered the Queen's tea because we get a little bit of everything. Highlight: scones, Devon cream, lemon curd, crumpet and petite four. Ordered the following sandwiches: cucumber cream cheese, mandarin cream cheese, ham and mustard, turkey and mustard. I personally like the cucumber and mandarin sandwiches because they are light and refreshing. We ordered the savory sandwiches with a little punch of flavor to complement the lighter fare. 

The staff are so nice and accommodating. As it is high tea, we sat for about 2 hours. Staff checked on us regularly enough. We refilled our tea twice (we drink A LOT of tea). 

You get a little coupon to their retail storefront across the street Lovejoy's Attic when you dine.

excerpts: For high tea for 12 (13), we were able to pick any teas off of the menu, and due to our large party we had a preorder selection of six kinds of sandwiches, along with salad, scones and cream, and tea biscuits.
The salad was just some greens, nothing too special, but the scones were solid and the sandwiches as well.
high tea.author: Wayne H.
high tea.review:
We had a large reservation for two birthdays here, but they were really good with helping me over the phone while making the reservation and with service while we were here. We had 12 adults plus a baby, so we were posted up in their largest table. It's a little bit cramped inside because it is chock full of decor, hats, and additional tables, but it wasn't much of a hassle.

For high tea for 12 (13), we were able to pick any teas off of the menu, and due to our large party we had a preorder selection of six kinds of sandwiches, along with salad, scones and cream, and tea biscuits. The salad was just some greens, nothing too special, but the scones were solid and the sandwiches as well.

We got the following sandwiches: Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Roast Beef & Horseradish, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Lovejoy's Daily Special, Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise, Pear & Stilton. They were all pretty solid, but the smoked salmon & cream cheese and the daily special were definitely the favorites.

The tea selection were all pretty solid as well, and they were pretty good with getting us more hot water or more teapots as we asked for different flavors of teas.

Many thanks for the flexibility in accommodating our large party, especially when we weren't sure how large the party was going to be during the reservation process.

excerpts: High Tea - I always opt for this one since it's more than enough to fill me up.
It's like the high tea except you get fruits and a dainty dessert at the end.
In my opinion, it's the best high tea in the city.
high tea.author: Annie V.
high tea.review:
I adore anything cute so naturally I was drawn to Lovejoy. I went here twice, once with my boyfriend and once for my sister's bridal shower. Both time I really enjoyed myself and left with great pictures for the IG. 

Logistics:
Making a reservation is a must! This place is crazy popular that a walk in will be difficult. I would recommend calling instead of using the reservation system they have on their site. I was able to book a reservation through the phone when the site showed no open table for the time and date I wanted. Granted they will never pick up so leaving a voicemail is the way to go as they always call you back to confirm. 

Service:
The service here treats you like a queen (or king)! They are so nice and accommodating with last minute changes and even seat you even if everyone from your party have not arrived. I know some busy places don't allow seating until everyone has arrived which may lead to some resentment towards your chronically tardy friends lol. 

Food:
High Tea - I always opt for this one since it's more than enough to fill me up. You get a choice of two sandwiches and bottomless tea. 

Tea - I recommend the white peach tea as the teapot comes with its own strainer. Also it taste great! 

Sandwich - It is roast beef/horseradish + turkey/mustard all the way for me. I just like the combo of those two. I will ventured with the daily special as well since they have sandwiches not listed on the menu. 

Queen's Tea - This one is definitely a 2 person option. It's like the high tea except you get fruits and a dainty dessert at the end.  

Blueberry scone - Everyone raves about this scone and it's definitely the highlight! Definitely try it with the jam (but it's already really good by itself). 

Overall: 
I would definitely come back if I want to feel a little classy and drink tea with my pinky up. The price is also very decent for the service, atmosphere, and food you get. In my opinion, it's the best high tea in the city.

excerpts: We opted for the High tea.
There is another higher level set with more food.
But, we ended up really being stuffed, so I'd recommend the High tea unless you are absolutely starving.
high tea.author: Sean A.
high tea.review:
Made reservations for Lovejoy's on their website for 11 AM. Be sure to do the same. When we arrived the tables were all reserved. 

The restaurant is outfitted with English decor. There is a hat rack with hats that you might be able to wear. 

We opted for the High tea. There is another higher level set with more food. But, we ended up really being stuffed, so I'd recommend the High tea unless you are absolutely starving. It's much cheaper too. 

Our server was nice and friendly and suggested teas and sandwiches that we might like. There was another server that did, however, give a far more detailed explanation of the menu to another party. 

For tea, I chose Chestnut. My girlfriend chose Apricot. Mine wasn't suited to me. My girlfriend, being awesome as she is, tried mine and liked it, so we switched. I really liked the Apricot. They freshen up the tea for you after a bit and give you huge potfuls. 

I was able to choose two sandwiches for my set. The two that I chose were salmon and chicken salad with walnuts. The sandwiches were good not great. 

Also included was a wonderful cabbage salad with Carraway cream dressing. I scarfed that one down. 

The organic spring greens were a little wilted. 

The highlight of the set had to be the scone! Nice and warm with currants. I recommend spooning some Devon cream and preserves on each bite. Super yummy!

I think the next time that I come here I will go straight for the tea and scones. I'd like to try a crumpet as well!

excerpts: I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea.
The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me.
I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea.
Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over.
high tea.author: Katie C.
high tea.review:
Simply put, I love Lovejoy's Tea Room.

Just entering the tea room, I felt incredibly happy and giddy. Although the decor consisted of beautiful mismatched items, it was still in good taste. There are hats available for you to wear during your tea time. 

I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea. The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me. I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea. Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over. We were well taken care of by the staff. 

I made a reservation for two about a month in advance. I highly recommend you make a reservation, especially if you are planning on coming on a weekend. 

The tea room is perfect for all types of parties: couples, parents with their young children, and friends catching up.

excerpts: We got a Queens Tea and a High Tea set.
The food was decent but nothing special.
high tea.author: Tina G.
high tea.review: We got a Queens Tea and a High Tea set. The food was decent but nothing special. The scones were pretty good - which is what I came for. I think it was overpriced for the amount of food and quality. The decor was very cute but kind of old (frays and stains). Maybe I was expecting too much, but it definitely doesn't compare to tea service in the UK.

excerpts: Each one of us decided to order the High Tea set, which came with a selection of two tea sandwiches, cole slaw, salad, a scone, and a tea biscuit, along with a bottomless pot of tea.
I went with the decaf chocolate truffle tea, which had a deep chocolatey aroma, but not a lot of chocolate flavor.
I got to try the artichoke hummus, bay shrimp, chicken/asparagus, and pear/stilton sandwiches, and while all of them were good, they were definitely on the small side and didn't have much filling.
The cole slaw salad was refreshing, but completely overpowered by the caraway seeds.
The highlight of the food was the currant scone.
high tea.author: David K.
high tea.review:
What a lovely place is Lovejoy's for an English tea service! The most memorable parts of this restaurant are definitely the flamboyant decorations and the beautiful mismatched china and flatware. I came (with a reservation) right when they opened on a Saturday with a group of four, and it was a great place to sit back, relax, and chat. Unlike some other tea rooms, there's nothing stuck-up or overly formal about this place; it's a rather casual spot to get tea--there are kids all around and no need to dress up as for a formal occasion.

Each one of us decided to order the High Tea set, which came with a selection of two tea sandwiches, cole slaw, salad, a scone, and a tea biscuit, along with a bottomless pot of tea. I went with the decaf chocolate truffle tea, which had a deep chocolatey aroma, but not a lot of chocolate flavor. I got to try the artichoke hummus, bay shrimp, chicken/asparagus, and pear/stilton sandwiches, and while all of them were good, they were definitely on the small side and didn't have much filling. The cole slaw salad was refreshing, but completely overpowered by the caraway seeds. The highlight of the food was the currant scone. The scone was soft, fluffy, warm, and tender, pairing perfectly with the clotted cream and raspberry preserves!

Overall, a great neighborhood place to get tea. Though the food portions were not huge, this was a decent price for what we got, and I'd definitely recommend Lovejoy's for a laid back yet elegant tea service experience!

excerpts: I love high tea..
So I was dying to try this spot!
I happened to be in the neighborhood with my husband
so he decided to treat me.
As I walked in to inquire for a table, I was greeted with a terrible look from the hostess.
I asked if I can get a table for two.
The spot was NOT full whatsoever and there was even outdoor seating free.. before I could speak, the hostess said: sorry, were full.
I mentioned I didn't mind waiting and coming back at a later time, I was really excited to eat here!
She then proceeded to tell me it was an hour to two hour wait.
I told her
I didn't mind
but she was VERY hesitant about putting my name down for a table.
Don't think she liked the idea of two gay men enjoying high tea at her business..
high tea.author: Victor-Hugo W.
high tea.review:
I love high tea.. So I was dying to try this spot! I happened to be in the neighborhood with my husband so he decided to treat me. As I walked in to inquire for a table, I was greeted with a terrible look from the hostess. I asked if I can get a table for two. The spot was NOT full whatsoever and there was even outdoor seating free.. before I could speak, the hostess said: sorry, were full. 
I mentioned I didn't mind waiting and coming back at a later time, I was really excited to eat here! She then proceeded to tell me it was an hour to two hour wait. I told her I didn't mind but she was VERY hesitant about putting my name down for a table. Don't think she liked the idea of two gay men enjoying high tea at her business..

I waited and waited for my call but never heard from them. I walked past later just to see if the place was full and there was literally more free tables an hour before closing. I was too hurt to even ask again. What crazy times we live in..

HOW CAN A PLACE CALLED LOVEJOY BE SO HATEFUL?

excerpts: It's a truly charming and sweet high tea experience.
It's not super glam like the Palace Hotel's garden court, but it's way more intimate, comfortable.
The food and tea is better than most high tea place I've been in the city, and priced lower than the higher end places.
I especially love all the eccentric tea ware and everybody gets a different set.
Bonus that even though the main clientele are ladies, every guy I've ever taken to have tea at this place loved it
, so take your man there next time!
high tea.author: Yi Y.
high tea.review: I've never been to Lovejoy's and not loved it. It's a truly charming and sweet high tea experience. It's not super glam like the Palace Hotel's garden court, but it's way more intimate, comfortable. The food and tea is better than most high tea place I've been in the city, and priced lower than the higher end places. I especially love all the eccentric tea ware and everybody gets a different set. Bonus that even though the main clientele are ladies, every guy I've ever taken to have tea at this place loved it, so take your man there next time!

excerpts: I recently went twice and got Queen's Tea one time and High Tea the other time.
Both are good options
but I definitely prefer High Tea and will probably get that from now on.
The reason I prefer High Tea over Queen's Tea is that Queen's Tea is $7 more and only gives you a crumpet, some fruit, and a Petit Four.
high tea.author: Amanda L.
high tea.review:
I recently went twice and got Queen's Tea one time and High Tea the other time. Both are good options but I definitely prefer High Tea and will probably get that from now on. The reason I prefer High Tea over Queen's Tea is that Queen's Tea is $7 more and only gives you a crumpet, some fruit, and a Petit Four. Personally I don't really enjoy crumpets or Petit Fours so that basically means $7 for a bit of fruit. However, if you love crumpets and Petit Fours, go for it! I can finish the whole High or Queen's Tea myself so it makes me full but doesn't keep me full for more than an hour or two. However, the experience is really fun and cute for special occasions. If you're looking for a light fruity tea, one of my personal favorites is White Peach.

The environment itself is very old fashioned and cute with pretty, mismatched dishes. Everyone is friendly there too. However, both times I came with a party of 3 and got stuck at the table with the "shared" bench, meaning you share a bench with someone from another table. The time I sat on that bench, I felt every time the girl sitting on the other side moved or rocked it (because of course it's not level). I plan to now go with either one other person or a party of 4+ now unless they replace that bench haha. Don't forget to make reservations (which you can do online)!

excerpts: There are a couple restaurants in the city for high tea, and I've tried just about every one of them.
Lovejoy's is such a cute spot!
At first it seems like there isn't a lot of treats on the table, but once you start eating you realize the food is quite filling.
I love the quaint, welcoming atmosphere.
high tea.author: Ali R.
high tea.review: There are a couple restaurants in the city for high tea, and I've tried just about every one of them. Lovejoy's is such a cute spot! At first it seems like there isn't a lot of treats on the table, but once you start eating you realize the food is quite filling. I love the quaint, welcoming atmosphere.

excerpts: Once I got the high tea and another time
When I got the high tea, you can get two sandwiches.
I picked the artichoke hummus/arugula and the roast beef with horseradish.
Both of these sandwiches were good and they were a good balance to each other.
It came with a salad and scone.
It kept me surprisingly full!
I picked the white strawberry tea.
It was so yummy and light.
I didn't add any cream or sugar into it at all.
The salad from the high tea didn't excite me in anyway.
The sandwich that I got for this tea service was the chicken walnut.
I think I would have went with another sandwich for next time.
I got the decaf mango black tea.
It got pretty strong after sitting for a while.
high tea.author: Tina Y.
high tea.review:
It's such a cute experience! 

I think that out of all the tea rooms that I've been to, this one is the best. I came here twice in the span of two weeks because I know so many of my friends have always wanted to try this. 

Once I got the high tea and another time I got the light tea. 

When I got the high tea, you can get two sandwiches. I picked the artichoke hummus/arugula and the roast beef with horseradish. Both of these sandwiches were good and they were a good balance to each other. It came with a salad and scone. It kept me surprisingly full! 
I picked the white strawberry tea. It was so yummy and light. I didn't add any cream or sugar into it at all. I think it was too light for the cream and sugar. 

The second time I came, I ordered the light tea but added a crumpet on the side. I think that I liked this tea service a lot better. It still made me full and instead of the salad, there was fruit. I think that it was nice to have some sweet. The salad from the high tea didn't excite me in anyway. The sandwich that I got for this tea service was the chicken walnut. I think I would have went with another sandwich for next time. I got the decaf mango black tea. It got pretty strong after sitting for a while. I didn't add cream and sugar when it was lighter, but my second and third cup I put in the works. 

I would say that this is kind of pricey for what it is, but this place is really more for the experience more than anything. It's nice food to chat over.

excerpts: It's definitely a cute little tea place to visit if you're into high tea.
high tea.author: Amy C.
high tea.review:
My sweet boyfriend took me here for my belated birthday celebration this past Sunday since I celebrated with both him & my family on my actual birthday. Originally, he made reservations at Benihana, but I prefer something that is new to us from my bookmarks therefore Lovejoy it is! 

We luckily found a good spot a few steps from Lovejoy's since it was starting to drizzle at the time. I love the heart painting on the side of the place. So cute!

We were seated at a small table next to the English red telephone booth looking cabinet. This place is very mismatch-y which really bothered my hunny cause he's like OCD. Haha.. but it's still very cozy and cute and unique little place. 

We both got the Queen's Tea for 2 while he chose the English Breakfast while I had the China Rose Petal tea. Everything was pretty delish, but the most outstanding would be the crumpets. They were warm & soft & crunchy. Yum! 

Service was friendly, sweet, and attentive. The lady which we're pretty sure is the owner is always addressing us as loveys which was very endearing. 

She brought out a candle on a present box looking petit four since he told them it was for my birthday during the reservation process. So that was nice. 

It's definitely a cute little tea place to visit if you're into high tea. :)

excerpts: We did high tea, there were a few options to choose from.
Everything was delicious, they also had a variety of finger sandwiches to choose from.
I would recommend making a reservation in advance because it filled up pretty fast and there's only so many tables.
I can't wait to come back here when I'm visiting again!
high tea.author: Leanna U.
high tea.review: This was mine and my best friends first stop while visiting the Bay Area. Amazing service and eats! There's plenty of teas to choose from and the servers are happy to help you out when deciding between the different options they have. It is a bit cluttered, but most tea rooms I've been to have been like that.. so be aware! The interior was beautiful, there was so much to look at. We did high tea, there were a few options to choose from. Everything was delicious, they also had a variety of finger sandwiches to choose from. I would recommend making a reservation in advance because it filled up pretty fast and there's only so many tables. I can't wait to come back here when I'm visiting again!

excerpts: We ordered one High Tea service to share; this included the choice of two tea sandwiches, small salad, cabbage slaw, and two scones with clotted cream and berry preserves.
For the sandwiches we went for the sweet and savory: the pear and stilton & the special of the day fig tapenade with goat cheese.
Both were delicious!
For our bottomless pot o' tea --the "champagne of teas" was elected: Afternoon Darjeeling.
This really was bottomless as a server would check it periodically and warm it (put more hot water in) to assure that we didn't run out in the middle of our tea service.
The presentation of the tea service was on a two-tiered stand --which gave a nice 360 view of your items to pick and choose as you ate.
**some tables are a bit smaller and may get a bit crowded as items come  out from the kitchen, so maneuver carefully --definitely wouldn't want to break anything!
high tea.author: Vanessa G.
high tea.review:
I am so happy to finally be able to write a review for Lovejoy's Tea Room.  The first and last time I came was nearly 15 years ago for a birthday party; at the time, I was ten and loved the experience.  I kept eyeing this place for years and finally my best friend and I decided to catch up and we were able to book a table at Lovejoy's for the same week --a Wednesday at 3pm.  We went yesterday and loved every minute.  

Upon first arriving it was such a charming view to see all the tables and chairs set up with their cups, saucers, and small plates.  The mismatched china is fun to look at and compare.  The tables had a lace tablecloth and honestly, I felt like I would be joined by Jane Austen any minute.  The set up is wonderful!

The host and server was very friendly and gave us her recommendations to order our tea service.  We ordered one High Tea service to share; this included the choice of two tea sandwiches, small salad, cabbage slaw, and two scones with clotted cream and berry preserves. For the sandwiches we went for the sweet and savory: the pear and stilton & the special of the day fig tapenade with goat cheese.  Both were delicious! For our bottomless pot o' tea --the "champagne of teas" was elected: Afternoon Darjeeling.  This really was bottomless as a server would check it periodically and warm it (put more hot water in) to assure that we didn't run out in the middle of our tea service.  The presentation of the tea service was on a two-tiered stand --which gave a nice 360 view of your items to pick and choose as you ate.  
**some tables are a bit smaller and may get a bit crowded as items come  out from the kitchen, so maneuver carefully --definitely wouldn't want to break anything!** 

My friend and I enjoyed the whole experience and even looking around at the decor is fun! There is so many unique and fun items hanging around.  

Although they tea room was not very busy when we went, I'd definitely recommend making a reservation to secure a table especially for the weekends because there is usually a crowd gathered outside waiting whenever I drive by.  

My friend and I agreed to return again and soon!  We'd love to visit around the holidays as well.  There is something truly special about sipping tea here --I definitely recommend.

excerpts: Took me a bit to figure out the sandwiches on the platter for high tea, but all in all it was a huge spread that left us full for the afternoon.
Chicken salad was a favorite, but I thought it was just okay.
The pear and Gorgonzola and the tea (apricot and chestnut) were excellent.
The chestnut tea was almost like drinking maple syrup without the sweet.
The salad was yummy-
I liked that it wasn't dressed, but I didn't much care for the slaw-although my boyfriend liked it.
high tea.author: Carolyn H.
high tea.review: This place was unexpected and pretty charming. It is like being at grandma's house. Lots of breakable items on doilies and a pillow for everyone's back. Even the bathroom was dolled up. This is like playing tea party as a kid, but with food that is not imaginary. The service is outstanding, and the scones were really buttery and flaky. Took me a bit to figure out the sandwiches on the platter for high tea, but all in all it was a huge spread that left us full for the afternoon. Chicken salad was a favorite, but I thought it was just okay. The pear and Gorgonzola and the tea (apricot and chestnut) were excellent. The chestnut tea was almost like drinking maple syrup without the sweet. The salad was yummy-I liked that it wasn't dressed, but I didn't much care for the slaw-although my boyfriend liked it.

excerpts: We had the Queen tea set & High tea set.
The food was okay, but tea wasn't impressive.
The place was cute and cozy.
The mismatched tea cups and pots were fun too, but a few were quite worn -
I understand that they might be trying to keep the antique and vintage look but teacups with chipped edges should not be allowed.
high tea.author: Marina M.
high tea.review: Recommended by a friend and came to check it out.  We had the Queen tea set & High tea set. The food was okay, but tea wasn't impressive. The place was cute and cozy. The mismatched tea cups and pots were fun too, but a few were quite worn - I understand that they might be trying to keep the antique and vintage look but teacups with chipped edges should not be allowed.

excerpts: Food: ordered the High Tea set, which came with two tea sandwiches, cole slaw, salad, scone (with amazing clotted cream and jam), and a cookie (small and meh), along with a bottomless tea.
high tea.author: Taryn Q.
high tea.review:
So it's definitely further out from the city than I'm used to going to but it adds to the overall appeal. It's definitely a very quaint and cute tea shop versus a fancy or ritzy place. None of the tea sets match but are all very cute! Went with a big group and had a reservation but still had to wait ~10 mins to be seated. Other than that, service was great!

Ambiance: mainly female but more families here than any other afternoon tea room I've been to! Has a small town feel to it but mixed with eclectic SF details
Food: ordered the High Tea set, which came with two tea sandwiches, cole slaw, salad, scone (with amazing clotted cream and jam), and a cookie (small and meh), along with a bottomless tea.

excerpts: I had the High Tea
I suggest getting two Queen tea or High tea sets for 4 people instead of each of your own.
Make sure to check out their "attic" across the street for some tea set goodies!
high tea.author: Angelie A.
high tea.review: It's a cutesy little place to go for a Sunday brunch. The service and ambiance was great. They have tea sandwiches that was surprisingly filling. Also, maybe it was because of the pot of tea refills that made us feel full. My friends and I each ordered our own sets which was waaaayyy more food than we anticipated. My friends had the Queen and Light Tea set. I had the High Tea and I honestly would've been okay with the Light Tea set. We reserved this place a week ahead on a Sunday and used up the two hour seating limit. Overall, a fun little place for a catch up sesh. We paid about $90 between the four of us with each of our tea sets. I suggest getting two Queen tea or High tea sets for 4 people instead of each of your own. Make sure to check out their "attic" across the street for some tea set goodies!

excerpts: I ordered the "High Tea for Two" w/ a black lavender tea.
Again I was not really impressed with the tea.
I couldn't taste nor smell the lavender even though I let it sit for a bit.
The sandwich selection wasn't to my liking but my friend and had two choices each so we decided to share a , cucumber & cream cheese, egg & onion, asparagus & chicken, and salmon & cream cheese.
I mean you can go wrong with sandwiches, but I didn't finish  it at all.
There wasn't much that came with this "High Tea" package.
high tea.author: Tiffany K.
high tea.review:
My girlfriends and I decided to try this place out for her birthday. I honestly don't recall anything that WOW'ed me. I have to say that I was a bit disappointed after trying this place. I've definitely had better tea time . I think this place was hyped up but I'm glad to have tried it at least once. 

I ordered the "High Tea for Two" w/ a black lavender tea. Again I was not really impressed with the tea. I couldn't taste nor smell the lavender even though I let it sit for a bit.  The sandwich selection wasn't to my liking but my friend and had two choices each so we decided to share a , cucumber & cream cheese, egg & onion, asparagus & chicken, and salmon & cream cheese. I mean you can go wrong with sandwiches, but I didn't finish  it at all. We had also scones that came with with jelly and cream.

I have to say the chicken & asparagus looked really weird, almost like it was avocado as it was a spread , and the egg  & onion was a bit too much too my liking, (a lot of onions).  The salad was ok, ( can't go wrong with that). There wasn't much that came with this "High Tea" package. 

Overall service was great, I recommend to at least try this place once, parking is easy but this place gets packed quick so make a reservation ahead of time as its very popular.  But I don't think I would come back again unless its a new seasonal menu.

excerpts: But even in the end, he was a convert to the joys of high tea and wants to go experience it at one of the fancy hotels in the city!
I cannot wait to come back to Lovejoy's in any case
but I wish I could just stop in and get a scone to go :D
high tea.author: Carrie W.
high tea.review:
I am officially obsessed with Lovejoy's! I live a few blocks from here and after begging A for MONTHS to go on a tea date with me, he finally gave in and we were able to make a reservation. I will say that I think we may have gotten in earlier had we been able to walk in but Lovejoy's is too popular. I think the reservation process is a bit opaque, however, since you have to request a reservation without knowing which times are available. I wish they were on OpenTable or Resy or at least had a more detailed calendar but I guess there is some charm in having to go through a bit of effort.

Anyways, we requested any available time but noted that we preferred earlier in the day on Saturday rather than later. To our luck, we got a reservation at 11AM right when they opened. When we got there, the place was already pretty full and there was a wedding shower going on at one of the long communal tables. Lovejoy's is SUPER cute on the inside and they have all of these adorable hats you can wear during your tea party. A was not about that AT ALL and felt a bit self-conscious in the admittedly feminine space.

Anyways, we had a difficult time ordering because we didn't want to over-order. We settled on getting one Queen's Tea ($28) and split the bottomless tea pot (+$2) since we both wanted a black tea and it didn't make sense to spend an additional $10 when we would have ordered something similar if not the same thing. We also split the Tea Sandwich Plate ($12.95). The 4 tea sandwich choices we chose between the Queen's Tea and the Plate were the Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken-Apple-Walnut Salad, Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese and the Pear and Stilton. We liked them all with the exception of the Pear and Stilton which had a weird taste. Both sandwich plates also came with a mixed green salad and cabbage slaw both of which were okay if not standard. The Queen's Tea also came with a scone, a crumpet and a petit four. The scones at Lovejoy's are AMAZING. It was served warm and was flaky but not dry. We devoured the one that came with our tea so we ordered another one for $2.95 and did not regret it at all. The crumpet was satisfying and the petit four was cute and the perfect end to our meal. Was it cheap? No. Did A leave hungry? Maybe. But even in the end, he was a convert to the joys of high tea and wants to go experience it at one of the fancy hotels in the city! I cannot wait to come back to Lovejoy's in any case but I wish I could just stop in and get a scone to go :D

excerpts: My fiance and I came here once and ordered our usual high tea - which among other things includes 2 sandwiches and 1 pot of tea each.
The waitress takes our order and returns some time later with one pot of tea.
I was surprised.
We always get 2.
I asked her nicely if we could get another pot of tea.
She was not happy with this, and said something along the lines of "well, since it's the same tea and the table is small you only really need one pot.
I guess that makes sense, I can see the logic there.
I told her that I understand
and I was sorry to ask again I really would like for us to both have our own pots, we have always had our own pots because that's what we're paying for.
Plus, we like the tea really strong.
2 people sharing a tea pot would dilute it immediately.
This waitress gets really snappy with us and straight up tells me, she's not bringing us our own pots, sorry, it's the same tea, the table is small, etc.
At this point I'm indignant.
What do you mean?
We are paying for 2 pots.
You're not only withholding a pot, but you're actually arguing with me that the size of the table is the reason (if we ordered 2 different teas we would have gotten 2 different pots!!)
At this point I'm annoyed.
I basically have to beg this woman into adding some fresh tea leaves at least.
She grudgingly agrees and walks away, leaving us confused and grumpy.
To put it short, our tea was watered down, I did not taste any added strength to our tea, and I walked away feeling like this human put up an unreasonable fight.
I believe she's a red head.
high tea.author: Julia C.
high tea.review:
I had a very unpleasant experience with a waitress some time ago. I'm still giving this place 4 stars because it's usually all very good. Here's what happened.

My fiance and I came here once and ordered our usual high tea - which among other things includes 2 sandwiches and 1 pot of tea each. The waitress takes our order and returns some time later with one pot of tea. I was surprised. We always get 2. I asked her nicely if we could get another pot of tea. She was not happy with this, and said something along the lines of "well, since it's the same tea and the table is small you only really need one pot." I guess that makes sense, I can see the logic there. I told her that I understand and I was sorry to ask again I really would like for us to both have our own pots, we have always had our own pots because that's what we're paying for. Plus, we like the tea really strong. 2 people sharing a tea pot would dilute it immediately. This waitress gets really snappy with us and straight up tells me, she's not bringing us our own pots, sorry, it's the same tea, the table is small, etc. At this point I'm indignant. What do you mean? We are paying for 2 pots. You're not only withholding a pot, but you're actually arguing with me that the size of the table is the reason (if we ordered 2 different teas we would have gotten 2 different pots!!) At this point I'm annoyed. I basically have to beg this woman into adding some fresh tea leaves at least. She grudgingly agrees and walks away, leaving us confused and grumpy. To put it short, our tea was watered down, I did not taste any added strength to our tea, and I walked away feeling like this human put up an unreasonable fight. I believe she's a red head. Anyway, I haven't seen her since (if she's still there, please address this because it was rude).

Another side experience happened about a week ago. I asked an elderly waitress if the salad dressing was vegan. She told me she didn't know. That's alright. I asked if she could check for me. She said they used some french dressing, the can was in french, she'd have no way of knowing. I literally had to ask her multiple times - is there a label? Can you please check for me otherwise I'm not able to eat it. She said she didn't know and just walked away. As a restaurant providing a service, your job is to be familiar with ingredients. She came back some time later and showed me the can (in english) with the ingredients. I'm grateful she did that - I'm just upset I had to wrestle her for it. A simple "i'm not sure - let me check for you!" would have sufficed.

All this aside, this place is delicious, it's cute, and generally a wonderful experience. The staff is usually very nice and the english woman at the front desk is very accommodating and kind.

excerpts: I believe she chose the high tea menu, but I could be wrong.
She had planned this tea party way beforehand, and had selected a set menu with Lovejoy.
There were many selective mini sandwiches; everything was different.
high tea.author: Lucy L.
high tea.review:
This is the cutest place for an afternoon tea party! My cousin made reservations way ahead of time, because we had about 15 guests that day. It was for a special occasion. They allowed her to decorate the tables and dining area we were sitting. Their decor itself is super cute. They definitely know how to make the place look absolutely adorable. 

Food:
I believe she chose the high tea menu, but I could be wrong. She had planned this tea party way beforehand, and had selected a set menu with Lovejoy. There were many selective mini sandwiches; everything was different. Scones were very delicious, especially with the lemon spread. Yum! The teas were really good. We had two kinds of teas. One with caffeine and one non caffeine. I do not remember the names of the teas. Both were delicious. I will definitely come back here again for a tea party!

Service and staff were amazing. They were all very friendly. They would constantly come over to check up on our tea kettles and refill. Overall, an amazing first-time experience.

Parking: it sucked for me. It's just regular street parking. Our reservations was on a Saturday @11am. I circled around the area for 30 darn minutes.... Luckily, I ended up finding parking 3-4 blocks away. Beware of weekend parking! *sigh*

excerpts: Been here 3-4 times and it's still the best high tea I've had in the city.
high tea.author: A Y.
high tea.review:
Been here 3-4 times and it's still the best high tea I've had in the city. I've had crown and crumpet, dartealing, and sip as well. Haven't tried the bougier spots like rotunda. 

For $29.95 you get the queens tea which includes all the items you need - 2 sandos, scone, crumpet, fruit, cookies, and a few more. I like that the price is reasonable and you get your tea refilled as well.

The interior is very cozy and intimate, and I personally love the mismatched cushions and tea sets.

This place gets packed on the weekends so book ahead! Also I'm thrilled they now have an online Rez system where you don't have to email them for time slots.

excerpts: Being a generic tea lover, however, is separate from being a Western-tradition high tea lover, in that, there's East and West.
Dimsum-style East, high tea-style West.

If you're not a tea whore and don't really take your high tea very seriously, and you rarely do this sort of thing, you'll be satisfied with the environment and you will have fun, and one tea service will generally make you stuffed and happy.
Let's just say that the vibe I expect when I go to High Tea is generally about ensuring you are calm, comfortable, looked after, and delighted.

We had touch points with multiple staff members and only one staff member was happy and pleasant toward us; the rest treated us like they were busy lor annoyed and that worrying about how busy they were was more important than worrying about the experience for the customers they had.
They basically expect that making the food, putting the tea in front of you, the decor, and checking on you once suffices.
It does not.

I highly recommend that if it's possible all the staff members attend a proper tea (I have yet to find one in SF actually, even at highly rated hotels) and once they have their mind blown they'll get it.
It's hard to explain.
It's about the experience, the ritual, and being catered to, tea time is sacred in England.
Originally, it went on for hours.
If you are really trying to recreate that experience, you're not there yet.
If you're making your own Cali version ...
high tea.author: Miriam W.
high tea.review:
OK, I'm going to split this into a two-pronged attack!

1) TEA WHORES

If you are a true tea connoisseur and lover and you have at least 5 loose-leaf teas at home in proper temperature controlled and vacuum-sealed containers that did not come to you as a gift in a gift basket, you are a true tea lover. Being a generic tea lover, however, is separate from being a Western-tradition high tea lover, in that, there's East and West. Dimsum-style East, high tea-style West. If you have participated and explored the tea rituals of the west frequently -- you will not see this as five-star place, but you will enjoy it. 

2) GENERAL PUBLIC

It is quaint, it is charming like all the reviews say. The teas are good. Not amazing, but good. The service is ... good enough. It's San Francisco, the place isn't huge. The prices ... are as expected. The ambiance is your dotty grandma's house, stuffed to the gills with tea paraphernalia and family photos, doilies and crochet-work cuddling up the dusty old lampshades. The bathroom is clean and spacious (a rarity in the city). It is filled with many groups of women at various stages of life, from celebrating engagements to graduations to gossiping to catch up. The petit fours are freshly made and moist (I was surprised and impressed by this). The scones are freshly made, as they should be. They do provide proper clotted / Devonshire cream, and luxurious preserves to smear on your scone. They have a good-sized savoury menu aside from tea service.

If you're not a tea whore and don't really take your high tea very seriously, and you rarely do this sort of thing, you'll be satisfied with the environment and you will have fun, and one tea service will generally make you stuffed and happy.

If you ARE a tea whore, you will notice some thangs. They aren't major, but cost the fifth star:

- Service: This place has been around a while and is extremely busy and popular, and it's in the city, so I get the "French maitre'd" vibe that has happened. Let's just say that the vibe I expect when I go to High Tea is generally about ensuring you are calm, comfortable, looked after, and delighted. We had touch points with multiple staff members and only one staff member was happy and pleasant toward us; the rest treated us like they were busy lor annoyed and that worrying about how busy they were was more important than worrying about the experience for the customers they had. They basically expect that making the food, putting the tea in front of you, the decor, and checking on you once suffices. It does not. I highly recommend that if it's possible all the staff members attend a proper tea (I have yet to find one in SF actually, even at highly rated hotels) and once they have their mind blown they'll get it. It's hard to explain. It's about the experience, the ritual, and being catered to, tea time is sacred in England. Originally, it went on for hours. If you are really trying to recreate that experience, you're not there yet. If you're making your own Cali version ... it's good enough.

- Pricing: A quality tea service doesn't charge you extra for a "bottomless pot of tea." It's included in the price of the service. Also it's SF, so I wasn't surprised by how much you pay for what you get, but it's a little on the stingy side (I was letting it go for the foodstuffs but I got offended that you're paying extra for the tea, since that's the whole point of being there).

- Food: For 3 people, they don't give you particularly generous portions of clotted cream or preserves. We are all trying to watch our weight so we didn't ask for more and made do. Salad is generous. The caraway seed (I think that's the spice) is FAR too overused in their coleslaw salad and I'd frankly they not include that salad and expend that on a free petit four for everybody by default. Quiche looked good; we didn't get to try the crumpets. Scones were good. Sandwiches were on the small side so if you order a tea service with 2 included per person I recommend you order one more for the table to share. Cream cheese is nothing special / has nothing in it (no herbs or seasoning) but the salmon tasted fresh. Basically the sandwiches are super simple and more like tea at home that auntie made versus tea at a fine tea house. Tomato and cheese is straight up tomato and cheese - you could make it at home.

- Tea: As mentioned, good, not amazing. If they spent money on real high quality tea they'd be broke of course, or prices would have to go up significantly. They have a pretty broad selection. I just went with the House Blend, which was okay. Friends ordered other types and were pleased with theirs. The staff made note of how long we should steep the tea, which was great to see.

If you ever want to have a tea experience that blows your mind -- Brown Hotel in London. DO IT.

excerpts: I loved my "High Tea" experience at Lovejoy's.
As you walk into this tea shop, it's as if someone vomited tea paraphernalia into every nook and cranny.
high tea.author: Irina R.
high tea.review:
I loved my "High Tea" experience at Lovejoy's. As you walk into this tea shop, it's as if someone vomited tea paraphernalia into every nook and cranny. Big ol' hats and other role play costumes are available for wear during the tea experience, books on tea etiquette line the shelves, little doily tablecloths everywhere - it's cute as heck in a stuffy way. 

I have a mild suspicion some of the food items are from Trader Joe's - the mustard on one of my sandwiches reminded me so much of Trader Joes mustard. Aside from that, I loved the neatly cut, super cute little sandwiches and my floral tea pot filled with yummy tea of my choice. 

What I didn't like: the butter cookie. Nothing special and not tasty. 

Small upside - "bottomless tea" - get wild ladies!

excerpts: and I had sent him a list complied by the website SF.eater.com of the best places to enjoy afternoon or high tea in the city and
Lovejoy's was one of their top picks for their unique yet homey ambience with a wide variety of traditional English teas and sandwiches.
After doing some reading some reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I knew that Lovejoy's would be the perfect place to enjoy a pot of tea in the city for the very first time.

She suggested we get the High Tea which consisted for our choice of two tea sandwiches served with organic spring greens, cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, a warm scone served with preserves and Devon cream and a tea biscuit to boot.
At $21.95 for all of that, we felt that that was a very affordable deal.
Since she knew we were going to stay a while she suggested we get one more sandwich (at an additional $3.95) to go with this combination to satisfy our taste buds.
We agreed and although all of the sandwich options looked plenty good
We were so enthralled by the food we wanted to try a couple more items after we feasted on our high tea meal.
So we went with a chicken apple walnut sandwich and since our day was not all about cold mini sandwiches a my friend really wanted to sample some of Lovejoy's pub fare
, so we went with the sausage rolls which were puff pastries with a sausage filling.
The rolls were decent tasting, nothing truly spectacular here, as once again the sandwich was a highlight when sampled with tea.
And what a wonderful tea it was, perfect with milk and sugar, they kept our tea pot filled with plenty of water as we drank all afternoon long.
high tea.author: Jason F.
high tea.review:
A great place in a tony San Francisco neighborhood to act as if you are a citizen of Great Britain, thanks to the many options they have here, as you can enjoy a spot of tea as well as the traditional British-inspired dining options that accompanies them, Lovejoy's Tea is great place to kick back and hang out with friends or have a calming moment to one's self. 

A friend had been dying to enjoy a traditional tea room in San Francisco and I had sent him a list complied by the website SF.eater.com of the best places to enjoy afternoon or high tea in the city and Lovejoy's was one of their top picks for their unique yet homey ambience with a wide variety of traditional English teas and sandwiches. After doing some reading some reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I knew that Lovejoy's would be the perfect place to enjoy a pot of tea in the city for the very first time. My friend got a reservation for Thursday afternoon at 4pm, which turns out we didn't even need it as it wasn't packed at all at this time of day.

There are a lot of great options at Lovejoy's for tea and sandwich lovers alike. Since we were newcomers to all of this, we asked our server what she would recommend for two tea lovers who also wanted to try a lot of traditional British goodies and who also wanted to just sit back and take it all in. She suggested we get the High Tea which consisted for our choice of two tea sandwiches served with organic spring greens, cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, a warm scone served with preserves and Devon cream and a tea biscuit to boot. At $21.95 for all of that, we felt that that was a very affordable deal. Since she knew we were going to stay a while she suggested we get one more sandwich (at an additional $3.95) to go with this combination to satisfy our taste buds. We agreed and although all of the sandwich options looked plenty good but we knew we had to get the traditional sandwich that pairs perfectly with English tea, cucumber and cream cheese, in addition to the roast beef and horseradish and ham and English mustard options.

Served on a two tiered cake stand, with the scone on top and the sandwiches and salads on the larger bottom tier, everything tasted amazing. I loved the scone especially when spread with the Devon cream and preserves. The sandwiches were so tasty, I especially loved the traditional cucumber sandwich made with real English cucumbers. The horseradish gave the roast beef a real kick, so be wary when biting into them. The sandwiches and salads paired very well with our tea, which was also selected with our server's advice, when we asked what went well with milk, we went with the Yorkshire Gold Black Tea which was a high quality blend of teas from Africa, Assam and Ceylon, it was a bold and brisk, full bodied tea with a smooth and even flavor. My only issue since Lovejoy's prides itself on using a wide array of porcelain serving ware, my cup was way too large for a traditional tea steeper and promptly kept falling into the cup! Oh well I guess the tea leaves just made my drink stronger and therefore only taste better!

We were so enthralled by the food we wanted to try a couple more items after we feasted on our high tea meal. So we went with a chicken apple walnut sandwich and since our day was not all about cold mini sandwiches a my friend really wanted to sample some of Lovejoy's pub fare, so we went with the sausage rolls which were puff pastries with a sausage filling. The rolls were decent tasting, nothing truly spectacular here, as once again the sandwich was a highlight when sampled with tea. And what a wonderful tea it was, perfect with milk and sugar, they kept our tea pot filled with plenty of water as we drank all afternoon long. Just be forewarned they charge two extra dollars to split a pot.

I really love Lovejoy's with its interior filled with British inspired kitsch and wide variety of traditional teas and sandwiches. When the place isn't packed with customers, it is the perfect place to sit down and relax and contemplate life in a comfortable environment. You can check your cell phone from time to time, but this is a place to enjoy the tranquil beauty of stillness or actually converse with your drinking mate so to speak, so what people tend to do in a traditional coffee shop is a no-no, as well it should be. In the end, our bill literally came out to twenty dollars for each of us which when you come to think of how much food we ate and how much tea we drank is a pretty good deal. I think it actually cost me more to take public transportation to get to the Noe Valley location of Lovejoy's and I can't think of anything more quintessential San Francisco than that!

excerpts: Mom and I both ordered high tea.
We each got to choose two sandwiches, sliced into 4 triangles each.
Lots of filling options to pick from, they came between a slice of white and brown bread, crusts removed.
I went with smoked salmon and cream cheese (YUM!) and Branston pickle chutney with cheddar (nice cheddar, but a bit skimpy on the chutney).
Mom let me try a piece of her hummus and arugula, which was good, though not as good as the salmon.
I didn't try her ham and mustard, but said the mustard was nice and spicy.
Dad seemed happy with his roast beef and chicken sandwiches- again, not a sharer.
high tea.author: Ryen B.
high tea.review:
There are so many things I enjoy about high-tea... the option of lots of different sandwiches, scones with cream, pretty plates, dainty cups. I met my parents at Lovejoy's feminine little tea room, one of the few open for tea mid-week. The place was full and the staff was hopping!

Mom and I both ordered high tea. We each got to choose two sandwiches, sliced into 4 triangles each. Lots of filling options to pick from, they came between a slice of white and brown bread, crusts removed. I went with smoked salmon and cream cheese (YUM!) and Branston pickle chutney with cheddar (nice cheddar, but a bit skimpy on the chutney). Mom let me try a piece of her hummus and arugula, which was good, though not as good as the salmon. I didn't try her ham and mustard, but said the mustard was nice and spicy. Dad seemed happy with his roast beef and chicken sandwiches- again, not a sharer. :-(

The sandwiches were arranged around a mixed green salad, fresh and kicked up by the mandarin oranges and a sweet/tangy dressing. The two tiered tray also had a bowl of cabbage salad- a slaw really- with a creamy caraway seed dressing that was also good. 

My fave of the bunch was the currant filled scone which I slathered with devon cream and a bit of raspberry preserves. The tea biscuit was just ok to my taste buds.

We each got a pot of tea. I ordered the chestnut which had a lovely maple aroma, but was a bit weak for my liking, even after steeping quite a while. Glad she didn't add any extra hot water to my pot. I tend to drink a lot of water and the staff was too busy to keep my glass filled. Glad I brought a bottle of my own!

All in all, a nice spot to try if you haven't been before.

excerpts: This was my first time enjoying high tea.
My first impression was that it was visually too busy for me with all Victorian decorations everywhere but was happy to see that as heavily decorated as it is, the place seemed very clean.
For me it was definitely more about spending time and enjoying a nice conversation with my friend than the food.
We had the Queen's Tea which is $30 dollars.
We added  a sandwich which is essentially two slices of bread with trimmed edges, $10 dollars.
As you can see on the picture, it includes fruit, two small sandwiches, some greens and a bottomless pot of tea.
The sandwiches are tasty but small for the price I thought.
If you love high tea and you want the experience then Lovejoy's Tea Room is the place for you.
You'll most likely need a reservation as it can get pretty difficult to get a table  and there is a limit of two hours stay even with a reservation.

My first impression was that it was visually too busy for me with all Victorian decorations everywhere but was happy to see that as heavily decorated as it is, the place seemed very clean. excerpts: High tea is always pricey
so I wouldn't frequent here unless there is an occasion for me every now and then.
However, when I am in the mood for one, I will definitely choose this Lovejoy's!
high tea.author: Kristi T.
high tea.review:
Love the ambiance here! The tea room is quaint and cozy, though can get a bit too packed sometimes. That's ok though, since service is still attentive. 

I usually order the Queen service. It comes with a pot of tea and your classic three tier service. One tier contains sandwiches (two types of your choice) and salad, another contains scones and tea cookies, and the uppermost is filled with fresh fruit. I always feel like a princess whenever I'm here! There are also hats and a vanity in the center of the room where you can choose your accessories to go with your tea. 

The most recent time I went was for my mom's birthday, and they brought a little piece of dessert for her with a candle. I thought this was super thoughtful of them! Mom greatly enjoyed her first time at Lovejoy's. 

Parking may be difficult around the area. I've always happened to luck out, but I can see how parking could be a headache around the area. Make sure you check out their store across the street! They have their teas for purchase, as well as other cutesy items for you to host your own tea party at home. Your bill comes with a small discount should you wish to purchase from their store across the street. I would advise making a reservation a week in advance as space is quite limited. 

High tea is always pricey so I wouldn't frequent here unless there is an occasion for me every now and then. However, when I am in the mood for one, I will definitely choose this Lovejoy's!

excerpts: High Tea!
I ordered High Tea.
We shared.
Black Tea with Summer berries and White Strawberry with notes of vanilla, berries, and mango.
Delicious warm scone with jam, hand crafted select sandwiches including chicken chuteny mango cream cheese sandwich!
The food and Tea were amazing and "as good as it gets.
high tea.author: Nick H.
high tea.review:
*****Afternoon Tea!*****

So, what do old British men with hairy noses and ears have in common with little girls? High Tea!

Old British guys and little girls are not wrong. While many places are gimmicky and cheap,  there is absolutely nothing better than a good afternoon tea with great company. Lovejoys serves up a great tea time with delicious finger foods and solid tea! You can sit on quilt ladened couches amongst fluffy pillows, frilly girlie things, teddy bears and tea pots.

~High Tea and Wee Tea-5 Stars!
The Wee Tea is designed for the little one. I ordered High Tea. We shared. Black Tea with Summer berries and White Strawberry with notes of vanilla, berries, and mango. Delicious warm scone with jam, hand crafted select sandwiches including chicken chuteny mango cream cheese sandwich! The food and Tea were amazing and "as good as it gets."

~Service-4 Stars
Our hostess was a little short and not very friendly.

~Atmoshphere-5 Stars
I prefer sitting on a chair with a normal table. However, the little one lived the couch and all the girlie and fluffy things. She said the two top highlights of our trip was her company and the tea time!

While the interior does seem a bit girlie, this place does offer man food. The menu includes hearty food such as shepherd's pie.

Overall, the only tea time I had better was in Canada and this place is as good as it gets in the U.S!!

excerpts:
The atmostphere and high tea experience have not changed a bit.

We each ordered the High Tea and were stuffed beyond belief.
high tea.author: Jen A.
high tea.review:
I have been coming to Lovejoy's for decades! I remember it's original location when it was on the other side of 24th Street. The atmostphere and high tea experience have not changed a bit.

I am writing this review because I recently came with 8 of my friends.  Historically I have always ordered Earl Grey as my tea selection.  However, this time I made a point to try all the teas my friends ordered.  And, to my delight they were all very good:

Tea Room Blend = good strong flavor
Vanilla Rooibos = nice full bodied option for an herbal tea
Apricot (decaf) = reminded me of potpourri
Genmai Cha = green tea with toasted rice and popcorn ( my daughter's favorite) very tasty
Forest Berries and Rose Hips = herbal tea that tastes like candy (my other daughter's favorite)
Chocolate Truffle = very yummy chocolate flavor 

We each ordered the High Tea and were stuffed beyond belief.  

The staff is always on top of making sure your tea pot is always full of hot water!  Thank you!!

excerpts: My go to place for high tea with the girls.
Delicious food and tea.
Wide selection of teas.
Very comfy and quaint as if you're at home.
Clean and service has always been great.
See you again soon!
high tea.author: Jennifer C.
high tea.review: I've been coming here for years. My go to place for high tea with the girls. Delicious food and tea. Wide selection of teas. Very comfy and quaint as if you're at home. Clean and service has always been great. See you again soon!

excerpts: We enjoyed high tea in a party of four, and got plenty of food.
The price was a little high, but you go to experience high tea.
Our server was friendly, and the tea and sandwiches were fantastic.
high tea.author: Kelly A.
high tea.review: Lovejoy's was fantastic. We enjoyed high tea in a party of four, and got plenty of food. The price was a little high, but you go to experience high tea. Our server was friendly, and the tea and sandwiches were fantastic. If you enjoy scones, tea, and petit fours, you'll enjoy Lovejoy's. It is a very old fashioned place full of beautiful antiques. Very cozy feeling, but not fancy. Great!

excerpts: I usually order the High Tea (~$20) or the Queen's Tea (~28).
The finger sandwiches are quite delicate, and my party
and I usually order ones that we would not make ourselves (chicken and asparagus, artichoke and arugula).
high tea.author: Joanne K.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's is my favorite tea place! It's a wonderful tea place for hosting bridal parties or any get-togethers. I love the stellar customer service here. The wonderful ladies are always checking to make sure our tea pots are filled. 

I usually order the High Tea (~$20) or the Queen's Tea (~28). The finger sandwiches are quite delicate, and my party and I usually order ones that we would not make ourselves (chicken and asparagus, artichoke and arugula). The scones are golden, crispy, and delicious! You can pair them with a light, Devonshire clotted cream, or a sweet strawberry jam. Finish off with some berries to cleanse your palate, then have a petit four to sweeten the deal. Lovejoy's is a treat, and well worth it, in my opinion.

excerpts: My mom and I went here for my 22nd birthday since I've been craving high tea
and I am so glad we did!
It's such a cute and cozy little spot that has great customer service and great food.
Our server (I forgot her name) but she was so sweet and even gave me a cute complementary petit four with a candle.
All in all it was a great experience and I would definitely go back again!

Our server (I forgot her name) but she was so sweet and even gave me a cute complementary petit four with a candle. All in all it was a great experience and I would definitely go back again!

excerpts: We were a group of 6 girls and all chose to do their "high tea".
We chose various teas and sandwiches so everyone could sample something different.
high tea.author: Emily C.
high tea.review: I love this incredibly cute place! We were a group of 6 girls and all chose to do their "high tea". We chose various teas and sandwiches so everyone could sample something different. The sandwiches were good, the teas were great, but the scones were Amazing!  I might just go back for just tea and scones!

excerpts: Ordered High Tea for 2 and for sandwich selections
, we ordered cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut salad, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and chicken & asparagus.
I must say,
I was very disappointed in the sandwiches.
The only sandwich I thought was decent was the smoked salmon & cream cheese while the others were far below average.
high tea.author: Mango T.
high tea.review:
For a 4.5-star rated tea room, I expected WAY more from Lovejoy's Tea Room.

Ordered High Tea for 2 and for sandwich selections, we ordered cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut salad, smoked salmon & cream cheese, and chicken & asparagus.  I must say, I was very disappointed in the sandwiches.  The only sandwich I thought was decent was the smoked salmon & cream cheese while the others were far below average.  There's something wrong when you feel like you can make better sandwiches at home than the ones served here. 

The cabbage salad (i.e. cole slaw) wasn't good at all and the cumin seeds didn't help the taste one bit and the organic green springs was nothing to write home about either.  I agree with the masses that the scone was probably the best part of the meal.

I've been to a tea room where they give you a thick pamphlet of teas to choose from so I was certainly not impressed with the selection here.  My biggest gripe with this tea room is that they put all the tea leaves INSIDE the tea pot and make you filter your own tea each time you pour yourself a cup.  This makes the tea really really dark and bitter towards the end, unless you can somehow drink mass amounts of tea in a short period of time.  I would have preferred that they put the tea leaves in a filter on top so that we have the option to choose how dark we want our teas.

Also, what happened to this excellent service that everyone was gushing about here?  There was certainly no 'pampering' here.  As a matter of fact, some would even consider the waitresses to be aloof and nonchalant but I didn't particularly mind despite expecting more.  Overall, I thought the experience was disappointing and overpriced, and I doubt I'll ever make a second visit.

excerpts: It was me and my friend Valerie's first time ever for high tea
high tea.author: Alyssa C.
high tea.review:
Let me start off my saying u need to book a reservation in advance! 

It was me and my friend Valerie's first time ever for high tea we had no idea what we were doing but very thankful for out server to help us and tell us what to do.

Once we got everything all situated, we picked out the type of tea we wanted. It was delicious and very fast too!

I love the whole place it is adorable, cozy, and it is a great place to catch up with friends! I am definitely coming back here!

excerpts: We ended up getting high tea
and I chose Pear & Stilton and Egg & Onion sandwiches with my course.
high tea.author: Yi Z.
high tea.review:
The reservation process was so tedious; there were many emails back and forth before I was able to book a time about 4 weeks out. I was persistent and checked in for cancellations and luckily was able to get my time moved up by 2 weeks. They don't always answer their phones on busy weekends so email seems to be the easiest way to go. I wish they would have an online booking process and they can even consider holding a credit card if they are concerned about cancellations.

Anyway, when the day finally came, all 4 of us made sure to be on time. The menu was a bit overwhelming for a first timer like myself. We ended up getting high tea and I chose Pear & Stilton and Egg & Onion sandwiches with my course. There are dozens of tea options and the server recommended the Tea Room Blend, which I ended up liking. The snacks were alright; the scone was probably the best part. The experience was really fun and I'd recommend Lovejoy's for a girls' get together. At ~$22, the price is reasonable for everything you're getting.

high tea.author: Jo W.
high tea.review:
Had my first time here yesterday after years of staring at photos online, and it certainly did not disappoint! I had imagined it to be two stories for some reason, and it's a little smaller than I expected, but the decor is so beautiful, charming, and quirky, like straight out of a Victorian storybook with a modern touch (mismatched tea cups, saucers, teapots, and plates).

My friend and I had Queen's Tea. I didn't see it offered on their Yelp menu, but on their menu at the table, it was listed. It's an awesome deal and can certainly be split between two people, along with add-ons (extra scones or petit fours) without it being too pricey. (I looked at the High Tea option. If we had chosen that, and then had extras, it would have costed more than the Queen's Tea with extra). Scones, fruits, salads, crumpet, YUM!

For tea, we got China Rose Petal. It's as delicious and beautiful as it sounds. The staff and waiters were so friendly and courteous, and were very kind to help me and my friend get photos of us even though they were closing up at 6:00 (my friend and I had a 4:30 reservation).

I really recommend everyone who has appreciation for tea and Victorian aesthetics/culture to visit this place. What a gem! You just have to drive over a bunch of crazy narrow streets and scary steep San Francisco hills.

My sole critique would be reservation. At the time of this review, only phone reservations are accepted, and I booked between a month to 2 weeks in advance, with the option of 11:00 AM or 4:30 PM on the day my friend and I wanted to come here. I would have liked to reserve online for simplicity's sake, and also not to have to play phone tag with staff (nothing wrong on their end. I left a message, and they called back when I was luckily not busy).

I'll be back here! This is a lovely place for a fairy tale tea getaway! :D

high tea.author: Olivia W.
high tea.review:
Queens Tea for 3 please! 

I have always wanted to have high tea, but I never had anyone that was interested in going with me. Lucky me it was my anniversary with my husband so he had to go with me. I'm glad that we chose to go to LoveJoys as our first high tea experience. We brought our daughter and she loved it as well. She's a little young for high tea and I probably won't bring her back until she's older.

We had the queens tea and a sandwich platter. We had the Royal Blend tea which I highly recommend. It was delicious. Since our daughter is too young for tea they gave her a teapot of milk. It was so cute and they even had a little cup for her to drink out of. We tried 4 different kinds of sandwiches. My favorite out of everything was the scone and lemon curd. I loved my entire experience here at LoveJoys. From the decor to the food and the service. Everything was amazing for a first time experience and I can't wait to come back. 

This is great place to bring your loved ones to celebrate a special day.

high tea.author: June Y.
high tea.review:
I was super excited to try this place out seeing as how they have 4.5 stars with a ton of reviews! First off, finding parking in the area during the weekend is TERRIBLE. I had to circle the blocks for 25 minutes before I could find a spot. 

Did high tea for 2 and sampled the following sandwiches:
1. Smoked salmon and cream cheese: Classic. Yummy.
2. Salmon Mousse: Can you tell I like salmon? A-OK.
3. Chicken apple walnut salad: didn't taste any walnut and just tasted like chicken salad to me. Meh.
4. Artichoke Hummus: good but so SALTY.

The tea sandwiches are TINY. tinier than the majority of tea rooms I've been to and I wasn't really terribly impressed with any particular sandwich.

The scones though are a different story and probably on my top 3 scones I've ever tried. Freshly baked, crumbly, flaky, buttery, light, just enough moistness and not softness. If you're not looking to try the full tea service, at least try their scones.

For my tea, I tried the black lavender vanilla tea. Really yummy! You can really taste the lavender and vanilla and it went so well with the savory sandwiches.

Pretty affordable as far as afternoon tea services go. The high tea for two cost $50.
Make reservations ahead of time. They get really busy especially during the weekends.

excerpts: My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here.
This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories.
We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us!
high tea.author: Ziyan C.
high tea.review:
My girlfriends and I had a lovely high tea on a Sunday afternoon here. This place is pretty decked out with all sorts of knick-knacks, teapots, lace galore, and accessories. We were able to borrow extra hats they had to really add to the high tea vibe, and when our server saw me using my fan to legitimately cool off from my bike ride, she brought fans for all of us! 

THE COST: $20 total for 2 Queen's Teas and 1 Light Tea. This was a filling afternoon snack shared amongst 5 of us. They bring out sandwiches, salads, scones, tea biscuits, and fruits first. The crumpets come next so they're warm and fresh. Last they bring around the tray of petit fours. 

THE SERVICE: Great. Even though the staff all look very hipster (read: tattoos, funky hair colors, piercings) and maybe could've fit in better in a coffee shop on Valencia, they all embraced their floral aprons and seemed to enjoy every minute of their jobs as much as the customers. The guy who brought out our tiered platter was also nice to offer to take photos of our group, taking several and offering tips like having my friend tilt her hat a certain way so her face would show up better. 

MUST-HAVES: If you're getting a Tea Service and like strong cheese, definitely get the The Pear & Stilton when you're choosing your Tea Sandwiches. For the Petit Fours, choose the rose water. 

Our platter: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg#MOK7eDDrfqmsqCOH7VIVTg

TEAS: 
Violet - My fave. A light sweetness that still mixed well with the herbal flavors of a tea.
Vanilla Rooibos - more sweet, but leaves a bitter aftertaste in my mouth.
White Peach - fruity and light.

TEA SANDWICHES
Best: Pear & Stilton by far! The intense blue cheese paired incredibly well with the sweet pear.

Everything else was quote bland and "safe":
Mediocre: Daily Special (roast beef & mustard), Chicken Apple Walnut Salad (though 
Too plain for me: Cucumber & Cream Cheese, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, Salmon Mousse

* Organic Spring Greens, Cabbage Salad in a Caraway Cream Dressing - 3 stars
Pretty simple, the only accent flavor being little mandarin orange slices, and there wasn't quite enough of that. The dressing seemed like a balsamic vinaigrette and the sharpness of that complemented the greens and the orange pretty well. I did wish the salad was colder; it seemed room temp, even warm later on.

Pretty, but not much beyond that. The winter melon was not ripe and a bit hard. Strawberries, blackberries, and kiwi were nice.

Not much here, like those generic hard, buttery Italian cookies.

LIke an English Muffin, but a little more dense, not so airy/fluffy. The outside is a little more crisped as well. Great with combinations of the lemon curd, butter, and blackberry preserves!

Not quite warm. Tasty but a little bit on the dry side. Love the combos of cream and blackberry preserves, that's the way to have it!
