excerpts: Never offer less than what the previous owners had all the regulars used to, like your choice of a tea with every high tea!
Today, upon getting seated we were "graced" with a black tea and a vanilla roiboos, but who ordered or picked those two?
How pretentious of them to force their choice of tea on a patron!
We know they are extra and not included with a high tea
high tea.author: Emilia G.
high tea.review:
It is sad to see that the new owner does not have a clue about how to run this potential gold mine.  Never be short staffed.  Never fill the whole restaurant at once and only have 2 servers.  Never offer less than what the previous owners had all the regulars used to, like your choice of a tea with every high tea! Today, upon getting seated we were "graced" with a black tea and a vanilla roiboos, but who ordered or picked those two?  How pretentious of them to force their choice of tea on a patron!  Then,  the crumpet for the queen was served as an afterthought.  The sandwiches overall, were great.  The chicken walnut salad sandwich tasted funny, like tuna fish and a tad sour.  The cucumbers were not fresh.  Only one of the persons at the table was offered a petit four! The rest of us were left speechless.  We know they are extra and not included with a high tea but we always used to get tempted at the end of the meal!

To add insult to injury, I ordered a chicken and asparagus tea sandwich to go and when my son opened the box to eat it at home it was turkey with mustard!  no asparagus! what????? So for that measly insult of a sandwich and two scones and a miniscule scoop of watery double devon cream I paid the exorbitant amount of $13+.  Oh I miss the ladies that for decades really knew what they were doing with this place.  It takes one person to bring it to ruin.  Sigh!  

Go to Lovey's in Pacifica, perhaps you will get lucky with the servers there.

excerpts: I had the high tea set with the Daily Special (Coronation Chicken, I think) and Cream Cheese Cucumber sandwiches.
high tea.author: Icy H.
high tea.review:
Came here for a mini bridal shower.  I found street parking in 5 minutes, about a block away, which isn't bad for SF.  The food was delicious.  I had the high tea set with the Daily Special (Coronation Chicken, I think) and Cream Cheese Cucumber sandwiches.  The decor is very cute, with the pink, tea sets and all.  

I took 2 points off for the following: 
- My tea (genmai cha) was lacking in flavor, so I felt like I was dranking hot water the whole time even though I let it seep as instructed.  I probably should've stuck with non-Asian tea at non-Asian restaurants.  
- We felt rushed by the waitress.  She came by multiple times within the first 15 minutes of seating even though we told her we were waiting for one more friend to arrive before placing any orders.  She did not appear happy about letting us wait...After placing our orders, we didn't see her again until "dessert" time and she placed the check on our table shortly after we declined the desserts she offered.  About 5-10 minutes later, she reappeared to "remind" us that we have 5 more minutes left in our seating.  So, my friends and I quickly paid and left.  

I would recommend management to train the staff to let the customers know that there is a 2 hour seating limit when they're placing the orders, so the customers are aware of it.  And, perhaps, also train the staff to be more discreet and polite when reminding customers of the time limit.

excerpts: We both got the high tea and the teas were great.

high tea.review: Came here to celebrate birthdays with a close friend. I made reservations online a little while back by sending them a message on their website. The process was pretty easy, it's just not instant but they're very responsive. We both got the high tea and the teas were great. Overall, I thought it was a nice cute experience. excerpts: I've been meaning to try this place out because I love high tea just as much as I love brunch.
Came on Wednesday early afternoon and got a table for 2 without a problem.
We got the Queen's tea which we shared (see picture) with an extra pot of bottomless tea.
It is a lot of food and finishes off with petit fours.
$45 in total + tips which is a great price for high tea.
It's super kooky and vintage decor, mismatched tea pots and cozy vibe.
The best thing is they were able to do the entire high tea gluten free for me including scones and biscuits and sandwiches which I am extremely impressed with.
I highly recommend the salmon and cream cheese sandwiches and the black vanilla tea.
Definitely coming back!!

, so we each got our own choice of tea and each high tea comes with 2 choice of sandwich so we were able to choose 4.
high tea.author: Angela L.
high tea.review:
The interior is gorgeous! Every little thing and detail in here fits in all together. Place isn't really big so best to make a reservation. But a really nice place to just have a girls day and just relax and catch up. 

The scones are the best! I've never been a fan of scones because they are typically dense and cold and hard but theirs is complete opposite  (of course you should eat it while it's still warm once it comes). It comes with double Devon cream and a jam. It's already perfect by itself.

My friend and I got the High Tea, so we each got our own choice of tea and each high tea comes with 2 choice of sandwich so we were able to choose 4. 

Overall, the service was good. Making sure we're doing okay and explain to us what the daily special sandwich was and explain each section as our food arrived

excerpts: The highlight for me and friends is High Tea with delicious sandwiches.
I love the Earl Grey and the teapots they serve it in.
high tea.author: Jane F.
high tea.review: The atmosphere and service is quaint and charming, just as a British tea house should be.  The highlight for me and friends is High Tea with delicious sandwiches.  I love the Earl Grey and the teapots they serve it in.

excerpts: I usually get The High Tea and not the Queen's Tea, only because I don't like Petit Four's.
Nasty cake covered in sugar.
high tea.author: Jack R.
high tea.review:
Came here to treat my editor out for lunch, and by the looks of it, I didn't know there was a prerequisite of knowing Downton Abbey to eat here.

Woman near the restroom: "Do you watch Downton Abbey?"
Me waiting in line, minding my own business: "No."
Woman near the restroom: "Oh, EVERYBODY WATCHES IT, dear."
2nd woman queuing up; there's only one toilet: "Oh, I heard you mentioning Downton, oh I love that show..."

The next 5 minutes was a blur as they chatted back and forth over what seemed like the game of Clue. There was a butler, a rich man, a maid, and murder.

Thank goodness I was here for their tea. And speaking strictly as someone who's father is British, and from all my travels to London and back, I love this place.

I usually get The High Tea and not the Queen's Tea, only because I don't like Petit Four's. Nasty cake covered in sugar. No offense to Lovejoy's, I dislike all Petit Four's alike.

My favorite sandwiches are their Salmon Mousse, Chicken Salad, and Egg Salad.

The service here is always top notch, they refill my honey, add more water, etc without me having to flag them down.

But, my all time top 20 food comes from this place, and that's their scone with Devon cream. Even the Brown's hotel in London doesn't have scones and cream this delicious.

And, at least the lovely staff doesn't require any prior knowledge of Downton Abbey before they seat you.

excerpts: Came here with 5 of my friends for a bachelorette kickoff with high tea.
We ordered the High tea and the Queen's tea.
high tea.author: Payal B.
high tea.review:
Oh Lovejoy, just the mere mention of Parisian-standard tea is enough to make every girl excited. Its one of the best picks to celebrate a day with your lovely ladies such as  bachelorette's, bridal shower or simply when you wanna dress up n feel fancy.

Came here with 5 of my friends for a bachelorette kickoff with high tea.  Made reservation at least 3 weeks in advance as this place is super busy on weekends.

Play dress up for the fun of it. Make sure your girls pick their choice of hats from the hat stand and do a role play from Downtown Abbey. 

Decor -
You are sure to be transformed to the British la la land. The decor is sure to melt your heart like candy floss. So charming with lace, hats, florals and everything antique chic.

Food -
We ordered the High tea and the Queen's tea. Served in absolutely adorable tea sets!

Tea comprises of sandwiches, scones,fresh fruits, biscuit, fresh fruits and bottomless tea. 
- The warm scones served with raspberry & lemon curd jams were buttery deliciousness.
- They have a variety of flavorful teas such as Rose, Summer berries, Violet, White Peach,etc. We went with the choice of rose tea which was highly fragrant and refreshing. 
- For the sandwiches, our favorites were - salmon cream cheese and chicken asparagus.. All sandwiches were super delicious.

Service - 
Excellent. Everything came on time.They always made sure our tea pots are filled.

Price - 
We paid $25 each, for a group of 5. Not bad.

This place was just perfect and a 5 star. Everyone had a great time.

excerpts: Do have high tea.
I loved the white strawberry flavor.
high tea.author: Catherine K.
high tea.review:
In the game of scones,
This is the iron scone.
The one scone to rule them all.

----
Do have high tea. I loved the white strawberry flavor.
Did I mention the scones?
So buttery and scrumptious!

excerpts: I felt so sophisticated, posh, elegant and English when I was high tea-ing here.
high tea.author: Lisa Z.
high tea.review:
This place is a-mazing.

I felt so sophisticated, posh, elegant and English when I was high tea-ing here. Satisfied my adult tea party cravings!

I'd recommend you call and make reservations. Book 2 weeks in advance because it gets booked out easily....almost all their tables are reserved. 2 hour seatings.

I got the queen's tea. Go big or go home folks. 

My favorite out of all the sandwiches was the chicken and asparagus! Asparagus never tasted so good in my life. 

For tea, I recommend the white peach as it paired very well with the food and experience. Light, mildy sweet, very enjoyable.

excerpts: We all ordered the High Tea.
The tea was yummy, I ordered Strawberry White Tea.
The scone was tasty.
The sandwiches, salad, and slaw were blah.
We ordered the chicken salad, cucumber, salmon, and cheddar chutney.
The chicken was the best tasting but lacked flavor and had barely any chicken salad.
The salmon one, nope, the cucumber was blah no dill... and the chutney was disgusting!
Tasted like super strong ketchup.
high tea.author: Audra M.
high tea.review: Way too cramped, was so muggy and smelly when I first walked in. There was condensation on the windows. We requested a seat in the back, it seemed a little less noisy. We all ordered the High Tea. The tea was yummy, I ordered Strawberry White Tea. The scone was tasty. The sandwiches, salad, and slaw were blah. We ordered the chicken salad, cucumber, salmon, and cheddar chutney. The chicken was the best tasting but lacked flavor and had barely any chicken salad. The salmon one, nope, the cucumber was blah no dill... and the chutney was disgusting! Tasted like super strong ketchup.

excerpts: We ordered 1 light tea, 1 high tea and 1 queen's tea.
It was more than enough for 3 people.
We were a little sad that they didn't have macarons, but they did have a lot have cute hats that you can borrow to take photos in!
high tea.author: Michelle C.
high tea.review: Had a great time coming here with my friends. YAY for having gluten free options! (Even it does cost a little more) We ordered 1 light tea, 1 high tea and 1 queen's tea. It was more than enough for 3 people. We were a little sad that they didn't have macarons, but they did have a lot have cute hats that you can borrow to take photos in!

excerpts: I've had high tea in London and it was amazing.
I also just had a tea party of my own a few months back
and it was a delight.
I was so eager in fact that I insisted we go to tea before we even handled the errands that brought us to SF for the day.
The tea room itself is adorable.
I love how none of the cups, saucers and pots match.
The eclectic decor gives it a really authentic feel and even the bathroom is done up.
The antique furniture is great too.
We were surprised that there were a lot of kids inside the business and it was actually rather loud and noisy.
The staff was nice enough, but not genuinely warm.
We each had a pot of tea.
We got 4 sandwiches with our high tea for two.
I had the special which was a fig and goat cheese and I also ordered the pickle chutney.
My date had the hummus and artichoke as well as turkey with dijon mustard.
When the sandwiches came out they were TINY which is too be expected at a tea.
But still, these were exceptionally tiny
so we resigned ourselves to eat a real meal somewhere else later.
Unfortunately, the sandwiches were inedible.
The flavors were overpowering in the worst way and they smelled and tasted rancid.
Honestly, there were all terrible with no consideration for anyone's pallet.
I was very disappointed.
high tea.author: Dale S.
high tea.review:
I was SO excited to try this place! I've had high tea in London and it was amazing. I also just had a tea party of my own a few months back and it was a delight. I was so eager in fact that I insisted we go to tea before we even handled the errands that brought us to SF for the day. 
The tea room itself is adorable. I love how none of the cups, saucers and pots match. The eclectic decor gives it a really authentic feel and even the bathroom is done up. The antique furniture is great too. We were surprised that there were a lot of kids inside the business and it was actually rather loud and noisy. 
The staff was nice enough, but not genuinely warm. 
We each had a pot of tea. I chose the Vanilla black tea and my fiance had the black currant. I don't know why he chose that and it tasted bad (as I expected it would) with a bad aftertaste as well. Can't blame them for that. We just kept drinking out of my pot lol. 
We got 4 sandwiches with our high tea for two. I had the special which was a fig and goat cheese and I also ordered the pickle chutney. My date had the hummus and artichoke as well as turkey with dijon mustard. When the sandwiches came out they were TINY which is too be expected at a tea. But still, these were exceptionally tiny so we resigned ourselves to eat a real meal somewhere else later. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were inedible. The flavors were overpowering in the worst way and they smelled and tasted rancid. Honestly, there were all terrible with no consideration for anyone's pallet. I was very disappointed. 
The warm scones were good and the raspberry preserves were delicious. I could eat that on it's own. The "salad" and slaw on the bottom of the tray were minimal and flavorless and the dressing was no help. 
The real reason we came was for the petite fours! I have loved them since I was a child and could not wait to have my fiance taste one :) I was overjoyed when they brought out the desserts; both for the petite fours and because we were both starving! Although they are small and were $2.50 each, we got 3 just to sample. I heard the server advise that they were Marzipan, but after biting into the first one, I almost spit it out. My fiance bit into his at the same time and the look on our faces spoke volumes. It was terrible! I tried to eat them but they literally made me feel sick. We had to put napkins over them so we could get our check. I felt so bad. Last night I had to order some real petite fours online to try and "un-traumatize" my fiance and let him know they aren't really disgusting. 
Sad to say, but this place is just a novelty and I should not be rated as highly as it is. I would give our experience 1.5 stars.

excerpts: We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie.
Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches.
You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal!
I have not been to Crumpet.
high tea.author: Elizabeth T.
high tea.review:
Beautiful, old-fashion-looking, tea room serving some good 'ol afternoon tea!

Crowd: for weekends --- go online for reservation. You won't be able to get in otherwise. There are set entry times as well. I think the max stay for each party is 2 hours. You will need to put down a card for the reservation as well.

Location: right next to the muni stop on Church, J line goes through here.

Tea set: you order tea, each person can get his/her own tea, and then depending on the price range, either 1-2 tea sandwiches, salad, crumpets, scones, cookies, etc. All the sandwiches are decent, but I won't say extremely outstanding. After all, I don't think an afternoon tea is about how extreme their sandwiches are :) You're really just there for the nice atmosphere, pleasant decor, warm and nice food, and chit chat. 

For those with kids: strollers will not fit inside. No room for highchair. OK to bring infants that can be held/wrapped and are relatively quiet. Not suitable for small children who can't sit still.

Experience: We went with a party of 6 on Sunday 1:15PM with reservation a month in advance. Promptly seated. We all ordered "high tea" which comes with two tea sandwiches, salad, crumpet, scone, cookie. Don't be fooled by the tiny sandwiches. You WILL BE FULL by the end of the 2 hour meal! Service is good and there's really not much to complain! 

Compare to other tea places in SF:

Dartealing is a little better in terms of tea uniqueness & sandwich quality, but overall these two are my favorites. Fairmont hotel afternoon tea is more expensive, has more fancy decor, but the sweets are actually worse. The Rotunda downtown is more noisy, fancier looking, more expensive, and also less refined. Samouvar is not really the same type of place, so no comparison.  I have not been to Crumpet.

So really, Dartealing and LoveJoy are my top 2 recommended afternoon tea in SF. Very affordable and very good!

excerpts: As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea.
The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard.
My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny.
Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small!
The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people.
high tea.author: Joyce E.
high tea.review:
I was seriously envisioning giving Lovejoy's Tea Room a glowing 5 star review because I love all the cutesy quirky decor, but my best friend and I got the serious runs after visiting this place! I made a reservation for 2 at 2pm on a Thursday afternoon and my best friend and I arrived 15 minutes before our reservation. We were seated right away, but I was a bit disappointed that we were sitting so close to the party next to us because we could hear every single detail of their conversation. We were going to ask if we could move, but the place was packed and we didn't want to seem like snobs!

As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea. The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard. My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny. Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small! The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people. Also, the scones were some of the best I've had!

As we were eating and chatting about life, I noticed that I felt a tad bit hot halfway through. Thinking it was the tea and lack of ventilation on our side, I ignored it and started to feel this way throughout the remaining portion of our tea time. We paid, left, and my stomach started making odd noises. I ignored it until an hour passed and my BFF and I ran to the shiny porcelain throne and girl, let me tell you, it definitely felt like we were reenacting the scene from White Chicks when Brittany or Tiffany Wilson was holding on for her life when she had the quiche. Definitely NOT  a pretty look! It was my first time taking Pepto Bismol and I was not happy.

Again I really do hate to be that person giving 2 stars on a highly rated establishment, but Lovejoy's, you let me down. Would I come back? Probably not!

excerpts: Best high tea place ever!
There's so much character here in Noe Valley, San Francisco!
Lovejoy's hits the spot.
It was the first time for my little lady
and I wanted to show her the best.
The owner gave us marzipan petit fours and rose petal lemonade.
I love the eclectic decor.
We tried on hats, played with teapots, ate divine treats.
Just a great 'lady day' with my special little girl.
A new tradition!
Go!
high tea.author: Jennifer B.
high tea.review: Best high tea place ever! There's so much character here in Noe Valley, San Francisco! Lovejoy's hits the spot. It was the first time for my little lady and I wanted to show her the best. The owner gave us marzipan petit fours and rose petal lemonade. I love the eclectic decor. We tried on hats, played with teapots, ate divine treats. Just a great 'lady day' with my special little girl. A new tradition! Go!

excerpts: I'm not a high tea person.
I don't normally drink tea.
I don't like eating dinky portions.
But it's one of those get-in-touch-with-your-feminine-side things.
high tea.author: Marti L.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy won me over with their pub fare menu. Yup, it was that simple. 

I'm not a high tea person. I don't normally drink tea. I don't like eating dinky portions. But it's one of those get-in-touch-with-your-feminine-side things. And of course, it's about being in the company of good girlfriends. 

The place felt crowded and cluttered. It was overloaded with pictures, posters, hats, and all sorts of dainty things! Still, they were all interesting to look at. Service was quite friendly and attentive given how busy they were. 

Out of 7 girls, 4 did tea service while 3 ordered from the pub fare. I don't remember the exact tea service, but it came with delicious looking tea sandwiches, fresh fruits, fresh scones, and more. But I would say the winners were the shepherd's pies and salad from the pub fare menu. 

Shepherd's Pie (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#TO35VWsTkBqeB_BW3eXzHg): Minced meat and mashed potato baked in a large dish. Served with mixed greens. Not only was the portion huge, it tasted so good! So flavorful and hearty!

Pear & Stilton Salad (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lovejoys-tea-room-san-francisco?select=QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw#QYmRr5ttvjsDnGRY18jAzw): Spring greens with pears, strawberries, oranges, blueberries, walnut, stilton cheese, and strawberry balsamic vinaigrette. Served with slices of grapefruit and pita on the side. The salad was also huge. But also very refreshing and delicious! 

One of the girlfriends and I originally made plans to go eat in the Mission afterwards, thinking we won't be full. We ended up going to the Mission to walk off our stuffed bellies.

excerpts: As far as high tea goes, it's very affordable!
I loved the English Cheddar and Tomato sandwich.
high tea.author: Lizzy B.
high tea.review: So much fun! They have a great selection of teas (I really liked the Chestnut) and some really tasty sandwiches! As far as high tea goes, it's very affordable! I loved the English Cheddar and Tomato sandwich. Also, the SCONES!

excerpts: I couldn't fault the Tea Service (High Tea) and I left satisfied.
It's a smallish place--and very popular--so plan to get cozy while knowing there is still plenty of space to enjoy a conversation with a close friend or two.
high tea.author: Tao G.
high tea.review:
If you are looking for "ultra-posh" Tea Service, try the Fairmont Hotel. It isn't any better than Lovejoy's fare, but you can pay more and not complain about the charming mismatched antique tea sets.The place may be a collage of eras and furniture to match, but it doesn't "smell" bad. The reviews that say that are hyperbolic.

Even the neighborhood is a bit out of time, more like the SF of yesteryear, quieter, charming, more contemplative than most, including nearby 24th street, which means you can park if you need to drive. 

Lovejoy's embraces an informal aesthetic with staff that are incredibly friendly and attentive. I couldn't fault the Tea Service (High Tea) and I left satisfied. It's a smallish place--and very popular--so plan to get cozy while knowing there is still plenty of space to enjoy a conversation with a close friend or two.

excerpts: It was my first time experiencing high tea, and I didn't expect anything great
; I mean, it's just tea and some overpriced biscuits.
high tea.author: Kim D.
high tea.review:
I came here for my sister's baby sprinkle in a party of ~ 8. It was my first time experiencing high tea, and I didn't expect anything great; I mean, it's just tea and some overpriced biscuits. How great can it be, right?

Well, I found out that it's pretty darn great! First off, everything was adorable, from the mismatched plates and saucers to the homey, antiquey decorations around the tea room. It reminds me of Alice in Wonderland, just a bit! The service is also wonderful. She always came around to keep our tea pots full and to make sure we were doing okay. 

The menu is extensive - you're definitely not limited in food, as there's salad, fruit, crumpets, scones, sandwiches, and other pastries. I ordered the Queen's tea with a pomegranate black tea and shared it with my cousin. It's seriously a lot of food! My favorites were the buttery, delicate scones, crumpets, and the smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. They were heavenly when paired with the tea. I prefer plain unsweetened tea, but they do provide sugar and milk for you to add as you prefer it. Also, when you choose your petits fours at the end of your tea ritual, I would suggest avoiding the salted caramel truffle unless you like your truffle EXTREMELY salty. Everything else seemed fine, though.

Overall, I'd definitely come back when I'm in SF. Seeing as how brunch has become pretty basic (but I'm still a huge brunch fanatic - does that make me basic?), I say skip the eggs benedicts and mimosas and have a tea party date with your girlfriends at Lovejoy's instead!

excerpts: We got the high tea for two ( 21 dollars per person)!
It comes with two sandwiches of your choice ( we got four types), one scone, salad, coleslaw!
A lot of food!
high tea.author: Josie H.
high tea.review:
After hearing about this place for awhile, I was finally able to try it out. Keep in mind, this is a few blocks away from the 24th mission! ( and you have to walk uphill!) . My advice is either drive, uber, maybe the j muni line! 

You definitely need more than an hour here and make sure to make reservations! We came on a Thursday and it was packed! ( thank goodness for reservations!) 

We got the high tea for two ( 21 dollars per person)! It comes with two sandwiches of your choice ( we got four types), one scone, salad, coleslaw! A lot of food! We also got two pots of tea!

The only con about this place is their lack of desserts!( perhaps they come with a different tea set)! I'll definitely come here again but not during my lunch for sure!

excerpts: Btw we ordered the high tea!
high tea.author: Rosh E.
high tea.review:
Location: It's on the corner so you won't miss it and it is street parking!


Customer Service: Friendly staff and very attentive.


Decor: Very cute vintage and antique feel! I love the decor actually, it feels like somebody took a box and put in all these memorabilia with cute old school furniture and shook it up and bam you got the love joy tea room!


Presentation of Food: Very cute and everything you'd expect in a tea party setting! Cutest thing was the mismatched tea sets gave it a different feel compared to other tea spots!


How did the food taste?: This is why I gave it two stars! The sandwiches were plain and nothing to rave about? I tried the chicken walnut sammy and it had no flavor! Their sandwhich of the day had turkey cranberry etc and you'd think it's be good because it's the special of the day but it was too sour and just wasn't what I had expected. The salad was bleh also, the dressing was just so bland! the only thing i did enjoy were the yummy scones but other than that everything was dissaponting especially because of the raving yelpers that attracted us to even try this place out );!!! Btw we ordered the high tea! I will say though is that they had good tea.



Overall Experience: It was just eh....


Would I Come Back?: No there's other tea places I target go to!

excerpts: For special occasions, we usually get high tea.
high tea.author: Cat B.
high tea.review:
My friends and I come here every other month for special occasions and when we just want to have a nice cup of tea and sandwiches. For special occasions, we usually get high tea. The warm scones and raspberry jam are always amazing. My favourite sandwiches are the chicken apple walnut and salmon and cream cheese. Their sandwiches are always delicious and the bread is soft like clouds. 

For birthdays, LJ's gives a special small birthday cake petit four (all the other petit four flavours are incredible as well- especially the lemon and strawberry ones).
I love the "endless pot o' tea" -- my friends and I always find ourselves drinking two or more teapot-fulls! 
As for tea, China rose petal and Forest berries and rose hips are my absolute favourite.
Lovejoy's is perfect for just hanging out with the girls or for birthday parties. I have seen a post-wedding celebration take place at Lovejoy's as well. I highly recommend for all ages and just about any occasion.

excerpts: Had high tea here this afternoon, very quaint and cute little tea room.
high tea.author: Eileen H.
high tea.review:
Had high tea here this afternoon, very quaint and cute little tea room.  Lots of books and general clutter around but in a cute "grandma" way.

Servers were amazing, tea and scones were delicious.  

Between the two of us we had 4 sandwiches, the only one I would skip is the salmon and cream cheese.  We had the daily special which was a curry sand which and was delicious.

excerpts: Tried their high tea and me tea.
I was starving and my high tea portions filled me up.
I've had better sammies (cucumber cream cheese and bay shrimp)
elsewhere
high tea.author: Julie L.
high tea.review:
Great little tea room for lunch. I ordered the white peach tea and it was smoooooooth. My GF had the black vanilla lavender tea which she said was fragrant.

Tried their high tea and me tea. I was starving and my high tea portions filled me up. I've had better sammies (cucumber cream cheese and bay shrimp) elsewhere but their scones are the best. Dense, moist and flaky. 

Good service. Cute setup. Clean bathroom (it's important!).

excerpts: We ended up ordering the high tea and "me" tea with black vanilla lavender tea and darjeeling tea-- both of my new favorites.
What I loved about the tea was that it was loose leaf, which is definitely the healthier type of tea
(tea bags contain added chemicals that aren't good for you).
With the tea, we were able to order sandwiches and a side pastry.
I ordered the darjeeling with the chicken and asparagus & salmon and cream cheese sandwiches.
My brother ordered his vanilla lavender tea with the daily special sandwich-- which was cranberry and turkey (reminded me of Thanksgiving).
high tea.author: Brittany D.
high tea.review:
Takes me back to England! Even though my fondest memories were in England, drinking tea is a global phenomenon that many people from all the different parts of the world partake in. When I was in college, I studied abroad in England and one thing I miss most is the amazing tasting teas & the tearooms! Pinkies up! 

Of course, tearooms are more widespread in the land of the monarchy, but it's nice to know one of them is a 10-minute drive from my place in SF. Parking is very easy to find even on the weekends. We were able to find street parking a block away. Beware of street signs if you park in the afternoon on weekdays. The tea room is only open Wednesdays to Sundays until 6PM. Last feeding (their words not mine) is at 4:30PM. I would highly recommend making a reservation, especially on the weekends just so you secure yourself a spot in this quaint and cozy little tearoom. You can reserve up to 2 hours in advanced if you're not quite sure of your schedule until the day of. They usually don't pick up, so make sure you leave a message & they'll return your call right away. 

When we arrived we were seated at this cute little table by the window and on the table, there was a sign that said "reserved for royalty". I know at one point I wanted to marry Prince William, but that hardly makes me royal. Regardless, that made me feel very special. The tearoom is small, probably fitting only about 7-10 tables tops. But I think this creates a very intimate experience. Our waitress was very attentive and I felt like she was able to get us everything we needed, which was probably because the space accommodated a handful of people (a plus!). Our waitress was also very knowledgeable about the teas and didn't mind waiting until we perused through the extensive menu that included over 20 different teas! 

We ended up ordering the high tea and "me" tea with black vanilla lavender tea and darjeeling tea-- both of my new favorites. What I loved about the tea was that it was loose leaf, which is definitely the healthier type of tea (tea bags contain added chemicals that aren't good for you). With the tea, we were able to order sandwiches and a side pastry. I ordered the darjeeling with the chicken and asparagus & salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. My brother ordered his vanilla lavender tea with the daily special sandwich-- which was cranberry and turkey (reminded me of Thanksgiving). Along with my sandwiches came a delicious scone with a side of strawberry jam and butter; while my brother chose a crumpet, his personal favorite, with a side of lemon spread. The sandwiches also came with a salad and vinaigrette. I think the food was excellent and it paired very well with the tea. 

The tea is a bit pricey (bill was $40 for 2), but I think it was worth it given the wonderful experience that my brother and I had. I definitely want to come back another time with family and friends. It was such a lovely and nostalgic experience.

excerpts: We had the High Tea service which also came with sandwiches, cabbage salad, spring mix salad and tea biscuits.
The sandwiches, spring mix salad with balsamic dressing, and cabbage salad were good, pretty tasty.
The chicken & asparagus and the tomato & cheddar sandwiches were my favorites.
The tea biscuits, cookies really, melt-in-your mouth buttery.
high tea.author: Marivic T.
high tea.review:
I came here for my friend's baby shower  yesterday and loved it! It's a wonderful place to enjoy afternoon tea. 

Ambiance: Cozy, fun, warm and welcoming. Lace topped tables, mismatched floral porcelain tea sets, cute curtains and the carefully cluttered look...definitely makes you feel like you're in Grandma's dining/sitting room. The hat stands with an assortment of fun and unique hats completes the quaint shabby chic look. 

Food: Best scones I've had in America. Buttery, creamy, tender and flavorful currant scones served with real Devonshire cream and jam. These scones are the closest to the ones I've had in the tea shops of Cambridge and London, England. We had the High Tea service which also came with sandwiches, cabbage salad, spring mix salad and tea biscuits. The sandwiches, spring mix salad with balsamic dressing, and cabbage salad were good, pretty tasty. The chicken & asparagus and the tomato & cheddar sandwiches were my favorites. The tea biscuits, cookies really, melt-in-your mouth buttery. The scones were truly the highlight for me, a definite must! 

There's quite a selection of teas to choose from, all loose leaf. We enjoyed several teas but my favorite was the white peach. It was the perfect complement to the sandwiches and scones. They definitely know how to brew a proper pot of tea here.

Service: Friendly and quick. We were served shortly after everyone was seated. I don't believe we ever ran out of tea. The waitresses even offered to take our group picture at the table and outside by the mural, a nice touch. Usually you have to ask so it's really nice when they offer. 

I'm definitely coming back with family and friends. This is a great venue for a baby shower, birthday or brunch with friends. 

Don't forget to make reservations because this place was jam packed. 

Parking: Street parking only. Surprisingly, I was able to park on the same block. I saw several other spots close by too.

excerpts: so I love the idea of high tea in all its fancy glory.
This place is in the heart of Noe Valley, walked by it a million times but finally came around to trying it.
The decor reminds me of the Shabby Chic collection with the crocheted pillows and floral patterns.
We ordered the "High Tea" service with the Mango, White Peach (my favorite), Chamomile and Peppermint teas.
high tea.author: Tania S.
high tea.review:
Can you say CAYOOT with a capital Q? First and foremost, I'm an avid Downtown Abbey viewer so I love the idea of high tea in all its fancy glory. This place is in the heart of Noe Valley, walked by it a million times but finally came around to trying it. The decor reminds me of the Shabby Chic collection with the crocheted pillows and floral patterns. I've been to Crown & Crumpet in Japantown before but the food/tea here is WAY better.

Normally, there's a long wait but if you get there early enough you might be able to skip the line. We got there right when it opened so we were seated immediately. We ordered the "High Tea" service with the Mango, White Peach (my favorite), Chamomile and Peppermint teas. I loved the sandwiches and the scones were ultra fluffy and yummay. I wasn't a fan of the crumpets with the lemon curd but then again, I never have been a fan of crumpets to begin with. Also, I normally wouldn't have opted for the "Pear and Stilton" sandwich but it was delicious! The waitresses are all very friendly. Perfect place for a date with your girlfriends.

excerpts: Product: high tea service -
This place is a breath of British Victorian fresh air.

Though this place can seem a bit pretentious due to the nature of British high tea, the staff and the atmosphere that the place brings makes it more like having tea with grandma and telling her what's going on with life.
Ambiance: Granny from Wales who likes to bake, have tea, and then go hunting in her Chanel or Burberry hunting ensemble post afternoon high tea.
This place is really great at keeping itself authentic to an old fashioned Victorian tea time saloon.
They offer afternoon tea, high tea, and Royal tea service which I find very refreshing and proprietary.
high tea.author: Edgar I.
high tea.review:
Product: high tea service - This place is a breath of British Victorian fresh air.  The only thing missing is a garden in the back with soft white butterflies fluttering around while sipping some tea and eating some crumpets and petit fours.  Though this place can seem a bit pretentious due to the nature of British high tea, the staff and the atmosphere that the place brings makes it more like having tea with grandma and telling her what's going on with life.  The sandwiches are divine and this place alone can sell itself with the fresh made blueberry scones and warm crumpets with their spreads.  My sister and I had the chestnut tea which is my favorite and the staff made sure that we were never without tea and good fine service.  Definitely a go to place for morning brunch and afternoon tea time.  "It's divine, it's delectable, is de-Lovejoy's!"

Service rating:  The staff at Lovejoy's is nothing but wonderful.  Very friendly, very respectful to not interrupt conversation when refilling your teapots, and makes sure that everyone in your party is enjoying their tea time and snacks.  Whether you're in your best floral Sunday brunch dresses, button down and designer jeans, or even just shorts and a sweater they make you feel like you belong and either are really great at hiding judgment or are just quite humble and amiable.  

Ambiance: Granny from Wales who likes to bake, have tea, and then go hunting in her Chanel or Burberry hunting ensemble post afternoon high tea.  This place is really great at keeping itself authentic to an old fashioned Victorian tea time saloon.  They offer afternoon tea, high tea, and Royal tea service which I find very refreshing and proprietary.  

Recommendation: Clotted cream or spotted dick, YUM! Other than that, I hope they keep it as it is and I hope this place keeps attracting customers.  I plan to bring my future children here for afternoon tea or Sunday brunch one day!

excerpts: I had the High Tea that included scones, salad, coleslaw, and sandwiches.
Scones: YUM!
I am usually not a huge fan of scones since they are often too dry and flaky.
However, this was absolutely delicious.
Do not forget to use their raspberry jam and devon cream on the raisin scones as well!
As I write this review, I am still thinking back to that first bite of my raisin scone...
and I only ordered a high tea for $19.95 and were not asked to follow this "minimum," which was great because we were so full by the end of our meal.
high tea.author: Jinyen Y.
high tea.review:
5 stars : Partly because of the food and partly because I ate it with my significant other during Valentine's. WEEEEEEEEEE

I have been meaning to come to this place for the longest time after I saw pictures on Facebook from my friends. I am so glad we came here. We made reservations beforehand and had a lovely seat by the window. I had the High Tea that included scones, salad, coleslaw, and sandwiches. 

Scones: YUM! I am usually not a huge fan of scones since they are often too dry and flaky. However, this was absolutely delicious. Do not forget to use their raspberry jam and devon cream on the raisin scones as well! As I write this review, I am still thinking back to that first bite of my raisin scone...so delish.

Sandwiches: We had the Salmon Mousse as well as the Lovejoy's Special, which was a Chicken with Arugula, coupled with curry sauce. The Salmon Mousse was great, but nothing special or out of the blue. The chicken sandwich was very special as you usually wouldn't come across curry as a spread on sandwiches. 

Tea: Black Vanilla with Lavender. I decided to try something more relaxing since it's a date and I wanted something relaxing. I couldn't really taste the lavender but maybe because my taste buds were masked by the amazing raspberry jam. The servers kept making sure that we had enough tea and poured hot water to ensure warm tea. 

We ended up staying for 1.5 hours because it was such a cute place! I remembered that a fellow Yelper described this place as "your crazy aunt's place where none of the cutlery or plates matched". This is incredibly true. Yet, this "crazy aunt" must also be such a lovely and homely aunt because of all the picture frames on the wall and cozy little cushions. The table beside us (a group of retirees) even dressed up for tea, with little hats and bows to match their dresses!

I will definitely come here again if i am by the area.

One more thing - while the menu states that each person must spend $10.95 minimum, my bf and I only ordered a high tea for $19.95 and were not asked to follow this "minimum," which was great because we were so full by the end of our meal.

She didn't eat at all.
But I requested they make half of the tea sandwiches for her- cream cheese/strawberry jam which I ended up eating.
It was yummy.
The hummus sandwich I ordered was bland.
Tea was good
I ordered their berry fruit tea with Rose in it.
Over all it was okay.
high tea.author: Jade D.
high tea.review:
This place is super cute. Love the decor feels like I'm in my grandmas's house Lol. 

I ordered their high tea since I came here with my 3 year old. She didn't eat at all. But I requested they make half of the tea sandwiches for her- cream cheese/strawberry jam which I ended up eating. It was yummy. The hummus sandwich I ordered was bland. Tea was good I ordered their berry fruit tea with Rose in it. Over all it was okay. The upside was their scones. Yummmmmmy!

excerpts: Most of us ordered the High Tea (~$20) which comes with your choice of 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, cabbage salad, mixed green salad, and a cookie biscuit.
high tea.author: Jennifer W.
high tea.review:
Quaint, charming, and whimsical place for a fun afternoon tea with your girl (and guy) friends! The decor made me feel like I was in some English lady's closet/house. 

Most of us ordered the High Tea (~$20) which comes with your choice of 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, cabbage salad, mixed green salad, and a cookie biscuit. The sandwiches are pretty standard, but the scone was so good, and I usually don't like scones at all! It's served warm with jam and clotted cream, and not dry at all, but flaky and buttery. I ordered green tea, and the tea itself was very light in flavor, I prefer mine a bit stronger, but it didn't really deter from the overall afternoon tea experience. I've only had one other afternoon tea experience in the city at Neiman's, and Lovejoy's is definitely a more laid-back (and economical) affair. 

Reservations are in 2-hour blocks which can be a bit of a downer if you're having good conversation with friends. I'll probably want to check out other afternoon tea places in the city before I come back, but it's overall a great place to relax and enjoy yourself in good company.

excerpts: We got the Queen's Tea and the High Tea.
high tea.author: Judy L.
high tea.review:
Good for the price. Not the best tea I have had but one of the best for the price. We got the Queen's Tea and the High Tea. With the two combined, we had a total of 4 different types of tea sandwiches, 2 pots of tea, salads, 2 scones, 1 crumpet, 2 checker cookies and slices of fruits. My favorite was the scone. It was buttery and of the perfect texture. Everything else was tasty but not mindblowing. Service was great though. I loved the hostess and our server. Also, very cute tea sets with quirky tablecloths and decorations. 

Call ahead at least 2 weeks in advance to make sure you can get a reservation.

excerpts: I ordered the High Tea, which comes with a bottomless pot of tea, two sandwiches,  coleslaw, green salad, scones and spreads.
I had the Afternoon Darjeeling, which I drank two pots of.
The scones were fluffy and warm, served with devonshire cream and preserves.
high tea.author: Rebekah T.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is such a pretty place. My experience there was as lovely as the company that I was in. You are never too old to play tea, I mean have tea with friends. lol.

It is the perfect place for tea and lunch with your girlfriends, when you want to feel like the Queen, a Princess or a Lady. Invited by the lovely Elle Q. for tea and a late lunch with the ladies, I was eager to stop by the little Tea House I pass almost every day. 

The interior reminds me of my grandmother's the cute kitschy collections of things. Pretty crocheted pillows, figurines, beautiful mis-matched china and floral patterns everywhere, my eyes wander around the room because there is so much to look at. 

I ordered the High Tea, which comes with a bottomless pot of tea, two sandwiches,  coleslaw, green salad, scones and spreads. I had the Afternoon Darjeeling, which I drank two pots of. My favorite tea.

The salads were pretty typical but good. The sandwiches were dainty, crustless and cut into fours - you could totally inhale them (but I didn't - that's not very lady like). The scones were fluffy and warm, served with devonshire cream and preserves. 

Next time I would like to come back with my mom and sister, I know they would love this place as much as I did.

excerpts: My friends and I split 5 High Tea's ($19.95) among the 7 of us (see picture for the tower o' treats!).
high tea.author: Eileen E.
high tea.review:
The perfect venue for a girly birthday, bridal shower, baby shower, mother's day, or just a cozy hangout with friends. :) For my 26th birthday, I wanted to celebrate with my friends and do something a little bit different than just a fun lunch or dinner. I also wanted to do something that would give us a chance to catch up and chat :). Lovejoy's Tea Room was absolutely perfect for this.  

I made my reservation 2-3 weeks in advance and they were able to seat 7 of us no sweat. We had a big round table near the window with lots of comfy pillows. I think the term "Shabby Chic" was invented to describe the quirky, frilly, cozy decor in this lil tea shop! A sign reading "Reserved for the Queens" was sitting on the table when we arrived. *Does the Queen of England Wave.*

Their menu features ala carte items (including pasties ($9.95), shepherd's pie ($10.95), and quiche ($10.95)) and an assortment of combinations, ranging from the "Cream Tea" ($14.95) which comes with scones, fruit, and a bottomless pot o' tea to the "Queen's Tea" ($26.95) which comes with two types of finger sandwiches, a coleslaw type salad, a green salad, scones, crumpets, fruit, petit fours, shortbread tea biscuits, and, of course, a bottomless pot o' tea.

My friends and I split 5 High Tea's ($19.95) among the 7 of us (see picture for the tower o' treats!). This came with 10 different types of finger sandwiches, 5 different pots of tea, a green salad, coleslaw, scones, and shortbread cookies. They have many different finger sandwiches to choose from. My favorites were the smoked salmon and cream cheese, the special chicken and pesto, and the pear and stilton (blue cheese). They also have an assortment of teas. We tried the vanilla lavender, a green tea, the spiced citrus, and the teahouse blend. Our favorite was the Vanilla Lavender so definitely try that one when you go :).

Thank you so much Lovejoy's for such an adorable, fun, and laidback way to spend my special day with friends!

excerpts: My friend and I both got the "high tea", so we tried each other's tea.
high tea.author: Cassy H.
high tea.review:
4 stars for its ambiance -- Victorian and quirky, imagine Ms. Havisham from the Great Expectations. If she had a tea room, it would look something like Lovejoy's... filled with lace, Victorian furniture,English tea pots, etc...

3.5 stars for the tea -- My friend and I both got the "high tea", so we tried each other's tea. One was the Tea Room Blend and the other one was the Royal blend. I prefer the Royal blend, because it was sweetier and fruitier. However, both types of tea go well with some milk and sugar. 

3 stars for food -- The sandwiches were pretty average, nothing amazing. The scone was amazing, especially with the raspberry preserve! 

Overall, a good experience for $25 (tax and tip). I'd probably come back for another birthday party or if I am ever in the mood for a girly tea party.

I have to say, all their sandwiches, were a bit small, but still very tasty!
My favorite sandwich will have to be the Chicken Apple Walnut sandwich.
high tea.author: Belinda C.
high tea.review:
This place is SUPER CUTE... and i mean super. It's like walking into a someone's house there it's all decorated in an old fashion tea house style sorta way. You will need to make reservations here in advance.  My friends and i ended up sharing two orders of the High Tea for two. I have to say, all their sandwiches, were a bit small, but still very tasty! My favorite sandwich will have to be the Chicken Apple Walnut sandwich.  If i didn't have to share, i swear i will get all the scones! They are served warm and it's so fluffy and buttery! Their tea selection here is huge.  It took us a long time to decided what we wanted. However, i'm not a fruit tea type of girl, but if you like that, you will love all the selections here

As for the sandwiches, I selected the chicken salad and the special that day, which was turkey and cranberry.

excerpts: I've finally found the best high tea room in San Francisco!
Everything was lovely.
high tea.author: Laura T.
high tea.review:
I've finally found the best high tea room in San Francisco! Everything was lovely. I came here with a group of ladies today and received the special treatment of royalty.

We all ordered the queen's tea which consisted:

2 sandwiches of your choice, cole-slaw, greens, assortment of fruits, currant scones, crumpets, a petite four, a small white and brown cookie, your choice of a pot of tea and 3 spreads: lemon curd, raspberry-blackberry(?) jam and this amazing white clotted cream which tasted like a sweet butter.

 I decided on the salmon + cream cheese sandwich, as well as the bay shrimp + mayo. Both were delicious! The fruits had a wonderful selection, all the spreads were delightful, even the salad dressing was yummy. But what really stood out here was the freshly baked currant scones, OMG. These were amazing! Hands down the best scones I've ever had.  They were soft, flakey, buttery, moist and full of flavor. I wish they sold them in bags to go! I also decided on the strawberry tea which was a nice and refreshing taste. I really liked my friends China rose petal black tea though. Also, the interior of the tea room was gorgeous, really, a girl's dream. 

I just wish they had sugar cubes.

excerpts: I bought my mom a gift certificate for High Tea for Two (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lovejoys-attic-san-francisco#hrid:I-uCa9YzHcHbGTS7M9ewMA) but upon arrival, and after a quick peek at the menu, both my mom and I and our mother/daughter friends decided to go big with the Queen's Tea.
*High Tea ($17.95; additional people $17/each):
Same as the High Tea but with the addition of fresh fruit, a crumpet with lemon curd, and a petit four.
both their High Tea and the Queen's Tea come with mixed greens with balsamic and coleslaw.
Their coleslaw is light with the perfect amount of mayo and the surprising addition of caraway seeds.
high tea.author: Emily J.
high tea.review:
Another perfect mother-daughter tea time. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/crown-and-crumpet-temporarily-closed-san-francisco#hrid:6FAE-J3uCt0c9lpTUeTBMQ)

I bought my mom a gift certificate for High Tea for Two (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lovejoys-attic-san-francisco#hrid:I-uCa9YzHcHbGTS7M9ewMA) but upon arrival, and after a quick peek at the menu, both my mom and I and our mother/daughter friends decided to go big with the Queen's Tea. 

*High Tea ($17.95; additional people $17/each): A bottomless pot of tea with choice of two sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, scones, preserves and devonshire cream, and a shortbread biscuit.

*Queen's Tea: ($24.95; additional people $24/each): Same as the High Tea but with the addition of fresh fruit, a crumpet with lemon curd, and a petit four. 

We each ordered a different tea so we could taste four different ones. I picked the Genmai Cha which I had taken a whiff of across the street at Lovejoy's Attic. It is a green tea with popcorn and rice in it. Yes, POPCORN and RICE. It sounds strange but it is now one of my new favorite teas. The popcorn and rice add a subtle nutty flavor. I also enjoyed a cup of both the apricot tea and a rose petal tea that two of my tea companions ordered. 

My mom and I ordered four different sandwich options to share. We got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, pear and stilton, chicken and asparagus and the special which was a turkey salad sandwich with cranberries and pecans. I like that both their High Tea and the Queen's Tea come with mixed greens with balsamic and coleslaw. Their coleslaw is light with the perfect amount of mayo and the surprising addition of caraway seeds. The fresh fruit included honeydew, orange and grapefruit slices, kiwi, strawberries and blackberries. 

Even though I was full after consuming the fruit, salad, coleslaw, sandwiches, and mass amounts of tea, I managed to make room for my scone (with currants) and crumpet. Both were delicious with the devonshire cream and lemon curd. I took my shortbread biscuit and petit four to go. They bring out the petit fours near the end of the tea service for each person to pick one. I chose a little hazelnut and chocolate cake which made for a delightful snack later that day. 

As if the wonderful tea and foods weren't enough, service was wonderful and the quirky mix-n-match furniture and table settings create the perfect ambiance for time spent with fabulous company.

excerpts: This is British High Tea, done right.
Or opt for $19.95 High Tea service, including 2 tea sandwiches, a scone, coleslaw, and some other goodies.
high tea.author: Tiffany D.
high tea.review:
Cuteness and lace doilies explosion. When you enter this adorable space full of pink frills, tea hats, crumpets and everything inbetween, you will be feeling very "Hi, your majesty. May I pour you another glass?" This is British High Tea, done right. It's the perfect cutesy brunch, afternoon with the girls, little girl's birthday party, etc. etc.  

Share a bottomless pot of tea with your best girls for $9, +$2 per additional person to a single pot. Or opt for $19.95 High Tea service, including 2 tea sandwiches, a scone, coleslaw, and some other goodies. We ordered 2 tea services for 4 of us ladies (2 per single person serving) and were stuffed.

The sandwiches were delicate and delectable, my favorite being the Chicken Asparagus (surprisingly!) and the Cucumber & Cream Cheese! They have such great mixes of sandwiches, and many traditional ones with an interesting twist. The Roast Beef & Horseradish was also very tasty.

Scones were good, but standard. They have devonshire cream, and while I prefer clotted cream, this was also tasty with their jam. 

We tried the "Afternoon Darjeeling" for our tea and it was DELICIOUS. Highly recommend it!

Had a splended time here, and will definitely be back! 

Tip: while you wait, there's a cute store of tea-related accessories across the way "Lovejoy's Attic". Scout what you want, then have your tea, and go back, because at the end of tea they give you a nice 10-15% off coupon for the Attic store!

excerpts: Overall, i've been to other high tea places of same calibre with less fuss.
high tea.author: Yvonne L.
high tea.review: Came here with a large group for a bridal shower, we had a reservation and were seated promptly when we arrived.  It's a cute cozy and well decorated place.  My only complaint is that the menu had too much to choose from and the menu was like reading a two full page newsletter article.  After reading through the two pages and distinguishing the type of "package" they offer, you'd then need to decide on the choice of sandwiches and type of tea.  We ended all coupling with a gf and splitting a queens tea.  One item to highlight is the scone, it was fluffy, warm and served with a delicious preserve.  I would go back just for the scone.  The rest of the items were quite forgettable.  The queens tea came with a small pouch of tea leaves to take home, which was a nice touch.  Overall, i've been to other high tea places of same calibre with less fuss.

excerpts: I brought my British friend here (more like, forced him to teach me the ways of High Tea), and he was amused, to say the least, by the cutesy, lacey decor and the mismatched dishware.
It's worth upgrading from High Tea to Queen's Tea to try this sucker out.
high tea.author: Courtney N.
high tea.review:
I brought my British friend here (more like, forced him to teach me the ways of High Tea), and he was amused, to say the least, by the cutesy, lacey decor and the mismatched dishware. Let's just get over the fact that the decor is, well, a bit over the top, because the service and food are both excellent!

We ordered Queen's Tea for two: 
- Yorkshire Tea (amazing -- apparently quite difficult to find in the States, because I've been looking for this stuff ever since. Really, this is the only tea you'll ever need)
- Apricot Tea (paled in comparison to the Yorkshire tea)

- Chicken walnut salad sandwiches were delicious! Half white and half whole wheat bread, which is a nod to both tradition and current standards. Also had Branston Pickle Chutney and Cheese, which sounds strange, but is absolutely delicious! Would highly recommend those two sandwiches
- The salad and coleslaw was okay -- they were skimpy on the mandarins, and the Caraway Cream Dressing was oddly bitter? Mayonaisse-y? Not my favorite part of the meal.

- I learned, finally, how to eat scones properly. And have a proper scone. Which aren't the scones from Starbucks, or wherever you get them. These scones are large and studded with blueberries and are warm, not flaky, like you'd think a biscuit sort of thing should be, but are meant to be cut down the middle, like a bagel, and spread with Devon cream (which isn't normal butter -- it's thicker and whipped and DELICIOUS) and then preserves. Amazing! Absolutely delightful. I'll never have a Starbucks scone again. 

- Crumpets. Oh my god. I don't even know what to say about these. There aren't American corollaries, but think of a biscuit, but not flakey. In fact, holey. And warm. And delicious. And should be slathered with the butter and the lemon curd, while the crumpet is still warm. The butter will soak through the crumpet. And so will the lemon curd. It's worth upgrading from High Tea to Queen's Tea to try this sucker out. 

- Fruit was good, pretty fresh and ripe, well cut
- The tea biscuit (which is just a lil tea cookie) was a bit disappointing
- You get to choose a Petit Four from a platter of many, and they were quite delicious! 

Don't forget to make reservations, at least a week or two in advance! They fill up quite quickly, and it's worth the brunch out with a date or with friends.

Overall, worth the experience and quite authentic, according to my friend.

excerpts: If you want to spend more money at big hotels for high tea then this place is not for you.

I always feel taken care of and when I come here it's usually for a special celebration: of friendship, girlfriends, coworkers or my husband on an afternoon date.

excerpts: We had their "High Tea" for 3 and everything was good - selections of tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, salad, scones, petit cookies, crumpets and petit fours.
high tea.author: Ken G.
high tea.review:
This was a unique and interesting thing to do on a Sunday morning...

We had their "High Tea" for 3 and everything was good - selections of tea, sandwiches, fresh fruit, salad, scones, petit cookies, crumpets and petit fours.  Amazingly enough we left very satisfied, but it wasn't an extremely heavy meal.

The ambiance is fun and quirky with a nod to the Victorian era...very cool spot.

excerpts: The quaint little tea room was inviting and yesterday was the perfect gloomy rainy day to have high tea.
I dragged the hubs and he initially was wary because he thought it was going to be cutesy and pink like a little girls tea party
but once we arrived he was relieved to see that it was not.
We didn't have reservations and all tables were booked
high tea.author: Esther A.
high tea.review:
This place has charm and character and I love that I live nearby. The quaint little tea room was inviting and yesterday was the perfect gloomy rainy day to have high tea.  I dragged the hubs and he initially was wary because he thought it was going to be cutesy and pink like a little girls tea party but once we arrived he was relieved to see that it was not. We didn't have reservations and all tables were booked but they let us sit at a table that was reserved and the party wasn't arriving for awhile. 

We didn't go w/ the recommended teas but went with a black one that we thought sounded great. We ordered some finger sandwiches, some crumpets with lemon curd and a Pear & Stilton salad that was large enough for two to share. The finger sandwiches are tiny so if you are hungry make sure you order enough and order some of the other "Pub Fares".

I loved the decor. This place had the an old vintage antique shop feel with the mismatched tea pots/cups. They had ladies hats hung up on a dresser situated right smack in the middle of the tea room with a red British phone booth behind it. Service was quick and friendly.  I absolutely loved everything about Lovejoy.

excerpts: Lovejoy's is a delightful and romantic place for Afternoon High Tea.
The Queen's Tea is my all-time favorite.
I highly recommend this "hidden gem" for high tea located in Noe Valley.
high tea.author: Susie L.
high tea.review: Lovejoy's is a delightful and romantic place for Afternoon High Tea. The Queen's Tea is my all-time favorite. You have a choice of two tea sandwich selections: LOVE the delish Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese / Bay Shrimp & Mayonnaise sandwiches served with coleslaw, organic spring greens, a scone, a crumpet, fresh fruit, a petit four and shortbread tea biscuit.  The tea room decor is quirky and whimsical filled with mismatched tea cups, saucers and teapots . Excellent attentive servers.  I highly recommend this "hidden gem" for high tea located in Noe Valley.

excerpts: For my High Tea
high tea.author: Lisa T.
high tea.review:
Afternoon tea is one of my favorite pastimes, especially when visiting another city. San Francisco, in particular, seemed like a wonderful place to explore this little touristic tradition of mine.

I was initially torn between Lovejoy's and The Rotunda, but now having visited both I am glad that I chose Lovejoy's. The two venues are complete polar opposites, so if you prefer something more cozy and low key, then LoveJoy's is for you.

I arrived early afternoon on a Thursday, having made a reservation in advance.

The ambiance of Lovejoy's is very quaint and shabby chic, which I enjoyed. The service was impeccable; very fast, very courteous, and they really take an interest in your preferences so that they can make appropriate menu recommendations.

For my High Tea I sampled:

- Apricot tea with a shortbread tea biscuit

- Two sandwiches: turkey with cranberry mustard and arugula, and hard boiled egg with onion and caper dressing. Both very tasty and neither too dry nor over-dressed. A little coleslaw and salad on the side.

- Scone with preserves and devon cream

I spent a good two hours just lazing about, and they kindly topped off my tea pot several times and took great pains to ensure that my tea wouldn't over-steep.

The best part of all? The whole thing was only $25, even after a 20% tip.

The worst part? Hard to identify one, but I will say that I found the tray of petit four a bit ambitiously priced at $2.50/each.

excerpts: As a group, we enjoyed the High Tea (++ selection) of assorted non-crust finger sandwiches, petite shortbread cookies, organic spring greens with Mandarin oranges, and scones with Devon cream + preserves (which I enjoyed the most).
I can't remember the names of the teas we had, but they were all pleasant.
High Tea food tends to be on the lighter spectrum.
high tea.author: Cathy K.
high tea.review:
I LOVE Lovejoys! 

A charming spot for a celebration with (girl)friends (and/or men who are comfortable with an abundance of femininity) ~ i.e. plenty of floral patterns, pinks and lace. 

My friend's baby shower brought me here and we had a lovely time. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the food and tea were a delight! As a group, we enjoyed the High Tea (++ selection) of assorted non-crust finger sandwiches, petite shortbread cookies, organic spring greens with Mandarin oranges, and scones with Devon cream + preserves (which I enjoyed the most). I can't remember the names of the teas we had, but they were all pleasant. The sandwiches are classic, on regular (white/wheat) crustless bread with fillings such as egg salad, cucumber + cream cheese, hummus, ham-tomato, etc.)

Tip 1: You can view their sample menu online: http://www.lovejoystearoom.com/Menu/menu.html

Tip 2: Single bathroom, plan ahead.

Tip 3: Reservations highly recommended.

Tip 4: High Tea food tends to be on the lighter spectrum. Don't expect to feed a Hungry Man.

Tip 5: Extended pinkies not required, this is an all occasion place. Good for dressing up or keeping it casual.

excerpts: and I think we did the high tea service, which was pretty standard, food-wise.
Since the high tea didn't include sweets, we'd brought our own mini cupcakes -- they have a $1 cake cutting fee per person, but no cupcake fee, so yay for that.
high tea.author: Shing H.
high tea.review:
Visited here for a bridal shower and I think we did the high tea service, which was pretty standard, food-wise. I liked the scones with devonshire cream and preserves, and all of the sandwiches were good as well -- my favorites were the bay shrimp and mayo, and the egg salad. Since the high tea didn't include sweets, we'd brought our own mini cupcakes -- they have a $1 cake cutting fee per person, but no cupcake fee, so yay for that.

The atmosphere, in my opinion, was just okay. The decor was sort of standard old-person's room, complete with sort of creepy photos. They were VERY crowded the whole time we were there (though I guess that's just a good sign for the place). It seemed like a lot of other bridal shower or similar event groups, and since the first "seating" all showed up at the same time, there was a bit of a traffic jam both at the beginning and end of our visit. We were crammed into pretty tight quarters, with very little room for our seats, as well as on the table -- we had to constantly move things around to find places to put everything, and it was almost impossible to do anything without elbowing people from my group on either side. They even had to basically rush us and kick us out at the end, which I suppose is necessary -- at least they were very nice about it. Still, would have been nice to have a bit more breathing room, both physically and temporally!

excerpts:
High tea for two: $34.00
- warm scones with raisins
- devonshire cream and strawberry jam
- shortbread cookies
- organic salad with vinaigrette dressing
- coleslaw with caraway seeds?
- choice of 4 sandwiches (16 quarter triangles)
* pear & stilton cheese
* chicken apple walnut
* prosciutto & pesto (lovejoy special)
* albacore tuna & capers (lovejoy special)
With our high tea, we were barely able to fit 2 pots of tea, a tray of sandwiches and salads and our tea cups and salad plates on our small round table and tiny side table.
\ Expect to be here for a good solid 2 hours.
high tea.author: CeCe C.
high tea.review:
I came here today for my birthday!! :D

Outside of Lovejoy's is the world of chaos (loosing cellphones, bus passes, your mind, and then getting locked out of your house)! My week was a totally mess! Day after day things didn't seem to get any better. I wonder what's going to happen to me tomorrow. Like my day can get any worse...

Soon the chaos is temporarily forgotten. Inside Lovejoy's is peace, laughter, cuteness, yummy foods, and delicious teas!

High tea for two: $34.00
- warm scones with raisins
- devonshire cream and strawberry jam
- shortbread cookies
- organic salad with vinaigrette dressing
- coleslaw with caraway seeds?
- choice of 4 sandwiches (16 quarter triangles)
 * pear & stilton cheese
 * chicken apple walnut
 * prosciutto & pesto (lovejoy special)
 * albacore tuna & capers (lovejoy special) 
- apricot tea
- pomegranate & green tea

Saturday, 12:30pm reservations: this place was packed with baby showers, bridal showers, friends getting together, etc. Our table wasn't ready so we walked across the street to the gift shop of Lovejoy's! And when our table was ready, Lovejoy's Tea Room called the store to let us know that we could walk back! haha

Tea time: I'd recommend coming with at least 3 people for a bigger table and more teas to try at once!! With our high tea, we were barely able to fit 2 pots of tea, a tray of sandwiches and salads and our tea cups and salad plates on our small round table and tiny side table. =\ Expect to be here for a good solid 2 hours. And after drinking all that wonderful tea, make sure to make use of the restroom before you leave!

Parking: we were able to find street parking around Clipper & Church.

Go Green: taken the J line

excerpts: What we ordered: high tea for two ($34), cream tea ($12.95), and savory tea ($13.95).
Each order came with a pot of unlimited tea, which was amazing.
The tea cups, pot, plates and whatnot were impossibly fitting; matching tea sets with some mismatched but homey utensils.
high tea.author: Colleen M.
high tea.review:
Oh how I love tea and scones.

I made a reservation for five at 1:30 p.m. about two days in advance; two arrived on time, and like proper ladies, the rest of us arrived around 15-20 minutes late. Lovejoy's is really the spitting image of grandma's place, only blown up and with more tables.

Our server was dressed to impress in an old school peasant dress and greeted us with a warm smile. The menus were just printed on paper, but whatever, we were sitting on floral couches and little chairs for chrissakes. Paper menus are perfect.

What we ordered: high tea for two ($34), cream tea ($12.95), and savory tea ($13.95). Each order came with a pot of unlimited tea, which was amazing. The tea cups, pot, plates and whatnot were impossibly fitting; matching tea sets with some mismatched but homey utensils. A couple tea stains here and there, but there's no complaining from me! 

I had the Dragon Well tea (green tea), but I also tried their Yorkshire Gold (black), China Rose Petal (black flavored - it's sweet!) and Darjeeling (black). They basically give you your pots of hot water and the leaves, and instruct you briefly on what to do, aka steeping it for a minute. Oh, and of course there's milk and sugar on the table.

Oh gosh, such good tea! The China Rose Petal turned out to be my favorite of the day, and don't even get me started on the scones with lemon curd and devon cream.... An absolute must try.

The sandwiches were light, cute, and oh-so yummy. We decided to get the cucumber and cream cheese (I don't really recommend it... You can make it yourself, but it's cute...) and their daily special, some sort of curry-like sandwich - which blew my mind. I wish I knew what the name of it was now. 
If you eat a lot, perhaps you should get your own order of sandwiches. 

The store's right across the street, and I've already promptly bought a jar of their lemon curd. 

Keep in mind:
 It's $1 to share your tea.
And calling in to reserve seats never hurt anyone.

excerpts: I sampled the high tea set, which pretty much comes with everything.
I am not a huge fan of tea sandwiches, the ones here are good but nothing great.
I sampled both black and rooibos tea, both are delicious, although I prefer the rooibos.
Black tea just tasted like black tea?
The ornaments and decorations are cute and pretty.
I got to say it was a bit too cramped inside
, I understand there's not a lot of space in SF, but I was expecting more white table clothes and white everything.
high tea.author: Terence N.
high tea.review:
Finally came here for brunch and the experience is really amazing.  I sampled the high tea set, which pretty much comes with everything.  I am not a huge fan of tea sandwiches, the ones here are good but nothing great.  I sampled both black and rooibos tea, both are delicious, although I prefer the rooibos.  Black tea just tasted like black tea?  The ornaments and decorations are cute and pretty.  I got to say it was a bit too cramped inside, I understand there's not a lot of space in SF, but I was expecting more white table clothes and white everything.  This tea room is really laid back and cozy.  

My favorite are the scones, these suckers are absolutely delicious!  Reminds me more of a buttery biscuit, but it has the perfect texture.  Slap on some of their famous marionberry jam and extra butter, you are in heaven!  The crumpets are also really good, crispy outside with a soft chewy inside.  If you order anything from Lovejoy's, get the Scone and Crumpet!  They constantly refill your tea, and you have about 2 hrs to chit chat..but really how much tea can your bladder hold?  For dessert you get to choose a marzipan chocolate, if you like marzipan you will lose these, otherwise it will be really sweet for you.

You definitely need to make reservations here, we got lucky and came 30min before they open.  We got lucky and got the only non-reserved table left.  There was a line even before they opened doors!  Scone and Crumpets are delicious, I highly recommend sampling them!

excerpts: We had a proper High Tea for 2 at 4.
high tea.author: Rick L.
high tea.review:
I went there with a former co-worker and good friend from England that is touring the Bay Area. We met on Friday which was also my Birthday. We had a proper High Tea for 2 at 4. 

The food selections were simply marvelous. The scones were pure heaven and the crumpets just as good. My friend selected 2 sandwiches (classic cucumber and classic salmon) and I selected 2 sandwiches (savory chutney & cheddar and a lovely stilton & pear). I was saying mmmmmmm so many times!! We took a very long time to nibble and chat and eat. I did try to make room for the petit fours that were totally unexpected. I chose the lemon!

I do wish there were finger bowls to dip and cloth napkins as well, yet the experience was DREAMY!

Just near my seat was a lovely little book of birthdays so I read mine, and she read hers. Great fun!

The decor was fabulous and the little touches were just dreamy.
I do love the selection of hats to choose from while we experienced the joys of Love Joys!

I've been there before and will assuredly return.

p.s. The SCONES ARE AMAZING!!!!

excerpts: We got the high tea with mango black tea.
The sandwiches and pastries were delicious!
I would do five stars but the tea could be better.
high tea.author: Shelly M.
high tea.review: you need to make a reservation pretty far ahead but everything about this place is SO CUTE and SO QUAINT. We got the high tea with mango black tea. The sandwiches and pastries were delicious! I would do five stars but the tea could be better.

excerpts: We also just got the high tea breakfast and the coleslaw was very good and you can't go wrong with any selection of sandwiches.
high tea.author: Lily P.
high tea.review: Go 20 minutes early before they open or wait 2.5 hours seems like the normal rule of thumb. A bit over the top on the inside but the teas are good and the hazelnut one I had was SUPER STRONG. The service is very friendly and helpful. We also just got the high tea breakfast and the coleslaw was very good and you can't go wrong with any selection of sandwiches. The scones are very fresh and good and I should have just ordered more while I was there.

excerpts: Get two more sandwiches then you think you want, trust me, for $2.5 each to add to a high tea, you're getting a bunch more food and the opportunity to try more!
high tea.author: Cori N.
high tea.review:
As fantastic as it ever is!
