I've been going to Lovejoy's for almost five years. It is one of the few experiences in SF that I can not do enough. Every time I go I feel like I'm experiencing it as a new person all over again. The quality is top notch and never wavers. In all this time I have never had the women at Lovejoy's make a mistake. The baked goods are always fresh and yummy, the sandwiches are always perfectly cut (never crushed!) and ultra flavorful.

The decor might seem a bit kitschy to some, but I feel like they do it in the best way. The decor becomes part of the experience and in that way it becomes special. 

I also LOVE how they make even the guys feel comfortable here. Over the years I've watched more and more men show up (both with their girl and boyfriends!) 

And the fact that they do their best to accommodate requests is awesome. 

Go here! You won't be disappointed!

PRO TIP: Get two more sandwiches then you think you want, trust me, for $2.5 each to add to a high tea, you're getting a bunch more food and the opportunity to try more!

excerpts: I'm from the Silicon Valley, where we have Lisa's Tea Treasures, so I thought it'd be fun to check out what sorts of high tea shops San Francisco has!
Be warned: you MUST make a reservation no matter what.
I I arrived here at 10:50 A.M. for my 11 A.M. reservation, and there was already a long line of other folks who had made reservations.
After we were all seated in the crowded shop, there was hardly any room left for non-reservation customers to see if they could squeeze in a spot.
The ambiance here is very artsy and hipster, with a touch of Victorian (typical San Franciscan artsiness), and the staff is super friendly and nice!!!
However, the quality of the food and tea was what disappoints me about this place.
The sandwiches had too much mayonnaise in them, and the desserts were far too sweet for my liking.
high tea.author: Taehyun P.
high tea.review: I'm from the Silicon Valley, where we have Lisa's Tea Treasures, so I thought it'd be fun to check out what sorts of high tea shops San Francisco has! Be warned: you MUST make a reservation no matter what. I I arrived here at 10:50 A.M. for my 11 A.M. reservation, and there was already a long line of other folks who had made reservations. After we were all seated in the crowded shop, there was hardly any room left for non-reservation customers to see if they could squeeze in a spot. The ambiance here is very artsy and hipster, with a touch of Victorian (typical San Franciscan artsiness), and the staff is super friendly and nice!!! However, the quality of the food and tea was what disappoints me about this place. The sandwiches had too much mayonnaise in them, and the desserts were far too sweet for my liking. The teas were bland and stale, but the scones were top notch!! Additionally, I like how they serve their food on the tiered plates, which Lisa'a Tea Treasures does not do. I'm sad to give this place 3 stars, because I really want to give it a higher rating, but the food and teas fell short of my expectations :( still a very lovely place!!!

excerpts: One of my friends (who happened to be one of our other friend's bridesmaid) decided on the high tea menu.
high tea.author: Jenn D.
high tea.review:
My friends and I have been planning to come to Lovejoy's for a year now. However, every time we made a reservation, we always had to cancel it. 

This time, we came for our friend's bachelorette party. She loves tea so it was the perfect place for her. If you get off at 24th St BART station, it's about a 20 min walk. The other way is to take public transportation. Since I was already going to be out in the city, my husband dropped me off.

The place is small, with a table for every corner to accommodate the guest size with space for guests and employees to get around. For me, it's not as spacious as two of the tea places I've been to. One of my friends (who happened to be one of our other friend's bridesmaid) decided on the high tea menu. We had a variety of tea sandwiches, salad and scones (with jam or butter). Everyone was able to have at least 8 tea sandwich slice. It was actually more than enough. I think this is the first time I've seen salad served.

For tea, we had decaffeinated tea, vanilla tea, passion fruit tea and mango tea. The last two, we ordered from the tea list. The passion fruit tea was actually a favorite. Most of the guests were there for hanging out while there was one other party for a baby shower. At the end, my friend was given a spoon for a memento.

Overall, I think all the guests had a wonderful time. On the other hand, my friends and I were happy that we finally made it. It's a nice place if you want to hang out with the girls or have a small party. I would love to come back here again.

excerpts: We had the high tea, the tea was exceptional and the pretty little sandwiches and scones were delicious.
It was filling.
Staff is exceptionally kind and gracious.
Check out their shop across the street for cool gifts/mementos.
high tea.author: Robin C.
high tea.review: Awesome experience. The place is adorable, with so much to look at. They have fancy hats for you to borrow and the table setting is so pretty. We had the high tea, the tea was exceptional and the pretty little sandwiches and scones were delicious. It was filling. Staff is exceptionally kind and gracious. Check out their shop across the street for cool gifts/mementos.

excerpts: My sister and I both ordered the High Tea ($19.95).
When I had looked online, their menu had a High Tea for Two
but that is no longer on their menu.
It is now just a High Tea and add additional High Tea for $19.
high tea.author: Roya B.
high tea.review:
Loved the ambiance, the selection, and the service! 

My sister and I both ordered the High Tea ($19.95).  When I had looked online, their menu had a High Tea for Two but that is no longer on their menu.  It is now just a High Tea and add additional High Tea for $19.  I think it ended up being a couple more bucks.

We ordered the Apricot Tea, which was tasty, especially with milk & sugar. I did not realize that we could have each ordered our own teas so I will do that next time.

The sandwiches were great: smoked salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, pesto & prosciutto, & a chicken salad sandwich.  The salad was fine... the dressing helped.  The cold slaw was interesting--a little basilly if you like that. The scones were hot and fresh and delicious-- way softer than others I've had!  The jam was also delicious.

We ended up taking 4 pieces of the sandwiches, some cold slaw, and salad home. I just ate it for my leftovers at work--still good! 

I would highly recommend for a ladies afternoon or special occasion.  I recommend making a reservation in advance... we walked in (only 15 minute wait) but were lucky.  Dressing up is totally optional, but can be fun!

excerpts: Perhaps I have this wrong illusion of high tea being a little bit formal.
I wanted the experience to be a treat.
Although, I must say that the prices matches the experience.
I would not pay more.
The place is a bit cluttery for my taste.
It didn't help that a big group was present and was very loud.
To their credit, the service was fast and the staff were friendly and accommodating.
high tea.author: Carmencita S.
high tea.review: It felt like being in a crowded local cafe. Perhaps I have this wrong illusion of high tea being a little bit formal. I wanted the experience to be a treat. Although, I must say that the prices matches the experience. I would not pay more. The place is a bit cluttery for my taste. It didn't help that a big group was present and was very loud. To their credit, the service was fast and the staff were friendly and accommodating.

excerpts: I had the high tea - choice of two sandwiches, salad, scone and biscuit.
high tea.author: Pam S.
high tea.review:
Came here for tea with my lovely girlfriends.  Who said mix and match are not fun?  This place is exactly that but it all came together perfectly.  It feels like you just walked in one of your friend's house and chit chated about life over tea and snacks.

A lot of knick knacks all over the place so your eyes and conversations will sure be entertained.

Reservations only!

I had the high tea - choice of two sandwiches, salad, scone and biscuit.  If you don't care about the greens, you can get the light tea, that will come with fres fruit.  The scone is heaven with the cream.  My friend says you can only find it at one grocery store in SF.  I need to remember which one ggrrrr.   Our afternoon tea was served with bottomless tea.  

We also ordered some sausage rolls but it felt out of place and the taste was so-so.

For $20, why not spend a couple hours at Lovejoy's with your besties ;)

excerpts: We ordered the high tea (there were five of us) with ten tea sandwiches -- the chicken asparagus is my favorite, followed by the artichoke hummus and turkey with dijon.
high tea.author: Katie M.
high tea.review:
The ambience is really the draw (for me) chez Lovejoy; it feels as if you are visiting both an eccentric great aunt's house and a tea party in Wonderland at the same time.  I love the mismatched teacups, teapots, furniture, etc., and there's enough floral brocade to keep my Victorian-era obsessed soul happy.

The tea itself is delicious -- during my most recent visit, I ordered green tea with kombucha; another time I had the blood orange tisane, and both were excellent. 

We showed up with a party of 5 -- and no reservation -- at 11:00 on a Sunday morning. They weren't sure if they could accommodate us, but they managed to squeeze us in by 11:05, which was lovely. We ordered the high tea (there were five of us) with ten tea sandwiches -- the chicken asparagus is my favorite, followed by the artichoke hummus and turkey with dijon. The accompanying salad was simple but good, and I love the scones; the Devon cream is delicious. The bill came out to around $25 per person -- a bit pricey considering it's not a meal, per se -- but I think the experience is more important. Service has always been very friendly, and the space is cozy and intimate.

Food: 4/5
Ambience: 5/5+

excerpts: and I always have high tea here when she visits from the East Coast.
We made reservations (a wise thing to do) for the 4th time this Easter.
The sandwiches are delicious-
I never get tired of the salmon and cream cheese and do check out their special.
They have an amazing selection of tea.
My favorite one is the forest berries/
rosehip-
it's a deep rosy color, citrusy, sweet.
So delicious with your scone, devonshire cream and strawberry jam.
high tea.author: Tes Y.
high tea.review:
Miss Eliza Doolittle, would you care for some tea?

Oh yes, that is exactly how you feel when you're at Lovejoy's. You're in a period drama, adorned in a soft, romantic dress, speaking in a British accent, lifting that dainty pinky as you gently lift your porcelain teacup to your lips, enjoying the vintage details of lace and florals surrounding you. 

My best friend and I always have high tea here when she visits from the East Coast. We made reservations (a wise thing to do) for the 4th time this Easter. The sandwiches are delicious- I never get tired of the salmon and cream cheese and do check out their special. They have an amazing selection of tea. My favorite one is the forest berries/rosehip- it's a deep rosy color, citrusy, sweet. So delicious with your scone, devonshire cream and strawberry jam. I strongly recommend it!

Do bring your daughters here. Do have a bridal shower here. Do catch up with a friend here. Do bring your Mark Darcy here ;)

excerpts:
High on tea:
I have never tried high tea, but I have heard tis most civilized.
When I discovered Lovejoy's Tea Room online, I decided I had to give it a go.
I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room for a sampling of high tea.
high tea.author: Audrey C.
high tea.review:
High on tea:
I have never tried high tea, but I have heard tis most civilized.  When I discovered Lovejoy's Tea Room online, I decided I had to give it a go.  I was not disappointed.

We were greeted most courteously and seated straight away.  I ordered the Me Tea which comes with a bottomless pot of tea and neat little sandwiches.  The tea was loose leaf, and the sandwiches dainty and fresh.  Although the menu is not extensive, and the teas offerings did not include my favorite oolongs, I did enjoy my meal and experience.  The tea room is decorated with British nick nacks which give it an informal vibe.  I felt like I was visiting my British great aunt for the afternoon, but I am not even from the UK.

I highly recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room for a sampling of high tea.

excerpts: Some men may never have the high tea experience and I'm lucky enough to have been here so many times.
Well, having ordered the High Tea and the Queen's Tea many times, that quickly became a non-issue.
high tea.author: Ben H L.
high tea.review:
I've been to Lovejoy's four times in my life.  Some men may never have the high tea experience and I'm lucky enough to have been here so many times.  Since my friend lives in the Diamond Heights neighborhood, she had known about Lovejoy's long before they became super popular.  

My first concern when coming here was about whether I'd still be hungry when I left.  Well, having ordered the High Tea and the Queen's Tea many times, that quickly became a non-issue.  The variety of sandwiches to choose from, the scones with jelly, and the appealing pub fare menu looked and tasted equally appealing.  On my last trip here, I remembered seeing a Shepard's Pie on the menu but not a Chicken Pot PIe.  I could have sworn that I had a chicken pot pie here long ago...maybe it was a special request or they don't do it anymore.

As always, the biggest challenge is to get a reservation here on a weekend.  A fourteen days in advance reservation call to them is highly advised.  They usually have two walk-in tables for people without reservations so whoever gets to the door first before they open will get those tables...and possibly any tables where the reservation party didn't show up.  Since my group got there forty minutes before they opened, we were lucky to get the first walk-in table.

Since it is a small room, the higher volume of ambient noise does make it difficult to talk and seating around your table could be a bit snug.  But after a few minutes, these small issues will pass through your conscious mind after pouring your first cup of tea and enjoying the first few bites of a tasty roast beef and horseradish sandwich.

I definitely won't mind coming back to Lovejoy's because this English style tea house was my first introduction to the tea experience.  I can't imagine going to any other tea house unless they could surpass what Lovejoy's brings to the table...and I highly doubt that any locale in SF can do that.

excerpts: If your afternoon tea is also your lunch, I recommend the High Tea which comes with 2 sandwiches, salad, a scone, and a shortbread tea biscuit.
My favorite sandwich selections are the cucumber & cream cheese (a tea time classic) and the chicken apple walnut salad.
high tea.author: Catherine A.
high tea.review:
This is my favorite tea room in California: no-fuss, welcoming, and delicious. Their reservations fill up quickly around holidays, but if you plan ahead you won't have a problem finding something that works for you. I've come with small and large groups, and everyone always has a blast. 

First-timers never fail to comment on how cute the space is itself. You feel as though you've walked into a Victorian grandmother's parlor. With mismatched furniture and English china, framed sayings and hats on the wall, Lovejoy's provides plenty of pieces to keep the conversation going. Once the food is served, however, all attention goes to the edible.

For $17-20 per person, the tea service is surprisingly filling. Typically, each guest chooses a service which comes with a personal pot of tea (unlimited refills included) and a range of tea snacks from biscuits and scones to salad and sandwiches. They serve their scones fresh and warm with an authentic Devon cream that melts in your mouth. If your afternoon tea is also your lunch, I recommend the High Tea which comes with 2 sandwiches, salad, a scone, and a shortbread tea biscuit. My favorite sandwich selections are the cucumber & cream cheese (a tea time classic) and the chicken apple walnut salad. Since I gravitate toward floral tea flavors, I always order the China Rose Petal black tea and add some milk.

For those with a sweet tooth, the tray of petit fours can be irresistible if you still have room after your service. I have only tried the Victorian Wedding Cake which tasted very much like a standard vanilla cake pop but was a slightly bigger portion.

The lovely ladies who run the place are ever the gracious hosts--checking in for questions, constantly refilling tea pots, and never rushing the party. As I write this, I'm already thinking up an occasion for my next tea time.

excerpts: It's more than just high tea, it's an experience.
high tea.author: Lisette P.
high tea.review:
I love this place! It's more than just high tea, it's an experience. A girlfriend and I got dolled up one Sunday afternoon and stepped into quaint England in this little tea place. 

We had the Queen's tea service and we were so, so full afterwards but couldn't resist everything that was on the menu - from the crustless triangle sandwiches, scrumptious scones and fruit platter. The ladies serving us were so lovely - they talked us through the menu and when the fruit platter came and I realized that we had to change it as I'm allergic to kiwifruit, rather than whisking it away, they gave me a separate platter to eat and let my friend keep the one we had.

Definitely book in advance. A great alternative to a Sunday brunch.

excerpts: All 5 of us got the high tea service, which was amazing.
high tea.author: Jo G.
high tea.review:
What an absolutely perfect place for brunch! The table set up, decor, and atmosphere are exactly what I'd hoped for in coming to a tea room - British shabby chic at its finest!

Rachel, our server, really made the experience for us too. She was so kind, friendly, patient, and prompt (even refilled our teapots to keep them just right!). Such a sweetheart!! The food was really fabulous too. All 5 of us got the high tea service, which was amazing. Plenty of vegetarian options, gluten free bread, etc. to accommodate our quintessentially San Franciscan table of dietary preferences! 

Be sure to make a reservation!! It was quite busy and we were glad we did. We will definitely be back!

excerpts: Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!
high tea.author: Stephanie C.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy' s is the definition of shabby chic. It's completely charming and full of tons of character. The place is adorned with hats perfect for a royal wedding, lace, cuckoo clocks, vintage pictures, and of course tons of mismatched tea sets. I've been here before but most recently came for my Mom's birthday tea.

My Mom and I shared the Queen's tea for two, $27/person, and then added on my sister for $17. With the Queen's tea you get your choice of two sandwiches, salad, scones, cookies, and of course, tea. We had a huge pot of earl grey and I had the cucumber & cream cheese and tomato & cheese sandwiches. I also ordered a side of crumpets, because really, no tea party is complete without crumpets!

The scones and crumpets were probably my favorites! The scones were warm and fluffy and I loved the raisins. It came with a side of devon cream and strawberry jam. The crumpets were soft and light, they came with a lemon curd spread which was really sweet!

This is the perfect place to have a girly date with friends or with your Mom. Having high tea is such a fun experience and something that any tea and sweets lover should enjoy!

excerpts: We got High Tea ($16.50) and 2 sandwiches.
Although sandwich meal didn't come with a pot of tea, since my high tea came with a pot, by paying extra $1, two people were allowed to enjoy unlimited pot of tea.
See the pictures I uploaded for menu and High Tea as it shows how pleasing it is to the eye as it is to your tongue.
If there is any CONS I have about this place, it may be the price.
High tea at $16/person and Queen Tea at $20/person seem a bit high.
But, note one thing: I have a fairly large appetite, but I became full with High Tea.
You can easily make your trip to Lovejoy's as a weekend activity by spending a long time drinking their bottomless tea and later visiting their Lovejoy's Attic across the street.
(http://www.yelp.com/biz/YN_Fm4paIod5jpnaAXATtQ)
high tea.author: トモ T.
high tea.review:
Two layers of food
Salad in the bottom tray
Difficult for fork to reach
---------------------
As mentioned before, I give high points for unique places, like Lovejoy's Tea Room, that enhances my options for a weekend lunch.  As evident by my Yelp ID, I'm not British, but I do like English style sandwiches - crust cutoff, cut into triangles, only a few slices of meat - which is very much like Japanese sandwiches (I don't know the historical facts, but I'm sure Brits brought the technique to Japan).  While I love mile-high sub sandwiches too, I crave for English sandwiches once in a while.  I've been disappointed with ones at On the Bridge in J-Town (http://www.yelp.com/biz/pLZFRsn8HjVzcITHqa8Yfw), so I'm glad Lovejoy's does it right.

As you enter Lovejoy's, it feels like you've entered Jane Austen's living room.  Along with chairs from your dining table, they have couches and antique chairs.  All their cups and pots are unique - none of them match.  As you may expect, 90% of customers were female, probably because male customers feels a 'tea room' would not provide enough food to qualify as a lunch.  I'll get into this later, but they do give you enough food for a full lunch.

Service was excellent as we were offered for tea refills (bottomless service) three times.  Host was quite friendly and explained which sandwiches were popular.  

FOOD:  We got High Tea ($16.50) and 2 sandwiches.  Although sandwich meal didn't come with a pot of tea, since my high tea came with a pot, by paying extra $1, two people were allowed to enjoy unlimited pot of tea.  See the pictures I uploaded for menu and High Tea as it shows how pleasing it is to the eye as it is to your tongue.  

If there is any CONS I have about this place, it may be the price.  High tea at $16/person and Queen Tea at $20/person seem a bit high.  But, note one thing: I have a fairly large appetite, but I became full with High Tea.   

You can easily make your trip to Lovejoy's as a weekend activity by spending a long time drinking their bottomless tea and later visiting their Lovejoy's Attic across the street. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/YN_Fm4paIod5jpnaAXATtQ)

excerpts: The service is solid here and while I love high tea, this one is totally average.
high tea.author: Snuffles B.
high tea.review: Grandma love this place because it looks like her house exploded and landed in Lovejoy's. Its a tough reservation because the place is not big and people sit there for hours on end. The service is solid here and while I love high tea, this one is totally average. The crumpets were good and  scones and finger sandwiches are OK, but I'm pretty sure I got the 'Betes from the over-the top sweet Petit Fours.

excerpts: This was my first ever experience of afternoon high tea, which was influenced by an instagram post by a Youtuber.
I went with my friend and her foreign exchange student from Italy and were half an hour late to our reservation at 4:30 PM, which is the latest possible.
The lot is not large nor is it especially tiny.
I have never been to England, but this place is reminiscent of the Victorian era.
Everything is mix-matched - from the tea cups to the chairs and tables.
We ordered high tea for three, which includes two sandwiches each, three scones, and three bottomless pots of tea.
Our favorite sandwich was the tomato & cheese.
high tea.author: Joanne M.
high tea.review:
This was my first ever experience of afternoon high tea, which was influenced by an instagram post by a Youtuber. I went with my friend and her foreign exchange student from Italy and were half an hour late to our reservation at 4:30 PM, which is the latest possible. The lot is not large nor is it especially tiny. I have never been to England, but this place is reminiscent of the Victorian era. Everything is mix-matched - from the tea cups to the chairs and tables. We ordered high tea for three, which includes two sandwiches each, three scones, and three bottomless pots of tea. Our favorite sandwich was the tomato & cheese. I LOVED the scones, omg so good! We chose two teas however I only remember the second one, which was White Peach. i highly recommend that one. It was sweet and flavorful, nothing over the top. I am British-obsessed so it was only time that I came to a place like this.

TRY IT OUT.

excerpts: We ordered two "High Tea for Two" since there were four of us.
high tea.author: S Y.
high tea.review:
"Would you like some tea & crumpets?" I never thought I'd be saying that... and actually mean it! 

A Girls Day Out started here and it was actually fun. It was time to be dainty and ladylike while having some qt with your girlfriends! Cute and charming atmosphere. Bridal and baby showers, little birthday tea parties and girlfriends of all ages get together here. On this lovely day, a group of ladies had a mad hatter party- all dressed in the most hideous hats I've ever seen. I wish I had taken pics! 

Even though we had reservations, we still waited about 15 minutes to be seated, which meant picture ops on the bench placed right outside. 

When finally seated, we were helped by a nice lady who made a few suggestions. We ordered two "High Tea for Two" since there were four of us. We added crumpets, picked our sandwiches and the teas chosen were two black teas; Afternoon Darjeeling and Passion Fruit. 

With our pinkies up, we sipped from our teacups. The Passion Fruit tea was the best of everything! Yess, even out of the crumpets, short breads and sandwiches. We've never tried tea with cream, and I was a little hesitant mixing the flavors of cream and passion fruit together- but it adds just the right amount of sweetness. As for the food, great compliments to tea. Freshly made, but not so filling. You'll be hungry soon after. 

One tip: the tea runs right through you like some bad alcohol. Wherever you go after, make sure there's a bathroom. We went to Haight after and all of us were strugglinggg!

excerpts: high tea was a very fun couple of hours on a beautiful saturday afternoon.
a table with a sign "reserved for the queens" was waiting for us by the window.
3 bottomless teas: earl grey, passion fruit black tea, and pomegranate green tea.
high tea.author: Charmaine L.
high tea.review:
lovejoy's took me all the way back to when i was 5 years old playing tea party with my stuffed animals and serving them plastic cookies and pouring water as tea. except lovejoy's was far better than my imaginary tea and crumpets!

high tea was a very fun couple of hours on a beautiful saturday afternoon. a table with a sign "reserved for the queens" was waiting for us by the window. 3 bottomless teas: earl grey, passion fruit black tea, and pomegranate green tea. the teas had light flavors and were not bitter.

we had the following finger sandwiches, i'm listing them best to less than best. but they were all good.
1. pear and stilton (sweet and pungent)
2. roast beef and horseradish (tasty)
3. turkey and dijon mustard (the mustard seeds were like luxurious caviar)
4. smoked salmon and cream cheese (can't go wrong)
5. lovejoy's special which was turkey, cranberry, pecan (savory and sweet mixed together)
6. ham and english mustard (spicy kick from the mustard)

all the sandwiches were served on a bed of fresh greens and light dressing. it was very refreshing, especially with a few segments of mandarin oranges.

the scones were dotted with plump raisins. the double devon cream was just about the best imaginable thing you could possibly spread on a warm crumbly scone. it was rich, decadent, and pure love and joy. the strawberry preserves were full of fruit.

the crumpets were a tad rubbery and dry, but the lemon curd more than made up for it. the curd was smooth, tart, and not too sweet. i rolled my eyes back at first bite.

thank you lovejoy's. you've shown me royal greatness. my stuffed animals would have been green with envy.

excerpts: I never had a "high tea" experience, so this was pretty fun to experience for the first time.
We each ordered the "high tea" ($19/person), which included bottomless tea, 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, 1 shortbread cookie, and shared coleslaw and salad.
While a lot of food, I don't think it's anything unique (the sandwiches I could have easily made myself).
I didn't like the chicken and walnut salad sandwich, but the smoked salmon was tasty.
high tea.author: Mina K.
high tea.review:
I tried this with some girlfriends recently for my best friend's birthday. I never had a "high tea" experience, so this was pretty fun to experience for the first time. The tea room is decorated with cute little trinkets, pictures, etc, and is certainly catered to the female crowd. 

I have to admit you're paying more for the service and experience than anything else. We each ordered the "high tea" ($19/person), which included bottomless tea, 2 sandwiches, 1 scone, 1 shortbread cookie, and shared coleslaw and salad. While a lot of food, I don't think it's anything unique (the sandwiches I could have easily made myself). I didn't like the chicken and walnut salad sandwich, but the smoked salmon was tasty. However, the warm scone was de-li-cious!

Service was extremely friendly! The waiter/host gave the birthday girl a Petit Four when he overheard us saying "Happy Birthday" to her, which was a very nice personal touch. 

Definitely something every girly-girl should experience once!

excerpts: My absolute favorite item, however, was the scone that came with my high tea... add on a dollop of lemon curd and it was just delicious.
In fact I think it'd be safe to say that it's the best scone I've had yet.
high tea.author: Rachel M.
high tea.review:
My friends and I had a great time here last weekend - had a party of 7 and they were able to accommodate us quite well. We had an assorted order - light teas, high teas, and separate orders and everything came out pretty speedily.  The staff was very friendly and attentive (but not intrusive, which I find very important) - our teapots were constantly getting refreshed and never sat idle for long.

The sandwiches were delicious - I had the salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, and one other that eludes me at the moment...

we also had an assortment of teas at the table - dragon well was my choice, and one of the gals had a blood orange that was just wonderfully refreshing. I'll probably have to try that one again when I return (and yes, it's just a matter of "when" and not "if"). 

My absolute favorite item, however, was the scone that came with my high tea... add on a dollop of lemon curd and it was just delicious. In fact I think it'd be safe to say that it's the best scone I've had yet.

excerpts: Having never had high tea, I have no standard of comparison.
I do drink my fair share of tea, but that's about it.
high tea.author: Brian W.
high tea.review:
Having never had high tea, I have no standard of comparison. I do drink my fair share of tea, but that's about it. And, uh, I have spent quite a bit of time in the UK, so that makes me absolutely completely no-more-qualified than the average person off the street to judge.

*cough*

So without further ado...

You walk in and it's charmingly quaint but-not-quite-antique in a very British way, down to the cobwebs on the lights, the pictures on the walls, the cliche British sayings. It's actually pretty awesome.

Tea selection is surprisingly diverse and very, very good.

The little tea sandwiches that us Americans laugh at (with our footlong pastramis from Togo's)-- well, the chicken and asparagus is seriously nom-worthy. The roast beef and horseradish somewhat less so, but the tomato and cheese is again surprisingly good. Who'dya thunk?

The tea biscuit with jam and butter (oh the butter!) is tasty too, and scones-- well, they weren't what we expected. They reminded us of a super-light, crispy pancake. If the thought of a super-light yet crispy pancake sounds good to you, well, it sounded good to us too.

I'll be in my kitchen tomorrow trying to figure out how to copy it... can someone bring the special butter and the jam?

excerpts: The boyfriend wanted afternoon tea after late night, so we looked at Gridskipper's guide to "High Tea Places in Jolly San Francisco" at http://gridskipper.com/travel/san-francisco/high-tea-in-jolly-old-san-francisco-305421.php
high tea.author: Angie C.
high tea.review:
The boyfriend wanted afternoon tea after late night, so we looked at Gridskipper's guide to "High Tea Places in Jolly San Francisco" at http://gridskipper.com/travel/san-francisco/high-tea-in-jolly-old-san-francisco-305421.php   

We rolled up and looked into Lovejoy's late on a Sunday afternoon to see nothing but girls -- sixteen year old girls, twentysomethings, families of girls (and maybe the odd forty-year old father-figure). I laughed. Apparently afternoon tea is a "girlie" thing here with cutesy mismatched china. Anthropologie the clothing store on crack was my first thought. 

But the food was pretty good, the service prompt, and the bottomless tea pot is perfect to combat the chilly San Francisco winter. This isn't the place to bring boys, but if you want to break out the floral skirt and have a super-girlie get-together, this is the place for you.

excerpts: I usually get their High Tea.
high tea.author: Anne K.
high tea.review:
I've always been a fan of Lovejoy's. I usually get their High Tea. Their sandwiches are good and their scones are DELICIOUS!! The decor at the tea room is really cute too.

Recently hosted a baby shower there and I must say, they have everything down to a T. I really appreciated that. The service was excellent!! For large parties (up to 20 guests), you get 2 hours for your tea time. The waitresses, especially Samantha, were very good about letting you know how much time you have remaining (which is good because when you're having such a good time, it's easy to lose track of time!) without being pushy or mean. Our tea and food were brought out as soon as all the guests had a chance to sit down. An area was set aside for the presents. They brought out a plastic garbage bag for all the wrapping paper/garbage in case we wanted to open presents. The leftover food was boxed up so that we could bring the leftovers home. They even helped us take a group photo outside, around the corner, in front of the Lovejoy's painted on the wall, which I think all groups do! The staff at Lovejoy's really think of everything so that hosting an event there is stress-free and quite enjoyable!!

excerpts: Maybe High Tea is just not my cup of tea.
high tea.author: Steph L.
high tea.review:
" Sorry Honey, but the jam is not homemade. I just saw a jar of Smuckers in the back." - my girlfriend who came back from the restroom!

Teas Worthy of Trying:
-Passonfruit Black Tea (aromatic, but has a stronger/darker taste)
-Mango Black Tea (very aromatic)
-Pomegranate Green Tea (light, couldn't really taste the pomegranate)
-English Tea (if you like milk tea - this is your cup of tea)

I had the Savory Tea (2 types of sandwiches + Pot of Tea), selected the LoveJoy's Special (Turkey + Cranberries) and Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese.  The Smoked Salmon was extremely salty (which is very consistent to previous reviews by other yelpers).  Turkey and Cranberry Sandwich was very simple, nothing special.

I'm not a scone person, but I was able to sample some.  The scones were exceptionally fluffy and light with the perfect hint of raspberries.

Since it was one of my girlfriend's birthday, LoveJoy's complimented the birthday girl with one of the petit four + candle (which was a definite bonus).

Definitely make a reservation before coming!  Service is exceptional! Parking wasn't too horrible - near residential area. 

Maybe High Tea is just not my cup of tea.

excerpts: Heaven, perfection, and love all wrapped up into a high tea experience!
And they even had soy milk for me to put in my tea!!!!!!
high tea.author: Jacquie L.
high tea.review:
I love tea.  I mean, REALLY REALLY love tea.  There is NOTHING better than a perfect cup of black tea, with a bit of sugar and milk.  Herbal tea makes me feel better when I'm sick and without fail, I have a cup of black tea at least once a day.

So, for the girl who thinks that having a perfect cup of tea is the high point of her day (I'm simple.. what can I say) I didn't know it could get this much better!

Lovejoy's offers a beautiful traditional tea experience with a bit of whimsy and all the charm of an English tea room.  Beautiful porcelain tea cups, saucers and tea pots set atop lacey doodles with colorful tablecloths make the perfect tea party for two, three or up to 20 some odd people for larger parties.

And so came the bottomless pot o tea, tiered platters, complete with fresh, hot scones topped with Devon cream and preserves, and tiny crust-less sandwiches of our choosing, with cole slaw and mixed greens.

Heaven, perfection, and love all wrapped up into a high tea experience!  And they even had soy milk for me to put in my tea!!!!!!

excerpts: We got High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Nona T.
high tea.review:
You go here for the experience obviously.
It's like a grandmothers house. All the saucers, teacups and pots are mismatched and many have chips on them.
The service is nice and helpful.

If you don't mind spending more money on having a nice, quiet time its nice to experience tea here at least once.

The food is Ok. Nothing to rave about. We got High Tea for Two. Nothing too memorable.

With nice company who also enjoys a nice tea time, Lovejoy's is fun for brunch sometime.

excerpts: This place captures every girl's heart for a nice relax afternoon high tea.
We went for the high tea package.
For the sandwiches, their choices made my brain surrender.
The pear and stilton was nice, so was the salmon mousse and the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.
high tea.author: LeeLee C.
high tea.review:
So cute, so adorable and so picture worthy!  This place captures every girl's heart for a nice relax afternoon high tea.  

We didn't make advanced enough reservation and we called in 11am on Saturday to see if we would be lucky enough.  At first we were told that there was no opening, but by 1pm, they called us back for one cancellation.  So besides us being lucky, I guess they also managed their schedules pretty effectively. 

We went for the high tea package.  For the sandwiches, their choices made my brain surrender.  The pear and stilton was nice, so was the salmon mousse and the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.  The scones were wonderful, fluffy, sweet and tasty!  The tea choices were abundant and they came with tea pod, filter and a beautiful cup set.  

The service was good, only problem, it was so popular that we were only allowed to stay up to certain hours.  After 3.30pm, we were no longer so royal and had to pack up and leave for the next guests. 

As if they were not cute enough, there is a shop setup on the opposite side of the street for souveniors, anything from aprons to tea pots.  They know how to get to girls!

excerpts: As for the food, my friends and I tried the "High Tea".
high tea.author: Leslie T.
high tea.review:
This place deserves four stars for the ambiance, but the food was more a three.

Lovejoy's furnishings are a patchwork collection of Victorian armchairs, kitschy cat tea pots,  and charming British "keep calm, carry on" type art pieces. Nothing really matches but that's what makes the place just "work". 

As for the food, my friends and I tried the "High Tea".  On a three tiered plate came: 

    -chicken apple walnut, egg and onion, cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches; honestly this was pretty disappointing.  Perhaps they were in a rush when cutting off the crust because some of the "sandwiches" ended up being no larger than the size of my pinkie finger. 

-scones (good), coleslaw (meh), spring greens (I ate some, but it seems more like filler since placed under the sandwiches)

- a pot per person of endless tea; excellent tea!

With tax and tip it was about $25 a person. 

The service was a bit of a miss for me. A little over an hour in, and our server asked us if we were through with our plates; this happened two more times. I found it odd since there were no people waiting for the table, and most of the other parties in the room seemed to be lounging around just as long. Didn't really appreciate feeling rushed out. 

Loved the random mix of china, tea pots and cups they served everything on. This is a great place to hang out and catch up with your girl friends.

excerpts: The 8 of us all shared 4 orders of the High Tea for 2.
high tea.author: Jessica C.
high tea.review:
They've got gadgets and gizmos aplenty
They've got whozits and whatzits galore
(You want thingamabobs? They got twenty)
But who cares?
No big deal
I want more...

I want to be where the tea sandwiches are! I want to see, want to see them dancing... Er um wait, I'm getting carried away with my Little Mermaid references. Anyhoo... we came here for a friend's baby shower and sat in the window table, and everything was adorable. They definitely have a lot of gadgets and gizmos about decorating the tea room.

How is it that one can eat more sandwiches when they are cut into tiny pieces? I wolfed down my share in minutes then looked around to see the ladies I was with chatted and drank tea in such a dainty way and slowly noshed on their sandwiches. *sigh*

The 8 of us all shared 4 orders of the High Tea for 2.

I ordered the blood orange tea and then the chicken apple walnut sandwich and pear and stilton cheese. Both sandwiches were delicious and the tea was flavorful and really nice.  The best part was the scone however, which was warm and fresh and I caressed this scone with a healthy helping of devonshire cream. 

Fantastic experience here in terms of eats and a feast for the eyes, my only wish is that you could sit around gabbing longer, but alas they give you a limited amount of time for your reservation and need to get going soon after the timing ends.

excerpts:
We all decided to get a high tea and get the birthday girl the Queen's tea, and here are my comments from that day:

1.)
high tea.author: Jessica H.
high tea.review:
Though a Lovejoy's was definitely a bit on the more pricy side for starving college students, it was worth the splurge for my housemate's 21st birthday. We all decided to get a high tea and get the birthday girl the Queen's tea, and here are my comments from that day:

1.) The service was excellent. The lady took our order was very sweet and helpful in helping us pick out teas.
2.) The sandwiches were delicious. So good. And the salad was pretty good, and this is coming from someone who doesn't really like salad. 
2a.) Now, the food might seem like it's little. But it was enough for us. We even had to take some home for leftovers. Or maybe a late night snack.
3.) My friend's seasonal chestnut flavored tea was so sweet and delicious. To die for. All the teas were great actually. Did I die and go to tea heaven?
4.) The decor at the place definitely kept me interested. Mismatched tea cups and coat hangers all added to Lovejoy's charm.

I really wish I was in San Francisco right now so I can go and get some Lovejoy's, but my cravings can just wait.

excerpts: Maybe it was because there was so much buildup for this place, but I was just so excited the whole time I was there - this high tea was HAPPENING, and only a mile from my apartment!
Lovejoy's certainly lived up to the hype
high tea.author: Lia S.
high tea.review:
After months on the waiting list (I exaggerate) (but only a little) (maybe), my family finally scored a table fit for royalty at Lovejoy's. We each got our own Me Tea, which allowed us to pick from a list of tempting sandwiches, scones, and other tasty teatime treats.

Their houseblend tea is phenomenal. All of their others are somehow also outstanding. I could have happily ordered every tiny sandwich on the menu, but opted for a special that day of curried chicken - good choice! The scones are just the right amount of moist and crumbly. Everything was delivered to the table perfectly inoffensively and our waitress gladly took all of my parents questions about the various teapots and cozies around the room.

Maybe it was because there was so much buildup for this place, but I was just so excited the whole time I was there - this high tea was HAPPENING, and only a mile from my apartment! Lovejoy's certainly lived up to the hype and I would love to go back eventually.

It was also surprisingly not crazy-expensive.

excerpts: Comfortably nestled in Noe Valley, I always look forward to high tea here every time I'm in the area.
The tea room is a cozy size, with British paraphrenalia scattered about and dainty chairs and tables that make you feel like a hoity-toity fancypants (without the snobbish air, of course)!
I feel like a princess every time I've been there for high tea.
high tea.author: Paula G.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is nothing short of magical.  Comfortably nestled in Noe Valley, I always look forward to high tea here every time I'm in the area.  The tea room is a cozy size, with British paraphrenalia scattered about and dainty chairs and tables that make you feel like a hoity-toity fancypants (without the snobbish air, of course)!  I feel like a princess every time I've been there for high tea.

Three cheers for bottomless tea!  I am a tea fanatic and can't get enough of it!! Their ginseng green tea is superb, very light and not too bitter.  The ginseng is a plus too. I absolutely love their pesto and prosciutto sandwich (available only on Fridays I believe), the pesto is zesty and the prosciutto is ever so tasty.  Their chicken salad sandwich is divine, and don't even get me started on their smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwich! Yummy!!  Their scones are also to die for, and paired with the lemon curd...delicous!  Lovejoy's lemon curd is also perfect!  It's not too tart and has that perfect balance of sweet and tangy that creates a symphony of delight in your mouth!

I could boast about their shepherd's pie and brag endlessly about their delectable pasties as well as their cheerful and polite staff--always willing to give the absolute best service to their customers. 

I will definitely be frequenting Lovejoy's every few weeks or so because, accurately reflecting the five stars they deserve, they're as good as it gets!!

excerpts: I only knocked down a star since its my first time enjoying high tea, so I'm unsure if its really "as good as it gets" but the going sure is gooooood.
We decided on High Tea for for four, enjoying the cucumber and creamcheese, bay shirmp, smoked salmon and cream cheese, and the chicken apple walnut.
I had the pomegranate green for myself, which was delicious... and bottomless!
We paid 25 each including tax and tip for high tea and petit fours, which is quite reasonable considering we each got bottomless tea, salad, coleslaw, 8 mini sandwiches, a scone and a tea biscuit.
I also had the lemon curd petit four, which was tasty, albiet a bit sweet after having the tea biscuit and clotted cream scone
high tea.author: Samantha D.
high tea.review:
I only knocked down a star since its my first time enjoying high tea, so I'm unsure if its really "as good as it gets" but the going sure is gooooood.

I came here to reunite with three of my friends whom I've known almost all of my childhood, so we were bound to catch up and talk about the past year (since we haven't reunited with all of us together for a year or so)

We decided on High Tea for for four, enjoying the cucumber and creamcheese, bay shirmp, smoked salmon and cream cheese, and the chicken apple walnut. I had the pomegranate green for myself, which was delicious... and bottomless! Soo amazing!

The service was very attentive and welcoming, it was the perfect place to spend from 3:00 till closing talking and updating each other on what was going on in our lives. We didn't feel awkward or feel like we needed to leave, it was like we were in our own house.

The decor is great, the mismatched tea pots and cups were adorable. We paid 25 each including tax and tip for high tea and petit fours, which is quite reasonable considering we each got bottomless tea, salad, coleslaw, 8 mini sandwiches, a scone and a tea biscuit. I also had the lemon curd petit four, which was tasty, albiet a bit sweet after having the tea biscuit and clotted cream scone but I couldn't resist how cute they were!

Most of the time my reviews focus on the food rather then the service (I will go back to a yummy place even if the service is so so) but you really pay for the experience/ambiance here. My time here was just amazing and fun.

excerpts: High Tea per person: $19.95 (choice of tea, 2 sandwiches, a scone, a shortbread cookie, and salad greens)
high tea.author: Vanessa T.
high tea.review:
I've been coming to Lovejoy's for years now. It's perfect for Mother's Day, a date with the girls, and (in the future) my baby shower! I love the mismatched tea cozies and dishes and the service has always been top notch. The only downside is that in order to make a reservation (and this is a MUST DO) you almost always have to book 2-3 weeks in advance. They never answer their phones so you'll have to leave a voicemail and they call you back. Also, I wish they would use a different type of bread, I swear they become stale 10 minutes after being served. Try their house tea (it's a black tea) and put some of the fresh cream on your scones!

High Tea per person: $19.95 (choice of tea, 2 sandwiches, a scone, a shortbread cookie, and salad greens)

excerpts: Awesome high tea!
My Canadian mother is visiting and I took her to Lovejoys.
Absolutely wonderful service, such a cute atmosphere, and delicious tea.
The food is really good, and I will definitely be coming back!
I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a genuine English tea experience.
high tea.author: Elizabeth S.
high tea.review: Awesome high tea! My Canadian mother is visiting and I took her to Lovejoys. Absolutely wonderful service, such a cute atmosphere, and delicious tea. The food is really good, and I will definitely be coming back! I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a genuine English tea experience.

excerpts: - I've been to quite a number of high tea places in the city - it's usually pretty steep.)
I have every intention of planning a girl's outting here again soon.
high tea.author: Kate R.
high tea.review: Thank you yelp for this find! My mom surprised me with saying her and my Aunt from Japan wanted to hang out in the city that day with me. I told them I'd call then back once I figured out some (family-friendly) fun things to do. Got in the same day, they had a blast and I certainly earned my "awesome daughter of the day" badge. It also was so reasonable I was a a bit overwhelmed (like, I could actually afford to take my aunt and mom out for this much fun? - I've been to quite a number of high tea places in the city - it's usually pretty steep.) I have every intention of planning a girl's outting here again soon.

excerpts: We also had the High Tea at our table, and the sandwiches, cookies, and such were all delicious.
high tea.author: Kym M.
high tea.review:
I was looking for a kitschy tea room for my birthday, and Lovejoy's fit the bill exactly. We went on Halloween and all the waitresses even dressed up as men with mustaches ("We thought it would be funny to dress up as men since there are hardly any that come here.")

I ordered the "Healthy Tea", which was ginormous! I consider myself a big eater with a bottomless stomach, but I could not finish the plate--excuse me, I mean platter! The Healthy Tea came with one of the most delicious hummus (hummi?) I've ever tried and the yogurt brought out the sweetness of the strawberries and was a soft accompaniment to the crackers and veggies.

We also had the High Tea at our table, and the sandwiches, cookies, and such were all delicious. No complaints.

I'm not much of a tea connoisseur, so I'll just say that I ordered the Blood Orange Herbal Tea, and it tasted exactly as such.

The only complaint is that we sat next to a glass china cabinet and there was a picture inside of Barack Obama. They need to take that out. . .It ruins the whole atmosphere.

...Also have to add...We were there around closing time, and we felt a little rushed, so we hurried out. We were sitting outside for awhile waiting for our ride, and when we got home, we realized we had left our box inside the tea room on the couch. I don't know why they couldn't have given it back to us while they were cleaning up inside and we were waiting just outside the door.

excerpts: This is a beautiful place to bring a friend to treat them out for an afternoon of high tea and catch up!
high tea.author: Helen L.
high tea.review:
Such good service! 

I came here a week ago with my old friend, who recommended the place. 

The servers were really attentive and didn't rush us out the door. They were very good with refilling our pot of teas!

It was my first time at a tea room and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. 

The sandwiches I ordered wasn't that impressive but I really did enjoy the experience and the service.

They have seating for large parties but I think if you have more than 4 people you should definitely made a reservation instead of just showing up and testing your luck. Me and my friend were lucky to have seating available( the two tables in the front that are always open to drop in customers) , but the lady informed me that they were filled until March 2012. 

This is a beautiful place to bring a friend to treat them out for an afternoon of high tea and catch up!

excerpts: I always try to find other high tea places, but no where else comes close in comparison.
high tea.author: Rachel L.
high tea.review: I don't think you can leave this place without feeling completely full. I've been here at least a dozen times, and every time has been enjoyable. The scone, the sandwiches & the cups of tea all compliment one another. I always try to find other high tea places, but no where else comes close in comparison.

excerpts: I've been to high tea time at a few places, but this is the one place I would come back to!
My good friend

Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea
high tea.author: Maile N.
high tea.review:
I've been to high tea time at a few places, but this is the one place I would come back to!  My good friend and I had reservations for 3:30 this afternoon, and we had the best seat in the house next to the window!  

Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea (I had the Blood Orange tea, very good -- my friend likes her stand-by Black Currant tea).  

I thought everything was yummy and just right for the two of us, plus it was reasonably priced.  We stayed for two and a half hours, and not once did I feel like we were rushed out the door - just right!  Thank you, Lovejoy's for a very enjoyable Saturday afternoon!

excerpts: We ordered "High Tea for Tea", which gave us a substantial amount of food.
When it says "four sandwiches" they actually mean four whole sandwiches, not four quarters or four halves like some other tea places.
high tea.author: Alice L.
high tea.review:
I took a visiting friend here since it's been a long-time tradition to have tea every time we meet. Located right off a metro stop on the J Line,  I remember passing by the store when I was in 24th Mission but had concluded it was some sort of salon because of its looks.

We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation time, but got seated immediately with a cute sign on the table that said "Reserved for Queens". We ordered "High Tea for Tea", which gave us a substantial amount of food. When it says "four sandwiches" they actually mean four whole sandwiches, not four quarters or four halves like some other tea places. They slice it into quarters, so there were 16 quarters in total.

Savory:
-roast beef and horseradish: This had a nice zing to it provided by the horseradish, 
-chicken apple walnut: This probably had the most filling-to-bread ratio and it tasted like the chicken apple salad that they sell at Costco, which I actually liked
-smoked salmon and cream: Salmon tasted fresh and this was our favorite
-pear and stilton: your standard sharp tasting stilton

Sweets:
The scones were more like biscuits with raisins and I prefer more buttery scones, but props to them for still being somewhat warm when they came out even if they were a little dry. It was served with Devonshire cream and preserves and those were definitely done right!

The shortbread tea biscuits were surprisingly decent tasting. 
We got the Italian wedding cake and a chocolate apricot petit four a la carte. They were $2.50 apiece, which seemed quite steep for a wee piece, but I believe they get it from Dianda's bakery (25th + Mission) that also sells it for the same price.

Ambience: I definitely thought this place was more shabby than chic, like some kind of untouched-for-centuries, dusty house that I would be afraid to touch. I do prefer somewhere that has some finesse, while still keeping the Grandma and girly vibe like Lisa's Tea Treasures,  but this is more a matter of taste preference, so it didn't impact my rating. What did MATTER was the tables were cramped and quite close to each other, making it difficult to go to the bathroom. We could also hear a lot of different conversations. I would prefer more private tables with wider spacing, so I could just relax, but that's just not feasible in a small and popular place. I saw a bridal shower and I felt as if I would want a private room or alcove with less tables if I were them, which is offered in some tea places. The mismatched teapots/cups/strainers resulted in my friend getting a tea strainer that was not wide enough to place on her huge cup, so she had to do a switch-a-roo.

Service: The ladies offered to take a picture for us and were quite prolific in topping off our tea with more water. After some time, it seemed like they were a little too hasty in trying to take our food away before we finished, but nothing super offensive. One of the workers (or manager?) was on the phone, going over some business accounts at the table next to us for a good while, so that was off-putting.

excerpts: High Tea at Lovejoy's Tea Room...
High tea for two was $35.

We tried two teas: darjeeling black tea, which we drank with milk & sugar like we heard the Queen does & their "special find" of the day which was pomegranate green tea (totally try whatever "special find" they are offering.
This one was exquisite.)
high tea.author: Fancypants X.
high tea.review:
My mother & I participated in the ultimate female bonding ritual: High Tea at Lovejoy's Tea Room...

My first thoughts were, did i trip, fall down the rabbit whole & end up as a character in Alice in Wonderland?

LOOK AT ME:
This place is really unique & charming, almost reminds me of an antique shop; there are so many things to gawk at: chandeliers made from spoons, mirrors on the wall, the red British phone booth, a fireplace, hats hanging on a dresser, etc. All their silverware & chairs are mismatched. 

DRINK ME:
High tea for two was $35. We tried two teas: darjeeling black tea, which we drank with milk & sugar like we heard the Queen does & their "special find" of the day which was pomegranate green tea (totally try whatever "special find" they are offering. This one was exquisite.) Each tea was served in a different style teapot. 

EAT ME:
The tea sandwiches were dainty, delicate & delicious & were served on a two tiered porcelain carrier . We chose:
- cucumber & cream cheese (obviously)
- apple walnut chicken salad
- tomato & cheese
- "lovejoy special" of the day- ham & mango chutney
Also included were: salad, cole slaw, two scones & two tea biscuits. We could not stop raving about the scones, which were unusually moist & buttery (as opposed to dense & hard like other scones.) And the double devon cream & strawberry jam made it that much more decadent (a little *too* decadent says my scale.)

ADORE ME:
I just experienced Lovejoy's for the first time this week & I am already planning another trip back ASAP. Prices are decent for the extraordinary tea party experience you get & service was simply marvelous. Don't forget to sip tea with your pinky up (i swear, i DID NOT do this, but you should.)

excerpts: I believe we had the High Tea for four and this came with bottomless pots of tea for each of us.
high tea.author: Sannie L.
high tea.review:
I had an absolutely wonderful experience here with my friends. It was our first time coming to one of these tea places and we left satisfied and happy. They have choices that are more affordable (ex. a la carte items, tea sets of different prices) and this allows for more flexibility so you can tailor what you order to how hungry you are, how much money you're willing to spend, etc. (ahem, Crown & Crumpet, take note).  I believe we had the High Tea for four and this came with bottomless pots of tea for each of us. Their scones are so freaking delicious! I want some right now just thinking about it. Even though I discovered that Earl Grey was not my thing, I still thoroughly enjoyed the other teas at the table. 

When we arrived we were met with absolutely excellent service. They were friendly and patient when we had no idea what to order. I loved the interior, even though space was a bit limited. They had shelves full of trinkets, teapots, and things that made it feel very home-y. It was packed the day we went because it was a weekend but we had reservations so no problems there.This is my go-to place when I want to get tea. Great service, good food and tea, cozy environment.

excerpts: We all ordered the high tea and we loved every bite.
When that tower comes out and you see those dainty little sandwiches you think, "This isn't going to be enough!".
And then... you start eating.
$20 for high tea, worth every single cent.
And they are extremely nice about refilling your teapot as often as needed.
The staff was very polite and gave us good info about when they needed the table so we never felt rushed.
I really appreciated that they made the effort to fit us in!
Also, they give all diners 10% off loose leaf teas at Lovejoy's Attic across the street.
I can't wait to come back!
high tea.author: Rachel A.
high tea.review:
I spent my childhood going to the Tudor House in LA with my mom, so I have pretty high standards for tea rooms... all of which were met by Lovejoy's! This place is absolutely, mindblowingly, crazy adorable! I love the mismatched plates and cups and teapots. I love that it feels like someone's super-cozy living room, and that the entire staff is incredibly sweet and treats you like family.

They were also really great about getting us a table at noon on a Saturday without a reservation. Someone had the table reserved for 1:30pm (seatings are usually 2-hours), but they let us squeeze in with the understanding we'd have to short it a bit. Still, it didn't matter. They took our order immediately and we waited less than 5 minutes before our tea came. 

We all ordered the high tea and we loved every bite. When that tower comes out and you see those dainty little sandwiches you think, "This isn't going to be enough!". And then... you start eating. You realize that the sandwiches are on a giant bed of nice, fresh salad, and suddenly you're only halfway in and you're totally full!

$20 for high tea, worth every single cent. And they are extremely nice about refilling your teapot as often as needed. The staff was very polite and gave us good info about when they needed the table so we never felt rushed. I really appreciated that they made the effort to fit us in! Also, they give all diners 10% off loose leaf teas at Lovejoy's Attic across the street. I can't wait to come back!

excerpts: We had the High Tea for Two, and it was more than enough food.
high tea.author: Marsha Z.
high tea.review:
Tea rooms are to women what sports bars are to men.  Leave the boys at home and come here with the gals.  

I celebrated a belated birthday here, and it was a joy.  It's very cute and homey, which is what sets them apart.  A lot of British memorabilia fills the space.  (I loved the "Keep Calm and Carry On"  signage so much, I ended up buying one for my own place.)  You won't find any culinary delights here, but I thought the food was good.  Though very simple, I enjoyed all the finger sandwiches, the scones, and their luscious lemon curd, which they happen to sell at their Attic across the street (along with their teas).  We had the High Tea for Two, and it was more than enough food.  It was a very good mix of sweet and savory.  

I loved the bottomless pot of tea (I had the China Rose Petal), which proved to be very cleansing between my alcohol binges.

excerpts: I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.
The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.
high tea.author: Lis B.
high tea.review:
I absolutely adore Lovejoy's.  It is the quintessetial tea room.  Girly, dainty, chintzy, and oh-so-English, it's a definite winner.

Gentlemen:  enter at your own risk.

I have had both the High Tea ($17.95) and the Queen's Tea ($24.95), and I do think that unless you love crumpets (I don't) and petits fours (I do, but I can live without them after consuming a whole tea service), it's not worth the extra $7 for the Queen's Tea.  The High Tea is such a good bargain - so much food for under $20 - that it almost moots the point of the Queen's Tea, in my mind.

With both teas, you get your choice of tea sandwiches (I love the pear/blue cheese and the apple/cream cheese), tea (they're all good!), warm scone (with lemon curd, jam and clotted cream), coleslaw, spring salad (with mandarin oranges) and shortbread cookie.  The Queen's tea adds a crumpet, a petit four, and a lot of fresh fruit.  

All of the tea cups and saucers are mismatched, making it all completely adorable.  It's all for sale, too.  Just ask (they also have a shop with everything for sale across the street).  

I like sitting near the front, near one of the windows.  It's especially nice if you can get a seat on the banquette and tuck yourself in.  The place is always packed, and it's good to be able to observe the fray, rather than be a part of it.  Speaking of packed, reservations are a necessity.

The waitstaff is always friendly and helpful, although they sometimes look a bit beleaguered.

And the best part about coming here?  In addition to the delicious tidbits I hear from my friends over tea, I always end up hearing little snippets of other people's conversations (hey, the place *is* small), and I've learned more about complete strangers than I ever wanted to know.  Something about the tea must make them open up and spill all their secrets!!

excerpts: We decided on the high tea for two for $34 (that's $17 each).
high tea.author: Julia T.
high tea.review:
3.5 stars. I adore tea time. There's nothing like taking a couple of hours to slow down and enjoy some quality time with scones, sandwiches and friends. My BFF and I came here on a beautiful Wednesday afternoon. Our table was waiting in the middle of the room. It was fun looking at all the random knick knacks and mismatched plates and cups. We decided on the high tea for two for $34 (that's $17 each). We got four sandwiches, coleslaw, spring greens, two scones, strawberry preserves and double devon cream, two shortbread cookies and two tea selections. I chose the black mango tea and it was great. You don't need sugar or milk because when a tea is good, you can just appreciate it for what it is. I loved how many loose leaves there were in the pot. 

We chose the salmon & cream cheese, egg & onion, chicken apple walnut and asparagus & cream cheese sandwiches. All of them had the crust cut off and were pillowy soft. My favorite was the chicken apple walnut but none of the sandwiches were above average. The asparagus was a yellowish green color that looked like it was boiled too long but it tasted fine. The coleslaw was a little bland for me. Furthermore, I didn't like that the only taste I had was the caraway seeds that were mixed in. I had to spit out those little suckers after every bite. The salad was more like a garnish for the sandwiches to rest upon. I did like the little mandarin oranges in it though. 

The warm scone with raisins was delicious as were the shortbread cookies. Heaven is biting into a warm scone with cream spread and strawberry preserves on top. Lovejoy's is a bit hyped up but the service was fantastic. Our pots were never less than half full. I was also worried that I would still be hungry but the sandwiches and drinking so much of the tea left me quite satisfied.

excerpts: Lovejoy's is such a charming place to go for high tea.
It's a place you would wear your Sunday clothes to, complete with grandma's pearls, hat, and lace gloves.
high tea.author: Steph L.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's is such a charming place to go for high tea. It's a place you would wear your Sunday clothes to, complete with grandma's pearls, hat, and lace gloves. Their mismatched tea sets add a nice quirky touch too!

In addition to their tea service, they also serve standard British fare like sausage rolls, ploughman's, pasties, shepherd's pie, and quiche. My mom and I shared a shepherd's pie and a Queen's Tea.

The SHEPHERD'S PIE was amazing! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=PeTed6UBTWeBk7jEVkTkLw) Perfectly seasoned ground beef topped with creamy mashed potatoes. And pretty too! The mashed potato is artfully swirled onto the top - details like this really add to their charm :)

The QUEEN'S TEA (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=A8V8DoiszacJREq7-b0w0g) was pretty good. It came with everything I wanted to try. I had a really hard time choosing the sandwiches because they had such a big selection! (Not that I'm complaining). The coleslaw and spring greens were aiight (I'm not what you would call a "salad girl"). The scone and tea biscuit were also good, but mostly because of the fabulous fruit preserves and lemon curd. My favourite was the crumpet though. They brought it out later, freshly out of the toaster. Amazing texture - crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. We also got our choice of petit four at the end and I chose the cutest one (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/s-ihKanDRDHTD8U49HFA5Q?select=dZd79TtAvold1OhQdyiesQ).

All in all, Lovejoy's is a great place to go for afternoon tea - charming neighbourhood and decor, unpretentious, good selection of food, and not ridiculously overpriced.

excerpts: I loved loved loved having High Tea here!!
high tea.author: Lois W.
high tea.review:
I loved loved loved having High Tea here!!

Came over here last weekend with few friends after hearing so much about the place. Reservations are hard to come by, and sometimes they forget to call people back. Therefore, my friend came here physically days prior to make the reservation!

The tea room was cutely decorated. There were so many random items all over the place, but somehow they worked together. After being seated, we each picked different types of tea and set - pinkies up! Everything was delicate and delicious. We especially enjoyed the scones and crumpets, which were buttery and yummy :)

Didn't realise how much food was served until we felt like taking a nap on the sofa, all for ~$20 per person!

excerpts: The two times that I have come here, me and two other friends have gotten the High Tea for Three.
It's just High Tea for Two with an added person.
It's pretty filling.
high tea.author: April D.
high tea.review:
Aw tea parties.  The two times that I have come here, me and two other friends have gotten the High Tea for Three. It's just High Tea for Two with an added person. It's pretty filling. I think it's the best deal, as it comes with small sandwich slices, salad, coleslaw, scones, cookies, and three pots of tea. China Rose tea is my favorite! 

I highly recommend that you make a reservation, because you may not get seating. There is usually one small table available if you get there as soon as the place opens, but it is really is meant for two people. I wish this place were bigger or spacier, but I think they intentionally make the place look overcrowded with nic nacs. I don't recommend it for people who are claustrophobic. I'm not, but the space still bugs me. However, I will come back, because the food, tea, and service is great.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for two and got to choose 4 different sandwiches.
We got the Smoked Salmon & Cream, Cheese Chutney & Cheese, Pear & Stilton, and Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard.
high tea.author: Rose C.
high tea.review:
My friend and I love to get tea with the whole English tea time accompaniments.  We went on a Friday for lunch and luckily, she made reservations.  The decor is utterly quaint and reminiscent of flowery furniture seen in historical films.

We ordered the High Tea for two and got to choose 4 different sandwiches.  We got the Smoked Salmon & Cream, Cheese Chutney & Cheese, Pear & Stilton, and Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard.   Those sandwiches were quite filling, in addition to the gigantic scones and salad.  The scones were so delicious - we wanted more but were simply stuffed.  I opted for the Passion Fruit tea while she got English Breakfast.  We spent a good 2 hours just drinking tea and talking.

excerpts: Out of all the items for our high tea order, I loved the warm scones (point!).
The service was nice, and I liked the variety of people who were there.
It didn't matter if you were more girly, goth, or just wanted to have some tea.
I don't like that it requires reservations.
We called 2 weeks in advance and the 1PM - 3PM tea was full.
high tea.author: Lily W.
high tea.review:
I guess I'm not really a tea person.

Came to celebrate a friend's birthday, and it was only OK.  I was definitely hesitant to come, as it reminds me of a small child having a tea party at Grandma's house. Nice, but not my cup of tea...ha.  No? Fine.

Out of all the items for our high tea order, I loved the warm scones (point!).  The service was nice, and I liked the variety of people who were there. It didn't matter if you were more girly, goth, or just wanted to have some tea. I don't like that it requires reservations. We called 2 weeks in advance and the 1PM - 3PM tea was full. Sucky.

The food was small portioned. Fair, as this is tea. However, after hanging out with people afterward, we found ourselves hungry after 3 hours. Some people were hungrier even earlier than that.  The sandwiches were only OK for me.  Fruit in sandwiches are just strange for me.  I also saw a large amount of canned veggies and fruits in the back...and realized almost everything I had came from cans. Interesting...

It was also a little pricey for me.  We averaged out at about 23 per person.  If I were more of a British tea person, I think I'd give it a 4.

excerpts: We had the "high tea" which it was not, for $20.00 plus $9.00 for tea you get two sandwiches, some greens tossed on to the tier and a dish of coleslaw and scones and a cookie..
The Queen would be appalled!
We went with a group and you really don't get much however it is definitely popular.
It was so cramped one could barely walk to the table.
Our server when available was on the surly side.
I really wonder why this place is popular.
I was a guest and honestly next time I am invited
I will suggest tea at my house at least the bread will be fresh and I will provide deserts as part of "high tea"  or save your pennies and go for real afternoon tea at the Garden Court.
high tea.author: rassors T.
high tea.review:
What are the rave reviews all about? Yes if you want to sip tea and eat stale bread sandwiches in a sardine can this is your place.  Ok I have only had tea in London, Victoria Canada and the Garden Court in SF and I realize Church street is far away but really!  They do not use the thin bread but instead thick American bread, think wonderbread. The parchment thin roast beef was undetectable as were many other fillings..We had the "high tea" which it was not, for $20.00 plus $9.00 for tea you get two sandwiches, some greens tossed on to the tier and a dish of coleslaw and scones and a cookie..
The Queen would be appalled!
We went with a group and you really don't get much however it is definitely popular. It was so cramped one could barely walk to the table. Our server when available was on the surly side. I really wonder why this place is popular. I was a guest and honestly next time I am invited I will suggest tea at my house at least the bread will be fresh and I will provide deserts as part of "high tea"  or save your pennies and go for real afternoon tea at the Garden Court.

excerpts: I ordered the High Tea, which came with tiny finger bite sized sandwiches.
I selected the Cucumbers with Cream Cheese and Tomato with Cheese - I am obviously a big cheese fan.
I also had the White Peach Tea, which was delightfully light and sweet!
A perfect match for the tea sandwiches and pastries!
I also tried the delectable Petite Fours!
They all had very cute intricate designs.
I would  recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room , however, I could only see myself going to this place for a few occasions.
It would be a perfect place to take your mother and sisters here for Mother's Day.
It's also a good  place  to catch up with your girlfriends.
Portions are tiny , but it is pretty filling with the tea.
Service is great.
Reservations only.
high tea.author: Clementine D.
high tea.review: First of all, can we talk about the ambiance of this place? Quaint atmosphere (very English style), a little pricey but its worth the experience! I ordered the High Tea, which came with tiny finger bite sized sandwiches. I selected the Cucumbers with Cream Cheese and Tomato with Cheese - I am obviously a big cheese fan. I also had the White Peach Tea, which was delightfully light and sweet! A perfect match for the tea sandwiches and pastries! I also tried the delectable Petite Fours! They all had very cute intricate designs.   I would  recommend Lovejoy's Tea Room , however, I could only see myself going to this place for a few occasions.
