high tea.review:
My girlfriends treated me to afternoon high tea for my birthday and I loved it! It's a great place to unwind hopped up over tea scarfing down finger foods and accompanied by attentive conversation. It's really the type of place for all ages and occasions. Contrary to belief...
   -we were able to get full
   -there were just as many males as females the day we were here
   -it was pretty casual but it wouldn't be unusual if you really wanted to "dress up"

We stopped into their shop across the street where I got schooled on Digestives :/

excerpts: We made our order, of High Tea for four and the Queen's Tea for the birthday girl.
high tea.author: Annie Y.
high tea.review:
In the last few years, I have nurtured a love for afternoon tea. Something about sitting around a wooden table with a lace tablecloth, or antique-style sofa with a few friends and a nice pot of tea really resonates within me. One would think I feel like a pretentious bourgeois snob, and I am not hypocritical enough to deny it; however, just let it be known that being San Franciscan automatically ingrained a bit of elitism in me. That being said, Lovejoy's Tea Room was not the first time I've taken afternoon tea, and it certainly won't be my last.

We came to Lovejoy's for my friend's birthday and hoped that we did not miss our stop while riding the J-line. The exterior did not impress me, but the moment we stepped inside, it was as if we were transported into another world. In contrast to the brightness and cuteness of Crown & Crumpet, Lovejoy's interior looked antique and mismatched and absolutely lovely. The cups and plates were all unique and pretty. Of the three tea rooms I've been to thus far, the interior design of Lovejoy's is my favorite by far. 

Luckily for us, it was a slow Friday afternoon and we were immediately seated, despite our lack of a reservation. Score! In preparation for documenting my friend's birthday, I brought my camera so I ended up obnoxiously taking pictures of the interior. We made our order, of High Tea for four and the Queen's Tea for the birthday girl.

Food was mediocre. Honestly, the best thing about the food they gave us was the dressing for the salad. I got the smoked salmon with cream cheese, and Lovejoy's special, which was chicken and pesto. Both were unimpressive and was much too creamy. The Devon Cream made me feel as if I were eating butter. I've had better scones elsewhere. The strawberry preserves they gave us was definitely not homemade, and reminded me of smuckers (didn't even spring for Bonne Maman!), and the lemon curd was not tart enough.

But the tea was fantastic! I loved the pomegranate green, and the China Rose Petal tea was a perfect sweetness (this is from someone who does not like herbal teas). Those were my favorites of the five we order. The waitress was also really nice.

Usually, I'd give three stars for mediocre food, but the decorum, service, and company made the entire experience much more enjoyable than the food. This is a fantastic place for just a lovely day out.

Bottom-line: you come here for the setting, the company, and the tea; but not the food.

excerpts:
The best in food, tea, and ambience as far as high tea in the Bay Area goes.

Everyone usually gets the high tea -- endless pot of tea, choice of a couple of sandwiches, bit of salad, etc.
high tea.author: Wella L.
high tea.review:
The best in food, tea, and ambience as far as high tea in the Bay Area goes.

Everyone usually gets the high tea -- endless pot of tea, choice of a couple of sandwiches, bit of salad, etc.

But if you go one step higher in the menu, you get a little more food for a few more bucks.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I tend to go for the High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Renee M.
high tea.review:
*Sigh* My cozy, eclectic hideaway.

Layered doily tablecloths, mismatched utensils, and antique photographs occupy every nook and cranny of this English-style teahouse.  It is the perfect introduction to an afternoon abundant with delicious food, comforting tea, and good conversation.  

My boyfriend and I tend to go for the High Tea for Two.  For about $35, we each get coleslaw, salad, a choice of two sandwiches, scones, cookies, and our own individual pots of bottomless tea.  The pear and stilton sandwich is my favorite, but if you eat anything make sure you try the scones!  

My boyfriend, who is more of the coffee type, enjoys the Yorkshire Gold tea.  I have tried both the pumpkin spice and cha cha cha teas and like them as well.  

We have had the same server on both of our visits.  She has been very good about explaining the menu layout and recommending items.  Our teapots always stay hot and full.  Service is attentive without being invasive.  

Lovejoy's is the perfect place to enjoy some simple food over a nice pot of tea and good company.  I look forward to trying out more teas in the visits to come!

excerpts: Great atmosphere, delicious high tea treats, and wonderful company!
high tea.author: Caroline S.
high tea.review:
I love doing girly things with my girlfriends and this was quite a treat for my bday! 

I've been to Lisa's Tea Treasures in Campbell and enjoyed the atmosphere there. Outside of work, I don't go to SF much, so it's great to find an unique place worth driving out to.  Parking may be a bit of a pain though, unless you are get lucky on one of the side streets with no meters. 

I sure felt like royalty here with the 'Reserved for Royalty' sign and our attentive wait staff. Everyone ordered the Queen's Tea special, which was more than enough food to feast on. I loved all the sandwiches, especially the curry sandwich special they served that day. The scones went well with the different preserves and lemon curd. The petite four bites were a bit too sweet for my taste, it looked too good to eat. 

Great atmosphere, delicious high tea treats, and wonderful company! 

I will be back for another special occasion.  Be sure to make reservations, this place is always packed!

excerpts: Great to go for high tea!
high tea.author: Jeremy H.
high tea.review: Quite nice little tea room. Great to go for high tea! The Yorkshire Gold is amazing and the shepherds pie is well proper British! Go!

excerpts: We had the high tea for two and were rather full by the end.
We got the cucumber sandwich, roast beef with horseradish, salmon with cream cheese and stilton and pear (love!).
high tea.author: Deanna L.
high tea.review:
Kind of new to the whole tea thing, I wasn't sure what to expect. I was super excited though, and definitely not disappointed. It definitely has a cozy feel to it, so I wouldn't imagine it would be able to accommodate huge groups. I think the mismatched furniture and silverware adds a nice touch to the atmosphere. 

The sandwiches were really good! We had the high tea for two and were rather full by the end. We got the cucumber sandwich, roast beef with horseradish, salmon with cream cheese and stilton and pear (love!). The warm scones were delicious and the dressing for the salad was lovely. Not the hugest fan of the coleslaw, probably because of mint? in it. I don't know. And having just come from Crown and Crumpet, I can say that I prefer Lovejoys because of the sandwich selections.

excerpts: Me and Ness usually get "High Tea for Two," and I usually end up finishing whatever she leaves behind.
high tea.author: Tor E.
high tea.review:
My girl Ness first introduced me to this spot on 16th and Church in the city, and I've have tried to make it a monthly routine ever since. I know, I know. I used to be just like you. Laughing in a bad English accent, "Tea and crumpets with the Queen?" Pshhh. And we all know "cucumber sandwhiches wtih the sides cut off," are frowned upon by heffers far and wide. But let me tell you, this ain't your grandmother's tea party.

The place is a cozy, yet eclectic corner tea house. Complete with mix matched China, vintage wall hangings, and crochet doilies. The waitresses are all very pleasant and very knowledgeable of the teas, food, and what goes good with what. And while it's a rather noisy establishment, cell phones are not allowed so please take ur loud ass outside when ur T-Pain ringtone goes off.

OK, now for the food. OMG. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. While it's no House of Prime Rib, I can honestly say that I've NEVER left this place still hungry - and I CAN GRUB. Me and Ness usually get "High Tea for Two," and I usually end up finishing whatever she leaves behind. This includes, salad, cole slaw, 2 sandwhiches of our choice (each, so 4 in all), 2 scones, sugar cookies, and 2 bottomless pots of tea. My fave combo is bay shrimp and mayo, and either chicken and asparagus or egg and onion with passion fruit tea. And seriously, the "devonshire cream," aka butter from the Gods is so good on top of a warm scone I'm thinking about stealing it next time. Mind u, they also have savory side dishes like sausage rolls, shepards pie, quiches, and puff pastries filled with things like curried chicken.

Lovejoy's Tea Room is the quintessential spot for a bridal/baby shower but any day (especially sunny, warm Sundays!) is a good day for tea!

excerpts: I came here with a friend and we had high tea for 2.
We had the darjeeling and the china rose petal teas.
The china rose petal was amazing--light but also unique and flavorful.
Its probably my all time favorite tea so far!
The darjeeling was ok, I'd probably go with something else next time.
You get a generous portion of 2 sandwiches for each person (that's 8 triangles per person!) which I believe is more than other high tea places.
I wish we could get more than 2 kinds of different sandwiches given that you actually get 8 pieces, but I understand that it would complicate things in the kitchen.
We had the bay shrimp and mayo, salmon and cream cheese, chicken apple walnut and the daily special (can't remember off the top of my head), which were all very very good.
The scone was also very good, though I usually like mine a little fluffier.
The reason I give it four stars is because they give a lot of greens as filler, which is pretty tasteless.
I also wasn't a huge fan of the cabbage salad.
I just don't think these 2 things go very well with a tea service, but that's just my opinion.
high tea.author: Janet N.
high tea.review:
I came here with a friend and we had high tea for 2. We had the darjeeling and the china rose petal teas. The china rose petal was amazing--light but also unique and flavorful. Its probably my all time favorite tea so far! The darjeeling was ok, I'd probably go with something else next time. You get a generous portion of 2 sandwiches for each person (that's 8 triangles per person!) which I believe is more than other high tea places. I wish we could get more than 2 kinds of different sandwiches given that you actually get 8 pieces, but I understand that it would complicate things in the kitchen. We had the bay shrimp and mayo, salmon and cream cheese, chicken apple walnut and the daily special (can't remember off the top of my head), which were all very very good. The scone was also very good, though I usually like mine a little fluffier. The reason I give it four stars is because they give a lot of greens as filler, which is pretty tasteless. I also wasn't a huge fan of the cabbage salad. I just don't think these 2 things go very well with a tea service, but that's just my opinion. For $20 a person, I'd rather have more tea biscuits or petit fours.

The tea room is a little bit small/cramped and our table was very tiny. I was a little scared of knocking something over. The same goes for the Lovejoy's tea shop across the street, though the surrounding neighborhood is very cute. Service was very good. The bathroom was very clean and was decorated nicely (lots of mirrors-haha)! Parking can be a little difficult if you come here at a busy time.

Overall, I had a very good experience and I would definitely come back if in the area. However, I do prefer Tyme for Tea in Fremont, which is similar in price, but is a little easier to get to and superior in taste in my opinion.

excerpts: Absolutely the tops for a high tea experience.
The decoration is surpassed only by the teas and nibbles.
Even my gruff cowboy loved it.
high tea.author: Anne S.
high tea.review: Absolutely the tops for a high tea experience. The decoration is surpassed only by the teas and nibbles. Even my gruff cowboy loved it.

excerpts: My absolute favorite is the High Tea for Two in which you can add an additional person for $17.99!
Since you can pick 4 different kinds of sandwiches, (6 if you add an additional person)
my grandma, mom and I got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roastbeef, bay shrimp and mayonnaise, cream cheese and green apple, chicken apple
walnut salad and smoked turkey and dijon mustard!
It comes with the High Tea for Two by the way.
It's warm and soft with raisins mixed in.
Once you spread the preserves and double devon cream, omg...it's ON!!
high tea.author: Kanani N.
high tea.review:
LOVE.THIS.PLACE!  Everything about it!  From decor to their food!  I've been here twice.  My absolute favorite is the High Tea for Two in which you can add an additional person for $17.99!  Since you can pick 4 different kinds of sandwiches, (6 if you add an additional person) my grandma, mom and I got the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roastbeef, bay shrimp and mayonnaise, cream cheese and green apple, chicken apple walnut salad and smoked turkey and dijon mustard!  My ultimate favorite was the bay shrimp and mayonnaise.

You can pick 2 kinds of tea (3 teas for three people).  We ordered the Vanilla Roobios, China Rose Petal and Passion Fruit which was by far my favorite.  I must say that they're NOT greedy with their tea.  It comes in a big teapot and the waiters are constantly refilling it.  All you can drink tea!  

And omg, their scones!  I never liked them until I tasted Lovejoys' scones.  It comes with the High Tea for Two by the way.  It's warm and soft with raisins mixed in.  Once you spread the preserves and double devon cream, omg...it's ON!!  So delicious!  

The decor is super cute especially the utensils, teacups, teapots and plates.  As if you were at your grandmother's house.  So girly.  However, it can get a bit squishy when you try to get to your table.  Be careful when you walk between tables.  You might break something!  

The waiters are very nice.  I also love how they come to your table and offer you little dessert pastries.  It's not free but it's quite delicious.

Safe area but parking might be hard to find.

excerpts: Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.
It was my first high tea experience
and i'm going to continue finding places to have my tea.
However, I now feel a lot more sophisticated now that I've done this.
I am a proper gentleman now.
My next goal is to be knighted.
Sir Aaron Gong has a nice ring to it doesn't it?
high tea.author: Aaron G.
high tea.review:
I've been dying to have a tea party since Jennifer C. told me about her experience in Seattle.  Does this make me an old English lady?  Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.  Yes, I had my pinky up a few times. Is there any other way to drink english tea?

The interior is quite antiquated.  I was waiting for the smell of mothballs to invade my nostrils, but it never did.  There are little knick knacks everywhere.  Antique galore might be a better phrase to describe this place.  I almost felt like i was invading an old lady's hang out spot.  

Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.  The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.  The sandwiches were good but not anything special.  I enjoyed the tea.  We had the Tea Room Blend (black tea) and the Passion Fruit Black Tea.  

Other than that, everything was good.  I didn't find this place super special or super awesome.  It was my first high tea experience and i'm going to continue finding places to have my tea.  However, I now feel a lot more sophisticated now that I've done this.  I am a proper gentleman now.  My next goal is to be knighted.  Sir Aaron Gong has a nice ring to it doesn't it?

excerpts: Just man up and go in there and order the High Tea!
We ordered High Tea for two and the servers were great in helping us to choose through the selection of teas and sandwiches available.
high tea.author: Theresa D.
high tea.review:
Guys don't be scared of Lovejoy's Tea Room. Just man up and go in there and order the High Tea!( hehehe)

But seriously, this place is perfect if you want to spend an afternoon conversing with friends over some tea and good food. We ordered High Tea for two and the servers were great in helping us to choose through the selection of teas and sandwiches available. The tea room blend was my favorite from the four my group ordered. I added a splash of milk and a spoonful of sugar and it was almost like a chai tea, but lighter with a slightly bitter taste that wasn't bad. And the little sandwiches were great! The combinations of sandwiches may sound a bit strange, but they are all rather yummy. Like who puts Oranges with cream cheese in sandwich?! Genius, I tell you! Make sure you make reservations because this place can get packed. I can't wait to go back. eww that rhymed.

excerpts: It is unique tea-lover's experience without all the frills of high tea.
high tea.author: Nichole P.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's is so sweet and lovely. It was especially nice when I visited because I was feeling a bit off and having a bad day. My trip to LJ's turned my whole day around. I had the Sweet Tea, which included a bottomless pot of whatever type of tea you desired, plus a few petite foures to go with. Since I wasn't feeling my best I had a pot of green tea with mint. It was good and it lifted my spirits. I highly recommend trying Lovejoy's for yourself in great company. It is unique tea-lover's experience without all the frills of high tea.  

Oh, did I mention that EVERYTHING is on sale?! If you like the pot your tea was brewed in or the cup you are sipping out of... why not purchase it. I thought that was a nifty idea.

excerpts: Each high tea cubes with a scone, two sandwiches,  salad, coleslaw,  and a tea biscuit.
high tea.author: Lorenzo V.
high tea.review: My family and I had a pleasant dining experience,  but the food was mediocre. Service was friendly and the ambience was home like.  The four of us shared the quiche,  hight tea for two, and another order of scones.  The quiche was okay;  savory and a little fever with egg  cheese and potatoes.  Each high tea cubes with a scone, two sandwiches,  salad, coleslaw,  and a tea biscuit.  The scones were sublime and as large as hamburger buns; this is the best feature.  The sandwiches were too tiny and nothing special as the turkey and ham meats are the sky deli meats you get from a grocery store.  I kid you not: the sandwiches are the size of two McDonald's chicken nuggets. The white peach tea was very tasty.  The black vanilla lavender is actually very pleasant too and was soothing and not at all perfume.

excerpts: First high tea experience.
high tea.author: Cynthia C.
high tea.review: First high tea experience.  The bride invited her bridal party to this place for cucumber sandwiches sans the crust, tea, freshly made crumpets, buttery cookies and petit fours.  Delicious food, teacups with character, and a wonderful venue for a get together.  Make reservations and be prepared to wait when you arrive.

excerpts: I joined my mother and my aunts here for a high tea, the menu is very vegetarian friendly, I loved the hummus and the toast bites (even though when I posted a picture of it on FB
high tea.author: Peta C.
high tea.review:
I felt under=dress here, but don't feel like you will get the boot, the owner is very welcoming and friendly, no need to worry about the snootiness us Brits are known for (some of us, no offense your Majesty). I joined my mother and my aunts here for a high tea, the menu is very vegetarian friendly, I loved the hummus and the toast bites (even though when I posted a picture of it on FB I was getting a carb lecture from one of my friends -- its all good) 

Make reservations, I'm not sure about the walk ins, my mother is planning to bring her friends here for a get together, she talked to the owner because one of her friends is in a wheelchair, the place is wheelchair accessible, but if you have a friend in a wheelchair, it's best to call ahead of time to let them know, they will make sure to give you a space up in the front. 

Cheerio! enjoy your spot of tea loves

excerpts: We had "High Tea
" the bite sized smoked salmon sandwiches were great!
We also had apple-cranberry-nut sandwiches, and they where great!
Service was good, food was good, and prices are good.
high tea.author: C J.
high tea.review:
Let me first start by saying this is not the type of place I would usually go to, but it was good!   My girlfriend was given a gift certificate to this place, so we thought we would have a Sunday brunch there.  We had "High Tea" the bite sized smoked salmon sandwiches were great!  We also had apple-cranberry-nut sandwiches, and they where great!  Service was good, food was good, and prices are good.  The scones were even warm! The jam even tasted like it was home-made!  It went great with the tea.  The only thing they where missing there, was my Grandma! ha ha!  They were busy, but we never felt rushed.  The little old lady that waited on us really was sweet.  We're glad we stopped by!

It really has the charm of my Grandma's old home back in the Mid-West.  

Well done...

Perfect place to take Mom, Grandma, or the girlfriend!

excerpts: High tea is served here.
I had Queen's tea.
It's more than enough food and variety.
high tea.author: Janet J.
high tea.review: Best blueberry scone I have ever had in my life, and I have lived in many cities. Crispy and buttery with perfectly cooked blueberries. High tea is served here. I had Queen's tea. It's more than enough food and variety. Very tasty sandwiches, rich cookies and crumpets, ridiculously good scones, to die for lemon curd, and super sweet fruit. Great tea selection and quality. Ambiance is cute and cozy. Take a friend or family member at least once. It makes for a memorable experience.

excerpts: My daughter and I each ordered "high tea", discussing what sandwiches we each wanted
so we would share items we liked.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.
We ordered one type of tea during lunch and a different one to have with our dessert.
There was plenty of food, all fresh and attractive.
I will go back again, although if I am sharing with someone, I don't think I would order 2 high teas.
There was quite a bit of food for 2 of us.
We were kept entertained by looking at all the "stuff" around us.
There was a lot to see.
high tea.author: Carol H.
high tea.review:
What a wonderful time!  My daughter loves tea, so I took her on a bit of an adventure last Friday, to Lovejoy's.  My husband and I had seen a segment of "Eye on the Bay" highlighting Lovejoy's and immediately thought of taking my daughter there.
We traveled from Walnut Creek on BART, getting off at Powell station.  From there we jumped on Muni "J" outbound line.  There is a stop right at Lovejoy's.
I will tell you I made a reservation for our visit.  I would definitely recommend doing that.  While we were dining, I heard staff telling people there would be an hour wait.
(I did see the group come back and hour later!)
My daughter and I each ordered "high tea", discussing what sandwiches we each wanted so we would share items we liked.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered one type of tea during lunch and a different one to have with our dessert. There was plenty of food, all fresh and attractive.  I will go back again, although if I am sharing with someone, I don't think I would order 2 high teas.  There was quite a bit of food for 2 of us.
We were kept entertained by looking at all the "stuff" around us.  There was a lot to see.  
The clientele was mainly women with a few gents thrown in.

After we had consumed our lunch, which took a good 2 hours, we walked across the street to Lovejoy's store where you can purchase tea and all kinds of tea related goods.  

The inbound Muni "J" stops right in front of the tea room, so it was extremely convenient.

We will return and bring others.  I have started to spread the word!

excerpts: I officially love high tea.
high tea.author: Nancy H.
high tea.review:
I officially love high tea. 

It was really an experience coming here. I loved the atmosphere and the service was great. It was a little crowded, but it's obvious why. I went with my friend and fellow yelper Shirley W. and another friend, so I don't need to describe the tea and food again, but it was excellent! My favorites were the mango tea, and turkey with cranberry and egg with onion sandwiches. 

Definitely a ditto on the bathroom situation. But I would still come back too!

excerpts: Might I also add that there's a rather large price difference; hotel high tea could set you back about $40+ per person, but at Lovejoy's, the most indulgent tea service is a mere $24.95.
high tea.author: Virg Y.
high tea.review:
Tea rooms range from the opulent such as those at the grand hotels or understated and cuddly, like Lovejoy's. Might I also add that there's a rather large price difference; hotel high tea could set you back about $40+ per person, but at Lovejoy's, the most indulgent tea service is a mere $24.95. 

This small tea room is oh so darling, with it's haphazard decor of mismatched tablecloths and grandma's attic tea implements. The service is warm and friendly, with a wonderfully varied menu of good quality teas and yummy sandwiches. The scones were flaky and flavorful, served with Double Devon cream and preserves...just as they should be. The hot chocolate for my girls came out in an adorable little pitcher with whipped cream on the side in a smaller pitcher. And the petit fours were in the shape of hats.

Cute, Quaint and utterly Fabulous...especially for a girls' afternoon, discussing the finer points of gymnastics camp and soothing the jitters of a newly hatched Kindergartener.

excerpts: and we had been talking about having high tea.
I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.
The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.
But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it
high tea.author: Monique H.
high tea.review:
Went here for the first time today.  My girlfriend from high school was visiting from out of town and we had been talking about having high tea.  After much searching and disappointment that The Four Seasons Hotels and the Ritz-Carlton Hotels have discontinued their tea service, we found this place on Yelp.

We were half an hour late (boyfriends are slow) but lucky one person in our party was only 5 minutes late and saved the table for us.  She said they were very nice and didn't harass her about the rest of her party not showing up.

I had the Queen's Tea with English Breakfast tea and cucumber and turkey sandwiches.  The tea arrived first and after waiting anxiously for it to seep, I poured myself a cup.  It was delicious, but I am not a tea connoisseur.  Then arrived the food, on a three tiered platter.  The top tier was the fresh fruit, next the scone, biscuit, jam, lemon stuff, and the devon cream, the bottom tier had the sandwiches, cole slaw, and greens.

To be frank, when I first looked at it I thought they kind of skimped out on the fruit, but I was stuffed by the end of my meal, so really they are smarter than me!

After having some fruit, I decided to try the scone.  I first tried the devon cream...and that is when I realized that I loved this place!  If I had a lover, forget the whipped cream or chocolate sauce, this is what I'd cover his body with and lick off!!!  I could not get enough of it and I think this was my favorite item here.  Of course the jam and lemon stuff was good too, but I cannot describe my devotion to devon cream now.

The sandwiches were of course delicious and...dainty, delicate?  FUN!  I am not a super girlie girl.  My friend and I decided to put dresses on for the special occasion and I felt like a streetwalker even though my dress is conservative, but that is how rarely I wear things that don't have legs.  But this place played into my feminine side without me feeling awkward about it.  So yes, it's frilly and kitsch, but it works for this place.

A little while later came my fresh crumpet.  We decided crumpets are a pancake-english muffin hybrid, a puffin. Delicious, but I just wanted to get back to my scone and devon cream to be honest.

Lastly when we were done, we had our petite fours.  Which apparently I didn't really experience because I got the dark chocolate truffle with dried apricot.  But it was so cute and I love dark chocolate.  Petite fours are candy-sized, individually glazed pieces of cake. (My friend went to culinary school)

I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.  The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.  But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it made me want ribs or something) and I was too full to even consider wasting space on a salad!

So if you go, invite me?

excerpts: Most high tea places look a little intimidating, but this place is definitely homey and worth trying out.
high tea.author: Jasmine A.
high tea.review:
I love tea parties! jk. I love tea and pastries.  I took the best friend and her beau and one of my guy friends to this spot.  I feel bad for the guys because they definitely looked out of place.  Then again, we were out of place dressed in jeans and coats and being Asian.

We were starving and without a reservation we waited such a long time (45 min to an hour) for a table.  There were tea parties going around near us.  Book clubs.  Little girls vomiting after eating too much...

After getting seated, we ordered 3 high teas and one shephard's pie. I was surprisingly full afterwards.  That feeling only lasted about 1 hour then i was hungry again. haha.  

The overall experience would have been better if:
1. we had a reservation
2. we had eaten before hand

Despite my review, I would come here again for the decor and menu.  Most high tea places look a little intimidating, but this place is definitely homey and worth trying out.

excerpts: Best of the best for authentic and exceptionally tasty high tea in San Francisco.
The staff is amazing, perfect ambiance and this place is a family celebration tradition.
I am almost glad I live across the city because if I lived in the hood, I would be here everyday probably.
high tea.author: Jennie M.
high tea.review: Best of the best for authentic and exceptionally tasty high tea in San Francisco.  The staff is amazing, perfect ambiance and this place is a family celebration tradition.  I am almost glad I live across the city because if I lived in the hood, I would be here everyday probably.

excerpts: High Tea for Two was the perfect cozy way to end the year.
high tea.author: M G.
high tea.review:
Lovejoy's is usually booked the week between Xmas and New Year's. This year is no different. Hoping to score a table, I signed up for the waiting list and was happy when they called me back with an opening.

High Tea for Two was the perfect cozy way to end the year.  Besides two sandwiches and two bottomless pots of tea, you get two big scones, two cookies, greens and coleslaw for $34.95. My friend and I always end up packing the cookies home - it's a lot of food!

The sandwiches are always tasty.  I had the smoked salmon/cream cheese and chicken-apple-walnut while my friend ordered the cucumber/cream cheese and one other I can't remember.  

Service was exceptional.  Our pots of tea were constantly kept full and hot.   Our gabbing easily had us occupying the table for 2 hours.  When the next reservation was due to arrive, the wait staff gently let us know they needed the table.

The ambiance is cozy and warm, but not stuffy.  I love the little sayings posted throughout the shop. This has become my go-to place for tea with friends. We've tried other tea houses, but they just doesn't compare to Lovejoy's. So, now, if Lovejoy's is closed, we usually just end up waiting until they're open again rather than go elsewhere.

excerpts: I recommend the "High Tea" if you're in a big group or the "High Tea
For Two" if you're going with one other person.
(The "For Two" version is basically two high teas packaged together at a slight discount).

The High Tea comes with (in order of best to worst):
1:
Bottomless pot of one type of tea.
Warm scone.
Double that for the High Tea
For Two, meaning you get four sandwiches total.
high tea.author: Chad H.
high tea.review:
Wow, totally did not expect to like this place.  My girlfriend kept wanting to drag me here, and my initial reaction was "Really?  Tea?  Really??"  Eventually I caved, because I'm totally whipped.

Well, I'm glad I did.  Holy hell this place is delicious.  Not only did we go that one time, we've been back a bunch of times, and have even been inspired to try other tea places in the city.  However, none of the other places we've tried are as good as Lovejoy's.

I recommend the "High Tea" if you're in a big group or the "High Tea For Two" if you're going with one other person.  (The "For Two" version is basically two high teas packaged together at a slight discount).  The High Tea comes with (in order of best to worst):
1: Bottomless pot of one type of tea.
2: Warm scone.
3: Two sandwiches.
4: Sugar cookie.
5: Salad.
6: Cole slaw.

Double that for the High Tea For Two, meaning you get four sandwiches total.  There are a lot of variety of teas, from standard stuff like English Breakfast to more unique teas like Passion Fruit.  (I stick with the green teas myself).  The scone is delicious, especially once you spread the accompanying cream and jelly on it.  There are some great sandwich options, too.  My favorites are apple and cream cheese, shrimp and mayo, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and egg salad.

The place is slightly pricey, but you'll come out so incredibly full of good food that it's totally worth it as an "every one in a while" place.  One other thing: definitely get reservations ahead of time, especially if you have more than two people, or else it's going to be a hell of a wait.

excerpts: We ordered high tea for four, since there were the four of us.
We got to choose four different teas, all of them bottomless.
We chose the strawberry (so good

, it really tasted like strawberries, the sweetness of it and the bitterness from the tea, such a good blend), the vanilla black tea (the special of the day, creamy rich vanilla taste), the china rose petals (our favorite, so light and refreshing, all flavors just blended in perfectly; the aroma of the rose hits your nose immediately and the hot tea somehow cools you down, so so so good), and last the blood orange tea (it was good, but a little too citrus-y for me...).
We each got to order two sandwiches, a scone, a cookie, salad, and cole slaw.
I got the chicken apple and walnut salad sandwich and the horse-radish and roast beef sandwich.
Both of them were so yummy!
The scone was warm and really delicious.
Before every bite I would spread the jam and the double devon cream onto it, and it literally melted inside your mouth.
I'm drooling as I am typing.
high tea.author: Betty C.
high tea.review:
I really really loved it here. 

Tea parties seem so fancy-smancy but Lovejoy's so quaint and unassuming that it balances the uppiddy feeling of brunch tea time and you can't help but fall in love with it's quirkiness. (Okay, so that kinda sounded like a critic on the back of a novel....)

We ordered high tea for four, since there were the four of us. We got to choose four different teas, all of them bottomless. We chose the strawberry (so good, it really tasted like strawberries, the sweetness of it and the bitterness from the tea, such a good blend), the vanilla black tea (the special of the day, creamy rich vanilla taste), the china rose petals (our favorite, so light and refreshing, all flavors just blended in perfectly; the aroma of the rose hits your nose immediately and the hot tea somehow cools you down, so so so good), and last the blood orange tea (it was good, but a little too citrus-y for me...). We each got to order two sandwiches, a scone, a cookie, salad, and cole slaw. I got the chicken apple and walnut salad sandwich and the horse-radish and roast beef sandwich. Both of them were so yummy! The scone was warm and really delicious. Before every bite I would spread the jam and the double devon cream onto it, and it literally melted inside your mouth. I'm drooling as I am typing. The salad, the cole slaw, and the cookies were rarely touched, so I can't really comment on that.

Service was awesome. We got a cute waitress, who was so helpful with suggestions. And though we didn't make reservations, they gave us a table, but reminded us that someone had reserved the table in an hour, but they never rushed us (but in our own conscience we felt bad and tried to be quickish, but trust me time flies when your with your bffs chatting).

We have already discussed it, and we're definitely coming back again! But with reservations this time, so we can take a while longer here, take more pictures, &talk more. 5 stars!

excerpts: I shared a High Tea for two with A.
high tea.author: Yan E.
high tea.review:
Being Chinese,  "drinking tea" means hot food, hot tea, and cheap prices to me, or at least in my backwoods dialect of Chinese. So Lovejoy's tea was a different experience for me: major sticker shock. Popular place.   There was a large crowd waiting at 10:30, despite the fact Lovejoy's opens at 11a. The six of us had reservations at 11am on Saturday.

I shared a High Tea for two with A. We got English breakfast tea and the following sandwiches:

Chicken-Apple Walnut Salad
Artichoke Hummus
Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese-A's Jewish, so of course he picked it 
Chutney and Cheese-stupid pick on my part bc someone raved about it here. If you don't know what chutney is (like I said, I was stupid), don't get it. 

Tea, sandwiches, shortbread cookies, and salad were all ok, nothing spectacular. It didn't feel very filling either.  I thought it highly overpriced for some tea and crust-less sandwiches. However, my god, the scones with double Devon cream were divine! I was slathering the cream on my scone like a Chinese mom outdoors with sunblock. Every time I walk by now, I yearn for those scones.

Decor: eclectic collection of ornate seats, tables, chairs. Mismatched charm. I loved the different tea sets, cups, creamers etc. Service: great. Everyone was seated quickly. Your pot is refilled quickly no matter how little you've poured out.

As I'm breaking down the price in my head right now, I guess it's not that bad for everything you get. The food is mostly mediocre for what you pay, but the service, decor and ambiance makes for a nice one time experience.

excerpts: Can you say HIGH TEA?
On a lovely sunny day, I went with my home girl to this tiny tea room.
The set up is so cramped that I barely had any room to get into my seat.
Let alone the servers go by.
We had the tea for two, which came in your choice of two pots of tea (try the passion fruit tea)
I can not recall the exact amount but it was a bit pricey for high tea that did not have tea treats that stood out.
However, for the experience it was not bad.
high tea.author: Ann L.
high tea.review:
Can you say HIGH TEA? On a lovely sunny day, I went with my home girl to this tiny tea room.  The set up is so cramped that I barely had any room to get into my seat.  Let alone the servers go by.  We had the tea for two, which came in your choice of two pots of tea (try the passion fruit tea) so flavorful and refreshing, two scones, two different sandwiches for each person, and a cookie each.  The food was just okay.  Although their finger sandwiches are not bad and have a big selection to what meats you want in it.  Unfortunately, I was too stuffed to try their desserts, they look quite delicious! The price was about $24-28 each person with tax & tips.  I can not recall the exact amount but it was a bit pricey for high tea that did not have tea treats that stood out.  However, for the experience it was not bad.  I wished they had more than one bathroom for its customers, the wait can be pretty long if there's a line.  

P.S. parking is a F*king b*itch here... =/

excerpts: We settled on "high tea," all the tea you can drink for $17 per person, plus two sandwiches, a scone, a cookie, some salad and a bit of cole slaw per person.
I did not want to like this place.
But when the tea arrived, it was perfect.
The Irish Breakfast was strong and piping hot, deep and refreshing.
high tea.author: Michael W.
high tea.review:
Straight out of a six-year-old girl's tea party fantasy. Lovejoy's is like having tea with your kooky Great Aunt Beatrice. Mismatched floral cups and pots, three-tiered serving trays, and lace. Lots of lace. I went with my mom and sister for my sister's twentieth birthday. We walked in, passed a group of six-year-old girls celebrating a birthday, and got to our seats. The only men in the joint were beaming fathers of six-year-olds, grandfathers, and defeated looking boyfriends and brothers. There was a lot of estrogen.

Our waitress was very sweet, gave suggestions, described teas. We settled on "high tea," all the tea you can drink for $17 per person, plus two sandwiches, a scone, a cookie, some salad and a bit of cole slaw per person. I did not want to like this place. But when the tea arrived, it was perfect. The Irish Breakfast was strong and piping hot, deep and refreshing. The green was herbaceous and nourishing, and the apricot tea was...apricotty?

The scones were bliss-inducing, wonderfully warm pillows of fluff. Not the flaky bricks one usually encounters, these were described as "Irish style," if that means anything to you. The sandwiches were wonderfully fancy versions of the dainty crustless numbers moms make for their daughters. Pear and stilton, salmon and capers, chicken salad, shrimp. Delicate, airy little tastes.

But what really makes this place fun is the service. Tables are labeled "reserved for royalty" or "reserved for the queen," and the waitresses treat you as such, really doing their best to make your experience enjoyable.

I think I may come back for the impressive selection of pub food on the menu!

Oh, and it is easily walkable from 24th st BART!

excerpts:
High Tea for Two allowed us choice of 4 sandwiches and we enjoyed each one:

Cucumber & Cream Cheese - refreshing and light
Roast Beef & Horseradish - to satisfy hubby's neat for meat and the horseradish has a nice kick to it
Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Chutney & Cheese - flavorful
Ham & English Mustard - tasty
high tea.author: Gloria H.
high tea.review:
Ever since trying it for the first time in Victoria years ago, we've been hooked.  During a conversation at a party, friends asked if we've tried Lovejoy's - where?  Boy, are we thankful for the tips!

This is what tea should be - cozy, comfortable and non-pretentious like some other places.  We sat at the corner and settled into the comfy settee.  We like all the standard fare, no flavored tea for us - just the good old English Breakfast w/ sugar and milk.  The tea cozy is homey but it sure helps the keep the tea hot/warm!  Can't even describe the quaintness of this place and how charming it is...  We loved looking around and just about everything is for sale here!

We really enjoyed the tea sandwiches.  The bread was very soft and not "squished" from when they cut off the crumb.  High Tea for Two allowed us choice of 4 sandwiches and we enjoyed each one:

Cucumber & Cream Cheese - refreshing and light
Roast Beef & Horseradish - to satisfy hubby's neat for meat and the horseradish has a nice kick to it
Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Chutney & Cheese - flavorful
Ham & English Mustard - tasty

This is more enjoyable than Ritz, even the tea and sandwiches were better.  There's no harp playing and large fireplace BUT this is the perfect place to enjoy tea with your special someone, girlfriends, mom...etc.

excerpts: If it's just you and another person, order the High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Kat M.
high tea.review:
This quaint and charming Tea room is very Victorianesque. Everything -- from the furniture to the ensembles of the waitresses, is Victorian. The place has an old feel to it. It's extremely girly, so I wouldn't recommend bringing the boys here. Make a reservation for the girls. This would be an awesome "girls day out" place to visit.

I will admit, at first glance, I didn't believe anything on the menu would fill me up. However, each item was so rich with fresh flavor and I was actually stuffed by our meal's end. A downfall -- the prices. I didn't expect tea and sandwiches to be that expensive. The way I see it is, I paid for the experience of trying something new in a great environment, where they definitely pay attention to detail and where high attentive and personable.

If it's just you and another person, order the High Tea for Two. You get to choose several different sandwiches, spring greens, scones, shortbread, biscuits, crumpets, and spreads. I loved the cucumber and cream cheese and apple walnut salad. I literally moaned when I put the crumpet topped with Devonshire cream in my mouth. It just melted...I loved that combination so much, that I went to their retail store across the street to purchase a jar. As far as teas, they offer a wide selection...I would try one from each category.

In short, try it on a Saturday or Sunday morning with girlfriends!

excerpts: This is a local favorite and it's not hard to understand why after you've ventured in here for high tea.
The service is great and the food is absolutely delicious.
Bring a friend and split a high tea for two.
high tea.author: Cathy L.
high tea.review:
This is a local favorite and it's not hard to understand why after you've ventured in here for high tea.  The service is great and the food is absolutely delicious.  Bring a friend and split a high tea for two.  Guaranteed you will depart relaxed, refreshed, and in a happy spirit.

If you come here on the weekends, reservations are recommended during breakfast to lunch hour.  If you drop by closer to closing time after 2pm the crowd dies down and you can usually find a table for two.

excerpts: Now wouldn't think this would be filling after doing Bay to Breakers, but got surprisingly full after eating all that came with the high tea.
high tea.author: Peg S.
high tea.review: Antique-y girls' tea.  Teeny sandwiches were divine, daarhling.  Now wouldn't think this would be filling after doing Bay to Breakers, but got surprisingly full after eating all that came with the high tea.  Scones with jam and cream were delectable.  Cookies good. Plentiful (damn big, it hurts my wrist to pour) pots of tea.  Too much estrogen in there though.

excerpts: We had the High Tea for 2, the first tea our server recommended a black tea, so we went for the English Breakfast.
The second tea we tried was the Decaf Chocolate Truffle, the aroma was lovely and light.
This was my first High Tea experience, and will definitely come back again.
high tea.author: Em A.
high tea.review: Today I came here for lunch with a friend and had a blast!  The teas and sandwiches were delicious.  We had the High Tea for 2, the first tea our server recommended a black tea, so we went for the English Breakfast.  The second tea we tried was the Decaf Chocolate Truffle, the aroma was lovely and light.   This was my first High Tea experience, and will definitely come back again.

excerpts: Went with my girlfriends and it was a majority of our first time experiencing high tea.
Fell in love with the decor (very eclectic).
Our waitress was very nice.
She suggested the "high tea for two" instead of each of us getting the "high tea" because it was the best value for our group size.
high tea.author: Ai B.
high tea.review:
It's a tea party for Adults!

Went with my girlfriends and it was a majority of our first time experiencing high tea. Fell in love with the decor (very eclectic). Our waitress was very nice. She suggested the "high tea for two" instead of each of us getting the "high tea" because it was the best value for our group size.

Tea for two came with a bunch of tea sandwiches that we picked out, salad, scones (that never tasted sooo good), sugar cookies, and bottomless tea (we each got to pick out our own tea).

excerpts: I suggest the Garden court at the palace hotel orTthe Ritz for an authentic classy High Tea delight.
high tea.author: audrey w.
high tea.review:
Um no.....no.
 I had heard rave reviews for this Noe valley spot, and what a hudge let down.
We had a pot of overbrewed TRB ( their suggestion )....
Our tea came out in a rickety old pot with a craked leaky lid.  I was sure the handle would break off.....ewww paper napkins on old dingy tablecloths covered with ripped lacey doiles.
The tea sandwiches are not elegant but just tiny and over priced, bland mushy pieces of white bread with margarine spread.  I fet like I was eating toddler food.
 How english.  The room is stuffy, the decor is cluttered and frumpy. I suggest the Garden court at the palace hotel orTthe Ritz for an authentic classy High Tea delight.

excerpts: This time it was for a high tea time for a special 13 year olds birthday.
You start with a menu of teas (I love the strawberry tea) and different options of high tea and hot appetizers.
The high tea has a menu of sandwich's', each person picks two (I love the smoked salmon, and the chicken asparagus)
You can end your meal with a petifore (truffle), which might be a little too much after a high tea
high tea.author: Frankie F.
high tea.review:
I've been to Love Joy's Tea Room and the sister store, The Attic, across the street and each and every time it is an unforgettable experience.  This time it was for a high tea time for a special 13 year olds birthday. I've been here for Mother's Day, birthdays' for the young and more mature, this is a true gem!

You need to make reservations because it is a known spot. Once you arrive you enter a living room looking space with tea pots, doyles, couch's', tables, and coffee tables spread about.  I've sat in 5 different spaces  and each space is special and unique in it's own way.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  You can tell these ladies like what they do.  They will also take a picture of the whole table because you want to capture the moments spent in Love Joy's.  

You start with a menu of teas (I love the strawberry tea) and different options of high tea and hot appetizers.  The high tea has a menu of sandwich's', each person picks two (I love the smoked salmon, and the chicken asparagus) You also get cole slaw, salad w dressing, scones with butter cream and preserves and butter cookies.  Everything is so good and the hot Shepard's Pie is the best Shepard's Pie I've ever had, great balance of all ingredients. You can end your meal with a petifore (truffle), which might be a little too much after a high tea but it is a delightful treat.

I have never seen a guy in Love Joys so save this one for the special ladies in your life!

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for two and it included cole slaw, spring greens, scones, shortbread biscuits and a bottomless pot of tea of your choice.
You have your choice of four different sandwiches.
We chose the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roast beef and horseradish, fig and olive tapenade and chutney and english cheddar.
I have to say that my favorite has to be the fig and olive tapenade.
It was more on the sweet side rather than the salty but very yummy.
The cream and jam that I put on the biscuits were to die for!
I am not kidding!
A nice little addition to the High tea for Two.
high tea.author: Dominique H.
high tea.review:
I absolutely loved this place!! All of the antiques and different table settings add so much to the feel of this place. The staff was also really nice and helpful. We ordered the High Tea for two and it included cole slaw, spring greens, scones, shortbread biscuits and a bottomless pot of tea of your choice. You have your choice of four different sandwiches. We chose the smoked salmon and cream cheese, roast beef and horseradish, fig and olive tapenade and chutney and english cheddar. I have to say that my favorite has to be the fig and olive tapenade. It was more on the sweet side rather than the salty but very yummy. The cream and jam that I put on the biscuits were to die for! I am not kidding! It was so good. 

The sausage rolls were warm on the inside and had a crust on the outside that was super flaky. A nice little addition to the High tea for Two.  

At the end of tea time for us they had a tray of many different petite fours that you could choose from. I had the strawberry shortcake petite four which was good but I think by the time they came around with the tray I was too full to really enjoy it. My sister had the lemon one which I liked better.

This was a great place to relax and enjoy a cup of tea with some goodies. The set up was so cute and definitely a place I would like to go back to when i visit San Francisco again. Thanks sis for taking us to such a fun place!

excerpts: The food was fine, and at $16/person, the high tea is a bargain, but they don't understand proper tea brewing:
high tea.author: Laura R.
high tea.review:
The food was fine, and at $16/person, the high tea is a bargain, but they don't understand proper tea brewing:

You do not leave the tea in the pot to continue brewing. You strain the brewed tea into the pot. The Ritz Carlton and other (more expensive but infinitely better) places know this. 

You also use enough tea. And if you don't, you definitely do not "top off" the pot, especially without asking first. 

What an annoying hostess! She came to our table EIGHT times in the 50 minutes we were there to pester us about her "bottomless pot." I've never experienced so much fuss (and debate!) resulting in so little quality. 

I stopped her from topping off a pot that was already too weak, and thereafter had her question and debate my every reply. 

It was also unsanitary: Some pots and cups were so chipped, with the underlying clay so blackened, they were serious bacteria sources. Also unsafe: The mismatching is taken too far, with lids falling off and such.

And apparently you're supposed to figure out that the 2nd mismatched saucer under your cup is the only plate you'll get to eat off. Try eating salad greens with dressing off a 4 inch saucer, and then having to use those same 4 inches to cut and butter your scone.

Finally, as many others point out, the tablecloths are overly worn and the seating uncomfortable and overcrowded. The group at the place of honor, the couches around the coffee table in front of the mantle, were struggling not to spill everything in their laps and were clearly very uncomfortable.

We won't be back.

excerpts: Yes it's true, I have never ever had "high tea" and couldn't honestly tell you what it was until after living here for almost six years.

Being part of a generation the UK so quaintly labeled 'Generation-X', I feel that such age old traditions have somewhat passed us by (not that kids in the 60's or 70's particularly practiced large amounts of earl grey consumption - but I am sure they knew what 'high tea' was).
And as with anyone born in the early 1980's, I would imagine that unless you are from British royalty the chances are you didn't either.
high tea.author: Jack G.
high tea.review:
Sweet! Almost as sweet as the tea!

I'm from England, I was born there, grew up there, was educated there, experienced my first 'everything' there... except this. Yes it's true, I have never ever had "high tea" and couldn't honestly tell you what it was until after living here for almost six years.

Last march Oscar took me here for my 26th birthday lunch and it was lovely! It was not at all what I was expecting, completely informal and more like a trip to Grandma's house than tea on the lawn with the queen. Being part of a generation the UK so quaintly labeled 'Generation-X', I feel that such age old traditions have somewhat passed us by (not that kids in the 60's or 70's particularly practiced large amounts of earl grey consumption - but I am sure they knew what 'high tea' was). And as with anyone born in the early 1980's, I would imagine that unless you are from British royalty the chances are you didn't either. Ok moving on...

The tea and sandwiches are the up-most of British tradition (apparently) including white bread with the crusts cut off (I knew so many boys that would insist on that in junior school) a real porcelain pot of tea (sugar provided but not essential) and scones and jam for dessert (but obviously scoffing down prior to tea is allowed too - or instead of).

Definitely somewhere worthy of treating someone special too, the place is both unique and eye catching. A totally different 'cuisine' and likely something they have never had, or thought of having - and I can't imagine anyone who wouldn't enjoy it. This would do well even in the modern day, chain bar, chain store, chain coffee, chain England.

Enjoy, darling!

excerpts: we ordered the high tea for two &, damn, it was tasty.
high tea.author: Lizzy L.
high tea.review:
my momma loves her some tea. she has a whole shelf in one of her kitchen cupboards devoted to it, no joke. when she came to visit me this past summer, i knew i needed to find a tea room to take her to. i found Lovejoy's last minute & easily made a reservation for the next day.

as soon as we walked in, i knew i chose the right place.  Lovejoy's packs a lot of femininity into a small space, with lace table cloths & mismatched floral chairs.  we were seated immediately & our table had the most adorable "reserved" sign on it. we ordered the high tea for two &, damn, it was tasty.

chicken salad, salmon & cream cheese, artichoke hummus, & bay shrimp sandwiches- amaaaaazing.
coleslaw- it was coleslaw.
salad- basic but the dressing was yummy.
scones- i don't remember the flavors but they were still warm & they were delicious.
biscuits- could have been a little fluffier but the devon cream & preserves that were served with them made up for it.

in between stuffing our faces with all of those yummy treats, we went through three (yes three) pots of tea. we had the mango first, which was perfect and not too sweet. then we switched over to the vanilla rooibos... i swoon!! it was aromatic, smooth, & sexual. k maybe not sexual but it was really that good.

overall, my mom & i were both very impressed with the food, tea, & the service. Lovejoy's is really my cup of tea...hardy har har.

excerpts: Where to go for High tea and Scones?
Lovejoy's Tea Room!!
It's the perfect setting for a Girl's day out, Birthdays, and Baby Showers.
My girlfriends and I go to Lovejoy's every year; it's become an annual Girl's day out tradition.
We usually order High Tea for Two, but we make it for High Tea for Four.
Everyone gets to pick a tea and two sandwiches each, so it's perfectly even!
The presentation of all the tiers of tea sandwiches, salad and scones is so cute and elegantly organized!!!
Even though it doesn't look like it would fill up the 4 of us, it does!
Oh and the scones??
Yum!
Double Devon cream and jam on a warm scone?
So good
high tea.author: Karen L.
high tea.review:
Where to go for High tea and Scones? Lovejoy's Tea Room!!  It's the perfect setting for a Girl's day out, Birthdays, and Baby Showers. My girlfriends and I go to Lovejoy's every year; it's become an annual Girl's day out tradition. We all dress up in our cutest outfits and heels and meet at Lovejoy's for tea once a year.  

We usually order High Tea for Two, but we make it for High Tea for Four. Everyone gets to pick a tea and two sandwiches each, so it's perfectly even! The presentation of all the tiers of tea sandwiches, salad and scones is so cute and elegantly organized!!! Even though it doesn't look like it would fill up the 4 of us, it does! By the time the staff comes around to offer a petit four, we all have to say no, because no one can eat another bite! 

All the tea sandwiches and tea selections on the menu, whatever you decide to choose, it will be delicious! I've never had a sandwich I did not want to eat or drank a tea that I did not want to drink. I recommend the blood orange tea; it doesn't require sugar or cream and tastes fabulous on its own. All the tea sandwiches are mouth watering delicious, I cannot pick one that stands out on its own, they are all worthy of being ordered and eaten. Oh and the scones?? Yum! Double Devon cream and jam on a warm scone? So good, it's like heaven in your mouth! 

To make sure you get a table for your party, I highly recommend calling early for a reservation.  The place is small and they only keep one table open for walk ins. Your reservation is only good for 2 hours, so arrive on time to get the most out of your Lovejoy's Tea room experience.  

The staff is friendly, helpful and attentive, BUT they will give you subtle hints to place your order even if you're waiting for the rest of your party or to pack up the last bite of your scone (apparently they have cute mini bags just for it) and if you're really taking your sweet time, they're not afraid to ask you to leave and they do it with a smile!!! =)

excerpts: + We split a High Tea for One ($17.95), and the scone was FABULOUS.
It tasted like a biscuit to me, but slightly sweet.
With the butter and jam, it was perfect.
+ Our order had a really good mix of different tastes: sweet scone, the healthy greens and cole slaw, the savory and sweet sandwiches, the shortbread cookie.
I thought everything was very well-paired.
high tea.author: Vivian C.
high tea.review:
This was my first afternoon tea ever!  And it was awesome!  We walked in, and I could smell the estrogen in the air.  Ladies and more ladies.  Oh, and one dude who was having afternoon tea by himself.  That was cute.

Aite, here's the rundown:

THUMBS UP:
+ The service was awesome.  The waitresses are all SO SWEET.  They come and ask you if you want to have your picture taken. They wear their cute little outfits.  They smile a lot. We arrived one hour before our reservation time, and they still seated us.  Seriously, they made us feel totally welcome and at home.  
+ I don't know how I feel about all the pink stuff.  PINK EXPLOSION. It kind of weirded me out especially because I'm not a very girly girl at all.  But, in this case, I thought that even though the decor was definitely overdone, it still had charm.  Go big or go home, yeah?  Yes.  
+ The bottomless tea.  Not the bestest tasting ever, but it's bottomless.  Drinking equivalent of all-you-can-eat is always a plus in my book.
+ We split a High Tea for One ($17.95), and the scone was FABULOUS.  It tasted like a biscuit to me, but slightly sweet.  With the butter and jam, it was perfect.
+ Our order had a really good mix of different tastes: sweet scone, the healthy greens and cole slaw, the savory and sweet sandwiches, the shortbread cookie.  I thought everything was very well-paired.
+ Um, it's afternoon tea!  

THUMBS DOWN:
- The food, though well-paired, wasn't really spectacular.  

Final word:  Who actually goes to afternoon tea for the food?  No one!  It's all about just being there, pretending to be a lady (not easy!), and enjoying yourself with your girlfriends.

excerpts: The food is delicious - scones with cream, mini tea sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, and cookies are all included in the High Tea service.
And of course, there's the tea itself - pot after pot of any tea from their long menu (my favorites are the house blend and the peppermint).
high tea.author: DD B.
high tea.review:
My college alumnae group has an annual tea at Lovejoy's every year, and it's always been my favorite event (and yes, I went to a women's college).  The food is delicious - scones with cream, mini tea sandwiches, salad, coleslaw, and cookies are all included in the High Tea service.  And of course, there's the tea itself - pot after pot of any tea from their long menu (my favorites are the house blend and the peppermint).  And all of it served on lovely china in a cozy, pretty, exceedingly feminine setting.  

This year I organized the tea.  It was amazingly easy, and the women at Lovejoy's were so professional and pleasant to work with.  It's easy to see why there always seem to be so many groups here. They're also very accomodating: it turned out that one of the women in our group couldn't have dairy, which I didn't know about until the event.  No worries - they whipped up a delicious-looking salad for her, and she was very happy with it.

P.S. I have never seen a man in here, but I'm told that they have been spotted.  So for any man out there who's secure in his masculinity and wants to hang out where a bunch of women are, this is an ideal destination!

excerpts:
My friend and I had High Tea for two which included four crustless sandwiches (each sandwich cut into fours), two scones, two cookies, double Devon cream (same thing as clotted cream) strawberry preserve and a choice of tea that was continuously refilled.  
For sandwiches, we ordered:

Roast Beef and Horseradish (too little roast beef for me, and not the best roast beef I've had either)
Cucumber and Cream Cheese (because it's a must for high tea)
High Tea for two was $34.95 (I think that included the tax).
high tea.author: Sooj O.
high tea.review:
You must be fully aware in advance that this establishment is in Noe Valley (in the same manner that those who complain about the hipsters in Ritual should really consider that Ritual is smack dab on Valencia).  Truly, I have never seen so many pregnant women in their late twenties, early thirties in one single place.  I counted at least five pregnant women....and on further reflection, as pointed out by my tea-mate, where else would you hold a baby shower considering the ban on caffeine and alcohol during pregnancies?

My friend and I had High Tea for two which included four crustless sandwiches (each sandwich cut into fours), two scones, two cookies, double Devon cream (same thing as clotted cream) strawberry preserve and a choice of tea that was continuously refilled.  For sandwiches, we ordered:

Roast Beef and Horseradish (too little roast beef for me, and not the best roast beef I've had either)
Cucumber and Cream Cheese (because it's a must for high tea)
Hummus (I love having hummus as a sandwich)
Fig and Olive tapenade (the best of the four sandwiches...what a wonderful combination.  The sour sharp tang of olives pairs perfectly with the sweetness of figs)

The clotted cream was wonderful.  For those who have never had clotted cream...if you like butter, you will love clotted cream.  

High Tea for two was $34.95 (I think that included the tax).  

It's a very girly place, so wear something a little precious, catch up with your gal friends and giggle away over girl talk.

excerpts: That said, splurge on the high tea.
high tea.author: Krisztina F.
high tea.review:
Now I remember why I never reviewed Lovejoy's on Yelp! When you have 365 reviews, who needs one more? But oh well... 

There hasn't been anything I've ingested or imbibed at Lovejoy's that hasn't been tasty or worth the price. It evokes going to a dotty, dear old Aunt's house resplendent with doilies and chintz, and settling in to be well fed over a long period of time. It's shabby chic all the way. If you can't imagine yourself happy being surrounded by chintz....then you're me BEFORE I tried Lovejoy's. I've set my pinstripe suit and high heels and modern style on the shelf for the luxurious, melting, home-like atmosphere of Lovejoy's. 

Whether you're a party of 2 or 12 (I've been in both), I highly recommend reservations. That said, splurge on the high tea. The sandwiches are all tasty (I won't go into them here, just read all the previous gazillion reviews), the scones and cakes are lovely, the jams are fruity and sweet, and the cream...speaks for itself. Any tea you select will be steeped properly before it's served, so patience, dearies. Also, they have a lovely shop that's worth your perusal, and I always end up with a few little sachets of my favorites. Try the vanilla roobois. You'll thank me later ;)

excerpts:
( REAL MEN DO HIGH TEA ) there now I've said it.
 
With all the rave reviews what more can be said about Lovejoys.
You can enjoy a wonderful high tea for half the price most of the hotels
in the city charge.
Great atmosphere mismatced tea pots,chairs.tables,sofas etc.
Both women and men of all ages have a great time .

have room.
