excerpts: We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea.
As both of us were tea novices,
Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling.
The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that.
It was really delicious
and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before.
The salad was fresh.
I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches.
Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese.
The salmon and cheese really went well together.
Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough.
high tea.author: Amanda K.
high tea.review:
My friend and I both enjoyed our time at Lovejoy's Tea Room the other day. I loved the atmosphere of the place. The decorations that adorn the walls and the mismatched cups and saucers gives Lovejoy's a quirky and rustic atmosphere. I had this perception that tea service would be all proper and formal, but at Lovejoy's it was really relaxing. All the tables were quite close, but I still could have a nice conversation without having to shout at each other.

We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea. As both of us were tea novices, our helpful waitress recommended Tea Room Blend and China Rose Petal. Both were really yummy, with the tea room blend being a little heavier and more bitter, and china rose petal as really fragrant yet light. Our waitress would reheat and refill our tea as well, which was very nice. As for the food, before it arrived, I was a little concerned that I'd still be left hungry. Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling. The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that. It was really delicious and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before. The salad was fresh. I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches. Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese. The salmon and cheese really went well together. Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough. The scone and the teas were the highlights though!

I would definitely make a reservation if I wasn't coming in early. We went right when it opened at around 11 without reservations and we got a table easily, but we saw about half the tables already reserved for later. And when we were about to leave the room was packed and there were a couple people waiting outside. Also there is a two hour time limit, but we never felt rushed. I probably wouldn't come regularly since the prices are a bit high, but I'd definitely return for a special occasion or if I wanted to do something different with my girl friends or mom.

excerpts: I came thinking that perhaps I'd need lunch afterwards, but those teeny tiny sandwiches are surprisingly filling - you get a choice of 6 different kinds of sandwiches for the Queen's High Tea (we chose cucumber + cream cheese; shrimp + mayo; roast beef with horseradish crme; pear & stilton; egg salad; smoked salmon + cream cheese), light salad; a scone with double cream and preserves, cookies, crumpets and petit fours
high tea.author: Claudine C.
high tea.review:
4.5 stars...

Another bachelorette party highlight, this was the last stop of our weekend.   My girls thought of everything and ordered a "Queen's Tea" which included, for our table of 11, 3 enormous tiers of food. I came thinking that perhaps I'd need lunch afterwards, but those teeny tiny sandwiches are surprisingly filling - you get a choice of 6 different kinds of sandwiches for the Queen's High Tea (we chose cucumber + cream cheese; shrimp + mayo; roast beef with horseradish crme; pear & stilton; egg salad; smoked salmon + cream cheese), light salad; a scone with double cream and preserves, cookies, crumpets and petit fours... I was so full that I could not bring myself to finish my petit-four; several girls agreed likewise, and I got to take what was not consumed home.

All in all, a very delightful place to visit - the places settings are charmingly mismatched hodge-podge china pieces, service is exceptional and yes, their chestnut tea is one of the most beautifully unusual tastes you'll encounter.  I wish they had some for us to purchase and take home.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for Two (I think...) and had a wonderful time exploring different levels of heaven!
high tea.author: Christine C.
high tea.review:
It's official - this place is awesome! Man, writing this review makes me wish I was there right now!... (pics to come soon)

Came here for a going away tea for one of my best buddies. Thought it'd be nice to dress up and be girly - funnnn!

We reserved a table - which is highly recommended because they have many events going on ALL the time - and were greeted by a card holder with a sign that said, "Reserved for royalty." Cute. Nothing matches but everything is pretty, frilly, flowery, cutesy, charming, lacy... you get the picture! And that's what makes tea so fun! 

My friends ordered a cheese plate - which I am indifferent to because I don't like cheese but they loved it - and I ordered the curry puff. I am a curry puff weakling! Any kind, any day, curry in a flaky pastry - I am your girl! And it was mouthwateringly delicious as well as filling! It came with beans and salad but I didn't care much for those.. heh. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two (I think...) and had a wonderful time exploring different levels of heaven! The scones, the creams, the sandwiches, the fruit - delightful. We had the darjeeling and a vanilla tea? I can't remember but it was gorgeously scrumptious. The waitress came around with petite fours which were dainty and delicious! It was like biting into little pieces of art =)

What a fun experience with wonderful friends - just awesome! This is a great place to be!

excerpts: We ordered High Tea for four ($17/persom).
high tea.author: Roenna N.
high tea.review:
This is one of two tea rooms I've been too, and I'm going to say, this tops it.  We had reservations of course, highly recommended, as they seemed pretty busy from start to finish.  The team room was sooo, cozy and quaint.  Made me feel like I was in someone else's grandmother's tea room.  I liked how the tea cups and plates were all different, but complimented each other well.  The seating and the tables were all different.  Some benches, chairs, armchairs, etc.
We ordered High Tea for four ($17/persom).  Great selection of sandwiches, some coleslaw, salad, scones with preserves and double devon cream, shortbread and each of us had a tea selection.
We ordered some blood orange tea, which was my favorite!  There were three other ones that were good, but I was so taken by the blood orange, I don't really remember. 
It was a great place for 4 friends to get together, catch up, and enjoy a great filling lunch!

excerpts: Turns out I am also a complete sucker for High Tea.
A total carb, sugar and caffeine fest.
high tea.author: Molly T.
high tea.review:
This is my 10 year old daughter's favorite place to eat.  Turns out I am also a complete sucker for High Tea.  A total carb, sugar and caffeine fest.  Really doesn't get any better than that.  

The little sandwiches are always just right.  I even love the coleslaw.  But the clotted cream, oh the clotted cream - like butter and whipped cream got married and had the perfect child.  If only those wonderful scones didn't have raisins in them.  Hate raisins.  Love Lovejoys.

excerpts:
I always order the High Tea for 2 if I'm with a friend with this you get:

1 pot of tea (great selection from black, green or fruit teas)
high tea.author: J. C.
high tea.review:
There is no better English tearoom than Lovejoy's.  I had frequented this establishment before they moved to their new location on Clipper. The orig. location was a lot smaller and but now they are able to accommodate baby showers and still have room for parties of 2's.  I always order the High Tea for 2 if I'm with a friend with this you get:

1 pot of tea (great selection from black, green or fruit teas) my favorite is the Tearoom blend. Do it like the English and drink it with milk
 4 sandwiches (my favorites are bay shrimp w/mayonnaise, chicken and asparagus, turkey with horseradish mustard, and egg and onion)  
Cole slaw w/poppy seed salad 
Green salad with mandarin orange slivers with a vinaigrette dressing
2 raisin scones (OMG I've died and gone to heaven goodness)
Devonshire cream and strawberry preserves to go on those awesome scones and finally 2 shortbread "I can't believe its butter" cookies.

If you're into English teas this is the place to be.  The prices are very reasonable and staff is extremely attentive.  
Once you walk through the door you will forget all your worries.  Just concentrate on enjoying the time with you friend(s) and renew yourself spiritually.  Reservations are recommended.

excerpts:
On the menu: High tea for 2 is the best. 
Great place for get together with girlfrineds too. 
I will be back.
high tea.author: Ty N.
high tea.review:
A lovely place for tea, I love  this place, I would love to come back here with my boyfriend and introduce him to all kind of tea they serve.
On the menu: High tea for 2 is the best. 
Great place for get together with girlfrineds too. 
I will be back.

excerpts: The little high tea snacks alone give it 5 stars....
high tea.author: Angela C.
high tea.review:
This cute little tea room makes me feel like a bull in a china store.

I don't let that stop me though.  Its not very often that I get to go here but when I do...its tasty!

It is just so incredibly hard to not completely rub that devon cream all over my face and shovel hands of it into my mouth like a cave man scoops the last bits of food out of his bowl made of wooly mammoth bone (or whatever fine materials he makes to use as bowls).  

And those scones! oh those delicious scones made of flour and magic and other fairy like fantasy things.  I have never in my life been a fan of scones.  Id rather put a cake like muffin in my mouth.  But damn, these scones are amazing.

and what is better than one big sandwich?  How about a lot of little ones....arranged on a three plate tier?!?!  devine...

The little high tea snacks alone give it 5 stars....

oh yeah. and they have tea there too.

excerpts: Lovejoys has *true* "high tea" atmosphere and offerings.
At Lovejoys, spring for the High Tea spread.
The sandwiches are to *die* for... and you've NEVER tasted such cold-slaw and salad.
All of this comes to you on a Lazy-Susan (translation for the guys - a tiered tray) with delectable delights on several tiers.
Come with someone whose conversation you enjoy.
It's like a little bit of heaven.
high tea.author: Now V.
high tea.review:
It's about the scones! It's about the glorious antiques! It's about the lace table cloths, the warm customer service and chattiness of other patrons... It *is* Sense and Sensibility come alive! 

I once had tea at the Hotel Picadilly in Picadilly Circus, London. It was *not* as good as LoveJoy's by any means. Lovejoys has *true* "high tea" atmosphere and offerings. 

Treat yourself to a tea service or antiques teapot across the street in their little antiques shoppe. They also offer a bevy of loose teas for your enjoyment at home. It's the best.

I went with a sista-friend but, there were men there as well... Gorgeous mediterranean he-men but... I digress, LOL (tea, girl TEA!) Yes, ahem. Tea. 

All of your favorite teas (Darjeeling, Earl Grey) are available and some you may wish to try (exotic smoky black teas are my fave). I came home with several tins.

*** You can find exceptional tea pots at estate sales for a song! The last one I found came with sugar and creamers to match and they were from the forties!!! 

At Lovejoys, spring for the High Tea spread. The sandwiches are to *die* for... and you've NEVER tasted such cold-slaw and salad. All of this comes to you on a Lazy-Susan (translation for the guys - a tiered tray) with delectable delights on several tiers. Come with someone whose conversation you enjoy. It's like a little bit of heaven.

excerpts: High tea in SF?
High tea for four included eight tea sandwiches (picked from a menu of fifteen?!?), bottomless tea (eight or so choices here), salad, scones, devonshire double cream, jam, cookies and other bits.
high tea.author: G Z.
high tea.review:
High tea in SF? I was so surprised and delighted to be informed of the existence of Lovejoy's by my s/o's hairdresser. 

We made plans to go a weekend morning with another couple, and when we arrived it became apparent that things aren't exactly traditional in terms of decor. We were told we'd have an hour wait and offered to call us via mobile when a table was ready. We were seated in closer to 30 minutes.

High tea for four included eight tea sandwiches (picked from a menu of fifteen?!?), bottomless tea (eight or so choices here), salad, scones, devonshire double cream, jam, cookies and other bits. 

It was heaven. Service, aromas, atmosphere, everything. We stayed for around four hours... And never felt rushed to clear the table. 

Go. It'll do you good.

excerpts: We had ten girls go for high tea.
High tea was great!
Sandwiches were great!
high tea.author: Carol K.
high tea.review:
I will definitely go back to Love Joys! It was a very pleasurable experience.

We had ten girls go for high tea.  We had gone for two birthday parties.

High tea was great! Sandwiches were great! I dont like scones but I LOVED their scones! They were so moist! They have a great selection of tea!!

excerpts: My first ever high tea experience was right here at Lovejoy's this past Sunday, and I'm so glad I came here!
We chose the High Tea for Two with the cutest and most delicious finger sandwiches (Chicken Apple, Turkey Dijon, Egg and Onion, Chicken and Asparagus) -- perfect portions for a light brunch!
high tea.author: Katie C.
high tea.review:
My first ever high tea experience was right here at Lovejoy's this past Sunday, and I'm so glad I came here!  My girlfriend and I were on a mission to grab brunch in Noe Valley, and when Chloe's had a line out the door, we popped on over to Lovejoy's to see what the wait situation would be like, only to find no wait at all.  

Done and done!

We chose the High Tea for Two with the cutest and most delicious finger sandwiches (Chicken Apple, Turkey Dijon, Egg and Onion, Chicken and Asparagus) -- perfect portions for a light brunch!  Service was great and attentive and the ambiance made me feel like I was whisked away to my Grandmother's attic.  

I would definitely recommend this as a great alternative brunch spot -- you won't be disappointed!  ;-)

excerpts: We had the high tea for 2 which comes with a choice of 4 different types of sandwiches (2 of each kind per person
high tea.author: Jacqueline C.
high tea.review:
My friend took me here and I can't thank her enough! This place is so little and cute.  It's the perfect place to eat with a friend or a group of your girlfriends. 

We had the high tea for 2 which comes with a choice of 4 different types of sandwiches (2 of each kind per person so 8 total per person), scones with clotted cream, and a salad. You also each get to pick your tea. I chose the mango tea which was really fragrant. We had the chicken apple walnut salad sandwich, the salmon and cream cheese, the salmon mousse, and the pear and blue cheese. They were all good but my favorite by far was the chicken apple walnut sandwich. I had a petit four for dessert. It was good but probably better to look at than eat. 

I didn't see a lot of men here but I do think that if guys would actually give it a chance they wouldn't mind this place. But they also have meatier stuff like shepard's pie on the menu if you think that tea and sandwiches aren't going to cut it. 

Bottom line, this place has good food and tea. Yes, its a little pricey. But its definitely a worthwhile experience. I'd say try it if your curious and chances are you'll become hooked. I can't wait to go back to this place! I'm planning on taking my bridesmaids =)

excerpts: For many of us, it was our first high tea experience.
After we seated ourselves, our server met us with a warm smile.
She poured us two kinds of teas to begin with, one caffeinated, the other Vanilla Roibos herbal.
high tea.author: Anna Marie P.
high tea.review:
Well, at least we looked like we fit the part. 

My friends and I capped off the end of a bachelorette weekend with a tea party for 11 here. Dressed in our colorful sundresses, we giggled in anticipation as we walked to our table and saw the "Reserved for the Queen" sign. For many of us, it was our first high tea experience. After we seated ourselves, our server met us with a warm smile. She poured us two kinds of teas to begin with, one caffeinated, the other Vanilla Roibos herbal. She then came back with three-tiered trays holding crust-free sandwiches, salad, scones, and fresh fruit. It was all so lovely.

Less than eight minutes later, the tray on my end of the table, which I shared with three other friends, was empty. We scarfed down those yummy sandwiches so fast that our kind host came back with an incredulous look on her face. I'm pretty sure we broke the record for quickest disappearance of food. One of my friends was breathing deeply as if she'd just finished sprinting. The other was slathering the double Devon cream on anything she could get her hands on. The bachelorette's mother who was sitting near us kept offering me sandwiches from her tray because she and the others were nibbling at a normal tea party pace. I politely turned her down because I had held my own and devoured my fair share of the tray.

So much for a leisurely two-hour sitting. We were outta there in one hour. I highly recommend the sliced pear and stilton cheese sandwiches, the chestnut tea, and the lemon petit four. Just don't go with my friends and me, unless you got quick hands that is.

excerpts: We ordered the high tea for two.
Before I arrived I expected to leave hungry.
I mean how could some tea satisfy my empty stomach?
Boy was I wrong.
I was stuffed!
Delicious sandwiches.
Sliced cucumber, fig, smoked salmon, hummus, etc.
They were sooooooo good.
high tea.author: Lauren B.
high tea.review:
I love this place!!!!!!!!  Went here with my mom for mothers day.  We ordered the high tea for two.  Before I arrived I expected to leave hungry.  I mean how could some tea satisfy my empty stomach?  Boy was I wrong.  I was stuffed!  Delicious sandwiches.  Sliced cucumber, fig, smoked salmon, hummus, etc.  They were sooooooo good.  The scones with the Devon cream were scrumptious.  What a wonderful place.  The tea was amazing.  They gave us a bottomless pot.  I didn't know it was possible to drink this much tea in one sitting.
  Lovejoys definitely has character.  I love the look and comfort of this place.  Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go again.

excerpts: I've been to high tea at other tea spots around the country, and nothing compares to the feel you get at Lovejoys.
The sandwiches are nothing gourmet (white bread and mayonnaise!), and the tea is great but nothing exotic, but that is what they are all about.
It is a classic high tea place, not a new-age or vegan or hipster hang-out.
I love the mixes of tea cups, plates, and pots, the creaky wood floors, and the wait staff.
Definitely call ahead and make reservations if you want to go on a weekend, though.
high tea.author: Dana O.
high tea.review: This place is the best. It is so cute, and the perfect place to go and sit with your girlfriends, while eating sandwiches, scones, and endless pots of tea. I've been to high tea at other tea spots around the country, and nothing compares to the feel you get at Lovejoys. The sandwiches are nothing gourmet (white bread and mayonnaise!), and the tea is great but nothing exotic, but that is what they are all about. It is a classic high tea place, not a new-age or vegan or hipster hang-out. I love the mixes of tea cups, plates, and pots, the creaky wood floors, and the wait staff. Definitely call ahead and make reservations if you want to go on a weekend, though.

excerpts: It was 5 of us all getting the high tea which includes salad, scones, preservatives, double devon cream (YUM!), 2 mini sandwiches of choice, and of course tea.
high tea.author: kimy l.
high tea.review:
Love Joy transports you back to another time. The decor is quintessentially what I associate with English tea only more relaxed. Ther plates and cups are cute and nothing matches so it's interesting to look at the patterns of the teaware.

First place I've ever been where they serve the mini sandwiches with the crusts cut off. For those of you who have watched the movie "Brownsugar"

 I need you to be happy for me. I need you to be there for me, just like you asked of me. So - so I can have tea and eat cucumber sandwiches with the crust cut off!

It was 5 of us all getting the high tea which includes salad, scones, preservatives, double devon cream (YUM!), 2 mini sandwiches of choice, and of course tea.

We all shared our sandwiches. We got the smoked turkey & dijon, salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, chicken apple walnut, roast beef & horseradish, and fig and olive tapenade.

All the sandwiches were good and I was surprisingly full off the food. It 's a cute place to spend time with your girlfriends.

excerpts:
Favorites/the norm: High Tea for Two 
-beef w/horseradish, chutney and cheese, chicken w/asparagus & pear w/stilton
high tea.author: TC C.
high tea.review:
Great place for English Tea in the city!  I've been going to Lovejoy's for years and I even dragged my husband here recently and he liked it as well.  He said it reminded him of enjoying tea in England!

The decor is, dare I say, shabby sheek, but after many years in business it's leaning a bit more towards the shabby side.  My tablecloth was just a tad too worn w/one too many tea stains, and the pillows need some re-filling and re-covering by now.

The service and tea are still great though as one can tell by how packed it is at peak times, especially on weekends.  I always call ahead first to make a reservation or check to see if I can get a table last minute.
Most will love Lovejoy's for its simple charm and lack of pretension.

Favorites/the norm: High Tea for Two 
-beef w/horseradish, chutney and cheese, chicken w/asparagus & pear w/stilton---you will be surprisingly full if you eat all your sandwiches, salad, scones w/butter and jam and cookie!  save some jam for the cookie too =)
CHINA ROSE is my tea of choice and the Vanilla Roobois seems to be a favorite if you need to go decaf (what's decaf?!)

My last visit: there was a pretty annoying group next to me (half a dozen little girls hyped-up on sugar whilst their Moms chit-chatted with one another and let their girls run wild.  Not Lovejoy's fault, but beware of sitting next to a party like this if you are not entertained by children who are obnoxious and ill-behaved!  Ever heard of "indoor voices?!?!").  

Suffice to say, lots of groups here on the weekends in general, so bring your group and join in!!!

excerpts: Ok, soapbox aside, the devonshire cream and lemon curd is to die for, and if you can spring for it have the 'high tea for two' or the 'queen's tea'.
high tea.author: cat g.
high tea.review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?? Been here more than just a few times, my husband likes it too - he never wanted to come in the first place thinking he would starve to death but the food choices aren't bad and you *can* have a real lunch here and leave with a happy, full stomach. Just don't look at the bill. Anyway, all the tea connoisseurs out there will say that the authenticity of the tea experience here isn't quite authentic. But it comes close. Darn close. Close enough where if you know the real deal about tea you'll complain. But that just means it's cuz they're thisclose to the way it should be! Ok, soapbox aside, the devonshire cream and lemon curd is to die for, and if you can spring for it have the 'high tea for two' or the 'queen's tea'. If you love tea, sandwiches, and have never had crumpets, you're in for a real treat. 

Oh, and PS - it's all STREET PARKING only. Don't forget to call for a reservation or you'll be waiting outside for a while during their busier times.

excerpts: HIGH TEA
high tea.author: Bella B.
high tea.review:
Really good service. 

Quaint decor with many antique and vintage details -- table settings, tables, chairs, wall decorations, antique fine china and serving pieces.

The interior is small, and while the tables are close together, it felt cozy. I have to admit, that while walking to our table, I was scared I was going to accidentally bump and break something. (I have a hard time imagining someone maneuvering a baby stroller through here.)

I love the fine china! Who would have thought mixing-and-matching would work so well. 

I think it's the original floor, it's warped; while we at at the table half of us thought we were tilting forward, the other half tilting back.

You need to check out the bathroom, cute decor. (The sign about the original plumbing. Only one unisex bathroom in the establishment.)

I think the largest table holds up to 6 people.

I wouldn't recommend having a party for more than 4-5 kids. Kids should be approx 7 yrs or older. (If you're looking for a place where kids can play, take them to something like Chuck E. Cheese, or Super Frank's.)

Saw a father-daughter-grandmother tea time -- very cute.

HIGH TEA

Tea: Single Estate Ceylon was very good.

Sandwiches:
1) Smoked Salmon was delicious. Smoked salmon had a smooth flavor, and melted in my mouth. (Better than a bagel with lox!)
2) Chicken Apple Walnut was also delicious.
3) Chicken Asparagus was interesting. I didn't expect the asparagus to be pureed.
4) Egg & Onion. If you you like egg salad. (I'm not a fan of egg salad sandwiches.)

SCONES: to die for! Moist and fluffy, with delicious clotted cream.

Shortbread tea biscuit: yummy; but would chose the scone over the shortbread if given a choice.

Good experience.

excerpts: We always go for the High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Chris Q.
high tea.review:
My girlfriend and I have been here many times, and each one of them has been special.  This is one of those places where you feel like the people that own it and work there are in it because they have a passion they want to share.  They go out of their way to make sure your experience is relaxing, delicious, and memorable.

We always go for the High Tea for Two.  I recommend trying their Hazelnut tea, it's amazing.

For sandwiches, I'd suggest: Roast Beef & Horseradish, Chicken Apple Walnut, Hummus, Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese, and the Chutney.

Be sure to book your tea time a few days in advance, weekends usually book up quick.  However, last time we were late in getting a reservation, and tried calling them before they opened on Saturday.  We lucked out since there was a cancellation, and we got a spot right at the opening time.

Can't wait to go here again!

excerpts: We ordered High Tea for Two.
I was a little worried that even though it *sounds* like a lot of food, the portions would be dainty.
Not at all!
high tea.author: Heather T.
high tea.review:
I think this will always stand out in my mind as one of the best things I did on vacation in San Francisco.

I took my boyfriend with me on a mid-afternoon jaunt to Lovejoy's.  We ordered High Tea for Two.  I was a little worried that even though it *sounds* like a lot of food, the portions would be dainty.  Not at all!  We're both champion eaters, and this was enough to fill us up.  

I was absolutely in love with the Artichoke-Hummus sandwich, but we were both enamored by the Pear & Stilton sandwich.  The scones were so wonderful (the boyfriend prefers the American version of scones to these, the British kind, but I thought they were great).  The devonshire cream and strawberry preserves you can put on the sweet stuff is phenomenal, too.  The boy couldn't turn down buying an orange-chocolate petit four from the tray that was brought around by the owner.  That was also good.  :)  We had the Tea Room Blend-tea as well as Blood Orange tea.  Both were excellent (particularly the Blood Orange, which was surprising in its deliciousness).

Beyond the food, though, the atmosphere is above reproach.  It was so cozy, calm, friendly and just....happy.  I felt so at home here, and I've never been too much of a girly-girl.  The waitstaff was beyond attentive, but not at *all* obtrusive.  There were several tables full of people, but they still noticed when you needed a clean plate for your scone.  Our waitress complimented our sandwich choices.  I'm sure they do that all the time, but it was a lovely touch because it *seemed* genuine, even if it wasn't.  

I truly wish that this place existed in Madison.  I would go as often as I could!  Please take advantage of this gem of a restaurant if you can.  :)

excerpts:
Unless you're one of them, I suppose

Also, fyi, but this is just me being nit-picky, but if they're going for the Anglo-styley with the tea-room thing, they should know that in Britain sandwiches, cookies, tea and scones is called Tea, not High Tea.
High Tea is an early dinner kind of meal, usually for kids who don't eat late, where you eat something like baked beans and bangers, or fried eggs on toast.
high tea.author: emily c.
high tea.review:
Ho Hum. Average I'd say. Maybe I have certain expectations for tea-time as I'm English but I'd have to say Lovejoy's is only so so. Sure, it has a really nice atmosphere - quaint mismatched china, cute olde-worlde decoration - and the waitresses were nice, but where you get to sit in the room makes quite a bit of difference and the food, well, it just isn't that fabulous for the price. Nice selection of sandwiches, but they're teeny, and a good selection of tea, but the Devon "clotted cream" with the scones was horrible and not the genuine stuff at all. Maybe it's really hard to get here, but this was clearly not the real, delicious, super-rich, mccoy, and instead had that distinct UHT long-life flavor to it. Yeuk. 

Overall, cutesy and sweet place, but really overpriced for what you get and the food just isn't that great. Also, all the women there in their pastel-colored chanel-style suits and high-heeled shoes ooing and ahing over the bridal/baby shower gifts get a little annoying. Unless you're one of them, I suppose

Also, fyi, but this is just me being nit-picky, but if they're going for the Anglo-styley with the tea-room thing, they should know that in Britain sandwiches, cookies, tea and scones is called Tea, not High Tea. High Tea is an early dinner kind of meal, usually for kids who don't eat late, where you eat something like baked beans and bangers, or fried eggs on toast. 

Hmm, yeah, sorry, that was a bit nit-picky.

excerpts: We had the High tea and it was enough food and tea for us to leave satisfied and full.
high tea.author: Lisandra F.
high tea.review:
I have been here two times and I have had great food and service both times. 

On my most recent visit I reserved a table for a group of 8 girl friends for my birthday. They were all new to this tea room and the whole tea experience but they all raved about Lovejoy's for days. We had the High tea and it was enough food and tea for us to leave satisfied and full.

I tried many of the tea sandiwiches but chicken apple walnut was my favorite. The tea room blend and the pomegrante green tea were good.  All my girlfriends LOVED the warm scones with preserves and devon cream. I wish I had one right now.

Lovejoy's is a  great spot to gossip over tea with friends.

excerpts: For the three of us we ordered the High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Nicole L.
high tea.review:
Mismatched antique cups and an atmosphere just like a grandma's house. Lovejoys is an adorably cute tea room that is the perfect place to meet up with girlfriends to chat over tea and little snacks. I went to Lovejoys with 2 girlfriends and had an awesome time. We were seated on the red couch in the back which was perfect because it made us feel like we were chatting it up in one of our living rooms. 

For the three of us we ordered the High Tea for Two. We got a bottomless pot of tea, 4 sandwiches of our choice, scones, salad, and cole slaw. 

Service was fast and friendly, the 3 of us spent 3 hours hanging out at Lovejoys and the waitresses in no way made us feel like we had to leave. Instead they offered us tasty Petit Fours and allowed us to finish up our girl talk. I'd definitely recommend their little cakes, i particularly enjoyed the orange butter cream sponge cake one. I'd also recommend making reservations. The place gets packed quickly and only a few tables are available for walk ins and because they allow you to sit in there for as long as you'd like most tables don't clear out for a couple of hours. 

We had such a great time we've already made plans to come back again! Great place for gal pals to chat up a storm.

excerpts: High tea for one, yum!
high tea.author: M P.
high tea.review: Deeeeelicious, adorable, great service, a highly recommended experience - they were even gracious and welcoming when I showed up by myself without a reservation.  The tea selection is excellent, and the scones are insane.  High tea for one, yum!

excerpts: I had high tea at the Palace Hotel once, and it was $50 per person (!)
Lovejoy's is all the fun and sophistication of high tea, without all the snootiness and pretense.
Whether you're dressed as a pauper or a prince, you'll always be treated like royalty here.
high tea.author: Brendon C.
high tea.review:
This is probably my favorite place in San Francisco.

If you're going on a weekend, you must book WAY ahead, but it is SO worth it.

Why do I love it so?

- Fantastic teas (and bottomless tea pots)
- Delicious warm scones with double Devonshire cream and jam
- Tea sandwiches to die for
- Yummy petit fours
- Mis-matched antique furniture, cups and dishes
- AMAZING, ATTENTIVE, SUPER FRIENDLY service
- AFFORDABLE

A full tea service with scone, bottomless pot of tea, two kinds of tea sandwiches, and a tea cookie is something like $13.  I had high tea at the Palace Hotel once, and it was $50 per person (!) for lower quality product and service.

Lovejoy's is all the fun and sophistication of high tea, without all the snootiness and pretense. Whether you're dressed as a pauper or a prince, you'll always be treated like royalty here.

excerpts: I love going to high tea here.
high tea.author: J V.
high tea.review:
I love going to high tea here. Price is reasonable and the food and teas are tasty...

My fave tea sandwiches are: chicken asparagus, chicken walnut, and roast beef with horseradish. Yum!

excerpts: We ordered 5 "high tea for 2" meal sets which came with 5 different choices of tea and 2 sandwiches per person.
high tea.author: Kelly C.
high tea.review: At first, I thought the name - Lovejoy's Tea Room - was pretty funny so this would be a great place to have afternoon tea with the girls. Place opens at 11 and already a full house. Luckily, I reserved a table way in advance for my party and got the best seats in the house next to the lovely window. it was a nice set up. Lovejoy definitely had alot of attention to details which included cute plates and cups. My friend and I even flip the plates over to see where they bought them from (Japan and England). I docked one star for being too squishy. You almost feel like you're walking on eggshells in that place hoping not to knock something or someone over because it's so tight.  We ordered 5 "high tea for 2" meal sets which came with 5 different choices of tea and 2 sandwiches per person. The sandwiches fill us all up good and scones came after which really put me in a food coma. Overall, a great place to celebrate anything - promotion, engagement, birthday, etc.

excerpts: My wife got the high tea, which comes with sandwiches.
They were fine, but nothing particularly great.
high tea.author: Mister K.
high tea.review:
Went here for the first time with our 18 year old daughter. It was a fun time, and she loved it. The cuteness of the place, the outfits the servers wear...all that was just right, as you'd expect it to be. And, it didn't feel like a chain - more like someone's creative idea for a restaurant. They could even go more British...play some Henry Purcell in the background or something. Have pictures of the horse races.

Anyway, the thing to get here is the cream tea, or the tea with scones. The scones are good. My wife got the high tea, which comes with sandwiches. They were fine, but nothing particularly great. Right, it was probably Safeway bread, not some freshly baked bread. 

The tea is good quality. Perhaps not insane quality, but good quality.

I had the Stilton and pear salad, which was very good. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but perfectly good for the moment. I suppose you'd never waste a really top-notch Stilton this way, but for the salad, the cheese tasted good.

All in all, a fun thing to do, and we'll hope to come back.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea along with crumpets & petit fours.
It was a very relaxing 2 hrs, & was hard to leave.
high tea.author: Pam R.
high tea.review: I've been a fan of Lovejoy's since its original location @ Church/24th Sts. Great place to take my Mom when she visited from NY. About 3 mos ago 3 friends & myself went to Lovejoy's. We got there early thinking there might be a place for us. However, we just missed out as the tearoom was packed.  One of the owners was very accommodating & said for us to come back in about 45 minutes: there would be  table for us.  Sure enough, there was  Very nice table set-up. Excellent service. We ordered the High Tea along with crumpets & petit fours.  It was a very relaxing 2 hrs, & was hard to leave.

excerpts: We had "high tea for two" that come with 2 scones, 4 sandwiches, coleslaw, salad green, shortbread, and of course, bottomless tea.
high tea.author: Yoko S.
high tea.review:
My friend and I had a wonderful time there today.

We had "high tea for two" that come with 2 scones, 4 sandwiches, coleslaw, salad green, shortbread, and of course, bottomless tea.

I had black current tea, which I thought was perfect match with the food we've had.  Food was pretty good, but what I liked the best was the shortbread tea biscuit.  It didn't look like a lot of food as those sandwiches are quite small, but we were almost too full by the time we left the tea room.  It was $32 for 2 of us - reasonable in my opinion.

This place is pretty girlie as you can imagine.  Reserved seats have small card that says "reserved for queens."  Too girlie for guys unless they don't mind to be referred as queens.

Making reservation in advance is recommended since they seem to be booked almost every weekend.

excerpts: My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied.
We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches.
Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up.
The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd.
They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish.
high tea.author: Phoi B.
high tea.review:
Tea, cuteness, and mini-sandwiches... this place is right up my alley. 

Lovejoy's is a quaint little tea room that offers a variety of teas (duh!), sandwiches, and sweets. My bf and I had the High Tea for Two ($34) and the Crumpets ($5.25), and were more than satisfied. We tried the cucumber & cream cheese, smoked turkey & dijon, artichoke hummus, and the roast beef & horseradish sandwiches. Don't be fooled, these mini-sandwiches are bite-sized, but can really fill you up. The scones were yummy with the preserves and double devon cream. The teas we had were the Apricot black tea and the special during that time, which I don't really remember. The teas were nice and went well with our food, but nothing too exciting. The High Tea for Two also came with coleslaw, a salad, and biscuits which weren't anything to write home about.
The best part of our meal... were the crumpets with lemon curd. They were absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delish. Mmm : 9

Being in this place made me feel warm and giddy. I would definitely recommend Lovejoy's and hope to make a trip back there soon!

excerpts: The food was great, fun atmosphere for a non-stuffy high tea.
high tea.author: Brooke C.
high tea.review: Went here with my family for Father's day/birthday brunch and we had so much fun.  The food was great, fun atmosphere for a non-stuffy high tea. Very successfully gave myself a food coma with all the yummy sandwiches, scones and tea.  Great for a brunch with your girlfriends, but the men did seem a little awkward :-)

excerpts:
We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.
Everything was spectacular.

My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-

radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.
high tea.author: Carmen H.
high tea.review:
I'm no newcomer to afternoon tea, having even
experienced three in London - at the Ritz, the Savoy
and at Brown's.  Less than thirty minutes drive from
my Daly City home, I'm delighted to have experienced
Lovejoy's, at the recommendation of a dear friend
and colleague who has long been insisting that we
go there.

We recently treated another colleague for her birthday
and totally indulged.  What a lovely afternoon!!  We
splurged on high tea, even adding crumpets, a 
fruit plate, and some extra sandwiches...and there was
little left.  Everything was spectacular.  My friend had a 
mango tea, I had passionfruit - a nice change from my
usual Earl Grey - we shared several gourmet sand-
wiches - chicken and asparagus, roast beef & horse-
radish ( wonderfully piquant ), sliced pear and stilton
cheese, smoked salmon and cream cheese - to name
a few.  The scones, topped with clotted cream and 
lemon curd, though laden with calories, were devilishly
delightful.

At the end of our feast, we were served some scrumptious petit 
fours, followed by more tea, and happily waddled our way into the afternoon.

I purchased the beautiful strawberry teapot that held my
passionfruit tea....everything there is practically for sale...
at the teahouse or in their gift shop across the street.

Lovejoy's is a special place for an afternoon with the 
girls or one of the guys who appreciates some place 
special and unique.

excerpts: Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.
high tea.author: Audrey S.
high tea.review:
I feel very girlie when I come to this place for tea. It's very charming, very feminine. Shawls are thrown over couches -or on the flowery upholstered chairs, lace dollies are scattered here and there, and you drink from delicate tea cups, and eat tiny sandwiches (with the crust taken off). I like that the furniture and even the tea wear is mismatched. Sort of what one might expect in granny's old house. 

For me, the place feels like what I imagined when I had my tea parties as a young child. Well, except for the fact that the food and tea are real and so are the people (no, Mr. Brown Bear or Mrs. Rabbit in attendance). 

But Lovejoy's  can get stuffy. The place is always packed with people. The hot pots of tea also add to the temperature a bit. Reservations are HIGHLY suggested!

Anyway, I love the fact that this quiant place will "top off" your tea pot, thus insuring a very HOT pot of tea. The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . . gosh, everything is delicious.  

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.

It's a wonderful place to get away from it all and relax.

excerpts: We had Queen's Tea and High Tea - it was a nice combo of sandwiches, sweets, and fruit.
This is a cute place to come for girl time.
I just wish the place was bigger and not as cramped.
high tea.author: Tiffany M.
high tea.review: My sister, cousins, and I came here for brunch on a Sunday. Luckily, we came at opening time and were able to get a table. You definitely should make reservations because you probably have a 25% chance of getting a seated as a walk-in. I heard their reservations book out 1-2 weeka in advance. We had Queen's Tea and High Tea - it was a nice combo of sandwiches, sweets, and fruit. This is a cute place to come for girl time. I just wish the place was bigger and not as cramped.

excerpts: I've gone twice now, and both times got the High Tea with 3 of my friends.
It doesn't look like all that much food since it's so light, but I was surprised at how full I was by the end.
It's great to go with multiple friends so you can try different types of teas and sandwiches.
high tea.author: Kristen B.
high tea.review: This place is adorable, and perfect for a girls' day out. I've gone twice now, and both times got the High Tea with 3 of my friends. It doesn't look like all that much food since it's so light, but I was surprised at how full I was by the end. It's great to go with multiple friends so you can try different types of teas and sandwiches. And the scones, oh god, the scones - so so good! I would never come here too often (it's on the expensive side), but it makes a great treat.

excerpts: The best thing to order is the high tea for two, queens tea seems a bit overpriced for the additional candies you get.
The teas themselves are delicious, especially the seasonal ones.
high tea.author: Samantha C.
high tea.review:
For your next girls date, come to this place!

This cute little restaurant is definitely one my new favorite spots. It was packed with people when we came, but the hostess went out of her way to accommodate our party of 9, which was really nice. (hint, make reservations!) The best thing to order is the high tea for two, queens tea seems a bit overpriced for the additional candies you get. The teas themselves are delicious, especially the seasonal ones. And the scones were the best I've had since actually being in England - seriously.

The funniest thing we saw while we were there was a dozen 8 year old girls having a birthday party. They were all dressed up and I swear one even had on white gloves... Okay, that was a little scary. But don't let that scare you away from trying the place. I promise, you'll love it!

excerpts: My favorite is the High Tea, which comes with all that I mentioned above.
I've had the Queen's Tea but
high tea.author: Raquel U.
high tea.review:
I absolutely adore this place!!  After hearing so many good things, my mom and I decided to throw my sister a bridal tea party here last October.  From the moment we walked in, every aspect of the tea service did not disappoint.  Considering there were 13 of us, the service was prompt and definitely on point and we never had to ask for a HOT pot of tea as they were constantly topping off our pots.  What a concept!

Since that first experience, I've been here numerous times and I never get tired of it.  The mismatched furniture, dishes, tea cups and teapots... the lace and doilies... the variety of sandwiches... the salad... the coleslaw... the SCONES with double devon cream and jam... the shortbread cookies... and of course, the bottomless pots of hot tea.  Heavenly!

My favorite is the High Tea, which comes with all that I mentioned above.  I've had the Queen's Tea but frankly, I don't care for the fruit or the crumpets and if you change your mind and want a petit four, it can be added on for an additional $2.50.  I highly recommend the Vanilla Rooibos tea - my absolute favorite and I actually don't even ask for anything else anymore.  

Although it may not sound like it, you will get full off of what appears to be a petite meal.  The best part is that it's not that greasy, gross full but a satisfactory full.  You will definitely want to call in advance to make reservations.  They do have some open seating but it's first come first served and it fills up quick.  Be sure to plan to spend at least 1 1/2-2 hours - the service is not slow but you'll find yourself taking your time to savor the tea and food and enjoy the company you're with.  

Have I mentioned how much I adore this place?!

excerpts: My advice, get the High Tea (you're going to want the two sandwiches for sure) and split an order of crumpets with your favorite ladies.
Don't forget to ask for extra Devon cream.
high tea.author: Jane K.
high tea.review: I've been imbibing on tea ever since I can remember. My favorites are fennel-infused and sage (not together). After leaving home and not having Mom to steep tea for me, I went through a stint of settling on tea bags. Since moving to San Francisco, I graduated to loose-leaf and tea rooms. Lovejoy's is probably my favorite tea room in the area. I've enjoyed many girls' outings here as it would be remiss to bring a guy to these establishments.  I appreciate the quirkiness of the space staying true to its antique shop past, the 'Reserved for the Queen' sign that secured our table and the aromatic tea selections that can be enjoyed without having to mask the taste with sugar and cream. My advice, get the High Tea (you're going to want the two sandwiches for sure) and split an order of crumpets with your favorite ladies. Don't forget to ask for extra Devon cream.

excerpts: My husband and I shared a High tea for one (we had the smoked salmon and cream cheese and chicken walnut apple sandwich) and ordered an additional salad and it was just right.
I just adored the tea cups
so we went across the street afterwards and bought 4 sets for myself and 2 sets for my mother in law.
high tea.author: Taiga M.
high tea.review: This place is just darling- very cute and comfortable but be sure to make reservations. I've got the say though....finding parking on a sunny Saturday afternoon is pretty difficult so be sure to give yourself more time. It's a great place for a date with your lover or your girlfriends. My husband and I shared a High tea for one (we had the smoked salmon and cream cheese and chicken walnut apple sandwich) and ordered an additional salad and it was just right. I just adored the tea cups so we went across the street afterwards and bought 4 sets for myself and 2 sets for my mother in law.

excerpts: I threw a baby shower here for a girlfriend who really enjoys high tea.
Although a little too loud for a traditional baby shower, Lovejoy's was a great experience.
It is indeed a bit cluttered and a little grandmotherly in it's decor
but that's the part of the charm.
I really liked the hominess of the place, it brought comfort to me on that cold rainy day.
The tea was lovely, our table had Earl Grey and  Blood Orange teas.
We ordered an assortment of sandwiches which were all yummy.
There was actually quite a bit of food and we ended up taking some home.
high tea.author: Nou S.
high tea.review:
I threw a baby shower here for a girlfriend who really enjoys high tea.
Although a little too loud for a traditional baby shower, Lovejoy's was a great experience. 
It is indeed a bit cluttered and a little grandmotherly in it's decor but that's the part of the charm.  I really liked the hominess of the place, it brought comfort to me on that cold rainy day.  The tea was lovely, our table had Earl Grey and  Blood Orange teas. We ordered an assortment of sandwiches which were all yummy. There was actually quite a bit of food and we ended up taking some home. I loved the tea scones, served warm and with lemon curd and devon cream. My favorite sandwiches were roast beef and horse radish, egg and onion, and the hummus. 
The staff is very accommodating and gracious.   We had a tea leaf reader which added to the fun of the afternoon. 
We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely be back.

excerpts: we choose the high tea for 2.
it seemed like a steal.
we had 4 diff sandwichs, cucumber and cream cheese, love joy special (so far my fav there, its tuna, celery, and i think apples) chicken and walnuts,  and man we had one more sandwich
but i dont remember.
it came with a salad and a cole slaw.
we both didnt eat the cole slaw.
the sandwiches were good.
i think if it wasn't as busy i would have enjoyed everyting much more.
high tea.author: KK M.
high tea.review:
i've been wanting to try love joys ever since i've tried secret garden 2 years ago. my friends all rave how much better it is so finally me and the hubby went to try it this year

he's been trying to get reservations for over a week and finally on saturday they told him to just walk in and hopefully they can get us a spot. i can see why when i came in it was completely packed. so many gals with their baby showers and bdays going on. i guess since it was super busy everything was a lil lacking

i honestly didnt enjoy it as much as i thought i would like at secret garden. i had the mango black tea and he had forest berries. both teas were yummy and the sandwishes weren't as delicious as i have imagined. the scones were great!

we choose the high tea for 2. it seemed like a steal. we had 4 diff sandwichs, cucumber and cream cheese, love joy special (so far my fav there, its tuna, celery, and i think apples) chicken and walnuts,  and man we had one more sandwich but i dont remember. it came with a salad and a cole slaw. we both didnt eat the cole slaw. the sandwiches were good. i think if it wasn't as busy i would have enjoyed everyting much more.

excerpts: Our party was delighted by the High Tea for Two.
high tea.author: Jessica K.
high tea.review:
Came here for a little girls' afternoon out for my birthday. I was afraid we'd be turned away at the door for being late, but actually we were seated but had to wait at least 10 minutes before our server paid any attention to us. Another plus: we actually sat for about 2 hours even though I saw them ask a table of two to leave bc they "had other people waiting." On to the food part:

Of course, everything was cute and dainty and the only thing old lady-ish about the place was the musty/stuffy air that afternoon. Our party was delighted by the High Tea for Two. Scones smothered with cream and preserves were the group's favorite, but we were also pretty satisfied with the sandwiches, especially the fig and olive tapenade. 

Overall, it's a great place to meet up or celebrate a special occasion, although it is a very female dominated atmosphere. Parking wasn't too much of a problem. Like everyone else said, make reservations.

excerpts: I frequently stop by to have High Tea with friends.
The staff is by far the BEST the City has to offer.
high tea.author: Danny M.
high tea.review:
My favorite place in the City!!!

I frequently stop by to have High Tea with friends.  The staff is by far the BEST the City has to offer.  They are always friendly and helpful.

LOVE the selection of teas and sandwiches.

I enjoy stopping in on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon and unwind from the crazy week.  I have been to many other places in the City for tea, but none of them compare to LoveJoy's.

This place has a very homey feel...like going home to visit mom, or grandma.  A great place to go when the weather is chilly outside and you are looking for a nice comfortable place to relax.  There is always some type of party going on whether it be a baby shower, bridal shower, birthday party, or just friends getting together.

I can't say enough about LoveJoy's.  It is my home-away-from-home...my sanctuary.  I always know that I can go to LoveJoy's to relax from my busy/hectic life.

Thank you ladies for making my experiences at LoveJoy's a constant enjoyment in my life.

high tea.review:
We were 5 adults and 2 children for high tea and our 'royal' reservation saw us sat at a couple of sofas. 

The atmosphere of the place was quaint with its mismatched items, the food was tasty, but ......here are the drawbacks:-

 - the tea was VERY weak - we opted for the Tea Room Blend.
 - the 4" plates provided were impractical for eating salad.
 - a thimble full of Devonshire Cream for 3 of us to share .... is impossible, trust me, I'm a full fat whore as are other ladies in my party
 - and lastly, and most importantly, the woman serving us kept putting hot pots of tea right beside my 1 1/2 year old!!!!

In short, too twee of a tea for me.

excerpts: High tea for 2! =
high tea.author: Angela L.
high tea.review:
FOOD/DRNK:
1.) High tea for 2! = Comes with two pots of tea, choice of 3 or 4 type of sandwiches, two scones, two sugar biscuits, salad, and coleslaw. The food snacks are brought on this stacked tray, displayed nicely. 
2.) Smoked Salmon Cream Cheese Sandwich = Mmmm! I was hella craving smoked salmon the other day, so this totally satisfied
3) Smoked Mouse Sandwich = Hm, it just tastes like mushy smoked salmon spread.. it was good
4.) Hummus = O man this was pretty good
5.) Chicken Apple = This was alright. I'm not sure but I thought I tasted a hint of goat cheese, and I personally don't like goat cheese
6.) Tea = I forget what kind we had, but it was not anything fruity nor vanilla. Just some variety of black tea... But I must say it had a really nice aroma, and it tasted especially good with milk and sugar. Mmm! Basically a pearl milk tea without the pearls! Which lead me to wonder, were the English actually the first to drink milk tea? And not the Hong Kongese!? And why have I not had English tea time before?!!?!! 
7.) Scones = MMMmmmm!!! Oh man!! Fresh scones are pretty darn good! Specially with the ... butter? that they provided... and jam...
8.) Sugar Biscuits = just tasted like a dense sugar cookie :P
9.) Coleslaw = Ehhh how is coleslaw supposed to be like? I'm only used to the one from KFC hahaha. So this coleslaw seemed kinda plain and not much taste
10.) Salad = Um it had tangerines in it? Came with a little thing of Thousand Island I believe..

SERVICE:
We lucked out and got the server with an English accent!

ATMOSPHERE:
Very cute eclectic, mismatched antique furniture, mismatched English tea cups saucers and pots. The atmosphere is casual. Some table seating, and some sofa seating. Very cute for a group of ladies who want to catch up, or DEFINITELY major huge brownie points for a guy to bring a girl here for a first date.

excerpts: High tea here is unpretentious and delicious.
More important to the last vestiges of my masculinity, it is filling and plate lickingly delicious.
At this point in your meal when you should be wrestling with, "I'm a man, I had high tea
, I'm full, I think like being fancy...
this is so confusing," the waitstaff will come out with petit-fours as a knockout blow.
high tea.author: Aaron M.
high tea.review:
I'm a fancy boy - I love Lovejoys.  Yes this 6 foot tall, 200 lbs, one time varsity athlete (now just a weekend warrior) loves his lemon curd and warm scones.  Mmm...cry havoc and set free the drool!

High tea here is unpretentious and delicious.  More important to the last vestiges of my masculinity, it is filling and plate lickingly delicious.  Ok, so Lovejoys has far more doilies than a man should volunteer to be around, but the Queen's tea is outstanding enough to get me to turn in my man-card for an afternoon of finger sandwiches every time.  

Men this is how it works when you get the Queen's tea (my recommendation).  First, you get an endless pot of tea (which means I drink several pots without realizing it and spend the rest of the day peeing) and choice of a pair of finger sandwich flavors.   I like egg and onion and pear and gorgonzola the best, but I've had almost every flavor and they are great (although the shrimp one is a bit cat-foody).  The sandwiches come cut in little triangles, but you get a bunch of them so it's satisfying and delicious.  This is all served on a three tiered silver platter/tower, in which the top tier is covered in fruits and the second tier is where the real goodness hides.  Tier two has the warm scones (soft, hot and with raisins) on which you have the option of spreading clotted cream (think super-thick whipped cream), lemon curd (FANTASTIC), and/or fresh berry preserves (highly recommended to combine with the clotted cream).  There are also shortbread cookies in case your heart needed more butter and sugar.  The sandwiches are on their three, along with salad greens and some dressing.  

While you scarf up this bounty, over extend your bladder, and whittle away at your manhood, the waitstaff will come by to give you warm crumpets.  Crumpets serve as another vessel for the toppings on tier two.  At this point in your meal when you should be wrestling with, "I'm a man, I had high tea, I'm full, I think like being fancy... this is so confusing," the waitstaff will come out with petit-fours as a knockout blow.  Think bite sized cake.

To survive Lovejoys use my trick to maintaining the illusion of masculinity: take the women in your life here to celebrate their live events / hollidays.  They will love it, you get to eat the goodness and you can tell your buddies you were forced to go because it was your wife's birthday, because your sister had a wedding shower, etc.  Little will they know that you've turned into a fancy boy just like me.  

p.s. If you are going here, always have a reservation.

I've visited Lovejoys a couple of times wtih only one other person, and they were able to fit us in at the last minute, but the place is usually crowded so if you want to definitely get a table, you need to make reservations in advance. And, if you have a larger party, you need to book a few weeks out because this place is so popular.

In addition to all of the lovely English decorations, one nice thing is that while some parties are dressed up for special occassion, you don't feel uncomfortable in casual clothing or jeans.  It is a great place to take your Mom, to go with your girlfriends or for a young girl's tea party.

excerpts: My parents are super cheap and, while I had wanted to get the Queen's Tea (which included petit fors), my mother suggested that I get the (less expensive) High Tea.
For my birthday.
Sigh....
My parents jumped on board and we ended up ordering High Tea for three, with an endless pot of apricot flavored black tea.
The tea was smooth, not overly caffeinated, and super drinkable -- to the extent that two different servers remarked on how much we were going through.
When the food came (very quickly...almost suspiciously so), it was on a three-tiered tea tray, as it should be.
We had mismatched sets on a lacy tablecloth with a charming clutter in the background that soothed (rather than angered) my aesthetic sensibilities.
A good thing, since the sandwiches were sort of disappointing.
They weren't terrible, but the roast beef with horseradish was almost undetectable between the two layers of de-crusted wonder bread.
The egg salad was good and more like what I had expected, while the pear and stilton was skimpy as well...
to the point of the strong cheese's flavor being almost indistinguishable.
The scone, on the other hand was grand, and came with (one of the key elements to a tea!)
clotted Devonshire cream and preserves.

The shortbread -- something I am usually not that big a fan of -- was also very good, as was another surprise winner, the caraway seeded coleslaw (I usually avoid slaw as something that too often seems like a mere conduit for mayonnaise)!
The greens with some kind of citrusy vinaigrette were also tasty and fresh.
At the end of the meal, a waitress came around with a tray of petit fors, and Mommy asked if I wanted one.
I said I wasn't sure (always afraid to test the cheapness waters) and she said she was getting one, so I might as well...
Queen's tea after all!

I got the triple chocolate cake one, which tasted like it sounded: heavy and chocolatey; and Mommy got a Victorian wedding cake fors, which was very vanilla and very good -- shockingly good for white cake!
My parents didn't say too much about what they thought...
we have such different tastes that I think they were waiting to see what I thought before they said something conflicting (silly, but appreciated!).
I liked all the girls who worked there...
they were friendly and accommodating.
Unfortunately for them, Dad's caffeine caught up with him in a desperate way which resulted in a lengthy bathroom visit.
On the whole, I felt sufficiently able to pretend I was a gentleman's daughter (no help from actual Dad here) in 19th century England and, hence, will be back with the utmost dispatch.

The tables are covered with some old style table cloth, plate & cup sets are all very pretty, and there are different paintings, pictures, and other decorations all over the store and around the walls.
