I had Vanilla something tea, which is herbal tea, and my sister-in-law added another pot of tea that was caffeinated. The tea was really good, great aroma, and the sandwiches were good too. There was a long list of sandwiches, and we chose chicken asparagus, chicken hummus walnut, figs & olives, and beef and something (I forget). But of course, they are just sandwiches that you can make yourself.  Now the scones... mmm... so good! Very filling, but very good. They give you jam and butter for the scone, but the butter is very different. It's either home-made or flavored butter so it's so very delicious.  It's probably very fattening, but why would I care? I'm having a baby! We were so stuffed before we could finish everything, it cost us a total of $40 including tax & tips. The service was very nice too, so the overall experience was great!

Right across from the tea room, there's its shop where you can get the tea and the tea sets. It's also a very cute store.

We went on a Wednesday for lunch, and we thought it would be less crowded, but it was surprisingly full. We almost didn't a get a nice, cozy seat because we didn't have reservation, but the waitress was nice enough to work it out for us. So my recommendation is to always make reservations no matter which day you go.

excerpts: It was a wonderfully warm afternoon, and perfect weather for high tea.
high tea.author: Catherine Y.
high tea.review:
My roommate from college days set up a tea with the girls here.  It was a wonderfully warm afternoon, and perfect weather for high tea.  

The food was light and delightful.  The tea was not too strong, not too weak (I had the mango black tea).  The mismatched china was super-cute.  There are a couple of benches outside for early birds (such as myself) to wait.  They were generous with the seating, and gave us quite a spacious spot in the tea room.  They didn't rush us, and we hung out for quite some time.  

The only drawback was the occasionally snooty clientele; one such lady practically knocked over one of the wait staff carrying a very large tea service, which I was annoyed to realize was headed to our table.  OK, I realize you had to go to the bathroom and all, but watch it!  That's my food!  It's not Lovejoy's fault, but such a cute place will eventually draw some less than ideal customers. 

Price was about $20/person including tip, which I think is fairly reasonable considering it includes bottomless tea.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for Two with a Shepard's Pie on the side.
OMG the food was to die for and soooo outrageously delicious.
Loved it, my bf loved it.
I would definitely recommend going there for tea time without all the fancy pancy stuff.
It's super casual which made me like it all the more.
Thumbs up.
high tea.author: Linda X.
high tea.review: I took my bf there once last month, we had a 2:30pm reservation. First off, don't make a reservation that late because it will totally screw up your appetite for dinner. I actually didn't eat dinner that night. LOL. We ordered the High Tea for Two with a Shepard's Pie on the side. OMG the food was to die for and soooo outrageously delicious. Loved it, my bf loved it. I would definitely recommend going there for tea time without all the fancy pancy stuff. It's super casual which made me like it all the more. Thumbs up.

excerpts: I usually get the high tea (ok so no Bob Marley references) which has a scone with clotted cream and jam, 2 kinds of sandwiches (from a large delectable list), slaw and salad and a shortbread biscuit.
I always leave happily stuff and my eyeballs floating from so much tea.
As fair warning, the place is woman heavy with the occassional guy visiting.
The tea, the food, the space is so condusive to hanging out , you'll hang around outside chit chatting and visiting for another hour.
Best to make reservations because there is such a demand and space is at a premium.
high tea.author: Gwyneth T.
high tea.review: Baby shower? Bridal shower?  Hanging out with the girls? This is the place for you.   I usually get the high tea (ok so no Bob Marley references) which has a scone with clotted cream and jam, 2 kinds of sandwiches (from a large delectable list), slaw and salad and a shortbread biscuit.  I always leave happily stuff and my eyeballs floating from so much tea.  As fair warning, the place is woman heavy with the occassional guy visiting.  The tea, the food, the space is so condusive to hanging out , you'll hang around outside chit chatting and visiting for another hour.  Best to make reservations because there is such a demand and space is at a premium.

excerpts: Again, like the last time we all ordered the High Tea options, each getting to choose 2 sandwiches and a pot of our own tea.
This time I chose the salmon and cream cheese and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.
Both were pretty tasty, but the asparagus was mushy for me, but otherwise edible.
I probably wouldn't order it again though.
I did try my friend's shrimp and mayo sandwich and that was tasty also.
High tea is definitely more than enough for one person since you get 2 sandwiches (quartered, so you get 8 pieces each), plus salad, coleslaw, sugar biscuit and scone.
The scone was good, but don't forget to try the devonshire cream with it!
The servers were really friendly and informative anout their menu so it was all around a good experience.
high tea.author: Tess E.
high tea.review: I went here again for the second time this past weekend for my friend's birthday.  We were a group of 5 so she made reservations, which was a good idea since it was really crowded that day.  Again, like the last time we all ordered the High Tea options, each getting to choose 2 sandwiches and a pot of our own tea.  This time I chose the salmon and cream cheese and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.  Both were pretty tasty, but the asparagus was mushy for me, but otherwise edible.  I probably wouldn't order it again though.  I did try my friend's shrimp and mayo sandwich and that was tasty also.  I chose the black currant tea since I was in a berry mood (I drink green tea religiously every other day of the week) and that was pretty tasty alone, but even better with the cream/milk and a teaspoon of sugar to satisfy my sweet tooth.  High tea is definitely more than enough for one person since you get 2 sandwiches (quartered, so you get 8 pieces each), plus salad, coleslaw, sugar biscuit and scone.  The scone was good, but don't forget to try the devonshire cream with it!  The servers were really friendly and informative anout their menu so it was all around a good experience.

excerpts: Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.
All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.
high tea.author: Tera M.
high tea.review: Planned my best friend's birthday party at Lovejoy's for 6 of us, and ended up having 7 - they accommodated us with no problem.  The decor was cute, quaint and perfect for a ladies tea party.  It sort of reminded me of Alice in Wonderland with its mismatched cups and whimsical style.  Most of us ordered high tea, a few ordered light tea, and one person ordered the healthy tea.  All of the teas I tried were delicious and the food was great.  Warm, delicious scones and flavorful little tea sandwiches were the highlights, and they had plenty of different sandwiches (and teas) to choose from.  The service was good, and we all had a great time.  I would absolutely go back to Lovejoy's again for tea!  Oh, and the price was very reasonable.

excerpts: My mum would love this place....great for high tea.
Definitely secure reservations on weekends.
They were full two Saturdays in a row when I called during the week.
high tea.author: Yan M.
high tea.review: Comfortable and cosy little English tea house. Quaint place with lots of cute trinkets and bric-a-brac. The tiny sandwiches and scones were delicious however, the sausage rolls were mediocre. My mum would love this place....great for high tea. Definitely secure reservations on weekends. They were full two Saturdays in a row when I called during the week.

excerpts: I got the Queen's Tea which was a little too much food for me, I think the High Tea would be plenty.
I can't wait to go back!
high tea.author: Cathy T.
high tea.review: Yummy, yummy, yummy, yummy food! And so adorable! This is the perfect place to come with girlfriends to eat up and get lots of sustenance before hiking over a few blocks to 24th street for some serious shopping. I would also highly recommend this place for bridal showers or any kind of shower as it's just perfect. They're really accommodating, they were willing to change adjust one of their sandwiches for me as I don't like raw onions and they're very solicitous constantly checking to make sure you're ok. The food is really good and I like how they give you fresh fruit. I got the Queen's Tea which was a little too much food for me, I think the High Tea would be plenty. I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: 02.06.11 - high tea with one other, for my bday.
high tea.author: Jay R.
high tea.review:
02.06.11 - high tea with one other, for my bday. ordered the queen's tea

1 star for the choices tea (tried the passion fruit, it was great!)
1 star for the scones! yummy!
1 star for the great service (never had to ask for a refill of the tea pot)
1 star for the amount of food you get, make sure you go hungry
1 star for the take your time eating, enjoying your tea and company because they do not rush you out- so make sure you make reservations.

excerpts: This is the BEST place for high tea in SF.
I've been to other tea rooms, but Lovejoy's always comes out on top.
It could be because the service is on point.
Reservations are recommended.
Sometimes when you call, you'll get an answering machine.
The greeting will tell you if there are any upcoming dates that are fully booked, which is helpful.
If you leave a message, your call is returned promptly.
Its very girly inside, but its all part of the high tea experience.
The menu has good variety, but their high tea for two is my favorite when visiting Lovejoy's with my sis.
They have a great tea sandwich selection, and the bread is super soft.
high tea.author: Joyce G.
high tea.review: This is the BEST place for high tea in SF. I've been to other tea rooms, but Lovejoy's always comes out on top. It could be because the service is on point. Reservations are recommended. Sometimes when you call, you'll get an answering machine. The greeting will tell you if there are any upcoming dates that are fully booked, which is helpful. If you leave a message, your call is returned promptly. Its very girly inside, but its all part of the high tea experience. The menu has good variety, but their high tea for two is my favorite when visiting Lovejoy's with my sis. They have a great tea sandwich selection, and the bread is super soft. The salad is fresh and the scones come out warm! Then they give you petit fours to end the meal. Try this place and you'll never want to try another tearoom in the city.

excerpts: I strongly recommend that if you like tea, high tea finger foods, or girlie restaurants - this place is for you!
Reservations fill up long in advance around the time of holidays, especially Mother's Day.
I cannot say enough good things about this place.
It is a place that makes memories.
high tea.author: Evin B.
high tea.review: Entering Lovejoy's Team Room is like returning to your grandma's parlor. The decor is dainty, charming, and welcoming - all without being over the top. This is a perfect place for a bridal shower, baby shower, or girls' day out. Reservations are strongly recommended. The selection includes delicious tea sandwiches, delectable scones, and a wide variety of tea (herbal, black, and beyond). I strongly recommend that if you like tea, high tea finger foods, or girlie restaurants - this place is for you! Reservations fill up long in advance around the time of holidays, especially Mother's Day. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It is a place that makes memories.

excerpts: yay for high tea!
high tea.author: Janet K.
high tea.review: Eeek, so much fun at this place!  every time i've gone, i've had nothing but a great experience, friendly staff and great ambience.  it's fancy but not too stuffy or snotty.  great place to have brunch with your girlfriends or take a date.  yay for high tea!

excerpts: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office
and I have to say their food is delicious.
This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream.
Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.
high tea.author: Jelly F.
high tea.review: We ordered their sandwiches, scones, and crumpets for our high tea party in the office and I have to say their food is delicious. This was my very first high tea party and it was complete with strawberry preserves and double devon cream. Highly recommend them for your tea party because they have all tiers you can rent and most importantly they deliver.

excerpts: 2 High Tea for Two.
We ordered the Cucumber & Cheese ; Smoke Salmon & Creme Cheese (very tasty); Creme Cheese & Mando Orange ; Bay shrimp & mayo ; Smoked Turkey & Dijon..can't remember the rest.
The first 3 sandwiches was really tasty and filling.
The Bay shrimp & mayo and the smoked Turkey dijon are another story.
Yes they are filling, but the shrimp in the Bay Shrimp tasted very watery and wasn't wiped down enough.
As for the Smoked Turkey & Dijon, the dijon used was very spicy...has a lot of horseraddish, to the point where I almost choked and had to take it outta my mouth.
So if u likey the spicy, then you can choose the dijon & turkey sandwich.
The High Tea also had cookies, which my friends say were good, but I couldn't eat anymore after stuffing
myself w/ my diuretic tea and sandwiches.
Cost wasn't as bad, like $64 something, we split the bill so it didn't really hurt us as much.
All in all my Lovejoy's tea experience was ok.
I couldn't really give it a high enough score yet...
I need to go to other tea places to compare it to this.
high tea.author: Trish G.
high tea.review:
I went to my first Lovejoy's experience today with a couple of my friends and my friend's bf. Waiting outside till it open for afternoon tea, I can see the cutsey decor and all the mis-matched  Kate Spade tea dishes. The tearoom is very quaint, small and cozy...thought it was spatially larger from the looks on their website, but I was wrong. My friend opted to order us non-experienced tea partiers  2 High Tea for Two. We ordered the Cucumber & Cheese ; Smoke Salmon & Creme Cheese (very tasty); Creme Cheese & Mando Orange ; Bay shrimp & mayo ; Smoked Turkey & Dijon..can't remember the rest. 
The first 3 sandwiches was really tasty and filling. The Bay shrimp & mayo and the smoked Turkey dijon are another story. Yes they are filling, but the shrimp in the Bay Shrimp tasted very watery and wasn't wiped down enough. As for the Smoked Turkey & Dijon, the dijon used was very spicy...has a lot of horseraddish, to the point where I almost choked and had to take it outta my mouth. So if u likey the spicy, then you can choose the dijon & turkey sandwich.
The scones however...we're warm and fluffy on the inside and the mullberry jam that matched with it was perfect with the raisnyness of the scones!! I could eat those every morning (ok maybe not to the point I get sick of it.)LOL.
Each of us had our own pot of tea. My friends got the English Breakfast Tea, Earl Grey tea, Mango flav Black Tea and I got the Passion fruit flav Black Tea. I didn't try the others, but the Passion Fruit tea was ok. Couldn't really taste much of the Passion Fruit flavor as I'm used to in Japanese tea.
The High Tea also had cookies, which my friends say were good, but I couldn't eat anymore after stuffing  myself w/ my diuretic tea and sandwiches.
Cost wasn't as bad, like $64 something, we split the bill so it didn't really hurt us as much.
All in all my Lovejoy's tea experience was ok. I couldn't really give it a high enough score yet...I need to go to other tea places to compare it to this.

excerpts: So I wore some pearls, put on some white gloves and went to high tea with my friend.
And it did not disappoint.
We both got the Queen's Tea and it was A LOT of food!
high tea.author: Helen T.
high tea.review: I've been wanting to check out Lovejoy's for awhile now and finally had the chance a few weeks ago.  So I wore some pearls, put on some white gloves and went to high tea with my friend.  And it did not disappoint.  We both got the Queen's Tea and it was A LOT of food!  We sat there for over two hours, sipping on bottomless pots of tea and  indulged on sandwiches, petit fours, crumpets, and scones with jam and clotted cream (what I live for!).  The tearoom is very, very cute and quaint and it's a great atmosphere for a lovely get together with your girlfriends.

excerpts: We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea.
We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc.
It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable.
The scones came with devon cream and jam...
high tea.author: D L.
high tea.review:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time with a close friend on Saturday morning. We were greeted warmly by the waitress and seated promptly as we had reservations at 11am (which is when they open). The decor is adorable and the atmosphere is cozy, clean, and friendly. 

We ordered the High Tea for Two which came with tea biscuits, scones, tea sandwiches, and two kinds of bottomless tea. We chose a hot tea and an iced tea, and a variety of tea sandwiches such as salmon and cream cheese, chicken and asparagus, egg and onion, etc. It was way too much food for the two of us, but everything was delectable. We ordered a side of crumpets with lemon curd - I had never had crumpets before but it complimented the hot tea so well. The scones came with devon cream and jam...YUMMY!

The waitress saw my camera on the table and graciously asked us if we would like our picture taken. We were attended to very often as different waitresses came by to make sure that our teas were filled to the brim and the food was to our liking. 

I am definitely coming back here.. I think it would be a great place to take a girl friend out for her birthday!

excerpts: I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven.
high tea.author: Sharman G.
high tea.review: Lovejoy's is such a treat, and I'm so glad it exists -- if only they were open seven days a week and/or were open later! I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven. Be sure to get the Tea Room Blend.

excerpts: We had "High Tea
For 2".
We chose to drink the Rose Petal tea.
Along with tea we got an array of finger sandwhiches (salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, turkey & dijon, and chicken & asparagus).
high tea.author: Yolanda O.
high tea.review: iF YOU WANT THE ULTIMATE GIRLIE INDULGENCE...THIS IS IT!!! My BFF Caroline invited me to a private tea party for two for my birthday yesterday. We had "High Tea For 2". We chose to drink the Rose Petal tea. Along with tea we got an array of finger sandwhiches (salmon & cream cheese, cucumber & cream cheese, turkey & dijon, and chicken & asparagus). The best part of our meal were the traditional english scones....the best scone i have ever eaten in life no lie, like a mix between a bisquit and a scone. Then we ordered crumpets & lemon curd and sausage puffs a la carte. The sandwhiches were accompanied with a green salad and cole slaw. For dessert we each had a shortbread cookie and a petit lil cake that we inhaled in 2 bites. The service and experience was phenomenal. I adored every second of it. Go there with plenty of time to enjoy and relax. It took us 2 hours for our experience and we loved it. The tea pot was kept warm and full at all times. Great service as well.

excerpts: Fun place to go for high tea.
high tea.author: julie q.
high tea.review: Fun place to go for high tea. The detail of the scones and pastries was a bit lacking, not too fancy. More of a lady like lunch. BUT don't get me wrong the tea selections are great and just going with friends is so much fun you will get swept away! Lovely, just not fantastic!

excerpts: We picked High Tea for two.
We picked their blend and their strongest.
Their blend was described as smooth but ended up very strong.
The strongest ended up smooth????
high tea.author: Chris I.
high tea.review: Took my husband here this past weekend.  He went to the UK in the fall and has been mad about tea since.  This was the first experience for both of us so I'm trying to be reserved about my rating.  We picked High Tea for two.  We picked their blend and their strongest.   Their blend was described as smooth but ended up very strong.  The strongest ended up smooth????   The scones -- yummy.  I hate dried scones -- aka Starbucks.  The sandwiches were good, nothing to write home about.  We did try the pear & stilton cheese.  That was new and if you like blue cheese, this is something to try.  It was a great experience but I'll come back and edit this review when I've had a few more teas...

excerpts: We had the High Tea for Two, an excellent choice.
You get to pick two types of tiny sandwiches for each of you and then finish it off with a delicious scone with jam and devon cream.
Each person receives their own tea pot so you can share and try different varieties...if you are so inclined.
All in all a fabulous experience,  I will definitely be back.
The thing I like most about it is that it wasn't super stuffy and snobbish as some tea joints can be.
You can be completely casual or you can come dressed to the nines with your hat and white gloves.
Either way, everyone there seems to really be enjoying themselves and good vibes abound.
I want Tea EVERYDAY!!!
high tea.author: Jnzl D.
high tea.review: I LOVE TEA!!!! I've been planning to visit this place for years now, so you can imagine the hype that had built up in my head prior to finally making my way there to enjoy the fancy goodness. It did not disappoint! Ambiance was fabulous...crocheted doilies abound, beautiful china, comfy seats of different varieties. We had the High Tea for Two, an excellent choice. The thing I like most about it is that it wasn't super stuffy and snobbish as some tea joints can be. You can be completely casual or you can come dressed to the nines with your hat and white gloves. Either way, everyone there seems to really be enjoying themselves and good vibes abound. I want Tea EVERYDAY!!!

Lovejoy's Tea Room.
It's intimate and a great location to wind down and be surrounded by great company.
In regards to pricing, I personally think it a lot cheaper then having HIGH TEA @

high tea.author: Ted. G L.
high tea.review:
Once a month, my cousins and I get together for HIGH TEA  @ Lovejoy's Tea Room. It's intimate and a great location to wind down and be surrounded by great company. From time to time, we are  also surrounded by people hosting a bridal shower or celebrating some sort of special moment.

Their menu is amazing and is loaded with all the sandwiches you can possibly come up with and the list of tea selections cover everything from fruity tea to green tea to black tea....basically options are everywhere. In regards to pricing, I personally think it a lot cheaper then having HIGH TEA @ Neiman Marcus or @ The Westin St. Francis .

FYI: The only down side is PARKING. We all know parking in S.F can be a challenge and it may be the case when it comes to Lovejoy's.

excerpts: High Tea for Two was delicious and more food than we could finish, and the tea was  as good as any you'd get in the UK.
Highly recommended.
high tea.author: Lori D.
high tea.review: This place was a great find.  My friend and I were just looking for a decent lunch spot, and this was so much more!  High Tea for Two was delicious and more food than we could finish, and the tea was  as good as any you'd get in the UK.  Highly recommended.

excerpts: Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed.

The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios.
Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways.
The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch.
The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?
high tea.author: Gourmet G.
high tea.review: As rabid an Anglophile as I am, I detest tea . . . the beverage (although iced will do), not the lovely little afternoon break that's de rigueur in England, even to this day. In London, the best are offered on Oxford Street in Selfridge's - a grande dame of a department store overshadowed only by Harrod's - and Fortnum and Mason in Piccadilly. Here in the heart of Noe Valley we have this cozy  tearoom with its Laura Ashley-inspired decor providing a replica good enough to pass muster. Scones with strawberry jam and clotted cream (Devonshire's gift to mankind), toasted crumpets, and tiny cucumber, pear and stilton cheese, or smoked salmon sandwiches minus the crust evoke memories of every high tea I've ever enjoyed. The assorted place settings, mismatched furniture, and preponderance of doilies are eerily reminiscent of my friend Gerald's flat in St. John's Wood, and the waitresses look like extras in a classic film from Shepperton Studios. Pricey, but a lot less expensive than a ticket on British Airways. The general consensus among reviewers is that this is a place for the ladies who lunch. The way I see it, what better place for a group of guys from the Castro than a place that specializes in a Queen's Tea?

excerpts:
High Tea for Two is an awesome deal.

I didn't feel like I was truly having High Tea and felt more like I was eating in a San Francisco diner.

Parking is easy and I guarantee you'll have a heavenly High Tea experience
high tea.author: Carrie A.
high tea.review:
I went to Lovejoy's for the first time after reading the rave reviews here on Yelp. I usually go to Tranquitea in Pacifica and have experienced a NZ teatime. My thoughts:

Pros:
-TEA SANDWICHES & SCONES. Lovejoy's has an excellent assortment of tea sandwiches. You get to choose from 16 delectable little sandwiches, of which I enjoyed the Chicken-Apple-Walnut and the Chicken & Asparagus. High Tea for Two is an awesome deal.

Cons:
-LACK OF GENUINE CUSTOMER SERVICE. My mom went in to get a table while I found parking. Even though they had four women working, I wasn't greeted at the door and we were only asked how our meal was right at the beginning (when we barely took bites of our food). They topped of my tea without asking if I wanted it topped off (my idea of being wasteful). When the woman served us Petits Fours at the end of our meal, she picked the dessert up w/ the tongs and put it on my dirty lunch plate. Oh, and the Petits Fours were warm.
-PASTRIES. I've had meatpies overseas, and I really did not enjoy the meatpie here. I ordered the Curried Chicken, and it was definitely too spicy to be enjoying with tea. The pastry shell was not flaky and was quite soggy. It reminded me of one of those microwave pastry deals, but worse.
-AMBIENCE. The set-up was very cute; however, it did need some tidying up. Our tablecloth was stained with food and the place seemed like it needed some dusting. The area that had tea cups, teas, and collectibles for sale was a bit disorganized. This area drastically needed some cleaning up. Although some might appreciated the mismatched tea sets, I did not.

Although Lovejoy's has a nice assortment of teas, it wasn't anything that you wouldn't find at any other tea room.

Overall, Lovejoy's was not the pleasant little tea room that I envisioned it to be. I didn't feel like I was truly having High Tea and felt more like I was eating in a San Francisco diner.

DON'T BOTHER GOING HERE.

My recommendation: Tranquilitea in Pacifica. Parking is easy and I guarantee you'll have a heavenly High Tea experience :)

excerpts: The quintessential High Tea Room!
I absolutely fell in love with this tea room.
A great place to go with the girls or even bring some firm in their sexuality man-friends.
A great afternoon.
Their preserves were wonderful, I'm almost positive they make them fresh.
The tea, especially blood orange, was delicious.
I highly recommend the Artichoke Hummus sandwich for a tasty, vegetarian tea sandwich.
The service was great and we even got a 10% discount to buy a tea pot at their store across the street.
So much fun, go for the tea stay for the treats!

excerpts: We got the High Tea for Two plus one.
Three of us ordered two types of sandwiches each.
The fig & olive was not very popular, only one of us liked it.
The pear & stilton cheese was very good.
Chicken & asparagus delicious.
Roastbeef and horseradish a little too spicy for me.
Cucumber and cream cheese could've used a little more taste, but ate it all anyway.
Salmon and cream cheese, I didn't eat, but the other two loved it.
The teas--passion fruit tea was sweet and yummy.
Chinese rosehip very aromatic.
I got the forest berries, which smelled and tasted like cough syrup!
gasp.
I told our server I really did not like it, and she asked if I wanted a replacement :)
Hooray!
I got an earl grey instead, since that's what I know and love.
It was great.
high tea.author: Aiko L.
high tea.review:
Deeeelicious!!!!
Just went there today for the first time after having heard stories of wonderful sandwiches and teas. We made reservations for 1pm, but got there around 1:20, since our bart was running late (you can take the 24th/mission station, and walk about 10mins).
It was pretty packed when we arrived, but our table was there, w/that little "reserved" sign on it. The service was great. Our teas came out in less than 5 mins.
We got the High Tea for Two plus one. Three of us ordered two types of sandwiches each. The fig & olive was not very popular, only one of us liked it. The pear & stilton cheese was very good. Chicken & asparagus delicious. Roastbeef and horseradish a little too spicy for me. Cucumber and cream cheese could've used a little more taste, but ate it all anyway. Salmon and cream cheese, I didn't eat, but the other two loved it. The teas--passion fruit tea was sweet and yummy. Chinese rosehip very aromatic. I got the forest berries, which smelled and tasted like cough syrup! gasp. I told our server I really did not like it, and she asked if I wanted a replacement :) Hooray! I got an earl grey instead, since that's what I know and love. It was great. The scones were very fresh and warm. Cottled cream did wonders. I even had room for the cookies. YUMMMM. Would love love love to go back!
All three of us were soooo stuffed! But in a good way. Next time, I will try their Shephard's pie. Miss those...

Oh, there is only one bathroom. And don't use the lotion, it smells like shit!

excerpts: high tea is a must.
they have some of the greatest tea sandwiches.
one of my fav places in sf.
high tea.author: Sia K.
high tea.review: this is absolutely my favorite tea place.  it is great for a girls' afternoon out.  (probably a little frilly for boys)  high tea is a must.  they have some of the greatest tea sandwiches.  one of my fav places in sf.

AND feeling like your in grandma's living room then you will LOVE lovejoys!
its a sweet little place only to be reserved for those who will appreciate it...like me...
high tea.author: Amaly B.
high tea.review: i love, love, love, lovejoy...if you love high tea, scones with jam,  and delicious tea sandwiches... AND feeling like your in grandma's living room then you will LOVE lovejoys! its a sweet little place only to be reserved for those who will appreciate it...like me...

excerpts: Go for the High Tea or the Queen's Tea for the most variety but make sure you come with a hearty appetite.
high tea.author: Lisa C.
high tea.review: This was the first time I've ever had afternoon tea. I thought the place was really cute and the food was delicious. It's a bit pricey and not something you'd do often. But get a bunch of people together and it's great to way to spend an afternoon. Go for the High Tea or the Queen's Tea for the most variety but make sure you come with a hearty appetite. My favorites were the scones and crumpets. The decor is really quite ecclectic--assorted flatware, wall decorations.

excerpts: I did one of those semester abroad things in London, and one my absolute favorite things about the brits is their High Tea.
Hot pots of neverending tea accompany your high tea selections or you can buy just a pot for $8.
All the teas are amazing, and the servers come by every 10 minutes or so to check on the tea level and refill it.
Everytime
I've been there
I've ordered the High Tea for Two to share with my girlfriend, a freakin' steal at $34 bucks.

You select 4 types of sandwiches to share, a warm scone each, with strawberry preserves and double devon cream, 2 shortbread tea biscuits, coleslaw (with caraway seeds mmmmm) and spring greens/dressing.
I order the cucumber/cream cheese sandwiches (they cut off the crusts!!!)
, The Stilton and Pear, The Artichoke Hummus and the Tomato and cheese (I'm a vegetarian,
though I'm sure their meat sandwich selections are just are delicious).
All of this is served on a layered silver tray, which makes me feel a bit like a princess, I can't help it.
At the end of the meal, though I've always been stuffed, they bring around yet another beautiful tray with petit fours for an additional $2.50.
Omg, just get one, ok?
Everything about this place is enjoyable, calming, nurturing and delicious, and I feel again like I am in the UK.
I tried to think of a reason to give it only 4 stars, but I really can't.
An amazing place to bring out-of-town guests, or to enjoy a lazy sunday brunch with your love or a good book.
Oh, and their strawberry preserves would make sawdust taste like mana from heaven.
How the hell do they make them?
high tea.author: Robin A.
high tea.review:
