excerpts: I love the High Tea for Two.
Delicious and really fun.
high tea.author: Jennifer B.
high tea.review: I think this might be the girliest place on earth and I love it!  Its the best place to meet up with a girlfriend for a lovely brunch before heading down the street to Angel's for a mani/pedi.  I have always found the staff to be uber pleasant, great at making recommendations on which tea you might  like and so accommodating.  I love the High Tea for Two.  Delicious and really fun.

excerpts: We recently had a birthday tea with 9 girlfriends and it was by far the best high tea experience any of us had ever had!
high tea.author: Laurie G.
high tea.review: What an amazing experience!  We recently had a birthday tea with 9 girlfriends and it was by far the best high tea experience any of us had ever had!  We brought in our own champagne (they have a corkage fee) and we ordeded an incredible selection of sanwiches, fruit and salad accompanied by the most amazing scones and crumpets.  The service was the best any of us had experienced!  It was a rainy day in San Francisco and we endulged in our window seat and enjoyed the incredible food, tea and sweets...this is a must do!

excerpts: the teas don't taste as strong (i always get the tea room blend)
prices have gone up and service is not very warm or friendly, except for when you're asking for the check.
Saying that i'm very disappointed is an understatement!
tea room blend.author: Petra S.
tea room blend.review: Just like everything else that was good in the city, lovejoys apparently has become the latest sellout. The last couple of times i've come here i noticed that the new owners lack the British charm, the hospitality and most of all the portions that Lovejoys was so well known for under previous ownership. Portions have become incredibly stingy and trust me as i have been going here for nearly a decade. I always get the same thing, the egg and onion salad and smoked salmon and cream cheese sandwiches. There is barely any smoked salmon in there and the tiny layer that is there covers about half. The same with the egg salad being a very thinly spread layer and it was extremely over salt especially today. The crumpets have gone up for two pieces ($4 for one crumpet, seriously?!) the teas don't taste as strong (i always get the tea room blend) prices have gone up and service is not very warm or friendly, except for when you're asking for the check. Saying that i'm very disappointed is an understatement!

excerpts: I really like the tea room blend - a black caffeinated tea but there are plenty of other teas to choose from.
The sausage rolls are delicious and my favorite sandwich is the chicken and asparagus.
tea room blend.author: Vali G.
tea room blend.review:
I've been to Lovejoy's for the last 20 years and enjoy meeting up with my friends over a great pot of tea and sandwiches/scones.  I really like the tea room blend - a black caffeinated tea but there are plenty of other teas to choose from.  The sausage rolls are delicious and my favorite sandwich is the chicken and asparagus.  Don't forget the scone with clotted cream and jam.

It's a wonderful place to go to and I hope to enjoy it for the next 20 years or more!

excerpts: Tea Room Blend = good strong flavor

Vanilla Rooibos = nice full bodied option for an herbal tea
Apricot (decaf) = reminded me of potpourri
Genmai Cha = green tea with toasted rice and popcorn ( my daughter's favorite)
tea room blend.author: Jen A.
tea room blend.review:
I have been coming to Lovejoy's for decades! I remember it's original location when it was on the other side of 24th Street. The atmostphere and high tea experience have not changed a bit.

I am writing this review because I recently came with 8 of my friends.  Historically I have always ordered Earl Grey as my tea selection.  However, this time I made a point to try all the teas my friends ordered.  And, to my delight they were all very good:

Tea Room Blend = good strong flavor
Vanilla Rooibos = nice full bodied option for an herbal tea
Apricot (decaf) = reminded me of potpourri
Genmai Cha = green tea with toasted rice and popcorn ( my daughter's favorite) very tasty
Forest Berries and Rose Hips = herbal tea that tastes like candy (my other daughter's favorite)
Chocolate Truffle = very yummy chocolate flavor 

We each ordered the High Tea and were stuffed beyond belief.  

The staff is always on top of making sure your tea pot is always full of hot water!  Thank you!!

excerpts: There are dozens of tea options and the server recommended the Tea Room Blend, which I ended up liking.
The snacks were alright; the scone was probably the best part.
The experience was really fun
and I'd recommend Lovejoy's for a girls' get together.
At ~$22, the price is reasonable for everything you're getting.
tea room blend.author: Yi Z.
tea room blend.review:
The reservation process was so tedious; there were many emails back and forth before I was able to book a time about 4 weeks out. I was persistent and checked in for cancellations and luckily was able to get my time moved up by 2 weeks. They don't always answer their phones on busy weekends so email seems to be the easiest way to go. I wish they would have an online booking process and they can even consider holding a credit card if they are concerned about cancellations.

Anyway, when the day finally came, all 4 of us made sure to be on time. The menu was a bit overwhelming for a first timer like myself. We ended up getting high tea and I chose Pear & Stilton and Egg & Onion sandwiches with my course. There are dozens of tea options and the server recommended the Tea Room Blend, which I ended up liking. The snacks were alright; the scone was probably the best part. The experience was really fun and I'd recommend Lovejoy's for a girls' get together. At ~$22, the price is reasonable for everything you're getting.

excerpts: One was the Tea Room Blend and the other one was the Royal blend.
I prefer the Royal blend, because it was sweetier and fruitier.
tea room blend.author: Cassy H.
tea room blend.review:
4 stars for its ambiance -- Victorian and quirky, imagine Ms. Havisham from the Great Expectations. If she had a tea room, it would look something like Lovejoy's... filled with lace, Victorian furniture,English tea pots, etc...

3.5 stars for the tea -- My friend and I both got the "high tea", so we tried each other's tea. One was the Tea Room Blend and the other one was the Royal blend. I prefer the Royal blend, because it was sweetier and fruitier. However, both types of tea go well with some milk and sugar. 

3 stars for food -- The sandwiches were pretty average, nothing amazing. The scone was amazing, especially with the raspberry preserve! 

Overall, a good experience for $25 (tax and tip). I'd probably come back for another birthday party or if I am ever in the mood for a girly tea party.

excerpts: I have only tried the English Breakfast but have heard that the Tea Room Blend is also very good.
If you are a tea lover then you must visit Lovejoy's!
tea room blend.author: Janani G.
tea room blend.review: The atmosphere of Lovejoy's is a delight! The scones are amazing and even taste great after you freeze and reheat them in the oven. I have only tried the English Breakfast but have heard that the Tea Room Blend is also very good. If you are a tea lover then you must visit Lovejoy's!

excerpts: I didn't find the former very good, but I'd definitely recommend the "house" tea, the Tea Room Blend.
tea room blend.author: Josephine L.
tea room blend.review:
BREWING THE BAY: British afternoon tea

This might be the strangest five-star review I've ever written. It's strange because I don't think Lovejoy's is superior to its competitors in any of the areas I judge a British tea room on, and usually that has to be the case to warrant 5 stars from me. However, sometimes things are greater than the sum of their parts and my overall experience at Lovejoy's was five-star.

Decor and Ambience: Like many British tea rooms, Lovejoy's is dotted throughout with fancy, antique teaware. The quaint setting is accented with old photos and Christmas lights. There's ample seating, although reservations are a must and the seating can accomodate parties large and small. Expect a pleasant buzz of chatter at all hours of operation

Teaware: The saucers, cups and strainers have lovely Victorian designs with Mid-Century modern materials. The tea trays were a little disappointing--dull and metal

Tea selection: Lovejoy's offers some unique options like vanilla rooibos along with classics like English Breakfast. I didn't find the former very good, but I'd definitely recommend the "house" tea, the Tea Room Blend. Overall, I think the menu offers a good selection of British/Western favorites, but those hoping for good Asian options might be disappointed

Food: I found the prices a little high, considering the portion size, but the quality is definitely above average. I got the "Me Tea". The smoked salmon and cream cheese tea sandwich came on fluffy white bread and the salmon was moist and delicious. The scone was a little dry, but the accompanying Devonshire cream was plentiful and rich. I saw that Lovejoy's offered pasties and I just had to order a beef one. When I lived in London, I had the most delicious beef pasties and it's been extremely hard for me to find good ones in the US. Lovejoy's had a fantastic filling of flavorful beef and diced carrots with just the right amount of seasoning. The pastry shell was flaky, but the ones I had in England were thicker and crisper. I also tried two petit fours: the strawberry shortcake and the raspberry Victorian wedding cake. We were told the insides were marzipan (which I'm not really a fan of), but they were more like cake. Both were very sweet and delicious, but I think I preferred the strawberry shortcake

Service: Fantastic. Friendly, warm, attentive and efficient. All servers knew their menus inside and out, and were clearly passionate about afternoon tea

All in all, I had a wonderful afternoon chatting with my two Boston girlfriends who had just moved to San Francisco. Enjoying the company of good friends while sipping hot tea and nibbling delicious food--is there any better form of paradise? :)

excerpts: We had the Tea Room Blend (black tea) and the Passion Fruit Black Tea.
tea room blend.author: Aaron G.
tea room blend.review:
I've been dying to have a tea party since Jennifer C. told me about her experience in Seattle.  Does this make me an old English lady?  Cuz i totally enjoyed myself eating finger sandwiches, snacking on crumpets and scones, all the while sipping tea.  Yes, I had my pinky up a few times. Is there any other way to drink english tea?

The interior is quite antiquated.  I was waiting for the smell of mothballs to invade my nostrils, but it never did.  There are little knick knacks everywhere.  Antique galore might be a better phrase to describe this place.  I almost felt like i was invading an old lady's hang out spot.  

Jennifer C and I had High Tea for 2 + an order of crumpets.  The scones were super fresh and awesome... i could eat those forever.  The sandwiches were good but not anything special.  I enjoyed the tea.  We had the Tea Room Blend (black tea) and the Passion Fruit Black Tea.  

Other than that, everything was good.  I didn't find this place super special or super awesome.  It was my first high tea experience and i'm going to continue finding places to have my tea.  However, I now feel a lot more sophisticated now that I've done this.  I am a proper gentleman now.  My next goal is to be knighted.  Sir Aaron Gong has a nice ring to it doesn't it?

excerpts: The tea room blend was my favorite from the four my group ordered.
I added a splash of milk and a spoonful of sugar and it was almost like a chai tea, but lighter with a slightly bitter taste that wasn't bad.
And the little sandwiches were great!
The combinations of sandwiches may sound a bit strange, but they are all rather yummy.
Like who puts Oranges with cream cheese in sandwich?!
Genius, I tell you!
Make sure you make reservations because this place can get packed.
I can't wait to go back.
eww that rhymed.
tea room blend.author: Theresa D.
tea room blend.review:
Guys don't be scared of Lovejoy's Tea Room. Just man up and go in there and order the High Tea!( hehehe)

But seriously, this place is perfect if you want to spend an afternoon conversing with friends over some tea and good food. We ordered High Tea for two and the servers were great in helping us to choose through the selection of teas and sandwiches available. The tea room blend was my favorite from the four my group ordered. I added a splash of milk and a spoonful of sugar and it was almost like a chai tea, but lighter with a slightly bitter taste that wasn't bad. And the little sandwiches were great! The combinations of sandwiches may sound a bit strange, but they are all rather yummy. Like who puts Oranges with cream cheese in sandwich?! Genius, I tell you! Make sure you make reservations because this place can get packed. I can't wait to go back. eww that rhymed.

excerpts: our helpful waitress recommended Tea Room Blend and China Rose Petal.
Both were really yummy, with the tea room blend being a little heavier and more bitter, and china rose petal as really fragrant yet light.
Our waitress would reheat and refill our tea as well, which was very nice.
As for the food, before it arrived, I was a little concerned that I'd still be left hungry.
tea room blend.author: Amanda K.
tea room blend.review:
My friend and I both enjoyed our time at Lovejoy's Tea Room the other day. I loved the atmosphere of the place. The decorations that adorn the walls and the mismatched cups and saucers gives Lovejoy's a quirky and rustic atmosphere. I had this perception that tea service would be all proper and formal, but at Lovejoy's it was really relaxing. All the tables were quite close, but I still could have a nice conversation without having to shout at each other.

We got the high tea for two, which includes shortbread cookies, scones, salads, sandwiches and two kinds of tea. As both of us were tea novices, our helpful waitress recommended Tea Room Blend and China Rose Petal. Both were really yummy, with the tea room blend being a little heavier and more bitter, and china rose petal as really fragrant yet light. Our waitress would reheat and refill our tea as well, which was very nice. As for the food, before it arrived, I was a little concerned that I'd still be left hungry. Fortunately, I didn't have to worry about that at all, mainly because of their scones, which were really filling. The raisin topped scones came out warm, and while they were flaky and a little dry, adding the devon cream and jam more than made up for that. It was really delicious and I don't think I've ever enjoyed a scone that much before. The salad was fresh. I got the smoked salmon and cheese and the bay shrimp and mayo sandwiches. Both were nice, but I preferred the smoked salmon and cheese. The salmon and cheese really went well together. Ended with the shortbread cookies, which were nothing special, but good enough. The scone and the teas were the highlights though!

I would definitely make a reservation if I wasn't coming in early. We went right when it opened at around 11 without reservations and we got a table easily, but we saw about half the tables already reserved for later. And when we were about to leave the room was packed and there were a couple people waiting outside. Also there is a two hour time limit, but we never felt rushed. I probably wouldn't come regularly since the prices are a bit high, but I'd definitely return for a special occasion or if I wanted to do something different with my girl friends or mom.

excerpts: That's okay though...more finger sandwiches and Tea Room Blend tea for ME!!!
-P~~ *evil grin
tea room blend.author: Joanna R.
tea room blend.review:
I've been to this place since it was at the other location on 24th and Church.  Since then I have moved out of San Francisco, but I still occasionally return to this tea shop!!!  Their sandwiches and teas are wonderful.  Love their Devonshire cream and jam with the crumpets/scones.  And I have (to date) NEVER left the place hungry!

Note: Block off two hours for this experience of having a nice, easy comfortable tea and get away from civilization!!!  You *deserve* it!  (Also, make sure you go on a day when it's typical foggy San Francisco too!)

Of course, I can only go here with a female friend.  The decor is too "feminine" for my "macho" hubby to feel comfortable, even though he LOVES tea!  That's okay though...more finger sandwiches and Tea Room Blend tea for ME!!!  :-P~~ *evil grin*

excerpts: We had the Tea Room Blend-tea as well as Blood Orange tea.
tea room blend.author: Heather T.
tea room blend.review:
I think this will always stand out in my mind as one of the best things I did on vacation in San Francisco.

I took my boyfriend with me on a mid-afternoon jaunt to Lovejoy's.  We ordered High Tea for Two.  I was a little worried that even though it *sounds* like a lot of food, the portions would be dainty.  Not at all!  We're both champion eaters, and this was enough to fill us up.  

I was absolutely in love with the Artichoke-Hummus sandwich, but we were both enamored by the Pear & Stilton sandwich.  The scones were so wonderful (the boyfriend prefers the American version of scones to these, the British kind, but I thought they were great).  The devonshire cream and strawberry preserves you can put on the sweet stuff is phenomenal, too.  The boy couldn't turn down buying an orange-chocolate petit four from the tray that was brought around by the owner.  That was also good.  :)  We had the Tea Room Blend-tea as well as Blood Orange tea.  Both were excellent (particularly the Blood Orange, which was surprising in its deliciousness).

Beyond the food, though, the atmosphere is above reproach.  It was so cozy, calm, friendly and just....happy.  I felt so at home here, and I've never been too much of a girly-girl.  The waitstaff was beyond attentive, but not at *all* obtrusive.  There were several tables full of people, but they still noticed when you needed a clean plate for your scone.  Our waitress complimented our sandwich choices.  I'm sure they do that all the time, but it was a lovely touch because it *seemed* genuine, even if it wasn't.  

I truly wish that this place existed in Madison.  I would go as often as I could!  Please take advantage of this gem of a restaurant if you can.  :)

excerpts: The tea room blend and the pomegrante green tea were good.
tea room blend.author: Lisandra F.
tea room blend.review:
I have been here two times and I have had great food and service both times. 

On my most recent visit I reserved a table for a group of 8 girl friends for my birthday. They were all new to this tea room and the whole tea experience but they all raved about Lovejoy's for days. We had the High tea and it was enough food and tea for us to leave satisfied and full.

I tried many of the tea sandiwiches but chicken apple walnut was my favorite. The tea room blend and the pomegrante green tea were good.  All my girlfriends LOVED the warm scones with preserves and devon cream. I wish I had one right now.

Lovejoy's is a  great spot to gossip over tea with friends.

excerpts: Taylor's tea room blend is my favorite- very smooth.
Their pear and stilton sandwiches are delicious, and they even have shepards pie!
tea room blend.author: Kimberly F.
tea room blend.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is a cute little place to hang out with your girlfriends and sip some tea!

A quaint little spot to relax and enjoy tea in the middle of busy San Francisco!  The tea is very good, and the price is not bad.  The tea for two is good for two people... with it, you get your choice of tea as well as a dessert tea! yum!  They have a good selection of teas...Taylor's tea room blend is my favorite- very smooth.  Their pear and stilton sandwiches are delicious, and they even have shepards pie! :)

Afterwards, you can always go accross the street to their store where you can buy tea, tea pots, and the sort.  Great place to cozy up and spend time with friends!

excerpts: The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . .

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.
tea room blend.author: Audrey S.
tea room blend.review:
I feel very girlie when I come to this place for tea. It's very charming, very feminine. Shawls are thrown over couches -or on the flowery upholstered chairs, lace dollies are scattered here and there, and you drink from delicate tea cups, and eat tiny sandwiches (with the crust taken off). I like that the furniture and even the tea wear is mismatched. Sort of what one might expect in granny's old house. 

For me, the place feels like what I imagined when I had my tea parties as a young child. Well, except for the fact that the food and tea are real and so are the people (no, Mr. Brown Bear or Mrs. Rabbit in attendance). 

But Lovejoy's  can get stuffy. The place is always packed with people. The hot pots of tea also add to the temperature a bit. Reservations are HIGHLY suggested!

Anyway, I love the fact that this quiant place will "top off" your tea pot, thus insuring a very HOT pot of tea. The small sandwiches, the tea (I get Taylor's tea room blend), the scones, the crumpets . . . gosh, everything is delicious.  

Besides tiny sandwiches, crumpets and whatever else is served for High Tea, Lovejoy also serves what they call "Heartier Fare" which is your chicken pot pies, shepherd's pie, sausage rolls and something called the Ploughman's  Lunch.

It's a wonderful place to get away from it all and relax.

excerpts: The tea room blend is their specialty and it's definitely a good pot of tea.
I went into tea overload and was jittery for the remainder of the day.
But the experience definitely stays with you.
I highly recommend this place for a girls' weekend.
It's a great way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.
tea room blend.author: Alison N.
tea room blend.review:
Who knew that a cucumber layered with cream cheese in between 2 slices of bread could be so good.  Maybe it's because the crusts are cut off and the sandwiches are cut into cute little triangles.  The salmon, cream cheese and caper sandwich is to die for.  As are the scones.  Deelish!

The tea room blend is their specialty and it's definitely a good pot of tea.  I went into tea overload and was jittery for the remainder of the day.  But the experience definitely stays with you.  I highly recommend this place for a girls' weekend.  It's a great way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.

excerpts: I also usually pick up their tea room blend at the shop across the street.
I think you get a discount if you take tea at the shop, and their black teas are extra fine
tea room blend.author: Ms. Q.
tea room blend.review:
Best tea sandwiches in the city, hands down.  I've been to the Ritz, the Palace, etc, and this place takes the proverbial cake. Don't miss the crumpets.  Mmm..crumpets. With jam and Devonshire cream! Your inner anglophile would be so pleased.  

Plus, the staff was kind enough to accomodate a to-go order on a busy Sunday, only gently asking me to order at least a day in advance next time (note taken) without being the least bit bitchy about it.  I left with a platter full of tea sandwiches (covered in moist towelettes to keep them from drying), and even extra thinly sliced cucumbers for garnish. Wow, how nice.  I also usually pick up their tea room blend at the shop across the street. I think you get a discount if you take tea at the shop, and their black teas are extra fine so it takes less time for me to get a good, strong steep. 

If you know someone who'd appreciate some tasty, dainty sammiches but can't deal with the frou setting, a takeaway order would do nicely as it can be enjoyed in a more man-friendly setting. Just remember to order at least a day in advance.

excerpts:
the drawbacks:-

 - the tea was VERY weak - we opted for the Tea Room Blend.
tea room blend.author: ohreleigh ..
tea room blend.review:
We were 5 adults and 2 children for high tea and our 'royal' reservation saw us sat at a couple of sofas. 

The atmosphere of the place was quaint with its mismatched items, the food was tasty, but ......here are the drawbacks:-

 - the tea was VERY weak - we opted for the Tea Room Blend.
 - the 4" plates provided were impractical for eating salad.
 - a thimble full of Devonshire Cream for 3 of us to share .... is impossible, trust me, I'm a full fat whore as are other ladies in my party
 - and lastly, and most importantly, the woman serving us kept putting hot pots of tea right beside my 1 1/2 year old!!!!

In short, too twee of a tea for me.

excerpts: With the help of our patient server, we picked Taylor's Tea Room Blend and Yorkshire Gold and both were perfectly flavorful.
We shared both teas and ironically ended up preferring the one the other picked.
To every cup we added cream and sugar and seriously, I couldn't stop drinking.
It didn't help that our tea pots were refilled every 10 minutes!
tea room blend.author: Aisha W.
tea room blend.review:
This tearoom is wonderful! Reservations are a must but considering they have a cancellation wait list, this is a piece of cake! Despite the message machine saying they were fully booked for the weekend, I left a message including dates and times - requesting placement on the wait list - and my call was returned within hours! I immediately had a reservation and when another engagement popped up, rescheduling was super easy! Actually, I had to reschedule twice...but the woman returning my calls never expressed frustration at all!

So our tea date arrived and my mother and I happened to show up 10 minutes before our reservation. We found a parking spot immediately (perhaps it being 4PM helped) and were seated at once. A minute later, another woman asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we weren't because we were so busy taking pictures of the cute sign on our table that said Reserved for Royalty and were also settling into our lovely seats by the window! The room was packed with mismatched couches, chairs, tables, teacups, teapots and decor but this made it so much more comfortable. I felt I could talk as loud as I wanted, spill tea, whatever, and no one would notice. We finally decided on Queen's Tea (for two) and from the lengthy sandwich list, chose the chicken apple walnut, cucumber and cream cheese, pear and stilton cheese, and bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches. They were all deliciously different in their own ways, however, my favorite was the bayshrimp and mayonnaise sandwich. With the help of our patient server, we picked Taylor's Tea Room Blend and Yorkshire Gold and both were perfectly flavorful. We shared both teas and ironically ended up preferring the one the other picked. To every cup we added cream and sugar and seriously, I couldn't stop drinking. It didn't help that our tea pots were refilled every 10 minutes! Our sandwiches came on a bed of "spring greens" which had dressing on the side, and Queen's Tea also came with coleslaw (my mother said it was quite good), scones that had raisins, double devon cream, lemon curd and preserves, fresh fruit, crumpets, shortbread cookies and a petit four for each of us. The fruit wasn't too ripe, but that wasn't a big deal anyway, and we were full by the time the crumpets had arrived (fresh out of the oven by the way). 

Because I had so much tea, I had to use the restroom 4 times in an hour! After my mother and I left the tea room to check out their antique store, the Attic, I had to use the restroom again! Since Lovejoy's was closed, I didn't want to try using their restroom and I would've gone to a gas station but my mom was driving and refused to make another stop. So I went back to the tea room and surprisingly, the staff was so nice and didn't mind at all! Not even hints of irritation!

Definitely going back soon!!!

excerpts: Their Jade Tiger, and Tea Room Blend are heavenly!
I do adore this place!
tea room blend.author: Lindsey H.
tea room blend.review: I was hesitant in writing this review because I don't want it to become any more difficult to get a reservation on the weekend, but I also would be very upset to see them go out of business, ever. So do come here! It is truly a magical experience. The owner, methinks, is so very kind and makes you feel as though you are the only group of people in the world that she wishes to speak with. Their Jade Tiger, and Tea Room Blend are heavenly! I do adore this place!

excerpts: made for an enjoyable afternoon with a fancy tea room, playing dress up and downing those warm cups of caffeineted taylor's tea room blend.
what a mouthful.
the eclectic assortment of various tea services and mismatching teapots made for a well-loved, worn in feel.
tea room blend.author: Faye P.
tea room blend.review: Wonderful cup of tea. made for an enjoyable afternoon with a fancy tea room, playing dress up and downing those warm cups of caffeineted taylor's tea room blend. what a mouthful. the eclectic assortment of various tea services and mismatching teapots made for a well-loved, worn in feel. the scones were heavenly, soft and delicious. like little warm biscuits and definitely not the abhorred rock like ones. however baked goods that are really good, usually tend to involve a lot of butter. anyway, the cream and strawberry preserves combined with the scone and fruit was to die for. but then again, the warm tea, and warm scone made me really happy since it was freezing outside. some things just taste better in vivid contrast.

excerpts: Be sure to get the Tea Room Blend.
tea room blend.author: Sharman G.
tea room blend.review: Lovejoy's is such a treat, and I'm so glad it exists -- if only they were open seven days a week and/or were open later! I've been coming here for years, and am a big fan of their high tea -- the bay shrimp and egg and onion sandwiches are my favorites, and the scones are heaven. Be sure to get the Tea Room Blend.

excerpts: The sandwiches and salads paired very well with our tea, which was also selected with our server's advice, when we asked what went well with milk, we went with the Yorkshire Gold Black Tea which was a high quality blend of teas from Africa, Assam and Ceylon, it was a bold and brisk, full bodied tea with a smooth and even flavor.
My only issue since Lovejoy's prides itself on using a wide array of porcelain serving ware, my cup was way too large for a traditional tea steeper and promptly kept falling into the cup!
yorkshire gold.author: Jason F.
yorkshire gold.review:
A great place in a tony San Francisco neighborhood to act as if you are a citizen of Great Britain, thanks to the many options they have here, as you can enjoy a spot of tea as well as the traditional British-inspired dining options that accompanies them, Lovejoy's Tea is great place to kick back and hang out with friends or have a calming moment to one's self. 

A friend had been dying to enjoy a traditional tea room in San Francisco and I had sent him a list complied by the website SF.eater.com of the best places to enjoy afternoon or high tea in the city and Lovejoy's was one of their top picks for their unique yet homey ambience with a wide variety of traditional English teas and sandwiches. After doing some reading some reviews from my fellow Yelpers, I knew that Lovejoy's would be the perfect place to enjoy a pot of tea in the city for the very first time. My friend got a reservation for Thursday afternoon at 4pm, which turns out we didn't even need it as it wasn't packed at all at this time of day.

There are a lot of great options at Lovejoy's for tea and sandwich lovers alike. Since we were newcomers to all of this, we asked our server what she would recommend for two tea lovers who also wanted to try a lot of traditional British goodies and who also wanted to just sit back and take it all in. She suggested we get the High Tea which consisted for our choice of two tea sandwiches served with organic spring greens, cabbage salad in a caraway cream dressing, a warm scone served with preserves and Devon cream and a tea biscuit to boot. At $21.95 for all of that, we felt that that was a very affordable deal. Since she knew we were going to stay a while she suggested we get one more sandwich (at an additional $3.95) to go with this combination to satisfy our taste buds. We agreed and although all of the sandwich options looked plenty good but we knew we had to get the traditional sandwich that pairs perfectly with English tea, cucumber and cream cheese, in addition to the roast beef and horseradish and ham and English mustard options.

Served on a two tiered cake stand, with the scone on top and the sandwiches and salads on the larger bottom tier, everything tasted amazing. I loved the scone especially when spread with the Devon cream and preserves. The sandwiches were so tasty, I especially loved the traditional cucumber sandwich made with real English cucumbers. The horseradish gave the roast beef a real kick, so be wary when biting into them. The sandwiches and salads paired very well with our tea, which was also selected with our server's advice, when we asked what went well with milk, we went with the Yorkshire Gold Black Tea which was a high quality blend of teas from Africa, Assam and Ceylon, it was a bold and brisk, full bodied tea with a smooth and even flavor. My only issue since Lovejoy's prides itself on using a wide array of porcelain serving ware, my cup was way too large for a traditional tea steeper and promptly kept falling into the cup! Oh well I guess the tea leaves just made my drink stronger and therefore only taste better!

We were so enthralled by the food we wanted to try a couple more items after we feasted on our high tea meal. So we went with a chicken apple walnut sandwich and since our day was not all about cold mini sandwiches a my friend really wanted to sample some of Lovejoy's pub fare, so we went with the sausage rolls which were puff pastries with a sausage filling. The rolls were decent tasting, nothing truly spectacular here, as once again the sandwich was a highlight when sampled with tea. And what a wonderful tea it was, perfect with milk and sugar, they kept our tea pot filled with plenty of water as we drank all afternoon long. Just be forewarned they charge two extra dollars to split a pot.

I really love Lovejoy's with its interior filled with British inspired kitsch and wide variety of traditional teas and sandwiches. When the place isn't packed with customers, it is the perfect place to sit down and relax and contemplate life in a comfortable environment. You can check your cell phone from time to time, but this is a place to enjoy the tranquil beauty of stillness or actually converse with your drinking mate so to speak, so what people tend to do in a traditional coffee shop is a no-no, as well it should be. In the end, our bill literally came out to twenty dollars for each of us which when you come to think of how much food we ate and how much tea we drank is a pretty good deal. I think it actually cost me more to take public transportation to get to the Noe Valley location of Lovejoy's and I can't think of anything more quintessential San Francisco than that!

excerpts: As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea.
The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard.
My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny.
Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small!
The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people.
yorkshire gold.author: Joyce E.
yorkshire gold.review:
I was seriously envisioning giving Lovejoy's Tea Room a glowing 5 star review because I love all the cutesy quirky decor, but my best friend and I got the serious runs after visiting this place! I made a reservation for 2 at 2pm on a Thursday afternoon and my best friend and I arrived 15 minutes before our reservation. We were seated right away, but I was a bit disappointed that we were sitting so close to the party next to us because we could hear every single detail of their conversation. We were going to ask if we could move, but the place was packed and we didn't want to seem like snobs!

As per the suggestion of the server, we ordered the High Tea for one and added an extra scone and 2 extra sandwiches with the Yorkshire Gold Tea. The sandwiches we chose were Smoked Turkey and Dijon Mustard, Bay Shrimp and Mayo, Chicken and Asparagus, and Lovejoy's Daily Special, which was probably a ham with some sort of mustard. My BFF and I looked at each other thinking "this is just an appetizer" because the portions were very tiny. Yes, I do understand that tea is supposed to be light, but seriously, the portions were way to small! The Yorkshire Gold Tea was fantastic and definitely enough to share between 2 people. Also, the scones were some of the best I've had!

As we were eating and chatting about life, I noticed that I felt a tad bit hot halfway through. Thinking it was the tea and lack of ventilation on our side, I ignored it and started to feel this way throughout the remaining portion of our tea time. We paid, left, and my stomach started making odd noises. I ignored it until an hour passed and my BFF and I ran to the shiny porcelain throne and girl, let me tell you, it definitely felt like we were reenacting the scene from White Chicks when Brittany or Tiffany Wilson was holding on for her life when she had the quiche. Definitely NOT  a pretty look! It was my first time taking Pepto Bismol and I was not happy.

Again I really do hate to be that person giving 2 stars on a highly rated establishment, but Lovejoy's, you let me down. Would I come back? Probably not!

excerpts: I had the Dragon Well tea (green tea), but I also tried their Yorkshire Gold (black), China Rose Petal (
black flavored - it's sweet!)
and Darjeeling (black).
They basically give you your pots of hot water and the leaves, and instruct you briefly on what to do, aka steeping it for a minute.
yorkshire gold.author: Colleen M.
yorkshire gold.review:
Oh how I love tea and scones.

I made a reservation for five at 1:30 p.m. about two days in advance; two arrived on time, and like proper ladies, the rest of us arrived around 15-20 minutes late. Lovejoy's is really the spitting image of grandma's place, only blown up and with more tables.

Our server was dressed to impress in an old school peasant dress and greeted us with a warm smile. The menus were just printed on paper, but whatever, we were sitting on floral couches and little chairs for chrissakes. Paper menus are perfect.

What we ordered: high tea for two ($34), cream tea ($12.95), and savory tea ($13.95). Each order came with a pot of unlimited tea, which was amazing. The tea cups, pot, plates and whatnot were impossibly fitting; matching tea sets with some mismatched but homey utensils. A couple tea stains here and there, but there's no complaining from me! 

I had the Dragon Well tea (green tea), but I also tried their Yorkshire Gold (black), China Rose Petal (black flavored - it's sweet!) and Darjeeling (black). They basically give you your pots of hot water and the leaves, and instruct you briefly on what to do, aka steeping it for a minute. Oh, and of course there's milk and sugar on the table.

Oh gosh, such good tea! The China Rose Petal turned out to be my favorite of the day, and don't even get me started on the scones with lemon curd and devon cream.... An absolute must try.

The sandwiches were light, cute, and oh-so yummy. We decided to get the cucumber and cream cheese (I don't really recommend it... You can make it yourself, but it's cute...) and their daily special, some sort of curry-like sandwich - which blew my mind. I wish I knew what the name of it was now. 
If you eat a lot, perhaps you should get your own order of sandwiches. 

The store's right across the street, and I've already promptly bought a jar of their lemon curd. 

Keep in mind:
 It's $1 to share your tea.
And calling in to reserve seats never hurt anyone.

excerpts: For tea we chose the Yorkshire Gold, a favorite of my mom's.
They also offer you a coupon for their antiques/tea shop across the way which we used to buy some Yorkshire Gold for the road as well as a pair of their dainty little tea strainers.
yorkshire gold.author: Marissa C.
yorkshire gold.review:
Holy heart-attack on a plate, Batman!  Let me just preface this with a warning: if you get the Queen's Tea be prepared to be rolled out of this place from glutting yourself on sumptuous Devon cream and a sundry of other tasty, decadent bites!

I took my mom here recently for her birthday and dropped some major dollar for us to both have the Queen's Tea. For sandwiches we picked cucumber and cream cheese (classic), salmon and capers (amazing), chicken and mango chutney (daily special), and one other with a blue cheese that I can't recall.  For tea we chose the Yorkshire Gold, a favorite of my mom's.  Then came the three-tiered wonder with our sandwiches, cookies, fruit, greens and scones.  And of course, lemon curd and Devon cream.  

As if that wasn't enough, freshly baked crumpets arrived, taunting our already filled bellies.  And the petit four and brownie after that simply mocked us in our naivete!

The waitstaff are superb here and totally accommodating from start to finish. We arrived a little early for our reservations (which you will need!) and seated us at an empty table for a larger party that had not yet arrived while ours was being cleared and prepped so we didn't have to wait out in the cold rain.

Though this tea service does cost a handsome price, I think its well-worth the extra coin.  They also offer you a coupon for their antiques/tea shop across the way which we used to buy some Yorkshire Gold for the road as well as a pair of their dainty little tea strainers.

excerpts: and I ordered a Shepherd's Pie, two teas (Yorkshire Gold Black Tea & Pomegranate Green Tea), & various tea sandwiches, which were all very satisfactory and delicious.
I'd recommend the Yorkshire Gold, as the Pomegranate Green wasn't really for me.
The waitress said the Yorkshire Gold kind of resembles a coffee or English tea flavor, and I really can't describe it in words
but I thought it was pretty good.
The Shepherd's Pie is cooked in a loaf pan with a baked potato layer on the very top, followed by a mashed potato composition on the bottom mixed with peas and ground beef.
It was a great appetizer to split among the four of us!
The tea sandwiches served as the perfect snack as well, but definitely are not enough to fill you up.
We got the salmon mousse tea sandwiches and the bay shrimp tea sandwiches, and personally I like the bay shrimp tea sandwiches more.
yorkshire gold.author: Michelle S.
yorkshire gold.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room is the first tea room that I've ever been to and I found it absolutely exquisite. The decorations perfectly suit the theme of a real tea party, and for some reason it strongly reminds me of that teacup ride back in Disneyland, which of course would make anyone think happy thoughts.

Anyways, my party of four and I ordered a Shepherd's Pie, two teas (Yorkshire Gold Black Tea & Pomegranate Green Tea), & various tea sandwiches, which were all very satisfactory and delicious. I'd recommend the Yorkshire Gold, as the Pomegranate Green wasn't really for me. The waitress said the Yorkshire Gold kind of resembles a coffee or English tea flavor, and I really can't describe it in words but I thought it was pretty good. The Shepherd's Pie is cooked in a loaf pan with a baked potato layer on the very top, followed by a mashed potato composition on the bottom mixed with peas and ground beef. It was a great appetizer to split among the four of us! The tea sandwiches served as the perfect snack as well, but definitely are not enough to fill you up. We got the salmon mousse tea sandwiches and the bay shrimp tea sandwiches, and personally I like the bay shrimp tea sandwiches more. The salmon mousse tea sandwiches have goat or feta cheese in it, which I particularly am not a fan of.

Overall, this place deserves 5/5 stars for exquisite customer service and a fancy decorative interior :)

excerpts: All were good but the Yorkshire gold really was excellent.
yorkshire gold.author: Kym P.
yorkshire gold.review:
I love it! Came here as a party of five for my birthday this Sunday. I made reservations a couple of weeks in advance so we were lucky and had no trouble getting a table.

The service was excellent! The sandwiches were yum! We had the cheese and chutney, salmon mousse, chicken and asparagus and cream cheese and cucumber. For teas we tried the Yorkshire blend (a personal favourite of mine since my college days in West Yorkshire) and the Darjeeling. All were good but the Yorkshire gold really was excellent.

My only slight qualm was the mismatches furniture; I've been to plenty of tea places with mismatched furniture and tableware and it's hella cute but there were certain combinations that kinda made the zen feel weird.

Either way I'll be going back!

excerpts: My boyfriend, who is more of the coffee type, enjoys the Yorkshire Gold tea.
yorkshire gold.author: Renee M.
yorkshire gold.review:
*Sigh* My cozy, eclectic hideaway.

Layered doily tablecloths, mismatched utensils, and antique photographs occupy every nook and cranny of this English-style teahouse.  It is the perfect introduction to an afternoon abundant with delicious food, comforting tea, and good conversation.  

My boyfriend and I tend to go for the High Tea for Two.  For about $35, we each get coleslaw, salad, a choice of two sandwiches, scones, cookies, and our own individual pots of bottomless tea.  The pear and stilton sandwich is my favorite, but if you eat anything make sure you try the scones!  

My boyfriend, who is more of the coffee type, enjoys the Yorkshire Gold tea.  I have tried both the pumpkin spice and cha cha cha teas and like them as well.  

We have had the same server on both of our visits.  She has been very good about explaining the menu layout and recommending items.  Our teapots always stay hot and full.  Service is attentive without being invasive.  

Lovejoy's is the perfect place to enjoy some simple food over a nice pot of tea and good company.  I look forward to trying out more teas in the visits to come!

excerpts: The Yorkshire Gold is amazing and the shepherds pie is well proper British!
Go!
yorkshire gold.author: Jeremy H.
yorkshire gold.review: Quite nice little tea room. Great to go for high tea! The Yorkshire Gold is amazing and the shepherds pie is well proper British! Go!

excerpts: And the Yorkshire Gold was solid!
yorkshire gold.author: Chris T.
yorkshire gold.review:
AAAAAH!  This place is too cute!

Bring anyone with ovaries here, no matter what age!  What a thrill to have so many of my interests all in one place.  Antiques.  Sammiches.  Tea.  Kitsch.  Sofas for chairs.  Butta!

We got the section with the sofas and it felt like we were at g-ma's living room.  Nothing matches here, which makes you really look at every single mismatched piece.  Wow, this pink is different than this pink you soon discover.  From fine porcelain classic tea kettles to a Cow kettle... something for everyone.

Sandwiches were pretty fun to try out.  If your group is big enough, you can sample perhaps 8 different kinds!  All you need is a nibble!  Scones... wow... I hate scones.  Dry dusty crumbly cotton mouth-inducing pastries.  No!  Not here!  Fresh and moist like a biscuit... and all served with the most exquisites of jams and Double Devon Cream.  I have nooo clue what the heck that is, but it sounds fancy and fancy was delcious!

The Darjeeling was darling.  The Earl Grey was too bitter.  The Dragon Well was swell.  And the Yorkshire Gold was solid!

The waitress was so kind.  She was like someone's dearest mom making sure we had a good time.  With a full room, she kept her cool all day.  Making sure everyone had constant refills.   Going to come back for sure!

excerpts: Their Yorkshire Gold Blend (bottomless pot!) goes so well with everything.
I find myself vibrating by the time I walk out of there, but it's hard not to keep pouring myself another cup and doctoring it with the provided milk and sugar so long as it's there.
yorkshire gold.author: Cherie T.
yorkshire gold.review:
Every time family or friends visit (or even in-town friends gathering) I try to work in Lovejoy's. The atmosphere is fantastic, like going to my grandmother's house for tea (not that my grandmother ever served tea, she was more of a coffee person). Mismatched, antique everthing with little doilies everywhere. I love, love, love the variety of little sandwiches and oh, the scones! Perhaps it's my inability to make a scone that won't damage your teeth, but I'm in melty awe of their scones.  

Their Yorkshire Gold Blend (bottomless pot!) goes so well with everything. I find myself vibrating by the time I walk out of there, but it's hard not to keep pouring myself another cup and doctoring it with the provided milk and sugar so long as it's there.

excerpts: I highly recommend Yorkshire Gold!
yorkshire gold.author: Kristine K.
yorkshire gold.review:
Is it any surprise that most of the reviews of this place are written by women?  This is a great place to get together with your girlfriends after someone takes a vacation and pour over photos together.
The relaxed atmosphere and the smell of tea make this a little get away well worth the wait.  I highly recommend Yorkshire Gold!

excerpts: The little shop across the street has so many wonderful little things, I can never resist picking up some of my favorite teas (Yorkshire Gold or BlackCurrant!).
The service is friendly and warm.
I feel lucky that I am within walking distance.
yorkshire gold.author: Courtney Y.
yorkshire gold.review: I love this place!   The best place to gather with friends and  catch up over high tea.  The little shop across the street has so many wonderful little things, I can never resist picking up some of my favorite teas (Yorkshire Gold or BlackCurrant!).  The service is friendly and warm.  I feel lucky that I am within walking distance.
