excerpts: For tea, I chose yorkshire gold which was a stronger black tea.
Everything was very very delish, and I at 1st thought it wouldn't be enough to fill me up, but by the end I was stuffed.
yorkshire gold.author: S A.
yorkshire gold.review: Went here for brunch with 2 friends. The atmosphere is really kitschy with lots of knick knacks--kind of feels like what a sweet old grandma from england's house would be like. The chairs, tables, china--all odds and ends-nothing matches, but that's what gives this place its charm. We ordered the "High-Tea for 2, with an extra added on" which comes with a choice of 2 sandwiches per person, a green salad, scones with devon shire cream and jam, and cookies. For the sandwiches we ordered chicken apple walnut, chicken & asparagus, and pear & stilton. They were all very good, but the pear & stilton was my fav. For tea, I chose yorkshire gold which was a stronger black tea. Everything was very very delish, and I at 1st thought it wouldn't be enough to fill me up, but by the end I was stuffed. It all culminated with the scones and devon shire cream--Oh my god--pure heaven.  Good service, cute ambience, and yummy scones and tea! loved it!

excerpts: I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea.
The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me.
I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea.
Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over.
english breakfast.author: Katie C.
english breakfast.review:
Simply put, I love Lovejoy's Tea Room.

Just entering the tea room, I felt incredibly happy and giddy. Although the decor consisted of beautiful mismatched items, it was still in good taste. There are hats available for you to wear during your tea time. 

I ordered the Light Tea set ($19.95) with Chinese Rose Petal black tea while my boyfriend ordered the High Tea set ($21.95) with English Breakfast black tea. The portioning of the Light Tea set was perfect for me. I highly enjoyed the rose petal tea. Both of our tea pots were constantly being refilled without us having to call a waitress over. We were well taken care of by the staff. 

I made a reservation for two about a month in advance. I highly recommend you make a reservation, especially if you are planning on coming on a weekend. 

The tea room is perfect for all types of parties: couples, parents with their young children, and friends catching up.

excerpts: We both got the Queen's Tea for 2 while he chose the English Breakfast while I had the China Rose Petal tea.
english breakfast.author: Amy C.
english breakfast.review:
My sweet boyfriend took me here for my belated birthday celebration this past Sunday since I celebrated with both him & my family on my actual birthday. Originally, he made reservations at Benihana, but I prefer something that is new to us from my bookmarks therefore Lovejoy it is! 

We luckily found a good spot a few steps from Lovejoy's since it was starting to drizzle at the time. I love the heart painting on the side of the place. So cute!

We were seated at a small table next to the English red telephone booth looking cabinet. This place is very mismatch-y which really bothered my hunny cause he's like OCD. Haha.. but it's still very cozy and cute and unique little place. 

We both got the Queen's Tea for 2 while he chose the English Breakfast while I had the China Rose Petal tea. Everything was pretty delish, but the most outstanding would be the crumpets. They were warm & soft & crunchy. Yum! 

Service was friendly, sweet, and attentive. The lady which we're pretty sure is the owner is always addressing us as loveys which was very endearing. 

She brought out a candle on a present box looking petit four since he told them it was for my birthday during the reservation process. So that was nice. 

It's definitely a cute little tea place to visit if you're into high tea. :)

excerpts: I have only tried the English Breakfast but have heard that the Tea Room Blend is also very good.
If you are a tea lover then you must visit Lovejoy's!
english breakfast.author: Janani G.
english breakfast.review: The atmosphere of Lovejoy's is a delight! The scones are amazing and even taste great after you freeze and reheat them in the oven. I have only tried the English Breakfast but have heard that the Tea Room Blend is also very good. If you are a tea lover then you must visit Lovejoy's!

excerpts: Their English Breakfast tea was fantastic.
We also had some mango tea (my favorite) and chestnut.
I was wary of the chestnut at first, but that was pretty decent as well.
Had a great time here.
english breakfast.author: Jenn C.
english breakfast.review:
This place is simply adorable! I came here for a bridal shower, and it was perfect. They serve these little finger-food sized sandwiches on a 3 or 4 level tower. There are 5-6 different types. I think everyone's favorite was the roast beef and horseradish although they were all good - egg salad, ham, cheese, asparagus, all kinds of good stuff.

Their English Breakfast tea was fantastic. We also had some mango tea (my favorite) and chestnut. I was wary of the chestnut at first, but that was pretty decent as well. Had a great time here.

excerpts: English breakfast tea was awesome with milk.
english breakfast.author: Angela D.
english breakfast.review:
A cute and cozy place for tea time with your girlfriends! 
I got the Light Tea Set. The roast beef and horseradish sammy was delish. English breakfast tea was awesome with milk. Their scones are addicting and the cream/jam I kept on piling on!

Overall, it is kind of expensive for tea  ($17.95) but it was a fun time before going off to see Beach Blanket Babylon :)

excerpts: Tea selection: Lovejoy's offers some unique options like vanilla rooibos along with classics like English Breakfast.
english breakfast.author: Josephine L.
english breakfast.review:
BREWING THE BAY: British afternoon tea

This might be the strangest five-star review I've ever written. It's strange because I don't think Lovejoy's is superior to its competitors in any of the areas I judge a British tea room on, and usually that has to be the case to warrant 5 stars from me. However, sometimes things are greater than the sum of their parts and my overall experience at Lovejoy's was five-star.

Decor and Ambience: Like many British tea rooms, Lovejoy's is dotted throughout with fancy, antique teaware. The quaint setting is accented with old photos and Christmas lights. There's ample seating, although reservations are a must and the seating can accomodate parties large and small. Expect a pleasant buzz of chatter at all hours of operation

Teaware: The saucers, cups and strainers have lovely Victorian designs with Mid-Century modern materials. The tea trays were a little disappointing--dull and metal

Tea selection: Lovejoy's offers some unique options like vanilla rooibos along with classics like English Breakfast. I didn't find the former very good, but I'd definitely recommend the "house" tea, the Tea Room Blend. Overall, I think the menu offers a good selection of British/Western favorites, but those hoping for good Asian options might be disappointed

Food: I found the prices a little high, considering the portion size, but the quality is definitely above average. I got the "Me Tea". The smoked salmon and cream cheese tea sandwich came on fluffy white bread and the salmon was moist and delicious. The scone was a little dry, but the accompanying Devonshire cream was plentiful and rich. I saw that Lovejoy's offered pasties and I just had to order a beef one. When I lived in London, I had the most delicious beef pasties and it's been extremely hard for me to find good ones in the US. Lovejoy's had a fantastic filling of flavorful beef and diced carrots with just the right amount of seasoning. The pastry shell was flaky, but the ones I had in England were thicker and crisper. I also tried two petit fours: the strawberry shortcake and the raspberry Victorian wedding cake. We were told the insides were marzipan (which I'm not really a fan of), but they were more like cake. Both were very sweet and delicious, but I think I preferred the strawberry shortcake

Service: Fantastic. Friendly, warm, attentive and efficient. All servers knew their menus inside and out, and were clearly passionate about afternoon tea

All in all, I had a wonderful afternoon chatting with my two Boston girlfriends who had just moved to San Francisco. Enjoying the company of good friends while sipping hot tea and nibbling delicious food--is there any better form of paradise? :)

excerpts: For myself I ordered the English Breakfast tea and a light snack consisting of small sandwich, scone, fruits and a biscuit at about 15 dollars, I do enjoy the whole tier tray thing going on there.
Food on tiers are awesome.
english breakfast.author: Simon L.
english breakfast.review:
This is a great place to have brunch and some tasty tea while snacking on bite sized sandwiches. Although I would advise men who are thinking about going here...You might want to bring a female friend or a girlfriend along because this place is a bit geared towards women. When me and some friends went inside to check out the tea they had, it was probably 98% female.

For myself I ordered the English Breakfast tea and a light snack consisting of small sandwich, scone, fruits and a biscuit at about 15 dollars, I do enjoy the whole tier tray thing going on there. Food on tiers are awesome. For a light generally snack, it's quite good, I recommend biting on some bay shrimp and mayonnaise sandwiches with your tea.

The interior was cool, very English mod. Everyone has their own teapot and cups to drink with which I found to be pretty nice.

All together, it's a nice little place to sip on some tea, but like I said, if you're a guy, bring a girl with you.

excerpts: I opted for the Passion Fruit tea while she got English Breakfast.
We spent a good 2 hours just drinking tea and talking.
english breakfast.author: Rose C.
english breakfast.review:
My friend and I love to get tea with the whole English tea time accompaniments.  We went on a Friday for lunch and luckily, she made reservations.  The decor is utterly quaint and reminiscent of flowery furniture seen in historical films.

We ordered the High Tea for two and got to choose 4 different sandwiches.  We got the Smoked Salmon & Cream, Cheese Chutney & Cheese, Pear & Stilton, and Smoked Turkey & Dijon Mustard.   Those sandwiches were quite filling, in addition to the gigantic scones and salad.  The scones were so delicious - we wanted more but were simply stuffed.  I opted for the Passion Fruit tea while she got English Breakfast.  We spent a good 2 hours just drinking tea and talking.

excerpts: I tried my sister's English breakfast tea, which is different from what I am used to (outside of this tea room).
english breakfast.author: Fannie S.
english breakfast.review:
So...

I finally made an effort to actually dine-in for their afternoon tea here.  We made reservations and gathered a bunch of people too!  :-) 

We went on Saturday, with a nine-year-old in tow.

We had their High Tea...four sandwiches (artichoke hummus, roast beef, smoke salmon and cream cheese, and chicken-walnut-apple salad), some greens salad (delicious vinegar-y dressing), buttery buttery [evil] scones with devonshire cream and raspberry preserves.  

I also ordered some sausage rolls for the table (they're two-bite appetizers basically).  They were not greasy, flaky dough, and savory filling.  Yum.

For tea, we had the China Rose Petal...which was a strong black tea with hints of rose.  I tried my sister's English breakfast tea, which is different from what I am used to (outside of this tea room).  I was a bit flummoxed by how bitter it was, and how it totally required sugar for drinkability.  

She tempted us with petit-fours as well...so the kid tried triple chocolate (dark, milk and white), and I tried the plum rosewater one which was just so different and so addicting!  

Service = as expected.  They are very attentive, friendly, and just great about refilling your teapots and great about taking photos for us.  

I'll definitely come back...

One of the plus factors for this place: they do not have overly flowery wallpaper, covered in same-fashioned dolls!  

Warning: This is NOT a cheap place.  Go for the experience, and if you don't enjoy it, don't waste money.  I don't want to hear any whining!

excerpts: We had ordered the Lavender tea, as well as and English breakfast.
Along with the sandwiches were the most delectable finger sandwiches, which are incredibly deceiving.
You'd think that there's no way you can get full on these dainty sandwiches, but you are in for a surprise.
I had to be rolled back to my car because I was so full.
I really appreciated the staff for keeping my pot of tea warmed up every now
and then, which they don't do everywhere else.
I would really recommend Lovejoy's, but would strongly recommend you make a reservation.
english breakfast.author: Tammy L.
english breakfast.review: This place was cozy like a grandmother's living room, complete with decorative hats that you can put on and feel fancy. The teas were strong enough for me to add milk (because I put it in everything), and not have it turn into nothing but watery milk. We had ordered the Lavender tea, as well as and English breakfast. Along with the sandwiches were the most delectable finger sandwiches, which are incredibly deceiving. You'd think that there's no way you can get full on these dainty sandwiches, but you are in for a surprise. I had to be rolled back to my car because I was so full. I really appreciated the staff for keeping my pot of tea warmed up every now and then, which they don't do everywhere else. I would really recommend Lovejoy's, but would strongly recommend you make a reservation.

excerpts: Who could say no to an all-girls' bonding session, complete without a steaming pot of English Breakfast with milk and sugar, scones and clotted cream and strawberry jam, and tea sandwiches?
The sandwiches are delicious - we had a selection of salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, chicken apple and walnut salad, tuna, smoked turkey, and cucumber, so are the scones.
Light years better than the Rotunda at Neiman Marcus, sans the ladies with botox and Burberry scarfs, Lovejoy's is a definite gem in the quaint neighborhood of Noe Valley.
Reservation is a must, especially around prime tea time of 3PM and
parking in the area could be tricky
- your best bet is that the Parking God has mercy on you the day you plan on visiting Lovejoy.
english breakfast.author: Ange L.
english breakfast.review:
Who could say no to an all-girls' bonding session, complete without a steaming pot of English Breakfast with milk and sugar, scones and clotted cream and strawberry jam, and tea sandwiches?

Especially in a quintessentially English teahouse such as Lovejoy.  

The tea room is filled with a combination of long benches, straight-backed chairs with cutesy cushions, comfy sofas, and wooden buffet cabinets full of Victorian cups, teapots and whathaveyou.  The patrons of this oh-so-popular place comprise of understandably 99% women, smartly (and sometimes overly) dressed, daintily sipipng on their loose-leaf tea or munching on the perfectly cut triangular-shaped sandwiches.  

The sandwiches are delicious - we had a selection of salmon and cream cheese, roast beef, chicken apple and walnut salad, tuna, smoked turkey, and cucumber, so are the scones.  Light years better than the Rotunda at Neiman Marcus, sans the ladies with botox and Burberry scarfs, Lovejoy's is a definite gem in the quaint neighborhood of Noe Valley.  Reservation is a must, especially around prime tea time of 3PM and parking in the area could be tricky - your best bet is that the Parking God has mercy on you the day you plan on visiting Lovejoy.

excerpts: I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast.
english breakfast.author: Melissa B.
english breakfast.review:
I went to Lovejoy's Tea Room on one of my weekly "mommy-daughter" days. My mom and I went to enjoy a morning tea. We ordered one savory tea (with cream cheese and cucumber and cream cheese and smoked salmon sandwiches) and one sweet tea (called cream tea: with two of their signature scones). I had the apricot tea and my mom had english breakfast. 

The decor was so cute and quaint and the service was extremely friendly and helpful! Most of the good tables were reserved for a special party, but they did have a couple open tables for walk-ins. It was a bit cramped since they try to accommodate so many people, which is why I am only giving four stars, but my mom and I are both pretty small so it didn't bother us too much. I really enjoyed my experience here and seeing as how I love going to tea, this was a great outing for a cheaper price than other tea parlors I have been to. 

Overall great experience and can't wait to go back!

excerpts: I had the Queen's Tea with English Breakfast tea and cucumber and turkey sandwiches.
The tea arrived first and after waiting anxiously for it to seep, I poured myself a cup.
It was delicious, but I am not a tea connoisseur.
Then arrived the food, on a three tiered platter.
english breakfast.author: Monique H.
english breakfast.review:
Went here for the first time today.  My girlfriend from high school was visiting from out of town and we had been talking about having high tea.  After much searching and disappointment that The Four Seasons Hotels and the Ritz-Carlton Hotels have discontinued their tea service, we found this place on Yelp.

We were half an hour late (boyfriends are slow) but lucky one person in our party was only 5 minutes late and saved the table for us.  She said they were very nice and didn't harass her about the rest of her party not showing up.

I had the Queen's Tea with English Breakfast tea and cucumber and turkey sandwiches.  The tea arrived first and after waiting anxiously for it to seep, I poured myself a cup.  It was delicious, but I am not a tea connoisseur.  Then arrived the food, on a three tiered platter.  The top tier was the fresh fruit, next the scone, biscuit, jam, lemon stuff, and the devon cream, the bottom tier had the sandwiches, cole slaw, and greens.

To be frank, when I first looked at it I thought they kind of skimped out on the fruit, but I was stuffed by the end of my meal, so really they are smarter than me!

After having some fruit, I decided to try the scone.  I first tried the devon cream...and that is when I realized that I loved this place!  If I had a lover, forget the whipped cream or chocolate sauce, this is what I'd cover his body with and lick off!!!  I could not get enough of it and I think this was my favorite item here.  Of course the jam and lemon stuff was good too, but I cannot describe my devotion to devon cream now.

The sandwiches were of course delicious and...dainty, delicate?  FUN!  I am not a super girlie girl.  My friend and I decided to put dresses on for the special occasion and I felt like a streetwalker even though my dress is conservative, but that is how rarely I wear things that don't have legs.  But this place played into my feminine side without me feeling awkward about it.  So yes, it's frilly and kitsch, but it works for this place.

A little while later came my fresh crumpet.  We decided crumpets are a pancake-english muffin hybrid, a puffin. Delicious, but I just wanted to get back to my scone and devon cream to be honest.

Lastly when we were done, we had our petite fours.  Which apparently I didn't really experience because I got the dark chocolate truffle with dried apricot.  But it was so cute and I love dark chocolate.  Petite fours are candy-sized, individually glazed pieces of cake. (My friend went to culinary school)

I completely want to return, but will probably only get the High Tea or even just the Light Tea next time.  The Queen's Tea was fantastic for the first time, so you get the entire experience and learn what you like.  But I personally didn't really like the cole slaw (I'm too American and eating it made me want ribs or something) and I was too full to even consider wasting space on a salad!

So if you go, invite me?

excerpts: There are a lot of variety of teas, from standard stuff like English Breakfast to more unique teas like Passion Fruit.
(I stick with the green teas myself).
The scone is delicious, especially once you spread the accompanying cream and jelly on it.
There are some great sandwich options, too.
english breakfast.author: Chad H.
english breakfast.review:
Wow, totally did not expect to like this place.  My girlfriend kept wanting to drag me here, and my initial reaction was "Really?  Tea?  Really??"  Eventually I caved, because I'm totally whipped.

Well, I'm glad I did.  Holy hell this place is delicious.  Not only did we go that one time, we've been back a bunch of times, and have even been inspired to try other tea places in the city.  However, none of the other places we've tried are as good as Lovejoy's.

I recommend the "High Tea" if you're in a big group or the "High Tea For Two" if you're going with one other person.  (The "For Two" version is basically two high teas packaged together at a slight discount).  The High Tea comes with (in order of best to worst):
1: Bottomless pot of one type of tea.
2: Warm scone.
3: Two sandwiches.
4: Sugar cookie.
5: Salad.
6: Cole slaw.

Double that for the High Tea For Two, meaning you get four sandwiches total.  There are a lot of variety of teas, from standard stuff like English Breakfast to more unique teas like Passion Fruit.  (I stick with the green teas myself).  The scone is delicious, especially once you spread the accompanying cream and jelly on it.  There are some great sandwich options, too.  My favorites are apple and cream cheese, shrimp and mayo, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and egg salad.

The place is slightly pricey, but you'll come out so incredibly full of good food that it's totally worth it as an "every one in a while" place.  One other thing: definitely get reservations ahead of time, especially if you have more than two people, or else it's going to be a hell of a wait.

excerpts:
We got English breakfast tea and the following sandwiches:

Chicken-Apple Walnut Salad
Artichoke Hummus
Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese-A's Jewish, so of course he picked it 
Chutney and Cheese-stupid pick on my part bc someone raved about it here.
english breakfast.author: Yan E.
english breakfast.review:
Being Chinese,  "drinking tea" means hot food, hot tea, and cheap prices to me, or at least in my backwoods dialect of Chinese. So Lovejoy's tea was a different experience for me: major sticker shock. Popular place.   There was a large crowd waiting at 10:30, despite the fact Lovejoy's opens at 11a. The six of us had reservations at 11am on Saturday.

I shared a High Tea for two with A. We got English breakfast tea and the following sandwiches:

Chicken-Apple Walnut Salad
Artichoke Hummus
Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese-A's Jewish, so of course he picked it 
Chutney and Cheese-stupid pick on my part bc someone raved about it here. If you don't know what chutney is (like I said, I was stupid), don't get it. 

Tea, sandwiches, shortbread cookies, and salad were all ok, nothing spectacular. It didn't feel very filling either.  I thought it highly overpriced for some tea and crust-less sandwiches. However, my god, the scones with double Devon cream were divine! I was slathering the cream on my scone like a Chinese mom outdoors with sunblock. Every time I walk by now, I yearn for those scones.

Decor: eclectic collection of ornate seats, tables, chairs. Mismatched charm. I loved the different tea sets, cups, creamers etc. Service: great. Everyone was seated quickly. Your pot is refilled quickly no matter how little you've poured out.

As I'm breaking down the price in my head right now, I guess it's not that bad for everything you get. The food is mostly mediocre for what you pay, but the service, decor and ambiance makes for a nice one time experience.

excerpts: We like all the standard fare, no flavored tea for us - just the good old English Breakfast w/ sugar and milk.
The tea cozy is homey
but it sure helps the keep the tea hot/warm!
Can't even describe the quaintness of this place and how charming it is...
english breakfast.author: Gloria H.
english breakfast.review:
Ever since trying it for the first time in Victoria years ago, we've been hooked.  During a conversation at a party, friends asked if we've tried Lovejoy's - where?  Boy, are we thankful for the tips!

This is what tea should be - cozy, comfortable and non-pretentious like some other places.  We sat at the corner and settled into the comfy settee.  We like all the standard fare, no flavored tea for us - just the good old English Breakfast w/ sugar and milk.  The tea cozy is homey but it sure helps the keep the tea hot/warm!  Can't even describe the quaintness of this place and how charming it is...  We loved looking around and just about everything is for sale here!

We really enjoyed the tea sandwiches.  The bread was very soft and not "squished" from when they cut off the crumb.  High Tea for Two allowed us choice of 4 sandwiches and we enjoyed each one:

Cucumber & Cream Cheese - refreshing and light
Roast Beef & Horseradish - to satisfy hubby's neat for meat and the horseradish has a nice kick to it
Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Chutney & Cheese - flavorful
Ham & English Mustard - tasty

This is more enjoyable than Ritz, even the tea and sandwiches were better.  There's no harp playing and large fireplace BUT this is the perfect place to enjoy tea with your special someone, girlfriends, mom...etc.

excerpts: We had the High Tea for 2, the first tea our server recommended a black tea, so we went for the English Breakfast.
The second tea we tried was the Decaf Chocolate Truffle, the aroma was lovely and light.
This was my first High Tea experience, and will definitely come back again.
english breakfast.author: Em A.
english breakfast.review: Today I came here for lunch with a friend and had a blast!  The teas and sandwiches were delicious.  We had the High Tea for 2, the first tea our server recommended a black tea, so we went for the English Breakfast.  The second tea we tried was the Decaf Chocolate Truffle, the aroma was lovely and light.   This was my first High Tea experience, and will definitely come back again.

excerpts: We settled on a tower of assorted tea sandwiches and scones with English breakfast tea and something else.
english breakfast.author: Alex H.
english breakfast.review:
I've never been a fan of fu-fu restaurants and dining. "Give it to me big and give it to me good" has always been my motto. So needless to say that when the gf informed me that we were joining some friends for English tea time, my first question was "Do I have to go?" I'm fairly glad that she forced me to under promises of big food after if I was still hungry.

This place does do tea right. The decorations remind me of the old lady across the street's house that smelled of dust and strong perfume. There are tables of course, but there are also couches, love seats and chairs creating an environment that is both old-fashioned and fun (there's even a replica of an red English phone booth). I didn't try them myself, but I've been told that the hats in the parlor are available to borrow for the patrons during their tea-time.

Anyways, skeptical of the entire menu, I let the gf order whatever. I added a meat pie to make myself feel like I was going to eat something substantial. We settled on a tower of assorted tea sandwiches and scones with English breakfast tea and something else.

The tea was actually quite tasty. I enjoyed it as much as anyone who doesn't really like hot beverages could.

The tea sandwiches were awesome! My particular favorites were the bay shrimp salad and the pear with Gorgonzola cheese. Also, the meat pie WAS filling, and tasted great with a heap of homemade mashed potatoes on top. Yum!

I'm glad I was pleasantly surprised by the food and tea. I probably still wouldn't go back of my own free will, but I must give credit where credit is due. If you like tea, this is the spot.

*Note: Better make reservations, because this place is packed and you'll be waiting for a while.

excerpts: Bottomless pot of English Breakfast Tea.
I had the stilton and pear and the salmon and cream cheese.
Delish.
english breakfast.author: Alyssa d.
english breakfast.review: Went here for my birthday lunch, a gift to me from my sister.  I saw this place on "Check Bay Area Please" and decided to give it a try.  I was not disappointed. We got the Queen's tea and I was so surprised at the selections.  Bottomless pot of English Breakfast Tea.  I had the stilton and pear and the salmon and cream cheese.  Delish.  The crumpet came a little later and I was pleasantly surprised.  I had never tried one, and I wanted another as soon as I tasted it.  I have never been a fan of scones, but this is also the first time I had a hot scone.  It was wonderful.  Great experience, my first time at a tea house.  I will be back!

excerpts: My friends got the English Breakfast Tea, Earl Grey tea, Mango flav Black Tea
and I got
the Passion fruit flav Black Tea.
I didn't try the others, but the Passion Fruit tea was ok.
Couldn't really taste much of the Passion Fruit flavor as I'm used to in Japanese tea.
english breakfast.author: Trish G.
english breakfast.review:
I went to my first Lovejoy's experience today with a couple of my friends and my friend's bf. Waiting outside till it open for afternoon tea, I can see the cutsey decor and all the mis-matched  Kate Spade tea dishes. The tearoom is very quaint, small and cozy...thought it was spatially larger from the looks on their website, but I was wrong. My friend opted to order us non-experienced tea partiers  2 High Tea for Two. We ordered the Cucumber & Cheese ; Smoke Salmon & Creme Cheese (very tasty); Creme Cheese & Mando Orange ; Bay shrimp & mayo ; Smoked Turkey & Dijon..can't remember the rest. 
The first 3 sandwiches was really tasty and filling. The Bay shrimp & mayo and the smoked Turkey dijon are another story. Yes they are filling, but the shrimp in the Bay Shrimp tasted very watery and wasn't wiped down enough. As for the Smoked Turkey & Dijon, the dijon used was very spicy...has a lot of horseraddish, to the point where I almost choked and had to take it outta my mouth. So if u likey the spicy, then you can choose the dijon & turkey sandwich.
The scones however...we're warm and fluffy on the inside and the mullberry jam that matched with it was perfect with the raisnyness of the scones!! I could eat those every morning (ok maybe not to the point I get sick of it.)LOL.
Each of us had our own pot of tea. My friends got the English Breakfast Tea, Earl Grey tea, Mango flav Black Tea and I got the Passion fruit flav Black Tea. I didn't try the others, but the Passion Fruit tea was ok. Couldn't really taste much of the Passion Fruit flavor as I'm used to in Japanese tea.
The High Tea also had cookies, which my friends say were good, but I couldn't eat anymore after stuffing  myself w/ my diuretic tea and sandwiches.
Cost wasn't as bad, like $64 something, we split the bill so it didn't really hurt us as much.
All in all my Lovejoy's tea experience was ok. I couldn't really give it a high enough score yet...I need to go to other tea places to compare it to this.

excerpts: Tea: Single Estate Ceylon was very good.
single estate ceylon.author: Bella B.
single estate ceylon.review:
Really good service. 

Quaint decor with many antique and vintage details -- table settings, tables, chairs, wall decorations, antique fine china and serving pieces.

The interior is small, and while the tables are close together, it felt cozy. I have to admit, that while walking to our table, I was scared I was going to accidentally bump and break something. (I have a hard time imagining someone maneuvering a baby stroller through here.)

I love the fine china! Who would have thought mixing-and-matching would work so well. 

I think it's the original floor, it's warped; while we at at the table half of us thought we were tilting forward, the other half tilting back.

You need to check out the bathroom, cute decor. (The sign about the original plumbing. Only one unisex bathroom in the establishment.)

I think the largest table holds up to 6 people.

I wouldn't recommend having a party for more than 4-5 kids. Kids should be approx 7 yrs or older. (If you're looking for a place where kids can play, take them to something like Chuck E. Cheese, or Super Frank's.)

Saw a father-daughter-grandmother tea time -- very cute.

HIGH TEA

Tea: Single Estate Ceylon was very good.

Sandwiches:
1) Smoked Salmon was delicious. Smoked salmon had a smooth flavor, and melted in my mouth. (Better than a bagel with lox!)
2) Chicken Apple Walnut was also delicious.
3) Chicken Asparagus was interesting. I didn't expect the asparagus to be pureed.
4) Egg & Onion. If you you like egg salad. (I'm not a fan of egg salad sandwiches.)

SCONES: to die for! Moist and fluffy, with delicious clotted cream.

Shortbread tea biscuit: yummy; but would chose the scone over the shortbread if given a choice.

Good experience.

excerpts: I chose the Vanilla black tea and my fiance had the black currant.
I don't know why he chose that
and it tasted bad (as I expected it would) with a bad aftertaste as well.
Can't blame them for that.
We just kept drinking out of my pot lol.
black currant.author: Dale S.
black currant.review:
I was SO excited to try this place! I've had high tea in London and it was amazing. I also just had a tea party of my own a few months back and it was a delight. I was so eager in fact that I insisted we go to tea before we even handled the errands that brought us to SF for the day. 
The tea room itself is adorable. I love how none of the cups, saucers and pots match. The eclectic decor gives it a really authentic feel and even the bathroom is done up. The antique furniture is great too. We were surprised that there were a lot of kids inside the business and it was actually rather loud and noisy. 
The staff was nice enough, but not genuinely warm. 
We each had a pot of tea. I chose the Vanilla black tea and my fiance had the black currant. I don't know why he chose that and it tasted bad (as I expected it would) with a bad aftertaste as well. Can't blame them for that. We just kept drinking out of my pot lol. 
We got 4 sandwiches with our high tea for two. I had the special which was a fig and goat cheese and I also ordered the pickle chutney. My date had the hummus and artichoke as well as turkey with dijon mustard. When the sandwiches came out they were TINY which is too be expected at a tea. But still, these were exceptionally tiny so we resigned ourselves to eat a real meal somewhere else later. Unfortunately, the sandwiches were inedible. The flavors were overpowering in the worst way and they smelled and tasted rancid. Honestly, there were all terrible with no consideration for anyone's pallet. I was very disappointed. 
The warm scones were good and the raspberry preserves were delicious. I could eat that on it's own. The "salad" and slaw on the bottom of the tray were minimal and flavorless and the dressing was no help. 
The real reason we came was for the petite fours! I have loved them since I was a child and could not wait to have my fiance taste one :) I was overjoyed when they brought out the desserts; both for the petite fours and because we were both starving! Although they are small and were $2.50 each, we got 3 just to sample. I heard the server advise that they were Marzipan, but after biting into the first one, I almost spit it out. My fiance bit into his at the same time and the look on our faces spoke volumes. It was terrible! I tried to eat them but they literally made me feel sick. We had to put napkins over them so we could get our check. I felt so bad. Last night I had to order some real petite fours online to try and "un-traumatize" my fiance and let him know they aren't really disgusting. 
Sad to say, but this place is just a novelty and I should not be rated as highly as it is. I would give our experience 1.5 stars.

6/4/11

It was such a delightful place for afternoon tea/brunch.

The decorations were really whimsical and each utensil (teapot,plates,spoons,cups; were different).

Their sandwiches, crumpets, scones (lemon curd & berry jam), and especially the tea are first rate (I had their Chocolate Mint & Black Currant).

I was extremely satisfied and filled (all that tea just kept coming, our waitress made sure the pot was full and hot), what more can I say - I'M COMING HERE AGAIN!

excerpts: (I had the Blood Orange tea, very good -- my friend likes her stand-by Black Currant tea).
black currant.author: Maile N.
black currant.review:
I've been to high tea time at a few places, but this is the one place I would come back to!  My good friend and I had reservations for 3:30 this afternoon, and we had the best seat in the house next to the window!  

Service was prompt and friendly, and we caught up on all our girly talk over High Tea Time for Two - four kinds of sandwiches (we picked cucumber & cream cheese, smoked salmon & cream cheese, chicken & asparagus, ham & dijon mustard), sweet scones, cole slaw, salad and two pots of tea (I had the Blood Orange tea, very good -- my friend likes her stand-by Black Currant tea).  

I thought everything was yummy and just right for the two of us, plus it was reasonably priced.  We stayed for two and a half hours, and not once did I feel like we were rushed out the door - just right!  Thank you, Lovejoy's for a very enjoyable Saturday afternoon!

excerpts: And the black currant tea is to die for.

black currant.review:
Lovejoy's Tea Room has really delicious scones.  And the black currant tea is to die for.

Other than that, I didn't enjoy much else.  After the initial, "omg this is so cute and cozy!" reaction I had, the whole ambiance of the place just felt kind of off to me.  Hodgepodge furniture squished together, no room to even stick out your pinky finger to drink tea like a snob!  

I understand that they are super busy, so I appreciate them fitting us in the 1 hour opening they had.  But the waitress was kind of strange and didn't provide us with attentive, fast service given that she wanted us to leave ASAP.  

My friend came in 3 minutes after we placed our initial order so the waitress said she would be right back to take her order.  But she never really came back until we were half way through our tea time.  

Eat your scones while they're hot!!

Exquisitely dainty.

Even if you don't dress up, you feel transformed for the duration that you're there.  Everything about the place just reminds you to be a little more polite, savor what you're consuming, enjoy the Noe Valley sunshine, and appreciate the company you're with.

Typically, my friends and I get the queen's tea (for however many people are present) with black currant tea (it is quite good), the green apple and cream cheese, mandarin orange and cream cheese, and artichoke and hummus sandwiches.  Now that Jessica T. mentions it, I don't recall if we've ever tried the pear and stilton sandwich, but we'll do so next time for sure.  The lemon curd and devonshire cream pair wonderfully with the baked goods.  The fruit and greens are great to break up the richness of the sweets and sandwiches.

Dainty is the theme here, but don't be deceived.  The queen's tea is rather filling and they also offer heartier fare.

Reservations highly recommended.  

Going to Lovejoy's - also highly recommended.

excerpts: My favorite is the Black Currant.
black currant.author: Liz S.
black currant.review:
Mad Hatter: Would you like a little more tea?
Alice: Well, I haven't had any yet, so I can't very well take more.
March Hare: Ah, you mean you can't very well take less.
Mad Hatter: Yes. You can always take more than nothing.

I love Alice in Wonderland for its spirit of adventure, mismatched quirkiness, witty prose, and cast of characters.  It is all culture and tradition, seen through a child's eyes, and turned upside down. 

I love Lovejoy's for the same reasons.  Every chair, cup, serving platter and utensil is different and wonderful, straight out of your English grandmother's attic.  

Drink Me:
Unlike poor Alice, you can have all the tea that you want, a bottomless pot!  My favorite is the Black Currant.

Eat Me:
There is no shortage of savory and sweet treats here:  lemon curd tarts, scones, double cream, cheeses, chutney, toast points, cucumber sandwiches, petit fours - all cut and shaped into small sizes perfect for popping into your mouth.  You can get them in different assortments (Queen's Tea or Ploughman's Lunch, for example), or a la carte, depending on how hungry you are.  

The staff is extremely nice - I have been there both for a group event, and for an intimate lunch, and both times we were treated very well.  The place is usually full no matter what day of the week you are there, so reservations are a must. 

Lovejoy's is a place that you want to linger - filling your cup again and again with delicious hot tea, and savoring a rare moment in the middle of the city.  Going there for lunch with the fabulous laura b. is like the perfect icing on the most scrumptious cake.  Whether you are an underground Alice or a Queen of Hearts, Lovejoy's will tickle your fancy.

excerpts: I'd highly recommend the black currant tea -- it was fruity, without being overly sweet.
black currant.author: Evelyn K.
black currant.review:
I am clearly not one of the first reviewers for Lovejoy's and certainly will not be one of the last, so what can I possibly say about the legendary tea room nestled in a quiet part of Noe Valley...that hasn't already been said?

An old friend and I stopped by Lovejoy's for a spot of afternoon tea on a Thursday afternoon, and the place was absolutely humming with business.  There were groups with mommies and their little girls bouncing around the room, hyped up from all the caffeine and the sweets.  There were tables with mixed genders...and honestly, the guys looked a little awkward and out of place, no matter how much they profess love the yummy little finger sandwiches and warm scones.  It was definitely loud with chatter and laughter, but Michele and I were able to reminisce about old times and catch up each other on new gossip from our lives.  I was just at her wedding in La Jolla a few weeks ago and of course she was so preoccupied then, we hardly had a few moments to talk then.

A perfectly "delightful" afternoon!  I'd highly recommend the black currant tea -- it was fruity, without being overly sweet.  And yes, the scones are truly delish here....nicely warm and I'm sure that they're made with insane  gobs of butter to make them so lovely and unscone-like!

excerpts: I chose the black currant tea since I was in a berry mood (I drink green tea religiously every other day of the week) and that was pretty tasty alone, but even better with the cream/milk and a teaspoon of sugar to satisfy my sweet tooth.
black currant.author: Tess E.
black currant.review: I went here again for the second time this past weekend for my friend's birthday.  We were a group of 5 so she made reservations, which was a good idea since it was really crowded that day.  Again, like the last time we all ordered the High Tea options, each getting to choose 2 sandwiches and a pot of our own tea.  This time I chose the salmon and cream cheese and chicken and asparagus sandwiches.  Both were pretty tasty, but the asparagus was mushy for me, but otherwise edible.  I probably wouldn't order it again though.  I did try my friend's shrimp and mayo sandwich and that was tasty also.  I chose the black currant tea since I was in a berry mood (I drink green tea religiously every other day of the week) and that was pretty tasty alone, but even better with the cream/milk and a teaspoon of sugar to satisfy my sweet tooth.  High tea is definitely more than enough for one person since you get 2 sandwiches (quartered, so you get 8 pieces each), plus salad, coleslaw, sugar biscuit and scone.  The scone was good, but don't forget to try the devonshire cream with it!  The servers were really friendly and informative anout their menu so it was all around a good experience.
